The land is lo cated principally in Bridgeport, New London and Norwalk, Conn.; Porter County and Whit ing, Ind.; North Bergen and Guttenberg, N. J., and Boston, Taunton and East Hampton, Mass.

title: TAXI TALKS REOPEN AMID NEW URGENCY
description: Vincent D. McDonnell, chair man of the State Mediation Board, reconvened tax nego tiators yesterday but said that he was not optimistic about a quick settlement.

title: U.S. Spy Satellites Continue To Keep an Eye on Suez Area
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States is continuing to survey the Suez Canal area periodically by earthorbiting military satellites, it was re ported today.

title: CampbellMithun Splits Into 2 Operating Units
description: CampbellMithun is split ting itself into two operating divisions, each with its own president, with Raymond O. Mithun, founderchairman, re maining chairman of the fi nance committee of the whole show and Albert R. Whitman remaining chairman of the executive committee.

title: STATE DEFICIT PUT AT $400MILLION
description: Governor Rockefeller de clared yesterday that the state faced a minimum deficit of $400million in the next fiscal year even if no additional state spending was authorized.

title: Nixon's Congress Aide
description: After 10 years in the House of Representatives, Clark MacGregor will move next month to the other side of the fence to become, in his words, the President's man dealing with the Con gress. Representative Mac Gregor, a native of Minne apolis, whose suburbs he has represented since 1960, is aware that moving from the legislative to the executive branch as Coun sel to the President for Con gressional Relations will mean a major adjustment. It'll certainly give me a new perspective, he said yesterday. I doubt that one easily makes the transition.

title: BRUCE CRITICIZES HANOI ON P.O.W.'S
description: PARIS, Dec. 1David K. E. Bruce, the chief of the United States delegation at the Viet nam peace talks, held his first, news conference here today and denounced what he called the Vietnamese Communists shameful attitude toward American war prisoners and their refusal to negotiate at the peace table.

title: CANUCKS TOP FLYERS ON CULLEN GOAL, 54
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Dec. 1 (AP)Ray Cullen's goal with 4:03 to play in the game gave the Vancouver Ca nucks a 54 National Hockey League victory over the Phila delphia Flyers tonight.

title: Off Duty
description: The renewed stalemate in taxicab labor negotiations is fresh proof of the hash made of collective bargain ing when union and employer representatives start squabbling over how to split up other people's money.

title: Protectionist Challenge
description: The protectionist bloc has won another round in the Senate. Although initially advertised by Senate Finance Committee Chairman Russell Long as a bill that would meet Administration objections to the Mills bill passed by the House, the Senate bill is, if anything, even worse.

title: Met. Squash Racquets
description: CLASS A

title: FISCHER ADJOURNS GAME WITH UITUMEN
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 1 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles, the eighttime United States chess champion, maintained a slim lead in the 24man inter zonal knockout tournament here today when he adjourned his 16thround game with Tudev Uitumen, the champion of Mongolia.

title: Utility Forecasts Share Net
description: The Oklahoma Natural Gas Company expects its share earnings for fiscal 1971 to be at least $1.91 if the current heating season proves compa rable to the nineteenseventies. which was about 10 per cent colder than normal, C. C. In gram, chairman and president, told yesterday's annual meet ing at Wilmington, Del. This would compare with revenues of $99.5million and net income of $13million, or $1.91 a share, in the fiscal year ended Aug. 31, 1970.

title: New England and Canada Link Up Electricity Pool
description: The electric power pools of New England and eastern Canada were energized yester day at 345,000 volts through a 150mile transmission line. This was the first time the interna tional ties have been made at such a voltage through New England.

title: BLUES WILL RELY ON TIGHT DEFENSE
description: It is axiomatic in sports that the best defense is a strong of fense. The St. Louis Blues, who play the New York Rangers tonight in Madison Square Gar den, are defying the axiom.

title: Barge Canal Closes Monday
description: ALBANY, Dec. 1 (AP)The State Barge Canal System will close Monday morning for the winter, the State Transporta tion Department said today. The Erie Canal, from the Hud son River to Lake Erie; the Champlain Canal, from the Hudson River to Lake Cham plain, and the Oswego Canal, from the Erie Canal to Lake Ontario will be affected. The CayugaSeneca Canal, con necting Cayuga and Seneca Lakes with the Erie Canal, closed yesterday.

title: Paul Recital Hall: Little but Exquisite
description: Midst music and speeches. the little but exquisite Paul Recital Hall was officially opened at the Juilliard School on Monday evening. The music came from three Juil liard stars. The speeches came from Peter Mennin, head of the Juilliard; Amyas Ames, chairman of the board of Lin coln Center, and Col. C. Mi chael Paul, after whom the hall is named.

title: BUCKLEY DOUBTS SEATING PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Sen atorelect James L. Buckley of New York said today that he did not foresee any problem in being seated with the Senate's Republicans when the 92d Con gress convened next month.

title: Employes in Rome Dismissed by Fund
description: ROME, Dec. 1Jerome Hoff man, head of the troubled In vestors International Group, left Rome today amid reports that the transfer of his offshore fund's headquarters from Lon don to Rome had not helped the company bolster its posi tion and that his operation might be in danger of collapse.

title: London Stock Market Moves Ahead Following the Advances on Wall Street
description: The London stock market moved ahead yesterday in quiet trading and dollar stocks were higher in line with Wall Street'.s gains.

title: Undercover Agent Recalls How Role Was Almost Discovered by Black Panthers
description: A detective who pretended to be a Black Panther testified yesterday that his undercover role was nearly discovered when a Panther came close to touching electronic equipment under his shirt while taping a heartshaped target to the gar ment.

title: The Abiding Dream of Unity Among Arabs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 1 Up past the minarets of a Da mascus mosque floated cries of rijal al shaab! or men of the people!

title: The People Problem
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 1The official 1970 census figures on the population of the United States are a dramatic reminder that it is not primarily the decisions of governments that are changing the world, but the fertility of the human mind and body.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: The Pope Condemns Torture
description: ROMEPope Paul prefaced his con demnation of the use of torture by governments, in a recent Papal audi ence, with what amounted to a pice justificatif.

title: MOHAWK MAY DELAY PAYMENT ON NOTES
description: Mohawk Airlines, Inc., told holders of its senior subordi nate notes yesterday that inter est payments due Dec. I would not be made unless the air line's senior lenders consented.

title: Shaken Englewood Awaits Next Fire
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 1At 1:30 this afternoon a blue station wagon pulled up in front of the storefront office of a citizens group. A woman jumped out and yelled: There's a fire on William Street.

title: U.N. Inquiry Said to Have Evidence Linking Lisbon to Guinea Raid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1  The members of the fiveman United Nations fact finding mission that visited Guinea last week have re portedly reached the conclusion that there is solid evidence link ing the Portuguese armed forces to the armed commando inva, sion of which Guinea com plained.

title: East Bloc Leaders Gathering in Berlin For a Parley Today
description: BERLIN, Dec. 1Leaders of the Soviet Union and its War saw Pact allies flew to East Berlin today for a meeting on the sensitive Berlin issue and East German relations with Bonn.

title: I.B.M. FILES A SUIT AGAINST MEMOREX
description: The International Business Machines Corporation insti tuted a lawsuit yesterday against the Memorex Corpora tion charging wrongful appro priation and use of I.B.M. trade secrets and confidential infor mation. The charge involves disc packs and other computer memory devices.

title: Books of The Times
description: QB VII. By Leon Uris. 504 pages. Doubleday. $7.95.

title: LevinTownsend in Accord With Banks on Unit's Loan
description: The LevinTownsend Com puter Corporation said yester day that it had reached an agreement with 10 European banks to extend the shortterm debt of LevinTownsend Inter national, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary.

title: Minority Business: Influx of Aid
description: The Ford Foundation will help finance fledgling minor ityowned businesses in New York, in other large cities and in rural Georgia and Oklahoma.

title: RESERVE SIMPLIFIES LENDING PROCEDURE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (Reu ters)  The Federal Reserve Board announced today several, procedural changes under which member banks borrow funds from the System.

title: Walter Stuempfig Dead at 56
description: OCEAN CITY, N. J., Dec. 1 Walter Stuempfig, whose landscapes won him election to the National Institute of Arts and Letters in 1963, died yes terday at the home of his aunt, Mrs. Maude E. Raby, 1 Lagoon Road, after a long illness. He was 56 years old.

title: Bridge:
description: The Dallas Aces, world champions in 1970 and sched uled to defend that title in six months in Taipei, took a step toward the 1972 world Olym piad title at the fall nationals of the American Contract Bridge League. By finishing in a tie for first place in the Reisinger team championship, the final event of the tourna ment that ended Sunday in Houston, the Aces became probable contenders in the next United States team trials.

title: RECREATION PLAN PUT OFF UPSTATE
description: The Boise Cascade Corpora tion announced yesterday that it was deferring plans to build a vast recreational community that would eventually house more than 10,000 people in East Taghkanic, a rural township in New York State that now has a population of 727.

title: COLUMBIA VICTOR OVER C.C.N,Y., 8155
description: Columbia used a balanced scoring attack and a tight man toman defense to defeat City College, 8155, in University Gymnasium last night. It was the opening game of the sea son for both teams.

title: Unofficial Soviet Painters Work On as They Please
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1  Four Russian painters sat in a darkened room in a Moscow apartment recently and dis cussed color  not the col ors of their officially pro scribed abstract paintings but the poorly defined reds and blues of the icehockey game they were watching on television.

title: At Winter Ball, Clothes, Clothes and More Clothes and Salute to Obolensky
description: When the Nine O'Clocks dance club had its turnof thecentury costume ball last year, Sam LeTulle summed up the situation somewhat wryly. It's clothes, clothes and more clothesmore for the women than the men, the Texasborn architect said. Ditto last night's Winter Ball.

title: NEW CORONA PLAN SPARES 59 HOMES
description: Fiftynine homeowners in Co rona, Queens, who had fought vainly for four years against displacement for a proposed high school, won an extraor dinary lastminute reprieve yes terday at City Hall.

title: Market Place
description: Just how viable Is the na tion's rail system anyway? Is it possible that an industry with assets valued at more than $25billion is just barely chugging along with inade quate working capital to meet its daytoday opera tions?

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES FOOD STAMP BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1After months of delay, the House Rules Committee agreed today to allow floor action on a bill to extend the food stamp pro gram.

title: Old Toys, New Cookies
description: A vernissage of sorts, for children and their parents, was held at the Museum of the City of New York Mon day afternoon, to celebrate the opening of a toy exhibi tion called Visions of Sugar plums.

title: Bureaus to Start Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Officials of the Better Busi ness Bureaus announced today that they were starting a pro gram designed to make its offices more responsive to con sumers:

title: Seeks to Pressure Mayor on Planning Unit Post
description: The last Wagner administra tion holdover on the City Plan ning Commission began yester day an effort to pressure Mayor Lindsay into reappointing her.

title: Jonathan Logan Stock Split
description: Directors of Jonathan Logan, Inc., voted yesterday a five for four stock split and continuance of the fourthquarter dividend at 20 cents a share, effectively increasing the annual rate by 25 per cent. It will be distrib uted to shareholders of record on Dec. 29.

title: AGI RADO PROGRAM OFFERS PIANO MUSIC,
description: Agi Rado, pianist, who was heard at Tully Hall Monday night, projected a warm and comfortable relationship at all times between herself and the music she played.

title: Strikebound Shows to Try Broadway
description: Two strikebound Off Broadway shows have an nounced their intention of transferring operations to the Broadway area later this month.

title: A WEAPONS CACHE FOUND IN ALABAMA
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 1 (AP)Federal agents raided the home of a physician tonight and, after finding an unspeci field number of firearms, ar rested him on charges stem ming from the discovery of an estimated 30 tons of weapons in a suburb Sunday.

title: Meteorite Hints Space Life Is Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The freshest and strongest clues to the existence of con ditions suitable for the possi ble evolution of life beyond the earth were reported today by a team of American sci entists.

title: Fight Conversation at the Forum
description: Where is that short Argentinian? said Muhammad Ali, compressing his lips to stifle a smile. He is short, isn't he?

title: Tree More Bodies Found In the Mine Where 78 Died
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Dec. 1A recovery crew found three bodies today in the wrecked Consol No. 9 coal mine, where 78 men were trapped 600 feet below ground by explosions and fire in 1968.

title: ANTIWAR GROUP HEARS OF CRIMES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 About a dozen former service men, appearing here at the start of an informal inquiry into United States war policy, said today that they had wit nessed the torture or murder of South Vietnamese civilians.

title: Lindenberg Triumphs Twice In World Catamaran Racing
description: MELBOURNE, Fla., Dec. 1 (AP)  Paul Lindenberg, a skipper from Blake Park, Fla., gained two firstplace finishes to lead in the annual Tornado Class world championship catamaran races.

title: This Thomas Jefferson Is Good With Hammer and Saw, Too
description: It wasn't so long ago that Thomas Jefferson, sitting in his Greenwich Village apart ment, gazed at the gleaming 9footlong coffee table he'd made from a slice of an English oak, leaving the bark along the sides.

title: Danger in U.S. Nuclear Policy
description: The rumblings of a fundamental change in U.S. nuclear strategy are beginning to be heard outside the con fines of our national security structure. Deterrence, the cornerstone of our strategic policies for many years, is now beginning to be decried as defi cient. Nuclear sufficiency would be extended to include forces to fight nuclear war, not merely to prevent one.

title: Stadium of 214 B.C. Found
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia (AP) A stadium dating from 214 B.C. with a seating capacity of 30,000 has been unearthed here, the Belgrade newspaper Vernje Novosti reported.

title: Nixon Aides Say Freeze On Alaska Land Continues
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Senator Henry M. Jackson. Democrat of Washington, said today that he had received as surances from the Nixon Ad ministration that the Alaska land freeze would be con tinued until June 30, 1971.

title: FIELD IS DEPLETED BY COLD, INJURIES
description: Although Dundee Marmalade was the shortestpriced horse of the day at Aqueduct yes terday, thousands of bettors must have held their breaths after wagering on the chestnut 2yearold colt.

title: Milton Steinbach Is Dead at 67; Led in Creating Medical School
description: Milton Steinbach, an invest ment banker and philanthrop ist, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital after a short illness. He was 67 years old and lived at 150 Central Park and on Rockledge Road in Rye, N. Y.

title: Chrysler Increases Prices Again For 71, Following G. M. Pattern
description: DETROIT, Nov. 2  The Chrysler Corporation today raised prices for the second time this year on its 1971 cars. this increase averaging $15, or 0.5 per cent, the company said.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Executive Changes

title: Judge Declares a Mistrial in Conspiracy Case of Younger Colombo
description: A mistrial was declared yes terday in the case of Joseph Colombo Jr. after five jurors admitted they had ignored the judge's instructions not to read or listen to news accounts of the trial.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
90th Year. Marked By,Board of Rabbis With Tributes to 5
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay went to the WaldorfAstoria Hotel last night to salute the New York Board of Rabbis at a convoca tion marking its 90th anniver sary.

title: McGrawHill Obtains Ryerson Press
description: The United Church of Canada yesterday completed the sale of its Ryerson Press to the Mc GrawHill Company of Canada, Ltd., placing the 140yearold textbookpublishing concern in American hands.

title: Echeverria, Assuming Office, Pledges Greater Equity of Incomes
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1Luis Echeverria Alvarez took office as President of Mexico today and said he would steer the booming economy toward great er equity in the distribution of income.

title: FORT MARCY WINS 1970 TURF TITLE
description: Fort Marcy and Top Bid were picked yesterday as the Thoroughbred Racing Associa tions champion turf horse and champion steeplechaser for 1970.

title: Money
description: Tuesday, Dec. 1, 1970

title: Major League Doctors Form Exchange Group
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1  The physicians for the 24 major league teams com pleted two days of meetings here today by forming an or ganization to exchange ideas and information on the care and feeding of baseball play ers.

title: Downtown Department Stores Increased November Sales 4%
description: New York department  store companies last month achieved an average gain of 4 per cent in their downtown stores and 5 per cent in their area stores from yearearlier levels. The results indicated somewhat of a mixed pattern among leading retailers. They tended to agree that apparel sales made a comeback during November. Some stores ex pressed disappointment with the overall results, particu larly during the final week of the month which, they said, did not come up to ex pectations.

title: Cairo's Position Hardening
description: CAIRO, Dec. 1  Cairo's position on an extension of the ceasefire beyond Feb. 5 ap pears to be hardening day by .day. Egyptian leaders have de dared repeatedly that an ex tension will not be accepted unless Israel returns to the peace talks under Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermediary.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Strong Dose of Medicine
description: For a long time, no politician has been so foolhardy as to ad vocate, within hearing of the press, throwing hundreds of thousands of people out of work as a useful way of restor ing social order and discipline and of stopping inflation. But this is not to say that many politicians do not think these dark thoughts about the pur gative values of unemployment  with the encour agement of their economic advisers.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per centage losses on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: NEGATIVE REPORT ISSUED ON PHONES
description: There has been no improve ment in telephone installation and repair service in the New York City area, the State Pub lic Service Commission said yesterday, probably because of a shortage of skilled tele phone craftsmen in the area.

title: Kunstier Cleared of Assault Against Canadian Rightists
description: TORONTO, Dec. 1 (UPI) William M. Kunstler, the Amer ican civil rights lawyer who was a defense attorney for the Chicago seven, was acquitted today of assaulting two leaders of a rightwing group.

title: COLLIER QUITTING AS BROWNS'
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 1Blan ton Collier, the 64yearold coach of the Cleveland Browns, told a lunch group today that he would retire after the sea son.

title: Viatron Can't Pay Interest Due on Debenture Issues
description: BEDFORD, Mass., Dec. 1 (AP)1 The Viatron Computer Sys tems Corporation announced, today it is unable to pay in terest due Dec. 1 on $25million of convertible subordinated de bentures issued one year ago.

title: Kissinger Under Protection Of a Secret Service Guard
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)  At least one member of President Nixon's top White House staff has been given Se cret Service protection, pre sumably to guard against any possible kidnapping attempt.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHTS GAMES

title: German Daily Here To Cut Publication To 2 Issues Weekly
description: The StaatsZeitung and Her old, the daily Germanlanguage newspaper published here, an nounced yesterday that finan cial difficulties would force it to publish only two issues week beginning Jan. 1. The newspaper, founded in 1834, is among the oldest in the coun try.

title: Big Oil Slick Sighted Off the Florida Keys
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 1 (UPI)An oil slick believed caused by an Italian oil tanker was sighted yesterday off the Florida Keys.

title: Congo Art Yields Its Magic to Harlem Youngsters
description: Ten Harlem youngsters who won a brief reprieve from classes yesterday to at tend a press preview of a Congolese art exhibition to be held Sunday quickly dis covered that, like most of us, they knew what they liked.

title: Rockets Down Blazers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 1 (AP) Calvin Murphy and Stu Lantz sank nine free throws between them in the final three minutes tonight, giving the San Diego Rockets a 120114 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: MRS. MIR SENDS A NOTE TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Pre mier Golda Meir of Israel has sent President Nixon a new message to lay the groundwork for resumption of ArabIsraeli peace negotiations.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Tickets on Sale at Garden For $210,000 Tennis Series
description: Tickets for the $210,000 Tennis Champions Classic, fea turing Rod Laver, Ken Rose wall, Arthur Ashe and Pancho Gonzales, go on sale at 10 A.M. today at Madison Square Garden.

title: MORTGAGE CEILING CUT TO 8% BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. IThe maximum interest rate that may be charged on home mortgages backed by the Federal Hous ing Administration and the Vet erans Administration was cut today from 8 to 8 per cent.

title: COURT BAN ASKED ON POOL CLOSING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court today to declare that the city of Jackson, Miss., had violated the Constitution when it closed its public swim ming pools rather than inte grate them.

title: MENTAL HEALTH AIDE LISTS U.S. PRIORITIES
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1The Na tional Institute of Mental Health as placed first priority on problems of children's mental health.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Dec. 1. 1970

title: Text of Resolution Adopted in U. N. on War Prisoners
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1Following is the text of the United Statesspon sored resolution on prisoners of war adopted today by the Social Committee of the Gen eral Assembly:

title: Theater: The Revenger's Tragedy Done at Yale
description: NEW HAVENFirst, let me admit prejudice. I love the Yale Repertory Theater. It is run by Robert Brustein, whom I have long regarded as po tentially our best dramatic critic. It has some pretty good actors. And, let me level with you, if I had the chance which very prudently I would reject, for I am a critic almost pure and completely simpleto run a repertory company, Mr. Brustein's com pany is precisely the com pany I would run. As a conse quence, I empathize with its failures most alarmingly.

title: 8 GUILTY OF RUINING U.S. DRAFT RECORDS
description: ROCHESTER. Dec. 1 (UPI) A Federal Court jury tonight found all eight members of conspiracy guilty of all charges in the ransacking of Federal offices and destruction of mili tary draft records.

title: A Top Speed of 95 And Warning at 85 Sought in '73 Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Transportation Depart ment proposed today that all passenger cars starting with 1973 models be designed to op erate no faster than 95 miles an hour and to sound horns and flash lights at 85 miles an hour.

title: Five Girls Keep a ThreeMonth Vigil at Tate Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1Five frail girls emerge from the white van from time to time and feed coins into the parking meter. Sometimes they kneel on the sidewalk and stare blankly at the sky. At other times they stare at the Hall of Justice, where the Tate murder trial is under way.

title: HOUSE APPROVES A PLAN TO INSURE BROKERS CLIENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The House of Representatives passed legislation today provid ing insurance for the public against financial losses result ing from the bankruptcies of brokerage firms.

title: Kinney National Net and Sales Set Marks for Quarter and Year
description: Operations of Kinney Na tional Service, Inc. In the quar ter and year ended Sept. 30 resulted in record sales and earnings with all divisions showing higher profits, accord ing to yesterday's annual re port issued by Steven J. Ross, president of the diversified service company.

title: BucksLakers Set for TV
description: A Monday night National Basketball Association game between the Los Angeles La kers and the Milwaukee Bucks at Milwaukee Dec. 21 will be televised nationally by the American Broadcasting Com pany, Channel 7 in New York, starting at 9 P.M., the network announced yesterday.

title: 2 HURT, 3 SEIZED IN SCHOOL MELEE
description: Two students were injured and three were arrested yester day in new disorders at strife torn George Washington High School.

title: Celtics Win in Overtime
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 1 (UPI) Art Williams sank a 22foot jump shot with five seconds left in overtime tonight as the Boston Celtics, down by 18 points in the first half, edged the Buffalo Braves, 117116.

title: Raymond Zino Fiance Of Elizabeth Shaw
description: EAST HADDAM, Conn., Dec. 1Rear Adm. James C. Shaw, U. S. N., retired, and Mrs. Shaw have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Holt Perkins Shaw, to Raymond Grigore Zino, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marius A. Zino,, also of East Haddam. The wedding is planned for later this month.

title: Willard E. Shelton, Labor Editor, Dies In Capital at 65
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Willard Ellington Shelton, a longtime Washington news paperman and political col umnist, died today in George Washington University hospital after a brief illness. He was 65 years old.

title: MRS. SAMUEL ULANOFF
description: Mrs. Minnie Druss Ulanoff, wife of Samuel H. Ulanoff, member of the New York Stock Exchange firm of Hoppin Watson, died Friday in Putnam Community Hospital, Carmel, N. Y., after a short illness. She was 70 years old and lived at 220 East 57th Street and in Mahopac, N. Y.

title: Lakers Down Bullets
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 1 (UPI) Jerry West scored 37 points and Wilt Chamberlain blocked some key shots in the final minutes tonight as the Los An geles Lakers downed the Bal timore Bullets, 9793, in a Na tional Basketball Association name.

title: TEST MAIL STARTS ON BUSINESS DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)1  The United States Postal Service, following the lead of the British Post Office, today inaugurated a limited test of longhaul, overnight delivery of business documents.

title: 2 Reported Dead, 18 Saved In Ship Fire Off Nantucket
description: The crew of an American merchant vessel reported last night that it had recovered two bodies and 18 survivors from a Japanese fishing trawler that caught fire and was sink ing about 240 miles southeast of Nantucket.

title: TV: Six Experts Discuss the Country's Economy
description: Network television, which has tiptoed around the na tion's economic difficulties, met the issue headon last night in a special documen tary entitled Blue Christ mas: The State of the Econ omy on the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: Hartke Challenge Rejected
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 1 (AP) One of Democratic Senator Vance Hartke's motions to block a recount in his apparent Nov. 3 victory over his chal lenger, Representative Richard L. Roudebush, a Republican was overruled today. Judge Glenn W. Funk rejected Mr. Hartke's motion to dismiss a Roudebush petition for a re count in 124 precincts of Marion County.

title: Dooley Foundation Will Give Awards
description: The sixth annual Splendid American Awards will be given by the Thomas A. Dooley Foundation on Dec. 10 at a dinner dance at the Americana. Each guest of honor will receive a crystal abstract sculpture designed by Steuben Glass.

title: 3 MORE CONCERNS CUT COPPER PRICE
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration, the Anaconda Com pany and the Inspiration Con solidated Copper Company yes terday cut the price of basic copper by 3 cents a pound.

title: What Made Glass Fall in Times Sq.? Inquirers Puzzled
description: The city's Acting Buildings Commissioner said yesterday that he was mystified after a twoday investigation as to what had caused two sheets of glass to fall from a 50story building under construction in Times Square on Saturday night.

title: Film of Upset Viewed
description: Having forged three weeks of winning after six weeks of losing, the Jets suddenly have become successful at some thing elseavoiding injuries.

title: StandardBearer of Revolt
description: PARIS7The impending release of Regis Debray from a Bolivian jail is of international importance because, for the first time, it could give an experienced, serious leader to the revoltminded young New Left of the Western World.

title: U.S. Grand Jury to Resume Pro Football Investigation
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 1 (AP) A Federal grand jury that has been investigating pro foot ball will resume sessions here Dec. 14.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, Dec. 1, 1970

title: Disputed Chaparral Gets GoAhead for Next Year
description: The Chaparral 2J has been declared legal. The Sports Car Club of America, which sanctions the CanadianAmer ican Challenge Cup for Group 7 sportsracing cars, an nounced yesterday that the controversial 2J, introduced by Jim Hall in the 1970 se ries, would be permitted to run next year. About But the club has not heard the Motor last from the Sports Chaparral's prin clipal opponent. He Is Teddy Mayer, Ameri canborn manager of the Englandbased McLaren rac ing team, which has swept the CanAm championship four years in a row. Mayer is backing a formal protest to the superior governing body, the Commission Spor tive Internationale.

title: SEATTLE PUTS ON A STRONG FINISH
description: Because the Seattle Sonics wouldn't quit and because their own hot shooting cooled off late in the game, the New York Knicks had to endure a finish that was just a little too close for comfort before winning, 114109, at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Mexican Revolution After 60 Years. Great Progress, but Much Poverty, Too
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1The Mexican Revolution, which began 60 years ago as an up rising for land, bread and political freedom, has turned into a disciplined, productive system of nationalist capitalism.

title: Blackburn of Virginia U.  Is Out as Football Coach
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 1 (AP)George Blackburn will not be retained as football coach beyond the end of his contract next Jan. 25, the Uni versity of Virginia said today.

title: Williams Is Official Winner
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey was officially declared today the winner of the Nov. 3 elec tion. The New Jersey Board of Canvassers certified that Mr. Williams had won a third term, defeating the Republican chal lenger, Nelson G. Gross, by margin of 254,048 votes.

title: Witness Says Calley Shot Mylai Civilians
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 1 A former machine gunner testified today that he had seen his platoon commander, First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr., open fire on unarmed Viet namese civilians who had been herded into a ditch in the hamlet of Mylai 4.

title: Mansfield to Press Cuts
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 1Mike Mansfield, the Senate Demo cratic leader, served notice to day that he would seek Con gressional action next year to force a reduction of United States forces in Europe.

title: Leeds 242 Rugby Victor
description: LEEDS, England, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Leeds beat the Hull Kingston Rovers 242, in Rugby League Cup semifinal match tonight.

title: Gunman Is Seized in Harlem After Shooting One of His 3 Hostages
description: The disparate elements of a kidnapping charge, a Philadel phia murder trial and the dis covery of a bound corpse, came together yesterday as squads of policemen trained their weapons on a thirdfloor Har lem window behind which a frightened gunman was hold ing three persons hostage.

title: Pianist Adds Soul to Electronic Fete
description: The ColumbiaPrinceton Elec tronic Music Center was estab lished in 1959 but its com puters evidently have calcu lated that this is the year to celebrate its 10th anniversary, so on Monday night the first of two festive concerts took place at Columbia's McMillin Theater. As befits such an oc casion, live performers were scarce, the pianist Robert Miller being the only one to appear onstage, in fact.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Courage Needed in Facing State Fiscal Problems

title: Army Displays Scoring Punch In Routing Lehigh Five, 7247
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 1 Army added surprisingly ac curate shooting to its usual tough defense today and opened its basketball season with a 7247 victory over Lehigh.

title: TaxStudy Panel Asks Faster WriteOffs
description: President Nixon's Task Force on Business Taxation has rec ommended a major increase in the tax deductions that com panies are allowed to take for their investment in capital equipment, a member of the group said here yesterday.

title: President Appoints MacGregor Congressional Affairs Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 President Nixon moved today to strengthen his uncertain re1 lations with Congress by nam ing Representative Clark Mac Gregor as his principal assist ant for Congressional affairs.

title: Bonn Consul Is Kidnapped in Spain
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Wednesday, Dec. 2 (UPI)Sev eral men believed to be Spanish separatists kidnapped Eugen Beihl, the West German consul here, last night after lying in wait for the diplomat in his garage, the police said.

title: Medical School Fund Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The House voted 346 to 2 today to authorize $225million over three years to establish courses and training in medi cal schools and hospitals to try and halt the quickening disappearance of general prac titioners. The bill is similar to a fiveyear Senate bill author izing $425million.

title: A.H.L. Fines Clipper $500
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass. Dec. 1 (AP)  Larry Johnston, a de fenseman for the Baltimore Clippers, has been fined $500 by Jack Butterfield, president of the American Hockey League, the league office an nounced today. Johnston was fined for becoming physically involved with Referee Ken Bodendistel during a game at Providence Nov. 15, the league said.

title: CANTERBURY WARNS SOUTHAFRICAWH1TES
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 1The Archbishop of Canterbury, Dr. Arthur Mi chael Ramsey, warned South African whites today that they faced the choice between vio lent revolution and voluntary change to remove the injustices and inhumanity in their society.

title: Advertising: Activity in Syndication Field
description: While there is nothing new about advertiser involvement in television program syndi cation, there seems to have been quite a flurry of activity in that area recently.

title: For the Children: Things to Do and Places to See
Rev. Dr. David de Sola Pool Dies at 851
description: The Rev. Dr. David de Sola Pool, a world leader in Judaism, died last evening at his home, 91 Central Park West. He was 85 years old.

title: COMMONS ARGUES LIVERPOOL'S WOES
description: LONDON, Dec. 1Prime Minister Heath's Government came under political attack to day for refusing to supply pub lic funds to rescue the finan cially troubled Port of Liver pool.

title: BULLS SET BACK HERS, 107 TO 91
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (UPI)  The Chicago Bulls put on a 17 point spurt against the Phila delphia 76ers in the third peri od tonight and held on for a 10791 victory in a National Basketball Association game.

title: $114,000 Shakedown in Jersey Laid to Mosquito Commission
description: TRENTON. Dec. 1The State Commission of Investigation began public hearings today on charges that the Hudson County Mosquito Control Com mission had shaken down the Penn Central and a contractor for the New Jersey Turnpike Commission for $114,000.

title: OHIO STATE PUTS 4 ON HONOR SQUAD
description: Four members of the unde feated Ohio State team and the first Ivy Leaguer in 19 years highlight the United Press In ternational's 1970 AllAmerica college football team issued yesterday.

title: Key Aides Back SpeedUp In Expansion of Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Some of President Nixon's most influential advisers are advocat ing an economic policy for next year aimed at exceptionally rapid expansion of the economy  a rise in total output of 8 per cent in the last quarter of 1971 over the final quarter of this year.

title: U. S. ACCUSES BAKER IN STOCK FRAUD SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) Robert G. Baker was accused today of violating securities and exchange laws in the pur chase and sale of stock in metals corporation

title: RATES ARE LOWER IN CREDIT MARKET
description: ?? less than the 8.22 per cent provided by a smaller Delmarva Power and Light Company sale on Monday, also an Aarated credit. The same group will also market $50million of six year Detroit Edison bonds as 7's at 100.45 to yield 6.90 per cent.

title: Ky Heckled in California
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2, (UPI)  While shouting dem onstrators waved Vietcong flags outside his hotel, Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam, appealed to Americans today to continue to support his Government against the Communists.

title: Miss Yeilding Will Be Bride
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 1 Miss Hood Yeilding and Horace SeelyBrown 3d will be married next spring.

title: 2 UGANDA MUSICIANS GIVE PROGRAM HERE
description: Two musicians from Uganda, B. A. Kalanzi and J. M. Sendaula, who call themselves the Kars, sang and played music of their country, both traditional and modern, Monday evening at the Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street.

title: Nixon Economic Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Some old slogans as well as some recent metaphors are be ing openly abandoned here as the Nixon Administration scrambles to stimulate some very rapid economic growth. To wit: Only 10 months have passed since President Nixon declared in his State of the Union News address that we Analysis must balance our Federal budget so that American families will have a better chance to balance their family, budgets. Now, only halfway through that budget year, he is preparing a new budget that will bear a purposeful deficit in these conventional terms so as to encourage investment and help reduce unemployment.

title: Shell Oil Platform Is Ablaze in Gulf
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 1 (UPI)A Shell Oil Company drilling platform with 22 producing wells burst into flames in the Gulf of Mexico 10 miles off the Louisiana coast today. At least two men were killed.

title: Equatorial Guinea Ousts 40
description: MADRID, Dec. 1 (Reuters) A group of 40 Portuguese who said they had been expelled from Equatorial Guinea  at least six of them showing signs of having been severely beaten arrived at Madrid's Barajas Airport last night.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Aroiet Genl

title: HEARINGS FOCUS ON GAS IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1  The Federal Power Commission opened today a landmark hear ing on an application to im port liquid natural gas into the United States.

title: I Adams Leaving A.B.C. Unit
description: John Q. Adams will retire as president of ABC Interstate Theaters, Inc., the Texas film theater subsidy of the American Broadcasting Companies, on March 31. Mr. Adams, who has been with the concern 44 years, will be succeeded as president by William E. Mitchell, one of two executive vice presidents of the corporation.

title: UR. CRAFT SUNK IN GULF OF SUEZ
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 1  The Israeli military authorities an nounced tonight that an Egyp tian motor launch was sunk Saturday off the Sinai coast of the Gulf of Suez. Four Egyptian crewmen were killed, according to the announcement. derstood that Israeli forces opened fire on the lowflying planes, although neither side reported any damage.

title: Mrs. Pierson And Architect Are Wed Here
description: Mrs. Ann. Rockefeller Pier son, elder daughter of Gov ernor Rockefeller, was mar ried on Nov. 25 to Lionel R. Coste Jr., who heads Lionel Coste & Associates, archi tects and city planners here.

title: Blue Lake to Taos
description: The Senate can act today to right an old wrong. It expected to vote on whether or not to restore to the Taos tribe of the Pueblo Indians their title to a 48,000acre tract high in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains of New Mexico, a sanctuary nearly two centuries before Columbus first crossed the Atlantic.

title: U. S. Analysts Say Thai Rebels Have a New ChineseSupplied Base
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1  United States intelligence ana llysts have reported the estab ishment of a major Chinese supplied guerrilla base this month at Dong Luang, in east ern Thailand.

title: 40 Diabetes Experts Deplore Warning On Drug by F.D.A.
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (AP)A group of 40 top diabetes spe cialists charged today that the Food and Drug Administration, by a recent action, had dam aged the welfare of a million diabetic patients.

title: GERDA ZIMMERMANN IN SOLO DANCE BILL
description: Gerda Zimmermann does variety of things well. She moves with precise articulation, has a good sense of stagecraft and knows when standing still will make the strongest im pact, and she works best within the format of short mood pieces. Last night at the Cubiculn she presented a pro ram solo dances, the first half consisting of brief studies and the second given over to I he premiere of a sprawling and and not very successful dance called Salute to a Gorgon.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The Senate passed today a bill to es tablish an independent Federal agency with broad authority to function as an advocate and protector of consumer interests.

title: Warriors Top Hawks
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1 (UPI)A 6point spurt by Jeff Mullins in the fourth quarter led the San Francisco Warriors to a 113106 victory tonight over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: RESTRAINT URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Nixon Administration's second inflation alert leveled specific criticism today at wage or price increases in several industries, including construction, oil and automobiles.

title: Met Fille du Regiment With Sutherland Due
description: The Metropolitan Opera will revive Donizetti's La Fille du Regiment with Joan Sutherland in the title role during the 197172 season. The company has purchased the production in which Miss Sutherland appeared at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, London. The sets were designed by Anna Anni and the costumes by Marcel Escoffier. Sandro Sequi, who staged the London revival, will be the stage director here.

title: Rules Changes Proposed To Cut Down Injury Toll
description: Five more players were sidelined for the season yes terday, bringing this week's total to eight and the season total to 53. The latest casual ties were Jim Cheyunski and Toni Funchess of the Boston Patriots, Randy Minniear and Steve Engel of the Cleveland Browns and Jay Bachman of the Denver About Broncos.

title: Store Bandits Kill Guard
description: MACON, Ga., Dec. 1 (UPI) Two bandits killed a Wells Fargo guard and wounded two women today in a gun battle in a crowded department store and fled with $40,000. The guard, Rex E. Brantley, 45 years old, was shot twice as he delivered a money sack to the business office of a Sears, Roe buck and Company store.

title: Pontiff, in Australia, Cites Links of Church to Youth
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Wednes day, Dec. 2Pope Paul VI told young Australians at an out door mass this morning that the Roman Catholic Church shared many values of today's youth culture.

title: Administration Assailed By Muskie on the SST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1  Senator Edmund S. Muskie ac cused the Nixon Administration today of violating the spirit if not the letter of the law in the fight over the supersonic transport.

title: ExPoliceman Sentenced
description: S. CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 1 (UPI)  The first black man to wear the uniform of the West Virginia state police has been found guilty of dis orderly conduct and resisting arrest in an incident involving, a scuffle with a superior officer. Late yesterday James L. Giles, who was dismissed from thel force following the incident,) was sentenced to 20 days in jail and fined $100.

title: A Correction
description: In a story in the Nov. 21 edi tions of The Times, it was stated erroneously that the de parture of Prudential Grace Lines from the passenger ship business early next year would leave only two United States flag vessels, the Monterey and the Mariposa of the Pacific Far East Line, still in passenger service. In fact, the American President Lines ships, President Wilson and President Cleve land, also continue in the pas senger business with 24 cruises scheduled for 1971 and 1972, all leaving from San Francisco.

title: ETHIOPIA RECOGNIZES RED CHINESE REGIME
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 2Com munist China and Ethiopia an nounced today that they had established diplomatic relations.

title: WORLD IS ASSURED BY U. S. ON ASYLUM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The United States employed the full range of its foreign broadcast and information serv ices today to assure the world that the denial of asylum last week to a Lithuanian sailor re sulted from a bureaucratic bungle and not a change in United States policy on political refugees.

title: Miss Davis's Sister Cleared
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 1 CAP) Multiple felony charges against the 22yearold sister of Angela Davis and her husband have been dismissed in Superior Court for the second time. Judge Robert O. Staniforth dis missed the 18 charges against Samuel Jordan, 23, and his wife Fania Jordan, yesterday. The charges included attempted murder and assault of police men.

title: Rules Unit Asks Minors to End WildCard PinchHit Tests
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1 (AP)  Baseball's rules committee rejected proposals for colored bases and foul lines today at the winter meeting and voted to discontinue a wildcard, pinchhitting experiment in the minor leagues.

title: CUTBACK INDEFINITE, GERMAN DAILY SAYS
description: Gerhard Hirseland, manag ing editor of The Staats Zeitung and Herold, said yesterday that the Germanlanguage daily pa per was considering reducing its publication schedule to two days a week as a way out of financial difficulties.

title: Drop in U.S. Gold Imports Is Reported for October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reut ers)United States gold im ports fell in October to $14, 258,892 from September's $25, 797,973, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.The United States bought gold from only three countries  Canada, Switzerland and Britain. Canada's sales were largest at $7,997,270.

title: Edwin M'Donald And Mrs. Husted Wed in Montreal
description: Mrs. Charlotte Clark Husted was married in Montreal last Saturday to Edwin C. McDon ald, board chairman of the Royal Bank of Canada Trust Company of New York and of Thomson Newspapers, Inc. The ceremony at the Mount Royal Club was performed by the Rev. Dr. Alexander Kom thy of the United Church.

title: Carol Rosenberger impresses At Piano Recital in Tully Hall
description: Fifteen years ago, polio struck the young American pi anist Carol Rosenberger while she was studying in France. But Miss Rosenberger, who made her New York recital de but at Alice Tully Hall on Tues day night, turned that formid able hurdle into a catapult. In every way, her recovery has been complete, and then some.

title: HIPPIE IN SOUTHWEST SOUGHT IN 2 KILLINGS
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 2Ulysses S. Grant, the leader of a New Mexico hippie com mune near Albuquerque who unsuccessfully ran for Governor last month, is being sought by the police in the gunshot deaths of two commune residents last night.

title: Dow Industrials Top 800; Tape Runs Late at Close
description: The upwarddriving stock market stopped to refuel yes terday morning, then picked up momentum in a dramatic spurt toward the finish that saw it finally crest above the 800 level on the DowJones industrial average.

title: U. N. Speaks Up on Prisoners
description: The United Nations has spoken up eloquently and decisively in behalf of more humane treatment for prisoners of war and for compliance with the Geneva Convention of 1949. Ambassador Charles W. Yost said that adoption of this resolution by the General Assem bly Social Committee shows that the plight of American prisoners in Vietnam weighs on the conscience of the world.

title: STOCKS TAPER OFF  ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market drifted lower yesterday because of a lack of support after firm start that reflected the rally on Wall Street. Special sit uations dominated trading, but volume remained depressed.

title: RUMANIAN EXENVOY DEFECTS IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, Dec. 2  A senior Rumanian diplomat and his wife have requested political asylum in France, official sources disclosed today. The diplomat is Victor Dimitriu, who was Ambassador in Paris from 1964 to 1968.

title: 2 Cosmos Satellites Lofted
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today two new satellites, Cos mos 381 and Cosmos 382, the Soviet press agency Tass re ported.

title: Fanny May to Buy Regular Mortgages
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Federal National Mortgage As sociation announced today de tails of its new program, to begin in February, of purchas ing conventional mortgages.

title: Mets and Yanks Ponder Deal for Frank Robinson
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2The New York Yankees and Mets continued their efforts to ob tain Frank Robinson today as the trade market kept booming at baseball's winter convention.

title: Relief Plane Crash Kills 4
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 2 A fourengine turboprop plane chartered by the Belgian Red Cross in Luxembourg for a re lief flight crashed this after noon just before landing at Dacca Airport, killing all four Islandic crewmen aboard.

title: Taxi Parley Seeks A Pact for Drivers Meeting Tomorrow
description: Negotiations in the taxi dis pute continued yesterday in an effort to reach a tentative agreement before the scheduled general membership meeting of the Taxi Drivers Union tomor row morning at Manhattan Cen ter.

title: Paradox Files to Buy Pipeline That El Paso Gas Has to Sell
description: An application to acquire the Pacific Northwest Pipeline properties now being operated by the El Paso Natural Gas Company was filed yesterday in Federal District Court in Denver by the privately held Paradox Production Corpora tion.

title: Petroleum Group Def ends Increase  In CrudeOil Price
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2 (AP) A major oil industry organ ization today strongly defended recent crude oil. price increases as vital to stimulation of United States oil production which has fallen off in recent years while demand has steadily risen.

title: SENATE APPROVES TWO CURBS ON SST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate voted unanimously to day to require that supersonic transport airplanes be quieter in every stage of operation than the jetliners in common use today.

title: Screen: A Twin Bill of Sex Pictures:Loew's State II Runs From 'R' to 'X' Romances of Nurses Follow TV Format
description: The operations of "The Student Nurses" and "The Love Doctors," revealed at Loew's State II yesterday, are simple pseudo-clinical evidence that such TV series as "The Nurses" and the Masters-Johnson sex studies are not being overlooked as inspirational material by our moviemakers. Both are more closely related to the genus skin flick than to the austere practices of the American Nurses Association or original research in the medical sciences.In either case, the skin flick affliction is very mild and the possibility of contagion is slight. These seemingly serious dramatizations of the tribulations of their young men and women in white, filmed in fine color, only prove that the practitioners appear to have as many woes as their patients."The Student Nurses," four of them to be exact, are as quick on romance as they are on stuy. Sharon goes for her young, terminal case; Priscilla for a freaky, LSD imbibing bike boy; Phred for an interne who even helps with an abortion for Priscilla, and Lynn, for her Mexican-American La Causa activist boy friend. Things are rough, obviously, for the ladies, who appear to win nothing but their graduation caps. "Nothing stands still, I guess," Lynn says bravely, but it makes you wonder what kind of attention you'll get from these graduates when you're ill.Nothing stands still either for "The Love Doctors," in this case Ann Jannin and Frank Mahalan, whose problems are to keep aiding and charting the sex responses of their disturbed volunteers and to thwart a puritan college regent who wants to stop their experiment. Among their volunters are a young widow and a man whose wife is an invalid; a lawyer whose wife thinks she's frigid, and a blonde whose older boy friend is neglecting her.Despite the brief exposures and simulated couplings, viewing their minimal reactions on closed circuit TV, and oscilloscopes, does little to raise the temperature or expand our mental horizons. A tragic climax that does, however, point to a happier future for the Human Heterosexual Laboratory," is of no help to "The Love Doctors" or their patients, who still need lots of acting, writing and directional care.

title: Science Leader Criticizes Nixon on Lagging Research
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Dr. Philip Handler, president of the National Academy of Sciences, charged today that the Nixon Administration was allowing the American scientif ic complex to drift toward decay.

title: Essay by Pompidou Will Be Published For Friends Only
description: PARIS, Dec. 2The manu script of an essay about the philosophy of government by President Pompidou is in the hands of a Paris publisher. However, according to a reliable publishing source, it will be printed privately in a small press run and distributed to friends.

title: Senate Confirms Ruckelshaus To Head Environment Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate approved today, by unanimous voice vote, the nom ination of William D. Ruckels haus as director of the new En vironmental Protection Agency.

title: Tito to Call on the Pope
description: ROME, Dec. 2  President Tito of Yugoslavia will make an official call on Pope Paul VI on Dec. 12 at the end of a two day state visit to Italy, it was announced by the Vatican and in Belgrade today.

title: Little Rock and Providence Win Approval of Job Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson announced today the tentative Federal approval of plans by Little Rock, Ark., and Providence, R. I., to increase employment of Negroes and other minority workers on construction projects.

title: Head of Legal Aid Unit for Poor Here Scores O.E.O. Dismissals
description: John DeWitt Gregory, chief counsel and executive director of Community Action for Legal Services, charged yesterday that the dismissal of Washing ton officials heading the national program dedicated to supplying free services to the poor was part of an alarming attempt to subject lawyers representing the poor to local political pressures.

title: World Trade Down In Quarter but Up 11% Over 69 Span
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 World trade declined sea sonally in the third quarter of this year but continued to show strong yeartoyear expansion, the International Monetary Fund reported today.

title: STEPHEN L. MAYHAM OF COSMETICS GROUP
description: Stephen L. Mayham, retired executive vice president and for many years spokesman for the Toilet Goods Association, Inc., an international cosmetic trade group, died here Tues day. Mr. Mayham was 78 years old and lived at 8515 Main Street, Jamaica, Queens.

title: Buckley Is Briefed by Goodell In Friendly Meeting at Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Sen atorelect James L. Buckley and the Senator he unseated in the election last month, Charles E. Goodell, spent an amiable hour together today discussing the transition of the Senate office from liberal Republican to Con servative.

title: BACK TO BARGAIN FOR MORE IN 1971
description: As the surprise club leader In rushing yardage and touch downs, George Nock signed his 1970 contract with the New York Jets yesterday for an estimated $18,000.

title: A.A.U. TRIES TO EASE RULES ON PICTURES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. (UPI)The Amateur Athletic Union's national track and field committee, headed by Coach Stan Wright of Sacramento State, moved today for liberali zation of rules concerning the use of pictures and signatures of athletes in their daily occu pations.

title: M'ALOON VICTOR ON SPLIT VERDICT
description: Irish reaction had to be mixed last night as Irish Danny McAloon of the Bronx scored his second split decision this year over Irish Bob O'Brien of Bayside, Queens, before 1,800 fans in the Felt Forum.

title: Air Force Doctor Ousted
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Dec. 2 (UPI)  Capt. Richard Hubbard, an Air Force doctor who became a conscien tious objector because of what he called the military's capac ity for evil, was ordered to day to be dismissed from the service. Captain Hubbard, 29 years old, of Galion, Ohio, and Air Force Academy graduate, was found guilty by a oneman courtmartial of deliberately missing a flight to Vietnam last, July 6.

title: Ernie Ford's Mother Dies
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., Dec. 2 (AP) Mrs. Maude Lee Ford, mother of Tennessee Ernie Ford, died in a Kingsport hospital yester day after a long illness. She was 74 years old. Her husband, T. C. Ford, died last June. She is survived also by another son, Stanley, of Bristol; a sister and a brother.

title: House Unit Refuses to Approve Bill Creating Consumer Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  The House Rules Committee dealt a serious and possibly fatal blow today to legislation to establish an independent consumer protection agency in the executive branch.

title: U.S. Yacht Sweeps Aussies
description: SYDNEY. Australia, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The Sari Francisco Yacht, St. Francis IV, won again today and scored a 40 sweep over Australia's Toogoo lonwoo V in the fourofseven race series for the America Australia 6meter yachting Challenge Cup. St. Francis IV, skippered by Toni Blackaller, beat Toogoolonwoo V, skip pered by Bill Solomons, by minutes 1 secnd in the fourth race.

title: Hijacking Not Political, U.S. and Soviet Concur
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 2 (UPI) The United States and the So viet Union agreed today that hi jacking of aircraft should be considered a common crime and not a political offense.

title: Marketplace:
description: The American public is trusting.

title: DROP REGISTERED BY WORLD SUGAR
description: World sugar futures prices dropped yesterday as a result of a decision by the executive committee of the International Sugar Organization, meeting in London, not to release more sugar to the world freemarket at this time.

title: Challenge to European Industry: To Accelerate Common Ties
description: To meet the challenge of American industry in future yeas, Europe must accelerate the integration process that be gan with the formation of the Common Market.

title: Bolivia Expected to Free Debray at Christmastime
description: LA PAZ. Bolivia, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The jailed French writer Regis Debray will be freed around Christmas as part of a general amnesty for po litical prisoners, high Govern ment sources said today.

title: Three Witnesses in Jersey Testify They Paid Official $100,000 in Graft
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2Three witnesses at a public hearing conducted by the State Com mission of Investigation testi fied today that they had paid nearly $100,000 in kickbacks to C. Harry Callari, the executive secretary of the Hudson County Mosquito Extermination Com mission.

title: 26 Survivors of Jet Crash In Alaska Will Be Airlifted
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 2 (AP) The Alaskan Air Command an nounced today that 26 survi vors of a jet air crash on Friday will be airlifted to mili tary hospitals near their home towns within a week.

title: Appropriations Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI)  The Senate Appropriations Committee approved today $17.7billion appropriations bill for the Department of Housing and Urban Development and the independent agencies. The committee accepted without change the money bill ap proved by the House vote 375 to 10. President Nixon vetoed the original $18billion H.U.D. independent agencies appropri ations bill as too costly.

title: A CALLEY WITNESS REFUSES ANSWERS
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 2A longhaired youth who once told Army investigators that First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. had ordered the slaughter of Vietnamese civil ians at Mylai 4 invoked the Fifth Amendment today at the Calley courtmartial and re fused to answer all questions relating to the alleged mas sacre.W. Kennedy, that most of the questions were not incriminat ing and had to be answered.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nixon Correct on Vietnam

title: Butterflies Are Free: Still a Winner
description: The very real pleasure to be found in Leonard Gershe's comedy, Butterflies Are Free, now in its second year at the Booth Theater, is the effortless elegance with which it achieves every thing it has set out to achieve. It is funny, touching and wryly sentimental. It provides entertainment with out talking down, it is witty, honest, in that particular way proverbs tend to be hon est, and exquisitely written.

title: Personal Finance: Food Budget Pinch
description: Food prices held steady in October and that may be a little solace to housewives. However, in the last two years food prices have risen more than 10 per cent, cause for some financial headaches. With this and the persistent overall increase in the cost of living as measured by the consumer price index, the typical family has been pinched where it hurtsin the pocketbook.she shops once or twice a week and not more and sticks to her list of needs. In that way she has less opportunity to pick out inessentials from the shelves that can push up her bill sharply.

title: Rep. Colmer Believed Successful in Blocking Antibias Job Bill for This Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  Representative William M. Col mer, a Mississippi Democrat, appears to have succeeded in blocking passage this year of a bill to give the Federal Gov ernment power to enforce non discrimination in employment.

title: Senate Unit Tightens Definition Of Unemployed in Welfare Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate Finance Committee vot ed today for a change in the definition of unemployment that could deny welfare bene fits to thousands of parttime workers now eligible to receive them.

title: PROFIT RISES 12% AT ARMOURDIAL
description: Earnings came to $14,305,00 or $1.39 a share, up from $12, 727,000, or $1.23 a share in the previous fiscal year. Earn ings for fiscal 1969 have been restated to reflect a change to the equity method of account ing for its investments in for eign subsidiaries. The re statement added four cents share to the $1.19 reported last year. Net sales increased to $234,971,000 from $216,606,000.

title: Coast Democrat Seeks Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)  Representative George E. Brown Jr. announced today his candidacy for the chairman ship of the Democratic party in California and said he be lieved that President Nixon can and will be defeated in his home state in 1972. Mr. Brown said he had consulted many leading California Dem ocrats.

title: Bridge:
description: American bridge organiz ers have been much more backward than their Euro pean counterparts in plan ning competions for young players. In the United States there is an annual competi tion for students but that is all.

title: New Life for New Towns
description: The housing bill approved by the Senate and the companion measure pending in the House provide new substantial Federal help for both public and private corporations to develop entire new communities, the socalled new towns which have long been familiar in Britain and Scandinavia.

title: CORDERO IS FIRST ON THREE HORSES
description: Ship Leave bounced back to his form of last year in win ning the feature purse at Aque duct yesterday. Gustave Ring's 4yearold campaigner romped to a clear triumph in the 11/8 mile event, beating his near est rival, Marion Frankel's Wicked Man, by 3 lengths. Next in the field of nine was Sigmund Sommer's Pleas ant Harbour, a length and a quarter farther back. The 1110 favorite, Irurzun, finished in the pack.

title: Rider 7973 Victor
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 2 Clutch foul shooting by Barry Spears sparked the Rider bas ketball team to a 7973 victory tonight over Hofstra. Spears hit five straight freethrows in the final two minutes, while Hofstra was employing a full court press in an effort to get the ball.

title: CrossCountry Skiing Making Impressive Strides
description: Skiing has become expen sive, but not for me, said Art Tokle, the former na tional skijumping champion. Ten dollars for a daily lift ticket? That's ridiculous. I go uphill for nothing.

title: Al Hirschfeld Show Due
description: Al Hirschfeld, caricaturist, will have a oneman show of his drawings and unpublished lithographs on Dec. 7 at Graphics Inc., 21 Greenwich Avenue and West 10th Street. Some of the artist's subjects, including personalities of the theater scene, will attend the exhibition as will Mr. Hirsch feld's daughter, Nina, whose name is embroidered at least once in each of his drawings.

title: Hughes Leaves His Nevada Hotel and Is Reported in Bahamas
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2 Howard Hughes, one of the richest and most mysterious men in the world, left his hotel suite on the Las Vegas Strip a week ago.

title: I.M.F. Buys More Gold
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reu ters)The International Mone tary Fund announced today that it purchased a further $122.5million worth of gold from South Africa in Novem ber. This raised the total bought under the gold arrange ment with South Africa that went into effect at the begin ning of the year to $517.25 million.

title: White House to Unveil John Kennedy Portrait
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) A portrait of President John F. Kennedy will be unveiled at the White House next month along with a painting of his widow, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, it was learned today.

title: Soviet Changes Bolshoi and Mosfilm Leadership
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2Soviet authorities have announced highlevel changes in the Bol shoi Theater and Mosfilm studio, two of the country's leading cultural establish ments.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
BILL THAT EXPANDS HOUSING PROGRAMS WINS A HOUSE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  A compromise housing bill that would make sweeping new pro visions for the development of new communities won a test vote in the House of Represen tatives tonight.

title: Bandleader Marries Mrs. Keating
description: Mrs. Marianne Bier Keat ing, widow of John G. Keating, was married here yesterday afternoon to Charles Stoneham McCarty, band leader of the Brass Instru mentalists, a classical and jazz group. The ceremony was performed at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Jack lams by Civil Court Judge Leonard H. Sandler.

title: North Stars Triumph, 32
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 12 (UPI)Bill Goldsworthy tip ped in the winning goal on a second period power play to night to lead the Minnesota North Stars to a 32 victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: Stores and Unions Open Campaign Against Shoplifters
description: An intensive citywide cam paign to combat the growing problem of shoplifting and pickpocketing was begun yes terday by five department stores, three supermarket chains and 24 labor unions.

title: Slick Found Off Florida
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. (AP)An oil slick covering 760 square miles was located today in the Atlantic Ocean 23 miles off north Florida. A spokes man for the state said that the Navy had deliberately dumped it.

title: Tokyo Increases Aid
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2  Stung widespread criticism that of ficial Japanese aid to East Pakistani cyclone victims has been niggardly, the Japanese Cabinet yesterday approved a contribution of $1.5million in addition to its original gift of $150,000.

title: AMEX ISSUES HP IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to advance yesterday in active trading in a session that saw more large blocks cross the tape than ever be fore in the history of the exchange.

title: Paper Sponsor to Give Ecology Views on TV Show
description: A World or Love is what the allstar review is being called and it is now being taped at the United Nations General Assembly, where it is being produced with the coop eration of UNICEF, the Unit ed Nations Children's Fund.

title: A Warning to the Dollar
description: PARIS  Early in 1968, American tourists in France had an unpleasant experience: hotelkeepers wouldn't take their dollars without a substantial dis count.

title: Ousted City Principal Balks at Leaving
description: The ousted principal of Joan of Arc Junior High School showed up at. her office yester day morning and remained there all day, in defiance of an order from her district superintendent to report to his office.

title: Books of The Times
description: In spite of the mumbling and grumbling along Publishers Row, in spite of the Dow Jones averages (now a trifle better), in spite of ancestral voices prophesying doom, book stores this season are stuffed with the usual holiday cheer. The books are lusciously gotten up, often in color we would give a couple of wisdom teeth to see in nature, printed on weighted paper, and expensive enough to keep a man pleased with himself until the tax collector sends his billetdoux next April. The following sampling of books that have crossed the desk is designed only to jog the imagina tion, to indicate what is around and per haps supply an hour or two of pleasant browsing. The order in which they appear is pure chance.

title: Mayoral Deception On Corona Charged By Estimate Board
description: Members of the Board of Es timate charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay had deceived and fooled them in urging the razing of a Corona, Queens, neighborhood for a high school three weeks ago and then sud denly reversing the plan to as sume the role of a hero.

title: Women Pages Return To Floor of Big Board
description: The women's liberation movement took another step forward yesterday as the New York Stock Exchange allowed female pages on its trading floor for the first time since World War II.

title: U.S. Aides Promise Soviet To Find Arms News Leak
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The United States delegation at the talks in stra tegic arms limitation has prom ised the Soviet negotiators that it will find out how an ap parent news leak occurred, in formed sources said today.

title: A Touch of Diplomacy Gives Squirrels Victory
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (AP) The squirrels won the battle of Regents Park today, and the crocus bulbs of Walter A. Annenberg, the United States Ambassador, will have to suffer.

title: G.M. AND CHRYSLER LAGGING IN SALES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2The Gen eral Motors Corporation report ed today that its dealers sold only 23,589 cars in the final third of November and only 88,645 in the full month, a frac tion of the 111,584 and 362,668 car sales in the comparable periods last year.

title: Ky, in Los Angeles, Says He Is Not Upset by Protests
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2 (UPI) Nguyen Cao Ky, Vice Presi dent of South Vietnam, said today that he was not disturbed by demonstrations against him and indicated he would have liked to have met some of the protesters.

title: 3 Coal Miners Are Killed In Pennsylvania Rock Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  Three coal miners were crushed to death under a rock fall in the Russellton, Pa., mine of the Republic Steel Corporation, the Bureau of Mines reported to day. Three sections of the mine were ordered closed.

title: Sonics Top Royals, 119111
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 2 (UPI) The Cincinnati Royals squand ered a 25point halftime lead and lost. 119111, to the Seattle Supersonics tonight in a Na tional Basketball Association game.

title: PIERRE BEDARD,75, OF DESIGN SCHOOL
description: Pierre Bedard, former presi dent of the Parsons School of Design and since last spring special consultant to the New School for Social Research with which Parsons had become af filiated, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 1040 Park Avenue.

title: A 2D NEGRO JOINS BOBBY SEALE JURY
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 2A 22 yearold Negro woman wno dis played a reluctance to serve on the jury was selected today as the third juror in the murder trial of Bobby G. Seale, national chairman of the Black Panther Party.

title: SIDNEY GONDELMAN
description: LAKE SUCCESS, L. I., Dec. 2 Sidney Gondelman of 92 Mer rivale Road, president and chair man of Central Foundry Com pany with plants in Holt, Ala., and Buffalo, died today in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset. He was 73 years old.

title: SLIDES SAID TO SHOW U.S. TORTURE IN WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2A group of Vietnam war veterans continued their efforts today to document charges of wide spread murder, torture and terrorism by American forces in South Vietnam.

title: Soviet Tender Still Plying Caribbean
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2High Administration officials are said to suspect that the Soviet Union is playing a maritime catand mouse game with its sub marine tender in the Caribbean.

title: Pros Rally to Beat Pacers, 106 to 100, On Joneses Scoring
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 2 (AP) The Memphis Pros outscored Indiana, 111, in the final two minutes tonight and whipped, the Pacers, 106100, in an American Basketball Associa tion game.

title: A Warm Spell Invokes Signs and Sighs of Spring Here
description: The sidewalk Santas and the department store tinsel and colored lights made it look like the Christmas sea son, but it felt more like spring when the temperatures rose to 66 degrees, a record for the date, yesterday.

title: CITY WILL CLOSE 5 RELIEF CENTERS
description: The city announced yester day that five of its 50 welfare centers would be closed by Feb. 1 because of the fiscal crisis. Municipal union lead ers responded promptly with plans for a job action to protest the resulting heavier loads on caseworkers.

title: 10 Catholic Schools Will Close As Buffalo Diocese Cuts Budget
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 2Ten Cath olic schools will be closed and plans for a new hospital have been canceled as part of a re trenchment program that the Roman Catholic Diocese of Buf falo started today.

title: Honor Listed For Warren
description: Former United States Chief Justice Earl Warren will be guest of honor at the annual dinner of the Synagogue Council of America on Sun day evening at the Waldorf Astoria.

title: Barenboim on Podium: Robust Control
description: Daniel Barenboim con ducted the Philadelphia Or chestra at. Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night, and it was hard to believe that so young a man was creating such for midable structures in sound. He has come up as a pianist, and only recently has turned to the podium, but it is on the podium where he belongs. Certainly he conducts with much more freedom and au thority than he plays the nano.

title: Investment Bankers Back a Plan to Review and Restructure Wall St.
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. The board of governors of the Investment Bankers Associ ation unanimously approved here today a recommendation to form an industrywide commission to conduct an ex tensive review of the sec ondary market for stocks and bonds.

title: CELTICS CAPTURE THEIR 6TH IN ROW
description: BOSTON, Dec. 2 (AP)JoJo White sank a 20foot jump shot) in the closing moments tonight and John Havlicek put in a free throw with six seconds. to play for the Boston Celtics1 as they defeated the Los An geles Lakers, 114111, for their sixth straight National Basket ball Association victory.

title: Australia and England Play To a Draw in Cricket Test
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. (Reuters)  The first cricket test between Australia and England finished in a draw today.

title: Quebec Reports on Arrests
description: QUEBEC, Dec. 2 (AP)The Quebec police made 3,068 raids and arrested 453 persons under the War Measures Act from Oct. 16, the day the act was invoked, to Nov. 24, the na tional assembly was told today by Justice Minister Jerome Choquette.

title: Bar List Omission
description: In yesterday's listing in The New York Times of the 1,526 candidates who had passed the state bar examinations, the name of Frances Carol Sabel of 6 Huckleberry Lane, Hamp ton Bays, L. 1., was inadvert ently omitted.

title: Southern Teams Still Dominate Selections to Postseason Bowls
description: What is the dominant fac tor in selecting a college football team for a bowl, its wonlost record or ability to sell tickets?

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: ACWORTH, N. H.  Two days of deer hunting by four men in the rugged country side of westcentral New Hampshire produced only two snowshoe rabbits.

title: Britain to Turn Clock Back to G.M.T.
description: LONDON, Dec. 2The House of Commons voted tonight to end Britain's brief flirtation with Continental clock time. Beginning next November, the clocks here will be back on Greenwich mean time.

title: Pearl Gala Dec. 15 to Aid Retarded
description: The Pearl Gala, 14th an nual benefit for the Associa tion for the Help of Retarded Children, will be held on Dec. 15 in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza.

title: Laurel Results
description: Laurel Results
