title: UNION AT FORD BARS EXTENSION OF TALKS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2 (UPI)The United Automobile Workers top negotiator with the Ford Motor Company said today that there would be no further extensions of the union's con tract with the company past the strike deadline of midnight Monday.

title: Pope, in Australia, Consecrates Bishop of New Guinea
description: SYDNEY. Australia, Thurs day, Dec. 3Pope Paul VI, in his last mass in Australia, this] morning consecrated the first nativeborn bishop of the Terri tories of Papua and New Guinea.

title: Colonels Beat Condors
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 2 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels, Eastern Division leaders in the American Basketball Associa tion, got back on the winning track tonight by defeating the Pittsburgh Condors, 139127.

title: Justice Gellinoff Stricken
description: Justice Abraham J. Gellinoff collapsed with an apparent heart attack in State Supreme Court here yesterday while presiding over an extortion trial. He was taken to Beekman Downtown Hospital, where his condition last night was de scribed as critical.

title: For 73 Useful Objects, a Place in a Museum
description: There are those who believe that if someone builds a better mousetrap, it is bound to get star billing in the Museum of Modern Art's Design Collection.

title: Reading Company to Defer Collateral Note Payments
description: The Reading Company an nounced yesterday in Philadel phia that it was deferring prin cipal payments of $2million each due July 1 through 1973 on its outstanding $28million collateral notes guaranteed by the Interstate Commerce Com mission.

title: Chess
description: In the third round of the 24man interzonal knockout tournament at Palma. Ma jorca, Grandmaster Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles was White against International Master William Addison of San Francisco in an old fashioned Center Counter Game.

title: CourtMartial of 15 Basques Today Troubling Spain
description: MADRID, Dec. 2Shortly after 3 P.M. on Aug. 2, 1968, Menton Manzanas, head of the Political Police in the Province of Guipuzcoa, was shot dead on the stairs leading to his apartment in the dingy town of Iran, on the French border.

title: 2 Patrolmen Dismissed Over a $2 Bribe
description: Two patrolmen have been dismissed after being found guilty in a departmental trial of taking $2 from a small Brooklyn grocery store in re turn for not giving the owner a summons for being open on Sunday.

title: Atoms Track Club Places 5 on AllAmerican Unit
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2 At the Ameateur Athletic Union national women's track and field committee meeting at the Sheraton Palace Hotel, five members of Brooklyn's Atoms Track Club were named to the United States allAmerica track team today.

title: NATO ADOPTS PLAN TO BOLSTER FORCE DURING THE 1970'S
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 2The North Atlantic Treaty Organization adopted proposals today to strengthen the West's conven tional forces in Europe and the Middle East.

title: VIRGIL FOX PLAYS AT FILLMORE EAST
description: Someone in the balcony at Fillmore East on Tuesday night yelled Go, Virgil! And off went Virgil Fox into a program of Bach's organ music, backed by the chromatic extravagan zas of Joe's Lights. Mr. Fox, whose usual habitat is the con cert hall or the church, was invading New York's rock cathedral to sell the gospel of Johann Sebastian.

title: Regan Says Fixed Rates Should Be First Relic Discarded in Changes
description: The president of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the nation's largest brok erage house, called yesterday for an elimination of fixed mini mum commissions for stock transactions on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Mrs. Victor Harris Is Dead; Composer's Widow Was 80
description: Mrs. Catherine Richardson Harris. widow of Victor Harris, composer of many songs and conductor of the St. Cecilia Society from 1902 to 1936, died yesterday in her home at 150 East 69th Street. She was 80 years old and also had a resi dence in New Milford. Conn.

title: Francis J. Wazeter, Founder Of Pulaski Day Parade, Dead
description: YONKERS, Dec. 2Francis J. Wazeter, founder of the an nual Pulaski Day Parade on Fifth Avenue in New York and a statewide leader among New Yorkers of Polish origin, died today in St. John's Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: Coast Arts School on Unorthodox Path
description: BURBANK, Calif.  I see this place, said Herbert Blau, as total theater.

title: Senate Votes to Give Land to Taos Indians
WPIX WILL TELEVISE 10 N.Y. NETS GAMES
description: Ten New York Nets basket ball games will be televised; over WPIXTV, Channel 11, beginning Saturday night, Jan. The telecasts will mark the first appearances on television for the local representatives of the American Basketball Asso ciation.

title: BOSTON BOWS, 43, IN LAST 5 MINUTES
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 2 (UPI) Dennis Hull broke ties twice with his 11th and 12th goals of the season tonight in leading the Chicago Black Hawks to 43 victory over the Boston Bruins in a National Hockey Leaeue name.

title: Second Inflation Alert
description: The Administration's second Inflation Alert declares that economic policy is now in a new phasea phase of trying to speed up the response of costs and prices to the slack which exists in the economy while assuring that the slack does not last too long.

title: Soviet Scientists Told Acts Independent of Party Aid Enemy
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2  Soviet scientists were warned today that they were aiding the enemy if they acted independ ently of the Communist party line.

title: Spain Hunts Kidnappers of Bonn Consul
description: MADRID, Dec. 2The police set up roadblocks around San Sebastian today to try to catch the kidnappers of the honorary West German consul, Eugen Beihl, who was seized last night, apparently by a Basque underground group.

title: They Expected a Snob, They Heard a Comedian
description: Her profile is often likened to that of Nefertiti. The in ternational set swoons over her beauty, and fashion edi tors persist in calling her the most elegant woman in the world.really, in a town called Epa linges, up in the hills of Lau sanne.

title: MURDER SUSPECT TO BE EXAMINED
description: Charles Mathis, a 41yearold Philadelphian arrested Tuesday in a Harlem apartment where tile police found two hostages and a corpse, was ordered to Bellevue Hospital yesterday for psychiatric examination.

title: Tyranny of The Third House
description: The autocratic power of the House Rules Committee has deprived American consumers of the protection an independent Federal agency with broad authority to advocate and safeguard their interests.

title: SOVIET SHIP IS HELD AT CANAL ON WRIT
description: PANAMA, Dec. 2 (AP)  A Soviet ship bound for Australia with 700 passengers was at tached early today by order of the United States District Court of the Canal Zone in connnec tion with a $12million suit.

title: ROBERT C. PEALE, 69, PHYSICIAN, IS DEAD
description: He was the middle son of the I Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Charles Clif ford Peale. His older brother, Norman, and his younger brother, the Rev. Leonard D. Peale of Brewster, N. Y., proj ects director of Guideposts magazine, became ministers like their father, but Robert chose to be a physician.

title: Police Agent in Panther Case A Boyhood Friend of Defendant
description: The police undercover agent who supplied surreptitiously transcribed recordings said to be of conversations of Black Panthers on trial here was a boyhood friend of one of the defendants, it was disclosed yesterday in State Supreme Court.

title: Washington High Gets Fourth Principal This Year
description: A 42yearold high school teacher yesterday was named to take over today as principal of the embattled George Wash ington High School and he said he hoped to inspire confidence among the parents, students and teachers.

title: Stars Halt Squires
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. (UPI)  The Utah Stars with stood a fourthperiod drive by the Virginia Squires tonight and increased their Western Division American Basketball Association lead with a 122115

title: Mr. Laird's Credibility Gap
description: Disingenuous is a charitable word to describe Defense Secretary Laird's explanation of why he failed to tell the Senate Foreign Relations Committee that the Nov. 21 bombing of North Vietnam included air strikes in the Hanoi area. I only answer the questions that are asked, he said.

title: Caroline C. Owen Is Fiancee Of James Julian Coleman Jr.
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 2 Miss Caroline Campbell Owen, granddaughter of the late Robert Lee Blaffer, a founder of the Humble Oil and Re fining Company, and great granddaughter of the late William Thomas Campbell, a founder of the Texas Com pany, plans to be married here on Dec. 19 to James Julian Coleman Jr., a partner of the New Orleans law firm of Clay, Coleman, Dutrey and Thomson. The ceremony will be at the home of Mrs. Blaf fer, the bride's grandmother.

title: Newest Unit of City U. Named for Medgar Evers
description: The newest college or the City University of New York, which will open next fall in midBrooklyn, was named yes terday for Medgar W. Evers, the civil rights leader killed by a sniper in Mississippi in 1963.

title: HumanRights Debaters At U.N. Avert Fistfight
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 2Delegates debating human rights nearly had a fistfight today in the Social Committee over the right of one of them to speak.

title: NEW OFFERS URGED IN THEATER DISPUTE
description: A state mediator asked both sides in the Off Broadway thea ter strike to move heaven and earth to come in with new prop ositions before they resume bargaining sessions tomorrow.

title: Britain's Reserves Expand
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (Reuters) Britain's gold and dollar re: serves increased by $64.8mil lion in November even after allowing for debt repayment and other special outgoing pay ments, totaling $204  million, the Treasury announced today.

title: POSTAL STRIKE CHIEF UPSET IN VOTE HERE
description: The leader of last spring's New York City postal strike, the first in the nation, was un seated as president of local Branch 36 of the National As sociation of Letter Carriers in what was described as an upset election last night.

title: GIBSON PROPOSES NEW TAX PACKAGE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 2A new tax program for helping Newark out of a critical financial situa tion has been proposed by Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and approved by the City Council.

title: At This Ark, the Idea Is to Watch the Animals on the Outside
description: NAIROBI. KenyaSomeone at din ner at The Ark remarked that he had seen buffalo tail soup on a Nairobi hotel menu, and a hunterguide was surprised.

title: Court Rejects City Bid to Force Beame to Pay Consultant Fee
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday dismissed suit brought by the Lindsay ad ministration to compel Control ler Abraham D. Beame to pay $250,000 to a private consult ant for work done for the city.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Defense Planning Committee of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization adopted yesterday a document pledging concrete steps to strengthen conventional forces in Europe and the Middle East. The report cited a similar bolstering of Soviet forces in East ern Europe. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Memorex Says I.B.M. Suit On Secrets Is Groundless
description: The Memorex Corporation yesterday described a suit filed against it Tuesday by the International Business Ma chines Corporation charging Memorex with wrongfully tak ing and using I.B.M. trade se crets as groundless and whol ly without merit.

title: RATES ARE DOWN IN BOND MARKET
description: The corporate bond market gathered additional momentum yesterday as underwriters priced new offerings at sub stantially lower interest rates and investors nonetheless rushed to buy them.

title: Picturephones Placed in Offices Of Top Aides at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) The latest status symbol in the White House is the Pic turephone, which has been in stalled in the offices of some of President Nixon's principal aides.

title: N. M. Harris Weds Mrs. Feder
description: Mrs. Irma Rosenberger Feder, widow of James L. Feder, was married here yes terday afternoon to Nelson M. Harris, vice president of the Sameth Exterminating Company here. The cere mony was performed at the home of the bride's sister, Mrs. E. J. Liebowitz, by Rabbi Bernard Bamberger of Shaarav Tefila Congregation.

title: City Ordered to Revoke Permit for S.I. Grading
description: A State Supreme Court Jus tice yesterday ordered the city to revoke a grading per mit issued to a Staten Island developer accused of despoil ing private land to sell earth for land fill.

title: Honors in Racing Go to Personality And Fanfreluche
description: Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs's Per sonality and JeanLouis Leves que's Fanfreluche were named yesterday the top 3yearolds of 1970 by the Thoroughbred Racing Associations.

title: Nixon to Issue New, Clear Policy on Accepting Political Refugees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The White House said today that President Nixon would set forth a new, clear policy on politi cal refugees to prevent recur rence of the incident last week in which the United States Coast Guard refused sanctuary to a Lithuanian sailor.

title: Nagel Out After 5 Years As Iowa's Football Coach
description: IOWA CITY, Dec. 2 (UPI) Ray Nagel made the meeting of the University of Iowa ath letics board easier today.

title: 2d Autopsy of a Tombs Suicide Hints Beating Before Hanging
description: A leading pathologist said last night that a prisoner said to have committed suicide Nov., 3 had injuriesnot themselves fatal  that could have been sustained during an altercation or a beating before death.

title: Reform in Indian Bureau
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  The Commissioner of Indian Affairs, Louis R. Bruce, has begun a fundamental reform of the Bureau of Indian Af fairs that is intended to put the future of the nation's In dians into their own hands.

title: Plante Blanks Kings
description: TORONTO, Dec. 2 (UPI) Jacques Plante, a 41yearold goalie, registered his first shut out as a Maple Leaf tonight, and Dave Keon scored three goals, two while the Leafs were shorthanded, as Toronto routed the Los Angeles Kings, 70, in a National Hockey League game.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per centage losses on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: At Lunch
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Al, Nick, Pete and Quentin went to an expen sively decorated restaurant for lunch. The food was just as expensive as the decor and almost as tasty.

title: FOREIGN NEWSMEN CURBED BY ATHENS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 2  Greece's militarybacked Government is sued a decree today making correspondents of the foreign press, radio or television, whether Greeks or foreigners, liable to heavy prison terms and fines in Greece for dis seminating false reports.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLOCKEstelle. Dearest Estelle, as my wife you have enriched my life with deer, love.

title: Momentum and Injuries Factors in N.F.L. Races
description: Pro football has never had a race like the current one, with 18 of the 26 teams still in contention for the play offs and just three games to go. Of course pro football has never before had a play off system with eight open places. Which eight will qual ify? Reflect on those with

title: Sports of The Times
description: Samuel Jim Thorpe Yippie, who had urged athletes to melt their trophies to make bullets for the revolution, wrapped himself in a Vietcong flag and ran out onto the field during halftime of last month's game between the University of California and Stanford at Berkeley. He ran right into the Stanford band, which may have been more distressed by his discourtesy in upstaging their halftime show than by the fivepoint program of the People's Ath letic Committee. Band members jumped and pummeled the Yippie Minister of Sport, who is better known as Samuel Goldberg, once a decathlon star of the University of Kansas.

title: New President Elected By Dreyfus Corporation
description: In a series of executive changes at investment firms an nounced yesterday, Jerome S. Hardy was elected president and chief operating officer of the Dreyfus Corporation.

title: Under the Hospital Masks Are 9 Ordinary Citizens
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 2 It is a simple thing to recognize heart transplant recipients here at the Stanford University Medical Center. They wear little blue surgical masks over their noses and mouths to pro tect them from picking up in fections as they stroll through the halls during their weekly checkups.

title: LISBON TO WIDEN AFRICA HOME RULE
description: LISBON, Dec. 2  Premier Marcello Caetano told Parlia ment today that the Govern ment planned to give more local autonomy to Portugal's African territories, particularly Angola and Mozambique.

title: Expert Now Gloomy In Report to Nixon On Vietcong Power
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Sir Robert Thompson, the British expert on guerrilla warfare, has told President Nixon that the United States and allied intelli gence and police efforts have failed to destroy the Com munist subversive apparatus in South Vietnam.

title: 2 BIG BANKS EASE CONSUMER LOANS
description: Two of the nation's largest banks announced reductions yesterday in their interest rates on consumer loans. Two other major banks (one of them in New York City) indicated that such reductions were being considered. All the banks linked their actions to the general easing in the national money market in recent months.

title: CONTEST MARKED BY SOLID CHECKS
description: For a change, Madison Square Garden fans were treated to hockey game last night by two teams that know what the game's aboutthe Rangers and the St. Louis Blues.

title: FISCHER IS VICTOR IN MAJORCA CHESS
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 2 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles retained the lead in the world title elimination and qualifica tion round robin when he de feated Jorge Rubinetti of Argen tina in the 17th round today.

title: DAVID P. BARRY
description: WILTON, Conn., Dec. 2 David P. Barry, former super visor of a modelsfabrication group at Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, N. J., died yester day. He was 79 years old and lived at 91 Lee Allen Lane.

title: J. P. MORGAN RAISES QUARTERLY DIVIDEND
description: J. P. Morgan & Co., Inc., parent company of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, in creased it quarterly dividend rate yesterday by 13.3 per cent, to 68 cents a share from 60 cents.

title: Japan Socialists Reelect Leftist Chief
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2The Japan Socialist party, largest opposi tion grouping in this country, concluded a threeday congress here tonight with the leader ship firmly in the hands of the left wing, which clings to con cepts such as proletarian dicta torship at home and an un armed neutrality leaning to ward Peking and Moscow abroad.

title: Protestant Leader Demonstrates Against Pope at Sydney Meeting
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  A militant Prot lestant leader was hustled out of the town hall here today after he staged a oneman pro test in front of Pope Paul VI.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Plans Campaign By Lawyers on Civil Rights
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 2 (AP)  The National Associa tion for the Advancement of Colored People announced today a nationwide campaign to involve sympathetic lawyers in a moppingup operation on civil rights.

title: The Assets and Liabilities of Banks Reporting Weekly to the Federal Reserve System
3 Years of Heart Transplants: 23 Live
description: It was just three years ago today that Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard and his surgical teammates took the heart from a fatally injured 24 yearold woman and sewed it into the chest of Louis Washkansky, a 55yearold grocer in Capetown. South Africa. The surgeons had re moved his heart because it had been ravaged beyond re pair by the effects of arterio sclerosis.

title: Seoul Reports a Defection
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thurs day, Dec. 3, (Reuters)  The South Korean Defense Ministry announced that a North Korean Air Force pilot, flying a Rus sianbuilt MIG fighter, today defected to South Korea.

title: London Refuses to Aid 2 Airbus Projects
description: LONDON, Dec. 2The Brit ish and European aircraft in dustries were dealt a severe blow today when the Govern ment refused to give financial support to either the European airbus project or its allBritish counterpart.

title: Advertising: Little Ferment Is Found Among the Major Distillers
description: Moved by the spirits of Christmas past, Christmas present and Christmas bot tled, a call was placed to some major distillers to see what was new. This is, after all, not only the season to be merry but also the season to promote the goods.

title: Hadassah Dance Sunday
description: The New York chapter of Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, will hold its annual dinner dance at the Waldorf Astoria on Sunday.

title: `Middletown Revisited: Still in Transition
description: MUNCIE, Ind.No ques tion about it, Muncie's much like it was in 1935, but there's much important that's different, remarked Fred Mil tonberger, sitting neatly shirt sleeved in his realestate of fice here.

title: Mediators Named in 3 City Labor Crises
description: Three mediators were designated yesterday to help resolve critical contract dis putes involving the city and its firefighters, policemen and sanitationmen.

title: GROUP HERE HOPEFUL ON ULSTER OUTLOOK
description: An American interfaith group said yesterday that the British Government was firmly com mitted to the elimination of discrimination in Northern Ireland and that an outbreak of civil war there did not seem to be an immediate danger.

title: Canadiens Tie Penguins
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 2 (AP) Pete Mahovlich scored on a re bound shot midway in the third period tonight to give the Mon treal Canadiens a 33 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins in a National Hockey League game.

title: U.S. Accuses Utility
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) The Justice Department to day accused the Virginia Elec tric and Power Company, the nation's 19th largest utility, and its union of discriminating against Negroes in hiring and promotion policies.

title: MARINE'S RAPE TRIAL OPENS ON OKINAWA
description: CAMP COURTNEY, Okinawa, Dec. 2 (UPI)The court martial, of a United States marine from Brooklyn charged in the rape of an Okinawan girl opened today, and the defense imme1 diately challenged a jury of Marine officers, charging that) they were all white and were subject to strong racial tem! sions on Okinawa.

title: CANADA ABANDONS INFLATION FIGHT
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 2A break down in support from businesss and labor has forced the Cana dian Government to abandon to voluntary antiinflation pro gram.

title: The Everest Attitude
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate debate on the provision of $290 mil lion for the further development of the SST is part of a process that is more important than the outcome of the vote. This is not because the issue itself is negligible but because it is vital to advanced societies to make political decisions on great techno logical questions.

title: East Bloc Leaders Set Joint Policies In Berlin Parley
description: BERLIN, Dec. 2The Com munist party and government leaders of seven Sovietbloc countries declared today after a day's consultations that their attitudes were un animous on the problems of Europe, Vietnam and the Middle East.

title: SURVEY SHOWS RISE IN DRUG USE IN WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2An army psychologist told a Senate investigating panel today that more than half the enlisted men in a survey of drug abuse in South Vietnam acknowledged having used marijuana at least once and that one in six was a habituated user.

title: Ban on Bad Eggs Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) The House Agriculture Com mittee unanimously approved today a bill designed to pro hibit the distribution of un wholesome eggs or their use in food products. The bill, to take effect six months after it be comes law, would establish a Federalstate cooperative in spection system for eggs that are moved in Interstate com merce.

title: Eric M. Goldsmith Dies; Investment Firm Officer
description: Eric M. Goldsmith, a vice president of Loeb, Rhoades & Co., an investment firm, and manager of its international de partment, died Tuesday of heart attack at his home, 333 Central Park West. He was 58 years old.

title: SPECIAL DELIVERY ON GARDEN COURT
description: When Jacksonville plays St. Peter's tonight in the second half of the college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden, John Con don's announcement of the Dolphins starting lineup will intone:

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS SHIFTS IN CABINET
description: Governor Rockefeller will an nounce a major reshuffling of his top aides within the next week, high administration sources reported yesterday.

title: ExMember of Manson Group Held in Torture Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2 Bruce Davis, one of Charles Manson's former family mem bers, surrendered to the police here today, and the question was raised whether Mr. Davis would testify to attempt to ab solve Manson in the TateLa Bianca murders.

title: Easing of Tax Rules on Depreciation Is Under Study as Spur to Economy
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2  In line with its new emphasis on finding ways to stimulate the economy and reduce unemploy ment, the Administration is again examining the possibility of liberalizing the tax deduc tions that businesses may take for depreciation.

title: Food Industry Criticized For Price Levels on Pork
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) An Administration farm offi cial, speaking after a White House inflation alert yester day, criticized the retail food industry today for keeping con sumer pork prices up despite record low hog prices.

title: Boardwalk Kennel Club Event To Accept All Entries in 1971
description: The Boardwalk Kennel Club show in Convention Hall at Atlantic City, held with lim ited entries three times and once with no limit, will re turn to its unlimited status next year, said Dr. Irving Bot winick of Margate, N. J., the committee chairman, last Sunday while the annual

title: A Farewell to Bucks
description: LONDONThey used to come over the brow of the hill every evening at 6:40 during the HuntleyBrinkley broadcast in a slowmoving tapestry: First a doe, sniffing the air for pos sible danger to the two fawns follow ing her, then a halfgrown stepbrother and finally the antlered sire, all nib bling intently as they made their way toward the salt block down the western slope of our farm. Once in a while, when the volume of our TV set crackled with the bark of guns in Vietnam or the snarl of jet, the deer would lift their heads and listen, but most of the time they were too busy feeding to notice.

title: Warren Receives'70 National Medal for Literature
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Robert Penn Warren received the National Medal for Liter ature here today, and issued a call for any kind of poetry that is realfor the disease of our time is the sense of being cut off from reality.

title: SONT AY IS DESCRIBED AS EMPTY SOME TIME
description: VALPARAISO, Fla., Dec. 2 (Reuters)The North Vietnam ese prison camp at Sontay, site of an unsuccessful United States prisonerofwar rescue raid last month, had been va cant for up to three months, an Air Force brigadier general said today.

title: Three Ship Lines in Norway Join To Form Luxury Cruise Venture
description: The formation of a $70mil lion Norwegian luxury cruise venture was announced here yesterday.

title: Gailmor Tribute Sunday
description: A memorial service for William S. Gailmor, a medical writer and former newspaper man, will he held at 4 P.M. Sunday at the Community Church, 40 East 35th Street. Mr. Gailmor, who lived in West port, Conn., died Nov. 14. Rabbi Sherwin Wine of Birmingham, Mich., a founder of Jewish Humanism, will preside.

title: World Bank Offers Plan to Reconstruct East Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  Officials of the World Bank estimated today that it would cost $185million to reconstruct the area of East Pakistan that was devastated by a cyclone and tidal wave on Nov. 12 and 13.

title: Nixon Freezes $100Million For New Works Projects
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)  President Nixon has tem porarily frozen more than $100 million for new dams, flood con trol and other water projects pending a decision on their fu ture funds.

title: Fiberglass Gaining in Tires
description: The use of fiberglass cord in passenger tires will more than double by 1975, according to projections by OwensCorning Fiberglass Corporation. The cor poration predicts that the cur rent 45  million  pound annual consumption rate will reach 115 million pounds in five years.

title: FORDHAM QUINTET ROUTS YALE, 7456
description: Dick Phelps made a success ful debut last night as the Fordham basketball coach as the Rams gained a 7456 victory over Yale before a Rose Hill crowd of 3,100.

title: 3 Oil Concerns Fined $500,000 In Violations at Offshore Wells
description: NEW ORLEANS. Dec. 2 (AP) Three major oil companies were fined more than $500,000 in Federal court today after pleading no contest to charges that they had not placed safety valves on some offshore oil wells in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Increased Enemy Barrages Are Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 2 (AP)  Taking advan tage of moonless nights, the North Vietnamese and Vietcong have reportedly stepped up rocket barrages against towns and military bases almost the entire length of South Vietnam.

title: Takayama Defeats Gonzales
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2 (AP)Masa taka Takayama, Japan's light weight champion, defeated Rudy Gonzalez, the Philippines lightweight titleholder, on unanimous decision in a non title 10round bout today. Each fighter weighed 137 pounds.

title: U.S. Bids Israel and Egypt Be Prudent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The United States called upon Israel and the United Arab Republic today to act prudently and with restraint to preserve the Middle East ceasefire, at a time when Washington considers conditions propitious for re sumption of ArabIsraeli nego tiations.

title: L.I. Painters Union Official Indicted as Grafter
description: The business manager of a Long Island local of the paint ers union and two alleged ac complices were accused yester day of conspiracy and taking kickbacks on insurance pre miums paid by the union's nension and welfare funds.

title: Screen: Violence Galore
description: Not really a serious at tempt to capture the electric chair buff audience, Jack Smight's The Traveling Ex ecutioner, which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, fails in spite of its little peculiarities rather than because of them.

title: Birmingham Doctor Is Released On Bond in Arms Cache Case
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 2 Dr. Gus. J. Prosch Jr., a 40 yearold Birmingham physician, was released on $10,000 bond today after Federal investiga tors had charged him with the possession of illegal weapons.

title: $300M1LLION CUT IN ARMS PLANNED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate Defense Appropriations Subcommittee, ignoring Nixon Administration requests to re store some of the military funds deleted by the House, has decided to cut $300mil lion more from the defense ap propriations bill.

title: BANK RATE IS CUT IN WEST GERMANY
description: BONN, Dec. 2West Ger many's central bank today stepped up its fight against high inflows of foreign capital by reducing its bank rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: Nixon Calls Second Parley On Nutrition for February
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)  President Nixon announced today plans for a February meeting to follow up the White House Conference on Food, Nutrition and Health held last December.

title: TV: C.B.S. Shows Ethiopia: The Hidden Empire
description: Is the National Geographic Society falling behind the times? In conjunction with the Metromedia Producers Corporation the respected publicspirited organization presented last night a pro gram entitled Ethiopia: The Hidden Empire on the Co lumbia Broadcasting System.

title: Mayor Gets a Plan To Involve People
description: A sketch for a new struc ture of neighborhood govern ment  one that rejects ad ditional power for the Bor ough Presidents and simpli fies the crazy quilt of district lines that cover the city map  was submitted yesterday to Mayor Lindsay.

title: CASE OFFERS BILL TO DISCLOSE PACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Sen ator Clifford P. Case today in troduced legislation, first spon sored by conservatives 16 years ago, that would require the executive branch to transmit all international agreements to Congress.

title: Suns Set Back Hawks
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 2 (AP) Connie Hawkins's season high of 32 points tonight led the Phoenix Suns to a 126112 Na tional Basketball Association victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: She Fought City Hall
description: They made me cry plen ty, Mrs. Lillian Manasseri said yesterday, as she cele brated her successful fight against City Hall to save her home and those of more than 50 neighbors in Corona, Queens, from being bulldozed for a high school and athletic field.

title: Weather Outlook: The Month of December
Dayton Power Issue Sold
description: The Dayton Power & Light Company raised $23.75million yesterday through the sale of one million new common shares of stock managed by a Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc.W. E. Hut ton & Co. underwriting syndi cate. The price was $23.75.

title: French Reserves Increase
description: PARIS, Dec. 2 (Reuters) France's gold and convertible currency reserves rose by 960, 000,000 francs in November ccmpared with 224,000,000 francs the previous month, the Finance Ministry said today. (The French franc is currently quoted at about 18.004 cents).

title: Washington University Picks New Chancellor
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 2  Dr. William H. Danforth, vice chancellor for medical af fairs at Washington Univer sity here, was named 13th chancellor of the university yesterday by the school's board of trustees.

title: 3 Seized in Jersey With Bogus Stamps Totaling $530,000
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 2 Federal agents early yesterday morning raided a Jersey City Holiday Inn motel near the Holland Tunnel and broke up what is believed to be the largest stamp counterfeiting ring in New Jersey's history:

title: Golf Planning Tribute to Ike As Benefit for 2 Institutions
description: Golfs Tribute to Ike, a fund raising project of the United States Golf Association and the Pro:essional Golfers'Association of America, was introduced yes terday with an oral teeingoff ceremony at the Sky Club in the Pan Am Building.

title: NEW YORKERS OFF IN SHOOTING FORM
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2On one of those nights that coaches have nightmares about, the Knicks went from bad to worse to miserable tonight and took a 10182 thrashing from the De troit Pistons before a jubilant crowd of 10,656 at Cobo Arena.

title: STATE CRIME UNIT WILL CALL JUDGES
description: Several judges, lawyers and organizedcrime figures are to be questioned at hearings this month before the State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Television
description: Hope Lange in first part of Peyton Place (1957), Ch. 2 at 9 P.M.

title: Agnew Terms Democrats Isolated From the People
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Vice President Agnew said tonight that leaders of the Democratic party had become far removed from the reality of the com mon mans individual prob lems.

title: Hickel's Order Protecting Whales Goes Into Effect
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) The Interior Departments ban on imports of products from eight whale species be came effective today.

title: Nixon to Sign Pueblo Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 The Senate voted overwhelm ingly today to give the Taos Pueblo Indians title to 48,000 acres of Carson National Forest in New Mexico, land they have long claimed as part of their cultural and re ligious heritage.

title: Riot in a Women's Prison In South Vietnam Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec 2 (AP)Two women inmates of a South Vietnamese prison charged today that riot police had beaten and teargassed more than 100 women prisoners and thrown lye or acid on the group. Both women are in a hospital in Saigon.

title: Susan Smith Plans Marriage To Eric Peterson 3d on Dec. 19
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 2Miss Susan Gerli Smith, a greatgranddaughter of Joseph E. Gerli, cofounder of E. Gerli & Co., silk import ers in New York, will be married to Eric Henry Peter son 3d on Dec. 19 in St. Paul's Chapel of Columbia University.

title: Lafayette Unit Plans a Dinner
description: The Order of Lafayette's annual dinner dance will be held Monday at the Plaza. The organization's Freedom Awards will be presented during the evening to James Stewart, the actor; Peter J. Brennan, president of the Building and Construction Trades Council; Henry Sal vatori of Los Angeles, a friend and supporter of Gov. Ronald Reagan of California; Senatorelect James L. Buck ley of New York, and Spyros P. Skouras, chairman of the board of Prudential Grace Lines, Inc.

title: Executive Changes
description: A. Bruce Matthews has been elected president of Bliss & Laughlin Industries, Inc. Fred J. Robbins, who has been president since 1960 will continue in the capacity of chairman and chief executive offi cer. Mr. Matthews previously served as executive vice president.

title: Weekend Recipes
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Jones &
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Jones & Laughlin Steel Cor poration was fined $1,000 today by a Federal judge after the company pleaded guilty to vio lating a 71yearold law against water pollution. The company told United States District Judge Edward Dumbauld the dis charge of oil, grease and metal lic particles into the Ohio River May 20 was accidental and would not be repeated.

title: The Mercenaries Strike Again
description: President Skou Tour. appealing for help to the African chiefs of state and the United Nations, described the amphibious force against his capital city as consisting of hundreds of Portuguese mercenaries and merce naries of many nations. Americans who are accustomed to weighing mili tary threats on a more massive scale may gravely misjudge the emotive forces of fear and anger among Afri can leaders triggered by mercenaries on African soil.

title: Unions Protest as Tories Press a Bill to Regulate Labor Relations
description: LONDON, Dec. 3Protests from union leaders and Labor party politicians greeted the publication today of the Gov ernment's controversial bill to regulate industrial labor rela tions.

title: White House Says an Aide Of Rights Panel Is Leaving
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The White House said today that Martin G. Castillo, deputy staff director for the Commis sion on Civil Rights, was leav ing his nost.

title: Tannen Leads a Special Squad Of One Blocking Kicks for Jets
description: If the New York Jets game with the Oakland Raiders boils down to a lastminute field goal attempt by George Blanda, don't watch the 43yearold geriatric marvel. Instead, watch Steve Tannen, the Jets rookie I cornerback who has emerged as their kickblocking specialist.

title: Six Indicted in Westchester in Mortgage Loan Fraud
description: WHITE PLAE1S, Dec. 3  Six persons, including Tom Dunn, the television newscast er, and Arnold Mann, a New York City real estate broker, were indicted here today for their alleged participation in fraudulent mortgage  loan transactions.

title: A VOTE CENSURES AIDE AT LINCOLN
description: The chief of the psychiatric staff at Lincoln Hospital was censured yesterday by more than two dozen members of the staff of the South Bronx hos pital. ComMunity groups said the move was the beginning of an effort to replace yet another chief of a major service at the strifetorn hospital.

title: GILMORE EXCELS FOR FLORIDA FIVE
description: The University of Jackson ville basketball team has scored 284 points in its first two games, but it's difficult to de termine just how good the Dol phins really are.

title: TWO OLD FRIENDS LOOK FOR TROUBLE
description: It is inevitable that at some point during Sunday's game at Yankee Stadium, a couple of exschoolmates, Fred Dryer and Dennis Shaw, will meet in the Buffalo backfield. When they do, the conversation undoubt edly will be different from what it was the last time they met.

title: Government Suit Seeks to Allow A Mixed Marriage in Alabama
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Justice Department asked Federal Court today to strike down provisions of Alabama's Constitution and laws that make it a crime for whites and Negroes to marry. It was the first such action taken by the Government.which make it a crime to issue such a license.

title: Dartmouth Picks CoCaptain
description: HANOVER, N. H., Dec. 3 (AP)Stu Simms, a junior full back from Baltimore, and Wayne Young, a junior middle linebacker from Tarrytown, N. Y., have been elected cocap tains of the 1971 Dartmouth football team.

title: NAVY OIL DISCHARGE OFF FLORIDA SCORED
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 3 A 25milelong oil slick moved slowly along the North Florida coast today and there were conflicting estimates of its pollution threat to the coast line.

title: Advertising: An American Sees Commercials in the Soviet Union
description: Ken Drake, vice president for sales of RoseMagwood Productions (which makes commercials mostly), is just back from two weeks in the Soviet Union during which he spent two hours with a couple of Moscow agency men. This gives him more right than most to speak with authority on the Russian advertising scene.

title: East Pakistan Failed to Use StormWarning System
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 1 Reliable reports indicate that East Pakistan's stormwarning system, a limited one at best, was not put in motion properly when the devastating cyclone struck on Nov. 12.

title: Penney Suit on TV Imports Is Dismissed by U.S. Judge
description: A Federal district court judge here dismissed yesterday for lack of jurisdiction a suit brought by the J. C. Penney Company that sought to enjoin the Treasury Department from continuing to carry on anti dumping proceedings against imports of Japanese television sets.

title: Dance:DuoTchaikovsky
description: There are two Tchaikov skys. One represents the Rus sian landscapethe fir trees, the snow, the distances, and. yes, the romance, that almost every Russian writer has per ceived in looking at the depths and breadths of his homeland. The other Tchai kovsky is the urban Tchai kovsky, the Czar's Tchaikov sky  even though the Czar was never that impressed who looked at St. Peters burg society, saw the chan deliers, the uniforms, the color, the glitter and the pa rade, and quite obviously was not unmoved.

title: U.C.L.A., ST. LOUIS GAIN SOCCER FINAL
description: EDWARDSVILLE, Ill., Dec. (UPI)  Solomon Terfa scored a tiebreaking goal today to give University of California, Los Angeles. a 43 victory over Howard University and put the Bruins into the National Col legiate soccer final.

title: BRUCE URGES CHECK ON VIETNAM PRISONS
description: PARIS, Dec. 3The United States proposed today that all prisoner facilities in North and South Vietnam be opened to inspection and recommenda tions by an impartial interna tional organization such as the Red Cross.

title: Alma Phipps, Reginald Farr Are Wed Here
description: Miss Alma Mary Phipps and Reginald Farr were mar ried here Wednesday after noon in the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Kenneth 0. Jones.

title: War Veterans at Inquiry Feel Atrocities Are Result of Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3A spokesman for the 40 antiwar veterans who have testified at an unofficial inquiry into Unit ed States war policies said to day that they had tried to show that war crimes by American forces in South Vietnam were not aberrant isolated acts.

title: Chicago Police Slay Gunman
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3 (AP)A gunman who shot and killed a pursuing police dog was slain by the police today as he fled from a robbery at a South Side drivein restaurant. The police said that the dead man carried papers indicating he was Hor ace Ruth, 23 years old.

title: NIXON GIVES NATO PLEDGE ON TROOPS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 3President Nixon told the North Atlantic Alliance today that the United States would not reduce its forces in Europe unless there is reciprocal action from our adversaries.

title: Discharge of 8 Protested By Maintenance Workers
description: About 150 building manite nance workers employed in city urbanrenewal areas demon strated downtown yesterday to protest the discharge of eight employes on Monday.

title: STOCKS ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market was slightly firm in quiet trad ing yesterday mainly because of Wall Street's renewed strength.

title: A Correction
description: Because of an editing error, an article in early editions of The New York Times yester day erroneously described Op eration Phoenix in South Viet nam as a code name for a se cret Central Intelligence Agen cy operation that led to the alleged massacre at Mylai, March 16, 1968. The dispatch dealt with criticism of Opera tion Phoenix's effectiveness re portedly made by Sir Robert Thompson. The erroneous de scription did not appear in late editions.

title: Murrow Fellowship Set Up By Foreign Relations Council
description: The Council on Foreign Re lations has announced that it is offering a resident fellowship to an American foreign corre spondent for the academic year that begins on Sept. 1, 1971, and ends on June 1, 1972.

title: Excerpts From Report on Life and Death of a Citizen, Raymond Lavon
description: Raymond Lavon died in solitary confinement in the Manhattan House of Deten tion for Men (M.H.D.), other wise known as The Tombs, in the late evening of Nov. 3, 1970. He had been an inmate of that institution since Jan. 10. 1970.

title: DR. SIMON SEGAL, 61; HEADED JEWISH UNIT
description: Dr. Simon Segal, director of the American Jewish Commit tee's foreign affairs department for 25 years, died here Wednes day at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 61 years old and lived at 1327 Lexington Avenue.

title: ExG. I. Taken Into Custody After Refusing to Testify at Calley Trial
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 3  Paul D. Meadlo, who once told a national television au dience that he had shot un armed Vietnamese civilians at Mylai because it just seemed like it was the natural thing to do at the time, was temp orarily taken into custody by the military police today after he refused to testify at the courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. CalIev Jr.

title: Carnegie Study Author
description: When Earl Cheit resigned as executive vice chancellor of the University of Califor nia at Berkeley last year to take his sabbatical leave, he had three goals in mind: more reading and writing, getting reacquainted with his family, and picking up his handball game. He never did

title: JEWISH STUDENTS FOUND CONCERNED
description: By IRVING SPIEGELHOUSTON, Dec. 3Jewish college freshmen are more com mitted to resolving social prob lems and more concerned with limitations on their personal autonomy than are their fellow nonJewish students, a compre hensive study released here to day indicated.

title: LLEWELLYN GROUP PLAYS GRACEFULLY
description: Four women who for the most part teach and perform in northern New Jersey make up the Llewellyn Chamber Players, which made its debut on Wednesday night at the New York Cultural Center. They are Nancy Clarke, violin; Lori Berkowitz, viola; Mary Wortreich, cello, and Dorothy Priesing, piano.

title: Order for Extradition of Angela Davis Upheld Here
description: An order to extradite Angela Davis to California was upheld yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice Thomas Dickens. However, John J. Abt, Miss Davis's lawyer, was granted five days to appeal Justice Dickens's decision sustaining Governor Rockefeller's signing of the extradition papers.

title: Wazeter Rites Tomorrow
description: A requiem mass for Francis J. Wazeter, the founder of the Pulaski Day Parade, will be cel ebrated in St. Casimir's Roman Catholic Church, Nepperhan Avenue. Yonkers, at 10:30 A.M. tomorrow. Burial will be in the cemetery for American heroes at the American Shrine Church of Our Lady of Czestochowa in Doylestown, Pa.

title: Welfare Employes Vote Job Action
description: The city's 10,000 welfare workers were instructed by their union representatives last night to reduce their case loads on Monday in a job action against the Department of So cial Services to protest the rincincr of five welfare centers.

title: Iowa Player Improved
description: IOWA CITY, Dec. 3 (UPI) The condition of James Speed, a University of Iowa basketball player who has been hospital ized since Monday with bac terial meningitis, was reported as improved greatly today by, the Iowa team physician, W. D. Paul. Speed underwent surgery Tuesday.

title: Backstrom Ends Retirement
description: MONTREAL. Dec. 3 (AP) Ralph Backstrom, a center, has returned to the Montreal Cana diens after a brief retirement. Sam Pollock, the general man ager of the club, said today that the 33yearold native of Kirk land Lake, Ontario, had decided to return to the club he quit Oct. 10.

title: CRIMINAL INQUIRY ON TOMBS IS ASKED
description: A report by the Board of Correction to Mayor Lindsay asserted yesterday that a pris oner found dead in a cell at the Tombs had hanged himself but urged a criminal investigation of the events surrounding his solitary confinement.

title: New Corporate Bonds Plunge Below 8% Yield
description: interest rates plummeted below 8 per cent on new high quality corporate bonds yesterday. In dramatically powerful bidding for a $100million Aarated bond offering of the Southern California Edison Company, underwriters shoved the yield level down to 7.85 per cent. By late after noon the yield seemed fairly well established, with an esti mated 60 per cent of the bonds taken by investors.

title: PACT TALKS HELD BY MET AND BING
description: Discussions have taken place between Rudolf Bing and the heads of the Metropolitan Opera Association about the possibility of his staying on as general manager beyond his present contract, which expires in June. 1972.

title: PRICES OF GRAINS RALLY NEAR CLOSE
description: Under apparent speculative liquidation, soybean, corn and wheat futures prices dropped in early trading but all rallied later and closed mostly higher on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: HOFFMAN RECALLS 2 JURY MESSAGES
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3Federal Judge Julius J. Hoffman said today that he remembered that the jury in the Chicago con spiracy trial had reported it self deadlocked the day it be gan deliberations.

title: Professor Gets Year in Jail
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 3 (AP)James Whitney of Cam bridge, a professor at the Bos ton branch of the University of Massachusetts, was sentenced today to a year in jail for as sault on a policeman and to an additional six months for dis orderly conduct. He was ar rested at the Cambridge Dis trict Court in October in courtroom disturbance.

title: Dansant to Be Held By Russian Nobility
description: The annual dansant of the Russian Nobility Association in America will be held on Sunday at Delmonico's Hotel.

title: ANOTHER ADVANCE SCORED BY AMEX
description: The American Stock Ex change scored another advance yesterday although late selling trimmed some of the earlier gains.

title: The Question Before the President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3There is a break in the rhythm of the Govern ment now. The President is working quietly behind the headlines on the budget, which will carry him through 1971 and almost up to the nominating conventions of 1972. It is too early to say that he is changing the policies of his first two years in office, but he is clearly reviewing and modifying them, and looking to the future.

title: Universities in Danger
description: The alarm over the fiscal crisis of the universities, sounded by the Carnegie Commission on Higher Educa tion, will shock even expert observers of the nation's campuses.

title: POSTAL BOND SALE SET FOR NEXT FALL
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 3 The Post Office, reorganized in August, plans to sell $250mi1 lion of bonds in the fall of 1971  the first of $10billion of postal revenue bonds autho rized by the Government.

title: Bumpy Road Proves Fatal
description: LEWISTOWN, Pa., Dec. 3 (UPI)A .30caliber rifle on the back seat of an automobile dis charged on a bumpy road and killed the woman driver, Mrs. Margie Elizabeth Wright, 44 years old, of nearby McClure R.D. 2, the state police reported today.

title: Weissenberg Performs Prodigies in Piano Recital
description: Some of the interesting things about Alexis Weissen berg's piano recital, in Phil harmonic Hall on Wednesday evening, were things he did not do. Ever since the late nineteenforties, when lie won the Leventritt Competition and started to concertize, there has never been any doubt about this man's abil ity to play the piano. But often his ideas about inter pretation could leave one stunned. There was so much pullingabout, so much dis tortion of phrase, that one felt like screaming. So much talent, such a waste!

title: Seaborg to Head U.N. Talks On Uses of Nuclear Energy
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3  Secretary General Thant today announced the ap pointment of Glenn T. Seaborg of the United States as presi dent of an international con ference on peaceful aspects of nuclear energy. It will be held in Geneva next September.

title: Oklahoma Acquires A Theater
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 3 The Mummers Theater, a new $3  million theater grouping, situated on a city block of downtown property purchased from an urban renewal project, opened here this week with A Man for All Seasons, the Robert Bolt play, starring Edward Mul hare.

title: Play's Opening Deferred
description: Vinnette Carroll has set back the opening of her Urban Arts Corps production of Moon on a Rainbow Shawl, the Errol John play, from next Thursday to Dec. 17. Loretta Greene has replaced Micki Grant in one of the leading roles, necessitating additional rehearsals. The cast includes James Hainesworth, Maryce Carter and Marvin Camillo.

title: An 8MileLong Oil Slick Forms at Burning Rig Site
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (UPI) A thin sheen of oil, eight miles long and spotted with narrow patches of heavy brown crude oil and sludge, formed in the Gulf of Mexico tonight at the Shell Oil Company's Baker platform, which exploded Tues day.

title: U.S. WAR DEATHS HALVED IN WEEK
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 3 (Reuters)  American battle deaths declined by half last week to 32, the United States command said today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: That wondrous weaver of magic spells, George Blanda, will bring his art of necromancy into Shea Stadium on Sunday Wearing the black cloak of the Oakland Raiders, this Merlin in Moleskins will be ready to bewitch the New York Jets. One nagging question has begun to trouble the Raiders, though. Is Blanda losing his miraculous touch?

title: Bill Honors McCormack
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The House Public Works Committee has approved a measure that would give the post office in Post Office Square Boston, the name of John W. McCormack Post Of fice and Courthouse. The bill honors House Speaker McCor mack of Massachusetts, who is retiring from Congress after this session. He has repre sented his state's Ninth Dis trict since November, 1928.

title: Chaparrals Get Floridian
description: DALLAS, Dec. 3. (AP)The Texas Chaparrals said today they had acquired on waivers, Charlie Beasley, a former Chap arral, from the Floridians. Beasley, a 6foot5inch guard, traded to the Floridians earlier in the season for Greg Whitt man and two draft choices.

title: Stokes Records Album With Poetry by Hughes
description: Carl B. Stokes, Mayor of Cleveland, has recorded an album on which he reads poetry by Langston Hughes and spirituals against a back ground of music arranged and composed by Oliver Nelson.

title: Jesse Ford Bound Over To Grand Jury in Slaying
description: HUMBOLDT, Tenn., Dec. 3 (AP)  Jesse Hill Ford, the novelist, was bound over to the Gibson County grand jury to day on a homicide charge in the fatal shooting Nov. 16 of a young soldier on Mr. Ford's estate here.

title: MARY BARD JENSEN, AUTHOR, DIES AT 66
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 3 (AP)  Mrs. Mary Bard Jensen, author of several books, died Sunday after a stroke. She was 66 years old.

title: Independent Consumer Agency Backers All but Abandon Hope for This Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  Advocates of an independent consumer protection agency all but abandoned hope today of passing authorizing legislation this year.

title: Thompson Mission To Asia Confirmed By the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The White House confirmed to day that Sir Robert Thompson, the British expert on guerrilla warfare, had made a recent trip to South Vietnam for Pres ident Nixon and had submitted his findings to him in a secret report.

title: DEMOCRATS SEEKING WAGEPRICE FREEZE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Democratic leadership of Con gress called upon President Nixon today to impose a tem porary freeze on wages and prices while the Administration worked out a longterm plan for curbing inflation.

title: Purcell Transmuted To Rock in Recital By Sylvia Marlowe
description: That rocking harpsichordist, Sylvia Marlowe, gave a con cert at Carnegie Recital Hall Wednesday night.

title: Building in Cross Case Is Temporarily Cuban
description: The building in Montreal where the transfer of James R. Cross was concluded yes terday was declared Cuban territory temporarily as the result of an agreement be tween the two governments concerned, a Canadian Gov erment spokesman said yes terday.

title: Rock Salt Slides Into River
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3 (UPI)The Army Engineers began emerg ency dredging operations today to remove 20,000 tons of rock salt that slid yesterday into the Detroit River. The salt had been piled on the west bank of the river at the Detroit Bulk Termi nal in downriver River Rouge. It could endanger water life and water foul in the polluted river. In some places, the salt piled up 10 feet thick on the river bed.

title: Telephone Bettors In Offtrack Playing To Get Code Names
description: Beginning tomorrow, any one with a minimum deposit of $25 and a code name will be able to apply for a tele phone betting account to be used when the New York City Off Track Betting Corporation begins taking bets on Jan. 11.

title: Capital Outlays Expected to Rise in 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  Business expenditures on plant and equipment, after leveling from mid1970 through the first quarter of 1971, are planned to show a small upward move ment in the second quarter of next year, the Commerce De partment and the Securities and Exchange Commission an nounced today.

title: Blues Buy Canucks'Arbour
description: S. LOUIS, Dec. 3 (UPI)  The St. Louis Blues purchased a defenseman, John Arbour, from the Vancouver Canucks today. Arbour was with Van couver's team in the Western Hockey League last season and remained with the new Van couver franchise in the National Hockey League. He is no rela tion to the Blues coach, Al Arbour.

title: CUBAN'S EYE CUT SIGNALS THE END
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 3 (AP)  Billy Backus, who quit boxing in 1965 because he couldn't win, scored a stunning upset tonight by stopping Jose Na poles on cuts in the fourth round to win the world welter weight championship.

title: Night Ferry Runs To S.I. to Be Cut In Economy Move
description: Night service on the Staten Island ferry will be reduced starting Sunday as part of the city's economy measures, the Transportation Administration announced yesterday.

title: C.C.N.Y. Triumphs, 7972
description: City College squelched a late rally by Queens College last night and defeated the Knights, 7972, despite a game high of 27 points by John Molinari of Queens.

title: Weekly Comodities Index Declines .04 to 106.1
description: The wholesale commodity Trice Index fell to 106.1 Tues day from 106.5 last week.The index, compiled by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, stood at 112.1 on Dec. 2, 1969.The following table give the index and its components using 195759 as a base:

title: FRANCHISE SALES ORDERED VOIDED
description: State Supreme Court Justice David Ross ordered an Orlando, Fla., cosmetics concern yester day to offer a total of $3.8 HWElon in reimbursements to 1,604 New York State residents who had bought sales fran chises from it.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Dec. 3, 1970

title: Mecom Takes Step On Reorganization
description: John W. Mecom Sr., the multimillionaire Texas oilman, in a surprise development, dis closed last night that he and his wife, Mary Elizabeth, had asked the Federal Court in Shreveport, La., for permission to file for what he termed a personal reorganization.

title: MOVING OF HOUSES STUDIED IN QUEENS
description: City engineers have been in structed by the Mayor's office to consider such details as lawn Madonnas, grape arbors and fig trees as they evaluate the delicate job of moving 28 condemned houses in Corona, Queens, from the bulldozer's path to new foundations nearby.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week rose to an estimated $921million, 2 per cent above the $904million sales for the corresponding week last year. Total retail store sales last week were an estimated $7.196billion, virtu ally unchanged from the $7.220billion sales for the similar period last year.

title: Release and Reckoning
description: The world will rejoice with the family of James R. Cross at his release, evidently in good health and spirits, after being held 59 days by Quebec Liberation Front terrorists. Mr. Cross, a British trade official, was one those innocent victims of circumstance, used as a ploy by desperate men bent on subverting governments under the bogus banner of liberation.

title: East Pakistanis Parade As Election Fever Rises
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 3 Tens of thousands of followers of East Pakistan's most popu lar political leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, staged a bois terous but peaceful procession here today as election fever mounted in anticipation of bal loting Monday.

title: Nixon Sets Retail Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI)  President Nixon signed a proclamation today designating Jan. 10 as the start of National Retailing Week.

title: College Financial Crisis Found in Carnegie Study
description: A new depression has struck American colleges and universities and their deepen ing financial plight can be over come only by a massive na tional effort, according to a study released yesterday by the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education.

title: Visit by Howard Hughes To Bahamas Confirmed
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 3 When Howard Hughes left here on Thanksgiving eve. he went to Paradise Island, the resort about 100 yards off Nassau in the Bahamas.

title: MRS. A. R. HOLCOMBE
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Dec. 3 Mrs. Armistead Richardson Holcombe, whose late husband was managing editor of The New York Herald Tribune in the late 1920's, died today. She was born in Baltimore and came, to New York with her husband when he joined The Herald Tribune.

title: OFFICIAL ASSAILS OUSTED PRINCIPAL
description: A Manhattan district super intendent said yesterday that the ousted principal of Joan of Arc Junior High School was creating a potentially riotous situation by continuing to go to the school in defiance of his orders.

title: Menuhin Warned on Citizenship
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  Yehudi Menuhin, the violinist, who was born in New Yolk City, has been officially advised by the State Department that under a preliminary decision reached here he lost his United States citizenship after accept ing a Swiss honorary citizen shin.

title: Moslems, Hindus and Buddhists join Pope at Mass in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 3  Pope Paul VI arrived in the capital of overwhelmingly Mos lem Indonesia today and cele brated mass tonight in an ecu menical spirit that took full ad vantage of the national, linguis tic and religious variety of this island nation.

title: AWN, A ROOKIE, IS ONE OF GROUP
description: CORAL SPRINGS, Fla.. Dec. 3 (AP)Brian Allin, a former artillery officer in Vietnam, shot a fourunderpar 67 today and gained a tie with six others for the lead in the first round of the $125,000 Coral Springs open golf tournament Thursday.

title: Air Force Captain, Unwed, Has Baby
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 3 (AP)An unmarried woman officer, who went to court to oppose Air Force attempts to discharge her because of her pregnancy, gave birth to day to a 6nound daughter.

title: Richey Heads Final Standing In Grand Prix of Tennis
description: Cliff Richey and Arthur Ashe of the United States placed first and second but Austra lians dominated the final stand ing in the Pepsi Grand Prix of Tennis.

title: Soviet Envoy to Cuba
description: MOSCOW (UPI)The Soviet Union announced today the ap pointment of a new ambassador to Cuba, replacing Aleksandr A. Soldatov. The new envoy is Ni kita P. Tolubeyev, 48 years old, who served as ambassador to Cyprus before the new appoint ment.

title: HAUGHTON PROVES VERSATILE DRIVER
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec.Billy Haughton, the star reinsman who left here last Saturday with the intention of doing no more driving this season, has changed his mind. From Pom pano Park, Fla., where he has been breaking the colts and fillies among the 126 standard breds Haughton has quartered there, he sent word today that he would return tomorrow and devote most of the weekend to driving  in two sports.

title: Miss Alper Bride of Richard Otto
description: Miss Harriet Sigrid Somers Alper was married yesterday afternoon to Richard A. Otto, son of Mrs. and Mrs. Samuel K. Otto of New York. Rabbi Robert S. Widom performed the ceremony at the home here of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Sigfried Somers Amer.n

title: Texas Copter Crashes Kill 3
description: MINERAL WELLS, Tex., Dec. 3 (AP)Three helicopter pilots from Fort Wolters here were killed yesterday in two sepa rate accidents. One of the pilots was Warrant Officer Kennedy Craig Pettengill, 23 years old, Rutherford, N. J. The two others were South Viet namese. Their names were not released by the military here.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On Supersonic Airliner
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) Following is the 5241 roll call vote by which the Senate adopted a Transportation De partment appropriation bill amendment today to delete $290million for further devel opment of a supersonic trans port plane.

title: Tours of White House By Candlelight Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The White House will have candlelit nighttime tours again for the Christmas sea son and will decorate its tree with goldleaf paper fans in the manner of the Monroe era, Mrs. Richard M. Nixon announced today.

title: Britain Studies Low Wages
description: LONDON (UPI)The employ ment ministry said that nearly 300,000 British men earned less than e15 ($36) a week any 600,000 women made lesS thar E10 ($24) a week in their jobs

title: Princeton Six Bows, 64
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 3 Brian Hind scored three goals to lead St. Lawrence to a 64 hockey victory over Princeton tonight.

title: BUSINESS COUNCIL ELECTS CHAIRMAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) William M. Batten, chairman of J. C. Penney Company, was elected chairman of the Busi ness Council today, succeeding Fred J. Borch, chairman of Gen eral Electric Company.

title: RUTH LAW OLIVER, 79, PIONEER FLIER, DIES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 3 (AP)Ruth Law Oliver, a pio neer woman aviator, died here Tuesday. She was 79 years old.

title: House Panel Votes National Institute on Alcohol Abuse
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. s  Congressional concern over al coholism among civilians and in the armed services was re flected in the House and Sen ate today.

title: Colts Claim Dolphin Center
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 3 (AP) The Baltimore Colts announced today they have claimed a cen ter, Tom Goode, a nineyear pro from Mississippi State, from the Dolphins.

title: CHILEAN UNIVERSITY TENSE AFTER CLASH
description: CONCEPCION, Chile, Dec. 3 (AP)Classes were suspended and tension was high at the University of Concepcin today after one student died and an other was wounded .in a clash between young Communists and ultraleftists.

title: ALFRED P. SHAW, 75, CHICAGO ARCHITECT
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3Alfred P. Shaw, a leading Chicago archi tect and a former director of the American Institute of Architects, died Tuesday. He was 75 years old, and headed the firm of Alfred Shaw and Associates. Inc.

title: Volume Shows Gain
description: The British Petroleum Com pany, Ltd., showed earnings declines of 2 per cent in the third quarter and 22.6 per cent for the first nine months this year although sales increased 21.9 per cent and 15.6 per cent, respectively, according to the company's report issued yester day.

title: Gomulka Urges Accord
description: WARSAW, Dec. 3Wlady slaw Gomulka, the Polish lead er, indicated today that the Warsaw Pact meeting had en dorsed the present trend to ward better relations with West Germany.

title: Student Unrest in Germany
description: From The Abuse of Learning by Frederic Lilge, a history of the German universities up until the time of Hitler. Written just after World War II, it is now out of print.

title: BOTH SIDES SUM UP IN MAYNARD TRIAL
description: A prosecutor characterized William A. Maynard yesterday as a bold, shrewd, coldblooded murderer who deliberately shot a Marine sergeant in 1967 dur ing a streetcorner dispute in Greenwich Village.

title: Miss Susan Beckwith Blaine Is Betrothectto John B. Nesbitt
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 3  Miss Susan Beckwith Blaine and John Bale Nesbitt plan to be married. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Charles G. Blaine, parents of the bridetobe, whose fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl G. Nesbitt.

title: Dining Out: Two Oriental Restaurants
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Ashford Retires
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 3 Emmett Ashford, the first black umpire in the major leagues, retired today at the age of 56, but denied any pressure had been put on him.

title: New Tippett Opera Staged in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 3  There were cheers at the Royal Opera House, Covent Gar den, last night for the world premiere of Sir Michael Tip pett's The Knot Garden.

title: Cosmos 383 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3 (UPI)The Soviet Union launched today the second Cosmos satellite in two days. The official press agency Tass said that the latest unmanned satellite, Cosmos 383, went into a nearly circular orbit that carried it a maximum of 182 miles and a minimum of 129 miles from the surface of the earth.

title: Executive to Leave The Times To Join Massachusetts U. Staff
description: Thomas B. Campion, who has been director of operations for The New York Times since 1967, will become vice chancel lor for administrative services at the University of Massachu setts In Amherst on Dec. 22.

title: FreeChoice Detroit Schools Ordered
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3  A Fed eral Judge, saying that inte gration for integration's sake alone is selfdefeating, ordered today a new type of desegre gated, decentralized school sys tem for the city of Detroit. The order was immediately appealed by the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People. The order called for the establishment of magnet high schools around the city, specializing in voca tional, science, arts or business programs, with students choos ing the school and the program they want.

title: CREDIT EXPANDING AT MODERATE PACE
description: Money and bank credit ex panded at a moderate pace during the last few weeks, banking data published yester day showed. But the demand for business loans at the major New York City banks, which normally surges at this time of year, was notably weak, as it has been for some time.

title: Lord &
description: Lord & Taylor, one of New York's leading retailers, an nounced yesterday that it would .open next spring in. Burlington, Mass., the first of a new group of small stores to supplement its larger stores in the same areas. The new unit, to be known as Capsule by Lord & Taylor, will hold ,17,400 square feet, as compared with the chain's 130,000square foot store in Boston.

title: British Company Is Due
description: The Royal Shakespeare Com pany in Peter Brook's produc tion of A Midsummer Night's Dream has been booked to open at the Billy Rose Theater on Jan. 20. The New York en gagement, under the sponsor ship of David Merrick, is for limited run.

title: MARKET ROLLS ON TO NEW ADVANCES
description: The stock market's eye popping rally kept rolling for ward yesterday to the amazed delight of Wall Street observers who used such words as phe nomenal and astonishing to describe the latest turn of events.

title: Girl Accepting an Award Asks Nixon to End the War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3A 19yearold Wisconsin girl seemed to startle President Nixon today when she told him to get us out of the war as he was giving her an award for public service. As the President was handing her one of four Young Ameri can Medals distributed at a ceremony in the White House Blue Room this morning, Debra Jean Sweet delivered her plea in a voice barely audible to nearby newsmen. The reporters heard only the phrases Mr. President, find it very hard to believe and until you get us out of the war. Later, Miss Sweet reported that she had said to the President: I find it hard to believe in your sincerity in giving the awards until you get us out of Vietnam. Mr. Nixon, who seemed a bit taken aback, replied in voice that could easily be heard: We're doing the best we can.

title: TRIAL OF BASQUES STARTS IN BURGOS
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 3The ornate, heavily guarded trial room of the Sixth Military Dis trict here was the quiet center of a political storm today as Spain began the courtmartial of 15 Basques.

title: BRAZIL AIDE SAYS TORTURE IS USED
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 3 (AP)A Cabinet minister has acknowledged the use of tor ture in Brazilian jails. It was the first such admission by a member of the Government.

title: S.E.C. SUING I.D.S. ON LUM'S SHARES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that the nation's largest mutual fund complex, Investors Di versified Services, Inc., had il legally dumped its holdings of stock in Lum's, Inc., after re ceiving inside information that the food chain's profits were declining.

title: Undercover Agent in Panthers Feared the Police
description: Detective Gene Roberts tes tified under crossexamination yesterday that he was afraid of the police while he was pre tending to be a Black Panther, because they didn't know who I was.

title: Burglars Return for More
description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP)The police investigated a burglary at an apartment here one night. Three hours later, they were back, investigating a second breakin.

description: Maria Callas will teach a twoweek master class in operatic interpretation at the Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia next February, according to an announce ment made yesterday by Rudolf Serkin, director of the institute.

Proposed increases for business customers range from $1.20 to $5.20 a month per line. The company asked to have the new rates effective on Feb. 3.

description: The commission investigating allegations of police corruption here reported yesterday that large numbers of East Side busi nesses systematically bribed the police and that there was reason to believe that some supervising sergeants were either taking payoffs them selves or covering them uo.

description: ALBANY, Dec. 3 (AP)Neil W. Kelleher, a Republican As semblyman from Troy, de nounced the AliBonavena match today as a disgrace to the people of New York State.

The hope is that this will keep down theft in a store that could be a paradise for the acquisitiveall those small items, such as diamonds, with big, big prices.

title: T.R.A. Names 2 Champions
description: The Thoroughbred Racing Associations completed its ros ter of champions for 1970 yes terday, naming Forward Gal the leading 2yearold filly and Hoist the Flag the top juvenile colt.

We're still selling tickets for two of our lower lifts but so far the elements haven't cooperated with us much. A climbing temperature caused gloom at many ski centers yesterday as resort opera tors in the Cats kills, the Berk shires and the Green and White Mountains saw precious and expensive manmade snow melt and flow back to the reservoirs whence it had come.

Federal, state and local funds needed for schools, housing, health, public safety and other under financed community responsibilities are being poured into a program that degrades the people it is designed to help.

The Giants and Jets both play at home on Sun day, with the Giants favored over Buffalo and Oakland over the Jets. The televised games will be Chicago at Min nesota tomor row, Channel 2 at 1:15 P.M., and on Sunday, Bos ton at Miami, Channel 4, 1 P.M., and Washington at Dallas, Channel 2, 4 P.M. Here is a preview of all the games, with wonlosttied records in parentheses:

description: chairman for the President He referred to his overruling of a veto of an O.E.O. program by Gov. Louie B, Nunn of Ken tucky.

Hammerl, superintendent of Catholic Schools for the Diocese of Buffalo. Now we have a big, tangible example, as opposed to little closings here and there.

description: Mayor Lindsay cited the city' fiscal problems yesterday as major obstacles to decentral izing government and shifting some power from City Hall to local neighborhoods.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Senate Appropriations Com mittee today voted in favor of barring the President from using defense funds to intro duce American ground combat troops into Cambodia.

title: Pope's Attacker Pleads
description: MANILA, Friday, Dec. 4 (AP) Benjamin Mendoza y Amor Flores pleaded not guilty to day to a charge of attempting to murder Pope Paul VI and said: I did it in favor of the people. The hearing was post poned until Dec. 14. The 35 yearold Bolivian painted is charged with trying to stab the Pope when he arived at Manila International Airport last Fri day.
