title: Air War in Indochina Is Vastly Changed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 3Capt. John Lamb, 25yearold Air Force pilot from Ohatchee, Ala., climbed into his small A37 attack lighter at the Bienhoa air base, taxied out and then took off toward the Cambodian border.

title: For Foes of SST, 8 Months of Toil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  Eight months of intense lobby ing culminated in victory for .a coalition of conservationists today when the Senate voted 52 to 41 to strike down the supersonic transport.

title: Priority on Productivity Called For by Hodgson
description: A key priority for business, labor and government should be the development of ways to increase American output per manhour, or productivity, James D. Hodgson, Secretary of Labor, said yesterday.

title: MRS. ANTOINE PINAY
description: SAINT CHAMOND, France, Dec. 3 (AP)Mrs. Marguerite Fouletier Pinay, wife of Antoine Pinay, former French Premier and foreign minister, died today. The cause of death was not an nounced. Mr. Pinay is Mayor of Saint Chamond and president of the regional council of the Loire department.

title: LOAN COST IS CUT FOR CONSUMERS
description: The broad decline in the cost of money that has swept through the nation's financial markets this year benefited the man in the street yesterday.

title: NETS TURN BACK MEMPHIS BY 9887
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 3The New York Nets, No. 1 defensive team in the American Basketball As sociation, tightened things against the Memphis Pros to night to post a 9887 victory.

title: N.Y.U. TRIUMPHS ON GUMA'S TALLY
description: Three cakes were waiting downstairs in New York Uni versity's Alumni Gym last night in anticipation of Lou Rossini's 300th victory as a coach, and Rory Guma, a 5 foot8inch senior, put the icing on them with one jump shot.

title: Screen: Portrayal of Cuba:Documentary Depicts Youth Role in Revolt
description: "Compaeras and Compaeros," which opened yesterday at the New York Theater on a program with Luis Buuel's 44-minute masterpiece, "Simon of the Desert," is a feature-length documentary on youth's participation in the Cuban revolution. It was produced, directed and edited by David C. Stone, Barbara Stone and Adolfas Mekas, and is the committed record of what Mr. and Mrs. Stone saw in Cuba between June and October, 1969.I suspect that one's reaction to the film will depend largely on the sentiments one brings into the theater. The Stones and their cameramen, including Robert Machover who photographed Robert Kramer's "Ice" and co-directed "Troublemakers," are not at all interested in beguiling the senses by what I'm sure they would regard as cinematic superfluities. They believe so completely in the accomplishments of the revolution to date, and in its goals, that they waste no time trying to balance all the pros with even a few cons.This is their choice but, political considerations aside, it doesn't make for very compelling movie-watching. "Compaeras and Compaeros" consists mostly of interviews with young peoplesugarcane cutters, teachers, engineers and the liketalking about their jobs, the opportunities opened up for them by the revolution, and their commitments to its success.They are earnest and believable, but not terribly articulate (the Spanish dialogue is translated by English subtitles). In fact, in addition to ideals, they seem to share a collective vocabulary that is so small and austere that it would seem to do a disservice to the grandeur of the revolutionary dream, the goal of which must be humanism. There is one revealing sequence in which the young people of a collective meet to elect "exemplary workers." One girl is elected because she has "determination," because she always surpasses her goals, and because she never fights with anyone. Another girl is blackballed because, although she works hard, she doesn't inspire trust and hasn't many friends. One's heart immediately goes to the loser, which explains, I think, why committed movies of this sort never convert the uncommitted. They more or less insist on abject acceptance of premises that cannot be debated.The quality of the color photography is generally fine and, except for one orangey sunset, resolutely refuses to deal in bourgeois postcard esthetics.

title: FISCHER IMPROVES POSITION IN CHESS
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 3  Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles strengthened his firstplace lead in the chess knockout round robin by beating Wolfgang Uhlmann of East Germany in the 18th round today. Fischer now has 124 with two ad journed games. Uhlmann, close rival, has 10%61/2, with one adinurned.

title: Art Works From Japan Show Western Influence
description: For a few yen and with no more discomfort than can be taken care of with a couple of aspirins, they tell me, a Japanese girl can go out during her lunch hour and have a tuck taken in something called the Mon golian fold and transform those lovely almond eyes into the standard Western pecan. Japanese artists have been performing the same operation on painting and sculpture for some years now, and the Westernization has never before looked as complete as it does in a new exhibition, Contemporary Japanese Art: Fifth Japan Art Festival, which opened yes terday at the Guggenheim Museum.

title: Ruel Quits as Pilot of Canadiens
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 3 (AP) Claude Ruel resigned today as coach of the Montreal Canadi ens of the National Hockey League and was replaced by an assistant coach. Al MacNeil.

title: Auto Sales Nov. 21 to 30 Show a Drop of 38% From Year Ago
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3The four auto makers reported today only 138,556 sales of American cars in the final third of No vember, down 38 per cent from 223,873 a year ago. Only the American Motors Corporation showed a Nov. 2130 sales gain over last year and that was because the company was hurt by strikes last year.

description: HARTFORD, Dec. 3Gover norelect Thomas J. Meskill, a Republican, called today for a temporary moratorium on state public works projects because of the state's desper ate financial situation.

title: Books of The Times
description: The abbreviated shopper's guide that appeared in this space yesterday may have left the impression that any decent gift purchase has to be a doorstopping type of thing, ornate and very expensive. frequently is, but it does not have to be. There are any number of books that are distinctive, worth cherishing and that will not bankrupt the exchequer. Needless to say. I am not referring to bestsellers, which require no word from me, nor to those ubiquitous entries like cookbooks and little volumes that tell a man how to run three street car transfers into million dollars.

title: U.N. TEAM LIKELY TO ACCUSE LISBON
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 3  The United Nations factfinding mission that visited Guinea last week will submit to the Security Council tomor row a report described by in formed diplomatic sources as a strong indictment of Portu gal.

Nye of Greenwich, Conn., was awarded the 1970 Marine Alu minum Ocean Racing Trophy yesterday for the outstanding performance of their yacht Ca rina, but they were upstaged by another announcement: Alu minum had been accepted by Lloyd's of London as a proper material with which to build America's Cup boats in 1973.

title: Kobayashi Outpoints Saijo In Nontitle Fight at Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Dec. 3 (AP)Hiroshi Kobayashi won a 10round split decision over Shozo Saijo tonight in a nontitle fight be tween two World Boxing As sociation champions.

title: WILLIAM G. LAMOTHE
description: William G. LaMothe of 2185 Grand Concourse, the Bronx, a linotype operator at The New York Times since 1937, died on Thursday in MidIsland Hospi tal, Bethpage, L.I. He was 621 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1970

title: MARTIN J. REMSEN, RETIRED LAWYER
description: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Dec. 3 Martin J. Remsen, a Wall Street lawyer who retired to become a dairy farmer and gave $1,750,0,00 to Dartmouth College for its medical school, died here today. Mr. Remsen, a longtime resident of Garden City, L. I., was 78 years old.

title: Joseph Wheeler, 86, Expert On Library Administration
description: RUTLAND, Vt., Dec. 3Jo seph Lewis Wheeler, a librarian and consultant on the construc tion and administration of more than 175 libraries in the United States, died here today. He was 86 years old.

title: MIDWEST OIL GETS ACQUISITION OFFERS
description: The Midwest Oil Corpora tion, which is 52.6 per cent owned by the Standard Oil Company of Indiana, said yes terday it had received a num ber of bids to acquire it.

title: Smokers Return From Cruise With Hope for Future
description: Most people come home from a Caribbean cruise with dutyfree Scotch and a straw hat, but 95 cruise passengers docked here on the Santa Paula yesterday with some thing differentwith what they hope is a new lease on life.

title: Redeemer Nation to SuperPower
description: When President Nixon reviewed the American Armada, gathered in the Mediterranean, he assured the sailors that our fleet was the greatest force for peace in the world. The President was reminding the Russians that their fleet could not dominate that impor tant sea. Yet our Government had spent thousands of lives and billions of dollars in a futile war in Indo china.

title: Money
description: Thursday, Dec. 3. 1970

title: Jeanne Curtis Webber, Writer Of Magazine Articles, Is Dead
description: Mrs. Jeanne Curtis Webber, a freelance writer and former editorial researcher for Time and Fortune magazines, died yesterday of cancer at Me morial Hospital. The wife of Gordon Webber, novelist and advertising executive, she was 55 years old and lived at 60 East Eighth Street.

title: TV: Tennessee Williams Twin Bill
description: The most notable Tennes see Williams play, The Glass Menagerie, was produced in 1945, and ever since the play wright has been endeavoring in different ways to capture the sensitivity and ordeals of ordinary people. Last night, two short plays by Mr. Williamsa relatively new one entitled I Can't Imagine Tomorrow, having its first performance in any medium, and Talk to Me Like the Rain and Let Me Listen, written 17 years ago, were presented on Channel 13. In both instances the poignant pursuit of a common theme the horrors of human isola tionwas evident, but the touch was unsure.

title: Equity Votes to Continue Off Broadway Shutdown
description: The Actors Equity Associa tion voted overwhelmingly yes terday to continue the three week strike that has shut down 15 Off Broadway productions.

title: Silence Says a Lot for Film Archives
description: Silence is golden in the 90 seat theater at Anthology Film Archives, the new ten ant in the groundfloor north wing of the New York Shake speare Festival Theater com plex at 425 Lafayette Street. And the new showcase, in an experimental innovation geared to provide unbroken concentration on the art of film, has the seats to guaran tee the silence.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Films

title: Yovicsin Will Be Honored At Harvard Club Tonight,
description: John Yovicsin, Adolph Sam borski and Bill Brooks will be the guests of honor at the Har vard Club of New York tonight.

title: ned Boat Towed off Bronx Street by City
description: The Sanitation Depart ment, which tows away thou sands of abandoned cars every year, repotted yester day that it had towed away its first abandoned boata 30foot cabin cruiser beached in front of an autorepair shop in the Bronx.

title: SWING BAND FINDS IDENTITY IN DEBUT
description: A swing band made up of business and professional men, which has been keeping the musical sound of the thirties and forties alive at country clubs and yacht clubs in Con necticut, Westchester and New Jersey for the last five years, made its New York debut on Tuesday evening. The band, called the Sentimental Seven teen (there are actually 18 members), played in the Im perial Ballroom of the Ameri cana Hotel for the annual din ner dance of the Society of Cosmetic Chemists.

title: Taint Halts Quisset Fishing
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Mer cury pollution has forced a shutdown of shellfishing in Quisset Harbor in Falmouth, the state Public Health Com missioner, Alfred Frechette, said today. He said that there was no cause for alarm but that the source of the contamination was still not known.

title: Business Records

title: SHANKER DEBATES WITH BERGTRAUM
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, declared yesterday that school decentralization had no value at all in terms of educa tional change.

title: Cardan Outpoints Hidalgo
description: MARSEILLES, France. Dec. (UPI)Marcel Cerdan Jr. cele brated his 27th birthday today by outpointing Dario Hidalgo of Santo Domingo in a 10round contest. Cerdan weighed 146 pounds, Hidalgo 147

title: Attempt to Cool Blaze
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 4 (AP) Fire fighters began pumping sea water on a cluster of flam ing oil wells today, hoping to cool the blaze enough for ex perts to move in to try to put it out

title: Lakers Sink Warriors, 123101
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. UPI)Jerry West poured in 30 points, contributed 14 assists nd stole numerous passes to light to lead Los Angeles to 23101 rout of the San Fran isco Warriors as the Lakers loved into first place in the acific Division.

title: Cities in the 70's
description: The campaign of 1970so strident and yet so emptyfailed to meet the issues of the seventies. It was as though there were no war, no inflation, no recession, no unemployment, and no cities in deep trouble. The campaign substituted tough talk for real debate and double talk for real programs.

title: Texas Faces Arkansas Today in Quest for 30th Straight Football Victory
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 4  If tomorrow afternoon' s nation allytelevised game between Texas and Arkansas is decid ed late in the fourth quarter by less than a touchdown, it will come as no shock to the sellout crowd in this state and collegefootball capital.

title: CHEMICAL MAKERS SET A CUT IN PRICE
description: Major producers of metha nol, an important chemical in termediate going into fibers, coatings, adhesives and anti freeze, announced yesterday that they would lower prices beginning Jan. 1

title: Irving Allen, CoFounder Of Carpet Shops, Was 64
description: Irving Allen of Monroe Street, Hewlett Neck, L.L, died Thurs day in University Hospital after openheart surgery. He was 64 years old.

title: MECOM GUARANTEES OIL COMPANY DEBTS
description: John W. Mecom Sr., the Texas oil man, said yesterday that he and his wife, Mary Elizabeth, would personally guarantee the obligations of their privately held United States Oil of Louisiana group, now in the hands of a bank ruptcy trustee.

title: 4.6 Million Unemployed; Rate Highest in 7 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Un employment continued to rise, in November, reaching a total of 4.6 million persons and a rate of 5.8 per cent of the labor force. The rate was the highest in seven and a half years.

title: Rediscovering the Wheel
description: We all know that when the lights go green, every intersection in New York is barely more active than parking lot. We are all aware that this mass of cars belches out exhaust containing, among other things, lead, carbon monoxide, and soot (which is approximately what particulate mat ter boils down to). Various ailments result from the exhausted air we breathe in New York,

title: Ford Calls Efforts to Oust Douglas Far From Finished
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) The House minority leader, Gerald R. Ford, said today that efforts to impeach Supreme Court Justice William O. Doug las were far from finished despite a judiciary subcommit tee report that found no grounds for such action.

title: Cape Cod Bank Cuts Rate On Home Mortgage Loans
description: SOUTH YARMOUTH, Mass., Dec. 4 (AP)The Bass River Savings Bank, the largest bank on Cape Cod, has announced a  per cent reduction in its home mortgage loan rates, Le Roy W. Long, president, said today that the move followed the reduction in the prime rate by the Federal Reserve and the nation's major national banks.

title: Dance:
description: Frederick Ashton's Illumi nations, given for the first time this season by the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater, is a work of both biography and com ment. In cure dance terms this happens to be a more than difficult act. It is, as anyone can see, a literary oriented piece trying to place the poet Arthur Rimbaud into his own strange and convoluted world.

description: HONG KONG, Dec. 4Pope Paul VI headed homeward from Asia today after addressing message of unity and of love to Chinese everywhere at mass less than 20 miles from the Chinese Communist border.

description: The classic look will come back when they get finished with carnival time, Jack Lazar remarked in his office yesterday. He's the man responsible for the Kimberly fashions that women collect with the same devotion and passion they used to devote to cashmere sweaters.

description: SAN JUAN, P. R. Dec. 4 (UPI) The National Conference of State Legislative Leaders ap proved a resolution today call ing for a constitutional conven tion in 1971 to add a revenue sharing provision for states to the Constitution.

description: Pharmacies throughout the country reported yesterday that sales of vitamin C were boom ing in response to Dr. Linus Pauling's recent advocacy of large doses of the vitamin as means of preventing and curing the common cold.

description: The American Stock Ex change announced disciplinary actions yesterday against the Garvin Bentel Corporation, a member house, and two indi viduals for violating exchange rules through the improper use of certain trading  floor records of another member firm.

title: Cross in Excellent Health in Montreal; He Prepares to Fly to London Today
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4James Richard Cross, who was res cued yesterday after two months in the captivity of kid nappers, was declared in ex cellent health today and pre pared to return to Britain to morrow.

title: Bullets Win, 131116
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 4 (UPI) Jack Marin and Gus Johnson scored 28 points apiece tonight as the Baltimore Bullets put down a mild Seattle SuperSonic rally in the fourth quarter and coasted to a 131116 victory.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Oil supplies available to the nation will increase soon by at least 300,000 barrels and by as much as 500,000 barrels a day be cause of the decisions an nounced tonight by the Presi dent, Interior Department offi cials disclosed.

description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4  The North Atlantic alliance formal ly declared today that even the first steps toward an East West conference on European security, as sought by the So viet bloc, must await a satis factory conclusion to the four power talks on Berlin's future.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1970

title: OIL RESTRICTIONS RELAXED BY NIXON TO CURB INFLATION
description: President Nixon pledged last night efforts to move the econ omy up to its full potential for growth and announced a major new effort to reduce prices by relaxing Government restrictions on oil production and imports.

title: cuba Tops U.S.. 53 in Final
description: CARTAGENA, Colombia, Dec. (UPI)Cuba defeated the United States, 53, tonight to win the 18th world amateur baseball championship in a two ofthreegame playoff. The play off was instituted after both teams finished the tournament with 101 wonlost records.

title: ARMCO STEEL SETS DIRECT REDUCTION
description: The Armco Steel Corporation yesterday became the first major domestic steel producer to announce that it would build a directreduction plant in this country.

description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 4 (UPI)A Florida judge won permission today to carry a pistol, declaring he planned to take somebody with me if anyone tried to shoot up his courtroom.

title: KROSNICK PRESENTS A RECITAL ON CELLO
description: Joel Krosnick, the cellist who made his recital debut at Town Hall on Thursday night, showed why he has earned respect as a yarned ensemble player around town over the past few years.

title: Belatedly, a Drug Plan
description: The City of New York has submitted a Comprehensive Drug Abuse Plan in response to state prodding. The only thing really wrong with the plan, aside from a slight fudging of fact, is its inexcusable lateness.

title: RA Comparison of Zorach and Trajan
description: When the American sculp tor William Zorach died in 1966 at the age of 79. he had long been established as an important figure in the art of his time. His work was rep resented in more than 50 American museums, and his name was a fixture in the standard texts and chronol ogies of modern American art. Few American sculptors of his generation had received so much attention and ac claim.

title: Eaton Sues Power Company
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Cyrus Eaton, the millionaire and industrialist has filled $750,000 damage suit against the Cleveland Electric Illumin ating Company, charging that it had needlessly slaughtered more than 450 trees on his farm when the company installed a power line across the property at Northfield. Ohio.

description: VIENNA, Dec. 4Dr. Kurt List, the Viennaborn musicolo gist, conductor and producer of records of classical music, died in Milan on Nov. 16 of cerebral hemorrhage, it was learned here today. His age was 57.

The company petitioned the Federal District Court at Pitts burgh for an injunction, and Judge Louis Rosenberg issued, a temporary restraining order directing the workers to end the strike.

Willard Pear son, commanding general of the post, said today. General Pear son said the action was neces sary because of the general increase in vandalism, theft oP weapons, arson, bombings and related militant activities di rected at public property.

title: Manila Gets 747 Service

Ceremonies to mark the begin ning of jumbojet service here were held at the Manila Inter national Airport with President Ferdinand E. Marcos as speaker.

title: HERBERT L. BARNET OF PEPSICOLA, 61
description: Herbert L. Barnet, former chairman of the board of the PepsiCola Company and a di rector of the parent company, Pepsico, Inc., died at New York University Hospital on Thurs day evening after a brief ill ness. He was 61 years old and lived at 898 Park Avenue and Westhampton Beach. L. I.

title: Getting the Pusher
description: It used to be that we talked about the weather; today, the subject is crime. In New York, as in most large cities, it's a rare social gathering at which somebody can't report a mug ging, holdup or burglaryif not to himself, at least to a friend And as with the weather, talk is about all that gets done about it. Laws are passed, cops are hired, appropriations for law enforcement soak up more and more of municipal budgetsand crime con tinues to escalate.

title: Canada Increases Unemployment Pay 10% in New Budget
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 4 (Reuters) New unemployment benefits were announced here in a spe cial budget presented to the House of Commons by Finance Minister Edear J. Benson.

title: Executive Changes

Arthur Wormet who has been staff executiveinternational group, has been named to assume the duties previously held by Mr. Buck minster and as managing directorEurope will be responsible for directing the administration of all Chrysler activities in Europe.

title: Celtics Beat Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 4 (UPI) John Havlicek hit on 16 of 26 fieldgoal attempts and tallied 39 points tonight as the Boston Celtics ran their winning streak to seven games with a 118107 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.The Cavaliers, who have now lost 27 of 28 games, got within 3 points with 7 minutes 34 seconds left in the third quar ter, but the Celtics reeled off 24 points in the next 7 minutes.

title: U.S. TO REMOVE GAS FROM OKINAWA SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Defense Department announced today that it would begin, prob ably next month, to move 13,000 tons of nerve and mus tard gas stored on Okinawa to oJhnston Island, an atoll in the midPacific.

title: Nixon Said to Give Israel New Assurance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  President Nixon has reportedly given Premier Golda Meir re newed assurances that the United States will not allow Israel to be put at a diplo matic or military disadvantage if Arab  Israeli talks are re sumed. fense Melvin R. Laird. King Hussein of Jordan is also to see President Nixon and other high officials during a visit here Dec. 8 to 10.

title: WBAI Resumes War and Peace After Mishap
description: When radio station WBAI IFM's fiveday, nonstop reading of Leo Tolstoy's War and Peace was temporarily thrown off the air for an hour and 14 minutes on Thursday morning because of a faulty remote Icable connection, only the sta tion's listeners became unset.

title: CHAIRMAN RESIGNING POST AT TRAVELERS
description: The Travelers Insurance Companies announced yester day the resignation, effective immediately, of J. Doyle De Witt, its $225,000ayear chair man. Mr. De Witt, who is 68 years old, will continue as director.

title: Modest Moves on Inflation Front
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4On the inflation front, the chief thing about President Nixon's major economic speech to night was what it did not do and did not say. But there was importance in what it did do, as well. Officials here explain the decisions that underlay the speech in the following terms: First, the President has once again re jected any guide posts or general formulas aimed at influencing private wage and price behavior. He will not use armtwisting, in the sense of telephone calls or private confrontations with in dividual companies and unions, as Presidents Kennedy and Johnson did.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Friday, December 4. 1970

title: Aside to Nixon Makes Celebrity Of Girl Who Won Youth Award
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4  By the time a knock on her hotel room door awakened Debra Jean Sweet again early this morning, she had resigned her self to a sleepless night be cause of interruptions.

title: Program on Occultism
description: Occultism in the 70's, a prograni described as offering explanations and demonstra tions of astrology, witchcraft, mind reading, hypnosis, voodoo, magic and extra sensory per ception, will be presented Dec. 15 and 16 at the McAlpin Roof top Theater under the sponsor ship of Lester Productions.

title: 6 Identified as Weathermen Seized in an Attempt to Bomb Bank Here
description: City detectives posing as drunks arrested six men and women outside an Upper East Side bank before dawn yester day and charged them with at tempting to firebomb the building.

title: Polytechnic Data Accuses Xerox in an Antitrust Suit
description: The Polytechnic Data Corpo ration filed suit yesterday in Federal District Court in Chi cago charging the Xerox Cor poration with violation of the antitrust laws and asking $30 million in damages.

title: BUCKS VANQUISH 76ERS BY 128122
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 4 (UPI) The Milwaukee Bucks, led by Lew Alcindor's 10 points in ov ertime, defeated the Philadel phia 76ers, 128122, tonight after scoring two baskets in the last three seconds of regulation play to force the extra neriod.

title: Israeli Archeologists Find Ancient Treasure
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4 (Reut ers)  Israeli archeologists working in the ancient town of Eshtamao in the Judean wilderness have discovered silver and jewelry believed to be nearly 3,000 years old.

title: U.S. to Seek High Court Ruling On Case Involving a Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The Department of Justice an nounced today that it would ask the Supreme Court to re view the case of Earl Caldwell, a New York Times reporter onvicted of contempt by a Fed eral District Court whose con viction was then reversed on appeal.

title: LOAN BOARD SETS NEW HOUSING AIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec,. 4  The Federal Home Loan Bank Board formally announced to day a series of new policies designed to make 1971 hous ing's year in the United States, according to the board's chairman. Preston Martin.

title: U.S. Says Misunderstandings Confuse Case Against Menuhin
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The State Department conceded today that misunderstandings on all sides may have led to its preliminary decision that Yehudi Menuhin had lost his United States citizenship for having accepted a honorary Swiss citizenship.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES SLIP AFTER GAIN
description: Soybean futures prices ad vanced sharply in the early trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday but some of the gain was trimmed in al late wave of profit taking.

title: Screen::City Under Sea
description: "Latitude Zero," a Japanese science-fiction movie, and "Day of Anger," an Italian Western, were released yesterday as a double bill at neighborhood theaters.Latitude Zero is a secret city under the sea where all the men are great scientists, all the women are knockouts in plastic mini-dresses, and everybody does good. To balance so much good there must be evil. The center of evil is another secret city, ruled over by one Malic (Cesar Romero) and his consort (Patricia Medina), who practice mad medicine and drink endless quantities of what looks like lime Kool-Aid out of martini glasses.The actual story of "Latitude Zero" concerns a submarine expedition to rescue yet another great scientist whom Malic has captured and intends, by a bit of insane surgery, to add to his quite remarkably cuddly collection of intelligent monsters  which includes spastic bats, giant red-eyed rats and a super-scale griffin.The story, however, is the weakest element in "Latitude Zero." The real virtue of the film lies in its charming and careful models, its ingenious special effects, its fruity interior dcor, its elaborate network of television screens (nobody sees anything first-hand if he can watch it on TV instead) and in Dr. Anne Barton.Dr. Barton (Linda Haynes), all well-washed, pug-nosed beautiful blondness, is not so much a character as the perpetuation of an archetype. Merely repeating the hygienic syllables of her name should recall at least one generation of science-fiction addicts to the deepest sources of their delight.For "Day of Anger" there is not much good to say. It is a strange and muddled film, very long and mostly boring, depending for its plot upon notions of class and caste that seem foreign to the genre if not to real history.But I think attention should be paid to the doctor and the banker and the barber (I have no cast identifications and that whole collection of mostly villainous secondary characters who in Italian Westerns provide a quality of fastidious short fatness to oppose the general long leanness of the old frontier.

title: TRADING IS MIXED ON LONDON BOARD

title: Ecology Woes Here to Stay
description: The discouraging business of trying to cope with pollu tion continues and grows in fervor with each passing day.

title: Little African Reaction Seen
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 4The report of the United Nations mission to Guinea was expected to elicit little immediate reac tion from government leaders in the other black African na tions.

title: 600 New Listings Are Added To the Social Register for 1971
description: The New York Social Regis ter, that quasiofficial listing, albeit incomplete, of the up per class in the metropolitan area, published its 85th edi tion yesterday. And for a number of reasons, including marriages and the population explosion, about 600 new list ings have been included in the 1971 edition.

description: The kettle of preChristmas social activity that has been simmering since the Nine O'Clocks ball at the Plaza Tuesday came to a boil again last night when Mrs. Albert D. Lasker threw open her townhouse for some 100 of her closest friends.

description: Horne teams listed first

title: Housing Authority Will Back Loans To Black Concerns
description: The New York City Housing Authority, which runs low income public housing, an nounced plans yesterday to de posit $10million in several banks here with the condition that the money be used for loans to businesses owned by blacks and Puerto Ricans.

title: Day Care Centers That Aren't Just for Children
description: An alternative to com munal living, together with a concept of day care cen ters organized on a family pattern, rather than age groups, is in the experimen tal stages among a small number of families in Sweden.

title: Panel Urges That Vatican Stand On Jews Be Given Wider Effect
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4A report released here today by the American Jewish Committee said that considerably more systematic implementation should be given to the Declara tion on the Jews adopted by the Ecumenical Council Vatican II, although it found some positive developments.

description: Senator Barry M. Gold water charged American in dustry yesterday with what he called its greatest chal lengeproducing better qual ity defense equipment at less cost.

title: Harold R. Austin, ExPresident Of M. W. Kellogg, Is Dead at 85
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 4 Harold R. Austin, retired presi dent of the M. W. Kellogg Corn. pany, engineering and construc tion concern with global inter ests, died at his home here to day alter a long illness. He was S5 years old.

title: PENNSY UNIT BARRED FROM LEAVING ROAD
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (AP) A Federal judge issued a 30 day injunction today against a New England railroad seeking to remove itself from the cus tody of the Penn Central Transportation Company.

description: As the midnight strike dead line approached last night on duty cabs virtually disappeared from the streets of midtown Manhattan and offduty cabs grew exorbitantly expensive.

title: Jets Must Stop Raider PassCatching Pair Tomorrow
description: Warren Wells and Fred Bilet nikoff come to Shea Stadium tomorrow with 15 touchdown catches between them. If the Jets rookie cornerback corps has its way, they'll leave with the same number

title: NO BRAG JUST FACT WINS 3D STRAIGHT
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 4No Brag Just Fact, owned by Edwin F. Richards, stepped up in class today and scored his third straight triumph, taking the one mile Thwarted Purse at Laurel Race Course. margin was six lengths. The son or Silky Sullivan ran a race unlike his sire, who was famous for rallying from far off the pace. Instead of dropping far back during the early running. No Brag Just Fact battled for the Lead at the start with favored Lucky Lord. As the field of seven left the backstretch, Nick Shuk urged No Brag Just Fact and the horse moved rapidly ahead of his rivals. Brush Man closed fast and finished second, half a length in front of Tornum. No Brag Just Fact, who was timed in 1:38 25, paid $6.60, $5 and $4 for $2 across the board. Brush Man returned $8.40 and $5.40 and Tornum paid $5.60.

title: Issues in the Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, repre senting 69 of the 72 fleet owners who operate 6,816 cabs; the City Council, which has the responsibility for setting taxi fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who recommended a fare increase at an earlier stage in negotiations.

title: U.N. Mission on Guinea Says Portuguese Led Raid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 4The United Nations mission sent to Guinea by the Security Council has con cluded that on the morning of Nov. 22 the West African country was invaded by Portuguese troops under the command of regular white Portuguese officers.

description: RRccord

title: Hussein Meets Heath
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (Reuters) King Hussein of Jordan met Prime Minister Heath today to discuss events in the Middle East.

title: SPAIN PUTS CURBS ON A BASQUE AREA
description: MADRID, Dec. 4The Gov ernment decreed a threemonth state of emergency tonight in the Basque province of Guipdz coa, where a West German consul was abducted Tuesday.

title: Japanese TV Sets Dumped, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  The Treasury Department said today that Japanese tele vision sets were being dumped in the United States market at less than their fair value.

title: AMEX ISSUES POST 7TH STRAIGHT GAIN
description: The American Stock Ex change scored its seventh con secutive advance yesterday as the list closed with modest gains in lighter volume.

title: Wind Shift Eases Threat Of an Oil Slick to Florida
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 4 Brisk westerly winds pushed a large oil slick out to sea today and diminished the dan ger it has posed for three days to Florida beaches.

title: MAHON BISHOP SINGS PROGRAM OF LIEDER
description: Mahon Bishop, who gave a recital at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night, has a culti vated If somewhat superficial approach to lieder singing. He looks the part, and now and then sounds it, too. But neither the baritone's vocal equipment nor his artistic temperament really lived up to appearances.

title: NETS WIN, 115110, FROM FLORIDIANS
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 4  Sonny Dove scored 36 points, including 9 in the last quarter, to lead the New York Nets to a 115110 Ameri can Basketball Association vic tory tonight over the Floridians. It was the Nets fourth triumph in a row.

title: The Japanese Tourist Is Focusing on America
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.The Japanese may see America first.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT IN UNUSUAL DROP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  installment debt declined $82million in Octo ber, the first drop in more than nine years, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: The Urban Activist
description: The setting was a dilapidated man sion located near the downtown area of a northeastern metropolis. It housed an urban commune whose members were former students, all whites, from families that were uppermiddleclass in wealth or professional status.

title: Coast Guard Officers Relieved Of Duties in Defector Incident
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Three Coast Guard officers closely associated with the de cision to deny political asylum last week to a wouldbe de fector from a Soviet fishing vessel have been relieved of their duties pending the results of an investigation.

title: 6 New England Governors Seek Ban on Import Quotas
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)The six New England Governors voted today to ask the United States Supreme Court to over turn President Nixon's author ity to set oil import quotas for the nation east of the Rockies.

title: Snowmobiles Replace Sulkies At Monticello Raceway Today
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Dec. 4 A sudden cold snap, in which the temperature had dropped 26 degrees in four hours, assured the opening of the snowmobile racing season tomorrow at Monticello Raceway. The series of SaturdaySunday meets con tinues until midMarch, with races running from 11 A.M. to 4 P.M.

title: Britain's Hidden Hurdle
description: BRUSSELS  Like some intricate Richard Strauss opera, with characters and symbols operating on different levels and the stage machinery creak ing, the negotiations to bring Britain into the European Economic Commu nity are slowly unveiling the realities. What it all means at this point may depend on where the observer sits.

title: Moscow Criticizes NATO
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4The So viet Union tonight charged the North Atlantic Treaty Council with creating artifi cial obstacles to an improved atmosphere in Europe by in sisting on a Berlin settlement before steps can be taken for convening a European security conference.

title: Faster Withdrawal Planned
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4 (UPI)United States military sources today disclosed that there will be an acceleration in the withdrawal of American troops that will reduce their strength in South Vietnam to 337,000 men by Dec. 31. This is 7,000 fewer than originally had been planned.

title: UNIVERSITY SERVICE SEEKS TO CUT COSTS
description: The Academy for Education al Development, a nonprofit research and consulting organ ization with offices in New York and Washington, an nounced yesterday the forma tion of a management support service to help colleges and universities to cope with rising operational costs.

title: Boy, 7, Is Wounded By a Classmate Who Found Gun
description: A firstgrade pupil at Public School 11 in Queens shot a 7yearold classmate in the hand yesterday with a .22cali ber pistol he said he had found near the school.

title: She Made No. 10 Downing St. a Place to Relax
description: LONDON  The tenant at 10 Downing Street is one of Britain's most eligible bache lors, but recently a trim, at tractive woman in her forties has been spending consider able time in his anartrnent.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: PATROLMEN BARRED OUTSIDE CLUB ORGY
description: The Police Department will not be allowed to station uni formed patrolmen outside the Club Orgy, 110 West 24th Street, under an agreement reached in Manhattan Federal Court yesterday between the city and the club's lawyer.

title: 3 Killed, 39 Injured in Fire in Midtown Skyscraper
description: A fire poured dense smoke through a 49story midtown office building yesterday, kill ing three persons and injuring 39 of hundreds of persons trapped on the upper floors.

title: for Men Only To These Golfers, It Remains a Welcome Expression
description: ALPINE, N. J.While For Men Only are fighting words these days, the Tamcrest Country Club opened here last summer with just such a membership restriction.

title: South Vietnam's Supreme Court Elects Chief Regarded as Friendly to President Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4The Supreme Court, with which President Nguyen Van Thieu has clashed frequently in the last year, today elected court president more to his liking.

title: Rules Set on Towing Homes
description: The Highway Commission in the State of Washington gave three months for the towing of mobile homes up to 14 feet wide on state highways, but specified that the towing had to be in nonpeak hours on weekdays, at a speed below 20 miles an hour, and with pilot cars in front and behind on twolane roads, the magazine Fleet Owner reports.

title: New Mvlai Trial Set
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Dec. 4 (AP)A military judge today set Jan. 5 for the courtmartial of Sgt. Charles E. Hutto. charged in connection with the alleged Mylei massacre.

title: House Foes of SST Seek Voiding of Endorsement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  House opponents of the super sonic transport opened a drive today to retract early next week the House's endorsement of the project, even before conferees meet to consider a compromise on the $290  mil lion appropriation rejected yes terday in the Senate.

title: Neighborhoods:
description: IIl will is festering on a thumb of land jutting into Little Neck Bay that has seemed almost idyllic since the turn of the century to city residents who also want serene living:.

title: Company Cuts Dividend
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Carson Pirie Scott & Co. today cut its quarterly dividend to 15 cents from 25 cents. It will be paid Dec. 31 to stockholders of record Dec. I8.

title: THOMSON ELEVATES SON IN PRESS EMPIRE
description: LONDON, Dec. 4Lord Thomson, publisher of the ailing Times of London and chairman of the Thomson Organization, Ltd., tonight announced the ap pointment of his son, Kenneth, to serve as joint chairman of the publishing empire.

title: Pistons Too Bulls
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (AP)The Detroit Pistons built up a point lead in the first half to night and again in the third quarter but had to hang on heat the Chicago Bulls, 107.103, for their third straight victory.

title: Greene and Hill of U.S. Tie Track Marks in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Dec. 4 (UPI) Charlie Greene, a former Uni versity of Nebraska track star, equaled the men's best listed indoor world time of 6.5 sec onds in the 60meter dash to night and Heide Rosendahl West German set a mark seconds for the women's 60 meter hurdles at an interna tional meet

title: I.O.S. Outflow Slows
description: GENEVA, Dec. 4November redemptions exceeded sales in the 19 mutual funds of the In vestors Overseas Services by $20.5million, a spokesman for the mutual fund group said today. This was an improve ment over the comparable out flow of $24.9million in October.

title: Jews Seen as Nearing Accord On U.S. Aid to Private Schools
description: American Judaism, long di vided on the question of gov ernment aid to religious schools, is approaching the point of agreement on Federal support for nonpublic schools, according to an influential Jew ish scholar here.

title: Sale of AirPollution Devices For Homes Stirs Concern Here
description: Health and airpollutioncon trol authorities are becoming increasingly concerned over the growing sales of some home de vices that their sellers contend control air pollution.

title: EAST SIDE POLICE NIT FOR 4 HOURS
description: Scores of patrolmen assigned to the East 67th Street station house, bitter over publication of a statement made by the special commission investigat ing police corruption, refused to patrol the streets of the Upper East Side for about four hours yesterday.

title: Talented Children Discussed at a Hearing Here
description: The schooling of the nation's brightest children  a subject of major concern to parents and educators a decade ago, but a quiescent one in recent yearswas revived as an is sue of Federal policy in a spe cial hearing here yesterday.

title: Harvard Fills Urban Post
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 4 (AP)Harvard University an nounced today the appoint ment of Edward Simpkins as assistant dean of the Har vard Graduate School of Edu cation and executive director of the school's Center for Ur ban Studies.

title: NEW ISSUES FAIL TO FOLLOW MARKET
description: The newissue market failed to participate this week as listed stocks soared in heavy trading. Only a few companies made first public offerings, none of them meeting excep tional demand.

title: Howard Hughes Reported Studying Bahamas Property
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Dec. 41 (AP)  Howard Hughes, the multimillionaire who is Ne vada' s biggest casino owner, is reported to be in the Bahamas on a secret business trip in volving the $25million Cora] Harbour development on New Providence Island.

title: Giants Strategy in Playoff Bid Hinges on Johnson's Condition
description: Whether or not Ron Johnson will play for the New York Giants against Buffalo tomor row has developed into a matter of strategy as well as. nhvsical condition.

title: PHONE COMPANIES DISCUSSING DEAL
description: The Commonwealth Tele phone Company of Virginia an nounced yesterday that Con tinental Telephone Corporation has made an offer to buy Com monwealth through an ex change of stock worth about $39million. Under the proposal,

title: Crime Groups Said to Smuggle Hundreds of Sicilians Into U.S.
description: Hundreds of Sicilians are be ing smuggled into the United States through Canada by or ganized crime families in the Northeast seeking cheap labor for Mafiacontrolled businesses and recruits for underworld duties, Federal law enforce ment officials and immigration authorities said yesterday.

title: TOP SCHOOL AIDE QUITS CITY POST
description: Dr. Theodore H. Lang, deputy superintendent for personnel, will leave the city school sys tem Jan. 31 to become a pro fessor of education at Baruch College of City University.

title: Taxiless City
description: Rarely has a strike made less sense than the one that began taking all the city's unionized taxicabs off the streets last night. Both the union and the fleet owners recognize that the money limits for any strike settlement are fixed by the fare increases recommended three weeks ago by Mayor Lindsay.

title: MRS. REUBEN H. GUMS
description: Mrs. Frances Seifert Gums, wife of the Rev. Reuben H. Gums, director of radio and television for the Council of Churches of New York City, died of cancer Thursday at her home, 615 West 145th Street. She was 40 years old.

title: Italian Officials Seize Records At I.I.G.'s Rome Headquarters
description: ROME, Dec. 4  Italian fi nance guards, the enforcement agency of the Finance Minis try, put official seals today on all entrances to the Rome headquarters of the Interna tional Investors Group, an off shore mutual fund organization that suspended yesterday all sales and redemptions in shares in its major fund, the Real Es tate Fund of America.

title: Portugal in the Dock
description: From the outset, Portuguese Government authorities categorically denied any involvement in the recent com mandotype attack on Guinea. The imagination of the people of the Republic of Guinea has no limits, a Foreign Ministry spokesman in Lisbon said scornfully.

title: James Farmer to Resign As a Nixon Welfare Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  James Farmer, who is the Nixon Administration's most prominent Negro official, and the two chiefs of a White House committee on opportunities for the Spanishspeaking are re signing, the latter because of what they describe as weariness from dealing with bureaucrats.

title: Art: The American Realism of Sidney Goodman
description: Sidney Goodman, who is having his seventh oneman show at the Dintenfass Gal lery, 18 East 67th Street, is an American figurative painter who looked very good in his first show and has looked better and better ever since. With half a dozen other painters across the country as leaders whose suc cess has encouraged increas ing numbers of followers, Mr. Goodman represents a solidly established school of Ameri can realism. Its develooment beneath the noisy prolifera tion of international isms has been steady but so quiet that we have hardly been aware of its extent, much less its strength, until the last three or four years.

title: Court Refuses to Place Blame in 1965 Plane Collision
description: A Federal court refused to place blame yesterday for a col lision of two airliners five years ago over Carmel, N. Y., in which four persons were killed.

title: CITY CAB DRIVERS WALK OFF THE JOB; NO TALKS ARE SET
description: The city's 36,000 unionized taxi drivers went on strike at 12:01 A.M. today, leaving hun dreds of thousands of riders to find other means of trans portation.

title: Stately Technique Caps Dance Style Of Phoebe Neville
description: Given a choice, Phoebe Nev ille would opt for less move ment rather than more in a dance. She is an excellent al legro dancer but prefers to work in an adagio tempo. She

title: 3 SHOTGUN BLASTS FIRED INTO CHURCH
description: Three shotgun blasts were fired into an East Harlem church by unknown assailants last night while services were being held. No one was in jured.

title: ExG.I. Says Calley Killed Nonresisters
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 4  Before a hushed court, a former soldier described today the alleged massacre of South Vietnamese civilians at Mylai and said that he had seen First Lieutenant William L. Calley Jr. pour automatic rifle fire into a ditch full of people and blow the head off a woman who tried to rise from a pile of corpses.

title: Books of The Times
description: His name hack an aristocratic ring. And perhaps better than anyone else he exem plified E. M. Forster's aristocracy of the sensitive, the considerate and the plucky. A pioneer of the sky in the predawn of the space age, he breathed the romance of the air as no one had done before or has since. But in the brief span of his 44 years,

title: MSGR. A. H. GILLICK, HEMPSTEAD PASTOR
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 4 Msgr. Aloysius H. Gillick, pas tor emeritus of Our Lady of Loretto Parish In Hempstead, died today in Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre, after a long illness. He was 86 years old.

title: BOSTON REGAINS AMATEUR STATUS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (UPI)In an unusual move with possible international ramifications, the national Ama teur Athletic Union reinstated Ralph Boston, the 1960 Olympic long jumping, champion,. as an amateur. The vote by the Board or governors was overwhelm ingly in favor of reinstatement.

title: N.Y.U., COLUMBIA MEET IN GARDEN
description: L.I.U. Will Face LaSalle in Opening Game Today

title: Tektronix Net Is Lower in 2d Quarter
description: Tektronix, Inc., the world's leading producer of cathode ray oscilloscopes, which are electronic testing and meas uring instruments, showed larger decline in sales and earn ings in the second fiscal quarter ended Nov. 14 than in the pre vious three months, according to the company's report issued yesterday from its Oregon headquarters.

title: West Virginia Town Lifts Union Carbide Tax Ceiling
description: ANMOORE, W. Va., Dec. 4 The Union Carbide Corporation became liable today for about $400,000 in new taxes here over the next few years, and Buck Gladden, the Mayor of this oneompany factory town of 960 persons, called it a blow to corporate colonialism.

title: Bayard Rustin To Be Honored At Hilton Dec. 14
description: Bayard Bustin, executive director of the A. Philip Ran dolph Institute, will be guest of honor at a dinner Dec. 14 at the New York Hilton.

title: Bayh Considering Bid for the Presidency in '72
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Senator Birch Bayh is consider ing running for President in 1972. He is not certain that he is fully qualified, but he is sure that he is better qualified than Richard. Nixon.

title: A Listing by Categories Of 4.6 Million Jobless
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The following table presents a profile of the 4.6 million Americans who were unem ployed in November.

title: Antiques: Two in One
description: A gadget that should be awarded the prize for being the most contrived and star tling antique of the year is one of many interesting glass ceramic and furniture items in the extensive Channing Hare collection, which is now on display, until auction on Dec. 11 and 12, at the Parke Bernet Galleries.

title: Downtown Scene: Art in the Bowery
description: As a result of cramped spaces, spiraling realestate values and more than a little territorial and moral disen chantment, several galleries have moved out of their thick carpeted, expensive midManhattan and uptown locations and sought cheap er, more capacious shelters elsewhere. They have been finding them in Soho, below Houston Street, and in the East and Greenwich Village, especially around Fourth Street, 10th Street and Broadway.

title: Arthur Hosking, 96, Dead; Publisher Was Composer
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Dec. 4Arthur N. Hosking, a maga zine publisher, composer and artist, died here Monday at New Rochelle Hospital. He was 96 years old, and lived at 75 White Oak Street.

title: Virginia lselin Future Bride
description: NELSON, N. H., Dec. 4 Mrs. Arthur Iselin Jr. has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Virginia Iselin, to Jonathan Hall, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Hall of Wilton, Conn., and Cas tine, Me. The wedding is planned for Dec. 31.

title: Race Horse Training Aid Is Devised
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4An Alaska businessman and two Arizona coinventors were granted patents this week on a method and apparatus for producing race horses capable of optimum per formance. Young animals with adequately large hearts are select ??nd are devel oped by vigorous swimming exercises under close obser vation.

title: U2 Controversy Intensified
description: CAIRO, Dec. 4A somewhat mysterious controversy over United States U2 reconnais sance flights along the Suez Canal, which Washington in sists have been halted, was in tensified today by the Govern ment of the United Arab Re public.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Friday, Dec. 4. 41st day. Weather cloudy, track fast.

title: Apparel Groups Merged
description: The Corset and Brassiere As sociation of America and the Lingerie Industry Council have merged into the American Ap parel Manufacturers Associa tion, effective this month. The two groups will be the nucleus of the newly formed intimate apparel division of the A.A.M.A. and will maintain their office at 180 Madison Ave. in New York.

title: Dow Up 7.53 at 816.06; Closing Level Is 70 High
description: The stock market, continuing to amaze and confound 30 mil lion shareowners, boomed yes terday to its best level of 1970 as it rounded out the heaviest trading week in the history of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Maple Rides 2 Winners
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec.  Eddie Maple moved into sec ond place in the jockey stand ing at Liberty Bell Race Track today with a pair of triumphs that raised his total to 12.

title: Film Producton Venture
description: Cinema V, the movie theater distributor operation, will enter film production in a joint ven ture, called Cinema X, with Max Palesky, a member of the Xerox board of directors and chairman of the company's ex ecutive committee. Announce ment of the alliance was made jointly yesterday by Donald S. Rugoff, president of the movie company, and Mr. Palevsky at the offices of Cinema V, 595 Madison Avenue.

title: Reynolds, A.B.C. Newsman, Airs Protest on Transfer
description: Frank Reynolds, in his last appearance yesterday as the evening news anchorman for the American Broadcasting Company, said of his transfer from the job: I would prefer to pick my own time to leave.

title: ABRAMS IS CLEARED OF SOLDIER'S CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 4 (UPI) Secretary of the Army Stan ley R. Resor dismissed today a soldier's charges that Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the United States commander in Vietnam, had condoned inhu man treatment of prisoners.

title: Investment Bankers Elect Minnesotan as President
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 4 Wheelock Whitney, chief exec utive officer of Dain, Kalman & Quail, Inc., a Minneapolisbased securities concern, was elected today as president of the In vestment Bankers Association for 1971. He succeeds Andrew J. Melton Jr., chairman of the executive committee of Smith, Barney & Co.. Inc.

title: U.C.L.A. Triumphs, 10877
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (UPI) University of California, Lo.; Angeles, opened its basketball season tonight by breezing to a 10877 victory over Baylor before 12,433 fans at Pauley Pavilion. The topranked Bruins jumped to a 2310 lead in the first six minutes and were ahead, 4729, when Coach John Wooden removed his starters with more than five minutes left in the first half.

title: JOSEPH 4P. NELSON, 60, CHAPPAQUA DOCTOR
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y., Dec. 4 Dr. Joseph P. Nelson, a phy sician here for 25 years, died yesterday in Northern West chester Hospital, Mount Kisco. He was 60 years old and had been ill for several years.

title: Braves Top Knicks, 9791, as May Paces LastPeriod Rally Against ExTeam
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 4  Donnie May received his National Bas ketball Association champion ship ring tonight at halftime of the game between the New York Knicks, with whom he played last season, and the. Buffalo Braves, the team that. claimed him last spring in the expansion draft.

title: South Korea Sentences 2 U.S. Soldiers to Death
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 4 The Seoul District Criminal Court imposed death sentences today on two American soldiers convicted of murdering and robbing a South Korean couple last March at Tongduchon, 25 miles north of Seoul.

title: WALLACE, IN CITY, SAYS U.S. SUFFERS
description: George C. Wallace, in his first public appearance in New York since his 1968 Presidential cam paign, told a sympathetic audi ence at the John Birch Society's annual dinner last night that the silent majority should be silent no longer.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Are You Crazy??
description: The rotunda of Madison Square Garden, a whitewalled space off the main arena, reeks faintly of longgone ele phants, a vague yet cloying smell that hints of carnival. Yesterday, in a training ring pitched in the rotunda, Muhammad Ali heaved and slugged with a sparring partner named Bunky Akins, and grunted to him: C'mon, chump, take our hest shot, c'mon, boy, what did I tell you about all that talking?... C'mon, sucker, can't hit me, you can't hit me.... C'mon, Oscar, you're losing, chump, I'm gonna whip you, I'm gonna WHIP you, I'm gonna whip YOU.... I'm gonna run you back to Argentina.... I'm a chicken, huh. I'm a chicken, huh, I'm a chicken, huh?... Did you call me a chicken?... Are you crazy?

title: Inquiry Pressed In Cutting of Cables Of Queens Phones
description: Federal agents and the local police were investigating yes terday the cutting of cables at 30 locations in Queens Thurs day night that knocked out service to 10.000 telenhonps.

title: Weight Lifter Cracks Mark
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4 (UPI)A Soviet weight lifter, Vasily Al exeyev, broke his world record today by pressing 497 pounds during competition in Shakhty, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported. Alexeyev bettered his old record, set last month, by 1 pound 2 ounces.

title: Boycott of Gulf Oil Over Angola Urged By Church Group
description: The two million members of the United Church of Christ have been urged by their so cialpolicy council to boycott Gulf Oil Corporation products as a protest against the corn pany's alleged financial role in Portugal's African colonies.

title: London Hijackers Set Up Traffic Jam To Seize $250,000
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (Reuters) An armed gang hijacked an air line truck carrying $250,000 worth of gold bullion at Hyde Park cornerLondon's busiest traffic junctionat the height of the rush hour tonight, the police said.

title: FISCHER RETAINS LEAD AT MAJORCA
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 3 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles led the field today with one game remaining in the knock out round robin. Fischer, who has held the United States chess championship eight times, had 12 points. Yefim Geller, of the Soviet Union was secH and with 12, and Robert Hueb ner of West Germany third with 11.

title: British Martial Spirit at Sandhurst Isn't Quite What It Used to Be
description: SANDHURST, England, Dec. 3By 7:30 each morning the playing fields of Sandhurst are alive with the sounds of trotting cadets and a drill sergeant's sharp bellow: lef' righ'lef'righ'lef'righ'!

title: Information Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) William F. Gavin, a former speech writer for President Nix on, will replace Eugene Rosen feld as assistant director for public information of the Unit ed States Information Agency, it was announced today. Mr. Rosenfeld will be press officer at the United States Embassy in London, the agency, an nounced.

title: A Change in Economic Policy
description: President Nixon's speech before the National Associ ation of Manufacturers marks a decisive turn in his Administration's economic policies.

title: Chapman, After Week's Illness, Will Resume Driving Tonight
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 4A series of tests having deter mined that ulcers and not gall stones were the cause of John Chapman's recent miseries and that surgery would not be re quired, the 42yearold Toronto born reinsman will resume, driving tomorrow night at Roosevelt Raceway. Chanman. enjoying the most successful season of his 23year career in harness racing, has been inac tive for the last week.

title: Hildegarde Goepp Married in London
description: Miss Hildegarde Wenning Goepp, daughter of Mrs. John Wells Davidson of Princeton, N. J., was mar ried on Nov. 27 in London to Terry Meech, assistant di rector of the Mountview Theatre School of London.

title: 2 HORSES KILLED 1N6FURLONGDASH
description: Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt, recently appointed chairman of the board of the New York Racing Association, saw two of his homebreds visit the win ner's circle at Aqueduct yester day. One of those triumphs came in the feature race, sevenfurlong event for fillies and mares. Cold Comfort, rid den by Ron Turcotte, took this contest by three lengths over Powder Mountain in a front running effort, in 1:23 45. The crowd of 26,462 made her the favorite, and her price was $5.60.

title: MSGR. KRUPAVICIUS, LITHUANIAN LEADER
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP) Msgr. Mykol as Krupavicius, president of the Supreme Lithu anian Liberation Committee, died today in suburban Cicero after a long illness. He was 85 years old.

title: CHAVEZ IS JAILED IN LETTUCE STRIKE
description: SALINAS, Calif., Dec. 4 Cesar Chavez went to jail to day.

title: Mrs. Cross Plans Reunion
description: BERNE, Dec. 4Smiling and relaxed after two telephone calls from her husband, Mrs. Cross said today that she hoped to have a Christmas holiday in Switzerland after a reunion in London with her husband to morrow.

title: Libertarian, Foe of Terrorists
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4Al most from the moment that militant separatists in Que bec kidnapped a British offi cial two months ago, JerOme Choquette, the Justice Minis ter of Quebec Province, has been in the forefront of the continuing fight against po litical terrorists. Mr. Cho quette (his name)

title: Thursday Night Fights
description: TokyoHiroshi Kobayashi, 131 Japan, outpointed Shozo Saijo, 137 Japan, 10.

title: Bomb Suspect Tied to Radical Paper
description: Police sources said yesterday that Sharon Krebs, one of six suspects arrested in an alleged bank bombing plot, had been employed by RAT, the under ground newspaper that closely follows revolutionary move ments.

title: Greenwich Antiques Bazaar Will End Run This Evening
description: The annual Christmas An tiques Bazaar in Old Greenwich, Conn., an event that has not lost its style and charm from its first to the current 13th edi tion, will end its run today with a replenished stock of collecti bles, on sale from 11 A.M. to 6 P.M.

title: Owners Considering Plan For Series Night Games
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 The major leagues rejected plan today to bring all umpires under one roof and took steps to schedule part of next year' s World. Series at night for the first time in baseball history.

title: Music:
description: Those who love Bruckner's music must have had a won derful time in Philharmonic Hall on Thursday evening. Stanislaw Skrowaczewski, starting his stint as guest conductor of the New York Philharmonic, led the orches tra in a performance of the Bruckner Fifth Symphony, all hourplus of it. The Fifth is one of the lessplayed of that composer's nine.

title: NIXON NAMES BOARD OF VENTURE ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) President Nixon announced today the names of 12 directors of the Overseas Private Invest ment Corporation he plans to nominate, starting a public private venture to promote new American investments in de veloping countries. Bradford Mills, 43yearold investment banker from New Jersey, was chosen to be presi dent. Herbert Salzman of New York, now assistant administra tor of the Agency for Inter national Development, was picked as executive vice presi dent.

title: New Plant for Kennecott
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Kennecott Copper Corporation today unveiled its new $8million plant designed to make sulphuric acid from unwanted sulphur dioxide emissions from its smelter stacks. The new unit, the seventh at Kennecott's Utah di vision, can convert 163 tons of sulphur into 500 tons of sul phuric acid daily under opti mum conditions. It forms part of Kennecott's program to re duce smelter emissions caused by treating sulphide copper ores from the company's Bing ham Canyon mine.

title: MARC SILBER PLAYS, SINGS FOLK SONGS
description: The songs that Marc Silber sang in a casual, rambling pro gram on Wednesday evening at the Folklore Center, 321 Avefi nue of the Americas, were an odd mixture of blues, mostly traditional, city songs, mostly his own, and such widely diver gent pop material as I Love You for Sentimental Reasons and Percy Sledge's Take Time to Know Her.

title: Charges Against Principal Withdrawn
description: A Queens school district su perintendent yesterday with drew the charge of criminal trespass he had brought against a principal who came to her school last month in defiance of his order.

title: Met Will Celebrate New Year's Eve With `Perichole
description: The 16th week of the Metro politan Opera season will be highlighted by a revival of Of fenbach's La Perichole in a nonsubscription performance on New Year's Eve. Cyril Ritchard, who staged the production, will return in his familiar part of Don Andres. The title role will

title: White House Explains Poster Child Decision
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The White House said today that other commit ments made it impossible for President Nixon to be photo graphed with a 13yearold child from Wichita, Kan., who appears on a charity fund poster.

title: Pollution Is Laid to Officials
description: LEGNANO, Italy (AP)A magistrate charged four pro vincial governors, 35 mayors, three doctors and several other officials with negligence that led to the pollution of several rivers around nearby Milan.

title: U.S. Crusade on Cancer Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Prominent scientists, philan thropists, businessmen and la bor leaders urged Congress to day to mount a multibillion dollar Federal cancer crusade on the magnitude of the Man hattan project to build the atomic bomb and the Apollo project to put a man on the moon.

title: Enough Oil on the Waters
description: The Government of the United States has justly imposed heavy fines on three major oil companies for negligently polluting the waters of the Gulf of Mexico. It now remains to be seen whether it will deal as drastically with another culprit of the same sort, namely, the Government of the United States.

title: Sex in Old Verona
description: Lord Capulet Stuart Lancaster A group of the worst ac tors and actresses on the planet earth are pawing each other and wallowing around Old Verona in a lascivious, moldy piece of screen cheese called The Sex Life of Ro meo and Juliet, which slunk into town yesterday, leering. To call this thing a porno graphic teaser would be dignify it.

title: Teamsters'
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 4 (AP)A strike by Local 413 of the teamsters union today closed the two daily news papers here, The Columbus Evening Dispatch and The Columbus CitizenJournal.

title: AIR MEETING AGREES ON HIJACK DEFINITION
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 4 (AP) An international conference on air piracy agreed today on a definition of an airplane hi jacker.

title: YOUNG LORDS DECRY LAVONDEATH STUDY
description: The Young Lords charged yesterday that a prisoner of ficially found to have commit ted suicide in the Manhattan House of Detention for Men had instead been murdered by prison guards and that a re port by the Board of Correc tion was a whitewash.

title: Stage:
description: The Workshop of the Play ers Art (W.P.A.) is a perma nent theater with its own company of actors presenting a full season of plays off off Broadway. This year the W.P.A. is in a new home, on the Bowery (between Second and Third Streets). Outside it looks like a shabby store front, but inside it is a com fortable. flexible theater.

title: Condors Down Pros, 117111
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 4 (UPD George Thompson scored 35 points and John Brisker 28 to [lead the Pittsburgh Condors to a 117111 victory tonight over the Memphis Pros.

title: Sequential Bankruptcy Step
description: DOBBS FERRY, N.Y., Dec. (UPI)  Sequential Information Systems, Inc., has filed a peti tion to reorganize under Chap ter XI of the Bankruptcy Act, listing assets of $2.14million and liabilities of $3.49million. The company is engaged in de veloping a solid state microfilm system which will be computer controlled.

title: McGee Leads Golf With 133
description: CORAL SPRINGS, Fla., Dec. 4 (UPI)  Jerry McGee, who learned to play golf on his step father's ninehole course on an Ohio farm, shot a sixunderpar 65 today to take a twostroke lead at the halfway mark in the $125,000 Coral Springs open golf tournament.

title: STUDENTS ASSAIL TRAINING SCHOOLS
description: A score of witnesses told a hearing yesterday how they had enrolled in computer training schools with the promise of gaining highpaying jobs, bor rowed to pay tuition of up to $1,600 and then received only limited instruction before the schools closed.

title: Christmas Ceremony Urged
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 4 (AP) A group of University of New Hampshire students urged Amer icans today to light a candle outdoors at 9 o'clock on Christ mas Eve in a national social and spiritual event, symboliz ing the unity of man. Thomas Flanders of Cambridge, Mass., who acted as spokesman for the students, said the group had sent letters to student leaders at 3,000 colleges and universi ties and 1,300 high schools around the country, inviting everybody to take part in the event.

title: GORE LEADS FIGHT ON FOREIGN LOANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Senator Albert Gore, seeking one last notch on my gun, opened his last stand on the Senate floor today by opposing an Administration bill to in crease United States con tributions to four international financial institutions.

title: ALI, IN LAST DRILL, SPARS 12 ROUNDS
description: True to his style as an orig inal, Muhammad Ali sparred 12 rounds yesterday  only three days before his Madison Square Garden bout with Os car Bonavena on Monday night.

title: Foe Reinforced in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 4 (AP)A Cambodian military spokesman reported today that the Communist command was pouring reinforcements into the Cambodian Government's north ern front.

title: Duran Beats Bogs, Regains Europe Middleweight Title
description: ROME, Dec. 4 (UPI)Carlos Duran of Italy survived butts that opened cuts over both eyes and one in the middle of his forehead tonight to regain the European middleweight ti tle with a 15round decision over Tom Bogs of Denmark.

title: ENEMY TOLL PUT AT 59 IN FOREST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4 (AP)South Vietnamese infantrymen pushed deeper in to the U Minh Forest, 140 miles southwest of Saigon, today and reported 59 Vietcong killed in the first three days of the 7,000 man drive into the enemy stronghold.

title: Specialists in Snake Bite Among Ceylonese Throng
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Dec. 4 (UPI)A team of snakebite specialists were among the greeters gathered at the air port today for the visit of Pope Paul VI.

title: 278 Counselors Walk Oft Job At 3 Juvenile Centers in Bronx
description: Counselors at the city's three juvenile detention centers in the Bronx walked off the job yesterday after a dispute over security against assaults by the children. A union spokes man said that all 278 coun selors had participated in the walkout.

title: The New Plays
description: ODODO, the Negro Ensemble Company's production of a musical by Joseph A. Walker and Dorothy A. Dinroe, got one favorable, one mixed and six nega tive reviews. Clive Barnes:

title: Teaneck Plans Renewal For a Blighted Section
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 5 With some dissenting voices, this welltodo town of 46.000 people in Bergen County is moving slowly toward redevel opment of one of its few run down areas into what it hopes may be a $100million commer cial center.

title: Hartford Teachers End Their Strike
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 5A three week strike of onethird to onehalf of Hartford's 1,700 elementary and high school teachers is over.

title: L.S.U. TROUNCES MISSISSIPPI, 6117

title: Planners to Ask Major Downtown Zoning Change
description: The city's planners have developed a pioneering proposal for using zoning powers in an area of Lower Manhat tan to make office growth bring with it a physically integrated yet spacious working environment.

title: Train With a Floor Show
description: ROLLING down to Miami this winter it will be Pillow Talk. On the return to New York, pas sengers will be watching Thor oughly Modern Millie. That will be the movie program abcard the Seaboard Coast Line's premier daily train, the Florida Special, which starts its 83d sea son on Friday, Dec. 18. It is the only train in the world with a car devoted solely to recreation, and the only one showing movies and color television.

title: ABORTION BAN TOLD AGAIN TO CATHOLICS
description: The 30 Roman Catholic bishops in the state of New York issued a joint pastoral let ter yesterday reaffirming an earlier admonition that the church disowns by immediate excommunication any Catholic who deliberately procures an abortion or helps someone else to do so.

title: BULLS BEATEN, 2814; CLOSE 210 SEASON
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 5The Long Island Bulls suffered three interceptions in the first half today and each led to a touch down as the Indianapolis Cap itols whipped the Bulls, 2814, in the Atlantic Coast Football League season finale for both teams.

title: His Restraint During Visit Is a Surprise to Many
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam is relaxing in Hawaii this weekend at the end of a visit to the United States that, contrary to expec tations, proved to be quiet, lowkey and uneventful.

title: Middlebury Downs Army
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Dec. (AP)  Brian Iggulden scored one goal and assisted on three others today as Middlebury de feated Army 54 in hockey. It was the first victory over the Cadets in a decade.

title: 200 Happy G. I.'s Fly Out On New Vietnam Leaves
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 5The first Freedom Bird flight carrying soldiers home from the war for two weeks left here today with 200 of the happiest men in Indochina.

title: Budget Family Skiing in the Alps
description: THE cable car whispers upward along the sheer face of a moun tain so steep that it seems to rise forever, vanishing into the sky. As the car climbs, the frozen lake below becomes an elongated footprint in a narrow chasm between two broad shoulders of the Alps. The car slips into a terminal suspended over 4,000 feet of nothing but heady mountain air, and we are there: at the ski resort atop Mount Vogel in the northwestern corner of Yugoslavia, near the Italian and Austri an borders.

title: Concert Halls: A Reason for Each

In them have hearts been broken. In them have played Heifetz, Horowitz, Ru binstein, and also Colette Chaim beau, Ejnar Krantz and Bal bina Brainina. You never heard of the last three. But they were going to set the world on fire, and they had talent, and they played, and they were never heard of again. Talent, yes, but not enough talent.

title: OILSPILL MEASURES SAID TO BE LIMITED
description: ROME, Dec. 5It is still not possibile to neutralize all the oil spilled into the sea, and even existing detergents and dispersants can do environ mental harm, according to report prepared by an American oceanographer and made public here.

I., Dec. 5The Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Nancy Marie Brinkerhoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Henry Brinkerhoff Jr. of Levittown, to Joseph Clugston Winkler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Newton Winkler of Garden City. description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Dec. 5The first direct word came today that the West German honorary consul, kidnapped here on Tuesday, was alive and well.

description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 5 (AP)Brig. Gen. Robin Olds, commandant of cadets at the Air Force Academy, will be come the Air Force director of aerospace safety Feb. 1, the academy superintendent, Lieut. Gen. A. P. Clark, announced Monday. General Olds, a World War II and Vietnam flying ace, will he succeeded by Brig. Gen. Walter T. Galligan, now di rector of the Tactical Air Control Center in South Viet nam.
