title: 4 PACERS LISTED IN DRUGGING CASE
description: WESTBURY, L. I, Dec. 5 Four pacers from the stable of Herve Filion, the world's lead ing harness racing driver, were found to have been injected with butazolidin, a painkilling drug, and were ordered scratched at Roosevelt Raceway tonight.

title: Two U.S. Airmen in Vietnam Crash Are Rescued
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 5 (AP)The United States com mand reported today the rescue of two Air Force sergeants, said to be the only survivors among 32 Americans and 12 South Vietnamese aboard a C123 transport that crashed last Sun day near Camranh Bay. The two men, reported to have been taken to a military hospital at Carnranh Bay, were identified as Sgt. Gary Lee Ald redge of Navarro, Calif., and Sgt. Vincent Fairbrother of Riverside, R.I. United States officials said that Sergeant Ald redge was in fair condition with a broken leg and that Ser geant Fairbrother was seriously ill with an infected broken knee.

title: The Pines
description: By December the woodlands have become simplified into winter's pattern, most of the hardwoods leafless and stark, the pines sighing in the wind, green and reassuring even on a raw, dark day. Here and there an oak or a beech rustles, with its tatter of withered leaves still clinging; but it is a dead sound, as dead the rustle of fallen leaves at the roadside. But the pines whisper, live and almost sentient. The nines are alive.

title: Legendermain?
description: The Whitney Museum needs a new manual: Fifty per cent women artists in its Annual! Strikers of Art Worker's Coalition Have equal rights for women as their mission; They'll frisk the works of any suspect lender To catalogue the pieces by their gender, They've snowed the premises with paper strips Echoing the cry from every picket's lips; And uncooked eggs strategically are placed About the galleries with shells effaced, An embryonic symbol to proclaim The rights of female artists to complain. Poor Whitney, founded in full female flush, Today you juggle genes with paint and brush, And borrowing, whether his, or hers, or your loan, Must check the work for balancing of hormone. Your cantilevered structure's neutral stance Is sexless by contemporary chance, You've given pleasure to unmeasured eyes, Not counting sex identity percentagewise. So please take heart whatever the demands, We love you even with unbalanced glands!

title: LEGALIZING OF SALE OF MARIJUANA URGED
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 5 (AP)  A Harvard University Medical School professor has called for the legalization of marijuana for persons over a certain age, to be sold as al cohol is, with a specific po tency so the buyer knows what he is getting. At a Iuncneon on Thursday announcing the publication by Harvard University Press next spring of his book, Marijuana Reconsidered, Dr. Lester Grin spoon said legislation would immediately put an end to to the costs and harmfulness of the present legal approach of enforcing antimarijuana laws.

description: When the rest of New York City was just getting ready last month to buy Thanksgiving turkeys, the residents of Wood side were already walking jauntily along Roosevelt Ave nue, beneath arches of colored Christmas lights and chains of tinsel that joined the elevated with the stores that make up their Fifth Avenue.

title: NEW YORK CITY'S NEEDIEST CASES
description: ON behalf of New York City's needy, The New York Times today opens its fifty ninth annual appeal. On this page and the three that follow are stories symbolic of the sorrow and despair that mark the lives of so many who live in this crowded, hurrying city. These are stories about your neighbors. It is for them, and the hundreds of others whose need is as urgent and whose cases are unwritten, that the appeal is made today. Who are the needy and why do they need your help? They are the elderly who can no longer turn to friends or relatives for help; the children who have been abandoned or suffer the cruelty of neglect; deserted fathers trying to keep a home going; widows who are ill and struggling to keep their families to gether.

title: Poppa Laughs Best
description: CARL REINER'S Where's Poppa? is about a nice, decent, trapped, 35yearold Jewish boy and his ancient, terrible, senile mother, whom he dresses each morning, whose breakfasts he fixes (an orange sliced six ways and cold cereal soaked in Pepsi Cola) and whom he dreams of throwing out a window, scaring to death, or, if all else fails, abandoning in an old people's home, which is a kind of last resort because he specifically promised his late father he wouldn't do that.

title: The Public Be Damned
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Dec. 5Every nation has its nightmare. Britain's is unemployment, Germany's is inflation, and America's is probably Pearl Harbor., The successful attack on that island fortress just 29 years ago ended the ancient assumption that America was immune from military attack from across the seas and established the supremacy of the military in Washing ton for over a quarter of a century.

Connected with this conspiracy are plans to carry out armed bank robberies which the police believe may well in volve murders or attempted murders.

title: How Do We Look to Oh! Calcutta!'?
description: EVERY evening at about 8 o'clock they begin to arrive at the thea ter, milling around under the marquee and in the lobby, look ing at the pictures outside and at them selves in the mirrors:. the audience. There are the limousines and the hordes of taxicabs, the long sparkling dresses and the mink coats, although these become rarer as a show runs onand on. The audience waits to see Oh! Calcutta! and their surface look is much the same as that of any hit show audi ence in New York. In fact, these are the very same people who see all the other shows, the less controversial ones, but there is a distinct difference in these same theatergoers when they are waiting to see Oh! Calcutta!

Why? With all the trash, all the tiresome Junk being shown, how can United Art istsand most of the movie writers and criticsdo this to a fresh, beautifully real ized film, a film with some thing to say?

title: Science
description: Man is not intelligent enough to survive his pres ent crisis. He has built a world so complex, with so many interacting factors, that the human mind can no longer see its way through the maze to discern the ul timate effects of decisions and actions taken today. This is the view of a growing number of scientists. Only with the help of computers, they believe, can we deter mine our course with any assurance as to the conse quences.

title: If You Really Like The Sea People . .

The sea people know that with airplanes one has only to adjust his seat belt, where as aboard an ocean liner one must create a new way of life. They want that. Sea people want the time for dreaming, lounging, luxuriatingand observing the others of this breed in their natural habitat.

description: Children's theater, like baby food, seems flavored more for parents than for children. The parents recognize the taste and while not savoring it them selves feel compelled to force feed it to their youngsters. The problem is that it is more childish theater than theater for children.

description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Dec. Hofstra opened the Colonial Classic tonight with an 8775 triumph over Wilkes. Quinas Brower led the way for the winners with 21 points and 25 rebounds, and Dave Bell scored 18 and added 17 rebounds.

description: WARSAW, Dec. 5Poland has been forced to cut her ex port of meat to half the level of five years ago in an effort to ease shortages at home that have led to protests.

title: A Critic Asks: What Is Taste?
description: pROBABLY the most ter rible thing you can say about a critic is that he has no taste. The most terrible and the most vague. For what is taste, really? De gustibus non est disputandum, the scholastic proverb proclaimed: there is no quarreling about tastes. And ever since almost all critical quarrels have been about matters of taste, which is not surprising when you consider that taste cannot be defined  at least not in a way that would be to every one's taste. But what is sur prising is that so few people should even have tried to de fine it, or attempted to come to grips with the problem. In what follows, I shall make some suggestions about what taste might be with particular reference to dramatic criti cism; if some of my remarks should bear on the question of taste in general, so much the better.

description: SARK, Channel Islands, Dec. 5 (AP)A new mutiny is brew ing on the tiny isle of Sark. The rule of the Dame of Sark, 86 yearold Sibyl Hathaway, is challenged by her son.

title: Mississippi Editor Files Damage Suit Against Magazine
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 5 (AP) A $500,000 libel and damage suit on file in Federal court charges McGraw Hill, Inc., publishers of Business Week magazine, and a tormer aide to Charles Evers, the Negro Mayor of Fayette, with attempting to expose the editor of a weekly newspaper in Fayette to public hatred. ridicule and scorn.

title: Growing Pains In Palm Beach; Growing Pains in Palm Beach
description: pALM BEACH, Fla.  Sometime in the near future, this city, the name of which is synonymous with aristocratic luxury, will have its first supermarket. If such a store had been predicted a few years back, local residents would have considered It as unlikely as Jim Dooley taking his orange juice and moving to Maine.

title: Headliners
description: Debra Jean Sweet, 19, of Madison, Wis., went to the White House with three other young people last week to receive Young American Medals for bravery or public service. Miss Sweet was cited for organizing a 30mile march by 3,000 high school students to raise funds for the impoverished. But the citation was over shadowed by Miss Sweet's aside to President Nixon on his Viet nam policy. As she received the award, she quietly said to Mr. Nixon, Mr. President, I don't believe you're sincere about this award until you get us out of this war. Seemingly startled, Mr. Nixon replied, We're doing the best we can. Miss Sweet, who now works as a social organizer in Chicago, said she would wear the medal because the President said he hoped I'd continue my fine work.

title: Barbara Shaner Fiancee of William Von Klemperer
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Dec. 5Mrs. John McCoy Shaner has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Barbara Elaine Shaner, to William John Von Klemperer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred H. Von Klemperer of Mill Neck, L. I. A March wedding is planned.

title: Rogers Tells Menuhin It Was All a Mistake and Citizenship Is Safe
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Sec retary of State William P. Rogers informed Yehudi Menu hin, the violinist, today that your acceptance of a honorary Swiss citizenship did not place your United States citizenship in jeopardy. Secretary Rogers, who signed a personal letter to Mr. Menu hin minutes after landing at Andrews Air Force Base in Maryland on a flight from Brus sels, thus reversed a prelimi nary finding by the State De partment's passport office. The office had held that the New Yorkborn virtuoso had lost his citizenship for accepting honorary citizenship from two Swiss cantons last April.

title: SEATTLE IS VEXED BY PLANE'S DEFEAT

title: Trade Bill:
description: Thus spoke Representative Paul Findley, Republican of Il linois, during debate last month on the controversial bill that would impose limitations on im ports. The House approved the measure Nov. 19, and now the bill and the swarms of lobbyists representing textiles, shoes and other industries have moved to the Senate. The Senate Finance Committee has finished its delib erations, and as the date for the start of Senate debate, probably around Dec. 14, draws closer, the pressures on both sides are grow ing more intense.

description: MIAMI, Dec. 5Trainer Vinne Blengs spends almost as much time handicapping foot ball games as he does handi capping the races in which his horses run. Today he was wrong in both departments but ended up breaking even.

title: Robertson. Older, Is Helping to Make Alcindor Wiser and Bucks Stronger
description: Somehow, it wasn't the same Oscar Robertson who directed the Milwaukee Bucks against the Knicks last week at Madison Square Garden. The No. 14 that he had worn while scoring 2,973 points in three seasons at the University of Cincin nati and for 10 seasons with the Cincinnati Royals of the National Basketball Associa tion, was being worn by someone else. The Big O was older, heavier, less of a dribbler and more defensive minded.

description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)  A University of Pennsylvania pro fessor asserts that youth be lieves the sexual role is up for negotiation.

title: Not Much News That's the Beauty of It
description: GRAND GUANA CAY, Bahamas Sylvan dropped a dozen eggs and they all broke. There are not many places in the world where that remark would be the principal news of the day, but Grand Guana Cay, an island in the Abaco group of the Bahamas, is one of them. Within an hour or two of the egg dropping incident, most of Guana Cay's 112 inhabitants knew all about it.

description: LONDON, Dec. 5 (AP)Mr. Cross arrived in London tonight for a joyful reunion with his wife.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  Roland Romeo Penney is a member of one of the least exclusive groups in the world; the 50 million Americans who have at some time been arrested. In the case of Mr. Penney, a 20yearold product of a black slum here, the arrest was a mistake. But that did not put him in a unique category either. Almost onequar ter of those who get busted are either released without charge, have the charges dropped or are acquitted.

title: Refuge in Britain Is Taken By Yemen's Former Ruler
description: LONDON, Dec. 5 (AP)One of Britain's newest refugees is the former Imam, or King, of Yemen. Mohamad alBadr, who fled Sana, his capital, in 1962 and spent two years hiding in a mountain cave before cross ing into Saudi Arabia, has taken a house in the country. With him are three of his four wives.

title: About New York
description: Norman Maydit awakens to birds and horns. Norman sleeps in a luxury apartment on York Avenue in the East 60's. For $750 a month he rents three bedrooms and a balcony overlooking an acre of lawn from which dogs and children are banned. His apartment house is built like a fort around the acre of lawn, with intercoms and anterooms and doormen to protect Norman from the Real Majority. The apartment house has recently been purchased by a university, a medical school and a hos pital. They want to evict Norman and the other tenants because they need balconies and bedrooms for the doctors and professors they steal from other universities, medical schools and hospitals. But the tenants in Norman's apart ment house aren't a bunch of welfare clients; they have hired a lawyer. Carter Burden is on their side. They shall not be moved.

description: FORT RILEY, Kan., Dec. 5 (UPI)  Jet flights bringing wounded Vietnam servicemen to Irwin Army Hospital will be forced to land nearly an hour's automobile drive away begin ning Jan. 1.

title: Johnny Cash Pays A Neighborly Visit To 20,000 Fans
description: More than 20,000 footstomp ing, handclapping Johnny Cash, fans filled Madison Square Gar den to give their man enthu siastic support on his appear ance there on Friday night. Mr. Cash also had the support of his wife, June Carter; the off stage presence of his small son, John Carter Cash, whose name was invoked from time to time; the legendary Mother Maybelle Carter and the Carter Family (June's two sisters, Anita and Helen, and a ringer, Robin Hart), the four Statler Brothers, Carl Perkins, and his indefatigable backup trio, the Tennessee Three.

title: An old grad returns to Bayonne High School for his tenth reunion and finds he is
description: WHEN I decided at the last minute to go to my 10th high school reunion, I tried to find the girl whose name was on the invi tation. She wasn't listed in the phone book, so I called somebody with the same last name and asked for help. I don't know a Marie Sestito, said the girl who answered, but I'll ask my motherinlaw, she knows her. told the girl not to go to so much trouble. That's all right, she said. My motherinlaw lives upstairs.

title: Southampton Urges Placing of Farmland in Trust

R., Dec. 5 Representativeelect Herman Badillo announced today the first phase of what he called a reverse Peace Corps to send Puerto Rican professionals and intellectuals to New York City schools to encourage Puerto Rican youths to make the best of their educational opportuni ies.

title: Securities Men Somber

title: `I Escaped From Television
description: I ESCAPED television about four years ago and I am gratefully into movies now. I use the word escaped ad visedly. But don't misunderstand. Television was very good to me. It was a school and a laboratory where a young director could learn the tools and tech niques of film at small risk to himself or his producer. After all, no matter what we did, any of us, the show would be better than 26 minutes of blank screen. Come what may, it would go on the air.

title: Another of Those Conformist Selections of Conformist Art
description: GIVE me a couple of minutes to enter a state of petulance and will list a series of objections to the painting and sculpture in new exhibition of contemporary Japa nese art at the Guggenheim Museum, but first let's say that no show can be all bad when it includes work by an artist who has achieved the impossible.

title: Christmas scenestealer
description: To many Austrians and Germans, a stollen is as much a part of the Christmas scene as Yule logs and evergreens. A stollen is a very special, eminently delicious bread full of good things that smell like Christmasyeast and cin namon and cardamom and mace. Candied fruits and a frosting crowned with pecan halves give texture and add to its goodness. One of America's chief stollen bakers is David Dugan of North Caldwell, N. I., a retired professional baker. He bakes 200 pounds of fruitcake every year for Christmas gifts, but his stollen is reserved for family only. Here is his stollen recipe.

title: Japanese Scale Himalaya
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Dec (Reuters)Japanese climbers have conquered Kangroba, a 22,577foot Himalayan peak, the leader of the expedition saidon return here today.

title: 'WorldFamous Impossibility
description: There, as in all great capitals, people often behave symbolically and try to express the spirit of the place. A visit ing diplomat writes a letter to express gratitude to the anonymous person who discovered his wallet arid returned intact to lost and found. Off Times Square a blind man has been assaulted, his Seeing Eye dog stolen, he is bleed ing and weeping. A cop mutters, This could only happen in New York. Im pulses can be released here which in calmer environments are restrained. On every street people are taught what life is like.

title: This Week's College Basketball
description: By Associated Press

title: Film Catches TransAm Race Strategy
description: The TransAmerican race of last Aug. 16 at Watkins Glen was one of the season's most competitive for the sedans of the MustangCamaroJavelin class. Less than one second separated the six fastest Qualifiers. There were dra

title: Murphy Plans Literal Cleanup
description: Police .Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, who has been deeply engaged in departmen tal reorganization, is now turn ing his attention to such mun dane items as paint and soap as a way of brightening the life of patrolmen.

title: Books That Afford Feasts to the Eye, Profit to the Mind, or Both
description: All art books may be divided into four basic categories: (1) those that are a pleasure to look at, (2) those that are profitable to read, (3) the rare few that afford both pleasure to the eye and profit to the mind, and (4) the great many that afford neither. In sifting through the numerous books on modern art which have been pub lished this season, I shall confine my remarks to a selection of titles that may reasonably be judged to

title: Cremation Gaining Favor in U.S.
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5 After Mildred Harmon's hus band was killed in a boating accident last summer, she de cided to have his body cre mated. It just seemed a lot purer, said Mrs. Harmon, who is 30 years old. I didn't need all of that ritual and all of that sobbing around the gravesite.

title: HARVARD DEFEATS DARTMOUTH, 8978
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. Harvard's basketball team took the lead with 17:46 left in the first half and never relin quished it in registering an 8978 victory over Dartmouth tonight in a key Ivy League opening contest.ITACA, N. Y., Dec. 5  A smaller Cornell quintet over came a 5point Penn State half time lead to defeat the Nittany Lions, 69.59, in the Big Red's opener tonight.NEW HAVEN, Dec. 5Three Yale players scored 21 points or more tonight as the Elis de feated Connecticut, 9480.

title: After Love Story; After Love Story
description: IT would appear that Howard Minsky knew what he was doing when he gave up his plush job at the William Morris Agency to become a movie producer. For his first turn at cinematic bat, he gambled on an orig inal screenplay by Erich Segal called Love Story. Somewhere along the line Segal decided to convert his script into a novel and, as result. Love Story will

title: POPULATION UNIT CALLED FOR AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5  A team of experts in social fields appointed by Secretary General Thant has called for formation by April of a world body to try to con trol the rate of population growth to match the world's ability to feed it.

title: Fun City Revisited: Lindsay Glances Backward
description: After viewing New York City from a helicopter, dur ing the 1966 transit strike, newly elected John V. Lind say pronounced his domain Fun City.

title: CAB NEGOTIATIONS RESUME BRIEFLY
description: Negotiators trying to end the twodayold. taxi strike met briefly yesterday but failed to produce an agreement that would allow the 11,000 cabs affected to cruise the city's streets when the work week starts today.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Yves Saint Laurent Brings on the Mini
description: PARISWomen who resist wearing long skirts can take comfort in the fact that they have a powerful fashion ally Yves Saint Laurent.

title: BIGGER TAX SHARE FOR CITIES URGED
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 6  Repre sentatives of state and local governments asked the Nixon, Administration today to revise its revenue sharing proposal so as to give the cities a larger share.

title: FRED STEWART, 63, OF ACTORS STUDIO
description: Fred Stewart, an actor and director, died Saturday evening at the Actors Studio, 432 West 44th Street. He would have been 64 years old today. His home was in the Whitby Apartments, 325 West 45th Street.

title: BREACH OF ETHICS IS LAID TO POSTE,
description: City Councilman Robert I. Postel has been ruled in viola tion of the municipal code of ethicsthe first such finding against a Councilman in the 10 years that New York has had the code.

title: JAPANESE STUDYING NEW TUNNELING IDEAS
description: TOYKO, Dec. 6 (Reuters) Japanese engineers are experi menting with methods of tun neling through mountains with microwaves and with high pressure water iets.

title: Goodell Sees a Danger To U.S. TwoParty System
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (UN) Senator Charles E. Goodell, Republican of New York, said today that the twoparty sys tern in the United States was in serious danger. He pre dicted that unless the Nixon Administration changed its di rection, there would be a major cleavage within the Republican party.

title: Spain Buys Canadian Plane
description: MADRID, Dec. 6 (UPI)The Spanish Government has or dered two Canadair CL215 waterbomber planes from the Canadian subsidiary of General Dynamics and has taken an option on a third. They will be used for marine fish seeding, agricultural fertilizing and marine patrol.

title: Status of Major Legislation in the House and Senate
Funds Flow Again At Bank in Ecuador
description: QUITO, Ecuador, The Banco de Guayaquil reopened its doors last week after a fivemonth period in which thousands of depositors and top United States banks waited anxiously for their money.

title: New Bus Service to City From L.I. to Begin Today
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 6An effort to keep cars off the crowded highways by provid ing luxury bus service between points in Nassau County and Manhattan during the morning and evening rush hours will start tomorrow.

title: Manoff Agency Shifts Executives
description: Richard K. Manoff, founder of the 14yearold agency that bears his name, has moved up to board chairman and made Hanno Fuchs, president.

title: Tax Districts Planned on Fire Island to Fight Erosion of Dunes
description: HAUPPAUGE, L I., Dec. 6 Fire Island residents may soon obtain financial assistance in their long fight to curb the erosion of the beaches and dunes, which now form a bar rier protecting the Great South Bay.

title: France Takes Tennis Cup
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 6 (Reuters)France cap tured the King's Tennis Cup by defeating Denmark, 21, to night. West Germany finished third after winning a playoff against Italy.

title: Football Records
description: Teams that ended play prior to last Saturday:

title: ISRAEL STILL ASKS PLEDGES BY U.S
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 6Israel's Premier, Mrs. Golda Meir, told her Cabinet today that addi tional clarification of United States commitments would be required from President Nixon before Israel could agree to re sume peace talks with the United Arab Republic.

title: Bond Prices Strong Rise Found Losing Momentum
description: The bond market has leaped ahead so far, so quickly, that some analysts have decided that the greatest rally since World War II may be nearing an end.

title: SUNK IN THE PANAMA CANAL: The Sian Yung, a Chi nese Nationalist freighter in the Cucaracha Reach yester day. A tug and a crane boat are behind superstructure and masts. The 455footlong vessel struck the west bank
Job Corps Deputy Picked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Xavier Mena of San Diego. Calif., as deputy director of the Labor Department's Job Corps was announced today, Dr. Mena, 43 years old, has been States Training and Employ ment Service.

title: FIRE INSURERS ASK 41% RISE IN RATES
description: Hostility between consumers and the insurance industry be cause of.some inability to buy coverage at reasonable ,rates took a turn for the worse last week as thousands of. New York ers facecra rise in fire insurance rates: they may find too hot to handle.

title: 5TH IS MADE MALL FOR ALL TO MARVEL
description: A cold wind blew fiercely down Fifth Avenue yesterday afternoon but Mayor Lindsay and thousands of other people strolled in the middle of the boulevard enjoying the holiday spectacle of lights.

title: SIDNEY J. LO.EB
description: Sidney J. Loeb, a lawyer who retired last December after 60 years practice here, died yes terday in the White Plains Cen ter for Nursing Care after long illness. He was 82 years old and lived at 225 Central Park West.

title: Japanese Farmers March
description: NARITA, Japan, Dec. 6 (AP) About 5,000 farmers, stu dents and other protestors dem onstrated here today against Government plans to construct a new airport to replace To kyo'sH aneda International Air port. The Government says new field is needed to handle increased air traffic.

title: ESPOSITO IS HERO AS BRUINS WIN, 63
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Phil Esposito registered nis th,ird threegoal performance of the season and became the Na tional Hockey League's first 20goal scorer tonight in lead ing the Boston Bruins to. a 63 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: FIRE INJURES FOUR IN OFFICE BUILDING
description: A transformer exploded in basement at 1 Gulf & Western Plaza early yesterday, causing a brief flash fire that injured four persons. Fifteen firemen were treated for smoke inhala tion and exhaustion.

title: FIVE FUMBLES AID 163 LION VICTORY
description: DETROIT, Dec. 6The St. Louis Cardinals fumbled and lost today, adding further life to the race for the National Football League playoffs. The Detroit Lions won a difficult game, 163, the big play being Mel Farr's 28yard touchdown run late in the final period.

title: Bridge
description: The Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss Team Championship at the New York Hilton went into the fourth and final session last night with a group headed by John Solodar of New York In the lead.

title: Staten Island Train Kills Pony Near Pleasant Plains
description: A northbound Staten Island Rapid Transit train struck and killed a pony that was stand ing on the tracks yesterday evening, the police said.

title: MRS. JOHN G. FLINT JR.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 6Mrs. Sue Comegys Flint, the wife of John G. Flint Jr., a management consultant, died today in Greenwich Hospital atfer a long illness. She was 46 years old and lived at 372 Cedar Hill.

title: FAR LEFT APPEAL TO JEWS FEARED
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6  The American Jewish Committee to day sharply attacked Jewish young people within the New Left who allow their non Zionist or antiZionist views to be exploited as a vehicle for antiSemitism and hostility to ward Israel.

title: Frank S. Adams
description: No one at The Times is quite sure when Frank Adams stopped being a temporary employethe status assigned to him when he started as a reporter fresh out of Princeton in 1925but there can be no question at all of the permanence of the Imprint his 45 years of dedi cated service made on the integrity and quality of this newspaper.

title: Mary McCarty Makes a Comeback at Marymary
description: Mary McCarty, the bright eyed, rubberfaced comedi enne who has been missing from New York for all prac tical purposes (i.e., viewing purposes) since Bless You All closed early in 1951, is back and isin more ways than onebigger than ever.

title: Nixon Back in White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House this after noon following a windwhip ped helicopter ride from Camp David where he spent a short weekend devoted in part to watching football on television. A cold wind gusting up to 50 miles an hour buffeted the Marine Corps helicopter as it took off from the Presidential retreat in the Catoctin Moun tains of Maryland.

title: Kenyatta Order Protects Elephant
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 6 Africa's most famous ele phant, Ahmed, who has lived in the forests of Marsabit Mountain in Northern Kenya for many years, is now safe for the rest of his life. Presi dent Jomo Kenyatta has is sued a special protection or der that Ahmed under no circumstances might be hunt ed or harrassed by any per son.

title: Toward the Common Market
description: Britain's third effort in a decade to enter Europe's sixnation Common Market begins to move from the spar ring to the negotiating stage with tomorrow's ministerial meeting in Brussels. The major economic issues are unlikely to yield easily to solution. But a political will to succeed has be come evident on all sides.

title: 34 Scientists Back Nixon In a Defense of the SST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) A group of 34 scientists has endorsed a Nixon Administra lion statement favoring con tinued development: of the su personic transport.

title: BURGER SEES PERIL IN COURT WORK LOAD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (UPI) Chief Justice Warren E. Burger predicted today that the Supreme Court's work will either break down or it will deteriorate in quality before long unless its crushing bur den of rases is shifted to other courts.

title: Miss Rosmarin, Gilbert Joseph Married on L.I.
description: MUTTONTOWN, L.I., Dec. 6Miss Ghislaine Rosmarin of Melbourne, Australia, was married here this afternoon to Gilbert Michael Joseph, a law student at Harvard Uni versity. The couple met last year in Melbourne, where the bridegroom was attending Monash University as a Ful bright scholar.

title: French Radical Party Asks End Of State Rule Over Local Life
description: PARIS, Dec. 6The Radicals went on record today as the first French political party to favor breaking the party power of the state over France's local and regional life.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: tional broadcast TV added 6.9 million.

title: City Recounts Efforts to Help Retailers
description: The New York City Ad ministration hasn't deserted the leading merchants here but would like to see a more positive attitude on the stores part, which would support the city's efforts to stimulate retail activity.

title: Drilling Process Being Tried To Curb Oil Fires in Gulf
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. (UPI)Two drill bits cut into the soft bottom 55 feet below the surface of the Gulf of Mexico today toward two oil wells burning out of control on the Shell Oil Company's Baker drilling platform.

title: Burgos Court: Stage for Basque Cause
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 6 You have told us about tor ture, Mr. Abrisqueta, thun dered Juan Maria Bandres, one of the defense lawyers at the courtmartial of mem bers of ETA, the Basque guer rilla group. Now tell us: If you were Francisco Izco, and under this kind of treatment, would you have admitted killing Inspector Manzanas?

title: Personal Finance: Holiday Bonuses
description: Quite a few business con cerns are omitting or trim ming their Christmas bonuses this year because of the re cession. Wall Street, which has been wrestling with a big bear, is practically a dis aster area for bonuses.

title: Warsaw Pact Rift
description: Poland's leaders intend to make a major occasion out of today's Warsaw signing of the PolishWest German goodwill treaty, which contains Bonn's acceptance of the OderNeisse line as the western frontier of Poland. Chan cellor Willy Brandt has journeyed to Warsaw to par ticipate in the signing ceremony as an act of reconcilia tion. But there can be little doubt that East German boss Walter Ulbricht takes a dim view of today's event, as well as of the general trend of which improved Warsaw Bonn relations are but one part.

title: POLES DUE TO LET GERMANS MIGRATE
description: WARSAW, Dec. 6Poland is expected to begin next month] to fulfill a diplomatic promise she made to West Germany that tens of thousands of ethnic Germans still living in Poland would be permitted to emigrate.

title: Riggs Bows in Final
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 6 (AP) Tom Brown of San Francisco beat Bobby Riggs of Plandome, L.I., 63, 57, 61, for the na tional senior hardcourt tennis championship today.

title: Census vs. Gerrymander
description: The census is a report on the pattern which the natural tides of population have created. The gerry mander is the politician's effort to rearrange that pattern as cleverly as he can for the benefit of his party.

title: Memoir Says Khrushchev Signed Purge Death Orders
description: Nikita S. Khruschchev con cedes, in reminiscences attrib uted to him by Life magazine, that he joined in signing orders for the execution of leading victims of Stalin's purges after World War II.

title: Fire Union Warns of Job Action When Pact Ends
description: The president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association warned yesterday that there would be a job action by the city's 11,300 firemen if they did not have a satisfactory new con tract when their present one ex pired Dec. 31.

title: The Path of the Dodo
description: It is authoritatively estimated that in the present cen tury an average of one animal species or subspecies year has gone into oblivion, never to be seen again on this planet. Only in the past few years have more than handful of conservationists been awake to the sad and costly losses the world has suffered in the disappearance of the passenger pigeon, the moa, the giant ground sloth, the dodo and the prairie wolf, among so many others.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Hughes's Home Searched On Suspicion of a Felony
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 6A sheriff's party searched Howard Hughes's vacant penthouse at the Desert Inn here today on the suspicion that a felony had been committed there. The of ficers found nothing.

title: Athletes Today Are Turning In Blue Jeans for Peacock Feathers
description: One of the most noticeable things about the peacock revolution in men's fashion has been its effect on the pro fessional athlete. Formerly one of the world's worst dressed men, he now seems to be among the most fashion able.

title: Murray State Rifle Victor
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Dec. (AP)  Murray State of Ken tucky won two team titles for the second straight year at the

title: For Quebec Radicals, No Gains
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 6With the release of James R. Cross, the British diplomat held for two months in a suburban Montreal hideout, the radical Quebec separatists latest and boldest terrorist tactic has failed.

title: GermanHungarians Win,Gain State Final for Challenge Cup
description: Louis Karbiener's goal gave the GermanHungarians a 10 victory over the GreekAmeri cans yesterday at Metropolitan Oval in Queens. The Knitters also gained the New York final for the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer.

title: SEN. JACKSON URGES LONG VIETNAM TRUCE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, rec ommended today that the United States propose a truce in Vietnam from Christmas through late January to help reach a permanent ceasefire. The proposal won prompt sup port from the Nixon Admini stration.

title: BUILDUP IN STEEL SET FOR FEBRUARY
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 6  The physical buildup of steel inven tory will probably start in Feb ruary of next year.

title: ELECTRICAL WORKERS SLOW PACE IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Monday Dec. 7 (Reuters)Electricity workers began a work slowdown today that could deprive families of heat and light over the Christ mas period.

title: Anniversaries
description: AUERBACHKarl and Mariryn, Happy fifth anniversary to my wonderful husband. Love is you. Your loving, devoted and proud wife Marilyn.

title: Wells Heroin Final Reel Of Oakland's Late Show
description: Don't give up, Daryle Lamonica said in the huddle, and he said it directly to Warren Wells, his 27year old wide receiver, who had dropped five passes earlier in the game and caught one for a touchdown.

title: LAKELAND IS NAMED PENNSAUKEN'S BEST
description: PENNSAUKEN, N. J., Dec. S  Ch. Special Edition, Lakeland terrier owned by Mr. and Mrs. James A. Farrell Jr. of Darien, Conn., took best inshow honors today at the 38th annual Camden County Kennel Club competition. There were 1.222 dogs entered.

title: Homage to Adam Clayton Powell
description: When Congress convenes in January, Adam Clayton Powell Jr. will not be there and his absence will scarcely be noticed, if at all. Such is the fate of politicians. Most seem to exist only in newspaper headlines and when those headlines are not there to remind us (and them?) of their existences, they are quickly forgotten.

title: ConflictofInterest Controversy Swirls in Nation's Largest Scientific Group
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg, Nobel prize winning chemist, codiscoverer of plutonium and chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission, is almost assured of election this week to the presidency of the world's largest scientific group, the American Associa tion for the Advancement of Science.

title: RED CROSS FOCUS IS PUT ON PEKING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6Communist China, but not Nationalist China; has been invited to a major internation al conference to modernize the 1949 Geneva Conventions on the protection of human rights during war.

title: BRANDY IN POLAND, SIGNS PACT TODAY FOR NORMAL TIES
description: WARSAW, Dec. 6Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany, arrived here tonight to sign treaty opening normal relations with Poland.

title: White House Plans Report On Lithuanian Sailor Case
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (Reu ters)  The White House plans to issue a report early this week on the Administration's investi gation of the denial of asylum to a defecting Lithuanian sea man.

title: Week's Votes In Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Fol lowing are the votes of delega tions from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended Dec. 5.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 7, 1970

title: Dr. Samuel A. Dreyer, Led State Pharmaceutical Group
description: PELHAM, N.Y., Dec. 6Dr. Samuel A. Dreyer, a retired pharmacist, died today in the Northfield Manor Nursing Home in West Orange, N.J. He was 81 years old and lived at 87 Wolfs Lane.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: The Trade Reverberations
description: BRUSSELS  The builders of post war Western Europe used to say, as their continent revived in strength and unity, that in gratitude they really ought to erect a statue of Stalin. The point of the joke was of course that Soviet intransigence had spurred the Marshall Plan, the North Atlantic Treaty and the beginnings of collabor ation in Western Europe.

title: O'Rourke Offers to Cut Election Costs
description: Maurice J. O'Rourke, presi dent of the Board of Elections, plans to ask the board to make operation changes that could save $1.5million a year.

title: Bombs Fail to Dent Hanoi
description: PARISThe November 21 bomb ings were not a surprise in Hanoi. The commotion aroused in Washington by the downing of an American plane on the 13th had given the impression that something serious was in the offing.

title: Excerpts From Memoir on Events Before DeStalinization Speech
description: Following is an account of the, circumstances leading up to Nikita S. Khrushchev's secret deStalinization speech, at the 20th congress of the Soviet Communist party in 1956 excerpted from the reminiscences attributed to him by Life magazine:

title: Bahamians Hoping Hughes, the Man Upstairs, Will Pay the Bills
description: PARADISE ISLAND, The Ba hamas, Dec. 6In the casino, after a loss, the croupiers and the bettors joke back and forth across the gaming tables that there's really nothing to worry about because the man up stairs will pay the bills.

title: White House Tree Toppled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The White House Christmas tree was blown down today by wind gusts clocked at 54 miles an hour. The 78foot spruce is to be lighted in a traditional ceremony scheduled for Dec. 16 and officials could not say today whether the ceremony would be delayed.

title: Cougars Newmark Stars As Nets Are Beaten, 9490
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 6Dave Newmark, former Columbia star, left the bench in the last quarter tonight to score 10 points and lead the Carolina Cougars to a 9490 American Basketball Associa tion victory over the New York Nets.

title: Communal Living Here Lures the Untied but Lonely
description: Roommates, said Richie a gentle, gaunt 25yearold bookstore clerk with a full black beard, are like sepa rate units. There's no com mon goal, whereas in a commune there's a cohe sion.

title: Big Board's Female Pages Take Up Slack
description: When Janet Tanga reached home last Wednesday after her first day on the trading floor of The New York Stock Exchange, her mother said, Women's liberation, that's what it is.

title: Sheila H.WoodIs Wed To Richard Schwartz
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Dec. The marriage of Miss Sheila Hunter Wood to Richard J. Schwartz, presi dent and chief executive of ficer of Jonathan Logan, Inc., the nation's largest manufacturer of women's ap parel, took place here today.

title: Hunger in America
description: One of the present Administration's hallmarks has been a timid unwillingness to fight for the enactment some of the best of its domestic proposals, such as reform of the food program.

title: Burma Makes Road Switch
description: RANGOON, Burma, Dec. (Reuters)Burma switched to driving on the right shand side of the road today after four months of careful pre paration and training. Traffic moved slowly at first in Ran goons's crowded streets. No accidents were reported in the first few hours of the transi tion.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE RISING SUN.. The Decline and Fall of the Japanese Empire, 19361945. By John Toland. 954 pages. Random House. $12.95.

title: Boston Colleze Tuition Rise
description: NEWTON, Mass., Dec. 6 (AP) The board of directors of Boston College announced to day a decision to increase tui tion for all undergraduate schools by $260 and place

title: Texas, Ohio State Are CoChampions In Football Voting
description: Texas and Ohio State, each beaten, were named cowinners of the MacArthur Bowl yester day as the top college football teams in the country.

title: Bombing in Cambodia Reported
description: SOUTH VIETNAM, Dec. 6 (AP)A United States military spokesman said that the Strate gic Air Command sent B52 bombers over Cambodia today to prevent North Vietnamese war supplies from reaching units that are pressing a major offensive on Cambodia's em battled northern front.

title: Shot Hits Actor's Apartment
description: An unknown assailant fired a gun shot yesterday through the window of Elmore (Rip) Torn, movie and OffBroadway actor, but there were no in juries. The shot Went through Mr. Torres thirdfloor window at 435 West 22d St., at about 1:15 P.M. The actor has been active in the current OffBroad way theater strike.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Evaluating Use of Airpower in Vietnam

title: Yiddish Musical Shifts Time
description: Light,, Lively. & Yiddish,. the new musical starring Ben Bonus at the Belasco Theater, moves up its curtain time start.; ing today to 7:30 P.M., almost a month ahead of the rest of Broadway, which goes to the earlier starting time on Jan. 4.

title: CHANGES FAVORED IN STOCK HANDLING
description: Important procedural changes in the handling of certain de liveries of securities in Wall Street have been rcommended in a discussion paper issued by a task force of the Banking and Securities Industry Committee (BASIC).

title: A $3.9Million Suit Is Filed in Mercury Poisoning
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Dec. 6A $3,925,000 suit has been filed in Albuquerque in behalf of the Ernest Lee Huckleby family of Alamogordo, stricken with mercury poisoning in Sep tember, 1969.

title: Audi SquashRacquets Victor
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 6 Al Audi of the Heights Casinc won the Montclair invitation squashracquets Class B tourna ment today by defeating Quen tin Hyder of the New York Ath letic Club, 15.13, 615, 1510, 157.

title: HOFSTRA WINS, 6057, IN TOURNEY'S FINAL
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Dec. Hofstra won the Colonia clas sic today by defeating South ampton, 6057. Dave Bell paced the Dutchmen with 16 points and led all rebounders with 15.

title: Siegel Tennis Victor
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 6Steve Siegel of Tean eck, N.J., won the Nassau indoor tennis championship today by defeating King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, 06, 63, 64, in the final at the Hempstead Lakes Indoor Tennis center.

title: Elizabeth Millis Shires Is Bride Of Ens. Walter Terry Maguire
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. Miss Elizabeth Minis Shires and Ens. Walter Terry Ma guire of the Coast Guard were married here this after noon in St. John's Chapel of the Episcopal Theological School. The bride's father, the Rev. Dr. Henry M. Shires, the school's professor of the New Testament performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. John Crocker Jr.

title: One Trade Group Asked For Securities Industry
description: The public has lost confi dence in the securities business. Young men are not eager to work in the brokerage business any more. Many securities firms fail to regulate them selVes properly. Every time one problem is solved, two seem to pop up to take its place. This is the current state of the securities business, accord ing to Wheelock Whitney, new president of the Investment Bankers Association, largest trade organization in the field.

title: Redskins 3d Victimin Row For Surging Dallas Team
description: DALLAS, Dec. 6The Dallas Cowboys; supposedly headed for their last roundup., three weeks ago, suddenly were back in the saddle today and chal lenging for their first pro foot ball championship.

title: BLACKS IN ILLINOIS MARCH PAST GUNS
description: CAIRO. Ill., Dec. 6Under the green plastic tinsel and gOld Christmas stars strung above Commercial Avenue, the people marched past the busi ness district's parking meters decorated with red and white stripes and red bows.

title: AntiChavez Pickets Boo Mrs. Robert Kennedy
description: SALINAS, Calif., Dec. 6 (UPI) Nearly 3,000 MexicanAmeri can farm workers held a can dlelight mass tonight outside the jail where Cesar Chavez, director of the United Farm Workers Organizing Commit tee. is being held.

title: REV. JOHN A. M'NULTY
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 6  The Rev. John Archibald McNulty, a retired Episcopal clergyman, died yesterday in Hartford Hos1 pital. He was 87 years old and lived at 285 Ridge Road in Wethersfield. Mr. McNutly at tended City College in New York and Columbia and was awarded a divinity degree at Union Theological Seminary.

title: Tax Leaflets Fall on Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 7 (AP)  The South Vietnamese Government introduced today a new tax law. A small airplane dropped thousands of leaflets on down town Saigon saying the tax men were beginning houseto house calls to help taxpayers fill out their forms.

title: Lynn Reegen Bride Of John A. Anfanger
description: Miss Lynn Reegen and John A. Anfanger were married here yesterday afternoon at the Carlyle by Algernon Black, leader of the Ethical Culture Society.

title: Warmth and Dash Mark St. Paul Chamber Group
description: As trained and led by Leo pold Sipe, the Minnesota group played with enthusiasm, warmth and, especially, with most satisfying accuracy of rhythm. There was assurance to everything it did, and nice sense of dash.

title: NO COST CUT SEEN IN TREATY ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6High Administration officials do not expect significant cutbacks in the Defense Department's $8 billionayear budget for stra tegic arms as a result of any arms limitation agreement that may he signed with the Soviet Union.

title: RICKEL QUESTIONS 70 G.O.P. TACTICS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Wal ter J. Hickel, who was dis missed last month as Secretary of the Interior, strongly implied today that he would not cam paign for President Nixon in 1972 if the Republican atti tude was the same as in this Year's Congressional elections.

title: Russian Ends Swedish Visit
description: STOCKHOLM. Dec. 6 (Reu ters)Defense Minister Andrei A. Grechko flew home to the Soviet Union today after fourday official visit to Swed en that included political and military talks on Central Euro pean and SovietSwedish mat ters.

title: Garrett Cards 69 for 272 and Posts First Pro Victory
description: CORAL SPRINGS, Fla., Dec. 6 (AP)Bill Garrett, who had never even oome close to win ning before, shot a twounder par 69 today and won the $25, 000 first prize In the Coral Springs open golf tournament.

title: Pope Describes Attack As the Act of a Madman
description: Dec. 6Pope Paul VI, in his first address since his return from Asia and Austra lia, thanked God today for having saved him from an assassination attempt in Manila.

title: WARNING BY PHONE LINKS SABOTEURS TO JERSEY BLAST
description: LINDEN, N. J., Dec. 6Mayor John T. Gregorio made public today a tape of a drawled telephone warning that the Humble oil refinery here would burn, baby, burnreceived by the police less than two hours before last night's mas sive explosion and fire.

title: Television
description: Harvey Korman and Don Rickles do a parody of Sesame Street on The Carol Burnett Show, Ch. 2, .10 P.M.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: 125,775 See Games Here

title: Yale Gets $17,265,000 in Two Alumni Gifts
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 6Yale University, one of the many educational institutions facing a major financial crisis, re ceived help today in the form of a $15,348,000 gift from the estate of one alumnus and $1,917,000 gift from another alumnus.

title: White House Moderates Expect Good Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 The White House, which may have learned more of a les son than it admits from the 1970 Congressional elections, is now preparing to place emphasis on progressive legislation next year as a means of convincing the bluecollar American that

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: California Legal Aid Program Faces Threat of a Reagan Veto
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 Gov. Ronald Regan is threat ening to veto funds for Cali fornia Rural Legal Assistance, considered one of the most successful legal assistance pro grams in the country.

title: Staten Island Is Shaken By Blast's Shock Waves
description: Frank Palizzotto, the mana ger of the SayOn Drugs dis count center at the Forest Ave nue Shoppers Market in Port Richmond, Staten Island, closed up at 10:15 Saturday night after what had been a partic ularly busy evening.

title: All Shooting for a Knockout in Battle With Bonavena in Garden Tonight
description: Eager to accomplish what Joe Frazier could not, Muham mad Ali will be trying for an impressive knockout of Oscar Bonavena tonight in their scheduled 15round heavy weight bout at Madison Square Garden before a sellout audi ence of 19,000.

title: Pro Football: Chiefs, 49ers Cling to Shares of Leads
description: While phrasemakers have been busy labeling the Kansas City offense as the offense of the 70's, the Chiefs pass defense has quietly been making a name for itself.

title: Van Heusen Unit Appoints
description: Windbreaker, In., a division of the PhillipsVan Heusen Cor poration, has announced the ap pointment of V. Jerome Kaplan as president. He succeeds Leon ard Jaffe who assumes the new ly created position of chairman of the board.

title: Giants Win and Trail by Half a Game as Cards Lose
description: Bestirring themselves in the second half after showing several ways of turning success into failure, the New York Giants defeated the Buffalo Bills, 206, at Yankee Stadium yesterday and projected them selves into the crowded race for the National Football League championship.

title: HEARING ON WPIX IN CAPITAL TODAY
description: The Federal Communications Commission hearings into the news practices of WPIXTV, Channel 11, will reconvene this morning in Washington. The re sumption of the first phase of the challenge to WPIX's broad cast license follows 42 days of hearings here, which were re cessed Nov. 13.

title: Finns Devaluation Stabilizes Economy
description: HELSINKIA devaluation, followed up by a rigprously en forced incomes policy, has helped this small northern country achieve what larger states are seeking: full employ merit combined with price sta bility.

title: REPORT ON MISSILES DENIED BY PENTAGON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Pentagon officially denied today a report in The New York Times this morning that the Air Force had begun an effort to in crease protection of Minuteman missiles against possible attack.

title: Six Children Killed in Fire
description: NEW ALBANY, Ind., Dec. 6 (UPI)Six children died today, when a fire swept an apart ment during the predawn hours In this southern Indiana town. Three children of Mr. and Mrs. Knowland and three of the Kenneth Edwards family were trapped inside the burn ing building.

title: Brandt Hails Treaty
description: BONN, Dec. 6Before board ing his plane to Warsaw this afternoon, Chancellor Brandt declared that the PolishGerman treaty he is to sign tomorrow is an end and a beginning.

title: Sir Alec Lends His Home In the Country to Crosses
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (AP)The British diplomat James R. Cross, reunited with his family after two months as a hostage of Quebec extremists, spent quietday today at the country residence of Sir Alec Douglas Home, the British Foreign Sec retary.

title: LESTER STONE
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 6 Lester Stone, a New York lawyer, died today of cancer in the White Plains Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 255 Garth Road.

title: Class 44: A Rule Is Bent to Give Shaun a Chance
description: At the start of the third week of school this fall the children of Class 4.4 were told by Miss Dorothy Boroughs, their teacher, that a new stu dent was about to join them. His name was Shaun Shep pard and, as the teacher ex piained it, he was really in the fifth grade but was going to remain in their class.

title: SEARCH FOR LAWYER IN TATE TRIAL ENDS
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 6 (UPI)  An air search for the miss ing Tate trial defense attorney was abandoned today. A sub stitute lawyer was due in court tomorrow.

title: Two Israeli Planes Lost
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 6Two Israeli civilian aircraft were re portedly lost during the week end. A pilot and three passen gers were killed when one plane, chartered by a business man, crashed in the hills of Hebron this afternoon. Ye,.ter day a plane disappeared while on a cloudseeding operation over western Galilee.

title: Churchmen Debate What the Pope's Trip Achieved
description: ROME, Dec. 6Pope Paul VI, tanned and apparently re covered from travel fatigue, publicly reminisced in a noon day address today about his apostolic pilgrimage to East Asia, Samoa, Australia and Ceylon.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The curtains of the motel room are drawn against the early afternoon, but sunlight leaks In from the corners of the window. Two watercolor paintings are propped against unlit lamps. One of them, dated Dec. 4, shows Muhammad Ali, arms raised In triumph, standing In the center of the ring over Oscar Bonavena, who is flat on his back. There is blood above and below Bonavena's left eye, and blood on Ali's white trunks. Above them is sign: Round 9. This is the latest in a series of predictions that Ali paints for LeRoy Neiman, the artist. The other watercolor is dated Dec. 6. It was painted yesterday morning. A brown dirt road meanders up through a bold yellow desert, becomes a bridge over a dark blue river,

title: Menuhin Conducts as Son, a Pianist, Bows Here
description: Until now, the only image likely to have been stirred by the phrase Menuhin Plays Beethoven Concerto was that of the great Yehudi locked in familiarly ardent embrace of the violin masterwork. Since Sunday afternoon's American Symphony Orchestra concert at Philharmonic Hall, however, the picture must be expanded to take in another Menuhin, Jeremy, who made his Ameri can debut under his father's baton in Beethoven's Piano Concerto No. 3 in C minor.

title: Randers Down Canucks, 41, to Stay Unbeaten at Home
description: In time, the Vancouver Ca nucks may learn to start a line rush that can travel 90 feet withbut being broken up. But last night, in the first game of their rivalry with the Rangers, they proved only that they could fight as the New Yorkers overwhelmed them; 41.

title: Advertising: Vick Reassigning 2 Products
description: Vick Chemical's quietly made decision to balance its agency assignments has turned out to be very nice for Baten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, which on March 1 will take over Vicks Formula 44 Cough Syrup and Discs. The two products are backed by about $4million in TV advertising, most of it in network.

title: Synagogue Council Appoints Black Jew an Executive
description: The Synagogue Council of America, a coordinating organ ization for the three branches of Judaism, announced last night the appointment of Robert Coleman as director of its newly established Division of Social Justice.

title: $386,958 In as Fund for Neediest Opens
description: The 59th annual appeal for the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund opened yesterday with $386,958.60 already on hand from early gifts by 264 contributors.

title: College Presidents Group Rejects Nonprofit Tax Plan
description: STONE MOUNTAIN, Ga., Dec. 6 (AP)The American As sociation of Presidents of Inde pendent Colleges and Universi ties rejected today a proposal to incorporate as a nonprofit organization and criticized Con gress for its 1969 Tax Reform Act.

title: Dr. Pincus Stahl, 74, Dies; Physician and Psychiatrist
description: Dr. Pincus A. Stahl, a phy sician and psychiatrist who practiced at 1703 Vyse Avenue in the Bronx for more than 40 years, died yesterday in Miami, where he had continued prac tice since moving there. He was 74 years old.

title: Tank Truck Drivers Strike in Midwest; 13 States Affected
description: DETROIT, Dec. 6 (UPI) About 5,000 tank truck drivers in 13 states walked off their jobs today. As a result the Mid dle West faced a possible early shortage of gasoline and fuel.

title: The Cosmopolitan Cuisine in Nairobi Runs From Artichokes to Zabaglione
description: NAIROBI, KenyaThe tall, skinny kid sitting at the next table asks to shake my hand. Then he adds he is a student from Tanzania. He is one of 48 children, he explains, and his father, a village chief, has nine wives.

title: Chief Cheers N.B.C. Staff on Future
description: Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Com pany, will circulate today an in teroffice memorandum decrying suggestions that commercial TV is a oncepowerful institu tion that has passed its prime and is on the way downand out.

title: A Mock Trial Here On Housing Crimes Censures Lindsay
description: Mayor Lindsay and other city officials were censured in absentia yesterday at a forum that was billed as a housing crimes trial at Columbia Uni versity.

title: HANKER WARNS OF SCHOOL STRIKE
description: The president of the United Federation of Teachers warned yesterday of the possibility of a strike by the city's 60,000 public school teachers if the Chancellor of schools persisted in his illegal efforts to change procedures in the school system.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: London: On Contemporary Relevance
description: LONDONSome months ago, Joan Littlewood an nounced her intention of staging a documentary com edy, at her newly reacquired Theater Royal in London's East End, inspired by the Ronan Point disaster.

title: NOTEBOOK SEIZURE IRRITATES POLICE
description: Policemen who refused to go out on patrol on the East Side last Friday were reported yes terday to be angry because, among other things, investi gators entered the 19th Pre cinct station house one night and seized their memo books part of every patrolman's re quired equipment.

title: Adair Tops Reese in 5 Sets Of SquashRacquets Final
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., Dec. 6 Colin Adair of Montreal, the 1968 winner, prevailed over John R. Reese of New York in the fivegame final today of the 39th gold racquet squash singles tournament at the Rock away Hunting Club.

title: Globetrotters Draw Full Crowd of 19,500 at Garden
description: The Harlem Globetrotters, playing a combination of bril liant and zany basketball for the 45th consecutive year, paid their first visit to Madi son Square Garden in more than two years yesterday. An appreciative capacity crowd of 19,500the second largest indoor group the Trot ters have ever played to

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The following is a list loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Bullets Sink Royals, 126118, as Monroe, Loughery Excel
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 6 (UPI) Earl Monroe and Kevin Loughery combined for 55 points as the Baltimore Bullets stretched their Central Division lead to 51/2 games tonight with a 126118 victory over the Cincinnati Royals.

title: Boussac, 81, Hands Over Reins Of His French Textile Empire
description: PARIS, Dec. 6Marcel Bous sac, whose textile empire has made him one of France's wealthiest men, announced to day that he was withdrawing form active management of it for reasons of health.

title: RETURN OF CASEY BUOYS KENTUCKY
description: The 1969 midsummer auto mobile accident that seriously injured Mike Casey's leg was all a bad dream Saturday night for the fun  loving Kentucky backcourt man.

title: Lefkowitz to Investigate Insurance Sale Abuses
description: The hearing will examine complaints that working wi dows or young working couples cannot obtain homeowner poli cies in many eases, or that families are unable to renew automobile insurance when children become old enough to obtain drivers licenses. It will begin at 10 A.M. Friday in 80 Center Street.

title: Soviet Intelligence Role In Latin America Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 United States intelligence spe cialists are disturbed by what they regard as a steady in crease in the number and quality of Soviet agents in Latin America.

title: Foe in Cambodia Said to Raid Military Headquarters on Mekong
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 6 (Reuters)A Cambodian mili tary spokesman said tonight that the military district head quarters at Peam Chikang, on the northern bank of the Me kong River about 40 miles northeast of the capital, was under attack. A spokesman said air strikes had been called dur ing the battle.

title: Chess
description: In the first round of the Palma, Majorca, interzonal, knockout round robin quali fying tournament for the world challengers match Bobby Fischer of California clashed with the 22yearold West German star, Robert Huebner. Playing Black, the German moved . . . PQB3 in .reply to the American's 1 PK4 and established the CaroKann Defense

title: F.C.C. Investigates Campaign Activities of Radio Station Owner
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Un der pressure from the House Commerce Committee; the Federal Communications Com mission has ordered an investi gation into the activities of Don W. Burden.

title: Sculler on New Course
description: The newlyelected presi dent of the Amateur Athletic Union has some thoughts about the concept of ama teurism that may prove up setting to the organization's old guard.

title: HARTFORD TEACHERS WILL GO BACK TODAY
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 6 (UPI) Members of the Hartford Fed eration of Teachers will return to classes tomorrow and end threeweek strike against the city's public school system.

title: Gallico Manuscripts Are Gift to Columbia
description: Paul Gallico, the novelist, has donated his literary papers to, Columbia Univer sity. The collection embraces more than 10,000 manu scripts, research notes and papers, among them his early sports columns for The New York Daily News and the original copy of Mrs. Arris Goes to Paris, Thoma sina, The Snow Goose and The Poseidon Adven ture.

title: Charles Goldstein, 67, Dies; Distributor of Newspapers
description: Charles Goldstein, who was in the newspaper distribution field, died Saturday night after a short illness at Trafalgar Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived on East 17th Street, Brooklyn

title: Protest Held on French Fire
description: ST. LAURENT DU PONT, France, Dec. 6 (Reuters) About 250 relatives and friends of the 146 young people killed in a dance hall fire here Nov. 1 demonstrated here today to de mand a thorough inquiry Into responsibility for the disaster.

title: Soviet Ship Not Damaged By Bombing in Australia
description: FREMANTLE, Australia, Monday, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Ex plosives were thrown onto the deck of a Soviet motor vessel moored in the harbor here to day. Damage to the 9,150ton, ship, the Novgorod, was slight and no one was injured.

title: Vibrant Ballets Africains End Program With Explosive Shill
description: It drove some of the audience out of the theater confused and muttering, but the vast majority, which persevered, was rewarded. In the second half of the company unleached the mixture of exuberant, dancing and explosive drum ming that is its hallmark.

title: CURB ON ABORTIONS OPPOSED BY CHASE
description: The city's Health Services Administrator, Gordon Chase, said yesterday that it was pre mature to consider restricting abortions here under the state's new abortion law that went into effect only four months ago.

title: NASA MAY REPEAT TELESCOPE SHOT
description: The space agency will review this week proposals for a new telescope satellite to replace the one that was destroyed week ago when its rocket failed to reach orbit around the earth.

title: Indians Hail Return of Sacred Lake
description: TAOS, N. M., Dec. 6The little river that runs between the two ancient Indian pueb los was almost choked off with ice as blanketwrapped men and women moved through the frigid morning air toward church.

title: Jones Rides Spring Board To Victory at Horse Show
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Dec.  Doug Jones rode Spring Board to the intermediate jumper championship today after a close contest with the Wisefield Jewelers Diamond Cutter at the Thomas School of Horsemanship horse show.

title: CITY BUSES EMIT FEW POLLUTANTS
description: The New York City Transit Authority prides itself on hav ing buses that emit no visible smoke and few pollutants, yet it is spending close to half a million dollars a year to reduce pollution even further.

title: Adoption Agencies Report Shortage of White Infants
description: Adoption agencies across the country report a recent sharp drop in the number of white infants being placed for adoption.

title: LYNCH'S POSITION BELIEVED STRONG
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 6Despite public skepticism over the need for emergency measures, Prime Minister John Lynch appears to have the political strength to sustain his crackdown on an alleged kidnapping conspiracy.

title: Pakistani Election Politics Mix Public Relations With Religion
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 5 Two days before Pakistan's most important election, no tele phone rings in the multicolored tent that is the thirdward head quarters of one of Karachi's leading slates. There is no tele phone.

title: China Accuses U.S. of Acts Of Aggression in Korea
description: HONG KONG, Monday, Dec. 7 (Reuters)China today ac cused the United States of three separate acts of aggres sion against North Korea in the last week.

title: 2 Neighborhood Surveys Show Belief Conditions Have Declined
description: A series of neighborhood surveys made for the city has led to a report of a general belief that services and con ditions are generally worse than they used to be.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN THE NIGHT KITCHEN. By Maurice Sendai Illustrated. Unpaginated. Harper & Row. $4.95.

title: Korean Newsman Freed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Mon day, Dec. 7 (UPI)Joseph Lee, 37 years old, a Korean tele vision cameraman who was captured Nov. 22 when a bat talion of Cambodian paratroop ers was overrun by guerrillas, was freed by the enemy forces today, the Cambodian com mand announced. He is the eighth journalist to he released by the guerrillas in Cambodia.

title: Polluters Sit on Antipollution Boards
description: Most of the state boards primarily responsible for clean ing up the nation's air and water are markedly weighted with representatives of the principal sources of pollution.

title: Burrows Play on Road
description: Sid Caesar and Carol Chan ning will open tonight at the Nixon Theater in Pittsburgh in Abe Burrows's new comedy, Four on a Garden. Mr. Cae sar, who last appeared on Broadway eight years, ago in Little Me, took over his role from Barry Nelson. The comedy will play in Pittsburgh for one week and then move on to the Palace Theater in Milwaukee; where it will be seen from next Monday through Saturday. It will open here at the Broad hurst late this month.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Halfway Measures Get Job Done for Giants
description: Let's face it. This was game that everybody wanted to win without playing it, said Fran Tarkenton, the New York Giant quarterback, after yesterday's comeback victory over Buffalo.

title: Surgeon Marries Mrs. Nordenschild
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. Mrs. Adrienne Easton Nor denschild of New Rochelle was married here this after noon to Dr. Reuven K. Snyderman, a surgeon. Rabbi Jack Stern performed the ceremony at the Westchester Reform Temple.

title: GARY GROUPS JOIN TO FIGHT DIRTY AIR
description: GARY, Ind., Dec. 6About 1,500 working class white eth nics, students, suburban liber als and conservatives labored through rough the night yesterday and early today to create the Calumet Community Congress, a workingclass pressure group designed to gain political, so cial and economic power.

title: Child Center Dedicated To G.I. Killed in War
description: A childcare center in the Bushwick area of Brooklyn, named for a soldier who was killed in action in 1968 after only two weeks in Vietnam, was dedicated yesterday.

title: FIGHTING REPORTED IN JORDANIAN CITIES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 6 Fighting was reported between Jordanian and commando forces in Aninman, the capital, and in Kerash, a city in the north, for the second succes sive day today. Both sides ac cused the other of having started the fighting.

title: Walter O'Melia, 63, Active In Long Island Real Estate
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Dec. 6 Walter O'Melia, a real estate broker who played a prominent part in the development of the commercial Miracle Mile on Northern Boulevard here, died today at his home in Port Washington following a short illness. He was 63 years old.

title: Dance: Fun Time at the City Ballet
description: The New York City Ballet was a word called fun at the New York State Theater during the past weekend at Lincoln Center. To be honest, 1 missed its Saturday night performance, yet the three saw gladdened my heart. And if you want to know how rarely your heart can be gladdened,. try growing in door plants. It is enormously difficult, and neither water nor vitamins can provide the complete answer. Plants either grow or they do not grow.

title: Nixon Made a Pioneer
description: SAN FRANCISCO; Dec. 6 (UPI)The Society of Califor nia Pioneers is making Presi dent Nixon an honorary pioneer of his home state. The organiza tion, made up of male descen dants of persons who had ar rived in California by 1850, said it was awarding the hon orary membership to Mr. Nixon because he is the first native born Californian to be Presi dent of the United States.

title: 4 of Refinery's 20 Processing Units Are Knocked Out
description: LINDEN, N.J., Dec. 6More than 700 sootblackened fire fighters labored into the early morning hours today to subdue the massive petroleumfed fire that wreaked millions of dol lars in damage at the Bayway Refinery of the Humble Oil Company here.

title: Raiders Top Jets, 1413, Scoring on Pass in Final Second
description: With one second remaining, the New York Jets were de prived yesterday of their most satisfying victory of the season as the Oakland Raiders struck for a 1413 triumph on Daryle Lamonica's desperate, deflected 33yard touchdown pass to Warren Wells and 43yearold George Blanda's calm conver sion.

title: DENNIS J. M'NAMARA
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Dec. 6 Dennis J. McNamara, who re tired in 1960 as vice president and controller of the Flintkote Company, died today in St. Mary's Hospital, Passaic, after a short illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 228 Prospect Place here.

title: Issues in the Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, repre senting 69 of the 72 fleet owners who operate 6,816 cabs; the City Council, which has the responsibility for setting taxi fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who recommended a fare increase at an earlier stage in negotiations.

title: First SexEquality Action By U.S. Settled in Toledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 7 (Reu ters)The first suit brought by the Justice Department to win equal employment rights for women has ended in an agree ment that provides such rights.

title: Pay Under Cab Proposal Put at $196 by Owners
description: Taxi fleet owners yes terday disclosed further details of their final offer to the city's striking taxi drivers, indicat ing that the average driver would have received an increase of $36.80 per week, exclusive of tips, if the proposal had been accented.

title: Bank of America Expands
description: The Bank of America, San Francisco, the nation's largest bank, announced yesterday the opening of two new overseas branches  one in Salonica, Greece, and the other in Fort de France, Martinique.

title: Professional Football
description: American Conference EASTERN DIVISION

title: Staff at Lincoln Rebuffed On Attempt to Oust Chief
description: Psychiatric staff members at Lincoln Hospital were sternly warned yesterday that they would not be allowed to oust Dr. Gabriel Koz as their chief of service or to dictate the choice of his successor.

title: SALAVARRIA TAKES. FLYWEIGHT CROWN
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. (UPI)Erbito Salavarria of the Philippines knocked down Chart chai Chionoi, the champion, three times for a knockout vic tory in the second round to night to win the World Boxing Council's version of the fly weight title.

title: Conservation Group Buys Three Islands Off Virginia
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) The Nature Conservancy an nounced today that it had bought for conservation pur poses three islands off Virginia that had been slated for com mercial development.

title: JAPANESEAMERICAN SWORN INTO OFFICE
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7 (AP) George R. Ariyoshi, citing an impossible dream come true, was sworn in here today as the nation's first Lieutenant Governor of Japanese ancestry on the 29th anniversary of the Japanese attack on Pearl Har bor.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ADVANCES IN WEEK
description: Steel production last week rose 3.9 per cent, compared to output the week before, when it was reduced by the Thanks giving Day holiday. Major steel mills are not normally shut down for one day, but many smaller operations can be cur tailed or halted.

title: Tina Croll's Farm Mixes Rootlessness With Mock Combat
description: Tina Croll is a dancer of skill and a choreographer with variety of ideas . that seem promising, but for the most part never quite achieve their anticipated fullness. Last night at the Cubiculo she presented a program,of four works, the ear liest of which dates from 1967.

title: GIANTS BEST WAY: WIN LAST 2 GAMES
description: The big fact of life for the New York Giants today, only grasped by their followers, is that the scores of the two games they split with Dallas don't matter. That relates to last year's format for settling places in the standing between teams with similar records.

title: 1.5Million Bail Set for Suspect In U. S. HeroinSmuggling Case
description: A suspect in a heroinsmug gling ring was ordered held here yesterday in $1.5million bail, the highest amount ever set in the United States, according to United States Attorney Ed ward R. Neaher.

title: ExAide of Hogan Seized on Coast On Drug Charges
description: SAUSALITO, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)A former assistant to District Attorney Frank S. Ho gan of New York has been charged with illegal possession of marijuana, dangerous drugs, narcotics paraphernalia and tear gas, the police here said today.

title: JOSEPH C. JONES, 57, DESIGNED MAGAZINE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7Jo seph Corson Jones, a commer cial artist who was the design director of Discover, The Phila delphia Sunday Bulletin's maga zine, died today at his home here. He was 57 years old.SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 7 Mrs. Janet Dunbar, Deland, the wife of Thorndike Deland, widely known in the adver tising field as an employment specialist, died today in White Plains Hospital.
