She was 82 years old and lived at 34 Crane Road.

title: The Playoff Picture: 14 Teams Eligible, But 6 Won't Make It
description: The outcome of pro foot ball's 12 weekend games eliminated only four of the 18 teams eligible for the play offs and the Super Bowl. Out went the Jets, San Diego, Denver and Green Bay.

title: Executive Changes
description: George C. Gilfillen Jr., formerly president, was elected chairman and chief executive officer of the E. F. MacDonald Company succeeding Elton F. Mac Donald who is retiring. Robert E. MacDonald, for merly vice president and secretary, was appointed president.

title: Texas Gulf Sulphur Settles Last Timmons Mine Claim
description: TORONTO, Dec. 7 (Canadian Press)A spokesman for the Texas Gulf Sulphur Company said today that the company had completed the previously announced agreement to pay $27.5million to settle the final claim against the Kidd Creek mine.

title: Antitrust Violations by Chrysler Charged in a ClassAction Suit
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. (UPI)A classaction suit has been filed here against the Chrysler Corporation and its major affiliated companies ac cusing the company of numer ous violations of the antitrust laws and a conspiracy to create a nationwide system of captive dealers.

title: The $190Million Rundown Castle Job
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7News that the always troublesome Doctor Frank enstein had taken an abandoned castle somewhere in the United States and renewed his attempts to produce monster capable of. walking at twice the speed of sound was largely ignored by the public at first.

title: Heads of 5 Major Airlines Ask Congress to Retain SST Funds
description: The heads of the nation's five biggest airlines appealed to Congress yesterday not to can cel the program to build two test versions of a supersonic transport.

title: Money
description: Monday, Dec. 7, 1970

title: Origin of Life
description: It will be a major scientific landmark if further research confirms the conclusion of Dr. Cyril Ponnamperuma and his colleagues that they have found amino acids of extra terrestrial origin in a meteorite. Previous reports of such finds have tended to be dismissed as the result of con tamination of the meteorite after it landed on earth. But Dr. Ponnamperuma and his associates have assembled impressive evidence to suggest that their amino acids were indeed formed elsewhere in the universe.

title: Bette DavisIm a Hausfrau at Heart
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  Bette Davis has played many bad women in her nearly 100 films. Still women admire her and empathize with her characters. Because even when she kills a man (The Letter) or nearly destroys one (Of Human Bondage), it is because she has been buffeted by Life.

title: THEFT OF STOCKS LAID TO EMPLOYE
description: A stock brokerage employe was arrested on an indictment yesterday that charged him with the theft of $2.25,million in securities as part of an in ternational stock stealing op eration.

title: Lawyers Protest Antipoverty Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  About 500 antipoverty lawyers, clients and supporters rallied and picketed today against what they believe is political interference in the administra tion of the Federal Legal Serv ices program.

title: U.N. Condemnation Urged
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7The Security Council was asked by five African and Asian members today to issue a formal condemnation of Por tugal in the reported inva sion of Guinea by Portuguese armed forces.

title: Perpetrator of Baby Hoax Recaptpred by Indonesians
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 7 (Reuters)  The Indonesian woman who escaped from cus tody not long after her miracle baby hoax was un covered, has been recaptured, a police spokesman said today.

title: Park Safety Study Begun
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) A Department of Housing and Urban Development spokes man announced today the start of a nationwide study of public safety in parks. At the annual meeting of the National Associ ation of Citizens Crime Com missions, David 0. Maxwell, H.U.D. general counsel, said that the $80,000 contract has been awarded to Harold Lewis Malt Associates of Washington. D. C.

title: CHRISTA LUDWIG EXCELS IN LIEDER
description: When Christa Ludwig sings lieder, as she did at Carnegie Hall Sunday night, the listener is guaranteed a number of Measures.

title: Television
description: 7:30 P.M. The World of the Beaver (4)

title: Autonomy for West Bank Demanded by Arab Leader
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 7Hamdi Canaan, one of the most in fluential Arab leaders of the Palestinian west bank, has publicly renounced any wish to return to Jordanian rule. He challenged King Hussein to grant legal autonomy to the west bank even before the Israeli occupation ends.

title: 30 Senators Say I.C.C. Rail Moves Will Bring Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. (UPI)  The Senate Demo cratic leader, Mike Mansfield, and 29 other Senators, in biting letter to the Interstate Commerce Commission, said today that the agency had imperiled the future of rail transportation in the United States.

title: Basque Trial Delay Is Raising Questions
description: MADRID, Dec. 6The Basque courtmartial in Burgos, marked yesterday by accounts of tor ture and statements of opposi tion to the regime, was sud denly adjourned today for at least 24 hours.

title: GENERAL TELEPHONE GOING TO STAMFORD
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 7 General Telephone and Elec tronics Corporation announced today that its world headquar ters would be moved from New York City to a 10story building to be built in downtown Stam ford. The new central offices will be in the southeast quad rant of this city's urban re newal project.

title: Theater: `Greenwillow
description: There is a kind of irony in the fact that while Actors Equity is striking Off Broad way producers, it continues such productions itself at the Equity Library Theater. This, with the actors unpaid, and the audience making an op tional donation into a bread basket, is probably the pur est form of Off Broadway, and it may very well one day be the only form left,

title: StudentsFavorElectionWork
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 7 About onequarter of the 3,600 undergraduates at Princeton University became involved in political campaigning during their twoweek recess before the November elections, accord ing to a poll released today by the office of the dean of stu dents. Only 12 per cent of the 750 students interviewed in the survey were opposed to the pre election recess, despite the fact that it meant eliminating or re ducing other holidays.

title: BIG BOARD SHOWS 12TH GAIN IN ROW
description: The stock market, with its revvedup engine idling through most of yesterday's session as some passengers took their profits, pushed forward into new high territory for 1970 as charted by the DowJones in dustrial average.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: If you're planning to buy fly reel for a friend or your spouse for Christmas, do not subscribe to the often ad vanced theory that such a reel is no more than a device for line.

title: Space Wins Over Sewers In Senate Priority Votes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Senate became involved today in a debate over the priorities between sewers and space and decided in favor of further manned space flight. The Senate rejected, by a 50to 26 vote, a move by Senate liber als to eliminate $110million for development of a space shuttle and space stationthe next ma jor step in the manned space flight program of the National Aeronautics and Space Admin istration.

title: HIGH COURT REFUSES A GASRATE APPEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 UPI) The Supreme Court refused today to interfere with the in itial rates set by the Federal Power Commission for natural gas from the Southern Louisi ana area, the source of a third of the nation's total supply.

title: Rates on Bills Decline Sharply At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Treasury bill rates declined sharply at today's auction from last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: The Disease of Kidnapping
description: With the death in custody of the leader of the National Liberation Alliance last month, Brazilian authorities wrote off that terrorist group and said they expected no more political kidnappings. Now the supposedly mori bund Alliance has struck anew and the Swiss Ambassa dor to Brazil has become the fifteenth political kidnap victim in the Western Hemisphere in fifteen months.

title: Waltham Pares Operations
description: The Waltham Industries Cor poration will cease manufactur ing at the malleable iron foundry of MIF Industries, Ltd., at Brantford, Ont., on Dec. 23

title: De Carlo Stage Debut Set
description: Yvonne De Carlo will be co starred with Alexis Smith, Gene Nelson and Dorothy Collins in the forthcoming Harold Prince production of Follies, the mu sical having book by James Goldman and score by Stephen Sondheim. Miss Dc Carlo, who has appeared in more than 30 films, will he making her Broadway stage debut in the role of Carlotta, a movie star who began her slinv., businos.: career in the Ziegfeld Follies.

title: Hughes High School Is Closed After Protest on Panther Flag
description: A dispute over student de mands to be allowed to display a flag depicting a black panther at their functions touched off disruptions that forced the clos ing of Charles Evans Hughes High School yesterday.

title: POLLUTER IS FINED IN WEST GERMANY
description: KLEVE, West Germany, Dec. 7 (Reuters)A Hamburg ship ping line owner today was given an eightmonth sus pended prison sentence and fined $1,400 at the end of West Germany's first water pollution trial.

title: Traders Discern a Lot Of Interest in Figures
description: The Security Savings and Loan Association, a $260rnil lion institution based in San Jose, Calif., caused a bit of a stir in Wall Street yester day with an announcement that it was cutting its inter est rate on mortgages in sured or guaranteed by the Government from 81/4 per cent to 73% per cent.

title: HEALTH COVERAGE FOR ALMOST ALL GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A $2.2billion major medical in surance program that would protect about 95 per cent of the people under 65 years old against the cost of catastrophic illness was approved today by the Senate Finance Committee.

title: Flareup Viewed as Serious
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 7 The flareup between the Gov ernment troops and guerrillas today was generally considered the most serious since the Sep tember conflict

title: MAURICE PICARD, 80, OF DARTMOUTH DIES
description: HANOVER, N. H., Dec. 7 Maurice Picard, a retired phi losophy professor at Dartmouth College, died last night in the college infirmary. He was 80 years old.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange advanced yesterday for the eighth consecutive ses sion.

title: 5YEAR PROBATION IN DEATH OF BABY
description: The mother of a sevenmonth old boy who died of starvation last April was placed on pro bation for five years yesterday by a Bronx Supreme Court justice.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Monday, Dec. 7. 43d and final day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: S.E.C. PLANS TO HEAR LING &
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission has scheduled hearings to investigate charges that Ling & Co., a Dallas bro kerdealer, violated antifraud, registration and other provi sions of Federal securities law.

title: YOUTH DOMINATES U.S. ALPINE SQUAD
description: Led by Willy Schaeffler, their new coach who guided Denver University to domination of the National Collegiate ski cham pionships, 17 members of the United States Alpine squad ar rived at Sestriere, Italy, yester day.

title: NEW COURT CLEARS A MARINE OF RAPE
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Dec. 7 (AP)  A general courtmartial to day reversed an earlier military court ruling and found a ma rine not guilty of a charge of raping an Okinawan mess hall waitress.

title: Rail Union Chief Vows to Defy Any U.S. Action and Order Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Dec. 8 (AP)  A railroad union leader said early today that he would order a nationwide rail strike in defiance of any ac tion by Congress, the White House or Federal courts.

title: U.S. to Suggest Pollution Board Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The head of the new Environmental Protection Agency, William D. Ruckelshaus, said today his or ganization would suggest to states that it was undesirable for their regulatory boards to include representatives of pol lution sources.

title: Nyquist Backs British Informal Schooling Plan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 7Dr. Ewald B. Nyquist, the State Commis sioner of Education, today urged adoption of an informal British approach to schooling in which elementary school children essentially work on their own at whatever they desire.

title: $50MILLION GIVEN TO AID PAKISTANIS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Kai Warras, vice chairman of the League of Red Cross Societies, said today that about $50mil lion$20million more than pre viously reportedhad been con tributed by governments, inter national organizations and pri vate agencies for the relief of East Pakistani storm victims.

title: GAMBINO IS GRANTED SEVERANCE IN TRIAL
description: Carlo Gambino, 67yearold reputed boss of all bosses in the New York Mafia hierarchy, won a court order yesterday that makes it unlikely he will ever stand trial on charges of conspiring with four other men last year to hijack a Brinks armored truck full of money.

title: RELIEF WORKERS BEGIN SLOWDOWN
description: Welfare workers began a job slowdown yesterday by cutting back on their casework to pro test the city's plans to close five welfare centers in an economy drive.

title: Mobile Home Shipments Show 7% Drop in October
description: Shipments of mobile homes totaled 40,520 during October, down 7 per cent from the 43,440 shipped in the same month last year, the Mobile Homes Manufacturers Associa tion reported yesterday. For the first 10 months of the year, the Association said, shipments totaled 341,040, down 3 per cent from 1969.

title: Cuba Suspends Holidays to Harvest Sugar. Corp
description: MIAMI, Dec. 7  Premier Fidel Castro tonight sus pended Cuba's celebration of Christmas and New Year's, declaring, in a threehour and 20minute speech in Havana, that Cuba could not afford the luxury of having fiestas during sugar harvests.

title: Kentucky Tops West Virginia, 106 100
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 7 (UPI)Kentucky lost 17point lead but then held off West Virginia to win its third straight game, 106100, to night on 24 points by Tom Parker and 23 by Kent Hollen beck.DURHAM, N. C., Dec. 7 (AP)  Duke rallied in the second half behind the shooting and rebounding of Randy Denton to defeat Michigan, 9574, tonight. Denton scored 20 of his 35 points and grabbed 11 of his 16 rebounds after intermission. He also keyed the Blue Devil zone defense that limited the Wolverines primarily to long set shots.COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 7 (UPI)Allan Hornyak, a so phomore, scored 23 points to lead Ohio State to a 7458 vic tory over Alabama tonight. It was the Buckeyes second triumph of the season after they had lost their opening game.JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 7 (AP)Artis Gilmore led Jack sonville to a 11085 victory over George Washington in the opening round of the Civitan Charity basketball tournament tonight.

title: Ailing Richey Withdraws From $ 50,000 Tokyo Tennis
description: TOKYO, Dec. 7 (Reuters) Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., winner last Month of the first International Lawn Tennis Federation Grand Prix, with, drew today from a $50,0001 roundrobin tournament involv ing the top six Prix finishers. Doctors said they suspected Richey had hepatitis.

title: Kaiser Steel Omits Quarterly Dividend
description: The Kaiser Steel Corporation announced yesterday in Oak land, Calif., that its directors had voted to omit the com pany's quarterly dividend of 37.5 cents a share on the com mon stock. They declared the usual dividend of 36.5 cents share on the preferred stock, payable Dec. 31 to holders of record Dec. 15.

title: BUILDERS PROPOSE A $4.5BILLION PLAN
description: A group of major builders in the city said yesterday that they were ready to start a $4.5 billion program to construct 150,000 apartments here pro vided the city eased some regu lations and passed special legis lation.

title: DOUBLEDAY PLANS COSMONAUT FILM
description: Utilizing exclusive Soviet film, Doubleday & Co., the book pub lisher, will produce documenta ries on the Soviet space pro gram and on the GermanSoviet fighting from 1941 to 1945.

title: Holy Cross Spending Curbed
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. (AP)Holy Cross College must reduce its spending for the 197172 academic year by $370,000, the college president, the Very Rev. John E. Brooks, S.J., announced today. He said the figure was a mandate of the college trustees.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: 2 Men Are Killed in Crash Of a Plane in Connecticut
description: SHARON, Conn., Dec. 7 (AP) The bodies of two New York men were found here today in the wreckage of a singleengine airplane.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: BURNS SUGGESTS PAYPRICE BOARD TO CUT INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, sug gested today 11 possible addi tional steps that might be taken by the Government to help slow inflation as the economy expands.

title: Rube Goldberg, Cartoonist, Dies at 87
description: Rube Goldberg, the cartoon ist, died of cancer yesterday at his home, 169 East 69th Street. He was 87 years of age.

title: Fund for Neediest Recalls Gratitude
description: Among the 69 contributors to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yester day was a woman who wished to express her grate ful appreciation for the re cuperation of her 89yearold mother.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Pentagon today identi fied the following servicemen from the New York area as hav ing been killed in the war in Southeast Asia:

title: Frazier Scoffs at Jive, Says He'll Win After 5
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Dec. Claiming that Muhammad Ali wouldn't be able to jive me the way he did Bonavena tonight, Joe Frazier predict ed tonight that he'd come on in the sixth round to de feat Ali when the pair meet.

title: SCHWALB RETURNS FOR PIANO RECITAL
description: Although Miklos Schwalb has pursued an active career, con certizing, making musical films for television and teaching (he is Artist in Residence at North eastern University), his Car negie Recital Hall program Sunday afternoon marked his first New York appearance since 1957.

title: Governmental Twins
description: As Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay know well, the cities and the states are the twins of the American governmental structure, sharing alike the fiscal plight of neglect at the hands of the Federal Government. Washington collects most of the tax revenues; cities and states supply most of the domestic services.

title: U. S. Documents Hint Admiral Made Decision to Return Defector
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Two documents issued by the White House today appeared to con firm earlier reports that Rear Adm. William B. Ellis, com mander of the First Coast Guard District, gave the crucial order to return a Soviet defector to the fishing vessel from which he sought to escape two weeks ago.

title: Latin Council Assails Trade Bill
description: Jose de Cubas, the new chairman of the Council of the Americas, asserted yesterday that the council views the re strictionist trade legislation pending in Congress as very det rimental to world trade and particularly harmful to the de veloping countries, as in Latin America.

title: INFORMER SAYS F.B.I. PAID FOR SPRAY PAINT
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 7 (UPI)Horace Parker testified today that the Federal Bureau of Investigation paid for two cases of paint sprayed on the United States courthouse in Seattle during a riot last Febru ary.

title: $880,000 IS CUT FROM PARK FUNDS
description: The Lindsay administration announced further belttighten ing yesterdaythis time an $880,000 reduction in funds for parks, recreational and cultural programs.

title: British Soccer Team Standings
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: 6TH AND LAST PART OF MASTER PLAN ON CITY RELEASED
description: The City Planning Commis sion yesterday published its master plan for Manhattan, the sixth and final volume of comprehensive plan for the entire city that the commission has been laboring to bring forth for 32 years under five mayoral administrations.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Cincinnati 124, San Francisco 113.

title: FIRESTONE SHOWS SLUMP IN PROFITS
description: The Firestone Tire & Rubber Company posted record sales in the fiscal year ended Oct. 31, but earnings declined for the second year in a row.

title: JORDAN REACHES GUERRILLA ACCORD
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Agreement has been reached between the Jordanian Government and the Palestinian commandos to stop provoca tive actions and end tension, it was officially announced here tonight.

title: Hudson Expressway Foes Gain Point in High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Con servationists won a victory in the Supreme Court today as the Justices declined to disturb lower court ruling that pro hibited the construction of the proposed Hudson River Ex pressway.

title: Jailing of Fathers Who Desert Is Asked by Teamsters Council
description: Renewed increases in the city's relief rolls were attrib uted in an analysis by a union official yesterday to resump tion of tacit encouragement of illegitimate births and illegal abandonment of families rather than to the Nixon re cession blamed by the city's welfare chiefs.

title: 27 Hurt in Bus Accident
description: MANCHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 7 (AP)A Greyhound bus bound from Chicago to Boston skidded and tipped over today on the Thruway near here, injuring at least 27 of the 38 persons aboard, the state police reported. Ten persons were admitted to nearby Clifton Springs Hospital. The accident happened at about 3 A.M. near exit 43, which is southeast of Rochester.

title: Javits Sees Some Chance Of Postponing Trade Bill
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits said yesterday .that he saw some chance now that the protec tionist trade legislation before Congress might be put over until next year.

title: DETECTIVE SEIZED IN A BRIBERY CASE
description: A New York City detective was arrested yesterday on charges that he offered a $5,000 bribe to a state trooper to have him testify falsely to Federal grand jury about an indictment accusing a business man of making regular sales cf cocaine.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Peru's Rubble Cleared, but Rebuilding Is Another Story
description: CASMA, Peru, Dec. 2Half a year ago the worst earth quake in Peru's recorded his tory laid waste to several northern provinces, taking a toll estimated at more than 50,000 lives and depriving about 800,000 people of shelter.

title: Two Named in Inquiry
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. (AP)The commander and har bor master of Mayport Naval Base were named today as par ties of an investigation into the disposal of oil sludge dumping.

title: Erte Waits Out Nudity Trend by Designing Furniture
description: Pinkcheeked from wind gusts, Ede, the artistdesign er, arrived at the Sonnabend Gallery, 924 Madison Avenue, yesterday morning to put the finishing touches on the third retrospective show of his work held here since since 1967.

title: Bengali and Leftist Parties Lead in  Pakistani Election
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Tues day, Dec. 8An East Pakistani party advocating autonomy for that province and a West Paki stani party promising a redistri bution of national wealth along Marxist lines took leads early today in the country's first di rect nationwide election in 23 years of independence.

title: Entertainment Events
description: TONIGHT

title: Barney's Brings Byrne Hat Corp. and Botany
description: Barney's is bringing in the business, not only for itself but also for its ad agency, Jack Byrne Advertising.

title: Picasso Works, on Loan From Leningrad, Arrive
description: Accompanied by a Russian curator, two early paintings by Pablo Picasso arrived yes terday at the Museum of Modern Art. They have been lent by the Hermitage, the

title: HOUSE LAUDS RAIDERS WHO SOUGHT P.O.W.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The House adopted a resolution to day praising those who took part in the unsuccessful effort last month to free United States prisoners of war near Hanoi.

title: Gen. Thomas Power Dies at 65; Headed Strategic Air Command
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Dec. 7 (AP)  Gen. Thomas S. Power, retired commander of the Strategic Air Command, died here last night at the age of 65. General Power, who had a heart ailment, was stricken at his home and died before he could be taken to a hospital.

title: $125,000 FINE SET IN RIVER POLLUTION
description: Standard Brands, Inc., was fined $125,000 in Manhattan Federal court yesterday for polluting bywaters of the Hudson River at Peekskill, N. Y.

title: Bank Plans Saigon Branch
description: The First National City Bank has applied to the Federal Re serve Board for permission to open a branch in Saigon, the board disclosed yesterday. Ac cording to a spokesman for the bank, the new branch has been planned as a strictly commer cial venturein contrast to the Saigon offices of the Bank of America and the Chase Manhat tan Bank, which were originally opened at the urging of the Government in part at least to provide liankliig facilities for United States servicemen sta tioned them

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Grant to Seattle Medical School Will Aid Alaska and Worthwest
description: The University of Washington Medical School in Seattle has been awarded a grant of nearly $1million to develop a regional education program by estab lishing local teaching units in the basic sciences and in bed side medicine in Alaska and three other Pacific Northwest states, Quigg Newton, president of the Commonwealth Fund, announced here yesterday.

title: Brandt Moved by Visit To Warsaw Ghetto Site
description: WARSAW, Dec. 7The drama of the signing of the PolishWest Germany treaty today was almost overshad owed earlier in a touching incident at a memorial to the Jews who died in the Warsaw ghetto under the Nazi occu pation.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Ali Wins in 15th Round

title: F.D.A. Checking Tuna Fish For High Levels of Mercury
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration said today that it was starting a limited check of I canned tuna fish after a prelim inary test confirmed the pres ence of unsafe levels of portions of mercury in one brand.

title: Text of Burns Speech on Steps to Fight Inflation and to Extend U.S. Prosperity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Folowing is the text made public here of a speech in Los Angeles tonight by Ar thur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, before the Pepperdine Col lege great issues series of lectures:

title: Auto Speedway Planned For Florida at $10Million
description: FORT WALTON BEACH, Fla., Dec. 7 (UPI)  A $10million international automobile racing complex to be built in this northwest Florida area was dis closed today, with the first race scheduled for October, 1972.

title: Jailing Cesar Chavez
description: The imprisonment of Cesar Chavez, leader of the Cali fornia lettuce strikers, is an exercise in legalism of the kind that serves only to discredit the law. Mr. Chavez, firm in his dedication to nonviolence as Mahatma Gandhi, is a symbol of emancipation for the most exploited of the nation's workers, the agricultural laborers.

title: Farmer Leaves H.E.W. Job Amicably
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  James Farmer, the founder of the Congress of Racial Equality, resigned today as assistant sec retary for administration of the Department of Health, Educa tion and Welfare.

title: U.S. and South Vietnam Discuss Extended Holiday Truce but Officials, Say Hanoi Must Agree
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 The State Department said to day that discussions were under way between the United States and South Vietnam on the possibility of proposing an extended holiday truce in Vietnam.

title: PARIS REVUE TAKES A LOOK AT AMERICA
description: PARIS, Dec. 7Antoine Bour seiller, a French theater director just back from the States, has brought back a meandering, monotonous spectacle, Oh! America! which opened at the Theatre de France the other evening.

title: FIREMAN IS KILLED IN WEST SIDE BLAZE
description: A fireman was killed last night fighting a fire in an Upper West Side apartment building. He was Timothy J. Gray, 26 years old, of 10421 39th Ave nue, Corona, Queens.

title: Mercenary Reported Seized
description: BAMAKO, Mali (Agence FraticePresse), Dec. 7Guine an Army and home guard units today captured, a mercenary during final Clearing opera tions in the Koundara region on the border with Senegal and Portuguese Guinea, the Co nakry radio, monitored here, reported.

title: Bridge:
description: An exciting finish and a small mystery marked the Swiss team championship of the Greater New York Bridge Association played at the New York Hilton Satur day and Sunday. Going into the final match, two teams were tied on victory points, and team No. 10 captured the title by winning, 1614, while its rivals could win only by 128. spade. The best the defense can do is for East to win and return a trump. South can then win in dummy, play spade to the ace, ruff a spade, and return to the closed hand with a club ruff for the sec ond spade ruff.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Muhammad Ali won his fight with Oscar Bonavena just as he said he would. But he was off schedule by six rounds and hardly enhanced the magnificent image he had created six weeks ago with his swift and elegant disposal of Jerry Quarry in Atlanta.

title: College Paper Suspended; Abortion Clinic Ad Cited
description: He criticized appearance of an advertisement for an abor tion clinic in New York, adding in a Statement that drugs and sex seem to be the dominant thing among Concordia stu dents, in the perspective of news in The Concordian.

title: Canadian Kidnappers Are Reported in Isolation in Hotel in Havana
description: HAVANA, Dec. 7The seven members of the leftwing Que bec Liberation Front who were flown to Cuba Friday in ex change for the release of James R. Cross, a kidnapped British diplomat, are in a comfortable hotel under official isolation.

title: LEFTISTS IN BRAZIL SEIZE SWISS ENVOY
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 7 The Swiss Ambassador to Brazil, Giovanni Enrico Bucher, was kidnapped by leftist com mandos today and his Brazilian police guard was seriously wounded.

title: Benefit Parties Still Plentiful but Drawing Fewer Patrons
description: Volunteers working to keep the services of New York charities at top efficiency are facing a serious drop do pub lic support and Income be cause of the recession.

title: Equity Dispute at Impasse; Mediator Urges Arbitration
description: Meyer Drucker of the State Mediation Board said last night that the 23dayold Actors Equity strike against Off Broad way theaters could become the longest strike in the union's history, surpassing even the fourweek strike in 1919.

title: Roger T. McLean, Partner In Patent Law Firm Here
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Dec. 7 Roger T. McLean, senior partner in the New York patent law firm of McLean, Boustead & Sayre, died yesterday in Moun tainside Hospital after a long illness. He was 60 years old and lived here at 13 Cambridge Road.

title: TATE TRIAL LAWYER IS NOW FEARED DEAD
description: LOS ANGELES Dec. 7 (UPI)  The chief defense attorney at the Tate murder trial said today that he thought it prob ble that the missing defense attorney, Ronald Hughes, had been killed by floodwaters in a canyon of the Sespe Hot Springs Mountain wilderness.

title: MRS. WILSON SMILLIE
description: TOWNSHEND, Vt., Dec. 7 Mrs. Ottavia Hall Smillie, the wife of Dr. Wilson G. Smillie, a former member of the faculties at Harvard and Cornell Medical Schools, died on Wednesday after a brief illness. She was 82 years old.

title: ETA Kidnapping Role Denied
description: BAYONNE, France, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Three men who said they belonged to the national leadership of the Basque na tionalist group ETA today denied that the organization was involved in the kidnapping of Eugen Beihl.

title: FISCHER KEEPS LEAD AFTER 19TH ROUND
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 7  Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles led the 24 man field in the knockout roundrobin chess tournament at the end of the 19th round today. He has posted a 12 4 score, with two adjourned games.

title: MAURICE PICARD, 80, OF DARTMOUTH DIES
description: HANOVER, N. H., Dec. 7 Maurice Picard, a retired phi losophy professor at Dartmouth College, died last night in the college infirmary. He was 80 years old.

title: Ottawa Panel Urges Women's Equality
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 7A Gov ernment commission on the status of women called today for radical reforms to make women the equal of men in every area of Canadian soci ety.

title: A FIRM U.S. STAND ON MIDEAST LIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Nixon Administration is re portedly prepared to stand firm against new Israeli pressures for relaxation of American terms for a territorial settle ment with the Arabs.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW DECLINES
description: Trading Session Is Quiet Paris Market Is Mixed

title: EQUIPMENT FAILURES DELAY COMMUTERS
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 7 (UPI) This city's public school teachers have authorized strike if they cannot reach agreement on a wage contract with the school board by Jan. 3, the Pittsburgh Federation of Teachers announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Fulbright's Attack Held Misdirected

title: Seale Lawyer's Request for Trial Dismissal Is Denied
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 7The lawyer for Bobby G. Seale, the Black Panther leader, asked today that murder charges against his client be dismissed because it had become im possible for him to receive fair trial. The motion was denied.

title: Murphy Seeks a Policy To Disarm All Citizens
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Po lice Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy of New York City ap pealed today for a strong uni form policy of domestic dis armament to take away the guns from the people.

title: BUCHANAN'S SPEED DEFEATS  PADUANO
description: Whenever heavyweight cham pions or leading contenders are the principal participants of a boxing program, the promoter usually staffs the underneath card with struggling nonenti ties.

title: INDIA DENIES CHARGE OF PAKISTANI DEATHS
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 7 (AP) India's Foreign Ministry angrily denied today reports from Pak istan that Indian police and civilians killed 300 Pakistanis and wounded 700 last Wednes day in the Pakistani enclave of Battrigach, which is in India's West Bengal State.

title: Bonavena Predicts Ali Will Defeat Frazier for Title
description: While a thousand fists were held high last night in the black power salute, Muhammad All finally struggled past the Madi son Square Garden wellwishers, who looked, in their stance, as if they were holding imaginary torches to light his way.

title: Hussein in New York
description: King Hussein arrived in New York yesterday on his way to Washington to meet with Presi dent Nixon and other officials. He was staying at the Waldorf Towers.

title: New Hampshire Paper Sold
description: CLAREMONT, N.H., Dec. (AP)The Claremont Daily Eagle has been sold to the Phoenix Publishing Company of Connecticut for an undis closed price.

title: Betting Offices Leased
description: The New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation said today that offices would be located at 375 East 149th St., the Bronx, and 13655 Roosevelt Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens. This brings to five the number of branch offtrack betting offices leased. The three leased offices

title: Two 1851 Stamps Bring $40,000 at Auction Here
description: A pair of unused 1851 Ca , nadian black 12  pence stamps, each with a portrait of Queen Victoria, fetched $40,000 at an auction sale here yesterday. They were purchased by William Mar esch, Toronto stamp dealer, during the sale of a portion of the Canada collections of the late Louise Boyd Dale and her father, Alfred F. Lichtenstein, conducted by H. R. Harmer, Inc., 6 West 48th Street.

title: 18 of 27 on Rumanian Flight From Israel Die in Crash
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 7 (Reuters) Eighteen persons were killed today when a Rumanian air liner on a flight from Tel Aviv crashed at Constanta, in Ru mania, according to officials at Lydda airport.

title: Dr. Walter D. Ludlum Jr. Dead
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. Dr. Walter D. Ludlum Jr. of 10 Woodbine Circle, retired chief surgeon of the New York City Transit Authority, died today in Bridgeport Hos pital after a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Fight Crowd Boisterous, Excited and Fa'shionable
description: Along the approach to Madison Square Garden from Seventh Avenue, the usually everpresent hawkers of Knick and Ranger pennants were not visible last night. In their place black vendors held up portraits of Muham mad All and Angela Davis.

title: 5 Colleges Turn Down Rockefeller Fund Gift
description: AMHERST, MASS., Dec. (AP)  A $25,000 gift from the John D. Rockefeller Fund with no strings attached, has been rejected by five western Massachusetts educational institutions after the col leges students voted to re ject it.

title: VOICE COMPARISON SOUGHT IN BLAST
description: LINDEN, N. J., Dec. 7Com parisons of a taperecorded threat with the voices of pos sible bombing suspects were or dered today by the police in vestigating the fiery explosion Saturday night that swept the Humble Oil and Refining Com pany plant here.

title: Bank Robbers Get $22,560
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 7 (AP)Two armed men held upl the Fairlawn office of the Hart1 ford National Bank here this morning and escaped with $22,560 in cash. The police said no one was injured during the robbery. The Federal Bureau of Investigation said the holdup men had made the employes lie, on the floor while the money! was taken.

title: Chafee Criticizes Navy on Dumping of Oil Waste
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) Navy Secretary John H. Chafee told a Senate subcom mittee today that the Navy had violated the spirit and intent of new Federal law when it dumped oil waste off the Florida coast a week ago.

title: Business Records
description: Wednesday, Dec. 2, 1970

title: Fan's Court Suit Makes French Jockeys Try, Harder
description: PARIS, Dec. 7The French racing industry is in a fearful and angry uproar over an un precedented legal decision awarding damages to a bettor who successfully sued a los ing jockey.

title: ST. JOHN'S GETS COURT PROSPECT
description: Ed Searcy, the metropolitan schoolboy basketball player most sought by college recruit ers last season, will enter St. John's for the semester starting in February after having made a brief stop at Duquesne.

title: Gipson, 90, Marks End of Giant Task
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. 7 Smiling with cheerful good nature, Lawrence Henry Gip son, research professor emer itus of history at Lehigh Uni versity here and one of the country's most distInguished delineators of its past, celeb rated his 90th birthday today.

title: Theater: The Last Pad
description: The setting is Death Row and the three main charac ters are murderers about to be executed. The play is The Last Pad by William Inge, at the 13th Street Theater. Although the milieu is time wornone need only look back as far as The Last Mile:it is clearly a depar ture for Inge. Or is it?

title: Foreman to Fight Turnbow
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 7 (UPI) George Foreman of Hayward, Calif., the highly regarded heavyweight who stopped Boone Kirkman three weeks ago at Madison Square Garden, has signed for a bout here Dec. 18 with Mel Turnbow.. Fore man will be seeking his 25th consecutive professional vic tory and his 22d knockout.

title: CAMBODIA FEARS BASE HAS FALLEN
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 7 (AP)The Cambodian com mand said today that North Vietnamese and Vietcong troops might have captured district headquarters, 37 miles northeast of Pnompenh, that was being defended by a Cam bodian battalion.

title: Shell Oil Fire Fought
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. (UPI)Spray barges pumped 13,000 gallons of water a min ute on a Shell Oil Company platform fire today while fire fighters drilled three relief wells that they hope will snuff the fire from below. The relief well operation, designed to plug the runaway oil and gas wells with drilling mud, was com pared by a Shell spokesman to turning off the kitchen stove.

title: Taxi Strike Appears to Be Having No Major Impact
description: New Yorkers, as they have a way of doing, coped quite handsomely yesterday with the first weekday of the taxi strike. nesses that cater tb the taxi trade,. but some stores re ported slight declines. Farn ham Lefferts, the president of Tiffany & Co., said busi ness was down slightly at the Fifth Avenue establish ment. You get the feeling that there are fewer cus tomers in the store when you look around, he remarked.

title: Highlights of Plans for 4 Other Boroughs

BOND PRICES FALL AS RALLY COOLS; All Types of Issues Are Off as Much as Half a Point Early In the Day; 5WEEK ADVANCE LAGS; Trading Becomes Quiet in Expectation of Burns's Speech in California; BOND PRICES OFF AS RALLY COOLS
description: Bond prices declined yester day as the credit markets cooled off a bit after their hot rally for the last five weeks.

title: LISBON REJECTS U.N. GUINEA STUDY
description: LISBON, Dec. 7 (Reuters) The Portuguese Government, which has formally denied in volvement in an invasion of Guinea last month, today re jected the conclusions of a special United Nations investi gating mission.

title: A Plan for School Peace
description: Dr. Scribner, for his part, may have to persuade the Legislature to modify existing regulations to make them more responsive to changing conditions. The present difficulties have arisen partially because foes of decen tralization managed to write into law some provisions which are at crosspurposes with the reforms sought by Dr. Scribner.

title: Buckley and Javits in Cordial HourLong Meeting
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits and Senatorelect James L. Buckley met alone over breakfast for the first time yesterday and agreed later that the unan nounced meeting had been at least cordial.

title: Millionaire Devoted to Privacy
description: Why is Mona Lisa smil ing? What is the riddle of the Sphinx? Where is Judge Crater? And who is Howard Hughes?

title: EXECUTIVES VIEW 1971 WITH CAUTION
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7A panel of business executives was cau tious today in its prediction of better things to come for the economy in 1971.

title: AllStar Soccer
description: IVY LEAGUE

title: France Is Challenger For 73 America's Cup
description: France has issued a chal lenge to the United States for the 1973 America's Cup yacht race, Bruno Bich, son of French yachtsman, Baron Marcel Bich, said yesterday.

title: FORD PACT AVERTS A 2D U.A.W. STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7The Unit ed Automobile Workers and the Ford Motor Company reached a new contract agree ment today, averting a second major strike in the auto industry.

title: Leopold Ludwig Speaks of His Wagner
description: Leopold Ludwig, who made his Metropolitan Opera debut at the age of 62 this season conducting Parsifal, likes fast cars and modern music, but when it comes to Wag ner's operas he is a hard man to hurry. Once, he re

title: TOWN IN MISSISSIPPI KEEPS WHITE MAYOR
description: PORT GIBSON, Miss., Dec. 7 The white minority of this town of 2,900 persons turned back an attempt today by the black majority to take control of the city government.

title: Market Place:
description: The letter was personally typed and well drawn. Its recipient sent it along to this newspaper.

title: Detective Tells Panther Trial of His Attempt to Save Malcolm
description: An undercover police agent who obtained evidence leading to the indictment here of 13 Black Panthers testified yester day that he had tried to save the life of Malcolm X, the black nationalist who was as sassinated.

title: LifeSynthesis Pioneer Urges Policing of Research
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 7The leader of the team here that has as sembled onecelled animals from components of several such organisms urged today the creation of national or inter national, machinery to police such work.

title: F.C.C. Resumes Inquiry on W PIX News Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Hearings that will determine the future control of Channel 11, in New York resumed here this, morning, with a Federal Communications Commission examiner hoping to complete testimony on WPIXTV's news practices in a few days.

title: Camerata Singers Present Messiah At Philharmonic
description: The one thing New York would seem to need least at this time of year is another Messiah. On the other hand, when a performance is as lumi nous as the one Sunday night at Philharmonic Hall, when all the disparate elements in Han del's oratorio come together so perfectly, there can be only gratitude to everyone con cerned. On that praiseworthy

title: Witness Testifies Galley Shot Civilians at Mylai for an Hour
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 7  A witness at the murder trial of First Lieutenant Wil liam L. Calley Jr. said today that the killing of South Viet namese civilians in a ditch out side Mylai went on for an hour, with group after group of women, children and old men being shoved into a trench by soldiers and then shot by Lieutenant Calley.

title: Ky Returns to Saigon After U.S. Tour
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 8Vice Presi dent Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam returned from the United States today to report he had received assurances that American officials would keep hands off the presidential elec tions here next year.

title: MOTOROLA PLANS A LOWERPRICE TV
description: Will Offer New Line of 21 Sets, Some as Much as $80 Below Current Models

title: WORKER IS CHARGED IN A FIRE FATAL TO 3
description: The Fire Department issued a summons yesterday to sheetmetal worker who served as a fire watch while his part ner operated an acetylene torch on the fifth floor of midtown office building where a fire took three lives and in jured scores last Friday.

title: FEDERATION TIES URGED ON A.A.U.
description: An offer by John B. Kelly Jr., newly elected president of the Amateur Athletic Union, to settle the differences be tween the A.A.U. and the Na tional Collegiate Athletic Asso ciation was considered reas suring yesterday by Walter Byers, executive director of the N.C.A.A.

title: Best Scrooge in Town? Lindsay Ready for Bow
description: Mayor Lindsay rehearsed his role of narrator yesterday for a musical version of Charles Dickens's A Christ mas Carol, and said that he would prefer to play the role of Scrooge.

title: Books of The Times
description: Don't let the word Lives in the title trouble you. This book is not a series of biographies in miniature. Mr. Schonberg, music critic of this paper and author of two other studies, of pianists and conduc tors, makes the word mean what he wants it to mean. When he wishes, he'll descant

title: Prince Christian of Denmark To Wed Copenhagen Sales Girl
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 7Prince Christian of Denmark, a first lieutenant in the Danish Navy, has be come engaged to Miss Ann Dorthe MaltoftNielsen, a salesgirl at Fonnesbech, a fashionable department store in Copenhagen.

title: AGNEW SAYS YOUTH OF NATION IS SOUND
description: Vice President Agnew, a fre quent critic of youthful dis senters, declared last night that the youth of America is sound.

title: ST. JOHN'S GETS COURT PROSPECT
description: Ed Searcy, the metropolitan schoolboy basketball player most sought by college recruit ers last season, will enter St. John's for the semester starting in February after having made a brief stop at Duquesne.

title: KELLY AND NELSEN EXCEL ON OFFENSE
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) Leroy Kellyraced for 108 yards and one touchdown, and Bill Nelsen made the key third down plays tonight to lead the Cleveland Browns to a 2110 victory over the Houston Oilers before 50,582 Astrodome fans.

title: Rabbi's View on School Aid Disputed,
description: The view that organized Jew ish opposition to government aid for religious schools has abated and the inference that such a shift is justified are both contested in an article by Joseph B. Robison, director of the Commission on Law and Social Action of the American Jewish Congress.

title: Ali Stops Bonavena on 3 Knockdowns in 15th Round Before 19,417 at Garden
description: With only 57 seconds remain ing in the 15th round, Muham mad Ali accomplished last night what Joe Frazier or any other gladiator could not.

title: The Prison Raid Raised Hopes
description: The daring commando raid on the P.O.W. camp near Hanoi just before Thanksgiving could be termed a failure militarily in that it did not achieve its primary objective  the rescue of Americans held prisoner there. But in terms of morale, the raid was out standing.

title: Consumer Advocate Is Denied Tenure
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 John Banzhaf 3d, an aggressive antismoking crusader and con sumer advocate, has been de nied tenure as a faculty mem ber of George Washington Uni versity's National Law Center.

title: AllStar Football
description: WESTERN ATHLETIC CONF.

title: Hughes's Properties Are Reported Worth $2Billion
description: Howard Robard Hughes sits alone at the top of a highly complex maze of financial hold ings reputed to be worth $2 billion, thus making him one of the two richest men in the world, along with J. Paul Getty, the oil man.

title: Yorkville Building's Last Tenant Resists Eviction
description: Edward T. Lynch and his family, the sole remaining tenants in the building at 352 East 81st Street, yester day successfully resisted a city marshal's eviction at tempts.

title: Baeza Scores Triple as 35,362 Bet $4,813,195 in Final Fling at Aqueduct
description: $742,750,080 Is Wagered Campo Saddles 3 Winners and Finishes With 101

title: Laos Reports Setback
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 7 (Reuters)The Laotian Govern ment reported today the loss of a strategic intelligence out post at Muong Moc, about 20 miles from the border with North Vietnam.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 8, 1970

title: MAJOR BANKS HERE HOLD. LINE ON RATE
description: Major New York City banks held the line yesterday on their installment loan rates, for the moment at least declining to follow the lead of the Chase Manhattan Bank, which last Thursday announced an across theboard reduction in these consumer lending charges.

title: Borden, Inc., Plans $20Million  Offer For Sugar Refiner
description: Borden, Inc., announced plans yesterday to sweeten its corporate operations through acquiring North American Sugar Industries, Inc. The two companies announced the merger proposal yesterday and later disclosed details.

title: INQUIRY IS RESUMED IN JACKSON KILLINGS
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 7AI Federal grand jury resumed to day its investigation of the violence at Jackson State Col lege last May after being warned by a Federal judge not; to dillydally.

title: Jets Lower Their Voices Over PassInterference Call
description: Intimidated by the National Football League gagrule on public criticism of game of ficials, the New York Jets re1 fused comment yesterday on the controversial passinterfer ence penalty that positioned the Oakland Raiders lastsecond touchdown Sunday for a 1413 victory.

title: BEN O. HOWARD DIES; EXRACING PILOT, 66
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 (AP) Ben O. Howard, an airplane racing pilot of the nineteen thirties, died on Friday after long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: World Councils Asks Aid for Deserters Residing in Canada
description: GENEVA, Dec. 7The World Council of Churches issued an appeal today for $210,000 to help provide food, clothing and counseling for American de serters and draft resisters in Canada.

title: Nevada Governor Reports Hughes Ordered ShakeUp
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 7 The Governor of Nevada said that Howard Hughes had unex pectedly telephoned him from the Bahamas early today and told him that he had personally intervened in a power struggle among his aides by ordering the Hughes Tool Company to take control of his Nevada properties.

title: Football IS Relevant, Student Insists
description: Don Denbo, a senior psy chology major at the Univer sity of Tennessee, does not consider himself typical of presentday undergraduate psychology students. Few

title: . . . But It Avoided the Real Facts
description: In the last two weeks the Nixon Administration has not only escalated the war in Vietnam but also the hot rhetoric around the prisoner  of  war issue which it needs to gain support for a winthewar policy. In so doing it has engaged in gross distortions of fact and deliberate distractions.

title: Stamping Out Seniority
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Back in 1961, almost before he had had time to take the oath of office, President John Kennedy was plunged into what is still remembered around here as one of the great legislative battles of that or any other year. The result was that Mr. Kennedy and progressive Demo crats won control of the powerful House Rules Committee by expanding its membership; but neither in 1961 nor In later rules amendments was there a change in the fundamental power of the Rules Committeewhich is to send legislation to the House under certain rules of procedure, or to withhold it from the floor.

title: VOLUNTEER CORPS APPROVED BY U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 7The formation of an inter national corps of men and women to work in poor coun tries was approved today by the General Assembly.

title: FEDDERS SAYS NET CLIMBED IN QUARTER
description: Earnings of the Fedders Cor poration in the first fiscal quar ter, ended Nov. 30, were up about 27 per cent and sales were up about 10 per cent, Sal vatore Giordano, chairman and president, told shareholders at yesterday's annual meeting in Edison, N. J. This means the air  conditioning manufacturer expects to report net income of about $4.4million, or 42 cents a share, on sales of some $78 million.

title: Soviet Party Says Its 24th Congress Convenes March 30
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7  The Soviet Communist party today set next March 30 as the start ing date for the 24th party congress, which will chart the country's policies until the middle nineteen seventies.

title: PACT WITH POLES SIGNED BY BRANK
description: WARSAW, Dec. 7Chancel lor Willy Brandt of West Ger many signed a treaty of recon ciliation with Poland today and, expressed the hope that it would close the book on the sufferings and sacrifices of an evil past.

title: BLAZERS TO TEST HOT, COLD KNICKS
description: Still trying to achieve a con sistency of performance that has eluded them through the first 31 games of the National Basketball Association season, the Knicks take on the Port land Trail Blazers tonight at Madison Square Garden.

title: Upward Sales Trend Seen By Chairman of Genesco
description: F. M. Jarman, chairman of Genesco, Inc., said at the an nual shareholder meeting in Nashville yesterday that the company's first fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31 closed on strong note with both whole sale and retail volume making increases in October.

title: 72 MITCHELL ROLE DOUBTED BY AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)  Deputy Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that Attorney General John N. Mitchell, who guided President Nixon's 1968 election victory, does not want to run his 1972 campaign for re election.

title: DR. THOMAS GRAHAM, DERMATOLOGIST, 69
description: SOUTH NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 7Dr. Thomas N. Gra ham of Wilson Point, who re tired in 1966 after 38 years of medical practice in Man hattan, died last Tuesday in a Norwalk convalescent home after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Business in Togo Is Dominated by Women; Togo Business Dominated by Women
description: LOME, TogoThe women's liberation movement is old hat in this WestAfrican coun try. Togo's women have long ceased to worry about equal opportunities in business for a simple reason: as market women many of them own. and operate the most impor tant businessesthe whole saling arid retailing of food, clothing and other consumer products.

title: 3 Top Women Players Face Tennis Ban in Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 7 (AP)  Three of Australia's top women tennis players Kerry Melville, Karen Krantz cke and Mrs. Judy Dalton faced a ban by the Lawn Ten nis Association of Australia to day because they planned to bypass the Australian summer circuit.

title: Unconvincing Suspect in Holdup Attempt Acquitted
description: A man who walked into a Brooklyn bank and handed a woman teller a note read ing, Give me all the money you have, has been acquitted of attempted holdup charges because he failed to frighten the teller.

title: Wife of Johnny Carson Is Suing for a Divorce
description: Johnny Carson, the host of the National Broadcasting Corn pany's Tonight TV show, is being sued for divorce by his wife of seven years, the former Joanne Copeland, sources close to Mrs. Carson said last night.

title: It's More Dazzle for the New Valentino
description: Valentino hasn't given up his V'sthey're woven into his skirts and stockings and they dangle in metal from zippersbut otherwise he's a new man. At least the bou tique collection he brought over from Rome yesterday doesn't look like Mr. Sober sides.

title: Wreckage of Plane Found
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7 (AP)The United States command reported today the finding of the wreckage of C123 transport plane that crashed in central South Viet nam more than a week ago. No survivors were reported among the 6 United States servicemen and 73 South Vietnamese aboard.

title: MAYS TO EXPAND STORE ON 14TH ST.
description: In a countertrend to the de mise of downtown stores and the concern among many mer chants over the future of the centralcore areas, J. W. Mays, Inc., a chain of department stores, has set in motion a plan to increase by 40 per cent the size of its sevenyearold store on 14th Street in Man hattan.

title: Panel Named to Implement Prerace Test of Trotters
description: The appointment of a com mittee to implement proposals for prerace testing of trotters and pacers was announced yes terday by Robert A. Glasser, chairman of the State Harness Racing Commission.

title: FUTURES MIXED IN QUIET TRADING
description: Most commodities markets wore mixed yesterday in light trading.

title: Conservationists Attack Morton's Record in House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) A conservation group alleged today that Representative Rogers C. B. Morton, President Nixon's choice for Secretary of the Interior, bad a terrible record in the House on im portant conservation votes.

title: TEXAS VOTED NO.1 IN COACHES POLL
description: Texas, its mighty offensive machine having ground down its 10 opponents this season, is United Press International's national champion for 1970.

title: VERMEER QUARTET IN PROGRAM HERE
description: The four members of the Vermeer Quartet (Shmuel Ash kenasi and Pierre Menard, vio lins; Scott Nickrenz, viola; Richard. Sher, cello) are young musicians with a wide back ground of solo and chamber music experience. At present they are in residence at North ern Illinois University and on Sunday night the foursome per formed at the New School.

title: Summaries of Races at Westbury
description: FIRSTPace, $3,250, mile.

title: Advertising: Wells, Rich Gets AlkaSeltzer
description: AlkaSeltzer, with all its tiny little bubbles and big, big billings, is going to Wells, Rich, Greene for the biggest account switch of 1970so far.

title: `Fedora Capably Done as ConcertOpera Novelty
description: Giordano's Fedora may not be the worst 19thcentury opera to survive in the inter national repertory, though then again it may be. On grandopera stage, taken too seriously or not seriously enough, it can be a silly bore.

title: Staff at Lincoln Rebuffed On Attempt to Oust Chief
description: Psychiatric staff members at Lincoln Hospital were sternly warned yesterday that they would not be allowed to oust Dr. Gabriel Koz as their chief of service or to dictate the choice of his successor.

title: Royals Set Back Warriors In Game at Omaha, 124113
description: OMAHA, Dec. 7 (AP)  The Cincinnati Royals beat the San Francisco Warriors, 124113, tonight in the first of six Na tional Basketball Assocaition games scheduled here this sea son.

title: High Court Rejects Challenge On Selection of Panther Judge
description: The United States supreme Court declined yesterday to or der the removal of State Su preme Court Justice John M. Murtagh as the presiding judge at the trial in Manhattan of 13 Black Panthers because of de fense allegations that he was handpicked by the prose cutor.

title: F.P.C. Official Resigns To Take Coal Unit Post
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 7 (AP) Carl E. Bagge has resigned from the Federal Power Com mission to head the National Coal Association, a trade or ganization of bituminous coal producers and dealers.

title: Gingerbread Lady to Bow
description: Neil Simon's new play, The Gingerbread Lady,', starring Maureen Stapleton, will make its Broadway debut next Sun day at 7 P.M. at the Plymouth Theater. Robert Moore has di rected the production, which is being presented by Saint Sub ber.

title: Wings Recall Goalie
description: DETROIT, Dec. 8 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings called up Jim Rutherford today to sleeve as backup goalie to Don Mc Leod, who is replacing the in jured Roy Edwards. Edwards will be out three to four weeks with a hairline skull fracture.

title: Advertising: Custom Menus Bring Result,
description: For a year now HuntWes son Foods has been one of those rare enlightened adver tisers that believes that doing something nice for consumers will be appreciated and re warded. And there have been results.

title: Co;nferees Back Bill Letting President Raise U.S. Wages
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)  Senate House conferees agreed today on a bill to permit the President, rather than Con gress, to raise the pay of Fed evil employes.

title: Zapata Norness Net Declines Sharply
description: Zapata Norness, Inc. which is increasing its stake in marine activities with the current con struction of 10 more vessels scheduled for delivery begin ning in 1972, suffered a sharp drop in earnings for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30, primarily because of a loss on heavy con struction operations in West Virginia exceeding $7million.

title: Data on Soviet Budget Limited; Detailed Items Are Kept Secret
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8  Every year since 1959, Vasily F. Gar buzov has gone before the Supreme Soviet, this country's nominal legislative body, and outlined the budget for the next year. His twohour per formance today was no dif ferent from those of other years, and, as usual, the Su preme Soviet will adopt the budget with only minuscule changes,

title: Young Paces Violets
description: New York University .com bined an effective fast break with rebounding superiority to defeat City College, 8169, last night at the loser's Wingate Gymnasium.

title: EAST PAKISTANIS NEAR A MAJORITY IN NEW ASSEMBLY
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 8 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, polit ical leader of the East Paki stani autonomy movement, to night appeared close to winning a majority in the national as sembly that will draft Paki stan's first democratically pre pared constitution.

title: Sonics Defeat 76ers, 107104
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8 (UPI) The Seattle Supersonics over I came a 14point deficit and beat the Philadelphia 76ers, 107104, as Dick Snyder scored 11 points In the final period tonight.

title: Detective Defends Role He Played as a Panther
description: A police undercover agent who pretended to be a ,Black Panther denied yesterday that he had tried to foment con spiracy among them.

title: Dance: Israeli Troupe Right at Home
description: The Batsheva Dance Com pany of Israel, which made its first New York appear ance at the New York City Center last night, is, as na tional dance companies go, a veritable infant. But, as na tional dance companies go, it also goes extraordinarily well. The infant is fit, lusty and a joy to watch in these youthful, vibrant first steps.

title: HERBERT J. BLITZ
description: Herbert J. Blitz,: director of international affairs for the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Memorial Hospital. He was 41 years old and lived in Wash ington.

title: ACCORD REACHED IN TENNIS DISPUTE
description: DALLAS, Dec. 8 (UPI)  An agreement was reached to day that will enable the top contract professionals to par ticipate in three of the world's major tennis tournaments.

title: New Phase in Cambodian War Is Expected
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 7With the rice paddies drying out along the Mekong north east of here, Communist troops have apparently opened a drive to extend their supply lines south toward Pnompenh.

title: AURELIO RICH
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 8 Aurelio Rich, a member of the Stamford Republican Town Committee, died today at St. Joseph's Hospital after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 14 Hall Place.

title: Bears, Color and Skill Open Stand to Jan. 3
description: Scrooge himself would have smiled last night at the Felt Forum, an ideal setting for the Moscow Circus on Ice. The show, which plays through Jan. 3, was simply delightful.

title: Books of The Times
description: I seem to recall that Sturgeon's Law states that 90 per cent of everything is junk. (Don't ask me who Sturgeon is or was. For all I know, he was a fish.) Judg ing from the enormous pile I have just pushed off my desk, Sturgeon's law errs on the side of generosity when applied to this year's crop of children's book. A hard search through several hundred turned up one superb item and only a handful of others that roused the reviewer from his endoftheyear stupor. Brief descriptions of the best of these follow:

title: Theater on. Man in Universe Planned
description: Seventy feet below the street level of its new $100 million skyscraper headquar ters in midtown, McGraw Hill, Inc., is constructing special chamber that will combine the elements of a planetarium, theater, concert hall, art gallery and museum.

title: Renzo Sawada, Diplomat, Headed Consulate Here
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8Ambassador Renzo Sawada, a Japanese diplomat, died yes terday in Tokyo, the Japanese delegation to the United Na tions reported today. He was 82 years old.

title: Saigon Jails 2 Frenchmen
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 8 (UPI)  Two French schoolteachers who raised Vietcong flag atop a South Vietnames statue in July were sentenced to prison today by a miltary court. Andre Marcel Menras, 25 years old, was sen tenced to three years in prison and Jean Pierre Debris, 26, to four years.

title: The Tides of European Unity
description: HAMBURGIf you take a jet from Boston to Hamburg these days, the customs officials frisk you at both endsgeographically and physically. for concealed weapons. In Boston they are rather apologetic about it, and in Hamburg slightly officious, but slowly and unevenly a crude system of police control is being established over international air transportation.

title: Killing of 144 Vietcong Reported In First 8 Days of Drive in Forest
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 8 (AP)South Vietnamese infantrymen were reported to day to be continuing a drive into the U Minh Forest seeking about 3,000 Vietcong believed, hiding in the mangrove swamps and bamboo thickets.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
The Master Plan for Manhattan Termed a Master Sham by Sutton
description: Manhattan Borough President Percy E. Sutton yesterday de nounced the City Planning Commission's newly released master plan for Manhattan as an outdated, illconceived, se cretly contrived master sham.

title: 70 SHOTS TAKEN IN THIRD QUARTER
description: Finding in the Portland Trail Blazers an offenseminded op ponent not too well equipped to play defense, the New York Knicks followed suit at Madi son Square Garden last night and outshot the National Bas ketball Association expansion team, 139121.

title: St. Louis 72 Golf Site
description: St. Louis Country Club will be the site of the 1972 women's amateur golf championship Aug. 14 through 19, it was an nounced yesterday by the United States Golf Association. The Jefferson City Country Club will play host to the 1972 junior championship Aug. 7 through 12.

title: DOUGLAS ABSTAINS FROM MANY CASES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 jus tice William O. Douglas has disqualified himself from a series of Supreme Court cases recently, reportedly to avoid any appearance of conflict of interest while his conduct is being investigated in Congress.

title: Chaparrals Davis Waived
description: DALLAS, Dec. 8 (AP)  A spokesman for the Texas Chap arrals said today that Willie Davis, a reserve center, had been placed on waivers.

title: U.S. GROUP PROTESTS JAILING OF AMALRIK
description: A group of American histori an have cabled the Soviet Union to protest the imprison ment of Andrei Amalrik, the dissident Soviet author. He was convicted last month on charges of having defamed the Soviet Union and was sen tenced to three years in a prison camp.

title: Texas Pleased to Share No.1 Award With Ohio state
description: Texas and Ohio State, un defeated and untied, settled last night fora share of the MacArthur Bowl, which is presented annually to the No. 1 college team by the National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame.

title: Boston University to Get Speaker's Official Papers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, S (AP) House Speaker John W. Mc Cormack, Democrat of Mas sachusetts, announced yester day that lie was giving his of ficial papers to Boston Univer sity.

title: Pete's Chick Pays $9.60 In Taking Laurel Sprint
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec.8Mrs. Albert Lowenthal'S Pete's Chick took the lead shortly after:the start and pulled away in: the stretch to score a 3 victory today in the $11,000 Brazen Brat Purse for Mary landbred 3year old fillies at Laurel Race Course.

title: Mercantile Board Gets Chief, 39
description: The election of Richard B. Levine, 39 years old, as pres ident of the New York, Mer cantile Exchange was an nounced yesterday by Llewel lyn Watts Jr., chairman of the board_ of exchange. Mr. Levine formerly was vice president for corporate de velopment and assistant to the president of Blair & Co., Inc.

title: Allied Chemical Raises Sulphuric Acid Price, Effective Immediately
description: The Allied Chemical Corpo ration, the nation's largest pro ducer of sulphuric acid, an nounced yesterday a rise in the price of this basic chemical by $2 a ton, effective immediately.

title: Heath Government Taking a Firm Line Against Growing Turmoil of Walkouts
description: LONDON, Dec. 8The Gov ernment of Prime Minister Heath took a firm line today against growing strike turmoil.

title: Bridge
description: For obvious reasons most experts choose their partners from their own city or geo graphical area. The opportun ity for regular practice and discussion is clearly a major factor in success at the na tional level.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per. centage losses on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Memoir of Johnson Written by Daughter
description: Mrs. Patrick J. Nugent, daughter of ,former President Lyndon B. Johnson, has writ ten a 5,000word memoir of her. father's final year in the White House as visualized through the eyes, of his pet mongrel dog, Yuki.

title: With No Wheel in Town, Liberty Rings the Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8  Attendance and handle at Liberty Bell race track took a pronounced jump today when Eagle Downs Racing Associa tion opened its winter meeting on the day following Aque, duct's close.

title: Safety Council Clarifies Stand on Christmas Lights
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 8 (UN)  The National Safety Council has clarified an earlier statement regarding miniature Christmas tree lights that it had described as Italian

title: Lakers Subdue Suns
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 8 (AP) Wilt Chamberlain's 36 _ points led the Los Angeles Lakers to a 121112 victory tonight over the Phoenix Suns.

title: New Couple Help the Neediest
description: Two former contributors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund have sent a com bined gift this year. In a note accompanying their donation of $50, they explained why.

title: Californian to Attempt New Ascent of Everest
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Dec. 8 (AP)Norman G. Dyrenfurth of Pasadena, Calif., who led successful expedition to Mount Everest in 1963, is returning next spring with a 12nation team for another attempt.

title: Apollo 15 Team Practices On a Volcano in Hawaii
description: Apollo Hawaii, Dec. 8 (UPI) Apollo 15 astronauts are practicing for next July's lunar mission on Kilauea volcano, where the terrain is said to closely resemble the moon's sur face.

title: HOUSE DECLINES TO BACK SENATE IN SST FUND CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The House refused to go along with the Senate today and declined to retract its earlier support for the $290million appropriation for development of the 1,800 mileanhour supersonic jet transport.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, Dec. 8, 1970

title: Dr. Burns's Economic Strategy.
description: If thete were any remaining doubts that the Nixon Ad ministration is undergoing a major change in its basic economic policies, they should have been erased by the speech delivered by Chairman Arthur F. Burns of the Federal Reserve Board at Pepperdine College in Los Angeles Monday night.

title: PALESTINE RIGHTS STRESSED IN U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8Over strong objections by the United States, the Gen eral Assembly today adopted a resolution asserting that the people of Palestine have the inalienable rights of selfde termination.

title: U.S. Suspects Lisbon of Using Herbicides in Angola
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  The United States has indica tions that Portugal has used herbicides to destroy food crops raised by rebels in Angola, ac cording to State Department officials.

title: INVESTORS COOL TO 3 BOND ISSUES
description: Investors balked yesterday at the lower interest rates re sulting from the pronounced advance in the bond market in November and early December.

title: EastWest Trade Curbs Assailed by Czech Exile
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Czechoslovakia's former eco nomic planner told Congress to day that United States restric tions on trade with Communist countries supported Stalinist forces and did not impede the Soviet military machine.

title: McGill, Citing Values, To Forgo Inaugural
description: Dr. William J. McGill, Co lumbia University's new pres ident, will forgo his inaugural ceremony, asking that the $18,000 allotted for it be used for student financial aid.

title: 12 Blacks, Officials Confer
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 8 (UPI) A dozen black University of

title: Rosewall, Layer Win
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8 (AP)Ken Rosewall of Australia defeated Zeljko Franulovic of Yugo slavia, 63, 63, today for his second victory in the $50,000 roundrobin tennis tournament involving the top Grand Prix finishers.

title: IN ARAB CAPITALS, A CALMER PERIOD
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 8 New nightclubs are blossoming in this cosmopolitan capital. In Damascus, the talk is of civil liberties. In Cairo, the papers have been full of reports about the tea and sugar supply, while in Amman, the Government has banned teadrinking by of ficials during office tours.

title: RANGERS SUBDUED BY CANUCKS, 4 TO 1
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum. bia, Dec. 8 (UPI)The New York Rangers, with a chance to move past the Boston Bruins into first place in the National Hockey League East, played the Vancouver Canucks tonight for the second time in three days. A victory would give the Ran gers 37 points to 36 for the Bruins, who did not play to night.

title: Places to Go and Things to See for Children
ROBINSON TO DELIVER SOME OF SECURITIES
description: Certain customers of Robin son & Co., a brokerage house involved in bankruptcy pro ceedings, will receive their holdings as a result of a ruling in Philadelphia yesterday by Thomas J. Curtin, Federal Court referee in bankruptcy for the concern.

title: British Columbian Dam Is Called a Catastrophe for Wildlife in Alberta Delta
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 30A new lesson in man's un witing disruption of nature Is being learned in northern Alberta, in the delta of the Peace and Athabasca Rivers.

title: GypsyCabsLessen Taxi Strike Impact
description: Despite intensive efforts to repel their invasion of midtown, a growing tide of gypsy cabs along with the many striking cab drivers in their private carsgave Manhattan a sem blance of taxi service yesterday.

title: CHEMICAL BANK SAYS SUIT IS GROUNDLESS
description: The Chemical Bank said yes terday that a class action lawsuit against the bank charg ing civil violations of the anti trust, securities and banking laws was entirely without foundation. Chemical said the facts would show that the bank was solely interested in acting in the best interests of those for whom it has fiduciary re sponsibility.

title: From a Kibbutz at the Border, Arab Farms Appear Peaceful
description: KFAR RUPPIN, Israel Nov. 28The farmers of this border kibbutz are savoring a peace ful panorama these days, the sights of Arab farmers and shepherds returning to their fields along the muddy waters of the Jordan River.

title: Rockets Acquire Egan
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 8 (AP) The Cleveland Cavaliers traded Johnny Egan to the San Diego Rockets today for a thirdround draft choice and an undisclosed amount of money. Egan is in his 10th year in the National Basketball Association.

title: Not Too Impressive
description: Just before the fight Yancey Durham was standing at ringside and offering ran dom observations. As a manager and trainer for Joe Frazier, the recognized world heavyweight champion, the deep voiced Yancey speaks with considerable authority.

title: VOLPE ATTACKED ON SST STATEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Sec retary of Transportation John A. Volpe made available late today the department's final statement on the environmental impact of the supersonic trans port, together with comments from other agencies.

title: Beaty Tallies 23 as Stars Send Pros to 125106 Loss
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 8 (UPI) With Zelmo Beaty scoring 23 points, the Utah Stars, leaders of the American Basketball As sociation Western Division, handed the Memphis Pros their fourth straight loss tonight, 125106. The closest the Pros could get was 12 points in the third quarter.

title: STATE DEPT. GIVES A REVAMPING PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The State Department announced an internal reorganization pro gram today that it said was designed to create a new breed of diplomatmanagers for the diplomacy of the Seven ties.

title: Dr. Philip E. Smith, Noted For Pituitary Research
