description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Dec. 9Maj. Cecil Montgomery Moore, who served as a pilot with the ,Royal Flying Corps in World'. War I and was awarded the Distinguished Fly ing Cross, died here last night after a brief illness.

title: AN O.E.O. HEALTH AIDE EXPECTED TO RESIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9  The Director of Health Affairs of the Office of Economic Oppor tunity is expected to resign next year from the agency, which has developed many in novative programs to improve medical care for the ??oor.

title: To the Basques It Is Their Uniqueness That Is on Trial in Spain
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 9 Twothirds of the way north from this drab Castilian town, where 15 Basques are on trial, the train hurdles one of those sharply defined geographic boundaries that are more com mon in fairy tales than in life.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY TRIMS ITS BUDGET
description: Mrs. Bess Meyerson Grant, the city's Commissioner of Con sumer Affairs, declared yester day that her department's back log of consumer complaints was frightening, but she asked the city for less money for fiscal 1971.72 than the department is getting now.

title: Senate SST Filibuster Pledged; Conferees Will Convene Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Sena tor William Proxmire an nounced today that Senate op ponents of the supersonic trans port would filibuster against the Administration's entire transportation budget if it con tained any restored funding for the program.

title: A WILDCAT STRIKE TIES UP THE PORT
description: Officers of the International Longshoremen's Association and the New York Shipping Association met and agreed to submit the controversy to joint industry and union con trol board. The union an nounced that it would urge the longshoremen to return to work today.

title: Avery Strakosch Denham; Wrote for Many Magazines
description: ROSEMONT, Pa., Dec. 9 Avery Strakosch Denham, who for: many; years was a contrib utor of articles and short stories to many national publications, died yesterday. Her late hus band, William Denham, was a real estate broker.

title: Roads Replace Railroads For 144,500 Commuters
description: A total of 144,500 commuters in the metropolitan area were expected to switch to private cars and buses today as all suburban commuter lines except the Long Island Rail road and the PATH lines into New Jersey were shut down at midnight by the rail strike.

title: Bellevue Prison Ward Called Perilous
description: Prison wards in Bellevue Hospital's psychiatric divi sion are described in a new state inspection report as dan gerously overcrowded and un derstaffed.

title: Too Many Sex Movies Prompt Censor to Quit
description: LONDON Dec. 9 (AP) Britain's official film censor is quiting because he has had enough of sex movies.

title: ARTHUR BARBER
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 9 Arthur, Barber, a former of ficial of the Barber Steamship Lines of New York, which his father ,, Herbert Barber had founded, died today here at Englewood Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 69 East Hamilton Avenue.

title: Gross Scores Failure to Start Football Hall of Fame Building
description: The National Football Foun dation and Hall of Fame promised college football fans a building to house its Hall of Fame many years ago. Rutgers University donated 10 valuable acres as a site. Thousands of persons and many colleges donated to the project which was to be comparable with the Baseball Hall of Fame in Coo perstown, N. Y.; the Professional Football Hall of Fame In Canton, Ohio, and the Basketball Hall of Fame in Springfield, Mass.

title: Vibraphonist Leads Roy Ayers Ubiquity At Village Vanguard
description: Roy Ayers, who pounded his vibes Roy, Herbie Mann's group for several years, Is now lead ing a quintet of his own, Roy Ayers Ubiquity, which is at the Village Vanguard through Sun day.

title: EDWARD E. SIMMONS
description: BRONXVILLE; N. Y., Dec. Edward E. Simmons, known professionally as Steve Ed wards during a long career in film industry publicity and ad: vertising, died today in Law rence Hospital after a short illness. He lived here at 36 Penfield Road West.

title: U. of Massachusetts Installs a New Head
description: BOSTON, Dec. 9 (AP)Dr. Robert C. Wood, former chairman of the Massachu setts Bay Transportation Au thority, was installed today as president of the Univer sity of Massachusetts.

title: Salvation Army Honors Helen Hayes
description: Helen Hayes entertained the Salvation Army yesterday with a few bars of a song from a 1906 musical, The Belle of New York The musical, she said, starred the exquisite Edna May, who played a Salva tion Army lass.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of listed corporations. The list follows:

title: 16 Seized in Lettuce Protest
description: Sixteen demonstrators sup porting Cesar Chavez's drive to unionize California lettuce pickers were arrested yester day on charges of blocking, a loading platform in the Hunts Point Produce Market in the Bronx. The group, including four women, were among about 100 pickets who started demon strating at the market shortly after 6 A.M., the police said. Summonses were issued call ing for appearances in Bronx Criminal Court next Tuesday on trespass charges.

title: AIDES OF HUGHES SEEK AGREEMENT
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 9 A negotiated settlement was under discussion tonight be tween executives of the Hughes Tool Company and Robert A. Maheu, the man they have tried to dismiss as director of the Nevada operations of Howard Hughes.

title: Army Six Beats Princeton
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. Army scored four goals in the second period tonight and defeated the Princeton hockey team, 72. The victory was Army's first of the season after two losses. John Dawalgo and John Scott led the cadets attack, scoring two goals each.

title: 96 Decorated for P.O.W. Raid
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., Dec. 9 (AP)  Secretary of Defense Melvin It,. Laird presented Silver Star medals to Army and Air force commandos today in cere monies that disclosed that the unsuccessful effort to free American prisoners from North Vietnam was greater in size and scope than previously indi cated. Mr. Laird pinned medals on 96 of the raiders. The Army said the 96, plus four others decorated earlier at the White House, made up the party of 100 men that raided an evac uated prison camp at Sontay Nov. 21.

title: Peter L. Tea, ExProfessor Of Drafting at C.C.N.Y., 83
description: Peter L. Tea, professor emer itus of drafting at City Col lege, died yesterday in a Long Branch (N.J.) nursing home after a short illness. He was 83 years old and lived at 860 West 181st Street.

title: Cowles Sets Special Meeting
description: Cowles Communications, inc., announced yesterday that it had scheduled a special meet ing of stockholders for Feb. 18, 1971, at the company's offices in Des Moines, Iowa, to act upon the corporation's proposed transaction with The New York Times Company. On Oct. 28 an agreement in principle called for The Times to acquire a num ber of Cowles properties in ex change for 2,600,000 shares of Class A common stock of The Times. The properties will be acquired subject to $15million of longterm debt. Stockholders of record as of Jan. 15 will be entitled to vote.

title: HOUSE UNIT TRIMS LIST OF RADICALS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9  The House Internal Security Committee issued today a re vised list of what it called radical and/or revolutionary speakers who appeared on col lege campuses over the last two years.

title: 3,167 Workers Laid Off Contract Talks With Auto Union Begin
description: DETROIT, Dec. 9  The Chrysler Corporation has laid off 3,167 workers in the last two weeks and plans to stop most of its automobile produc tion in the last two weeks of the year.

title: Jane Fonda Talk Postponed
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Dec. 9 (AP)Jane Fonda, the actress, an antiwar activist whose causes also include support of black militant and American In dian causes, is being asked to postpone a speaking appearance at Texas Christian University. Betty Knox, the school's in formation director, said yester day that an invitation to make the speech had been indefi nitely postponed because it did not have sufficient administra tive approval.

title: WESTPORT. SPLIT OVER BUSING VOTE
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 9 A petition to unseat the chair man of the Board of Education here began circulating today after the chairman cast the de ciding vote to bring 25.Bridge port slum children into the nearly allwhite Burr Farms Elementary School.

title: Vietnam CeaseFire
description: Proposals for a yearend ceasefire in Vietnam, now under active consideration by the Nixon Administra tion, could make a major contribution to peace in South east Asia. But the bid for a fiveweek halt in hostilities is doomed from the start unless implemented with imagi nation and courage.

title: Move Started in House to Clear Bill Against Job Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A bipartisan drive opened today to force House action this year on a bill giving the Federal Government power to enforce nondiscrimination in employ ment.

title: `Eyewitness News Causing Change at Other Stations
description: Over at WCBSTV, Channel 2, it's being called The Re venge of Fred Friendly, as the station's news department pre pares to redesign itself some what along the lines of non commercial television news programs. At WNBCTV, Chan nel 4, anxiety is in the air, as various proposals are being made to rejuvenate a limping news operation. But at WABC TV, Channel 7, they're chuck ling with satisfaction because they're the cause of it all.

title: Syracuse Downs Cornell With Late Surge, 93 to 71
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 9A surge in the last 10 minutes of the game enabled the Syra cuse basketball team to defeat Cornell tonight, 9371. The Or ange scored 11 straight points in three minutes with their 6 foot11inch center, Bill Smith, sidelined with foul trouble.

title: FORDHAM BEATS SETON HALL, 9780
description: Burik, Sullivan Help Rams Gain Third Triumph

title: Laver Beats Ashe In Tokyo, 64, 62; Smith Tops Kodes
description: TOKYO, Dec. 9 (UPI)Rod Laver outplayed Arthur Ashe today to gain his second straight victory in the $50,000 Masters Grand Prix round robin tennis tournament, The scores were 64, 62.

title: Rosenfeld/Sirowitz Adds Partner
description: One of the early news stories of this year was the opening of Harper Rosenfeld Sirowitz, which toward mid year became Rosenfeld/Siro witz with the departure of Marion Harper, its president. With the new year, it will be come Rosenfeld, Sirowitz & Lawson with the arrival of Tom Lawson from Ogilvy & Mather.

title: BIDS MEN RETURN
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Dec. 10  A nationwide rail strike began at 12:01 this morn ing.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Orders Equal Welfare Aid in State
description: An order requiring the State Department of Social Services to pay the same welfare grants to residents of upstate coun ties as it does in New York City was upheld yesterday by a threejudge panel of the Unit ed States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: VIETNAMESE SAID TO CROSS BORDER
description: SVAYRIENG, Cambodia, Dec. 9More than 400 South Viet namese peasant families have taken over abandoned Cambo dian farmhouses and ricelands as far as seven miles inside Cambodia near the border with South Vietnam, the area's mili tary governor said today.

title: BULLETS TROUNCE BUCKS, 127 TO 97
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 9 (AP) Wes Unseld set the pace to night as the Baltimore Bullets routed the Milwaukee Bucks, 12797, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: 1,600 at Memphis to Be Out of JobsLag in TV Sales Cited
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 9 (UPI) Citing economic necessities and the failure of the retail televi sion market to grow as pro jected, RCA said today it would close its $20million plant here, putting about 1,600 persons out of work.

title: MARKET ROLLS ON T013MONTH HIGH
description: The stock market's easy money rally, circumventing possible roadblock posed by the nationwide rail strike, rolled forward yesterday to new high ground for 1970.

title: Cornell's Marinaro Takes Football Rushing Honors
description: Ed Mar,inaro of Cornell is the major college football rushing champion although Don Mc Cauley of North Carolina set a single season total rushing rec ord.

title: LTV Has Doubled Reserves for Loss
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., the financially ailing conglomorate, disclosed yesterday that it has established reserves as of Sept. 30 totaling $61.79million for possible losses that might re sult from the disposition of sub sidiaries.

title: The Earthians Critical Moment
description: Now 75 and born before the auto mobile, radio, airplane or cinema, my memory spans humanity's transition from a myriad of vastly isolated, popu larly illiterate communities and tribes .. with only vague awareness of one another . . . now converted into the beginning of an omniintegrated, free. ly intereirculating, omniliterate world society. .

title: Copeland's Help for Son Detailed
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 10The costly role that Lammot du Pont Copeland Sr., board chairman of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., has played in his son's tangled financial af fairs was discussed publicly today for the first time.

title: Ozite Omits Dividend
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (UPI) Directors of the Ozite Corpora tion voted today to omit the usual quarterly dividend. The last payment was 15 cents a share on Oct. 20.

title: Professional Football Statistics
description: Interception leaderRobinson, Kansas Cltv, 10. Punting leaderLewis, Cincinnati, 46.2 yard average. Punt return leaderPodolak, Kansas City, 13.9yard average. Kickoff return leaderDuncan, Baltimore, 36.4yard average.

title: Syracuse Plans No ShakcUp in Athletics
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 10 (AP) John E. Corbally Jr., chan cellor of Syracuse University, said today that a committee report on racism in the school's athletic department was not antiathletics and that he saw no need for per sonnel changes.

title: The Pennsylvanians Offer Concert Here In Customary Style
description: Fred Waring's Pennsylvani ans, the quintessential purvey ors of collegiate rahrah in the nineteentwenties, still have some of that innocent college aura five decades later.

title: Commodity Price Index Off From the WeekAgo Level
description: The wholesale commodity price index fell to 105.6 Tues day from 106.1 last week.

title: FRANK COLEMAN 3D, ACTOR AND SINGER
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Dec. 10Frank B. Coleman 3d, an actor and singer who appeared on the stage in New York, died on Saturday in Bassett Hospital. He was 35 years old.

title: Auto Companies, Post Offices and Commuters Felt Impact of OneDay Rail Strike
description: Although the rail strike was shortlived, its impact was felt almost immediately around the nation.WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) Postal officials reported some success today in keeping Christmas packages moving be yond the 300mile embargo limit.

title: Nixon Indirectly Predicts Drop In Jobless to 4.8% in December
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Nixon, arguing to night that unemployment had been lower during his Adminis tration than under the Dem ocrats, indirectly forecast a. huge drop in the unemployment rate in December.

title: New York and Toronto Get Soccer. Franchises
description: The North American Soccer League, the offspring of the unsuccessful National Profes sional Soccer League and the United Soccer Association, ex panded to eight teams yester day for the 1971 season by granting franchises to New York and Toronto.

title: Johnny Mostil, 74, Starred As White Sox Outfielder
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (AP) Johnny Mostil, former Chicago White Sox star rated almost as highly as legendary Tris Speak er as a centerfielder, died here today after a long illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Letter Purportedly by Hughes Backs Tool Company in Dispute
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 10 A longhand letter purportedly from Howard R. Hughes turned up here today. In it, he chides two of his executives for not solving the problem of Ma heu, and complains that this bad publicity seems to con tinue.

title: Zoological Society Elects Businessman as President
description: The New York Zoological Society has elected Robert G. Goelet, a conservationist and business executive, as presi dent, succeeding Laurance S. Rockefeller, who was named chairman of the board.

title: Howard University Is Given FM Station By Washington POst
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) The Washington Post Com pany announced today that it was giving its FM radio station to Howard University, com posed primarily of black stu dents.

title: Teacher of Social Protocol Upholds the Old Order
description: WASHINGTONThe wife of a Congressman who had been in Washington 20 years signed up for Mrs. Glad stone Williams's class in social protocol because she didn't know what to do with her hands. Mrs. Williams sug gested she hold a tea cup in one hand and a saucer in the other.

title: News Summary and Index.
description: President Nixon, in a nationally televised news conference, declared yesterday that military targets in North Vietnam would be bombed if the level of fighting in South Vietnam is increased by the North Viet namese. He added that missile and mili tary complexes in North Vietnam would be bombed if American reconnaissance planes were fired upon over that country. [Page 1, Columns 23; Text, P. 32.]

title: At Least 81 Are Killed In PeruEcuador Quake
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 10 (AP) An earthquake that rocked the coastal areas of northern Peru and southern Ecuado'r killed at least 81 persons, Government sources said to day.

title: Rail Striker Killed by 2 Cars
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 10 (UPI)  William Mohon, 40 years old, a striking Louisville & Nashville Railroad employe, was killed today when he was struck by two cars shortly after picket lines went up here in the rail strike. The police said that Mr. Mohon had been struck near the entrance to the rail road's Strawberry Yards in South Louisville.

title: .SHARES ON AMEX ::.iMIXED AT CLOSE
description: The American Stock Ex change did slightly better yes terday after two consecutive sessions of declines and finish ed Mixed on moderate volume.

title: PACIFICATION AIDE WILL VISIT LAIRD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The head of the pacification program in South Vietnam has been summoned to confer here next week with Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird amid a controversy in the Adminis tration over the effectiveness of the effort to suppress the Vietcong's underground organi zation.

title: Penn Routs N.Y.U. 9162
description: Phil Hankinson lived up to his reputation as a scorer last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Cuban Economy Is Strained Because Sugar Falls Short of Goal
description: HAVANA, Dec. 7  Cubans have begun their great annual effort to harvest sugar, the is land's main crop, but this time in a grim mood. .

title: U. S. and Agency Bonds
description: (Prices In 32d of a feint. Composite bill yields In basis points.)

title: Hughes Aides Looking for Property in Bahamas That Could Be Used for Office and Living Facilities
description: PARADISE ISLAND, the Ba hamas, Dec. 10  Whatever Howard Hughes's longterm plans are, his representatives) have been looking for property in Nassau to convert into office and living facilities.

title: French and Italian Skiers Break Legs During Training
description: SESTRIERE, Italy, Dec. 10 (UPI)Ingrid Lafforgue, the world special slalom champion, fell and broke two leg bones during training today for this weekend's world skiing meet.

title: Civilian Trial Lawyer for G. l.'s Charges Obstruction in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 10Allegations that American servicemen here are being denied their right to civilian counsel in courtmar tial trials were made today by an American lawyer who came to South Vietnam to defend them,

title: Adm. William Freseman Dies; Led Unit in Normandy Assault
description: Rear Adm. William Langfitt Freseman, U.S.N., retired, died Tuesday at ColumbiaPresby terian Medical Center. He was 69 years old and lived at 1600 Boulevard East, West New York. N. J.

title: Draft Officials Destroying Records of OverAge Men
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) The Selective Service System said today that it was destroy ing the files of Almost 26 mil lion overage registrants in an effort to save on maintenance costs, staff and space.

title: RUBE GOLDBERG HONORED AT RITES
description: Cartoonists, prizefighters and oldtime political figures were among the 400 people who crowded into Frank E. Camp bell's yesterday to attend brief funeral service for Rube Goldberg.

title: Catskill Center Keeps Humble For Skiers Who Like It Homey
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Dec 9In this Sullivan County region of plush hotels, the homey Holiday Mountain ski area provided a decided con trast.

title: MRS. R. F. HUNNEWELL
description: Mrs. Richard F. Hunnewell, the former Rosalie Clark, died of cancer yesterday at her apartment at 840 Park Avenue. Mrs. Hunnewell, who also had a home on Chicken Valley Road, Locust Valley, L. I., was 42 years old.

title: Foe of Corruption Carrying Grenades Gets to See T hieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 10A South Vietnamese Army doctor, carrying four hand grenades and a copy of the Constitution of South Viet nam, succeeded in reaching President Nguyen Van Thieu today to complain about cor runtion in this country.

title: `Trelawny of Wells Folds Because of Theater Strike
description: A third Off Broadway produc tion, Trelawny of the Wells, a revival of Sir Arthur Wing Pinero's play, will not reopen when the Actors Equity Asso ciation strike is settled. Other productions that have decided to close during the 25day strike are What the Butler Saw and Score.

title: Taxi Strike Aiding Transit Authority
description: The city's public transit lines have gained more than 200,000 fares a day since the taxi strike, began, according to data re leased yesterday by the Transit Authority.

title: CONFEREES ON SST BACK ALLOCATION OF $210MILLION
description: WASHINGTON,. Dec. 10  House and Senate conferees agreed tonight on a $210mil lion compromise appropriation for the supersonic transport $80million less than the Ad ministration requested and the House  has approved, but enough to keep the program alive.

title: CHILE SEIZES AIDE OF RED NEWSPAPER
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10 Officials of Chile's leftist Gov ernment jailed the director of the Communist party newspa per yesterday as a result of libel charges brought by a member of the Christian Demo cratic opposition.

title: Humphrey Urges Democrats to Avoid Divisive Prirmaries in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 _ Hubert H. Humphrey believes that Democratic leaders should unite behind the party's most promising Presidential candi date within the next year, avoiding any divisive primary competition and saving the party's financial resources for the battle against President Nixon.

title: State Judge Promoted
description: Supreme Court Justice J. Ir win Shapiro has been named an associate justice of the Ap pellate Division of the Supreme Court's second Judicial Depart ment, Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday. Justice Sha piro, 66 years old, will fill the vacancy created when Marcus G. Christ was elevated to Pre siding Justice of the Appellate Division.

title: Riga Offers Mixture of a Latvian Past and the Soviet Way of Life
description: RIGA, U.S.S.R., Dec, 2 Walking the narrow, twisting, cobbled streets past the Gothic houses of old Riga at night, the visitor can easily imagine that around the next corner he will meet a Livo nian knight bent on de bauchery or a frostpuffing 15thcentury bourgeois mer chant calculating his profits but never Lenin, who visit ed here, or even Peteris Stucka, the head of the first Communist government that took power here in 1919, Joldingit for only five months.

title: Protests Persist at U.S. Ports, but 11,000 Men Return
description: Labor troubles lingered in ports from New York to San Juan, P. R., yesterday following a oneday wildcat walkout here on Wednesday by 13,000 longshoremen.

title: NineHams Meet JY1 (Hussein Here)
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 King Hussein of Jordan met informally last night at Blair House, the Presidential guest house, with nine American friends who had previously known him only as a deep, resonant voice as he chatted by ham radio.

title: Executive Changes
description: Dale W, McMillen Jr. has been elected chair man of the board of the Central Soya Company while retaining the responsibilities of chief execu tive officer. He succeeds Harold W. McMillen who will continue to serve as a member of the board and will act as chairman of the executive com mittee. The Fort Wayne, Ind., company also elected Joseph F. Jones as president and made Burt A. Townsend and Douglas G. Fleming executive vice presidents.

title: Treasury Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Cash deposits and withdrawals, close of business, Dec. 7:

title: Yale Weighs PayasY ouEarn Tuition Financing
description: Yale University is consider ing a plan that would allow students to finance their college education after they graduate through annual payments of fixed percentage of their in come over a long period of time, perhaps 30 years.

title: CHARLES. S. JONES. OF RICHFIELD OIL
description: LOS . ANGELES; Dec. 10 Charles S. Jones, former presi dent and chairman of the board of the Richfield Oil Corpora tion, died last night at the Good Samaritan Hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: Exacta Returns $ 2 ,169 for $ 2
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 The largest exacta this year at Liberty Bell race track and the second largest in the track's history, clicked today when Brandys Play ($59.80) and Harry's Hat ($25) paid $2,169.40 for $2 in the third race.

title: INTERVIEW BY SNOW WITH CHOU APPEARS
description: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 10 (AP) Premier Chou Enlai of Commu nist China has told Edgar Snow, the American writer that the United States, the Soviet Union and Japan were menacing China with the threat of war.

title: Mercedes Shows New Car Brake System
description: STUTTGART, .West Ger many, Dec. 10A new brak ing system capable of reducing the distance an automobile needs to stop on wet surfaces by up to 40 per cent was shown by MercedesBenz here today.

title: Memorial   Seruices
description: ADAMSFrank S. Memorial service ?? Frank S. Adams on Sunday, Dec. 13, o'clock, Madison Room of Princeton CIub, IS West 43d Street. In lieu of flowers. donations to Princeton University would he appreciated.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: In 1955, when his master ly Matching The Hatch was published, Ernest Schwiebert won immediate acclaim as a fly fisherman  author of the first rank.

title: NIXON PROMISES TO SEEK HARMONY IN NEW CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 President Nixon pledged to night to work in harmony with Republicans and Democrats in the new Congress, and said that under no circumstances would he support a thirdparty candidacy against a regular Re publican.

title: ROCKEFELLER ASKS ACTION ON HOUSING
description: Governor Rockefeller, de scribing statewide housing as the greatest challenge to next year's Legislature, called yes terday for second passage of constitutional amendment man dating aid to community de velopment.

title: Lockhart Is Working Overtime In Preparation for Cardinals
description: Even if Sunday's game against the Cardinals in St. Louis wasn't for first place in the National Football Con ference Eastern Division, Carl (Spider) Lockhart, New York Giants defensive back, thinks he would be up for it.

title: The New Political Pragmatism
description: HELSINKI, Dec. 10In Europe to day there seems to be a new deter mination to deal with the facts of power and geography, and nowhere, with the possible exception of West Germany, is this tendency more appar ent than in Finland.

title: New President, 46, Assumes No. 2 Job at Auto Maker
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10  Lee A. Iacocca was named today pres ident of the Ford Motor Com pany by Henry Ford 2d, the company's chairman.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Won't you be seated, please. Miss Thomas has the first question tonight.

title: CarTrain Crash Kills 7
description: BRENT, Ala., Dec. 10 (AP) Five children, their mother and an aunt were killed last night when their car struck a freight train making its last run before the rail strike began. Brent Po lice Chief James Fondren said that the dead were Willia C. Lockett, 39 years old; her five children, Robert, 16; James, 14; Rose Mary, 12; Willie Dan, 9, and Michael, 8, and Mrs. Lock ett's sister, Louise Wilson, 50, Chicago, Ill.

title: Thursday, Doc. 10, 1970
description: (Rates le per cent) DOMES1 IC MARKET

title: Reserve Applies Pressure To Stem Credit Overflow
description: Massive flows of funds through the money market forced the Federal Reserve Sys tem to take extraordinary ac tion to offset the development of undue ease in credit, bank ing figures published yesterday showed.

title: U.N. Extends Cyprus Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 10 (Reuters)The Security Council unanimously approved a resolution today extending the mandate of the United Na tions peacekeeping force on Cyprus until June 15.

title: Solzhenitsyn Joins Rights Committee
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10  Alek sandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the 1970 Nobel Prize winner for litera ture, agreed today to join a , committee for human rights recently founded by Andrei D. Sakharov, the  physicist, and two of his colleagues.

title: INQUIRY ON POLICE SCORED IN COUNCIL
description: A City Councilman introduced a bill yesterday aimed at abol ishing the special commission investigating charges of wide spread corruption in the city's Police Department.

title: In the Tight World of 64 Squares, Chess Is Everything
description: PALMA, Majorca,. Dec. 9 Promptly at 4 P.M. the buzzer sounds. The audience hushes. The 24 chess champions troop into the narrow room and sit down in silence.

title: U.S. Agency, Charging Job Bias, Opposes Rate Rise for A .T. &T.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission sought today to block a rate increase for the American Telephone and Tele graph Company on the ground that its operating companies engaged in pervasive, system wide and blatantly unlawful discrimination in the employ ment of women, blacks and Spanishsurnamed Americans.

title: Lindsay and the Police: Graft Inquiry and Pay Dispute Widening the Rift
description: The Police Department and Mayor Lindsay are headed toward what is likely to be one of, the most tumultuous confrontations of their often turbulent relationship. The ex tent of the bitterness, many politicians agreed yesterday, is likely to match the stakes in the strugglesthe city's

title: Hofstra Beats Sacred Heart For Fourth Straight, 9188
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 10 Hofstra won its fourth straight game tonight, heating Sacred Heart, 9188. Quinas Browei led the Dutchmen with 2] points. Ed Czernota of the losers 28, including 17 in the second half.

title: Muscovite Detained Again in Citizenship Case as U. S. Embassy Aides Await Him
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10A So viet Jew seeking to establish American citizenship said to day that the police had threat ened him with a prison term if he persisted in his efforts to enter the United States Em bassy.

title: Turmoil on the Rails
description: The illegal strike that shut down the railroads yesterday is a dismaying new reflection of the breakdown respect for orderly process in conservative as well as radical sectors of American society.

title: Psychologist Will Head Public Relations Society
description: How's this for a sign of the times? The Public Relations Society of America has se lected a social psychologist as its first paid professional president.

title: Issues in the Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, repre senting 69 of the 72 fleet owners who operate 6,816 cabs; the City Council, which has the responsibility for setting taxi fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who recommended a fare increase at an earlier stage in negotiations.

title: HARRISON CADY, ARTIST, IS DEAD
description: Harrison Cady, one of the last survivors of the great age of the illustrator before World War I, died Wednesday night at his home, 27 West 67th Street, after a long illness. He was 93 years old.

title: Dance: Diversion of Angels Returns
description: One of the nicest things that can happen to a critic is to fall in love, and I have fallen in love with the Batsheva Dance Company of Israel, currently but all too briefly at the New York City Center. The company is so strong and vigorous, so exciting. It makes choreogra phy come alive, and dances every step with its heart.

title: FISCHER LENGTHENS CHESS TOURNEY LEAD
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 10 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles, the eighttime United States chess champion, lengthened his lead today in the 22d round of the 24man knockout chess round robin here by defeating Svetozar Gligoric, a manytime Yugoslav titleholder.

title: STOCKS RISE A BIT ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London , stock market rallied late yesterday in antici pation of a settlement of an electrical workers dispute. Losses among the leaders were regained or reversed, but the movement was not general and trading remained limited.

title: Ship Finally Clears Bridge
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 10 (AP)The 600foot Japanese freighter Essence finally got under Marquam Bridge in the lower Portland harbor today after nearly 24 hours of effort. She did so by pumping ballast into tanks on one .side so that she listed heavily .to port. The freighter, riding high as she came in to take a cargo of scrap steel, bumped the bridge yesterday and bent a mast.

title: A WINNING DRIVER NOT AN IDLE ONE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 10 Unless he is a Bill Naughton, Stanley Dancer, Herve Filion or any of the other trainers who have kingsized stables of their own, a harnessracing driver must depend mainly on catch drives to keep him going.

title: New Faces Help Young A.B.A. Take Giant Steps
description: The American Basketball Association doubleheader at Madison Square Garden Wednesday night was a fi nancial success, as proved best by the likelihood that two more such programs will be arranged, one next February and one in March. But what about artistically?

title: Fire Department Appoints First Black Assistant Chief
description: Augustus A. Beekman, who became a probationary fireman here in 1947, yesterday became the first Negro in the Fire De partment's history to achieve the fourstar rank of assistant chief of department.

title: MISTRIAL CALLED IN TACOMA CASE
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 10 United States District Judge George H. Boldt declared mistrial today on the ground that six of the seven defendants in a conspiracy trial had prejudiced the jury against themselves by misbehavior.

title: President of the Railway Clerks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Two weeks ago at a meeting here with representatives of the railroads, a beleagured. Charles Leslie Dennis, presi dent of the Brotherhood of

title: Arthur BeverleyGiddings, Author and Ad Copy Editor
description: UPPER FAIRMOUNT, Md., Dec. 10Arthur Raymond Bev erlyGiddings, an author and ad vertising copy editor in New York City, died at the Peninsula General Hospital in Salisbury last night after a short illness. His age was 72.

title: SENATE APPROVES STOCK INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The Senate approved legisla tion today that would insure investors against losses of cash and securities that they had left with their brokers if the brokerage firm they deal with went bankrupt.

title: GUIDELINES OFFERED FOR TRADE PARLEYS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The Atlantic Council published today a study of emerging in ternational trade conflicts that stresses the need for a new ap proach for negotiations, aimed at establishing international rules of the road to set standards for the behavior of individual nations.

title: ALI GETS LICENSE TO BOX IN TEXAS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 10, (AP) Muhammad All was granted a boxing license in Texas today clearing the way for a pos sible match between him and Joe Frazier, the recognized heavyweight champion, in the Houston Astrodome.

title: SECURITIES MEN UPHELD BY COURT
description: Federal Judge Walter R. Mansfield found yesterday that some 42 leading stock ex change brokerage firms and the New York Stock Exchange were not exempt from the Sher man Antitrust Law when they unilaterally reduced commis sions paid to securities repre sentatives.

title: `Nutcracker With Miss Hayden And d'Amboise, Marks Jubilee
description: Last night marked the 500th performance in New York of George Balanchine's fulllength version of The Nutcracker, an anniversary of sorts that was celebrated by members of the New York City Ballet family with the kind of per formances reserved for special occasions.

title: Appointment of Rep. Bush To U.N. Post Is Reported
description: WASHINGTON,. Dec.. 10President Nixon has chosen George Bush, a Texas Republican Congressman de feated in a bid for a Senate seat, as the next United States representative at the United Nations, informed sources said tonight.

title: Market Place:
description: Perhaps the world is get ting too complicated. No less an authority than a former Secretary of Health, Educa tion and Welfare, John W. Gardner, thinks so.

title: U.S. WARNS 3 CITIES TO HALT POLLUTION
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 10 (UPI)_ The Nixon Administration's new Environmental Protection Agency announced today that it was serving 180day notices on Atlanta, Detroit and Cleve land to halt alleged violations of federally approved water quality standards.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Right Songs for a Mad King a Delight
description: Half of the Evenings for New Music program, on Wednesday at the Carnegie Recital Hall, was made up of routine academic ditherings. But then, after the intermis sion, came Eight Songs for a Mad King by Peter Max wellDavies, and suddenly the audience was thrust into the presence of a creative mind.

title: Books of The Times
description: A nice idea in theorytelling a man's life through the voices of his friends on a funeral traingoes off the rails in American Journey: The Times of Robert Kennedy. The book is billed as a new genre in publishihgthe use of oral his tory as a form of communicationbut pull the plug on the tape recorder and what

title: Dining Out in a Neighborhood Ambiance
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: STRIKE HAMPERS COMMUTERS HERE
description: The workaday trek between city and suburbs was more of a scramble than usual here yesterday  for the approxi mately 150,000 commuters de prived of trains by .the nation wide strike, but service was expected to be back to normal this morning.

title: Woman Awarded $600,000 In Suit Against Skin Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) A Montgomery County, Md., jury has found a dermatologist negligent in his treatment and awarded $600,000 to a woman and her father.

title: In Salvation Army Family, Husband and Wife Are Really Equal
description: To many people, the Salvation Army is most visible at Christmas, when the men and women in the navy and red uniforms stand beside Christmas kettles, ringing bells, singing and playing brass instrumentssometimes slightly off key.

title: Met, Big Loser on Year, Asks U.S. Aid
description: The Metropolitan Opera's operating income dropped off $3.8million in 196970 from the previous' season, and the company is seeking new means of support to help fill future gaps.

title: Books of The Times
description: Let me make one thing quite clear: sleeping America must be alerted. It's all very well for reviewers, the privileged effete, to leaf through free copies of costly movie books with disgraceful captions like Joan Crawford and unidentified player or a fullpage shot of Greta Garbo in be jeweled Javanese regalia out of White Orchids shockingly identified as Queen Christina. But what about the good citi zens of this great country of ours, stum bling through the stores buying Christmas presents, who are asked to put down hard earned cash for such stuff? We live in an era of lawlessness, smudgy reproduction and unnumbered pages in pop publishing, and, By George, publishers have got to be told that Mr. and Mrs. America won't take it lying down.

title: Henry Ford 2d Sees Sales Strides and Mounting Prices
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10The Ford Motor Company's capital spending, the auto industry's sales and the nation's prices are all going up, Henry Ford 2d said today.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Signings: President Nixon signed the Horse Protection Act of 1970, aimed at halting deliberate soring of horses to change their gait, as in Ten nessee walking horses. He signed a  bill permitting the military to provide transpor tation and lend equipment to the Boy Scouts of America for the World Jamboree in Japan in 1971. He signed an other bill making the United States and the District of Co lumbia parties to an inter state compact governing de tention of prisoners for other jurisdictions.

title: No Logic for the SST
description: There is going to be supersonic flight whether we like it or not

title: Art: Highlights of Downtown Scene
description: Hundreds  of art lovers Made an amazing discovery last week that they could negotiate the downtown art scene without a taxi (on the other hand, thousands  of taxi lovers found .that they could do without art). At any rate, for those game enough to make the trip, by bus, subway, private car or shanks mare,, here are some shows to be caught below 14th Street:

title: Stevens Gets Citation For Arts Leadership
description: Roger L. Stevens received a citation for his services to the theater at a luncheon of the National Theater Confer ence, representing community and university theaters, at the Barbizon Plaza Hotel.

title: STORE PILFERAGE REPORTED RISING
description: An increase in store pil ferage by shoppers and em ployes was confirmed yester day by the National Retail Merchants Association in its annual report of financial op erations , for department and specialty stores.

title: MAKAROVA TO BOW IN `GISELLE DEC. 22
description: American Ballet Theater will present three premieres and two revivals in its threeweek season at the City Center from Dec. 22 through Jan. 10.

title: U.S. WAR DEATHS DOWN BY 5 TO 27
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 10 (AP)The United States command reported to day that 27 Americans were killed in action in Indochina last week, the second lowest toll this year.PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 10 (AP)  Cambodian troops trying to reopen the vital sup ply route from the sea clashed this morning with enemy troops holding Route 4 between Pnom penh and the port of Kompong Som.

title: MALCOLM WELLS, 51, OF PLAYWRIGHTS CO.
description: Malcolm Wells, a producer and playwright here, died Wednesday night in Gracie Square Hospital after a short illness. He was 51 years old.

title: LINKING SERVICES. SOUGHT BY SAUL
description: Ralph S. Saul, president of the American Stock Exchange, yesterday called for combining the services and facilities of the Amex and the New York Stock Exchange, plus other steps toward standardization of exchange management, plan ning and regulation.

title: HENRY ACKERSON OF JERSEY COURT
description: KEYPORT, N. J., Dec. 10 Henry E. Ackerson, a retired associate justice of the State Supreme Court of New Jersey, died yesterday at the Arnold Walter Nursing Home in Holm del. He was 90 years old.

title: LEGAL AID CHANGE PUT OFF BY O.E.O.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Office of Economic Opportunity appears to have retreated for the second time from heatedly opposed plans to revise the ad ministration of the legal serv ices program for the poor.

title: 13 Reserve Banks Cut Rates
description: The Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday that the Federal Reserve Bank of Chi cago, St. Louis and Richmond had reduced their discount rates to 51/2 per cent from 53/4 per cent, thus bringing all 12 re gional banks in line with the reduction first announced on Nov. 30.

title: ASIAN GAMES MARK SET BY CHI CHENG
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 10 (AP) Chi Cheng, of Nationalist China, broke a sprinting record, and three other Asian Games marks fell today as the Japanese launched their bid for team lau rels.

title: Episcopal Church, Financially Pressed, Is Halving Its Headquarters Staff
description: The headquarters staff of the Episcopal Church was ordered  cut in half yesterday by the 3.5 millionmember denomination's .:executive council because of .sharp reduction in giving by churchgoers.

title: SONG DEBUT MADE BY DELLA VECCHIA
Smith and Rosewall Continue Unbeaten In Tokyo Tourney
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10 (Reuters) Stan Smith of Passdena, Calif. and Ken Rosewall of Australia remained unbeaten today aft er four days of the Internation al Lawn Tennis Federatior masters tournament.

title: Economists Doubtful 71 Will Bring Buying Wave
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)A University of Michi gan expert in consumer psychology predicted today that 1971 will not be a good year for the United States economy because the wave of consum er buying the Nixon Admin istration expected would not materialize.

title: Lunokhod Resumes Work
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10 (UPI) Lunokhod 1, the Soviet moon walking robot, has awakened from two weeks of hibernation during the lunar night and re sumed its travels on the moon, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said today.

title: Miss Abbott: 63 Photographs At the Modern
description: The career of Berenice Ab bott is like none other in the history of American pho tography. Indeed, there are few American careers in any of the arts that engage so many disparate realms of ex perience. She has been a superb portraitist, an accom plished reporter of the urban scene and a pioneer in the photographic elucidation of scientific discourse.

title: Wichita Death Benefits Paid
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 10 (UPI) Claims totaling $1.2million will be paid out of the National Collegiate Athletic Association insurance program, beginning today, as a result of the Oct. 2 Wichita State University foot ball plane crash, the N.C.A.A. said of the 31 persons killed in the crash, 14 players and six Wichita staff members were covered. The other deaths in volved nonuniversity personnel. Marshall University, whose football team died in a plane crash Nov. 14, was also covered.

title: In Memorian
description: CAMPBELLMagdalene Whyte. In loving. memory of a Beloved Wife, Devoted Mother, Loving and Adored Grandmother, who passed away on December 11, 1963. You're always In our thoughts and hearts.

title: CALLEY'S LAWYER EXPLAINS ACTIONS
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 10First Lieut. William L. Cal ley Jr. had orders to kill every living thing in Mylai, and the alleged massacre that fol lowed was observed by super ior officers who did nothing to halt it, the lieutenant's chief defense counsel said today.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. GIVEN EVIDENCE ON PLOT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) Evidence concerning an al leged antiwar group's plot to kidnap a high Government of ficial has been turned over to the Justice Department for ac tion, J. Edgar Hoover has in formed a Tennessee Congress man.

title: 2 Women Accused of Hurling Fire Bomb Against Bank Here
description: Two young women from the East Village were arrested early yesterday on charges that they, had hurled an incendiary bomb at the Royal National Bank of New York at Fifth Avenue and 28th Street.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES Virginia 127, New York 100. Memphis 107, Floridians 102. Denver 131, Pittsburgh 109. WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES Indiana 129, New York 108. Virginia 113, Denver 109.

title: Bayh Plans Child Care Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) Senator Birch Bayh, Demo crat of Indiana, said today that he would introduce legislation to set up a national network of child care centers.

title: G.O. P. Majority in Assembly Backs $50Million for Newark
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10The caucus of the Assembly's over whelmingly Republican majori ty approved a $50million state aid and city tax package for Newark this evening after the collapse of a lastminute move by the city's financial and busi ness interests to lend the city $15million.

title: Hussein Tells of Arms Needs
description: In taping a television inter view here last night for show ing on Channel 5 on Dec. 18, King Hussein said in response to a question from David Frost that the arms he asked for in Washington were less than the $125million in five years that had been reported.

title: Sports of the unto
description: These have been troubled years on many a college campus and some student dis sidents have even questioned the relevancy of intercollegiate football. This posture regarded as a gross form of sacrilege by those noble squares who give their enthu siastic support to the National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame.

title: Security Traders Elect
description: The Security Traders Associa tion of New York announced yesterday the election of Arthur K. Salomon as presi dent, Mr. Salomon, who was first vice president of the group for the Jest year, is a partner at Salomon Brothers. Paul R. Yednak of Sidney A. Siegel & Co., Inc., was elected first vice president.

title: Television
description: 6:30 P.M. Black Perspective on the News (13)

title: Jets to Use Caster and Bell Sunday in Place of Injured Maynard and Sauer
description: The New York Jets lost George Sauer and Don May nard, their prime passreceiv ers, yesterday as they prepared for the last two games of the season, against the Miami Dol phins and Baltimore Colts.

title: Standpipe Over a Walk Held a Public Nuisance
description: A city judge has ruled in Brooklyn that a standpipe extending from a building over a public sidewalk with out warning to the pedes trian constitutes a public nuisance that justifies negli gence action against the building owner.

title: WESTBANK ARABS ACCUSE JORDAN
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 10  The Jordanian authorities have started to bar formerly routine visits to the westbank area by Arab notables, men believed to be active in seeking Palestinian selfdetermination, Arab sources reported today.

title: REPORT OF BILL DELAY BY HOGAN IN ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) United Press International in correctly reported that Repre sentative Lawrence J. Hogan, Republican of Maryland, de layed House action late last night on legislation to block a nationwide rail strike near the strike deadline.

title: W. Kentucky Wins No. 3
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky., Dec. 10 (UPI)Jim McDaniels scored 37 points tonight to pace eighth ranked Western Kentucky to a 9671 victory over Virginia Commonwealth. Western Ken tucky is unbeaten in three games.

title: Store Sales Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The Commerce Department to day estimated last week's de partment store sales at $1,162, 000,000, virtually unchanged from the yearearlier $1,160, 000,000. Total retail store sales last week were about $7,970, 000,000, up 3 per cent from $7,706,000,000.

title: F.C.C. CLEARS LINK BY 2 DRUG MAKERS
description: The Federal Communications Commission cleared yesterday the proposed merger of Plough, Inc., into the Schering Corpo ration, one of the biggest mer gers announced this year.

title: Off track Betting Made As Simple as A, B, C
description: Racing fans who bet with the New York City offtrack operation, which starts on Jan. 11, will use a system of alphabetical designations for their choices. Howard Sam uels, the head of the Off Track Betting Corporation, said yesterday that, for sim plicity, all a bettor need do is to call in and say, Please put $2 on G in the first race at Aqueduct. Even with sub sequent changes in the race, because of scratches, the let ter would remain constant.

title: Notre Dame 9488 Victor
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (UPI) Austin Carr scored 33 points and Collis Jones got 30 tonight to lead sixthranked Notre Dame to a 9488 victory over Northwestern. The Irish, gain ing their second triumph in three starts, were hard pressed most of the way to whip the Wildcats.

title: MERRILL LYNCH SETS GOODBODY AS A UNIT
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fen ner & Smith, Inc., said yester day that it planned to operate Goodbody & Co. as a corporate subsidiary, following the ac quisition of the troubled bro kerage firm today.

title: Difficult Program Played Brilliantly By Miss Yanagita
description: Matako Yanagita, violinist, played a redoubtable program with cameo perfection Wednes day night at Town Hall.

title: THREE NAMED AGAIN FOR ALL  AMERICA
description: Twentyone seniors, includ ing three repeaters and two players each from Texas, Ohio State, Nebraska, Louisiana State and Notre Dame, were named yesterday to the 1970 AllAmerica football team by The Associated Press.

title: SPANIARDS BATTLE POLICE IN 2 CITIES
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 10 (AP) Violence broke out in Madrid and Granada today as a court martial deliberated behind closed doors in Burgos on the fate of 15 Basques accused of murder, terrorism or rebellion.

title: ELECTRIC BONDS FALL TO 7% YIELD
description: Yields on highgrade electric utility bonds continued to move downward yesterday and reached 7.75 per centtheir lowest rate since August, 1969. This mark was set yesterday in the sale of $80million .of Aarated bonds by the Phila delphia Electric Company.

title: Latest Data Hint North America. And A Erica Were Not Connected
description: Scientists reported here yes terday evidence suggesting that contrary to widely accepted theory, the continents of Africa and North America were not joined millions of years ago, but have been drifting apart from what once was probably a much smaller proto  Atlan tic ocean.

title: The Basques Confront Franco
description: By incredibly mishandling a trial of Basque nation alists, Generalissimo Franco's Government has stumbled into one of its worst political crises since the end of the Spanish Civil War.

title: Benjamin Harrow Dies at 82; Professor and Science Writer
description: Dr. Benjamin Harrow, profes sor emeritus of chemistry at City College and a versatile writer on scientific themes, died Wednesday in Park West Hospital affair after a short ill ness. He was 82 years old and lived at 333 Central Park Wear..

title: M.I.T. Appoints a Dean
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 10 (AP)Prof. Paul E. Gray, as sociate provost at Massachu setts Institute of Technology, has been appointed dean of the M.I.T. School of Engineering.

title: 2 SST Opponents Charge Administration Suppressed Criticism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Two Senators who led the fight to cut off further funds for the supersonic transport charged today that the Administration was withholding from Congress and the public critical corn merits prepared by scientists in the Department of Health, Edu cation and Welfare.

title: Arming to Parley
description: Two decades ago Winston Churchill laid down the basic rationale that still governs history's most remark able alliance of free peoples, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. I do not hold that ,we should rearm order to fight, he said. I hold that we should rearm order to parley.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CONTINUE TO DROP
description: Soybean and grains futures tumbled again yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade mark ing the fourth straight session in which declines were re corded.

title: 4 in New Canaan Family Slain; Alarm Out for Son, 18, and Car
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 10The wife, daughter, moth erinlaw and one of two sons of a 44yearold New Canaan man were found slain at their home this afternoon.

title: President .`Outraged' By Denial of Asylum
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 AP) President Nixon said tonight that he was out raged and shocked at the incident last month in which a.. Lithuanian seaman trying to defect to a United States Coast Guard cuter was re turned to his shin.

title: 6 Brooklyn Councilmen Back Mrs. Spatt as Planner
description: Six of the 11 City Council men from Brooklyn urged Mayor Lindsay yesterday to re appoint Mrs. Beverly  Moss Spatt, the maverick member of the City Planning Commission.

title: ARMED FORCES LAG ON REENLISTMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec., 10 (AP) Reenlistments in the armed forces have dropped to their lowest point in 15 years and there is no sign that the Pen tagon has succeeded yet in reversing the trend.

title: JURY CHOICE SLOW IN TRIAL OF SEALE
description: , NEW, HAVEN, Dec. 10 The effort to assemble a jury in the murder trial of Bobby G. Seale reached a milestone today with the questioning of the 200th potential juror. Like most of his predecessors, he too was rejected.

title: RAIL UNION ENDS WALKOUT UNDER A THREAT OF FINES; SERVICE TO RESUME TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A nationwide railway walkout was called off tonight, about 18 hours after it started, when the leader of a striking union or dered his members back to Work and resumed negotiations with the railroads.

title: U.S. Judge Refuses To Enjoin the Sale Of 9 Disputed Toys
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) A Federal judge refused to day to issue an injunction] against the sale of nine toys that a consumers' group con tends are hazardous in the hands of children.

title: L. Mendel Rivers to Have Surgery on Heart Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)Representative L. Men del Rivers, Democrat of South Carolina, one of the most pow erful men in Congress, will undergo heart surgery tomor row in Birmingham, Ala., his office announced today.

title: WPIX Loses Bid to Show Film at F.C.C. Hearings,
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The initial phase of the WPIX license hearings ended here to day with the New York televi sion station being dealt strategic blow when its final exhibit, a filmed reconstruction of some of its controversial newsfilm, was not permitted to be introduced into evidence.

title: CRIME UNIT HERE IS TOLD OF LAXITY
description: Only 37 of 536 organized crime figures arrested on fel onies in New York City and the surrounding suburbs during the last 10 years were sent to prison, investigators testified yesterday before the State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Premier's Plan for Reform Approved by Belgian House
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10 (Reuters) The lower house of the Bel gian Parliament today approved Premier Gaston Eyskens's con troversial plan for amending the Constitution to end the country's bitter language con troversy.

title: Big Four Adjourn Parley on Berlin For the Holidays
description: BERLIN, Dec. 10  The Big Four talks aimed at improving transport links with and within Berlin adjourned today for Christmas recess after a four hour meeting without any visible sign of an accord.

title: BRUINS TRIUMH OVER SABRES, 82
description: BOSTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)1 John Bucyk of Boston celei brated his 1,000th National Hockey League game tonight, with a $1,000 bonus, two goals, and four assists in an 82 Bruin victory over the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Is Shakespeare Relevant?
description: I've spent the last couple of years, off and on, in two worlds simultane ouslyimaginatively in Elizabethan England, corporeally in Agnewian America. On one level the worlds are closer than you'd think: New York, for instance, has all the scatology, garbage and violence of that old Lon don, comple,te with blood on the side walks.

title: Drugstore Lunch Counters Fading Out
description: Except for a few embattled outposts, the drugstore lunch counter is almost as extinct in midtown Manhattan as the cigar store Indian.

title: Nixon Voices Hope on ArabIsraeli Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 President Nixon declared to night that he hoped ArabIsraeli peace negotiations would re sume eventually without seek ing to put any public pressure on Israel to speed up her re turn to the talks.

title: Levitt Will Build Mobile Homes
description: Levitt & Sons, the coun try's largest private home builder, is going into the mo bilehome market for the first time.

title: BULLS TURN BACK BRAVES, 138120
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 10 (UPI) Bob Love and Jerry Sloan col lected 34 points apiece as the Chicago Bulls handed the Buf falo Braves a record defeat to night with a 138120 triumph.

title: Eastman Dillon Survives Drain 0f 31% of Capital in 13 Months
description: Eastman,Dillon, Urifon Securities & Co., a leading invest ment banking and brokerage house, incurred a capital loss of $15,954,108 in 13 months largely as a result of the long stockmarket decline, but it now appears to. be profitable and to have a sound capital position. These were the major indications in a report made by the firm and in interviews

title: The BlueCollar Bind
description: American workers expect that steady, fulltime, conscientious job performance will pay off in an accept able quality of life for themselves and their families.

title: Racing to Resume Here on March 8 and Finish Dec. 4
description: The 1971 thoroughbred rac ing season in this state will start on Monday, March 8, at Aqueduct, it was announced by the New York State. Racing Commission yesterday. Joseph Gimma, the chairman of the commission and colleagues, Edmond Hanrahan and William Pfeiffer, accepted the request of the New York Racing As sociation for the opening date, and for season that will run through Saturday, Dec. 4.

title: A Feminine Touch Looms Among the Senate's Pages
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Paulette Marie Desell, who is 16 years old and is slated to become the first girl page in the United States Senate, fielded questions at a news conference today in a man ner not unlike many United States Senators.

title: Hope Is Seen in Britain For an End to Blackouts
description: LONDON, Dec. 10 Power blackouts spread across Britain today amid signs of hope that the electrical workers slow down would soon end.

title: CONSTRUCTION MEN SIGN TRAINEE PACT
description: Governor Rockefeller, Mayor Lindsay and representatives of the construction industry and its unions signed an agreement yesterday to speed and expand the training of minority group members here as skilled con struction workers.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Woman Must Display Flag in Defamation Case
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 10A woman who had been charged with casting contempt upon the United States flag was ordered in court today to make a public apology and to display the flag in her shop window for 30 days.

title: Heath: IMan for All. Seasons
description: LONDON  Although Prime Min ister Edward Heath is well known to many American leaders including Pres ident Nixon, whom he visits next week, he is insufficiently familiar to the U.S. public, partly because he is shy man although not in the least bit timid. Moreover, in some respects he resembles Nixon in being exceedingly pragmatic but not by nature endowed with charisma.

title: U.S. Seizes and Then. Releases 6,000 Copies of a Magazine With Article on How to Make Bombs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10 Nearly 6,000 copies of the Janu ary issue of Scanlan's Monthly, containing information on how to make bombs, were seized for review by United States Cus toms agents here and, in Oak land today, but were ordered returned to the publisher a few hours later without explanation.

title: Solzhenitsyn Hailed Despite Absence At Presentation of 1970 Nobel. Awards
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 10The Nobel Prizes for 1970 were for mally presented today, and along with the royalty and the rows of ,stiff shirts there was drama.

title: Bridge:
description: The victory of the Dallas Aces in the world champion ship last summer was a per sonal triumph for Ira Corn Jr., whose remarkable concep tion of a professional team that would bring the world title back to America became a reality within two and a half years.

title: CHILEAN COALITION SEEKS RIFTS END
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10 Chile's Marxist left has em barked on an effort to reconcile its hostile factions in hopes of governing the nation with some semblance of unity.

title: Bruce Kirman, Miss Cahill Win Figure Skating Titles
description: ARDMORE, Pa., Dec. 10 Bruce Kirman of Hershey, Pa. and Tracey Cahill of Baltimore won the intermediate titles in the opening of the threeday South Atlantic figure skating championships today at the Philadelphia Skating Club and Humane Society. Kirman and Miss Cahill each finished first in school figures and sustained the leads in free skating.

title: SUSPECTS SOUGHT IN JERSEY BLAZE
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 10 A fire that left six families homeless yesterday has been called definitely suspicious by the Fire Department, and the Police Department is look ing for definite suspects.

title: QUARTER NET UP AT UTAH MINING
description: The Utah Construction and Mining Company had the sixth successive year of record prof its in the annual period ended Oct. 31, according to the com pany's report issued yesterday at its San Franisco headquar ters. The company, engaged

title: 3 Arrested In Forgery Of Permits
description: A father and son and a woman friend were arrested yesterday by detectives as signed to the city's Depart ment of Investigation and charged with conspiracy to forge and sell more than 15,000 Department of Sanita tion . permits for dumping Construction  waste at city

title: DUKE NAMES M'GEE AS FOOTBALL COACH
description: DURHAM, N.C, Dec. 10 (AP) Mike McGee, head football coach at East Carolina Univer sity, was named today as head coach at Duke  University, where he starred as a lineman a decade ago.

title: Weekend of Final Reckoning Ahead for Many Teams in N.F.L.
description: A big weekend of decisions is ahead, with the local teams on the road, the Gionts un derdogs at St Louis and the Jets the same in Miami. The closest game is in Boston, but local stations will televise five. Tomorrow brings Dallas at Cleveland, Channel 2, 1:15 P.M.. and Kansas City at Oak

title: SQUIRES CONQUER NETS, 127 TO 100
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 12 The Virginia Squires reeled off 14 straight points midway in the first quarter to build a 3113 lead and coasted from there to a 127100 victory over the New York Nets in an American Bas ketball Association game be fore a crowd of 5,275 at Hamp ton Coliseum tonight.

title: Murder Defendant Acquitted
description: A defendant who allegedly bragged that he was paying $1,000 a day to find out things about prospective wit nesses, was acquitted of mur der charges lets night in State Supreme Court in Manhattan. A jury of 11 men and one woman heard several witnesses say they had seen the defend ant, Philip T. Clayton, 27 years old, of 124 West 112th Street, shoot William Ford, 31,. of 935 East 163d Street, last July 16 on St. Nicholas Avenue. Mr. Clayton maintained that he and a friend were drinking in a nearby bar at the time of the murder.

title: 45% RISE REPORTED IN. MUGGINGS: HERE
description: Although there. were de creases in the number of mur ders and forcible rapes the city during the month of Octo ber, the Police Department re ported a 45.1 per cent increase in robberies and muggings dur ing the month. There, were 6,838 cases reported, compared with 4.713 cases in October, 1969.

title: SWEIG NOW AIDE TO REP. LEGGETT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)  Martin Sweig, sus pended former administrative assistant to the Speaker of the House, John W. McCormack, and under sentence for perjury, is back on the Congressional payroll.

title: SANDERS GETS ACE AND STROKE LEAD
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas, Dec. 10 (AP)  Doug Sanders who hasn't won a tournament in al most four years, shot a record 66 including a hole in one to day and stormed into the first round lead in the $130,000 Ba hama Islands open golf tourna ment.

title: POLLUTING A CRIME IN JAPANESE BILL
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10The House of Representatives today passed and sent to the upper house a law that for the first time in. Japan defines pollution as crime.

title: TRUCK TONNAGE OFF FROM THE 69 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Dec. 5 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: Let Them Eat Bullets
description: Why not a gas mask as a pocketbook? Or a food stamp as a chic design for a brooch? Or the replica of an atomic warhead to make an amusing hat? None of these fashion fantasies is more offensive than the new fad of the cartridge belt, apparently designed to give relevance to women's stylishness.

title: Theater: Foreplay Opens at Bijou
description: There would seem to be at least two identifiable cate gories of sexual theaterthe purely erotic and the prosely tizing. They can overlap but recent examples have been quite distinct. Such shows as

title: Chotiner's Estranged Wife Sues for Divorce on Coast
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Dec. 10 (AP)The estranged wife of Murray Chotiner asked today for a divorce.

title: 2 Tall Coast Towers Topped
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (UPI) The tallest buildings in Los Angeles, the twin 52story At lantic Richfield Plaza's towers, were topped today by two beams, each carrying a Christ mas tree and a United States flag. The beams were raised simultaneously to the top of the 699foothigh structures.

title: COMPUTERS URGED AS AID TO DOCTORS
description: Doctors have been urged in a medical journal to use com puters to relieve the pressures of delivering medical care and to free them for more human tasks.

title: Los Angeles TimesMirror Sued Over Sales of 2 Papers
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Dec. 10 (AP)  A $4.5million suit has been filed against the Los Angeles TimesMirror Cor poration and three other par ties by a group representing the former owners oft he Sun Corn pany, which publishes the morn ing Sun and evening Telegram here.

title: Guido Della Vecchia, an Americanborn tenor who has studied and performed in this country and in Italy, made his New York debut at Tully Hall on Wednesday night. In songs by Bellini, Schumann and Vavolo, he was accompanied at
description: Guido Della Vecchia, an Americanborn tenor who has studied and performed in this country and in Italy, made his New York debut at Tully Hall on Wednesday night. In songs by Bellini, Schumann and Vavolo, he was accompanied at the piano by William Sower wine. For Vaughan Williams's cycle On Wenlock Edge, Mr.

title: U.A.R. Concession Sought
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 10Gideon Rafael the sec ondranking man in the. Israeli Foreign Ministry, said here to day that. acceptance of an in definite ceasefire was one of the concessions Egypt had to make before Israel would re sume indirect peace talks under Dr. Jarring.

title: P.O .W . Offer and Truce Counteroffer Fail in Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 10The United States and South Vietnam to day proposed an immediate ex change of war prisoners with North Vietnam and the Viet cong. They countered with an offer of a ceasefire immedi ately upon agreement by the United States to withdraw its forces from South Vietnam by next June 30.HONG KONG, Dec. 10The North Vietnamese Government and the Workers (Communist) party issued an extraordinary appeal today to the people andSAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 10 (UPI)North Vietnam today denounced any proposal of an extended ceasefire in South Vietnam from Christmas to the Tet lunar new year on Jan. 26 as a new treacherous trick by the Nixon Administra

title: Advertising: Shorter Commercial Favored
description: A check among media men in New York, Chicago, De troit and Los Angeles shows that most of them favor C.B.S.'s move of making the basic network TV advertising unit 30 instead of 60 seconds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Who Benefits From Tax Cuts? To the Editor: The Dec. 3 news report by Eileen Shanahan that Liberalized Deprecia tion Is Studied by Administration as Economic Spur must cause dismay to those anxious to achieve prosperity and economic growth without in equitable distortions of the tax structure.

title: NixonSaysU.S.Will Bomb North if Foe Steps Up War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 President Nixon declared to night that if North Vietnamese Forces increase the level of fighting in South Vietnam, as American forces are withdrawn, he would retaliate by ordering the bombing of military targets in North Vietnam.ed States and North Vietnam in 1968 during the Administra tion of Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: PRESIDENT URGES SENATE TO ALTER TRADE MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Speaking out today after a long silence, President Nixon sharply criticized the pending trade bill, which includes import quotas and restrictions that he opposes.

title: BUDGET CUT ENDS UNIT AT COLUMBIA
description: The theater arts division of Columbia . University's School of the Arts has been eliminated as a result of budget cuts. .

title: Gentele Maps His Changes for the Met
description: If  Goeran Gentele can ar range it, Ingmar Bergman  will be coming to direct a production at the Metropoli tan Opera. Mr. Gentele, the Swedish film and stage di rector who w.as picked this week to replace Rudolf Bing as the Metropolitan's general manager, says his famous, countryman  and fellow film maker is at the top. of my list of directors. Nine years ago, Mr. Bergman directed Stravinsky's The Rake's Progress for the Stockholm Opera, of which Mr. Gentele is now general manager.

title: Death Penalty Is Upheld
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 (UPI)  California's Supreme Court has affirmed a death pen alty for William D. Archerd, a state hospital attendant con victed of murdering three in his family with insulin injections. The court made its ruling yes terday after the Los Angeles Su perior Court convicted Archerd, 57 years old, in 1968.

title: Reactivated Moon Rover Scouts Sea of Rains Again
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Russian scientists put its moon rover, the Lunokhod 1, through its paces today, moving it by remote. control around boulders and in and out of craters on the lunar landscane

title: Death of ExVillage Official Held an Apparent Suicide
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Dec. 11E. Earl Udall, former vil lage manager here, was listed by the police as an apparent suicide today, pending a final report by the county medical examiner.

title: Japan Slowly Revives Arms Industry
description: TOKYOJapan, the world's thirdgreatest industrial pow er, is slowly developing the basis of a modern armaments industry.

title: URBAN BONDS GET A TAX EXEMPTION
description: After 10 months of negotia tions, the Treasury Department has granted an exemption to New York State Urban Devel opment Corporation bonds to be issued for construction projects that include some in dustrial and commercial pro grams.

title: Bridge:
description: To find the best discards when the declarer is running a long suit is often beyond the powers of the defenders. On the diagramed deal, played Wednesday at the Mayfair House of Bridge, West could have put the de clarer to a much more severe test if he had discarded well.

title: I.O.S.Gramco Merger Is Reportedly Due Soon
description: Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., and Gramco Management, Ltd., two troubled offshore mutualfund organizations, are planning to merge, sources close to the negotiations said yesterday.

title: Notre Dame Deficit Seen
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 11 (AP)The University of Notre Dame will have a deficit this year of about $70,000, a uni versity spokesman said today. Yesterday the university presi dent, the Rev. Theodore M. Hes burgh, told a news conference that the deficit would be about $200,000. But a university spokesman said today that Fa ther Hesburgh had qualified the statement by saying he had not seen the figures for some time and could be wrong.

title: 2 Makers of Bubble Bath To Reformulate Products
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) Officials of the Food and Drug Administration say two major manufacturers of bubble bath for children have agreed to reformulate their products in response to complaints of irritation and infection in the urinary tract.

title: STUDENTS DEFER ACTION ON GRANT
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 11 Discussions by students at five central Massachusetts colleges ended today without a firm de cision on whether to accept controversial $25,000 grant of fered by the John D. Rockefel ler 3d Fund.

title: High and Lows
description: FRIDAY, DEC. 11, 1970

title: Ah! Where Are the Rebels of Yesteryear?
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 11Dublin has become a sad, romantic city of dreams not quite ful filled, and when the rain washes O'Connell Bridge and a cold wind whips the leaves in St. Stephen's Green, some might feel discouraged and recall the lament of Yeats back in 1913: Romantic Ire land's dead and gone. For exam ple, down in Dun Laoghaire, the faded seaside re sort for Dublin, where James Joyce lived in a Martello tower, someone is trying to blow up an old mon ument to King George IV.

title: Rutger Raises Room Fees
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J. Dec. 11 (AP)  The Board of Governors of Rutgers, the State University, raised room and board fees by $190 today, making the: annual fee $1,300. The board also endorsed a pro gram to strengthen campus security forces and disciplinary procedures as result of recent bomb threats.

title: A.T.&T. Head Denies Job Bias; Terms Utility Leader in Equality
description: The board chairman of the American Telephone and Tele graph Company yesterday de acribed as outrageous an at tempt by the Equal Employ ment Opportunity Commission in Washington to block the company's request for rate in crease on the ground that the Bell System engaged in per vasive discrimination in the employment of blacks, women and Americans with Spanish surnames.

title: Panel Adopts Plan to Speed U.N. Disaster Aid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11A General Assembly committee adopted a proposal tonight to. improve the United Nations ability to rush help to countries stricken by natural disasters.

title: POLICE IN MONTREAL SEIZE A MONTHLY
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 11Last night and today the Montreal police seized 102,000 copies of the January issue of Scanlan's Monthly, an American maga zine given over to a single ar ticle, Guerrilla War in the U.S.A., and containing infor mation on how to make bombs.

title: Wide Areas of State Blanketed With Snow
description: Snowfalls of up to eight inches fell in wide areas across the state yesterday, ending one of the mildest pre Christmas seasons in the rec ords of the National Weather Service.

title: BILL GUARDS, RIGHTS TO NEW SEED PLANTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Congress has approved a sys tem, to be administered by the Department of Agriculture, for the protection of rights to new varieties of plants grown from seed.

title: Rep. Rivers Is Given A New Heart Valve
