description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 11 (UPI)Representative L. Men del Rivers, chairman of the House Armed Services Commit tee, received an artifical heart valve today in a successful operation to correct an. ad vanced stage of heart failure.

title: SEALE TRIAL FAILS TO ADD NEW JURORS
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 11The sixth panel of prospective jur ors in the Bobby G. Seale mur der trial was exhausted today without the selection of any member of the panel.

title: Chi Cheng Wins Asian Games Dash
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 11 (AP)  Chi Cheng of Taiwan, racing on injured legs, won her first gold medal of the 1970 Asian Games today  in the 100meter dash, but Japan con tinued to dominate the medals race, setting three more games records.

title: The Program
description: TAROT, a folkrock mime musical, con ceived by The Rubber Duck. Directed by The Rubber Duck and Robert Kai fin; music by Tom Constanten and the Rubber Band; settings and cos tumes by Stephen Hendrickson; light ing by Burl Hash; production man ager, Burl Hash; stage manager, Judi Fisher; masques devised by Tim Mil ler. Fomented by the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn. At the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafayette Me nue, Brooklyn.

title: PISTONS CONQUER CELTICS BY 121118
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The Detroit Pistons came from four points back with 11 seconds left to tie in regulation time and then rallied behind Bob Lanier and Dave Bing for a 121118 overtime victory over Boston tonight, snapping the Celtics 10game streak.

title: 2YEAR PROGRAMS URGED BY WELL
description: William J. McGill, the presi dent of Columbia University, called yesterday for greater emphasis on twoyear college programs and for the elimina tion of much redundancy in college studies.

title: Computer Examines Machinery
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 A computer that keeps track of a machine's health is be ing adopted to the heavy construction industry. The Bissett  Berman Corporation,

title: SLUGGING CROWN TO YASTRZEMSKI
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11 (UPI) Carl Yastrzemski of the Boston Red Sox led the American League with, a .592 slugging percentage and Ron Perrano ski of the Minnesota Twins set a single season league record of 34 saves, according to of ficial league statistics issued today.

title: Indios Tabajaras Put Songs to Guitar In Tully Hall Recital
description: The two Brazilian Indians who, are known as Los Indios Tabajaras stressed cultural ecu menism in their program Thurs day evening at Alice Tully Hall. Playing their guitars with warm, mellow tone and, on oc casions, singing, Natilico and Antenor Lima roamed through short, melodic tidbits of the European classical repertory; folk songs from various coun tries in South America, and popular songs of the United States, Japan and Brazil.

title: Market Place:
description: Mutualfund shareholders have grown accustomed to depending on their holdings for income.

title: Acquiring Sewing Skills Sense of Identity
description: Twelveyearold Carl Williams threw his schoolbooks in a corner, took down a box with his name on it from a shelf, withdrew a length of brown fabric, and began stitching the edges together. His friend, Anthony Thomas, 13, was confidently stitching away on another piece of brown fabric. He was making his fourth scarf.

title: U. S. and Agency Bonds
description: Friday, December 11, 1970

title: LABOR CONDITIONS NORMAL FOR PORT
description: Labor conditions in the port returned to normal yesterday following a week of stoppages including a wildcat strike Wednesday by 13,000 long shoremen.

title: EAST GERMANS VOICE HOPE ON BERLIN PACT
description: BERLIN, Dec. 11  The East German Communist party's Central Committee ended threeday session in East Ber lin tonight with the unanimous passage of a declaration ex pressing hope that the four power talks on West Berlin will reach a mutually accept able agreement.

title: Elite Riding in Happy Confusion
description: Mrs. Joseph A. Meehan is in the Social Register, and she is also in buses during these revolutionary times.

title: Measure to Extend Excise Taxes Wins Approval by House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)The House voted today to continue the excise taxes of 10 per cent on telephone serv ice and 7 per cent on new automobiles through 1972 and to speed up estate and gift tax collections to produce $4.1bil lion in additional revenue.

title: DALLAS TO DEPEND ON MORTON PASSES
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11 (AP) The key to Cleveland's con tinued mastery over the Dallas Cowboys is Bill Nelsen, a gimpykneed quarterback, who hasn't lost to the Texas team in three starts.

title: British Company to Help In Space Shuttle Design
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec 11 (UPI) The McDonnell Douglas Cor poration announced today that an agreement had been reached with a British aerospace com pany, Hawker Siddeley Avia tion, Ltd., to be a member of the McDonnell Douglas group working on a space shuttle de sign.

title: Commerce Group Asks Nations to Negotiate to Stem Protectionism
description: PARIS, Dec. 11An organiza tion representing private indus try in 80 countries is seeking to prod governments into a new round of trade liberaliza tion after conclusion of nego tiations to enlarge the European Economic Community.

title: CALLEY'S DEFENSE AIDED BY WITNESS
description: FORT BENNING. Ga., Dec, 11A former helicopter pilot, testifying for the defense at the murder trial of First Lieut. Wil liam L. Calley Jr., said today that a large group of Vietnam. ese strewn along a trail at the southern edge of Mylai had been killed before any Ameri can troops reached the scene.

title: SEIKO OBARA MAKES DEBUT AS GUITARIST
description: Seiko Obara, a 22yearold Japanese guitarist, made her New York debut Thursday night at Carnegie Recital.liall, five years affer, her father and teacher, Yasumasa Obara, gave his first recital from the same, stage. Miss Obara, who stood not much taller than the high. backed chair she used, made her best impression of the eve ning, coincidentally, as a mini aturist. In Four Pieces by Frank Martin, the recitalist's sensi tivity as a colorist gave these contemporary , cameos unex pected charm. Falla's brief elegy, Le Toinbeau de Debus sy, also caught and held attention, even though Miss Obara's rhythmic ideas sug gested a tension that was out of place.

title: OUSTED NICKEL AIDE SEES POLITICAL AIM
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 11 (AP) Dr. Leslie Glasgow, an en vironmental expert dismissed by the Nixon Administration, said today that he had been pushed out of the Department of the Interior by political and business interests in a shake up that represented a definite step backwards for environ ment.

title: Office's Output and Funds at Highs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Inventors will receive a record total of 80,000 patents in the current fiscal year, more than double the annual output of the early nineteen twenties. Weekly patent volume (they are issued only on Tuesdays) will reach 1,800 early next month.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE TO MOVE UPWARD
description: The stock market's dynamic recovery, a rally dominated by professionals almost to the ex clusion of small investors, kept rolling onward Yesterday.

title: Various Factors Cited in Yost's Dismissal
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11At the Security Coun cil's meeting last Saturday on Guinea's charges of a Portu guese invasion, the United States representative, Charles W. Yost, wore a lavender shirt of wallpaper design and a wide purple tie for the first time in his life. His preference had normally run to gray suits, white

title: Best in the East Pick Up Their Awards
description: Dartmouth, Delaware and Edinboro State players and coaches were honored at the annual Lambert awards luncheon yesterday as each institution received credit for outstanding performance this season in Eastern inter collegiate football.

title: Police Here to Seek Ties With the People
description: The Police Department here will soon begin a pilot project to encourage police men, under the command of a neighborhood police chief, to get to know the pqople on their beats better.

title: MARLAND TO AIM AT NEW PRIORITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Dr. Sidney P. Marland Jr., who was confirmed by the ,Senate last night as Commissioner of Education, said today that his major task would be to per suade the President of our ability to reorder priorities.

title: U.S.SOVIET PACT ON FISHING SIGNED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A SovietAmerican agreement on fishing rights off the Middle Atlantic Coast of the United States was signed here today amid complaints by Senators and American fishing interests that Washington had failed to bargain hard enough with the Russians.

title: MANY CRITICIZES LABOR EDUCATION
description: George Meany, president of the American Federation of LaborCongress of Industrial Organizations, stressed last night the importance of worker education programs but said that unfortunately America's educational system had not re sponded adequately.

title: Explosion Injures 3 In Computer Center At the U. of Kansas
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Dec. 11 (AP)An explosion ripped the University of Kansas computer center tonight three minutes after a telephoned threat of a bombing. Three persons were injured.

title: Notes From Underground
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 11In a world of megatons and onrushing technology and new forms of political control, words still have their mysterious power. That was the unexpected and moving lesson at this year's Nobel Prize ceremony.

title: MRS. J. WESLEY DALE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 11 Mrs. Elizabeth Marie Hoar Dale, widow of J. Wesley Dale, chief auditor of the American Tobac co Company, died yesterday in Atlantic City Hospital after brief illness. She was 72 years old and lived at Wildwood Crest, N. J., and Cape Coral, Fla.

title: Yale Prom Gives Way After a 127Year Run
description: The Yale Prom, a 19th century tradition that stum bled into the second half of the 20th, has run its course.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GRASPING IMAGINATION: The American Writings of Henry James. By Peter Buitenhuis. Illustrated. 288 pages. Univer sity of Toronto Press. $12.50.

title: Mother and Son Find That Grime Does Pay
description: An East Side housewife and her 16yearold son are to receive $12,500 jointly for providing information that led to the conviction of a concrete company for pol luting the East River.

title: WERNER W. HUTZ
description: KENNETT SQUARE, Pa., Dec. 11Werner W. Hutz, a lawyer, died Wednesday in Delaware Hospital, Wilmington, Del. He was 63 years old and lived on Chandler Mill Road here.

title: Bolivian Woman Arrested At Airport on Drug Charge
description: A 21 year old Bolivian woman was arrested at Ken nedy Airport yesterday and ac cused by the Customs Bureau of trying to smuggle into the United States cocaine having street value of $500,000.

title: SAMUEL T. WATSON
description: Samuel T. Watson, retired national manager of First Three Markets Group, died Wednes day night in his home at Tudor City Place, after a long illness. Ho was 65 years old.

title: RUSSELL WATSON, LAWYER, 85, DIES
description: BOUND BROOK, N. J., Dec. 11Russell , E. Watson, a law yer, government official and trustee of Rutgers University, died today at the Somerset Valley Nursing Home. He was 85 years old and lived in the Belle Meade section of Somer set County.

title: Pacers Top Cougars, 155148
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Dec. 11 (UPI)In a game in which the score was tied 32 times and the lead changed 54 times, the Indiana Pacers beat the Caro lina Cougars, 155148, in double overtime tonight.

title: TRAINS AND MAILS GO THROUGH AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The nation's trains and mails were moving almost normally today following an 18hour strike that was called off last night.

title: Pros Beat Rockets, 102100
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 11 (AP) Steve Jones scored on a jump shot at the final buzzer tonight to give the Memphis Pros a 102100 victory over the Den ver Rockets.

title: AGENCY TO TRAIN NEGRO TEACHERS OUSTED IN SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Nixon Administration, which has declined to challenge the legality of hundreds of dis missals and demotions of Negro teachers in the South, offered instead today $3.2million to retrain the displaced educators.

title: AUTOMOBILE OUTPUT ADVANCES FOR WEEK
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI) Passengercar production in the United States moved upward again this week as the General Motors Corporation stepped up its output after a 67day strike, Ward's Automotive Reports said today.

title: Utica Papers Name Head
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 11 (AP)  Herman E. Moecker has been elected president of Utica Observer  Dispatch, Inc., pub lisher of Utica's two daily news papers, it was announced today by the parent Gannett Co., Inc. He will continue as publisher. Mr. Moecker succeeds Paul Miller.

title: Courts, Crime, Dollars and justice
description: WASHINGTONIt is open season on the courts. The judges are blamed from all sides for the crime wave, the clogging of court dockets, the over crowded, jails, excessive bail, short sentences and downright indolence. If I were called upon to identify the culprit I would first point to the fiscal authorities who decide the amount of money the courts receive.

title: Hamilton Plans Oil Well
description: DENVER, Dec. 11 (UPI)A group headed by the Hamilton Bros. Petroleum Corporation and Hamilton Bros. Oil Com pany plans to dril an explora tory well in the United King dom sector of the North Sea. The companies said the Sea Quest, a semisubmersible drill ing rig, has been brought to the drilling location,

title: Mallick J. Fitzpatrick, 82, Catholic Archdiocese Aide
description: Mallick J. Fitzpatrick, who retired in 1966 as buyer for In stitutional Commodity Services, Inc., purchasing department of the New York Roman Catholic Archdiocese, died here Thurs day. He was 82 years old and lived at 94 Suffolk Lane, Gar den City, L.I.

title: Lighting a Dark Spot on Fifth
description: Not all department store miracles take place on 34th Street. In a week, the darkened windows of the old Georg Jensen building at Fifth Avenue and 53d Street had been transformed into a glittering introduction to the Light house Christmas Boutique, which opened here yesterday.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Rejects Death Penalty in a Rape Case as Cruel
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 11 (AP) A Federal Appeals Court held today that the death penalty for rape when the victim's life was neither taken nor endan gered violates the constitu tional prohibition against cruel and unusual punishment.

title: No U.S. Deaths for 2 Days
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Dec. 12 (UPI)  The United States command report ed yesterday that there had been no American combat deaths in the 48 hours ended last midnight. This was the sec ond such report in a month.

title: F.C.C. APPOINTEE AN INTERIM CHOICE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Thomas James Hauser, Presi dent Nixon's nominee to fill longstanding vacancy at the Federal Communications Com mission, confirmed this evening that he was being appointed only to fill out the six months remaining on an unexpired term..

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Coaching Staff Resigns In a Dispute Over Hair
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa, Dec. 11 (AP)Five coaches at Coe College resigned today in a dispute over long hair and a grooming code for athletes. Resignations were turned in by Glenn Drahn, football coach, Dave Etienne, basketball, Bob Thurness, track, Merle Masonholder, wrestling, and Al Kloppen, baseball.

title: Shanker Says Scribner Must Succeed
description: Albert Shanker, the president of the United Federation of Teachers, has declared that Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, whom he has frequently criticized, must succeed as city school Chan cellor because if he fails, there's trouble ahead.

title: Business of Business Art Since 1950
description: During World War II some companies that were unable to divert their prod ucts to consumers became concerned, naturally, that ?their public image might tarnish or even disappear. Rather than resort to tradi tional hardsell advertising for a nonnegotiable product, they decided to exploit the lull by brainwashing the pub lic that hardnosed business men were also interested in the spiritual and philosophi cal aspects of life and that businesses could be centers of sophistication, intellect and character.

title: Spanish General Deplores Army Role in Basques Trial
description: MADRID, Dec. 11  One of the few surviving. generals on the Franco side in the Civil War has written a letter to the military governor of Burgos de ploring the army's involvement in the courtmartial of 15 Basque activists.

title: U.S. Caribbean Economy Fare to Rise
description: GENEVA, Dec. 11Econ onlyclass air travel between the United States and the Caribbean area is to cost 5 per cent more beginning April 1, the International Air Transport Association announced today.

title: U.S. Mission headed Hardin Warns E.E.C. on Its Farm Policies
description: PARIS, Dec. 11An emissary of President Nixon, stepping up the American assault against discriminatory Common Mar ket farm policies, has warned that protectionism cannot be beaten back in the United IStates without a positive re sponge from Europe.

title: 2 Victors at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11  Carl Chapman, whose brother John is a harness horse driver trainer at Roosevelt Raceway. saddled two winners today at Liberty Bell Race Track where 9,069 fans wagered $1,084,712 on an eightrace program.

title: Chrysler Recalls 244 Trucks
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Chrysler Corporation an nounced today that it had noti fied owners of 244 Dodge trucks to return them to their dealers for inspection and, if necessary, correction of pos sible safety defects. The recalls involved a suspected defect in a spring hanger pin that could cause a loss of steering control and a hydraulic throttle con trol system that could cause the accelerator to stick.

title: CAMBODIANS BEGIN RATIONING OF GAS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 11 (UPI)Enemy pressures on the highway linking the capital to Cambodia's only oil refinery forced the Government to ra tion gasoline today for the first time. Thousands of motorists swamped service stations, whose pumps quickly ran dry.

title: Knights in Title Game Today
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Dec. 11 (UPI)  The Hartford Knights and the Pennsylvania Firebirds of Pottstown, Pa., meet here tomorrow for the Atlantic Coast Football League championship. It will be the third straight championship playoff for the Knights. They took the title in 1968, but lost it to the Fire birds last year, 200.

title: SHIBATA CAPTURES TITLE IN ROUND 13
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Dec. 11 (AP)Kuniaki Shibata of Tokyo scored an upset knock out victory over Vicente Sal divar of Mexico City tonight to win the World Boxing Coun cil's share of the featherweight title.

title: PLACE DE GAULLE AT A CROSSROADS
description: PARIS, Saturday, Dec. 12 The Paris Municipal Council ended a special session in com plete deadlock early this morn ing after a majority had voted to reconsider a monthold deci sion to giVe the name of Charles de Gaulle to the Place de l'Etoile.

title: More Diphtheria in Texas
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 11 (UPI)  The fourth diphtheria case of December was reported today in San Antonio,

title: DAYAN SAID TO ASK LONGERTERM AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Moshe Dayan, the Israeli De fense Minister, reportedly urged the Nixon Administration to day to put future arms sup plies to Israel on a longterm contract basis, like Soviet sup plies to the United Arab Re public, rather than to negotiate each arms deal piecemeal when crises occur.

title: $.1,1Billion Holding Company Proposed by Big Upstate Banks
description: The formation of a new $1.1. billion bankholding company in upstaste New York was pro posed yesterday by major banks in Albany and Syracuse.

title: G.I. Gets 18 Months
description: STUTTGART, Germany, Dec. 11 (AP)A United States Army courtmartial sentenced Pfc. Al phonso L. Lewis of New York City to 18 months at hard labor today on charges stemming from a fire May 21 at a train ing area in Hohenfels, West Germany, during a period of racial tension.

title: England 257 for 2 in Cricket As 2d Aussie Test Begins
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 11 (Reuters)England piled up firstday score of 257 runs for two wickets today in the sec ond cricket test against Aus tralia.

title: Nixon Aides Believe Hanoi Got Best of Deal on Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Behind the Nixon Adminis tration's expanding threats to resume the bombing of North Vietnam lies a growing conviction within the Government that Hanoi got very much the better of the deal it struck with President Lyndon B. Johnson two years ago.

title: Oil Executive Fears Disaster
description: PNOMPENH, Dec. 11 (AP) Thonn Ouk, president of Cam bodia's statecontrolled oil re finery and gasolinedistributing corporation, predicted today a paralyzed economy and possible defeat for the armed forces, un less Route 4 was reopened and gasoline trucks start rolling again before the end of this month.

title: African Council Condemns NATO on Portugal
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 11  The Ministerial Council of the Organization of African Unity condemned the North Atlantic allies today, charging them with complicity in attacks by Portu gal against African territories and states.

title: 4 of 8 New Issues Offered This Week Show Slight Gains
description: The newissue market, where shares of compapies that had never before offered their stock to the public are traded, edged up slightly this week in mod erate activity.

title: Antiques: To the Bottle
description: Bottle collecting is attract ing more and more antiques enthusiasts, and the prime reason for the great interest seems to be the low price of some examples.

title: Nader Urges F.T.C. to Ban Ads Not Backed by Scientific Tests
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Ralph Nader and other consum er advocates asked the Federal Trade Commission today to is sue a regulation prohibiting ad Vertisers from making asses Lions that were not, fully and completely substantiated by sci entific tests.

title: Dodgers Add to Power by Trading 2 Pitchers for Sims of Indians
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers who obtained Richie Allen two months ago, added more power yesterday when they acquired Duke Sims in a three  man trade with the Cleveland Indians.

title: 2 TOP H.R.A. POSTS MERGED BY MAYOR
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that he was consoli dating the city's top antipoverty and welfare posts, thereby eliminating a $37,500ayear executive job.

title: Holly Corp. Reports Failure To Pay Note Due on Nov. 1
description: DALLAS, Dec. 11 (Reuters) The Holly Corporation said today it had informed the Secu rities and Exchange Commission and the American Stock Ex change that it did not pay .a promissory note held by the. Republic National Bank of Dada las, due Nov. 1, 1970. The note, was in the principal amount of $1,696,518, Holly said.

title: Finger Lakes Gets 71 Dates
description: The State Racing Commission approved yesterday a 139  day season for the Finger Lakes Racing Association from May 5 through Oct. 13, 1971.

title: Chichester Sets Sail For a Speed Record
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Sir Fran cis Chichester, the first man to sail alone around the world, set off this evening to seek another record.

title: Women Artists Demonstrate at Whitney
description: Equipped with red armbands and a giant placard that read Women Now, a small bevy of women artists invaded the invitational opening of the Whitney Museum's 1970 Sculp ture Annual exhibition last eve ning. Waving the placard, they circulated among the guests and staged a fiveminute sitin before a massive piece of sculp ture.

title: Mrs. B Wallace Hamilton Dies; A Welfare and Church Leader
description: Mrs. Florence Durstine Ham ilton, a welfare and church leader, who was the widow of Dr. B..Wallice Hamilton, for mer secretary of the New York County Medical Society, died yesterday at the Courtland Gardens Convalescent Home in Stamford, Conn. She was 89 years old and had lived at 52 East 66th Street for 50 years.

title: Williston Park G.I. Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The Defense Department today announced the names of six United States servicemen killed in action in the war in South east Asia. Among them was Pfc. Carmine A. Macedonio, Williston Park, N.Y., of the Army.

title: Global Air Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Some 250 technical papers in several languages are being presented this week at the sec ond International Clean Air Congress. But this avalanche of verbiage tends to obscure father than illuminate the

title: Army Hits F.B.I. on Riot Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11High Pentagon officials said recently that an usuccessful attempt was made in the spring of 1969 to have the Federal Bureau of Investigation take over from Army investigators the task of looking into the prospects of riots in major American cities.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Dec. 8:

title: For Student Court Managers, the Reality Is Dismaying
description: DENVER, Dec. 7The na tion's most unlikely group of aging student radicals is preparing to graduate Satur day from a new school that was created at the suggestion of Chief Justice Warren E. Burger.

title: Rojas, Stopped by Ramos, Announces His Retirement
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11 (AP) Raul Rojas, former feather weight and junior lightweight champion, called it quits after Mando Ramos, former light weight titleholder, knocked him out last night in a 135pound match.

title: Cans That Go Clang in the Night May Yield to Paper and Plastic
description: The City Council's Housing Committee approved yester day a measure that would al low plastic and paper bags to replace the standard metal gar bane can.

title: U.S. Says It Has No Data On Herbicide Use in Angola
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A State Department official said today that the United States had no information that Portu gal had used herbicides to de stroy crops grown by rebels in Angola.

title: Money
description: Friday, Dec. 11, 1970

title: The Supreme CourtFor Export?
description: LONDONI wonder whether. those billboards calling for the impeachment of Earl Warren, whiclrused to disfigure the public highways of the Deep South, have yet been amended .with. the name of the new Chief Justice. Probably he is too recently in office; but I doubt whether, in the longer term, the Burger Court will prove any less controversial or more popular than its predecessor.

title: SKATE LEAD TAKEN BY DENISE CAHILL
description: ARDMORE, Pa., Dec. 11  Denise Cahill of Baltimore gained first place in school figures, leading Alice Stock fleth of Wilmington, Del., in the senior ladies singles of the South Atlantic figure skating championships today at the Philadelphia Skating Club and Humane Society. The free skating will be held tomorrow night.

title: Stage: A Musical by The Rubber Duck
description: Pretentiousness is rioting at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, where last night the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn illadvisedly opened a musical called Tarot.

title: RULES ARE PROPOSED BY HOME LOAN BOARD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reuters)The Federal Home Loan Bank Board proposed to day a new regulation that would increase the maximum term of construction loans se cured by apartments and other projects to 36 months from the present 24 months.

title: Mr. Bush to the U.N.
description: George Herbert Walker Bush is an attractive, intelligent Republican now completing his second term in the House of Representatives from, his adopted state of Texas. In time he may develop into an effective representative for the United States at the United Nations but there seems to be nothing in his record that qualifies him for this highly important position.

title: NLT in Ralston Deal
description: The NLT Corporation an nounced yesterday it has agreed to purchase 3 million common shares of the Ralston Purina Company from the Danforth Foundation of St. Louis for $73,125,000. This would give NLT, a holding company whose major property is National Life, and Accident Insurance Com

title: Seton Hall Beats Morehead
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Dec. 11Led by Frank Cortes's 33 points, Seton Hall University upset Morehead State 9166, tonight for Coach Bill Raftery's first victory at the Hall.

title: Kentucky Court Awards FirstPlace Money in 68 Derby to Dancer's Image
description: Thirtyone months after his original run for the roses, Dan cer's Image charged toward final, unequivocal, asteriskless victory yesterday in the 1968 Kentucky Derby,

title: West Germans Drop Case Against Thalidomide Maker
description: ALSDORF, West Germany, Dec. 11 (Reuters)A state prosecutor agreed today to drop proceedings in the twoyear old trial against the manufac turers of the drug thalidomide on charges that it led to de formation in children.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Surrealism and Collages
description: An unusual exhibition of 45 recent collages by the American artist Joseph Cor nell opened yesterday at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Organized by Henry Geld zahler, the museum's curator of 20thcentury art, the show consists entirely of works on loan from the artist himself. It is installed in Gallery 12. on the second floor of the museum, and the installation is, for a happy change, mod est, straightforward, and en tirely sympathetic to the art itself.

title: U.N. Committee Approves A Report Accusing Israel
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11A report accusing Is rael of maltreating Arabs in territories occupied since 1967 and calling for some interna tional supervision was approved here today by 3 vote of 49 to 14 with 37 abstentions.

title: JIMMY MURPHY, 79, SPORTSWRITER, DIES
description: Jimmy Murphy, a sports writer and sports editor here for more than half a century, died at his home yesterday. He was 79 years old and lived in Rockowaya Beach, Queens.

title: SOVIET BLOC LOSES SPACE PACT VOTE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 11  An isolated group of Soviet bloc states voted to day against a proposal urging speedy completion of a treaty covering damages caused by objects launched into space But the proposal was approved by the General Assembly's top political committee in an 85 to8 vote.

title: Moscow's Economic Priorities
description: Disappointed by the production performance of the Soviet economy in 1969, Soviet Communist party chief Leonid Brezhnev began insisting many months ago on sharp improvement in 1970. The statistics cited at this week's meeting of the Supreme Soviet indicate that the pressure must have had some positive results as indus trial and agricultural output increased 8 and 6.5 per cent respectively over last year.

title: Taxi Mediator Reports An Absolute Impasse
description: Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Media tion Board, said yesterday that there was an absolute impasse in financial areas in the negotiations between striking taxi drivers and fleet owners.

title: SST Compromise Greeted By Relief and Uncertainty
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Before House and Senate con ferees agreed last night on a compromise $210million appro priation for the supersonic transport, the Department of Transportation warned them that so low a figure would add $160million to the overall cost of the project and would de stroy the prototype program as we know it today.

title: U.S. RULES JAPAN IS DUMPING TUNERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.11The Treasury Department ruled to day that Japanese electronic tuners were being dumped on the United States market at lower prices than they were sold at in Japan.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, Dec. 11, 1970

title: W. ARTHUR RIEHL, 72, BUILDING TRADE AIDE
description: SPRINGDALE, Conn., Dec. 11 W. Arthur Riehl, former sec retary of the Building Trades Employers Association of the City of New York, died yester day in Stamford Hospital after a brief illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 29 Old Colony Road.

title: Nixons Christmas Card
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)  President and Mrs. Nixon started mailing out their Christmas cards today to thousands of persons.

title: DELINQUENCIES RISE IN HOME MORTGAGES
description: Delinquency rates on oneto fourfamily home mortgages climbed during the third quar ter as purchasers were ham pered by rising unemployment and lower takehome pay, the Mortgage Bankers Association of America reported yesterday.

title: FEDERAL BIAS SUIT ASSAILS U.S. STEEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  The Justice Department charged the United States Steel Corpora tion today with discriminating against blacks at its plant in Birmingham, Ala.

title: Aeronautics Board Sets Up Consumer Affair Office
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The Civil Aeronautics Board has established a consumer af fairs office to improve com munications with consumers and provide more effective han dling of their complaints against airlines.

title: Democracy for Democrats
description: In order to bring a greater degree of democracy into the nominating procedures of the Democratic party, and through that party into politics generally, the New York State Democratic Committee will meet in Albany today. The committee will consider a number of badly needed reforms. These reforms have been drafted to accord with recommendations made earlier by the McGovern Com mission which grew out of the debacle at Chicago in 1968.

title: Domingo Will Sing His First 'Ernani' At the Met Jan. 8
description: Placido Domingo will assume the title role in Verdi's Er nani for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera House in the performance to be given on Jan. 8 in the 17th week of the company's season. Bonaldo Gi aiotti will appear as Silva for the first time here in the same performance, and other leading members of the cast will be Martina Arroyo and Sherrill Milnes.

title: A U.S. JURY ENDS JACKSON INQUIRY
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 11 A Federal grand jury apparent ly closed the door today on prosecution of any lawenforce ment officers in the shooting that killed two blacks and wounded 12 at a dormitory at Jackson State College last May 14.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CLOSE ON UPTICK
description: The American Stock Exchange ended the week on an uptick yesterday as the list advanced on modern trading.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Life Without Taxis
description: The taxi strike is turning out to be more of an ordeal for the drivers, and probably for visitors, than for the inhabitants of this city. For many New Yorkers, in fact, it has been a refreshing interlude. Driving brisker, the streets are safer and the air is sweeter.

title: `LOS INVASORES REFLECTS A TREND
description: For anyone interested in what Spanish theater groups are do ing in the city, Los Invasores (The Invaders) by Egan Wolff, the contemporary Chilean play wright, provides a thought pro voking evening of theater.

title: Forces in Japan See Mishima as Yesterday's Dreamer
description: GOTEMBA, Japan, Dec. 5 To try to revive an Em perorcentered Japanin this day and age people simply aren't going to go along with a scheme like that, said Lance Cpl. Nobuyuki Fuji moto.

title: Squires Down Chaparrals
description: DALLAS, Dec. 11 (UPI) Charlie Scott scored 38 points tonight to lead the Virginia Squires to a 146136 victory over the Texas Chaparrals.

title: Market Averages
description: Friday, Dec. 11, 1970

title: BARRY SCORES 27, NETS WIN, 12899
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 11 (AP)Rick Barry, con tinuing his comeback after an injury, scored 27 points tonight and led the New York Nets to a 12899 American Basketball Association victory over the Kentucky Colonels.

title: STATE CRIME UNIT PRESSES INQUIRY
description: Lenient treatment of gang sters in the courts, corruption of police and public officials, and lack of emergency wire tapping authority seriously hamper the war against organ ized crime in the city, two city police officers testified yes terday before the State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Sweden Gives U.S. a Hanoi P.O.W. List
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reu ters)  Significant new infor mation on more than 200 Americans captured or missing in the Vietnam war has been received here from Hanoi through Sweden; United States officials said today.

title: Rangers Defeat Seals by 21, Rallying From 10 Deficit in Third Period
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 (UPIJack Egers tallied two goals in the final period tonight to give New York a 21 victory over the California Golden! Seals and move the Rangers! into a firstplace tie with Bos ton in the East Division of the National Hockey League.

title: Judo at Y.M.C.A. Tonight
description: The 10th annual North and South Shiai, for sectional hon ors in judo, will be held tonight starting at 6 o'clock at the Mc Burney Y.M.C.A., 215 West 23d Street. The McBurney and New York Athletic Club judo clubs are the sponsors. Each team will consist of 15 members and seven alternates.

title: College and School Results
description: PULLING ONE DOWN: Tom Boerwinkle of Bulls grabbing a rebound as Pete Maravich of Hawks looks on during action at Chicago last night. The Bulls won, 87 to 86.

title: Bucks Rout Cavaliers
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Milwaukee Bucks, led by Lew Alcindor's 34 points, hand ed the Cleveland Cavaliers their 29th loss in 31 games, 13492, tonight.

title: 60 Injured, in Blast That Shatters Bar Off City Hall Park
description: An old threestory building near the tip of City Hall Park exploded yesterday, then burst into flames.

title: 4 in Same Family Have Open Heart Operations
description: CAPETOWN, Dec. 11Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard, South Africa's heart transplant pi oneer, performed four open heart operations here this weekall on members of the same family.

title: Plea Made for Basques
description: GENEVA, Dec. 11The In ternational Commission of Jurists appealed today to the Spanish authorities not to execute the six Basque na tionalists for whom the prose cution in the Burgos trials has demanded the death sentence. The commission also requested the Spanish Government to investigate the defendants charges that they had been tortured.

title: Hunt Pressed in New Canaan Killings
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 11  Connecticut policemen searched Boy Scout camp sites and ski areas today for a 17 yearold honor student who dis appeared after his mother, grandmother, Sister and brother were found murdered yesterday in their home here.

title: Case Is Dismissed After Only 5 Men Show Up for Jury
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Dec. 11 A morals charge against a 32 yearold psychiatrist was dis missed in City Court here yes terday when for the third time in the last two weeks not enough people showed up for jury to be drawn.

title: COUNCIL IS ASKED TO TIGHTEN ETHICS
description: Written disclosure of their sources of income would be re quired of city Councilmen or candidates for the Council under legislation proposed yesterday.

title: Higher British Fares Denied
description: LONDON, Dec. 11  The Air Transport Licensing Board today rejected applications for higher fares on British domestic routes, saying that in creased fares would spur infla tion.

title: CowardMcCann to Add Geoghegan to its Name
description: CowardMcCann, Inc., the book publisher, will acquire a new name Jan. 1Cow ard, McCann & Geoghegan, Inc. The Geoghegan is for John J. Geoghegan, the 53 yearold president and editor in chief of the company since 1961.

title: LAIRD LINKS PACE OF TALKS IN PARIS TO FURTHER RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird suggested today that the absence of progress at the Paris peace talks could provide an other justification for renewed bombing of North Vietnam.

title: JEWS IN U.S. TOLD OF ISRAEL'S NEEDS
description: American Jewish philanthrop ic leaders yesterday called on Jewish communities through out the country to increase the financial aid for Israel's social welfare, education and health needs.

title: Consumers Tell of Canceled Insurance
description: A Forest Hills housewife told a hearing called by State Attorney Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday how both her auto mobile policy and homeown er's insurance coverage had been arbitrarily canceled although she had never filed a claim under either policy.

title: Hope Wanes for End of British Blackout
description: LONDON, Dec. 11Hopes for an early settlement of Brit ain's power crisis collapsed to night and the Government moved toward a declaration of national emergency.

title: Moscow Cancels U. S. Visit By Bolshoi Opera, Ballet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11  The Soviet Union today canceled planned visits to the United States by the Bolshoi Theater's opera and ballet companies next spring, charging that the American authorities had failed to stop provocations by Zion ist thugs.

title: Life Term for Slaying of 3
description: A 25yearold Brooklyn man was sentenced to life in prison yesterday after he was con victed Thursday of the meat cleaver slaying of three men in a Brooklyn butcher shop in 1965. Reginald S. Batten was sentenced by Supreme Court Justice Guy J. Mangano in Brooklyn. Batten had been con victed of firstdegree murder two years ago when he was on trial with Kazle R. Anthony. Batten's conviction was re versed and a new trial granted. Anthony is serving a life sen tence.

title: $210,000 Paid for an Eakins Sets a Record for U. S. Artists
description: A world auction record for an American artist was posted Thursday night with the sale of Thomas Eakins's Cowboys In the Badlands for $210,000. The painting, created in 1888, was recently seen in an Eakins retrospective at the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
Blocker Leads Bahamas Golf by Shot on 66 for 135 Total
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Chris Blocker equaled chte course record of 66 today and vaulted in to a onestroke lead after 36 holes of the $136,000 Bahamas Islands open, golf tournament. Doug Sanders was second and Arnold Palmer third another stroke back.

title: Bulls Down Hawks. 8786
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11. (UPI) Chet Walker's 25foot field goal with 42 seconds left and his free throw with 16 seconds re maining gave the Chicago Bulls an 8786 victory over the At lanta Hawks tonight to run their N.B.A. winning streak to three games.

title: W. Virginia Ousts Army Five
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 11 (UPI)West Virginia held off a secondhalf rally to night to beat Army, 7471, and join undefeated Virginia in the finals of the first Mountaineer Classic. Virgina pulled away early in the second half to beat Boston College, 7969, for its fifth victory.

title: PENNSY UNIT SKIPS A DIVIDEND ACTION
description: The Pennsylvania Company, the investment subsidiary of the Penn Central Transportation Company, omitted action yes terday on. the $1.15625ashare dividend on its 4 per cent cumulative preferred stock.

title: Lucile Collette, ExPianist, Violinist and Teacher, Dies
description: Lucile Collette, a former con cert violinistteacher and pian ist who, despite her failing eyesight, had provided piano accompaniment in musical pro grams of The Lighthouse, died Thursday after a short illness at her home, 11 West 69th Street. She was 79 years old.

title: PANAFRICAN BODY FORMED IN HARLEM
description: The recent raid on Guinea for which Portugal was blamed helped a Harlembased Af rican nationalist organization achieve in two weeks a goal it had sought for 14 yearsa federation of Africanoriented black groups.

title: Sir Arthur Longmore, 85, Dies; A Former Air Chief Marshal
description: LONDON, Dec. 11  Former Air Chief Marshal Sir Arthur Longmore, a pioneer in British Naval aviation, died yesterday at his home in Sunningdale, Berkshire. He was 85 years old.

title: DE VICENZO LEADS ARGENTINE GOLF
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 11 (UPI)Roberto de Vicenzo of Argentina shot a oneunderpar 69 today for a onestroke lead at 137 over Gary Player of South Africa and two others in the second round of the $10,000 Argentine Masters golf tournament.

title: KANSAS CITY CLUB IS 1POINT CHOICE
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 (UPI)  The Oakland Raiders and Kansas City Chiefs, who in 11 years have created one of the most bitter rivalries In the history of pro football, will tangle tomorrow in the one that counts for 1970.

title: Angry Maynard Ready for Dolphins
description: Don Maynard, sufficiently recovered from a strained calf muscle, will fly to Miami with the rest of the Jets today and undoubtedly will play in at least part, of tomorrow's game with the Dolphins.

title: Executive Changes
description: James O. Alston has been elected to the newly created post of vice chairman of the board at the Jim Walter Corporation. Frank J. Pizzitola, execu tive vice president an I chief operating officer, was elected to succeed Mr. Alston as president. Also elected was Arnold F. Saraw to the new post of senior vice president and Joe B. Cordell to senior vice president treasurer. In addition Richard H. Thompson was elected vice president and secretary.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SWING UPWARD
description: Soybean and grain futures prices for the most part. did an about face, yesterday in rather dull trading after having dropped for four days in a row.

title: It May Be a Bit Far to Go for Pasta, but Italian Cooking Is Popular in Ethiopia
description: ASMARA, EthiopiaThe Ethiopians of this second largest city of the country have a spaghetti complex. And it that sounds like a blithe or contrived quip, it isn't. After all, the Ethiopians have been either associating with or battling the Italians for nearly a century, and it is reflected to one degree or another in the kitchens of most middle  class grid upperclass citizens of this quiet, sprawling city, only 70 twisting, turning miles from the Red Sea.

title: Draft Director, in Vietnam, Opposes School Deferments
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 12Curtis W. Tarr, director of the Selective Service System, said today that five days of talking with American soldiers in the field has convinced him more than ever that educational defer ments from the draft should be abolished.

title: Deltec Cites Loss For Fiscal Year And 4th Quarter
description: Meat operations in Argentina that lost $6,717,000 in the fig cal year ended last Sept. 30 continued to depress results of Deltec International, Ltd the company reported yester day.

title: U.S. and Soviet in Accord On Joint Atomic Research
description: BATAVIA, Ill., Dec. 11 (AP) Representatives of the Atom ic Energy Commission and the Soviet Union's State Commit tee for the Utilization of Atomic Energy signed an agreement today for joint ex periments at the National Ac celerator Laboratory being built near Batavia.

title: MRS. HELEN WILLIAMS
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 11 Mrs. Helen Winsor Williams, a former buyer in the New York office of the T. Eaton Company, Ltd. of Canada, department stores and mailorder concern, died of a heart attack Monday in White Plains. She was 66 years old and lived at 235 Garth Road.

title: 11 Mid town Bookstores Raided In Drive Against Pornography
description: Plainclothes men made si multaneous raids on 11 mid town stores said to be selling pornographic materials, includ ing books and films, yesterday.

title: MASTERWORK BEGINS ITS MESSIAH SERIES
description: David. Randolph and his Masterwork Chorus and Or chestra must be indefatigable. On Thursday night they began their annual series of Christ mas performances of Handel's Messiah, in Carnegie Hall, and they will follow it with three more, in Carnegie or Phil harmonic Hall, with a final presentation in Newark's Sym phony Hall. That represents lot of singing and playing, since Mr. Randolph gives the oratorio complete (there are only two cuts of soloaria re peats) and it lasts almost three hours.

title: 3 Accused of Using Home Repair To Defraud Owner of $125,000
description: A Queens prosecutor charged yesterday that a, New Jersey couple and a man had worked a homerepair swindle on an 82yearold Queens woman, and defrauded her of almost $125,000. Two other men are being sought, he added.

title: Rep. Bush of Texas Named To Succeed Yost at U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Pres ident Nixon today announced the appointment of Representa tive George Bush as United States delegate to the United Nations, succeeding Charles W. Yost.

title: MRS. PHANOR J. EDER
description: Mrs. Violet Lindo Eder, the wife of Phanor J. Eder, an in ternational lawyer, died yes terday in their home at 29 Washington Square West. She was 78 years old.

title: The Judicial Process
description: Like every branch and division of government in the United States to day, the judiciary is suffering a series of problems all of which may be appropriately labeled as crises. Mr, Chief Justice Burger in his state of the judiciary message clearly de scribed onethe incapacity of the Federal courts expeditiously to handle the myriad of cases now brought before them for resolution and cer tainly none can deny that the Ameri can courts are ineffectively trying to carry caseloads with whicn they pa tently cannot deal. The Chief Justice, however, puts his emphasis on quan titative problems. There are more fundamental difficulties.

title: Saigon Papers Curbed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  South Vietnam confiscated today's issues of 11 Saigon daily newspapers be cause of false reports quoting President Nguyen Van, Thieu as having said that the United States and South Vietnam were considering a monthlong cease fire during the Christmas, New Year and Tet holiday periods, a Government spokesman said.

title: U.S. Protests to Moscow
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The United States asserted today that the Soviet polite were interfering with United States consular activities in Moscow.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sports books have always been a staple of publishing; often cheaply produced, sloppily written, technically inac curate and/or dishonestly moralistic. The few that sur vived as reading experiencesRunyon, Lardner, Liebling, Tuniswere likely to be catalogued as Americana or humor or sociology or children's fiction. Sports books are still a staple of publishing, but the level of the game has risen dramatically in the last several years. The success of Paper Lion and Instant Replay attracted money and talent, a trend that should continue on the inspiration of Ball Four by Jim Bouton, edited by Leonard Shecter (World, $6.95), a controversial bestseller that leads the roster of reading gifts for Christmas. One does not have to be a fanor even terribly interestedto enjoy any these books.

title: CHARLES GROSMAN, JERSEY LAWYER, 72
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Charles M. Grosman, senior partner in the law firm of Grosman & Grosman, died here yesterday of a heart attack. He was 72 years old and lived at 44 South Munn Avenue, East Orange.

title: Warriors Down 76ers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 (AP)  Field goals by Joe Ellis and Jeff Mullins in the last minute and a half tonight carried the San Francisco Warriors to 102101 victory over the Phila delphia 76ers. The victors had trailed by 12 points in the third period and 7 in the fourth.

title: Settlement Is Seen in Hughes Dispute
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 11 The court battle between the Hughes Tool Company and Robert A. Mabeu, an executive whom Howard Hughes appar ently wants to dismiss, was re cessed tonight in an air that forecast a negotiated settle ment.

title: ROGER Q. PEASE
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 11 Roger Q. Pease, a. retired paper mill executive, died today in Concord Hospital of a coronary attack after .a brief illness. He was 89 years old and lived in Warner. near here.

title: Disappointment Voiced Over Bolshoi
description: An expression of disappoint ment by the city's Cultural Af fairs Commissioner and a state ment of determination by the Jewish Defense League marked the reaction yesterday to the Soviet, Union's cancellation of appearances here next year by the Bolshoi ballet and opera companies.

title: The Law: Time for Change
description: We are now living In an age which is markedly different from the 40's and 50's. History in our time has ac celerated at a bewildering rate. The crucial drama enacted in the theater of the law is not the same today. Events have changed the plots, the story lines, the music and types of characters.

title: Rube Goldberg' s Will Filed
description: Rube Gpldberg left an estate estimated at between $250,000 end $500,000 when he died Monday at the age of 87 years, filed for probate of his will in Surrogate's Court yesterday. Mr. Goldberg in his will, dated Nov. 25, 1969, left onehalf of the estate outright to his wife, Irma S. Goldberg. Exception for a number of bequests to rela tives and friends, the remainder was divided between two sons.

title: President Hints Congress Recall If Welfare Reforms Are Balked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 President Nixon today told a group made up mostly of Gov ernors that he might call Con gress back for a special session after Christmas if it adjourned without approving his welfare reform program.

title: Training the Jobless
description: White House advisers will be aiding neither President Nixon nor the nation if they persuade him to veto the manpower bill just agreed on by SenateHouse conferees. It would be far more sensible for the President to embrace this urgently needed measure as the first fruit of the threepart social program he sent to Congress in August 1969.

title: Christmas Trees Rooted in Imagination.
description: They're not everyone's idea of Christmas trees and not just anyone would buy them. In fact, they are meant for the affluent and the sophis ticated. The trees, one more original than the other, were designed by Stephen Barany, a young man who decorates some of the most heralded

title: Letters to the Editor
description: One Plan for Health Care

title: Lipscomb New Chief Editor of Dodd, Mead Unit
description: Dodd, Mead & Co., one of the country's oldest publishers and Tong associated with institu tional books and mysteries, is taking on a new identity as a publisher of topical nonfiction and current novels.

title: Enlisted Man Is Charged In Death of a Vietnamese
description: QHINHON, South Vietnam, Dec. 11 (AP)  The United States Army charged an en listed man with negligent homicide today in the killing of a Vietnamese boy that set off two days of antiAmerican rioting here earlier this week.

title: TRADING MIXED IN LONDON STOCKS
description: After a firm start, the Lon don stock market Closed nar rowly mixed in quiet trading yesterday.

title: Tito's Visit to Pope Is Off
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 11Yugoslavia and the Vatican announced today the postpone ment of an official visit by President Tito to Pope Paul VI scheduled for tomorrow. The postponement follows the sus pension of the Yugoslav lead er's state visit to Italy.

title: Church Agency for Minority Aid Suspends Grants as Gifts Lag
description: The Interreligious Founda tion for Community Organiza tion called a threemonth mora torium this week on new grants to minority groups.

title: Gregarious Nominee for U.N. Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 When the George Bush fam ily arrived in Washington one snowy day in 1967, Bar bara Bush had to dash out and buy extra sheets. Her husband had insisted that the workmen on the moving van spend the night with them.

title: U.C.L.A. Sinks Pacific Five.
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11 (AP) Topranked University of California, Los Angeles, swept to its third consecutive victory, beating the University of Pa cific, 10088, in a nonconference game tonight. Curtis Rowe led a balanced U.C.L.A. attack with 28 points.

title: Art: An Exhibition That. Backfires
description: The small but comprehen sive exhibition of the work of Joaquin TorresGarcia, opening today at the Gug genheim Museum, is a sort of puzzler, or a sort of embar rassment, for the critic, be cause here you have a per fectly good exhibition that backfires by its very excel lence.

title: 2 Men Shot and 2 Others Held At a Drug Meeting in Brooklyn
description: A meeting of narcotics addic tion workers discussing policy and finances in Brooklyn's East New York section ended in gun fire yesterday. Two men were wounded and two were charged with attempted mur der.

title: Fog Cancels Nixon Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) President Nixon canceled plans to go to Camp David to day when the Presidential re treat in the Maryland moun tains was fogged in so heavily that his helicopter could not land. The White House said that he might try again tomorrow.

title: BURROUGHS TO TRIM WORK FORCE BY 10%
description: The Burroughs Corporation said yesterday that by the end of 1970 it will have cut its worldwide employment by 10 per cent to 48,000 workers.

title: Disservice to the Police
description: The breastbeating champions of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association in the City Council, notably Mat thew J. Troy Jr. of Queens, are doing both the city and the police force a gross disservice by seeking to kill the Knapp Commission's inquiry into police graft.

title: Dallas: Slump Puts a Cloud Over Holiday Shopping
description: DALLAS, Dec. 9 Ph.D.'s are driving cabs in down town Dallas, Electronics en gineers are pumping gas in local filling stations and working as salesmen at SangerHarris, one of the city's biggest department stora chains.

title: Saved in Fire Fete Their Rescuers
description: Six survivors, of an office building fire last week in which three persons died gave a party yesterday for the firemen who saved their liVes.

title: Filly Pays $13 at Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 11Sal ly's Truce, a 4yearold filly from the Audley Farm Stable, drew out in the final yards for a 1length victory in the Too Bald Purse at Laurel Race Course today. Ridden by Joe Imparato, Sal ly's Truce stepped the six fur longs in 1:12 35 for her second straight victory. Mrs. J. Fisher, Jr.'s Color Girl, was second, a head in front of Jean R. Pan coast's Imsodear.

title: Gift Horses Examined
description: The immediate reaction to the news item stating that the students of five Massachusetts colleges had rejected a $25,000 gift from the John D. Rockefeller Fund is ask whether the young ingrates had taken leave of their senses. Coming on the heels of persuasive evidence higher education's unprecedented fiscal crisis, the only thing less rational than refusal of a benevolent gift would be a deliberate effort to insult the donors.

title: 4Year Nickel Shortage Ending, Inco Chief Says
description: Henry S. Wingate, chairman of the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., the world's largest nickel producer, made it official yesterdaya fouryear shortage of the alloy ing metal is ending.

title: Slumping 76ers to Oppose Knicks at Garden Tonight
description: The Knicks opponent to night at Madison Square Gar den will be the Philadelphia 76ers, whose weak start in the first two months of the Nation Basketball Association sea son has been one of the league's biggest surprises so far.

title: PANEL IS REVISING QUERIES TO POLICE
description: The special commission in vestigating allegations of police corruption is revising and sim plifying an eightpage financial questionnaire that has stirred resentment among city police men.

title: Viscountess de Maublanc Is Dead at 87 in. Paris
description: Viscountess Gladys de Mau blanc, a sister of the late Eliza beth Arden, the cosmetics man ufacturer, died on Thursday at the American Hospital in Paris. She was 87 years old.

title: `ESTUDIOS MAKES ITS LOCAL DEBUT
description: Alberto Ginastera's Estu dios sinfonicos were inspired by Schumann's Symphonic Etudes. Mr. Ginastera says so right out in the program notes to this week's New York Phil harmonic concerts in which the first New York hearings of Estudios are being given.

title: New Haven Man Arrested In 3 Slayings Last Summer
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Dec. 11 (AP)A New Haven man waa charged with murder today ix the buldgeon slayings of three mentally retarded young per. sons in a park last summer, the police said.

title: St. Leo's Catholic School In Queens Damaged by Fire
description: A twoalarm fire of undeter mined origin yesterday after noon damaged the auditorium of St. Leo's Roman Catholic School at 10409 49th Avenue in the Corona section of Queens. The building was unoccupied at the time.

title: Summer Over, A Fire Island Builder Takes Stock
description: Hobby Miller of Patchogue, L. I., was in town the other day talking about Fire Island. We've finished closing down for the winter, he said.

title: Hijacking Case Dismissed
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Dec. 12 (UPI)A Federal commissioner has dismissed a conspiracy charge against 20yearold Ron ald L. Reed, who was accused of plotting a hijacking and plan ning to kidnap the Minnesota Governor to free black mili tants. The Federal Bureau of In vestigation had said notes Mr. Reed had were evidence of plot to kidnap Gov. Harold E. Le Vander and a St. Paul coun cilman.

title: Without Off Broadway, The Rest Is Silence
description: HAVE you noticed the silence? From the time that the Equity strike against Off Broadway managements be gan, there's been an unholy hush on Broadway. Not downtown, not high uptown, though things have been quieter there, too, of course. On Broadway. Its as though Broadway's heart had stopped, leaving only a few fingers wriggling.

title: Miami Strong on Ground
description: MIAMI, Dec. 12Although drained of much of their emo tional energy by last Sunday's, lastsecond 1413 loss to the Oakland Raiders, the New York Jets will attempt to snarl the American Conference playoff hopes of the Miami Dolphins tomorrow.

title: BIG PLAY SHIFTS EDGE TO COWBOYS
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 12 (AP) The Dallas Cowboys coach, Tom Landry, praised his de fensive unit today for having stopped Cleveland in the first half on a fourth down deep in Dallas territory. It was the key to the 62 victory. he said.

title: Muskie to Study Local Property Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Senator Edmund S. Muskie said today that his Subcommittee on Intergovernmental Relations would hold hearings next year to see if Congress should pass laws covering local property taxes.

title: HUGE HEROIN SEIZURE REPORTED IN MIAMI
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Government announced that its agents in Miami today seized 208 pounds of heroin with a street value of between $21million and $22million.

title: Koch Assails City on Welfare Hotels
description: Representative Edward I. Koch; accusing the Lindsay ad ministration of deliberately misleading the public, charged yesterday that there was noth ing to prevent the city from moving welfare families into permanent housing instead of forcing them to live in high priced, poorly serviced wel fare hotels.

title: Royal Artist for Denmark's Seals
description: EINAR HOLBOLL start ed it all  the idea of using Christmas aid those in need, young or old. As a pos tal clerk in Copenhagen in 1903, he was observing crowds at the post office when the idea came to him of sell ing some kind of label to be added to Christmas mail, with funds to be used for aiding the indigent or ill. He passed his idea on to his chiefs, and in 1904 the first Christmas Seal appearedin Denmark, of courseshowing a portrait of Queen Louise. Since then, many countries have adopted the idea.

title: Aliens Reminded to Report Their Addresses in January
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) The Immigration and Natural ization Service has again re minded the more than four mil lion foreigners living in the United States they must report their addresses in January.

title: After the BlowUp in the Garage
description: ABOUT 10 o'clock in the evening, and the open rehearsal of Commune has just ended. Humid and hot because it is July 24 in New Paltza small college town in a steamy valley just below Woodstock. A man in a white shirt and a loose tie comes over to me. You run this thing? I tell him I am the director of The Performance Group. A great play, a great play and you got a lot of good actors, he says. But why do most of them just sit around and watch? He gestures to thir ty or so young people sitting on the floor, many of them adorned with hair, jewelry, leather, and barefoot: The Look. I take in the scene, a touch flabber gasted. These people aren't part of our company, I say. They're the audience. The man in the white shirt laughs loud ly. Can you beat that? I thought me and my wife were the only audience and the rest of you was the theater!

title: Art
description: LIST of the virtues of She, an exhibition at Cordier & Ekstrom, 980 Madison Avenue, would have to begin with a catalogue of its twentyseven paintings and sculptures. With dates ranging from 2500 B.C. to 1970, they inelude a marble Cycladic god dess, two African sculptures of females, a Venus, Cupid and the Graces summarizing the alluring affectations of the nymphs of the School of Fontainebleau, a terrifying Lindner girl, two women put asprawl or opened like the pages of a book by de Koo ning and Dubuffet, the glor ious Khajurabo stone illus trated here in juxtaposition with a Matisse, a 14inch Han figure that might be my choice of the lot to take home, and a number of other items that would make any first choice difficult.

title: Beamon Jumping for Rebounds Now
description: Bob Beamon, who set a world record in the long jump at Mexico City in 1968, is jumping again. This time it's on the basketball court for Adelphi University.

title: ALABAMA NOMINEE OF NIXON OPPOSED
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 12For the second time in the last four months, the nomina tion of an Alabama lawyer to a new Federal judgeship has given rise to an unusual coali tion of opponents that includes liberals and conservatives, civil rights groups and segregation ists.

title: Vote in Pakistan. Jolts Punjabis
description: LAHORE, Paristan, Dec. 11 The Punjab is finished, smashed, the furhatted in dustrialist said. We will be ruled'. by Sind and Bengal. Our country has gone to the dogs, I am telling you.

title: In Movies, Whitey Is Still King
description: I'VE always been willing to admit promptly my mistakes in judgment. Today, unfortunately, too few people are, particularly many of our present politi cians who seem bent on plodding a pragmatic and un imaginative course that is surely going to spell doom for everyone everywhere.

title: Miss Kuehn Wed To Donald P. Perry
description: Miss Marjorie Kuehn and Donald P. Perry were mar ried here yesterday afternoon in the Embury United Meth odist Church, Queens Village, by the Rev. Nils Janson.

title: An Electronic Resuscitator Held Ineffective by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Food and Drug Admin istration has declared ineffec tive an electronic resuscitator, manufactured by Batrow Lab oratories, Inc., Branford, Conn.

title: Mailbox: Field Goals of Yesteryear
description: To the Editor: You printed letters dealing with football fieldgoal kicking, particularly the dropkick as opposed to the placement kick, and the difference in kicking created by the change years ago from a ball rather fatsome what rounded at the ends  to the present slenderized ball.

title: Tulane Conquers Colorado by 173
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 12Dave Abercrombie dashed 66 yards with the secondhalf kick off to set up the goahead touchdown today as Tulane, participating in a bowl game for the first time in 30 years, stunned favored Colorado, 173, in the Liberty Bowl game.

title: Medicine
description: In these days of rising medical costs, a recurrent nightmare of millions of mid dleclass families is the spec ter of financial ruin caused by catastrophic illness  the $5,000 to $50,000 or more that a case of cancer or heart disease or stroke can exact. Last week the Senate Finance Committee voted to exorcise that specter by setting up what amounts to a Govern ment system of major med ical insurance for the vast majority of Americans under 65 covered by Social Security.

title: FLORIDA BIOLOGISTS HUNT FOR PIRANHAS
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 12 (UPI)State Game and Fish Commission biologists plan to suffocate fish chemically in a aanai on the eastern edge of the Florida Everglades to de terinine if a lone piranha caught there has any cohorts in the area.

title: Television This Week
description: TODAYSUNDAY, DECEMBER 13

title: A Part Of Myself
description: Owing to the vagaries of Broad way, few Americans are likely to know even the title of a play by Carl Zuckmayer, one of the leading Euro pean playwrights and the grand old man of the German stage. Midway in the days of the Weimar Republic, Zuckmayer made a name for him self with The Merry Vineyard, a comedy so earthy and robust that it signaled the end of the vapid rhetoric of expressionist drama. Much ma ligned by the Nazis as a purveyor of obscene and decadent Jewish filth, Zuckmayer satirized German militarism and bureaucracy in The Captain From Kpenick, one of the best comedies ever written in Ger man. The two film versions of The Captain From Kpeniek, before and after the war, made him known all over the world, as did the scenario he wrote for that 20thcentury clas sic, Heinrich Mann's The Blue Angel.

title: MRS. JOHN C. ORR
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Dec. 12 Mrs. Bernice Bohne Orr, for mer manager of the Investors Savings and Loan Association branch here, and the wife of John C. Orr, advertising direc tor of The Wall Street Journal, died today at her home, 20 Martindale Road.

title: Dark Season Brings Sluggishness to Arctic Town
description: INUVIK, Northwest Territor ies, Dec. 6  The sun made a pale 18minute appearance to day and then set for a month. The dark season as at hand.

title: Photography
description: WAY back in the inno cent early years of this century, it was believed that en lightenment was all that was needed to overcome great so cial ills. If enough people knew what was wrong, a remedy would be found, and once it was found, of course, it would be applied. The great social peril is darkness and ignorance, said Lewis W. Hine, whose photographs are currently on view at the Witkin Gallery. Light Is re required. Light! Light in floods!

title: Using Used Paper
description: Despite public pressure for a cleaner environment, it will take more than greater dili gence by Boy Scouts to get the paper industry to expand the recycling of waste paper.

title: Is She Rita Hayworth Or Marion Javits?
description: The resemblance is therearound the eyes, maybe, or the cheekbones and the generous mouth. And Marion Javits doesn't .mind at all. In fact, Rita Hay worth is not somebody with whom al most anybody loathes being compared. And, as Marion Javits herself said, It's nice.

title: REMEMBER THESE: THE CITY'S NEEDIEST
description: IF Mrs. Leah K., of Case 17, lacked funds for food, shelter or clothing, she could obtain them through public welfare. She has some modest savings, however, and does not need money. Yet Mrs. K. is among the needy; at 76, she is blind, ill and alone in the world.

title: U.S. and Japanese Sign FishingRight Accords
description: TOKYO, Dec. 12 (UPI)The United States and Japan have signed agreements, including an accord settling crab quotas in the East Bering Sea.

title: RANGERS STREAK AT STAKE TONIGHT
description: The New York Rangers return from their threegame trip to the west coast tonight to take on the Los Angeles Kings at Madison Square Garden. Game time is 7:05, and the contest will mark the season's first visit of the Kings to New York.

title: Night Program Slated For Snowmobile Races
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Dec. 12  Monticello Raceway, which opened its snowmobile racing season last weekend, has changed its programming to start its Saturday races under the lights, beginning at 7:30 P.M. Time trials, if needed, will be run in the afternoon.

title: Spring Bridal For Miss Kien
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Wofford 20Game Streak Ends As Texas A. and I. Wins, 487
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 12 Texas A. and I. unleashed devastating offense and com bined it with a rugged defense to crush Wofford, 487, in the 15th annual National Associa tion of Intercollegiate Athletics Champion Bowl at Sirrine Sta dium today.

title: SKATERS WILL CUT FIGURES ON 5TH AVE.
description: There will be ice skating on Fifth Avenue this after noon, Mayor Lindsay an nounced yesterday at City Hall.

title: Child to Mrs. Besmer
description: A daughter was born on Nov. 24 to Mr. and Mrs. Fremont Edward Besmer of New York at Roosevelt Hospital. Mrs. Besmer is the former Miss Frances C. Rose. Her husband is an anthro pology instructor at City Col lege. The child has been named Hannah Rose.

title: A Marketable Degree
description: In this season's depressed job market, Wharton undergraduates are highly prized by costconscious companies because they can be had for less than M.B.A.'s. According to Arthur Letcher, placement director for the University of Pennsylvania, Whar ton seniors can expect to be offered $10,000 $11,000 after graduation.

title: Special to The New York Times
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Dec. 12Foley Jones's 6 points in overtime helped. Columbia post a 7163 victory over Penn State tonieht.

title: Instead of Village Welcome, Returning Yugoslav Is Convicted of a War Crime
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 12When Radovan Mirkovic came home from Canada to his native village of Konjarnik last July, be expected a gala re union with his family, who would be proud of his new Oldsmobile and eager to hear of the prosperity he had won working for General Motors in St. Catherines, Ontario.

title: Jacksonville (Ala.) Sets Back Florida Aggies in Bowl, 217
description: MIAMI, Dec. 12 (AP)Boyce Callahan, a freshman, pene trated Florida A and M's de fense for 226 yards tonight to spark undefeated Jacksonville, (Ala.), State to a 217 victory in the 38th Orange Blossom Classic.

title: Cuite Urges Adding Members to Board For City Elections
description: The traditional makeup of the city's Board of Elections two members from Brooklyn, two from Manhattan and no representation from the other boroughsshould be changed, according to the most powerful member of the City Council.

title: City Opposes Raises in Pay or Pensions for Uniformed Services
description: The Lindsay administration set out yesterday what it called the fundamentals of its posi tion in labor negotiations with the uniformed forcesa tough holdtheline statement that continues a carefully laid out campaign to dramatize the citv's fiscal plight.

title: Recordings
description: SONG, at the moment, seems to embarrass or bore many of our bet ter composers. Irregu lar, untidy and tending to overflow boundaries, it has been difficult to fit into the most prevalent contemporary moulds, which until quite re cently leaned toward the neat and the containable. Rather than expansive song, what was wanted was short breathed motives, since com plex structures may more easily be constructed from short motives. (A Wagner, of course, can have it both ways.)

title: OPENINGS OF THE WEEK
description: THE GINGERBREAD LADYTonight, Plymouth, 7. A play by Neil Simon. Starring Maureen Staple ton. Costarring Betsy von Furstenberg, Michael Lombard and Charles Siebert.

title: Charity Fetes
description: Manhattan Country School Dec. 14Cocktail reception and buffet dinner at the school, 7 East 96th Street, before film premiere of Little Big Man at the Sutton Theater.

title: LI. WOMEN LEARN ABOUT THEIR CARS
description: FREEPORT, L.I., Dec. 12If someone told you your spark plugs were missing, you'd know that: (1) Your car had been vandalized during the night or (2) Your spark plugs are not properly igniting the mixture of gasoline and air with the result that your car will not run smoothly.

title: Sublets Compete In Office Market; Big Lease Signed
description: A large amount of office space available in the city for subleasing is adding to the problems of owners trying to rent new space at a time of slack demand.

title: Jetting to the Jetty: A Fast Start for a Slow Cruise
description: MIAMIMany a winter cruise ship passenger here starts out flying, and not because he has had one drink too many before going aboard. It's just that increasing numbers of people are flying to Florida to start their shipboard vacations instead of putting to sea from New York City. By taking the air route to Florida, the cruise bound tourist skips two days of sailing through cold waters. And de parture times are likely to be more convenient for him, too, because fewer and fewer cruise ships sail under the Verrazano Bridge these days.

title: Gardens
description: FLOWER seed pods, cones, dried leaves and weed stalks can be turned into decorative Christmas trimmings with a little iniagination, some glue and paint. The Roxbury Bridge water Garden Club in Connecticut became so inspired with the creative efforts of one member, the entire club has turned this craft into a project.

title: Future Social Events
description: Dec. 20  MitchelLinden Chapter. Women's League for Israel, 1860 Broadway.

title: WELFARE FACING SHIFT IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 12  Tradi tional Canadian concepts of public welfare will undergo radical change If new proposals by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau are enacted into law.

title: Jill Berguido Has Nuptials
description: ROSEMONT, Pa., Dec. 12 Miss Jill Berguido and John Kay Clement 3d were mar ried here this afternoon in the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd. The Rev. James H. Cupit Jr. performed the ceremony.

title: Radio
description: 88:30 A.M., WNYC: Jake and the Kid. Canadian Broadcasting Corporation drama series.

title: Stage: A Musical by The Rubber Duck
description: Pretentiousness is rioting at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, where on Friday the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn illadvisedly opened a musical called Tarot.

title: Angry Gasoline Retailers Boil Over
description: Highway 46 in New Jersey is littered with gasoline sta tions and both sides of the divided road, and carries the flapping symbols of the oil industry, like the United Na tions flags at the World's Fair.

title: Trouble Bedeviling Schweitzer Chairs
description: New York's most prestigious academic award, the fiveyear old Albert Schweitzer Chair, has turned out to be a rather hot seat. Among those burned to date are Marshall McLuhan, Barbara Ward, the economist, and Fordham University.

title: Books
description: Forty years from now, In 2010, the United States will be in the throes of a Social Security crisis. It will also be totally unprepared for it.

title: U.S. Embassy's Staff In Cambodia Triples
description: PNOMPENI, Cambodia, Dec. 12 (UPI)The staff of the United States Embassy in Cambodia has tripled in the last six months, and more Americans will soon be added.

title: SCHOOLS TO REOPEN IN ST. LOUIS SUBURB
