description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 12The 10, 000 students in the Riverview Gardens school district in St. Louis County will return to school Monday after an en forced twoweek vacationthe first time in 131 years that Missouri public school district closed its doors for lack of funds.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: WHILE Wall Street continues to take a rather rosy view of business prospects and the economic situation, there is considerably less confidence in some other quarters about the general outlook for 1971 and the efficacy of the Administration's program to combat unem ployment and inflation.

title: Richard Rifkin, Lawyer, Weds Miss Jill A. Wertheimer in Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 12The marriage of Miss Jill A. Wert heimer to Richard Rifkin took place at the Westchester Country Club here this after nobn. Rabbi Joseph Weiss performed the ceremony.

title: Dressage Training Major Aid To Most Horses, Says Expert
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 12 Michael Handler, the son of the director of the Spanish Riding School of Vienna, sighed after finishing a dress age clinic today at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club.

title: Muskie Filling Key Posts To Start '72 Drive Early
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Al most against his will, Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine has decided to open his drive for the Democratic Presidential nomination earlier than he had expected and earlier than most candidates have in the past.

title: Italian Journalists Strike
description: ROME, Dec. 12 (UPI)Italian journalists went on a 24hour strike today, halting publica tion of Sunday newspapers and closing the national news agen cy. The strike was called to back journalists demands for a 20 per cent pay increase and for more voice in determining editorial policy.

title: `Fortunate Brooklyn Boy Aids Fund for Neediest
description: After reading about 16year old Jeanne H. in The New York Times last Sunday, a Brooklyn youth told The Times Neediest Cases Fund that he had concluded that he was most fortunate in being brought up in a family environ ment .

title: A New House In Westport Isn't Straight
description: WESTPORT, Conn.This house has a sense of humor, Harvey. L. Koizim was saying. It's not really straight in the way the kids use that word. It's a multimedia experience.

title: REPORT CRITICIZES CITY HIGH SCHOOLS
description: A charge that the city's academic high schools are failing to provide effective edu cation to most studentswhite as well as black and Puerto Ricanwas made in a report issued yesterday by the Brook lyn Education Task Force.

title: MISS CAHILL WINS TITLE IN SKATING
description: ARDMORE, Pa., Dec. 12 Denise Cahill of Baltimore maintained her lead in school Figures with accomplished free skating tonight in winning the South Atlantic senior ladies senior figureskating cham pionship against Alice Stock fleth of Wilmington, Del., at the Philadelphia Skating Club and Humane Society.

title: CONTROVERSY MARS FINALE FOR FISCHER
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 12 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles extended his winning streak to seven games today in the 23d and final round of. the Palma knockout roundrobin chess tournament. He scored by forfeit over. Oscar Panno of Argentina, raising his tourna mentwinning score to 18 1/2 41/2, consisting of 15 victories, seven draws and one loss.

title: Management by Objectives
description: The American economy's real gross national product has dipped again In the current quarter. Government economists expect the decline to be between 1 per cent and 2 per cent at an annual rate. They attribute the drop wholly to the General Motors strike.

title: Rev. Herbert Brown, 60, Dies; Led Grace Church in NeWark
description: The Rev. Dr. Herbert Stanley Brown; rector of Grace Epis copal Church in Newark and secretary of the board of trus tees of the General Theological Seminary here, died yesterday in New England Deaconess Hos pital, Boston, after a long ill ness. His age was 60.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor. It is not just the English who are forgotten by most writers as Sheldon Vanauken remarked in this space on Nov. 22but rather the original inhabitants . . . the Brython, the Cymru.

title: But Will Higher Gas Prices Stick?
description: The fate Of the recently announced crude oil and gas oline price increases will probably be determined not in Washington, despite the sound and fury, but at the nation's gasoline pumps. This at any rate is the opinion of many industry observers and Wall Street analysts.

title: Egypt Watches Ports
description: CAIRO, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Egypt's ports and airports are being watched to prevent the smuggling abroad of a relief of one of the Pharaohs, stolen from a temple close to the pyramids, it was reported this week. The relief is of King Amenophis 2d, who ruled about 1400 B.C. and whose tomb is one of the earliest discovered.

title: Crimson Clem Captures $59,600 Stakes on Coast
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Dec. 12 (UPI)Alvaro Pineda found an opening on the inside and guided Crimson Clem to an easy victory today in the $59,600 Ju venile Stakes at Bay Meadows.

title: 4 States in South and Midwest Involved in Dispute Over Geese
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 12 Louisiana and Texas have ac cused Missouri and Iowa of waylaying hundreds of thou sands of wild geese bound for the winter refuges and hunting paradise of the Gulf Coast.

title: The Rat and .the RatRace
description: A basic document of unusual frankness and precision sets the tone for the White House Conference on Children, which opens in Washington today. Composed under the direction of Professor Urie Bronfenbrenner, a noted ex pert on child psychology, it challenges the national myth of America as a child's paradise. Out of this critique emerges a society that treats its children as possessions neglected under the impact of poverty or as a conse quence of preoccupation with materialism.

title: Maximum15 Years, With Plea3 Months
description: As an example of the way felony charges can be re duced, some officials point to the case of a reputed member of the Mafia, Nicholas Bianco. He was indicted with 15 other men for conspiracy to murder 22 men in the Gallo war in Brooklyn in the early nineteensixties.

title: In Memoriam
description: BERNSTEINTeddy. Dec. 10, 1967. In lov ing memory of. a beloved husband, devoted father and adored grandfather.

title: British Santas Protest Arms
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Eight Santo Clauses in costume and wearing steel helmets dem onstrated in front of a down town store today against the weaponry displayed in the toy department by an army recruit ing team. The Santas slung toy weapons over their should ers. They were refused admis sion and were dispersed peace fully.

title: HOMEOWNERS SUE TO PROTECT LAKE
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 12A homeowners association here is suing this town, the City of New Rochelle, the Village of Scarsdale, and Westchester County for polluting its 62acre private lake with the runoff from storm sewers.

title: 6 Killed as Car Hits Train
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 12 (UPI) A car that the police said was drag racing struck the side of a train at a city intersection last night, killing six young men and critically injuring two others, The authorities quoted witnesses as saying the car that hit the train was racing with another car that barely slipped past the front of the train.

title: Pretty as a picture
description: Fashion's got the picture, all rightright on the clothes themselves. Storytelling clothes started in London (where cartoon characters were the big thing). Now they are turning up all over the place, mostly leather. Every conceivable sort of design, from American Indian geo metries to the Alice's tea party bit, is painted on every conceivable kind of clothes, from hats to shoes. One thing is sure. A girl wearing such picturesque gear can scarcely be dull.

title: DOCKING VOWS DRIVE ON KANSAS VIOLENCE
description: LAWRENCE, Kan. Dec. 12 (UPI)Gov. Robert B. Docking, described by an aide as fed up with violence at the Uni versity of Kansas, inspected today a campus computer cen ter where a bomb exploded last night. The Governor vowed an allout effort to apprehend those responsible.

title: Goldschmidts Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence E. Goldschmidt on Nov. 30 in the New York LyingIn Hospital. The child has been. named Alix Jill.

title: 3 Who Cut Man's Hair Pay the Victim $1,368
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 12 (AP) It cost three construction workers $1,368 to trim the long hair of a 20yearold man.

title: Survey Shows Shortage Of Medical Technicians
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 12 (Reuters)The World Health Organization has reported that 100 million people die or are disabled every year because of a worldwide shortage of personnel trained in even the most elementary, medical techniques.

title: CORNELL SEXTET DOWNS YALE, 53
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 12Cor nell registered a 53 hockey vic tory over Yale tonight in an Ivy League game enlivened by secondperiod brawl.

title: Television
description: B JACK GOULD

title: MONTREAL NETS 6 IN SECOND PERIOD
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 12 (UPI) John Ferguson and Henri Rich ard scored twice each as the Montreal Canadiens exploded for six goals in the second pe riod tonight and routed the Los Angeles Kings, 81.

title: Soviet Opens 10 Air Routes in Central Asian Republic
description: New Aeroflot routes serv ing the vast Central Asian republic of Kazakhstan illus trate the rapid expansion of the domestic aviation net work of the Soviet Union.

title: Toy Industry Is Not Child's Play
description: Would you believe that there's a child's game called Dirty Water? Or other games with such equally descriptive names as Generation Gap, Group Therapy, Blacks and Whites, Ghetto, Smog and Confrontation?

title: Miss Deborah Brooks Farber Is Affianced to William Kallop
description: RANDOR, Pa., Dec. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Brent Harrison Farber Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Brooks (Fritzi) Farber to William Moore Kallop, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur McKin ley Kallop of Summit, N. J. A March 29 wedding is planned.

title: First Americans in New Zealand Under FareSubsidy Program
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 12Migrants from the United States have started ar riving in New Zealand under subsidized passage arrange ment.

title: Chavez Loses Freedom Bid
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (UPI)The California Court of Appeal has denied a petition that would have freed the farm labor organizer Cesar Chavez from jail. Mr. Chavez was jailed a week ago for contempt of court after he refused to obey a court order to call off a boy cott of lettuce produced by Bud Antle, Inc., a major Salinas Valley grower.

title: A Stop Smoking Cruise Ship: Lots to Eat, Puffs on the Sly
description: ABOARD THE S.S. SANTA PAULA IN THE CARIB BEAN  When they sang I'm Sitting on Top of the World at the gala dinner of this Caribbean cruise, you got the feeling they didn't really mean it. In fact, any number of the singers  along had probably rarely been so miserable. It was the end of the first full day out of New York and out of cigarettes for most (if, it developed, by no means all) of the 130 heavy smokers who were attempting to kick the habit aboard the Santa Paula as she steamed south a few weeks ago for two weeks of tobaccolessness at sea. Never before had so many attempted to quit so much smoking in such a tight society, and for a while at least the level of mass crankiness rose with the shift of every latitude.

title: This Bill Bailey Did Go Home, To Rinkypink Singapore Bar
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 12 (AP) Bill Bailey, the guy who would not come home despite the pleas of innumerable singers, is in Singapore to stay.

title: Miss Virginia Woodworth Married
description: CHESTNUT HILL: Mass., Dec. 12Miss Virginia Wood worth was married here this afternoon to Stephen Her ririgton Brooks in the Epis copal Church of the Redeem er by the Rev. Donald E. Bits berger.

title: Lehigh Wrestlers Capture Tourney
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. Six Lehigh University wrestlers won in the finals tonight as the Engineers finished first in their second quadrangular tourna ment with 87 points. Southern Illinois was second with 55, fol lowed by Wilkes, 52, and Mary land 43

title: The Pentagon Of Power
description: For nearly half a century Lewis Mumford has been writing on one of the chief questions of our time: how technology can be directed to meet the needs of society. Starting with a book on utopias in 1922, he has developed his message in nearly two dozen books, including the in fluential Technics and Civilization (1934), The Condition of Man (1944) and The City in History (1961). It now has reached a kind of climax in Mumford's latest volume.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: ARTHUR F. BURNS, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, proposed an 11point antiinflation program, in cluding a board to review wage and price increases and compulsory arbitration of some major labor disputes. . . . Wishington officials said gross national product, after adjustment for price increases, would show decline in cur rent quarter because of General Motors strike.

title: ENTRY OF 2,409 RECORD FOR SHOW
description: BOSTON, Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. James A. Farrell Jr. of Darien, Conn., began to look pretty much like monopolists for the bestinshow title at the Eastern Dog Club competition tonight when their latest star, Ch. Special Edition, a Lakeland terrier. became the winner.

title: Young, agile, pragmatic, Rumsfeld supports the dickens out of Nixon
description: being chauffeured half a mile to the O.E.O. offices, where he stays until the end of a normal work day. Then he goes back to the White House un til 8 or 9 P.M. Occasionally he has supper with the President.

title: Jobs Fewer for College Men
description: College graduates of the 1970's can expect to find the job hunt more difficult than did those of the last decade, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: December Moon
description: The full moon of December, which occurred last night, is no summer serenader's moon, no sentimental moon silvery softness to match the rhyming of the ballad singer. It is a winter's moon with more than fourteen hours of darkness to rule in cold splendor.

title: Lon No1 Reads No Newspapers And Never Uses a Telephone
description: PNOMPENH. IN the early afternoon of last March 18, at about the time when Pre mier Lon Nol usually lies down for his siesta, he became in fact what he had been in name since the pre ceding August. The National As sembly voted to dismiss Cambodia's absent absolute ruler, Prince Noro dom Sihanouk, as Chief of State and put in his place Cheng Heng, who was rumored to have obtained his largely honorific post as President of the Assembly in return for donations to Sihanouk's state and was known as a political nullity. Since the over throw of the popular prince had come about more by events that had grown bigger than their makers than by plot, and no one had aspired to suc ceed Sihanouk as effective ruler, Gen. Lon Nol found himself that afternoon the real chief of government and maker of the big decisions for Cam bodia.

title: Music
description: LET'S talk about rhythm, the heart and soul and lungs and legs of music. It is rhythm that sots off a piece of music and propels it to its end. It is rhythm that, properly han dled, lends interest to a musical line. But it is amazing haw many musicians have so little feel for rhythm. This is especially true of con ductors. Either they establish a rhythmic pattern at the be ginning and relentlessly pur sue it, onetwothreefour, onetwothreefour, or they try to vary it by breaking up the pulse, and then there is chaos. Only a handful have the secret of maintaining the basic pulse and making del icate variations within it.

title: NEW ROUND TAKES LIBERTY BELL RACE,
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12 New Round shipped up from sunny Florida on Wednesday and won the $67,712 Heritage Stakes at chilly Liberty Bell to day. Michael Phipps's Kentucky bred was the favorite in the 1 1/16mile test for 2yearolds, and he won just that way.

title: Mrs. Lewis Has Child
description: LEVITTOWN, L.I., Dec. 12 A daughter was born to Cantor and Mrs. Walter J. Lewis on Nov. 22 at the. Glen Cove Community Hos pital. The child has been named Gail Diane. Cantor Lewis, who is with the Sub burban Temple in Wantagh is a former member of the Philadelphia Opera Company.

title: ARMY TRACKMEN DEFEAT HARVARD
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 12 Army's indoor track team, winning nine of 13 events, up set Harvard, 7138, at the West Point Field House today.

title: HEALTH RESEARCH AIDED BY AGENCY
description: A littleknown state agency has been bringing in about $14million a year in Federal, foundation and individual grants for health research.

title: Student Convicted in a Killing Linked to Panthers
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 12Irving H. Young, a senior at Morgan State College, has been con victed of murder in the tor tureslaying of a laborer the Black Panthers were said to have believed was a police informant.

title: Memorial Service
description: JAGER:Molly O'Doherly. First Anniversary) Mass, Monday, Dec. 14, 1970, 9 A.M., St. Mary's R. C. Church, Manhasset, L. I.

title: Berlin to Salvage Wreckage Of 1944 Bomber From Lake
description: BERLIN, Dec. 12 (UPI) West Berlin authorities have started expensive salvage operations to raise the wreck of a British World War II Lan caster bomber from the bot tom of a lake where it crashed hi late 1944.

title: A Linguist at Roosevelt Raceway Knows His Horses
description: Lee Benson Is the linguist of the paddock. He speaks three foreign languages  French, Spanish and Italian  and as might be expected from a man with his harnesshorse back ground he talks the language of his horses. As the nights in this season dwindle down to a precious few, Benson is busy making preparations for the new year.

title: Frances B. Tripp Fiancee of Lawyer
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam V. Tripp Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Frances Beale Tripp, to G. Michael Hawkey of Boston and Ly man, N. H. Mr. Hawkey is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold R. Hawkey of Mont clair. N. J., and Truro.

title: Albert Einstein Chairs Attract Little Notice
description: The Albert Einstein Chairs in the Sciences, unlike their companion Albert Schweitzer Chairs in the Humanities, have attracted almost no public notice except for the announcement of the appoint ments.

title: AMERICAN NEGRO TO BE AN AUSSIE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 12 teacher from Philadelphia is believed to be the first American Negro approved for Australian citizenship by the immigration authorities under the relaxed rules for admitting nonCaucasians as permanent settlers.

title: They're Making a Monkey of Kim Again
description: STELLA! Who will ever forget Marlon Brando's simian mating call in A Streetcar Named De sire? Certainly not Kim Hunter, who made her Broadway debut as Stella Kowalski, Brando's patient, compliant wife, and later repeated her role in the film version, an effort that brought her the 1951 Academy Award as best supporting actress.

title: INTEGRATION LAG NOTED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12  Even though the Board of Educa tion has been pursuing its of ficial policy of increasing the degree of integration in Chi cago's public schools. There is more racial segregation this year than last, an informal sur vey shows.

title: Kent State Gets Manuscript
description: KENT, Ohio, Dec. 12 (UPI) The original manuscript of a poem written by the Russian poet Yevgeny Yevtushenko and dedicated to a coed killed by National Guard troops has been donated to Kent State Univer sity. The poem, Flowers and Bullets, dedicated to Allison Krause, 19 years old, of Pitts burgh, one of four students shot to death May 4 in campus disorder.

title: Martha Doyle, Bennett Alumna, Bride in Jersey
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Dec. 12Miss Martha Ann Doyle and Capt. Jacques Real Gag non of the Canadian Armed Forces were married here this Afternoon.

title: Music in London
description: LONDON.

title: MIAMI AWARDED 2 TITLE REGATTAS
description: Miami has landed a cham pionship inboard powerboat regatta for 1971 and another for 1972, and each will be spon sored by the Florida Inboard Race Club and held in Marine Stadium.

title: Coins
description: A MEDAL to be issued this week for The Society of Medalists was fashioned from one of the four winning de signs submitted during the 1970 nationwide art competi tion sponsored by that organ ization. The pattern for the medal was the work of Tom Allen Jr, sculptorartist, now residing in Somerset. N. J.

title: Banned Nationalist Groups Agree to Merge in Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 12 (Agence FrancePresse) Leaders of two banned Rhode sian African nationalist groups have agreed to unite in a single organization, reliable sources reported this week.

title: New Bridgehampton Team Plans HardSell Campaign
description: Bridgehampton Race Cir cuit, that beautiful but im poverished road course in the dunes of eastern Long Island overlooking Sag Harbor, is classic textbook case of a loser. Its onegate layout constricts emptying of the parking lot after a race. Its access to the highway, is a pinched twolane About road. Its geo Motor graphic position forces race fans Sports into the Sunday evening traffic staggering westward from the shore areas. Finally, its promotion has never been effective: for all those gran diose figures announced on race days, attendance was never more than 11,000.

title: Nixon Signs Military Bill And Holds Budget Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)  President Nixon signed the $2billion military construc tion appropriation bill today and worked with top advisers on the Federal budget for the fiscal year 1972, which will vrobablv exceed $225billion.

title: LINDSAY WILL HEAD U.S. MAYORS LOBBY
description: Mayor Lindsay was chosen yesterday to head a bigcity Mayors lobby that will try to persuade Congress to give more help to cities.

title: Dance
description: MANY people have two homes  the place where they were born, and the place where they live. George Bal anchine's two latest ballets,, Suite No. 3, new this sea son, and Who Cares?, new last season, pay tribute to Balanchine's homes, the St. Petersburg where he was born and the New York where he lives.

title: Alan Bender to Wed Deborah Laub
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Laub have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Deborah Sue Laub, to Alan Simon Bender of New York. Mr. Bender is the

title: NATO IS STRESSING ITS MOBILE FORCE
description: SECKENHEIM, West Ger many, Dec. 8The Soviet mili tary attache in Belgium, upon encountering Maj. Gen. Alberto Li Gobbi at a diplomatic func tion recently, congratulated the Italian officer on the way his ACE Mobile Force had car ried out a recent exercise.

title: Columbia Wrestlers Blank City College Squad, 440
description: Columbia University's wres tlers pinned six opponents in routing C.C.N.Y., 440, yester day on the loser's mat.

title: Capital Adding Helicopters To Help in Crime Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) The Metropolitan Police De partment in the District of Columbia has decided to add three helicopters to ItS crime fighting weapons.

title: Child to Mrs. Cherkis
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Laurence D. Cherkis of Hartsdale, N.Y., on Nov. 19 in the LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Cherkis is the former Miss Laura Lipitz of Flushing, Queens. The child, whose father is a lawyer with Wachtell, Lipton, Ros en & Katz, lawyers here, is named Nancy Ruth.

title: Campus Crossfire: Coaches Trapped Between Dissenting Athletes and Rigid Policies
description: College athletes, exposed to philosophical dissent last spring, have created their own movement this fall for more personal freedom.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's Letter on Campus Unrest
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Following are excerpts from a letter from President Nixon to William W. Scranton, chairman of the President's Commission on Campus Un rest:

title: Division in Vietnam Sets Up `Hot Line on Racial Issues
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 12 (UPI)The Americal Division has announced that it plans to set up a hot line for rapid communication between lower ranking blacks and high command authorities on racial issues and differences.

title: Courts Still Weigh 1965 Yonkers Fire
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 12 It was five years ago this month that 12 people died in a fire in the Yonkers Jewish Community Center. Five years later the repercussions of that tragedy are still echoing in the courtrooms of Westchester County.

title: 100 Die in Colombia In Slides and Flood; Key River Blocked
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Dec. 12 Torrential rains caused land slides that blocked Colombia's second. largest river today, causing a flood that swept away houses, buses and cars.

title: V.A. SELLS HOMES UNDER NEW POLICY
description: ROSWELL, N. M., Dec. 12 A new sales policy, setting 3 per cent mortgage interest rate with no down payment on the purchase of houses repos sessed by the Veterans Admin istration in this city, was an nounced yesterday to local realtors by the agency's re gional office in Albuquerque.

title: Rockland Gets Historic Site
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Dec. 12 Title to the 140yearold Blau velt House and four acres of land two miles north of here was donated today to the His torical Society of Rockland County by Mr. and Mrs. John L. Gibbons of New City. Mrs. Gibbons is a lineal descendent of the Blauvelt who received the original patent. from George II in 1744. The house, built in 1834 to take the place of an early dwelling, is well pre served.

title: Stokowski: Too Busy to Be 88
description: WHO'S there? asks the voice behind the door. It is a ten tative voice  an old man's voice. I identify myself. The lock turns. Ah, yes . . . yes. Come in. There, behind a sea of Shadows, stands Leopold Stokowski, the image of an ageless angelan apparition half real, half imagineda legend floating eerily upon the vast, incalculably complex miraee of his own life.

title: Margaret Chase To Be the Bride Of John Hager
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. Verser Todd have made known the engagement of Mrs. Todd's daughter, Miss Margaret Dickinson Chase, to John Henry Hager. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Virgil Duke Hager of Durham, N.C.

title: MISS GORDON WINS HONORS IN RIDING
description: READINGTON, N. J., Dec. 12 Linda Gordon of Far Hills swept the equitation division at the Four Seasons Farm horse show today, and virtually clinched the New Jersey Pro fessional Horsemen's Associa tion horsemanship champion shin for 1970

title: DR. DAVID FRENKEL, INFERTILITY EXPERT
description: Dr. David A. Frenkel, an obstetrician and gynecologist whose major interest was in fertility, died Friday of a heart attack in Brooklyn. He was 57 years old and lived at 11221 72d Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens. His office was at 25 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: LatinAmerican Drivers Sometimes Ask a Fee
description: I HAVE just returned from a two month hitchhiking trip along the Pan American Highway through South and Central America. I flew. to Santiago, Chile, and then set out on the 10,000mile return: journey with one small suitcase, $600 in traveler's checks and a pair  of sturdy walking shoes just in case.

title: L.I. Town Bars Abortion Clinic; Other Suburbs Consider Curbs
description: HLTNTINGTON L. I., Dec. 12 The Town Board of this north shore community of about 20, 000 persons voted unanimously this week to bar abortions in any place other than a licensed and duly accredited hospital:

title: New and Recommended;
description: DOCTOR COBB'S GAME, by R. V. Cassill. The voodoo drums of new, dark sexuality are sounded by a London osteopath in this novel that probes the kinks of the psyche.

title: Child to Mrs. Ginsberg
description: ROCKAWAY, N.J., Dec. 12 A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Martin H. Gins berg on Dec. 6 in St. Clare's Hospital in Denville. The child has been named Julie Lyn. Mrs. Ginsberg is the former Miss Ruth Edelberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Edelberg of White Mea dow Lake. The child's father son of Mr. and Mrs. Max Ginsberg of Brooklyn and White Meadow Lake, is traf fic manager with P. & G. Trucking in the Bronx.

title: Gloria Spinelli Is Bride of Daniel Bohan
description: Miss Gloria Lois Spinelli, daughter of Michael J. Spi nelli of Brooklyn and the late Mrs. Spinelli, was married yesterday to Daniel Peter Bohan, son of Mrs. Francis J. Barry of Westhampton Beach, L. I., and Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Daniel Bohan. The ceremony was performed in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathe dral by Msgr. James F. Rignev. The bride Is a graduate of Marymount Manhattan Col

title: Winter, a Tad Time for Everybody, Is Prepared For by Area's Railroads
description: Winter means different things to different people but to the longsuffering railroad com muter it generally means that the service is going to get worse. Despite precautions being taken by railroads serv ing New York City, comments of railroad officials indicate that this winter will be no exception.

title: Alison J. Remy, J. H. Crowther To Be Married
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 12 Miss Alison Jane Remy, a research assistant at Rocke feller University in New York, and Jefferson Hay Crowther, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bosley Crowther of White Plains and Martha's Vineyard, Mass., plan to be married May 1 in the Hitch cock Presbyterian Church here.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS DOWN 7% SINCE 67
description: While the annual cost of op erating the nation's Roman Catholic elementary and sec ondary schools since 196768 has increased $200million, to $1.4billion, their number has decreased 7 per cent and enroll ment has fallen 10 per cent.

title: No Keys Needed
description: THE comparatively new type of keyless pushbutton combination door lock illustrated above should prove of interest to anyone who has ever lost their key, or to anyone who has ever been annoyed by the need for carrying keys and fumbling around to find the right one when coming home in the dark. It should also appeal to securityminded homeowners and apart ment dwellers who worry about skilled burglars picking their present locks, and to those who are concerned about the possibility of unauthorized persons gaining entry by means of a master key, or by illegal duplication of their present key.

title: The Washington Ten (Most Dept.); OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  Once again, ladies and gentlemen, it is ten mostlist time, or time for lists of the ten most, if you resent hyphens. The items appearing on the following lists have been of especial interest during the past year to the compiler and can be unreservedly recommended as gifts for persons you love or admire.

title: RUTGERS TROUNCES N.Y.U. QUINTET, 9169
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Dec. 12  Rutgers outscored New York University, 245, in the last eight minutes of the first half tonight and went on to 9169 victory over the Violets in the Ruteers gym.

title: SANDERS GETS 68 FOR 2SHOT LEAD
description: FREEPORT, Grand Bahamas, Dec. 12Doug Sanders, play ing despite a painfully swollen left wrist, stormed into a two stroke lead today in the third round of the Bahama Islands open golf tournament. Mean while frustrated Arnold Palmer all but eliminated himself from contention for firstplace hon ors.

title: Catharine Gould Planning Bridal
description: PAOLI, Pa., Dec. 12Miss Catharine McKoy Gould and Stephen Johnson Smith plan to be married June 19 in Pa oli.

title: Firstborn fortune's favorite?
description: HOW do firstborn children dif fer from laterborn children? Hundreds of experiments have yielded evidence that the eld est child tends to be more depend ent, more conscientious, more am bitious, more anxious. He is more sensitive to pain. He avoids dan gerous sports like football, soccer and rugby (firstborns were found to be underrepresented among the football Giants). Firstborn men marry earlier (this is not true of firstborn women, but more of them approve of early marriages and more get married in June than laterborn women).

title: Gannett Newsman Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) Jack L. Bell of the Gannett News Service has been elected president of the Gridiron Club, a newspaper social organiza tion here.

title: BRITAIN DECREES EMERGENCY CURBS FOR POWER CRISIS
description: LONDON, Dec. 12The Gov ernment declared a state of emergency today to deal with the power crisis bought on by a slowdown of electrical work ers.

title: Hans Albert Kluthe, 66, West German Publisher
description: ESCHWEGE, West Germany, Dec. 12 (AP) *West German publisher Hans Albert Kluthe, honorary president of the Inter national Federation of Maga zine Publishers, died here to night. He was 66 years old.

title: League Puts Off Houston
description: DALLAS, Dec. 12 (UPI) The Southwest Conference to day postponed action for at least five months on a bid by the University of Houston to gain membership. It appointed a committee to study the fea sibility and mutual benefits to be derived from inviting Hous ton.

title: NEW CHARGES FILED AGAINST POLICEMAN
description: A New York City policeman who was demoted from sec ondclass detective to patrol man last May after refusing to answer grand jury questions about his attempted murder has been suspended from the department with pay on new charees.

title: Extremes on Foreign Policy Deplored
description: Denouncing antipatriots on the left and superpatriots on the right, Freedom House charged yesterday that the national debate over foreign affairs had become dangerous ly polarized.

title: Manhattan Five Triumphs Over Rhode Island, 8482
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Dec. 12 Richie Garner, Manhattan's junior guard from Mount Ver non, N. Y., staged the defen sive heroics for the second straight game tonight with nine steals, four in a oneminutes 15seconds span, as the Jaspers beat the University of Rhode Island, 8482.

title: David Fleming to Wed Margaret Adams
description: LEONIA, N. J., Dec. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Adams of Leonia, formerly of Princeton, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Ellen Adams, to David Dan iel Fleming, son of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Fleming of Bay Village, Ohio.

title: Hearing Begins Tomorrow On Crash of Football Jet
description: Were the altimeters working properly on the jetliner that crashed Nov. 14 and killed 75 persons, including 43 players and coaches of the Marshall University footbal team?

title: The Emerging Japanese Superstate
description: Ebullient Herman Kahn, who boasts that under all those 300 pounds of friendly fat there lies a lean and sinewy intellect, is Prime Minister Eisaku Sato's favorite futurologist. Mr. Sato freely confesses to Tokyo visitors that he and his party have benefited mightily from Mr. Kahn's confident predictions  surprise free, he calls themthat by 1990 Japan will probably pass the United States in percapita income, and that by 2000 she will probably equal her partner across the Pacific in gross national product.

title: Rate Plunge?; Is the Cost Of Money Truly Set For a Long Decline?
description: Since last month, the cost of money has registered one of its sharpest, most dramatic declines in the last quarter century. LaSt week, however, the explosive, monthlong surge in bond priceswhich move up as interest rates come down  seemed to pause for a while.

title: ARKANSAS STATE WINS PECAN BOWL
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Dec. 12 (AP)James Hamilton stung the. Central Missouri State sec ondary with teuchdown passes of 42, 49 and 9 yards today to help No. 1ranked Arkansas State post a 3821 triumph in the seventh Pecan Bowl. The victory gave the Indians the National Collegiate Midwest Regional football championship.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON  They came like two suitors last week to woo the Nixon Administration for opposing causes, yet they had much in common. Both had won reputations in earlier, gayer years as social lions. Both were products of tough British train ing and now spoke for military establishments. Each counted on improving his political capi tal at a crucial moment at home by personal teteAtetes with the high and mighty in Washington.

title: Rights Group Leader Charged With Setting Fire in Englewood
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 12 The woman who is president of the Bergen County chapter of the National Welfare Rights Or ganization was arrested here late last night and charged with setting one of the 17 suspicious fires that have plagued the pre dominantly black west side of this suburban community of 27.000 people.

title: Miss Diana E. Peck Is a Bride in Islip
description: ISLIP, L. I., Dec. 12Miss Diana Eakins Peck, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Peck, was married here at noon today to Robert Colla mer Kelly, son of Mrs. Byron F. Kelly of Woodstock, Vt., and the late Mr. Kelly.

title: Syracuse Player Out
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (UPI)The EastWest Shrine committee said today that a defensive end, Ray White of Syracuse, would not play foe the East in the 46th game on Jan. 2 because of an injury. He was replaced on the roster by Ed Maguire of Indiana.

title: Carla Carbaugh And James Flug Planning to Wed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Miss Carla Josephine Car baugh, a program analyst in the Office of Economic Op portunity Legal Services Pro gram, and James Franklin Flug of Washington and Brooklyn, will be married be fore spring next year.

title: From Clich to Archetype
description: Let's see, what is it this time recycling, apparently. Yesterday's junk is today's antique; yesterday's garbage is today's middenheap; yes terday's clich, in short, today's archetype: a classier name, to em phasize the fact that the obsolete, when it is rediscovered, is apt to be invested with class. Decades after the Victorian Novel became a hope less clich, John Fowles made the bestseller lists by crafting a Vic torian novel.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: There is a newcomer in the ranks of the huge United States chemical industry, Ascension Chemical Compa ny, with headquarters in Ton awanda. Only recently opened for business, the small concern bears a singu lar distinction. It is the first blackowned, blackoperated chemical company in the united States.

title: Wagner Wrestles to Tie With FairleighDickinson
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 12 In a match that was held un der emergency lighting because of a power failure, Fairleigh Dickinson and Wagner wres tled to a 2121 tie today. Fair leighDickinson's Stu Pruzan sky scored his 26th straight varsity victory as he pinned Ed Bray in 2 minutes 37 sec onds of the 134pound bout. FairleighDickinson has one victory, one loss and one tie. Wagner, which has not lost, has four victories and one tie.

title: Bruins Blank Flyers, 10; Sanderson Fights 2 Fans
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12The Boston Bruins got a first period goal from Ken Hodge today and gained a 10 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers before a sellout crowd of 14,620  at the Spectrum. The game was marred by a secondperiod in cident during which Derek Sanderson of the Bruins left the penalty box to fight with two Flyers fans. Sanderson; was followed into the stands by the remainder of the Bruins team and it was sev eral minutes before order , could be restored.

title: Bond Supports McGovern
description: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., Dec. 12 (UPI)Julian Bond, a mem ber of the Georgia legislature, has announced that he supports Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of: South Dakota, for President in 1972. I think George McGovern is the best candidate, he told a meeting of Framingham State College, students. He is head and shoulders above the rest.

title: New Chilean Head Puts Public Health On Its Priority List
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10 The Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens, which came into office last month, has made public health one of its priority projects.

title: DECEMBER 13, 1970
description: WASHINGTON. ONE morning not long ago, a handsome Cau casian gentleman with a slightly cauliflow ered right ear stepped into the elevator at the Office of Economic Opportunity. Also waiting to begin the ascent were two black youths, one of whom asked him in a friendly way, Hey, man, ain't you Mr. Rumsfeldr Yes, the man said, he was Donald Rumsfeld. Well, I'm from the Oakland CAP office, and this here is my friend from Oak land, too, and we. . . .

title: GAIN BY STUDENTS ON RIGHTS FOUND
description: An American Civil Liberties Union survey of 155 college presidents indicates a steady extension of civil liberties to students and a corresponding decline of the colleges and uni versities practice of function ing as surrogate parents.

title: New Concept Expected From Mellow Foyt
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The little wrinkles are begin ning to show around his eyes, the hair line is receding, the suntanned face is dappled with white from burns re ceived years ago.

title: ARTHUR A. ATHA
description: Arthur A. Atha, a lawyer in Manhattan and Brooklyn for more than 40 years, died Thurs day in Brooklyn. He was 71 years old and lived at 1823 53d Street, Brooklyn.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 13, 1970

title: Berra an OddsOn Choice to Gain Hall of Fame Entry
description: Yogi Berra, at the age of 45, is about to go to bat again  as a candidate for base ball's Hall of Fame  and is widely expected to join the select group of stars who connected on their first shot.

title: Nancy Sinatra Is Bride
description: CATHEDRAL CITY, Calif., Dec. 12 (UPI)Nancy Sinatra, 30 years old, and producer choreographer Hugh Lambert were married today on her fa ther's 53d birthday. Following the wedding at St. Louis Roman Catholic Church, a reception was held at Mr. Sinatra's near by Palm Springs home. It was the second marriage for both. Miss Sinatra divorced singer Tommy Sands in 1965.

title: Returning Medics No Longer Spurned as. Civilian Health Aides
description: A few years ago, a young black Air Force medic came home to New York to look for a job. He had hoped to put to use in a civilian hospital the four years experience he had gained in a Midwestern mili tary clinic. But things did not work out that way.

title: A. K. C. Begins Drive to Help Dog Buyers With Registrations
description: A rising number of com plaints about the difficulty buyers of puppies from pet shops have had in getting their dogs registered has led the American Kennel Club to undertake an educational campaign through newspaper advertising. John A. LaFore

title: ALMA E. SHIMER
description: Alma E. Shimer, who retired as an administrator for the Commonwealth Fund here in 1948, died Friday in a nursing home in Sussex, N.J. Her age was 86.

title: Australia 84 for 3 in Reply To England's Opening 397
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 12 (Reuters)England's fast bowl ers were too sharp for the early Australian batsmen today in the second day of the second cric ket test.

title: DRAFT IN JANUARY GOES UP SHARPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Defense Department announced today that 17,000 men would be drafted into the Army next month. This will be the highest monthly draft call since last when 19,000 men were inducted.

title: REED TALLIES 25
description: Not in spectacular fashion but through basic superiority in every phase of play, the Knicks ground out a 118101 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers last night at Madison Square Garden before the Na tional Basketball Association season's eighth sellout crowd of 19,500 here.

title: Drew Pearson Prize Set Up in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Mrs. Drew Pearson, the columnist's widow, an nounced today the creation of a prize, bearing her late husband's name, to be awarded annually for excel lence in investigatory re porting by a Washington correspondent.

title: U.S. Warship Visits Manila
description: MANILA, Dec. 12 (UPI)The Oklahoma City, command ship of the United States Sevenths Fleet, docked at South Harbor here yesterday for a threeday goodwill visit. The 610foot, 14,600ton guidedmissile light cruiser has 1,300 officers and men, including the staff of the fleet commander, Vice Adm. Maurice F. Weisner.

title: Art Museum of Tel Aviv to Open With 5 International Exhibitions
description: Israel's newest cultural cen ter, the Tel Aviv Museum of Contemporary Art, will open officially April 19 with five major international exhibitions, it has been announced here by Dr. Haim Gamzu, the museum's director.

title: MRS. CARMEN SHUMLIN
description: Mrs. Carmen Shumlin, a for mer wife of the producer, di rector and playwright, Herman Shumlin, was found dead on Friday at her home, 201 East 83d Street. She had died of natural causes in her sleep early Wednesday.

title: Czech Worker Held in Crash
description: PRAGUE, Czechoslovakia, Dec. 12 (Reuters)A Govern ment commission today blamed a woman signal operator for a train crash yesterday in which 31 persons were killed.

title: V.A. Plans to Open 30 Centers to Treat G.I. Drug Addiction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)A Veterans Adminis tration official said this week that 30 specialized drug abuse centers would be opened to handle a sharp increase of drug addiction among G.I.'s.

title: Inventor Sees Wide Use Of New Car Steam Engine

title: MacGowran Play Off Today

title: the traveler's world
description: BY recent act of Congress, C. Lang home Washburn, director of the United States Travel Service in the Department of Commerce, was elevated to the rank of Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Tourism. He was authorized to spend up to $15 million a year for this fiscal year and the next two fiscal years ($41/2million had been authorized previously) and was given a fairly free hand to match his Federal funds with those put up by state and local tourist officials to be spent cooperatively in promoting for eign travel into the United States.

title: Cortina Is Chic On and Off Skis
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, ItalyIt's crowded up here in the Alps in high season, particularly around Christmas and New Year's, as I've found on three holiday visits. One needs a traffic cop on the slopes and a reser vation everywherebut it is worth it.

title: The Aleph and Other Stories 19331969
description: The reputation of Jorge Luis Bor ges in the United States is aston ishing, and less than a decade old. Labyrinths and  Ficciones, the first substantial translations of his work, appeared in 1962, one year after  he shared the International Publishers Prize with Beckett; by then he was 63 and well known in his native Argentira and elsewhere in Latin America and Europe (though not in Great Britain). These two volumes were followed by Dreamtigers (1964) as well as col lections of lesser note. Several books have now been devoted to him; his

description: At the beginning of his first, book, The Divided Self, R. D. Laing quoted the French psychiatrist Min kowski: This is a subjective work which tries with all its might to be objective.

title: Dr. William M. Breazeale, Nuclear Scientist, 62, Dies
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., Dec. 12 (AP)Dr. William M.Breazeale, a nuclear scientist who super vised engineering of the world's first nuclearpowered merchant ship, died yesterday at his home here. He was 62 years old.

title: Little League Dates Set
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Dec. 12 (AP)  The dates for Lit tle League baseball's three 1971 world series were an nounced as follows today: 8 to12 age division Aug. 24 to 28 here; 1315 division, Aug. 16 to 18 at Gary, Ind., and 1618 division, Aug. 16 to 18 at Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Two Fiberglass Racing Sloops Are Undergoing Tests
description: The International OneDesign Class, since 1937 a leading rac ing yacht on Long Island Sound, has achieved what may be a milestone in its history. The first boats built of fiberglass have been delivered from Nor way, one to James Bishop and Truman Bidwell Jr., on this coast, and the other to Bill King in San Francisco.

description: Today Worcester County K.C. all breeds, Worcester Memorial Auditorium, Lincoln Square, Worcester, Mass.; 1,346 entries; 9 A.M.

title: Ferrari Shifting Efforts.
description: MODENA, Italy, Dec. 12 (UPI)Enzo Ferrari, the car maker, said today he planned to concentrate his company's racing activities on Formula One and sports  prototype events. He said an experimen tal 3,000c.c., 12cylinder proto type would compete in the present season in preparation for the 1972 world champion ships.

title: Home Improvement
description: THERE are many steps the prudent home owner can take to save fuel during the coming winter months and, as discussed in this column last week, one of the most important is the installation of adeauate insulation.

title: STATES QUESTION STUDDED TIRE USE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The tire industry's success in pro moting the use of snow tires with metal studs for extra trac tion on icy roads has provoked an unwanted confrontation with state highway administra tors over the resulting road damage.

title: Traffic Feud Rocks Cradle of Renaissance
description: FLORENCE, Italy This Cradle of the Renaissance is currently be ing rocked by a rumble over traffic control that makes the ancient political struggles between the Florentine Guelphs and the Ghibellines resemble an oldtime taffypull. At stake: the safety and sanity of the millions of tourists who annually pour through this gem of a Tuscan city.

title: Coast Ecology Groups Favor PollutionFree Holiday Gifts
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (AP)To the ecologyminded the ideal Christmas gift this year might be nondisposable, biodegradable, reusable, non plastic, nonsynthetic and nonpolluting, but beautiful, preferably handmade or a product of nature.

title: A Children's Lobby With No TaxExempt Status Set Up by Sugarman
description: A children's lobby that will forgo taxexempt status to compete more aggressively for Congressional appropriations for poor; handicapped and un dereducated children has been formed by Jule M. Sugarman, New York City's Human Re sources Administrator.

title: Paula Schlick Plans Nuptials
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Dec. 12  Mr. and Mrs. John P. Schlick have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Paula Jeanne Schlick, to Michael Kenneth McGuinness, son of Dr. and Mrs. M. Joseph McGuinness of Mount Kisco.

title: A TRIUMPH IN MUD
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 12Two field goals by Mike Clark, one with the wind and one against, were the scores for the Dallas Cowboys today as they beat the Cleveland Browns, 62, be fore 75,458 fans.

title: Chess
description: THE current 24man roundrobin in Majorca, Spain, was played at high tension. The contenders se lected from zonal trials on the basis of top scores, all had one goal: to wind up among the six highest perform ers, who, together with the former world chess champions Tigran Petrosian and Viktor Korchnoi, both of the Soviet Union, will vie in knockout matches for the role of challenger for the title, which is now in the hands of Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union.

title: N.Y.U. Fencers Beat Yale
description: New York University, the defending National Collegiate fencing champion, defeated Yale yesterday, 216, in the School of Education gymnasium at Washington Square. Star ring for N.Y.U. were Marty Lang, 30, with the foil, Wayne Krause, 20, in epee, and Stephen Kaplan, 20, in saber.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The one distinguishing characteristc of every great athlete is his unsatisfied urge to excel. He wants every performance to be better than the previous one, and that's why Fran Tarkenton may find himself in frustrating bind today when the Giants square off against the Cardinals in St. Louis. Fran loused it up for himself the last time.

title: TITLE SHOWDOWN LOOMS IN JAPAN
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Sturdy little Kubiaki Shibata of Japan looked for ward today to a bout with his countryman, Shozo Saijo, to settle ownership of the feather weight boxing title.

title: CanadaSingapore Accord
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 12 (UPI) Canada and Singapore have signed agreement under which Canada will contribute $$33,330 in technical aid and equipment for a Singapore vocational in stitute. Under the agreement, Canada would also accept 18 Singapore students for training.

title: CITY MOVES TO FIX 3,500 APARTMENTS
description: Citing the need to repair the city's deteriorating housing, Mayor Lindsay announced yes terday the authorization of $55million for loans next year to rehabilitate 3,500 apart ments, primarily in Central Brooklyn, Harlem and the South Bronx.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Now that the stock market is back to a reasonable ap proximation of health, the two big questions on Wall Street are: Who will be the next president of the New York Stock Exchange and who will be the next chair man of the Securities and Ex change Commission?

title: Kremlin Assures Nation It Is Seeking Higher Living Level
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12The So viet leadership today opened nationwide campaign to con vince the nation that the Com munist party and the Govern ment are doing everything possible to improve the stand ard of living.

title: ARAB GUERRILLAS TAKE UNITY STEF
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 12 The Arab guerrillas took a mod est step toward unity this week with the formation of a single secretariat to oversee their movement.

Kessler, the harddriving executive vice president of RCA, who over sees the company's business in the defense, space and commercial aviation fields, likes tigers.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Despite the accumulating evidence that in economics, as in other areas of public policy, government is unable to exert the close control over events we should like to believe it commands, the conviction remains widely held that government must and can prevent business downturns, and quickly bring to an end any it hasn't pre vented. In 1968 and 1969 this conviction encouraged many to ignore or even deny the existence of the gathering clouds, thereby gravely intensifying the damage done by the storm.

title: Quotes
description: New York City's PATRICK V. MURPHY, Police Commis sioner, in calling for the dis armament of all citizens: Under the deceptive guise of freedom and the belief that citizens must be armed to resist tyranny, the American people tolerate... assault, robbery, murder and street crime at gun point. If this is freedom in its finest form, it is also freedom in its final hour.

title: LAUREL RACE WON BY SILVER BUTTON
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 12Jean R. Pancoast's Silver Button turned in a powerful perform ance today as she won the 22,000 First. Lady Handicap at Laurel Race Course by a head over Exclusive Dancer. The winner paid $6.60 for $2.

title: H.E.W. ACTS TO MEET RIBICOFF CRITICISM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare says it will put into partial effect next year a threeyearold law requir ing states to screen and treat health defects In poor children. The announcement Thursday came three days after the au thor of the law, Senator Abra ham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, criticized the de partment for missing the July 1, 1969, legislative deadline on beginning the program for six million welfare. children under age 21.

description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 12 Robert. A. Maheu, who ran things for Howard Hughes in Las Vegas for four years, testi fied today that he never saw him face to face in a 17year association.

title: CM Cheng Betters Asian Games Mark
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 12 Japan captured 11 more gold medals, ;ix of them in swimming, today ind Chi Cheng of Nationalist China set another sprinting rec ord at the Asian Games.

title: MRS. PETER SOBEL
description: Mrs. Ethel Biales Sobel, mother of the Rev. Ronald B. Sobel, associate rabbi of Con gregation EmanuEl, died Fri day, apparently of a heart at tack, at her home, 2 Riverside Drive. Her age was 60. Mrs. Sobel, the widow of Peter So bel, had been a showroom manager for Decorator Indus tries, Inc., 280 Fifth Avenue.

title: Orientals Find Bias Is Down Sharply in U.S.
description: When J. Chuan Chu came to the United States as a student at the end of World War II from his home in North China, he had trouble finding a place to live. Hav ing an Oriental face, he dis covered, was a liability.

title: A Psychologist. Looks At the Hitching Fad
description: Research has shown that man, like a number of animals studied, tends to seek a bal ance between security and sti mulation. Accordingly, at a time when the environment in America has become exceed ingly comfortable and predict able for the middle and upper classes, many young people are attracted by the challenge, trials and tribulation of hitch hiking with a knapsack on their backs.

title: Discovery
description: S.E.M. asks if any reader can locate the following quotation from the works of Alexander von Humboldt: There are three stages in the popular attitude to ward a great discovery; first, men doubt its existence, next they deny its impor tance, and finally they give the credit to someone else.

title: NORTH DAKOTA STATE WINS CAMELLIA, 3116
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 12 (AP)  Mike Bentson of North Dakota State ran for three touchdowns in the first half and the Bisons beat the University of Montana, 3116, today in the 10th annual Ca mellia Bowl.

title: Independent Mayor of Taipei Faces Impeachment Charges
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 12 The Control Yuan, Nationalist China's watchdog agency, yesterday voted to impeach Mayor Henry Kao of Taipei on 10 counts, two of which in volve possible criminal charges.

title: One+One= A Double Bill; THE FAMILY WAY; CHICKEN DELIGHT?; KID STUFF; AUTHOR! AUTHOR!
description: MOST movies eventual ly end up on a dou ble bill, but few are designed with that fate in mind. Producer Gene Persson and British play wright Peter Barnes are con vinced, however, that movie goers  especially in these fiscally troubled timesare ready for a twofortheprice ofone bargain. So they've gone and formed a company for the express purpose of turning out pairs of pictures, to be shown together and they hopeterrific.

title: Italy Puts U. S. XRay Satellite in Orbit
description: An American astronomy sat ellite, known as the Xray Ex plorer, was launched yesterday by a team of Italian engineers from an offshore platform in the Indian Ocean.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Agatha Christie's first book and the debut of Hercule Poi rot (The Mysterious Affair at Styles, 1920) Was a noble maiden effort, springing from a great fondness for the mold formed by A. Conan Doyle: the eccentric and brilliant detec tive, with a suitably idiotic friend. Styles was followed by 34 Poirot novels and short story collections; 15 titles fea turing the perceptive lady sleuth Jane Mamie (beginning with The Murder at the Vicar age in 1930); and sufficient nonseries suspense, plays and nonfiction to bring the total to 80 titles in the author's 80th year, which coincides with the publication of PASSENGER TO FRANKFURT (Dodd, Mead, $5.95).

title: Arthur Hadley to Wed Miss Susan K. Bryant
description: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. Ralph E. Bryant have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Susan Keith Bryant, to Arthur T. Hadley, writer, journalist and historian, of West Tisbury and New York.

title: Tracing Tourists Abroad
description: AN official with a new )company which tracks down tourists overseas tells the story of a man who went to Europe, re turned and discovered that his wife had died and was buried two weeks before he got back home.

title: Reader's Report
description: I am beginning to think that one can say of war what Oscar Wilde once said of art: that all interpretations are true and no interpretation is final. So there is room in military fiction for Sergeant Grischa and Lieu tenant Henry, for Sergeant Quirt and Captain Stanhope and Corporal Himmelstoss. While Lieutenant Yossarian may have been postulating Catch22, the marines of which Sergeant Sutton is the proto type were fighting and dying for all those Pacific islands, and one does not have to deny one to believe in the other.

title: News of the Rialto
description: LIKE Sarah Bernhardt's farewell tours earlier in the century, James Earl Jones's series of bouts with Othello appears to be without end. Five times now the celebrated actor has gone to the mat with the noble Moor  the last time was five years ago in the New York Shakespeare Festival's production in Central Park and he still hankers for more. In fact, at his suggestion a re match has been arranged for the spring at the Mark Taper Forum in Los Angeles.

title: No Tree on Campus
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Dec. 12 (AP)For the first time in 46 years, there will be no of ficial lighted Christmas tree on the Michigan State University campus. W. Michael Born, special assistant to the school's executive vice president, said the decision had been made as an economy measure.

title: BRANDT REBUFFS HIS U.S. CRITICS
description: BERLIN, Dec. 12Chancellor Willy Brandt today answered criticism by some Americans of West Germany's new policies by stressing that nothing will divert him from seeking to improve relations with Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union.

description: PITTSFIELD, Mass.  The future of some 3,000 electri cal workers here could be decided next year in Wash ington  or possibly in Swe den, Switzerland, France, It aly, Great Britain or Japan.

title: PLAN ON HIJACKING DUE WEDNESDAY
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 12A conference on air law in session  here is expected to produce on Wednesday the first interna tional convention that defines aerial hijacking as a crime and provides legal means for deal ing with the hijacker.

description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12 (AP) A suburban Oak Lawn woman received today a check for $1,102,678 for damages she allegedly suf fered 11 years ago when a can of commercial drain cleaner exploded.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Taimen are probably the largest salmon in the world . . . found in the north flow rivers of Russia . . . also found in the extensive water shed of the Volga, which drains into the Caspian Sea . . . recorded specimens as much as 150 pounds . . . the size and fighting power of this species, and its distri bution through the wilder ness rivers of Siberia, make the taimen an enigma for anglers with a sense of adventure.

title: World Bank Cancels Dance To Give Funds to Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The $30,000 the World Bank would have spent on its annual Christmas dance will be do nated to relief funds for cyclonedevastated East Paki stan, a bank spokesman has announced.

title: Where the Greeks and Romans Sought Healing
description: BERGAMA, TurkeyThe year is 300 B.C. Lysimachus, a general under Alexander the Great and ruler of Asia Minor, has consulted all the physicians in his capital city of Smyrna and tried all the traditional remediesbut to no avail. An ache per sists in his right ear. With no relief in sight, Lysimachus, in step with the fash ion of his time, gathers together his entourage and travels 74 miles north to the city of Pergamum to seek treatment at a place called the Asclepiona heal ing center often described nowadays as the Mayo Clinic of the ancient world.

title: California Legal Aid Program Faces Threat of a Reagan Veto
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 Gov. Ronald Regan is threat ening to veto funds for Cali fornia Rural Legal Assistance, considered one of the most successful legal assistance pro grams in the country.

title: OAKLAND CLINCHES WEST CROWN, 206
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 12 The Oakland Raiders downed the Kansas City Chiefs today, 20.6, for the American Confer ence Western Division cham pionship in the National Foot ball League.

title: Waring Has Heart Attack
description: EAST STROUDSBURG, Pa., Dec. 12 (AP)Fred Waring, the orchestra leader, suffered heart attack at his home but was resting comfortably at hospital today his physician said. Mr. Waring, 70 years old, is known for his famous sing ing group, the Pennsylvanians. He suffered the heart attack about noon yesterday at his home at ShawneeonDelaware, in the Pocono Mountains, Dr. R. Frederick Jones said.

title: Dayan Ties World Trot Mark, Defeats Fresh Yankee by Neck
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 12 Dayan, Adonis Stable's 4 yearold Hickory Smoke stal lion, beat Fresh Yankee by neck today and captured the $100,000 American Trotting Classic at Hollywood Park.

title: BRAVES SLUGGER 0UT UNTIL APRIL
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Dec. 12 (AP)  Rico Carty, the Atlanta Braves slug ger plagued by injury and ill ness in recent years, suffered multiple knee fracture in a Win ter League mishap last night the eve of his official designa tion as the National League's 1970 batting champion. He is expected to be sidelined for four months.

Brewen, chief medical officer of the Harrisburg Polyclinic Hospi tal, and Mrs. Brewen who is chief psychologist of Harris burg State Hospital. Mr. Ache son is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Harrison R. title: Letters to the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:  In my opinion the only so lution for solving the critical lowrent housing shortage lies in reconstructing the more than 25,000 sound, va cant and abandoned apart . ment buildings in the city. These lend themselves to re construction into 250,000 modern apartments. The rents would be $30 a room or less.

title: U. S. IS PRESSING FOR A SEA TREATY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 12The United States is playing a leading role in plans to revise the law of the sea, governing what countries may do on its surface, in the waters below or in the earth beneath it.

title: VOICES AND MUSIC IN GLOWING BACH
description: i The Bach concert in Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Friday night came as close to perfection as any musical event can. There was the musicfour extraordi nary works, including the Con certo in C minor for oboe and violin; the Concerto in D minor for two violins; Cantata No. 209, Non sa the sia dolore, and the Wedding Cantata. There was a handful of superb soloists backed by a small choice group of strings plus harpsichord. The concertos need little comment, although hearing the exquisite slow movements once again was a reminder of the emotional power the great con trapuntist could unleash. The Italian cantata must be one of Bach's most sensuous scores, with harmonies in the opening Sinfonia and in the final aria that are extraordinary. The Wedding Cantata, moving from the musical suggestions of dark shadows to the final blissful gavotte, is a glowing testimony to earthly happiness.

title: Ernst: Brainstorms of Wit and Fantasy
description: ONE of the less pub licized boons of this autumn has been the retrospective of 60 odd works in various media by Max Ernst at the Byron Gallery, a show whose run has happily been extended to Dec. 23. A concurrent and complementing treat is the modest exhibition of 37 orig inalprint photographs and rayographs (pictures made by exposing objects on photo graphic plates) by Man Ray mounted at the Goldowsky in honor of the artist's 80th birthday. Certainly the coin cidence of shows by these two founding fathers of Dada and Surrealism, following so closely on the recent and splendid Francis Picabia re trospective at the Guggen heim Museum, is noteworthy indicating as it does the persistent charm and rele vance of that oddlot, incred ibly talented generation whose halcyon days in Paris after World War I constituted perhaps the most glamorous and outlandish moment in the annals of modern art.

title: Elijah The Slave
description: The sagas of Elijah the Prophet come out of the six centuries (after A.D. 200) dur ing which the Midrashic liter ature of Israel was compiled. They combine religion with mythos  that underlying theme which expresses the bas ic truths and continuing appre hensions of a people's historic experience. And while religion seems to triumph in these sagas, the real victory is with mythos. Elijah, for example,

title: Reagan Outspent Unruh
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 12 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan spent more than $3million to get reelected to a second term, while his Democratic opponent, Jess Unruh, spent about $1.2 million.

title: Photography
description: A NEW instant load cam era that uses Magicube flash units (type X) also has a builtin automa tic electric eye exposure sys temyet it operates without any batteries at all. Called the Keystone 425X Magicube Electric Eye Camera, and made by the AtlasRand Cor poration, Keystone Place, Pa ramus, N. J. 07652, the camera uses 126 Instamatic cartridges and features a fully automatic, continuously variable lens aperture that is controlled by the amount of existing light on the scene. It adjusts from f/8 to f/22 depending on the light avail able, and a red indicator ap pears in the viewfinder when there is not enough light for a good exposure and use of a Magicube is recommended. The 425X is priced at $39.95 in a kit that includes the camera, a Magicube, wrist strap and a 126 Kodacolor film cartridge.

title: Constitution May Protect Hitchhiking
description: Hitchhiking with a sign in stead of an extended thumb may be protected by the free speech clause of the First Amendment, and therefore not illegal, declares John Meloney, eastern regional di rector of American Youth Hostels.

title: BOARDWALK BOWL WON BY BLUE HENS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 12 .The University of Delaware football team continued to dem onstrate today It enjoys the Convention Hall indoor spot light as much as Miss America does. The Blue Hens won the Boardwalk Bowl game for the third straight year by defeating Morgan State. 3823.

title: Price Daniel Is Appointed To Texas Supreme Court
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 12 (AP) Goy. Preston Smith appoint ,ed former Gov. Price Daniel to the Texas Supreme Court today.

title: Judge to Wed Joan Herman
description: Miss Joan Herman, associ ate director of nursing at the hospital of the Albert Ein stein College of Medicine, and Judge Lawrence Bilder of the Superior Court of New Jersey will be married in March. Their engagement has been announced by her par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Herman of the Bronx.

title: jersey City Protests Newark Focus
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 12Jer sey City accused the New Jer sey State Legislature this week of giving special attention to the fiscal problems of. Newark and overlooking similar crises facing the state's other large cities.

title: PHONE MONITORS LAID TO U.S. UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) When you telephone any of 52 Federal agencies, someone may be eavesdropping and at least nine agencies may not tell you about it, a House re port says.

title: Israelis Combating Pollution in the Sea of Galilee
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, Dec. 12 (AP)  Israelis are dumping waste into the Sea of Galilee and the lake faces a grim fate unless swift measures are taken to protect its 77 square miles.

title: Alan Ganek to Wed Jo Anne Dreyer
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Dec. 12The engagement of Miss Jo Anne Dreyer to Alan G. Ganek, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry S. Ganek of Millburn, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Dreyer. A wedding next May is planned.

title: Lodge Confers With Pope; P.O.W.s Believed a Topic
description: ROME, Dec. 12President Nixon's personal envoy, Henry Cabot Lodge, had a 25minute audience today with Pope Paul VI, their first meeting since the Pontiff returned from his jour ney to Asia and the Pacific.

title: AUDIENCE WORKS FOR PETE SEEGER
description: When Pete Seeger gives concert, he does not have to worry about bringing along backup group or musical sup port of any sort. All he needs is an audience and, before they know it, they're working for him.

title: DOWNHILL TAKEN BY MISS MACCHI
description: BARDONECCHI, Italy, Dec. 12 (UPI)Seven Frenchwomen, led by Francoise Macchi, turned the first World Cup ski race of the season into a national tri umph today.

title: Switch in Vietnam Policy?
description: The most critical question raised by President Nixon's threat to resume the bombing of North Vietnam if Hanoi's forces increase the level of fighting in the South whether a decision already has been made to reverse policy and reescalate the war.

title: Kings Point Wins, 8626, From Columbia Swimmers
description: The Kings Point swimmin, team won 9 of the 12 event yesterday to defeat Columbia 8626, at the loser's University Pool.

title: State Democrats Vote to Elect Full National Convention Slate
description: ALBANY, Dec. 12The Dem ocratic State Committee voted unanimously here today to change its rules to provide that all delegates to the party's na tional conventions be elected by nonular vote at a primary.

title: BLACK JEW HERE A BRIDGEBUILDER
description: Robert Coleman, who was named last week as the director of the Synagogue Council of America's newly established di vision of social justice views his job as one of trying to build bridges between the black and the Jewish communities. He is eminently qualified for the po sition, because he is both black and Jewish, a member of the highly traditional Hasidic sect.

title: In Ship Pilots Town, Weather Is a Worry
description: PILOTTOWN, La., Dec. 7 Larry Loga, the owner of the bar that is Pilottown's only commercial establishment, ac knowledges that his town has fewer municipal problems than almost any place he knows of.

title: McDivitt of Astronauts Nominated for General
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)Col. James A. McDivitt of the Air Force became to day the first United States astronaut to be nominated for promotion to general.

title: ROCKEFELLER NAMES NEW STAFF'S DUTIES
description: ALBANY, Dec. 12Governor Rockefeller announced today series of appointments on the executive chamber staff, includ ing the naming of his counsel, Robert R. Douglass, as secre tary to the Governor.

description: HARTFORD, Dec. 12The Pennsylvania Firebirds of Potts town, Pa., made it two Atlantic Coast Football League cham pionships in a row today by defeating the Hartford Knights, 31.0.

title: Mrs. Jacqueline Nelson and Peter Janover to Wed
description: Mrs. Frances Tuckerman Freeman Jalet of New York and Houston and Marius Stephen Jalet of New York have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Mrs. Jacqueline Jalet Nelson, to Peter Gumpert Janover, son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard G. Janover of New York.

title: Wharton: Not Just a Business School
description: PHILADELPHIA  Our name is misleading so we fuzz it up, acknowledges Willis Winn, dean of the Wharton School of Finance and Commerce, which is try ing every which way to be known as just plain Whar ton.

C., will be married on Jan. 30. The cere mony will take place in the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: Gregory Marwede Weds Miss Burrow
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Dec. 12Miss Penelope Sherwood Burrow was married here this afternoon to Gregory Marwede. The Rev. Harrison Davis performed the cere mony at the Grace United Methodist Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Arnold Westwood, a Unitarian min ister, and the Rev. Irving Marsiand.

title: KENTUCKY VICTOR IN OVERTIME, 9593
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 12 (AP)Fifthranked Kentucky pulled out a 9593 overtime victory over Indiana today. Tom Parker scored 24 points, including 9 in the extra period, for the Wildcats.

title: R M. Frehse Jr. And Dale Miller Plan Marriage
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 12Miss Dale Dunlap Miller, daughter of John Robinson Miller, executive vice presi dent and general manager of Hearst Magazines and Mrs. Miller and Robert MaxFrehse Jr., son_ of the Rev. Christians and Jews in the Michigan region and now a consultant to the organization, and Mrs. Frehse, plan to be married here in February.

title: MADISON AVE.

title: SALT Without Pepper
description: HELSINKI, Dec. 12The Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) here undoubtedly the most important diplo matic negotiations in the world today have achieved their first objective. After the first three rounds, they may not have disarmed the United States or the Soviet Union, but they have disarmed the press. In short, they have been all salt and, so far as anybody outside knows, no pepper.

description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 12 Eight years after Rachel Car son documented In Silent Spring the Agriculture Depart ment's campaign to eradicate the fire ants in the South with pesticides, the department has resumed its fight against the insect.

title: BOLD SKIPPER 2D IN FLORIDA STAKE
description: MIAMI, Dec. 12Ray Brous sard returned to Tropical Park, following a twoweek vacation ,in Louisiana, today and rode  one horse. It was the right one Landing More in the Bright Memorial Handicap.

title: Rothschilds: How to Make Music Out of Money
description: WHY would anyone write a musical about the growth of a financial em pire It would seem to be a selfdefeating project be cause the clink of coins must produce cold and, eventually, monotonous music. But Jerry Bock and Sneldon Harnick have found enough fleshand blood emotion in Sherman Yellen's book for The Roths childs (Columbia S 30337) to supply focal paints on which. to develop a score that is surprisingly warm and spirit ed. It has style and flair qualities that have become rare in our musical theater and the first side of this original Broadway cast re cording rides along with a brilliantly bravura sweep.

title: DE YICENZO LEADS ARGENTINE GOLF
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 12 (UPI)Roberto de Vicenzo, the home town favorite troubled by a bad back, shot a 68 in the third round of the Argen tine Masters tournament today and held a onestroke lead over Rills Caspar

description: LOS ANGELESWhen the Senate casts its showdown vote whether to kill the SST or to continue it under a $210million compromise appropri ation, this capital city of the aero space industry will not view the outcome in the lofty perspective of environmental protection or re ordering national priorities.
