Lowry, a management con sultant with McKinsey & Co. in New York. The Rev. H. Carl McCall of the United Church of Christ performed the ceremony at the home of William Chaffee, architect with the New York Urban Development Corporation.

title: HUSSEIN WEIGHING WESTBANK POLICY
description: King Hussein of Jordan said here yesterday that in recent letters to other Arab heads of state he had asked their views on the possible formation of an independent Palestinian state on the west bank of the Jordan River, the area of Jordan now occupied by Israel.

title: RAIDERS CONQUER CHIEFS UP FRONT
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 12 (UPI) John Madden credited fine work by the Oakland of fensive line and an oldfashioned running game for the Raiders crucial victory today over the Kansas City Chiefs.

title: BORGES IN ENGLISH TODAY
description: FICCIONES. Edited by Anthony Kerrigan. (1962) EvergreenGrove, paper, $2.45.

title: A Black Professor Says . .
description: CAMPUSES across the country are full of optimistic official reports and demoralizing pri vate discussions about programs for black students. As a black faculty member, I encounter more than my share of both. The private discussions revolve around underprepared black students who are in over their heads academically and those white faculty members who fudge their grades out of guilt, compassion or a desire to avoid trouble. Few faculty members are as blunt as the Cornell professor who said, I give them all A's and B's, to hell with em. At least he understood the consequences of what he was doing. Others think, they are doing a favor to the students, or to black people in general.

title: Gold Mine Seeks A Way to Operate Without Polluting
description: LEAD S. D., Dec. 12 (UPI) Gold pollutes. More accurately, the means used to extract gold from the Black Hills of South Dakota causes pollution.

title: Curbs on Phosphate Voted In Akron Pollution Move
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 12 (AP) The Akron City Council has ordered detergent manufactur ers to list on containers by Feb. 1 the phosphate content of the detergent.

title: Decorating a shell
description: BARONIAL NALLTypical of the way the house had been stripped by the previous own ers was the staircase, which was minus its banister. Dwork designed this wroughtiron one and the foyer carpet as well.

title: European Notebook
description: Among the many novels pub lished in France in this season of literary prizes, Le Roi des Aulnes (Gallimard) by Michel Tournier stood out as the most remarkableand it has just won the Prix Goncourt. Its title, inspired by Goethe's fa mous ballad Der Erlkonig, can be translated as The King of the Elves.

title: MISS JEANNETTE GREEN
description: Miss Jeannette F. Green, long an artists representative, died in Mount Sinai Hospital yes terday. She was 71 years old and lived at 175 West 76th Street.

title: Mayor of Culebra Sues Again to Halt Shellings by Navy

title: Reserve Chief Retiring
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 12 (AP)The top soldier in the Army Reserve, Maj. Gen. Wil liam J. Sutton of San Antonio, will retire May 31. General button, 62 years old, has served k:ts chief of the Army Reserve In Washington since 1963.

title: Phone Users Get a Present
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Dec. 12 (AP)The New England Tele phone Company has announced a Christmas present for resi dents in six south Berkshire County townsmore tollfree calls. Under the new system, starting Dec. 30, subscribers in Lee, Stockbridge and Lenox will be able to call anywhere in those three exchanges without the current 10cent charge for three minutes.

title: ROSS G. WALKER
description: SUMMIT, N.J., Dec. 12Ross G. Walker, a faculty member at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration for 33 years, died yesterday at Over1 look Hospital here. He was 79 years old and lived at 55 Beverly Road.

description: Moshe Dayan, the Israeli De fense Minister, asserted last night that President Nixon has kept every word concerning Israel's needs since Mr. Nixon was elected.

title: STOWE IS CHOSEN TO COACH CREWS
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Dec. 11The Coast Guard Academy announced today that it would introduce rowing as an inter collegiate sport in 1971.

description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Dec. 12 (Reuters)The United States Agency for International De velopment has donated $720,000 to the Ivory Coast's regional center for road maintenance and $195,000 to Its cattle and meat association.

title: On the Lam in America
description: As he hunched forward, rolling across the warped slats of the park bench his face passed into a patch of sunlight and I saw for the first time the depth of his prison pallor: slack skin the color of half cooked porridge.

title: REDMEN SUCCEED ON 201HALF RALLY
description: For a time last night, it ap peared that Georgetown was going to beat St. John's in bas ketball for the first time since the 194748 season. The Hoyas led the Redmen by 7 points late in the first half.

title: Rubella Immunization
description: Rubella, or German measles, until the last few years, was thought of as a children's dis ease with a transient rash that lasted a few days, a little fever and that was all.

title: ExIm Bank Adopts Hard Sell
description: WASHINGTONStimulated by a dash of old fashioned, once  staid Export  Import Bank of the United States has turned into an enthusi astically brash and expand ing promoter of American sales abroad.

title: From the Pen of Edgar Smith
description: In March, 1957, Edgar Smith, a 23yearold Marine veteran, married and with an infant daughter, was charged with the murder of a 15 yearold New Jersey girl. He de scribed the subsequent events in a 1968 magazine article: Within three months. . .I was arrested. . . .I was tried and convicted of firstdegree murder by a jury that had deliber ated for less than two hours. I was sentenced to die in the electric chair. I have since filed many appeals to win a new trial  so far without success, and I still remain under sentence of death.

title: Lockheed Woes May Cost U.S. Public $600Million
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 The Defense Department and the beleaguered Lockheed Air craft Corporation are resolving their differences in a way that will keep Lockheed solvent at an apparent minimum cost to the public of about $600mil lion.

title: MRS. JOSEPH SUTTON
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 12 (UPI)Mrs. Jean Harkness Sutton, wife of Dr. Joseph Sut ton, president of Indiana Uni versity, died last night at the Indiana University Medical Center in Indianapolis. She was 47 years old.

title: Bridge
description: WHEN bridge enthusiasts talk about good and bad cards, the bad players mean one thing and the good players another. To a bad play er, honor cards are good cards, and all others are bad. But when a good player refers to good cards and bad cards he means something different: he means honor cards that will or will not fit partner's hand.

title: Feminist Marchers Brave Icy Rain
description: Braving wind, cold and icy rain, 300 women marched up Fifth Avenue from 59th Street and across 86th Street to Gracie Mansion to demand free abortions and childcare centers.

title: Federal Plan Would Put Unemployed Scientists to Work on Urban Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Nixon. Administration is consid ering an emergency training and recruitment program that would put many of the na tion's 45,000 unemployed scien tists, physicists and engineers to work on urban problems.

title: Summary and Index
description: Today's news summary and index appear on Page 95.

title: Printing Flaws
description: FOLLOWING quickly on the report here last week that the flag on Mayflower depict ed on the 6c commemorative released Nov. 21 was in correct, Jacques C. Schiff Jr., 536 West 111th Street, New York, has reported discovery of a pane of 50 Pilgrim stamps missing orange and yellow colors  the rising sun back of the center mast of the Mayflower. The stamp was issued to commemorate the 350th anniversary of the landing of the Pilgrims at Plymouth Rock.

title: Miss Suzanne Fiske Shaffer Is Fiancee of Bayard Kellam
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Rich ard Fiske Shaffer of Brook lyn Heights and Nassau, N.Y., of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Suzanne Fiske Shaffer, to Bayard Kellam, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Kellam of East Chatham, N.Y.

title: Taps for the Bugler
description: Few veterans look back with longing on their spit andpolish days, or admit it if they do, except for those instances when they circumvented and outfoxed the brass. For any soldier worth his salt, though, there were many such occasions. It might even be grudgingly con ceded that the resourcefulness called for, even more the bit of daring, were part of the training for what lay ahead. So, perhaps, was the adjustment to total discom fort, possibly even the acceptance of the wild illogic that would accompany them all the way up to Catch 22.

title: Susan Tyler Is Bride of Peter P. Nitze
description: HINGHAM, Mass., Dec. 12 The Second Parish Church, Unitarian, was decorated with red and white flowers and Christmas greens for the wedding this afternoon of Miss Susan Prentiss Tyler to Peter Paul Nitze of New York. The Rev. Dr. Donald Robinson performed the cere mony, which was followed by a reception at the home of the bride's stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. John R. Thomas. The bridegroom is the son of Paul H. Nitze, former Sec retary of the Navy, and Mrs. Nitze of Washington and Bel Alton, Md., and a grand son of the late John T. Pratt, the financier and philanthro pist, and the late Mrs. Ruth Baker Pratt, who was United States Representative from the 17th Congressional Dis trict in New York.

title: COST OF ALCOHOLISM IS PUT AT $2BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) Alcoholism is costing Amer ican industry $2billion to 83 billion a year and the main offenders are executives, Labor Department magazine has said.

title: Administration Finds No Takers For Top Post in Space Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Nixon Administration is finding no takers in its effort to replace Dr. Thomas O. Paine, who re signed four months ago as head of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: UCONNS TRIUMPH OVER TRACK FOES
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 12The University of Connecticut de feated Yale and the University of Massachusetts today in a tri angular meet at the Cox Cage. Connecticut scored 54 points to 52 for Yale and 31 for Massa chusetts.

title: NEWSMEN'S RELEASE IN CAMBODIA URGED
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 12 (AP)  Correspondents from many nations appealed today to the Communists to use the Christmas ceasefire to free 17 newsmen known to be missing in Cambodia.

description: BOSTON, Dec. 12 (AP)The Massachusetts Housing Financ ing Agency announced this week that it had committed more than $166million for new construction and rehabili tation of housing in the state.

title: Barbara J. McClure Betrothed To William Benedict, a Cadet
description: Miss Barbara Jane McClure and Cadet William Edward Benedict of West Point plan to marry June 12.

title: To Company B, Apricots Suggest Death
description: NINHOKAI RIDGE, South Vietnam, Dec. 4In the last month of the fifth year of fullscale American action in Vietnam, a newly arrived 19yearold private named Thomas Hobbs has begun to feel afraid. He thinks that his armored personnel carrier known as a gun track be cause it is equipped with an 81mm. mortarwill hit an other mine.

J., and a greatgrandson of John LaFarge, the artist.

They do in Mexico  where each is an important in gredient of the holidays, along with poinsettias, bells, angels, lights, tinsel, toys and even a few scrawny bootleg pine trees that remind visitors of Christ MS north of the border.

title: Genesis 1948
description: In Genesis 1948: The First ArabIsraeli War, Dan Kurz man attempts to recreate that sad triumph from both the Arab and Israeli points of view. The concept is admirable; and, according to his huge bibliog raphy and the list he provides of the people he has in terviewed, he has done a monumental job of researching his material.

title: Butterflies Are Free Continues as a Winner
description: The very real pleasure to, be found in:Leonard Gershe's comedy, Butterflies Are Free, now in its second year at the Booth Theater, is the effortless elegance with which it achieves every thing it has set out to achieve. It is funny, touching and wryly sentimental. It provides entertainment with out talking down, it is witty, honest, in that particular way proverbs tend to be hon est, and exquisitely written.

title: ATHENS TIGHTENS CONTROL OF MEDIA
description: ATHENS, Dec. 12  Greece decreed today a drastic re organization of her press and information services, bringing them under the direct control of Premier George Papado ooulos.

title: Elizabeth Van Siclen Is Wed In Suburb to David Townsend
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Dec. 12Christ Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Elizabeth Van Siclen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Wyckoff Van Siclen of Munsey Park, to David Bruce Townsend, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roger Wilmoth Town send of Nutley, N. J. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Frank N. Johnston.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: In Maggie Scarf's article, Brain Researcher Jose Del gado Asks`What Kind of Humans Would We Like to Construct?  (Nov. 15), Dr. Delgado is quoted as follows: [Electrical stimulation of the brain] can certainly not be used to implant ideas or to order people about like robots you couldn't use it to direct a person down to the mailbox to get the mail.

title: St. Peter's Downs Wheaton
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 12St. Peter's College won its second straight basketball game to night, posting a 132100 victory over Wheaton College before 3,102 fans at Marist High School. Rich Rinaldi scored his 1,000th career point for the Peacocks and finished with a game high of 34.

title: Is Avoiding New Music Moral?; OLDER; SECOND PREMIERE; HEMIDEMISEMIQUAVERS
description: WEDNESDAY is Der Tag, and if anyone doesn't know by now that it is the 200th anniversary of Beetho ven's birth then he probably hasn't read a newspaper for the past year. The event has been heralded, trumpeted and celebrated for so long that the actual birthday comes almost as an anticli max.

title: NIXON CONTESTS SCRANTON REPORT ON HEALING RIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  President Nixon strongly con tested today the principal rec ommendation of his Commis sion on Campus Unrest that he must lead the nation back from the brink of ominous divisions over social problems.

title: Laotian Leftists Turn Down Plan for Neutral Corridor
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)  The leftist Pathet Lao today reject ed a proposal by the Laotian Government for a ninemile wide neutral corridor to pro tect access to the site chosen for talks between the Vientiane Government and leaders of the Pathet Lao.

title: The Timeless Story
description: At the Christmas season we take the long view of the Near East  aided by the handsome, profusely illustrated gift books that capture the timeless story of this crossroads of the world and its Holy Land, where three great faiths were born. The most impressive such volume this year is THE BIBLE: His tory and Culture of a People (Herder & Herder, $29.50 to Christmas, then $33).

title: 2Year Study Links Child Abuse To the Role of Force in Rearing
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Dec. 12 A major nationwide study has traced the high level of child beating in this country to a widespread acceptance among Americans of the use of physi cal force as a legitimate pro cedure in child rearing.

title: MICHIGAN DOWNS DETROIT BY 7473
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 12 (UPI)Dan Fife sank two free throws with 25 seconds left in the overtime today and the University of Michigan defeat ed the University of Detroit, 7473.

title: An Appetizingand ClassicGift for Holidays
description: Fruitcakes are a popular and relatively inexpensive holiday gift for friends and business associates.

title: PURSE SMATCHER, 17, CHARGED IN MURDER
description: A 17 year  old East Harlem youth accused of trying to snatch a woman's purse con taining $1.20 faced a murder charge yesterday after the woman died from her injuries.

title: Movies
description: AREN'T they ever going to do right by Tuesday Weld? It's no secret that she's good, very, very good, and sometimes better than that. Everyone has known for years that she has talent  just as they know about her cherub's face (she's a Shirley Temple doll) and those delicious baby teeth and that intriguingly lurid past. Yet here she is again, her first meaty starring role in an expensive dramatic film, I Walk the Line, with John Frankenheimer as director and Gregory Peck, no less, as her leading man, and look what happened. It opened on the circuits one week and vanished the next.

title: LETTERS
description: Tax Questioned

title: The Thumb As Travel Agent: Pleasures and Perils
description: W HEN the nation's five and half million college students are turned loose for the tradi tional Christmas recess next Friday afternoon, a good number of them will promptly thumb their noses at warnings from the FBI, the National Safety Council, city and state police and make their getaways from the groves of academe by hitchhiking.

title: Pamela Fairbanks Is Affianced To Aubert Gaudin de Villaine
description: Mr. and Mrs. Peter De Lancey Lewis of San Fran cisco have announced here the engagement of Mrs. Lewis's daughter, Miss Pa mela Fairbanks, to Aubert Gaudin de Villaine, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henri Gaudin de Villaine of Moulins; France.

title: Ayne Burgauer Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Rey Burgauer of New York and Woodmere, L.I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ayne Carol Burgauer, to Robert Brell Rogoff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sol Rogoff of North Arlington, N.J. Miss Burgauer is a graduate of Harcum Junior College. Her father is vice president of Manny's Musical Instruments in New York. Mr. Rogoff is a senior at C. W. Post College. His father is vice president of Vornado, Inc., which oper ates the Two Guys discount chain.

title: HANOI DENOUNCES NIXON'S WARNING
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)The press organs of the North Viet namese Communist party and army reacted sharply today to President Nixon's warning of retaliatory bombing attacks, presenting it as a preparation of American opinion for a stepping up of the war in Indochina.

title: Heath: IIPost to Pillar
description: LONDONThe grand design of Prime Minister Edward Heath's foreign policy is to get Britain into the Common Market and then help the latter to assume a greater share in Western defense. In a sense he wants to end this island's role as an offshore post and weld it to a European pillar which, under the twinpillar, or dumb bell, theory first enunciated in Wash ington during the Kennedy Adminis tration, would speak louder inside the alliance.

title: A Ringside Seat for the Battle Over Gibraltar
description: ALGECIRAS, SpainThis port city at the mouth of the Mediterranean, once a dreary, dusty stopover and perhaps best known to Americans as the background for those sinister Peter Lorre movies, is now the place for travelers in southern Spain to go in order to look at Gibraltar, six miles out in Algeciras Bay. The view is longrange, but it is as close as a land traveler can get because  due to the Spanish British quarrel over who should be Gi braltar's landlordthe Rock has been sealed off to all persons approaching it by land.

title: Miss Rigby of U.S. Takes Third Place in Gymnastics
description: TOKYO, Dec. 12 (AP)Cathy Rigby of Los Alamitos, Calif., celebrated her 18th birthday today by winning a bronze medal in the side horse event

title: Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The month following a national election is traditionally a transitional period for the President, a dead time when he and his staff keep to themselvesplanning the budget, laying the groundwork for the New Year, making little news. All of which leaves the press and the public free to engage in all sorts of ominous (and sometimes mischievous) speculation about what is going on behind the scenes.

title: Banker Weds Miss Larson
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 12In Christ's Episcopal Church here this morning, Miss Lin nie Christine Larson, daugh ter of Mrs. Randell Larson of Alameda, Calif., and the late Mr. Larson, was married to Frederick Butterfield Picker ing Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Pickering of Rye. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Wendell W. Phillips, rector of the church.

title: Pop
description: JESUS CHRIST SUPER STAR: A Rock Opera by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice (Decca DXSA7206). Here we go again. Rock operas, rock sym phonies, rock concerti. Does it all sound reminiscent? It should, because it hasn't been all that long since every com poser worth his salt thought he could liven things up with a dash of jazz rhythms. And, conversely, the climax of those old movies about jazz musicians always showed them on the stage of Carnegie Hall, surrounded by full or chestra and chorus, achieving respectability at last with all of the classical music swells.

title: VIETNAM STUDY CITES PLIGHT OF CIVILIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) United States Investigators reported today that they had found shortages of skilled med ical help, deficient facilities and even a lack of reliable statistics in their review of South Viet namese civilian health and war linked casualty programs.

title: THE BLACK EXPERIENCE
description: His poetry celebrated sur vival and endurance, those central ingredients of our ex perience; and he couched them in humor and irony, a frequently subtle but abiding passion, and, finally, a cer tain sad awareness regard ing the impossibility of being Hughes, the Black man, and Hughes, the American.

title: What We Have Forgotten About Pot
description: THERE was a time in the United States when extracts of can nabis were as commonly used for medicinal purposes as aspirin to day. Not only was cannabis a medi cation that could be purchased with out a prescription in any drug store (which is almost unbelievable when you consider that mere possession of marijuana is now a serious of fense), but it was also prescribed by physicians as an important treatment for a large number of medical condi tions, from migraines and excessive menstrual bleeding to ulcers, epilepsy and even tooth decay.

title: Ursula Holden Fiancee
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Dec. 12Mr. and Mrs. James F. Holden have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ursula Mary Holden, to Nels Augustus Palm 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Palm Jr. of Chelmsford, Mass., Miss Holden, a grad uate of Holy Angels Acad emy in Demarest, is a sen ior at the Boston College School of Nursing. Her fianc, a student at the Law School of Boston Col lege , was graduated from Georgetown University.

title: Cambodians Said to Repel Assaults Near Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 12 (AP)A Cambodian spokes man said today that Government forces had fought off heavy enemy assaults in handtohand combat 38 miles northeast of Pnompenh. But field reports said that a large number of North Vietnamese and Viet cong troops remained in the area.

title: A PARTNERSHIP ROLE AMONG JEWS URGED
description: An international Zionist leader said last night that relationship between Israel and Jewish communities over the world must be based on partnership and not a system in which the state gives orders and the Diaspora obeys. (Dia spora Jews are those living outside Israel.)

description: The program of the Cham ber Music Society of Lincoln Center, on Friday evening in Alice Tully Hall, was absorb ing and solid: three constrast ing masterpieces, played by the Guarneri String Quartet with assisting artists.

It said a rustprotection department at the stateowned mining equip:. ment organization in Leipzig had begun its austerity cam paign by canceling its sub scription to Neues Deutschland.

description: PARIS, Dec. 12There are Joe Namath posters all over town, but Paris is not yet ready for a National Football League franchise.

description: When an uninitiated visitor first sets foot in one of the informal elementary school classes praised and endorsed last week by State Commis sioner of Education Ewald B. Nyquist, the first reaction is often one of mild shock.

description: MANILA, Dec. 12 (UPI) Luis Silverio, a former open champion of the Philippines, shot a finalround 73 today to win the FilAm golf title for the seventh time with a four rnund tntal of 275.

description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 12 Post position No. 8, generally frowned upon by most harness racing drivers, proved no deter rent to Maida Million in to night's $25,000 final of the Fall Pacing Festival at Roosevelt Raceway.

description: GERTNERSadie unveiling Dec. 13 at 11:30 A.M. at Mount Zion, Masgeth, N.Y. No Postponement.

title: The Rediscovery of Storrs
description: IT is astonishing at times to realize the extent to which certain phases of American art have been allowed to become subjects of almost archeological ob scurity. This is true even for much of the art produced in recent decades by artists who are either still with us or only recently dead. The latest stars in the firmament of the marketplace are, if anything, too well known, too inces santly imposed on our atten tion. But their whether by a week, a decade or half a. century, tend to fade from official memory with indecent and uncon scionable haste. Again and again, we have allowed some of the most significant ac complishments of American art to sink almost without trace into the limbo of for gotten reputations. Philip Rahv once observed that America's second name should really be amnesia, and there is ample evidence in the annals of American art to bear him out.

title: Case Near Paris Shows Cholera Strikes Developed Lands, Too
description: At first, French health offi cials could find neither a source for her case, which is the first reported in France since World War I, nor any other causes of the bacterial disease, physicians at the Center for Disease Con trol in Atlanta reported last weekend.

title: Headliners
description: I want to be the guy who stands for change, George Bush said during his campaign for Senator from Texas last fall. Despite strong backing from President Nixon, the 46yearold Republican lost the election; but as a result, he is about to experience one the biggest changes in his life. In what was generally regarded a reward to Mr. Bush for his giving up a Congressional seat to run for the Senate at Mr. Nixon's request, the President announced last week that the millionaire oilman would be the next United States Ambassador to the United Nations, replacing Charles W. Yost. consider myself a very lucky guy, said Mr. Bush, a transplanted New Englander with no previous diplomatic experience. It's great and awesome responsibility.

There are, among others, studies of Hawthorne, Whitman, Horatio Alger, Laf cadio Ream (the one writer he does arouse enthusiasm for), Henry James, naturalists such as Dreiser, Robert Frost, and an interesting personal memoir of Eugene O'Neill.

title: Pope Deplores HolidayWaste

title: Airline Clerks End

title: Brown Takes. A.A.U. Run Of 20Kilometers in Bronx
description: Barry Brown of the New York Athletic Club won the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union's 20kilometer senior championship run yesterday over the Harlem River course in the Bronx.

title: Drive to Liberate Jews In Soviet Urged by Kahane
description: NEWTON, Mass., Dec. 13 Rabbi Meir Kahane, the head of the militant Jewish Defense League, today called on Ameri can Jews to begin a campaign to liberate Jews In the Soviet Union.

title: GOVERNORPUSHES

title: DIZZY DEAN TAKES SHOW JUMPER TITLE
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I., Dec 13George Holzman of Hamp, ton Bays, L. I., rode his big, aged gray gelding, Dizzy. Dean, to the intermediate jumper championship today at the Mid, dle Island Horse Show.

title: 35 on Trial in the Hague
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 13 (Reut ers)Thirtyfive Ambonese sep aratists go on trial tomorrow in connection with the storming and seizure. of the Indonesian Ambassador's residence Aug. 31. A Dutch policeman was killed. Two are charged with organizing the raid, the rest With carrying it out.

title: Mitchell Conducts National Symphony At the Philharmonic
description: The Washington National Symphony welcomed four guests at its Philharmonic Hall concert yesterday afternoon, most notably the conductor Howard Mitchell, the orches tra's music director for 21 years (194869). The soloists for the allAmerican program (if one includes Ernest Bloch

title: Terrorist Killings Suspected
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The police said that the kidnappers of Mr. Bucher were suspected of killing an ArabBrazilian mriionaire and an engineer last week.

title: VOTE ON A SCHOOL
description: RYE, Dec. 13Residents of School District 5, which covers most of the unincorporated area in the Town of Rye, will vote Wednesday on a school proposal that has created a surprisingly spirited fight.

title: JOHN R. PUCKETT
description: DALLAS, Dec. 13 (AP)John Robert Puckett, 46 years old. assistant managing editor of the Dallas Morning News, was killed today when. he lost con trol of his automobile and struck a light standard. Mr. Puckett joined The News in 1951 as a copy reader. He be. came news editor in 1961 and assistant managing editor in 1968.

title: Soviet Debates Whether to Expose Sins of Polluters
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13A lively debate, much of it behind the scenes, has arisen over whether Soviet media should be free to expose cases of environmental Pollution.

title: Khrushchev Memoirs : Some Distorted but Important Pictures
description: Khrushchev Remembers poses three major questions: Is it Nikita S. Khrushchev himself speaking, does he speak the troth and does he enlighten us himself? about his country, Stalin and himeself?

title: RALLY IN 2D HALF
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 13  The Baltimore Colts beat the Buffalo Bills, 20,14, today in the snow to win the Eastern Division championship of the American Conference and qualify fol. the National Football League's post season playoffs.

title: Chrysler Pay Offer Sought
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13 (UPI) The United Automobile Work ers plans to ask the Chrysler Corporation tomorrow to put firm, threeyear wage offer on the table for the union's 120,000 members at the com pany. Douglas Fraser, director of the union's Chrysler Depart ment, said he would insist that Chrysler make its offer retro active to Nov. 21, the same retroactive date the union won from the Ford Motor Company.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: House Unit Scores F.D.A. as Too Lax On False Drug Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI) A Congressional subcommit tee reported today that doctors were still confronted With false and misleading drug advertise ments and said that the Food and Drug Administration had fallen behind in acting against such advertisements

title: Democrats Assert Nixon Hurt G.O.P. Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP) The Democratic Study Group said today that President Nixon's involvement in the November elections, hurt, rath er than helped. Republican can didates for the House.

title: Sanitation Union Rejects City Stand on Contract
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, said yesterday that his union would reject contract proposals enunciated on Satur day by City Hall.

title: POLAND RESHAPES PRICE STRUCTURE
description: WARSAW, Dec. 13  The Polish Government started major effort today to bolster an ailing economy and to re direct the nation's buying and production patterns.

title: Bank Offers Unlimited Amount Of U.S. and British Gold Coins
description: The Republic National Bank is offering, in unlimited quan tities, $20 United States gold pieces and gold English sover eigns. Most of them were ob tained from European sources, apnarentiv from Geneva.

description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 13  De mend for steel moved up strong ly last week

title: 2 GROUPS PONDER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 Two new economic studies have independently reached the gloomy conclusion that the tradeoff between unemploy ment and inflation in United States Is a good deal worse than , had previously been thought.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Khrushchev 'Memoir'
description: The reminiscences attributed by Life magazine. Nikita S. Khrushchev ended today with a plea to the present leadership to open the frontiers of the Soviet Union and give people a chance to find outfor them selves what the world is like.

title: Bus Kills 3 on Horseback
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 13 (UPI)Three young women were killed yesterday when the backfiring of an automobile caused the horses they were

title: Nagle Takes Charity Golf
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 13 (AP)  Kel. Nagle of Australia swept to victory in the $16,800 Otago charity golf tournament at St. Kilda today with a courserecord 63. Nagle had a fourround total of 272.

title: GROUP AT PRINCETON BACKS U.S. RESEARCH
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 13 A studentfacult committee that investigated sponsored re search at Princeton University, noting that 40 per cent. of the university's 196970 budget came from the Federal Govern ment, has concluded that ex isting controls over the Federal research are sufficient.

title: Grotowski, 88 Pounds Lighter, Explains His Method
description: The meeting, the first, of three sessions (the last is to night at 8:30 in New York Uniyeisity's School of the Arts;',e which, sponsored the director's visit) became  a Gr Rivski talkathon, lasting unt3liafter. 4 o'clock Sunday morning. The second took place last night.

title: Consultant on Consumerism Is Busy
description: Ralph Nader, the con sinner champion, has been moving ahead like a steam roller in many directions, and he has indirectly created a new industry that might be described as dedicated to outNadering Nader_

title: NEW PLAYERS ALTER
description: Canned Heat, the Los An geles bluesrock group, Seem: to have survived reasonably well the loss of two origina. members: Al Wilson, guitarist who died in September, anc Larry Taylor, bass, who left tc join John Mayall's band.

title: CHASE SANK RAISES 4 TO SENIOR TASKS
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced over the weekend the promotion of four inter national banking officers to the rank of senior vice president and the reorganization of the international department along functional lines.

title: NICK LONDES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 13 (UPI) Nick Londes, a sports promoter for 40 years, died today in Ford Hospital. He, was 65'years old.
