description: GreekAmericans Suffer 2d Setback in a Row, 20

title: Sign of Prestige at. White House: Size of Chandelier
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.13. hi the statusconscious White House office spade is often the best index of. prestige

title: Dolphins Subdue Jets, 1610 on Pair of Field Goals in Final Two Minutes
description: MIAMI, Dec. 13In the last two minutes, field goals of 13 and 21 yards by Garo Yepremi an and an interception at the New York Jets 36yard line by Dick Anderson proyided the Mi ami Dolphins today with the most important victory in their fiveyear history.

title: U.S. Survey of Plant Outlays To Assess TightMoney Impact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP),  The Federal Government plans a confidential survey of more than 8,000 selected com panies next year to measure the tight money impact on busi ness investment in new plants and equipment.

title: Giants Conquer Cardinals, 3417, and Tie for Lead
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 13A good offense, they say, is the best defense, and that's what the New York Giants used today to, clirhb into a tie for first place bytbeating the. St. Lpuis Cardi nals,3417.

title: Man Is Unhurt in Leap From Bridge
description: A 20yearold man tried to commit suicide by leaping from the Williamsburg Bridge into the East River, 150 feet below yesterday, but was rescued from ,the water Unin juted. Policemen had tried unsuccessfully for a halfhour to talk him out of the suicide attempt.

title: RAT HUNT GROWS
description: Test Began in September Cost Put at $5Million

title: Mr. Nixon's Insensitive Reply
description: President Nixon has misread the report of his Com mission on Campus Unrest, just as he persists in mis understanding the mood of nonviolent but concerned young Americans. His reply to former Governor Scranton, the commission's chairman, is defensive and insensitive.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Ships

title: SovietHungarian Pact
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13, (Reuters Nikolai Patolichev, the Foreign Trade Minister will go to Budapest tomorrow to sign a new SovietHungarian five year trade agreement for 1971 through 1975, the Soviet press, agency Tass reported today.

title: Englewood Fire Victims to Get Housing
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 13 A plan to provide temporary housing by Christmas for the families left homeless by the ,series of fires that have flared throughout the city's Fourth Ward in recent weeks was an nounced today by Mayor Ned Feldman.

title: U.S. Is Leaving Door Open For Slower Troop Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (Reu ters)The Defense Department today left open the door for slowdownor even a complete stopin troop withdrawals from South Vietnam in the next two months in face of an enemy buildup of men and supplies before Tet, the Lunar New Year.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. I4 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Conferees Approve  Industry Safety Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 House and Senate conferees agreed tonight on an occu pational health and safety bill giving the Secretary of Labor authority to set safety standards for plants, farms and construction sites and creating a three member panel to enforce the stan dards.

title: Papp Cuts Bid to City for Theater Fund
description: Joseph Papp is now will ing to sell the Public Theater landmark .building at 425 Lafayette Street, home of the New York Shakespeare Festi val, to the city for $2.6mil lion, or almost half of the original asking price.

title: 2d Big Board Firm, Through a Merger, Plans to Go Public
description: Pressman, Frohlich & Frost, Inc., a brokerage house that belorgs to the New York and American Stock Exchanges, announced a merger agree ment yesterday under which it would become the second publicly owned member of the Big Board.

title: Venus Landing Today By Soviet Is Predicted
description: LONDON, Dec. 14 (AP) Space researchers in Moscow say the Soviet Union will land an instrument capsule on Venus tomorrow from the Venus 7 spacecraft, the Brit ish Interplanetary Society re ported today,

title: Hartack Rides 4,000th Winner, Scoring With Roart in Tropical Park Sprint
description: MIAMI, Dec. 14 (AP)  Bill Hartack, a fivetime winner of the Kentucky Derby, reached another milestone today when he rode his 4,000th winner, rallying from last place aboard Roart to win the seventh race at Tropical Park.

title: A Magazine Service Agrees To Give Refunds to 15,000
description: LANSING, Mich. Dec. 14 (UPI)  One of the nation's largest magazine subscription services, a subsidiary of Time Inc., has agreed to refund as much as $2million in subscrip tion fees in an agreement an nounced today by the Michigan Attorney General, Frank J. Kel ley.

title: Boston Gets New Bus Route
description: BOSTON, Dec. 14 (AP)The Massachusetts Bay Transporta tion Authority announced today a new bus service linking the North Shore with Logan Inter national Airport and downtown Boston. The service will begin Dec. 28.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ADVANCES IN WEEK
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday totaled 2,424,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute re ported yesterday.

title: Nursing Home Is Cleared In 25 Salmonella Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  The chairman of a Senate subcommittee investigating 25 salmonella deaths in a Balti more nursing home in July said today that he had seen no evi dence of any wrongdoing by the nursing home in connection with the outbreak of the dis ease.

title: A. EDITH KINGSLAND
description: ROSELLE PARK, N. J., Dec. 14A. Edith Kingsland of 21 East Webster Avenue, this borough's first librarian, died yesterday at the Elizabeth Gen eral Hospital, Elizabeth, after a brief illness. She was 86 years old.

title: Financier and 3 Aides Guilty Of Plotting to Defraud S.E.C.
description: A financier and three busi ness associates were convicted yesterday of a conspiracy to defraud the Securities and Ex change Commission by filing false statements concerning the acquisition of a $50million conglomerate corporation.

title: Pennsy Director Resigns
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14 (UPI)John M. Seabrook, chair man and president of the Inter national Utilities Corporation, has resigned as a director of the Penn Central Company, it was announced today. Mr. Sea brook's resignation brings to five the number of members now on the Penn Central board. The board is now headed by Dr. Gaylor P. Harnwell, former president of the University of Pennsylvania.

title: City Council of Pittsburgh Elects Negro as President
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 14City Councilman Louis Mason Jr. became today the first black man elected president of Pitts burgh's City Council.

title: SWIMMING POOL BAN IS TERMED SLAVERY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 The Supreme Court was asked today to rule that the city of Jackson, Miss., violated the antislavery prohibition of the 13th Amendment when it closed its five swimming pools to prevent integrated bathing.

title: Egypt Is Pressing Desert Reclamation
description: KHARGA OASIS, United Arab Republic, Dec. 14Vist reserves of fresh water that have accumulated for thou ands of years under the West ern Desert of Egypt, one of the world's most arid regions, have tantalized Cairo's econo mic planners with a vision of broad expanses of rich new farmland to help employ and feed the country's relentlessly increasing population.

title: BIG BOARD PAUSES AS DOW SLIPS 274
description: The stock market, which has feasted on higher prices since the third week of November, paused yesterday to digest some of its gains.

title: MERLIN H. BECHER
description: HOPEWELL, N. J., Dec. 14 Merlin H. Becher, business man ager of the Pennington School, died today in Princeton Hospi tal. He was 59 years old.

title: ADDICTS GET A HOME IN 'VILLAGE' MANSION
description: A preGivil War mansion in Greenwich Village that has been designated a historic landmark began receiving yesterday some of its latest occupantsyoung people seeking rehabilitation from narcotic addiction.

title: Ohio Paper Strike Ended
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 14 (UPI)Truck drivers for the Columbus Dispatch Printing Company accepted a contract offer tonight ending the city's 11dayold daily newspapers strike. The walkout by Team sters local 413 halted publica tion of the afternoon Dispatch and the morning CitizenJour nal, the only major newspapers serving this city of half a mil lion.

title: EWBANK MAY TRADE NO. 1 DRAFT CHOICE
description: Weeb Ewbank indicated yes terday that the Jets firstround draft choice might be auctioned.

title: Vandalism Delays Pupils
description: Pearl River, N. Y., Dec. 14 More than 1,000 Pearl River public school pupils were de layed more than an hour this morning because of damage to all 14 school district buses. The buses could not be started be cause the ignition wires had been broken.

title: City Says 7Million In Antipoverty Aid Is Not in Records
description: The City Controller's office said yesterday that $7,796,214 in antipoverty funds had not yet been accounted for by local antipoverty agencies.

title: 10 Clubs Still Contending For Five Playoff Berths
description: Three teams, Minnesota, Oakland and Baltimore, have qualified for the pro football playoffs while 10 others re main in contention for the additional five positions.

title: U.S. Acepts Responsibility On Civilians in Saigon Jails
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  The United States has told the International Committee of the Red Cross that the American Government has a residual responsibility for South Viet namese civilian detainees whom it turns over to the Government of South Vietnam.

title: Truman Gives Muskie Two Pieces of Advice
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Dec. 14 (UPI)Harry S. Truman told Senator Edmund S. Mus kie today to tell the truth and be yourself, Mr. Muskie said after a 40minute visit with the 86yearold former President.

title: Racing Canceled by Ice
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Dec. 14 (AP) The thoroughbred racing pro gram at Lincoln Downs was canceled after the second race today because of icy conditions.

title: ROYALTY IN INDIA REVIVED BY COURT
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, Dec. 15  The Indian Supreme Court revived the institution of royalty for impoverished India today, ruling that Prime Minis ter Indira Gandhi's abolition of princely ranks and privileges was unconstitutional.

title: Executive Changes
description: L. E. Donegan Jr. has been elected vice presi dent, RCA Information Systems, effective Jan. He has served as division vice president and gen eral manager of the RCA Computer Systems Divi sion since last January and will succeed James R. Bradburn who is resigning from the company.

title: Baruch Zuckerman Dead at 83; Leader in Labor Zionist. Affairs
description: Baruch Zuckerman, a leading Labor Zionist for most of this century, died on Sunday in Jerusalem, the National Com mittee for Labor Israel reported yesterday.

title: WESTBURY TO SET WAGERING RECORD
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 14  Some harness racing buffs wore a worried look as they spun the turnstiles at Roosevelt Raceway tonight. They were fretting over where to go for action after tomorrow night's final card of the year.

title: AGNEW MEETS HERE WITH BUSINESSMEN
description: Vice President Agnew had long private luncheon meeting here yesterday with the top ex ecutives of 15 major corpora tions and banks in the home of William F. Buckley Jr., editor in chief of the magazine Na tional Review.

title: G.M.'s Chairman Given Public Service Award
description: James M. Roche, chairman of the General Motors Cor poration, received last night the highest award for public service achievement from the Advertising Council.

title: Total Business Inventories Rise a Bit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Total business inventories rose by less than $100million in October, the smallest increase since inventories showed a de dine in May, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: WILLIAM F. SHAFFER
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Dec. 14 William F. Shaffer, business manager of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Work ers, Local 262 until he retired last year, died yesterday at his home. He was 70 years old and lived at 71 Leland Avenue.

title: State's Aid to Arts Feltat Many Levels
description: By the end of this month the New York State Arts Council will announce the last of its grants from the special $18million fund voted this year by the Legislature on Governor Rockefeller's recommendation for local as sistance to cultural organiza tions.

title: Ceylon and Thai Stars Shatter 2 Track Marks for Asian Games
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 14 (AP)  A barefooted distance runner from Ceylon and a Thai sprinter captured the hearts of the crowd at the Asian Games today as they outran the Japa nese in headtohead duels.

title: LISANTI PRESENTS PROGRAM OF SONGS
description: Mario Lisanti picked an agreeably unhackneyed pro gram for his second Carnegie Recital Hall appearance Friday night, including songs by Strauss and Respighi, and cy cles by Mahler and Britten.

title: Ousted Teacher Files Suit
description: BOSTON, Dec. 14 (UPI)A Lawrence High School teacher, Robert Mailloux, who was dis charged for writing an obscene word on a blackboard, filed a $50,000 suit in Federal court to day and asked for an injunction ordering school officials to re instate him. Mr. Mailloux, an English teacher, said he had written the word on the board while explaining the derivation of words to his 11th grade class. A hearing was set for Thursday.

title: Kaiser Gypsum to Shut Plant
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 14 (UPI)The Kaiser Gypsum Company said today it will close down a plant in Rosario, N. M., because Gypsum prices are extremely poor in the southwest. A spokesman said the plant, which employs 37 persons, will close down gradu ally and stay closed until busi ness picks up.

title: Israel Still Bars Dealing With WestBank Leaders
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 14 The Israeli Government remains op posed to any direct political dealings with Arab leaders of the occupied area on the west bank of the Jordan River, Israeli officials said today. They in sisted that the Palestinians po litical future must be worked out only between them and the Jordanian Government.

title: 2 POLICEMEN HELD IN EXTORTION CASE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 14Two vet eran Newark policemen and labor union official identified with the underworld were ar raigned before a United States Commissioner here today on charges of conspiracy and extortion against a man who turned out to be a Federal agent.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Noisy Melee Halts Contempt Hearing In Trial at Tacoma
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 14  The six male defendants in the conspiracy trial here received sixmonth sentences today for contempt of court as a result of actions in court last Thurs day.

title: Marinduque to Suspend Dividends and Split Stock
description: MANILA, Dec. 14 (UPI)Di rectors of the Marinduque Min ing and Industrial Corporation voted today to suspend payment of cash dividends and recom mended a 5for4 split of the common stock, to be distributed Feb. 26 to holders of record Jan. 29.

title: Aide Says Hughes Signed Vote Proxy
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 14 The dispute between Howard Hughes's executives produced today a man to testify under oath that he knew the billion aire very well, and that he had seen him face to face almost daily for the last 20 years.

title: Catholic and Protestant Group Sees Rise in Sharing Communion
description: A group of Roman Catholic and Protestant theologians has issued a 15point statement of consensus on the meaning of holy Communion Indicating Oat they no longer regard tra ditionally divisive issues such as transubstantiation as ecu menical obstacles.

title: Federal Lawyers for the Poor
description: WASHINGTONIn 1965, we em barked on a bold experiment to trans form the minimum private provision of legal aid into a major public deliv ery of legal assistance to the poor. Since then, the O.E.O.'s Legal Services program has grown to $60 million employing 2,000 attorneys in every state except North Dakota. It includes six centers supplying specialized as sistance in consumer, housing, educa tion, juvenile, health and welfare law. Over one million cases are handled a year. The cost to the American tax payer is $58 per case..

title: Soviet's Swift New MIG23 Fighter Is Regarded as a Problem for NATO
description: HEIDELBERG, West Ger many, Dec. 10The supersonic strike version of the MIG23 fighter is now being used by the Soviet Air Force in central Europe, according to qualified military sources.

title: MRS. ANDREW SHILAND
description: Mrs. Andrew Shiland of this city and Watch Hill, R. I., died Sunday at her home, 1 East 66th Street, after a long illness. She was 78 years old.

title: City Mediator Voices Concern In Talks on Uniformed Workers
description: The chairman of the city's Of fice of Collective Bargaining said yesterday we are getting more and more concerned about finding a solution in the mu nicipality negotations with its three major uniformed forces.

title: WILLIAM FERRALL, STATE SENATOR, 65
description: State Senator William J. Fer rall of 423 Ninth Street, Brook lyn, died Sunday in the Veter ans Administration Hospital, Manhattan, after a short illness. His age was 65.

title: City Bank Adds Coast Unit
description: The First National City Bank opened yesterday its new FNCB (International  Los Angeles) subsidiary, which is situated at 640 West Sixth Street, the bank's second in California.

title: Group Asks TV Time to Refute 3 Toy Commercials
description: Action for Children's Televi sion, a Massachusettsbased citizens group, has requested the Federal Communications Commission to mandate free air time under its Fairness Doctrine to permit the group to respond to what it considers misleading advertising claims being made by the manufactur ers of three children's toys.

title: New Man at the Treasury
description: President Nixon has decided to replace Secretary of the Treasury David M. Kennedy with John B. Connally, former Governor of Texas. At a time when the nation is buffeted by the crosswinds of inflation and unemploy mentand when the Administration has just begun to demonstrate a willingness to try new approaches to solving these critical problemsthe Connally appoint ment is a grave disappointment.

title: 6 G.I.'s Near the DMZ Killed in Old Minefield
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Dec. 15 (AP)A United States infan try patrol was virtually wiped out when it inadvertently en tered an old American mine field last Saturday night a mile south of the demilitarized zone, the United States com mand said today.

title: 2 L. I. Children Die in Fire
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I. Dec. 14 (UPI)Two young children died in a fire in Amity Harbor today when their mother left them alone for a short time to make a telephone call from the home of a neighbor. Dead of suffoca tion in the fire at 16 Hampdon Road were 4yearold Patrick Hughes and his 18monthold sister, Rita Mary. The mother, Mrs.. Barbara Hughes, was taken to Lakeside Hospital in Copiague suffering from shock.

title: ABERNATHY BACKS BOYCOTTING OF A. &
description: The Rev. Ralph David Aber nathy said yesterday that he was putting the full and com plete support of the Southern Christian Leadership Confer ence behind a proposed black refusal to patronize A. & P. food stores.

title: MOSCOW AFFIRMS MUSIC CONTRACTS
description: The Soviet Union's cultural ministry, which last week can celed the Bolshoi Opera's debut visit to this country, has in formed Columbia Artists Man agement that three other largegroup attractions would be coming as scheduled. The groups are the 100member Si berian Dancers and Singers of Omsk (12 performances at Car negie Hall beginning Jan. 28), the 80member Osipov Balalai ka Orchestra (January, Febru ary and March of 1972), and the 90member Don Cossacks Dance and Chorus company (fall of 1972).

title: 3 AGENCIES STUDY PARK ROW BLAST
description: A joint Investigation was be gun yesterday after witnesses reported that a man had been seen turning a gas valve last Friday shortly before a build ing on Park Row at Ann Street was devastated by an ex plosion and fire that caused at least nine deaths.

title: Fires on Trains to Connecticut Delay Thousands
description: Thousands of commuters were delayed getting home last night because of fires on three Connecticutbound Penn Cen tral trains. No one was injured.

title: New York Bell Bonds Priced At Lowest Yield in 18 Months
description: The New York Telephone Company's $200million tripleA bonds marketed yesterday, this week's most sig nificant corporate financing, were priced to yield 7.60 per cent, the lowest return on Bell System issue in a year end a half. The New York Bell bonds sold slowly as institu tional investors held back to see how the credit markets would act this week. Corpo rate and taxexempt bond prices declined yesterday, pushed down by the prospect of heavy schedules of new issues to be sold this week.

title: Ethiopian Food: Love It or Leave It
description: ADDIS ABABA, EthiopiaThere are, in general, two reactions to the native food of Ethiopia: It is consumed with considerable ardor or eschewed with comparable passion.

title: B. ALTMAN ASSURES CUSTOMERS ON SITE
description: About 250,000 charge cus tomers of B. Altman & Co., the department store chain, are re ceiving letters from the com pany's president assuring them that Alman's intends to stay at its Fifth Avenue site.

title: House Bars Action by Courts Against List of Campus Radicals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) The House formally prohib ited today the courts or anyone else from obstructing the print ing and public distribution of its revised report on 57 alleged campus radical orators.

title: Christmas Spirit Glows Without Gifts
description: As sableclad matrons cele brated the 10th shopping day before Christmas by scurry ing from Abercrombie's to Bendel's to Brooks Brothers to Cartier's to Dunhill to Gucci to Hanunacher Schlem mer to Jensen's to Lord & Taylor to Mark Cross to Saks and Tiffany's on the scent of the mythical per fect gift for those on their giltedged lists, Mrs. Seth M. Milliken Jr., whose friends are just as giltedged as any body's, took a few minutes away from her needlepoint in her Fifth Avenue apartment yesterday and offered her solution for the perennial question of what to buy the person who has everything. Nothing.

title: GOVERNOR TO SEEK AN AUDIT OF FUNDS OF 3 LARGE CITIES
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Dec. 14 In a move that could bring a direct confrontation with May or Lindsay, Governor Rookefel ler plans to propose legislation permitting the State Controller, Arthur Levitt, to audit the fi nances of New York City, Buf falo and Rochester. These are the only three municipalities now exempt from his audit.

title: UNION CARBIDE LIFTS PRICE OF ANTIFREEZE
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion announced yesterday that it would raise prices for pack aged custombrand antifreeze by 5 cents a gallon, beginning Jan. 2. Shipments covered by current contracts will not be affected, the company added.

title: Russel Triumphs in Special Slalom Despite Spraining Elbow on Second Run
description: SESTRIERE, Italy, Dec. 14 (AP)  Patrick Russel, despite suffering an elbow sprain, won the special slalom race today, giving France its fourth victory in three days of ski competi tion.

title: NASSAU APPROVES BUDGET FOR 1971
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 14 The Nassau County Board of Supervisors adopted a budget for next year that will result in a tax increase of about $105 for the average homeowner.

title: Pamela Heller Married Here
description: Miss Pamela Jane Heller, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Na than C. Heller of New York, was married last night to Charles S. Rubinger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Ru binger, also of New York. The Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Peril man of Temple EmanuEl performed the ceremony at the St. RegisSheraton.

title: U.S. Steel Charges Government Demanded Racial Job Quotas
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 14The chairman of the United States Steel Corporation accused the Justice Department today of demanding last week that the company allocate 50 per cent of all office and clerical jobs at its plant in Fairfield, Ala., to blacks hired during the next five years.

title: Capital Spending in Quarter Is Up by About 1% in Britain
description: LONDON, Dec. 14 (UPI)  Capital spending by the British manufacturing industry rose by about 1 per cent In the third quarter of 1970 compared with the previous three months, Gov ernment officials said today.

title: Scranton on Rebuff by Nixon: Pleased That He Read Report
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 14William W. Scranton reacted today to President Nixon's rebuff of the conclusions of his Commission on Campus Unrest.

title: U.S. Says It Would Join A Mideast Peace Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The United States has advised Is rael and Jordan that it would be willing to participate in a United Nationssponsored peacekeeping force in the Mid dle East, authoritative sources said today.

title: President Signs Park Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) President Nixon signed a bill today to provide $5.9million more in authorized funds for acquisition of land for Minute man National Historical Park, Massachusetts, commemorating the start of the American Revo lution and the first shots fired by the Minutemen.

title: World Red Cross Groups Plan Aid for DisasterProne Areas
description: GENEVA, Dec. 14  The League of Red Cross Societies is drafting a plan for immedi ate use in the event that a tragedy comparable to the East Pakistan cyclone should hit other disasterprone coun tries.

title: MRS. RALPH WADSWORTH
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Dec. 14Mrs. Harriet van Zelm Wadsworth, wife of Ralph K. Wadsworth, retired president of Wadsworth & Walker, Miami and New York advertising, died here Friday. She was 72 years old.

title: NEW RABIES VACCINE IS HAILED AT PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  A Philadelphia scientist re ported today that a new rabies vaccine had shown dramatic success in laboratory animals, perhaps opening the door for protection of humans before and after exposure to the dead ly virus.

title: VIOLETTE JACKSON
description: DETROIT, Dec. 14Violette Jackson, formerly an oboist with the Little Orchestra So ciety of New York, died today of a cerebral hemorrhage. She was 33 years old and lived at 510 Wilcox Street in suburban Rochester.

title: U. N. Defeats Bid to Back Soviet Policy
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 14An attempt by the So viet Union to obtain formal United Nations endorsement of some of its foreignpolicy con cepts was quietly buried here today.

title: Plenary Session Asked at White, House Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The White House Conference on Children got down to work today with growing demands for a plenary session for all 4,000 delegates that could speak with one powerful voice to President Nixon and the public,

title: BISHOPS ISSUE GUIDE ON MIXED MARRIAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  The National Conference of Catholic Bishops issued today guidelines aimed at easing the burdens of marriages between Roman Catholics and non Catholics.

title: Murtagh Finds Panther Lawyer Guilty of Contempt
description: Justice John M. Murtagh halted the State Supreme Court trial of 13 Black Panthers yes terday and held one of their lawyers in contempt.

title: Monzon, Backus and Ohba Rated CoBoxers of Month
description: SYLVANIA, Ohio, Dec. 14 (UPI)  Masao Ohba of Japan, Carlos Monzon of Argentina and Billy Backus of Syracuse, who won world titles, were named today as, coboxers of the month in the World Boxing Association ratings.

title: Holiday Mail Service
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) Only special delivery service will be universally provided by the United States Postal Serv ice on Christmas and New Year's Day, officials an nounced today. Some city post offices may keep their lobbies open for mail deposits and pur chase of stamps from selfserv ice machines, but regular win dow service and delivery and collection service will not be provided.

title: ALFRED B. LITTELL, JERSEY LEGISLATOR
description: FRANKLIN, N. J., Dec. 14 (AP)Alfred B. Littell, a former State Senate President, died Saturday in Guadalajara, Mexi co, where he was on vaca tion with his wife, Dorothy. He was 77 years old.

title: 5 Recall Impression Medina Wanted Everyone at Mylai Killed
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Dec. 14 Five defense witnesses at the murder trial of First Lieut. Wil liam L. Calley Jr. said today that when they stormed the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai they were under the clear impression that their company commander, Capt. Ernest L. Me dina, wanted everyone killed, including women and babies.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P. O. Box 557, New York, N. Y. 10036, or to any of the following eight organi zations that certify these cases:

title: News Summary and index
description: International

title: AN IS SOLICITING HEAD SKI TENDERS
description: AMF, Inc., announced yester day it was soliciting tenders for all the outstanding shares of common stock of the Head Ski Company at a price of $13.50 a share.

title: CAVALIERS WORK ON STREAK AGAIN
description: The Cleveland Cavaliers, who have already suffered through losing streaks of 15 and 12 games in their first National Basketball Association season, will bring a modest one of four games into Madison Square Garden tonight against the Knicks.

title: Son Sought in Slaying of Family, Surrenders to Arkansas Police
description: FORT SMITH, Ark., Dec. 14 A 17yearold New Canaan, Conn., youth sought since Thursday in the murder of four members of his family walked into police headquar ters here this morning and told the officer on duty he had no idea how he had come to be in Arkansas.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Coast Drugstore Bombed
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 14 (UPI)  A bomb exploded in a drug store in suburban Lake City today, causing Minor damage. There were no injuries.

title: SPAIN GIVES POLICE DETENTION POWER
description: MADRID, Dec. I4The Gov ernment of Generalissimo Fran cisco Franco, under strong political pressure as a result of the trial of 15 Basque national ists, gave the police special powers tonight to hold people for up to six months without a hearing.

title: Defense Lawyers for Basques Weep For Clients and Share Their Danger
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 10 I don't believe I have wept since I was a boy. Maybe once, when MY wife came to see me in Almeria.

title: Key to Growth: Technician School
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 1Algerian officials say the nation's main handicap in its drive for industrial development is a shortage of engineers, tech nicians and skilled super visors.

title: Americans in Pall Peel Machine Improves. Lives but at a Cost
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 14  A pilot study suggests that Americans tend to feel that machines have made their lives easier, but that people have become too dependent on them.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: BANKERS SURPRISED BY CONNALLY CHOICE
description: Banking leaders were non plussed yesterday by President Nixon's choice of former Gov. John B. Connally. Jr. of Texas to be secretary, of the Treasury.

title: Viscount Slim of. Burma Campaign Dead
description: LONDON, Dec. 14  Field Marshal Viscount Slim, who led the campaign that liberated Burma in World War II, died in a hospital here today. He was 79 years old.

title: ANGELS IN PIGTAILS SING SWEETLY HERE
description: Dylan Thomas once called the Obernkirchen Children's Choir Angels in Pigtails, and although there are not so many pigtails in the 1970 edition of the choir, the singing is still angelic.

title: Ozawa in Coast Hospital
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 14 (AP)Seiji Ozawa, the San Francisco Symphony's new con ductor, entered a hospital yes terday with nerve root irritation in his neck caused by a partly displaced spinal disk. Mr. Ozawa will miss three sched uled concerts this week. He is expected to return to the podi um Jan. 6 after rest and therapy.

title: Pompidou Warns Industrial Countries Against Trade Barriers
description: PARIS, Dec. 14 (Reuters) President Pompidou warned the world's rich nations today against the renewed temptation of trade protectionism, which he said would lead to economic slowdown.

title: 5 Reporters Injured in Collapse Of Gangway on Container Ship
description: A newspaperman was seri ously injured and four other persons suffered minor injuries yesterday when the gangway between a new container ship and a tugboat became discon nected, throwing two persons into the water and pitching the others on to the deck of the tug

title: Lawyer Joins N.L.R.B.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) Ralph E. Kennedy, a lawyer with the National Labor Rela tions Board, was sworn in to day as a board member. Mr. Kennedy, 51 years old, has been Regional Director in Los Angeles for the past 15 years.

title: Jersey Assembly Votes $50Million Newark Tax Aid
description: TRENTON, Dec. 14A $50 million aid package for Newark that includes state authoriza tion for the city to impose a 1 per cent hales tax and a 1 per cent fax on business payrolls was approved by the State As sembly tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carty's Operation Is Called Success
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 14 (AP) Rico Carty, the National League batting king, under went 90 minutes of surgery on his fractured left knee to day, and doctors said the in dications were that the oper ation had been successful.

title: Rustin Asks for End to Black Rage and White Fear
description: Bayard Rustin, the civil rights organizer, declared last night that the American people must get rid of black rage and white fear simultaneously, or we will not get rid of either.

title: Plea to Lift Florida Blackout Of Super Bowl Garne Loses
description: MIAMI, Dec. 14 (AP)  A suit charging the blackout of the Super Bowl football game to south Florida violates the Sherman Antitrust Act and the constitutional rights of 2.5 mil lion people was thrown out of Federal Court today.

title: Cab Pickets At 2 Hotels Stop Riders
description: Striking taxi drivers put picket lines in front of two large midtown hotels yester day to stop gypsy cabs from picking up passengers.

title: Syria Warns Against Any Plans To Liquidate Arab Guerrillas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 14 Syria warned today that she would not remain idle in face of what a Government spokes man in Damascus described as plans to liquidate the Pales tinian commando movement in neighboring Jordan.

title: ZBISLAW M. ROEHR
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 14Zbislaw M. Roehr, president of the Roehr Products Company of Waterbury, Conn., and DeLand, Fla., died today after a brief illness. He was 68 years old and lived in this com munity.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Nrixon Showing New Desire for Conciliation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 The growing impression here that President Nixon has de termined, for his own good, to put the campaign of 1970 be hind him and face his greater test in 1972 with fresh faces and a new tone of bipartisan conciliation has found further confirmation by his sudden

title: STOCKS IN LONDON MOVE UP SHARPLY
description: The London stock market moved sharply higher yester day after an erratic perform ance at midday. Prices had dropped with the announce ment of Britain's large trade deficit in November, but trad ing rallied with the news of the end of the electrical work ers dispute.

title: Bridge
description: Most bridge experts achieve their best performances in their 30's and 40's. After the age of 50 stamina and power of concentration begin to de cline somewhat. Technical knowledge and judgment may be unimpaired, but neverthe less few players capture na tional titles after the age of 60.

title: GIANT HOPES HIGH TO CLINCH CROWN
description: One more time.

title: Poverty Agency Drops Legal Service Reorganization
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The Office of Economic Opportu nity, under sustained criticism, announced today that it was abandoning for the second time its plans to give non lawyers control over its pro gram of legal services for the poor.

title: ANGELOS MELLIDES
description: Angelos Mellides, a vice pres ident of the Retail Master Furriers Guild of New York, died Sunday in Booth Memorial Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 13642 58th Ave nue, Flushing, Queens.

title: Seale Asks to See Psychiatrist About His Treatment in Prison
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 14 The lawyer for Bobby G. Seale told a Federal judge here today that the Black Panther national chairman wanted to see this psychiatrist and that the need was urgent.

title: No Place for Collision
description: The city and the unions representing its uniformed services have just two weeks in which to head off a New Year's Eve strike collision. Most of the progress thus far has been in reverse. Every effort by municipal officials to convince the police, fire and sanitation unions of the gravity of New York's financial crisis has merely heated up the bargaining atmosphere.

title: Terrell Gets New Foe
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 14 (AP) Sonny Moore will replace Tony Doyle as Ernie Terrell's opponent in a scheduled 10 round heavyweight bout here tomorrow night. Doyle hurt his hand in a workout. Terrell, former World Boxing Associa tion champion, is making comeback.

title: U.S. TO CHALLENGE R. J. REYNOLDS BID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (UPI)The Government an nounced today plans to chal lenge the proposed $65million merger of the two largest con tainership operators in the North Atlantic.

title: Labor Department Seizes Votes Cast In Miners' Election
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) The Labor Department an nounced today that it had seized ballots in a United Mine Workers district election. A slate of Miners for Democracy candidates is opposing officers who support the union presi dent, W. A. Boyle.

title: FISCHER IS SELECTED TOP PLAYER OF 1970
description: PALMA, Majorca, Dec. 14 Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles, the winner of the Palma knock out tournament that ended here yesterday, was voted the world's outstanding chess play er of 1970 today by 70 jour nalists. Fischer, who led the six qualifiers for the competi tion that will determine the challenger for the world title, finished with a score of 18 4, with 15 victories, four draws and only one loss.

title: December Song
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14What is so rare as a day in December? as the poets have, for centuries now, shrunk from asking. In December with the dying of the year, what the heart knows seems more urgent than in November before the football season's waning. In December the heart knows the ashes of defeat that linger on the taste buds of the mind when man's favorite team has a record of four wins, eight defeats, one tie, and two dreary more games to go.

title: Advertising: Cigar Sales Win Ogilvy Prize
description: The surprise ending to yes terday's 22d annual staff meeting of Ogilvy & Mather was the announcement of the creation of the annual David Ogilvy Prize$10,000 for the campaign that created the most sales for a client.

title: Science Group Elects Seaborg as President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg, chairman of the Atomic En ergy Commission, has been named presidentelect of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, thus surviving questions about his candidacy.

title: Senate Bars Pay Increase Of $2,300 a Year for Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) Members of the Senate, who gave themselves a $12,500 raise two years ago, decided today that it would be too inflationary to give their top assistants $2,300 a year more.

title: Children Fly Here To Rejoin Parents Wanted in Germany
description: Five children of a couple who vanished from West Germany last week while facing impris onment on charges of torturing their maid arrived at Kennedy Airport from Frankfurt yester day for a secret reunion with their parents.

title: PLANNERS SCORED ON SCHOOL BUDGET
description: The president of the Board of Education charged the City Planning Commission yesterday with cynically cutting back funds for new school building projects.

title: Ramsey of Eagles Shot by Gunman
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14 (AP)  Nate Ramsey, 29year old captain and defensive back for the Philadelphia Eagles, was shot today as he stood on a street corner in West Philadel phia.

title: MGM EARNINGS MAKE RECOVERY
description: MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc. has made a substantial recov ery in the fiscal year ended Aug. 31, following a major re organization and implementa tion of substantial economies initiated by James T. Aubrey Jr., who took over the presi dency on Oct. 21, 1969.

title: Impartial Pollution Units Vital, Ruckelshaus Writes Governors
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The head of the new Environmental Protection Agency, William D. Ruckeishaus, has told the 50 Governors that he considers it imperative for their state pol lution control boards to be un biased.

title: Manuel Ramos to Box Briton
description: WOLVERHAMPTON, England, Dec: 14 (UPI)Jack Bodell, the former British champion, will meet Manuel Ramos, the heavy weight champion of Mexico, in a 10round bout here Jan. 6, officials said today. This will be Ramos's second visit to Britain. In March he was out pointed in eight rounds by Joe Bugner.

title: Treasury Statement
description: Treasury Statement

title: ROLAND TREE
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Dec. 14 Roland Tree, a dealer in old books, died today in New Rochelle Hospital after a brief illness. He was 73 years old and lived on Albee Court here.

title: Tests on Minuteman 3 End
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 14 (UPI)The Air Force com pleted testing of its new multi warhead Minuteman 3 missile here today by firing one from an underground silo to a South Atlantic target area 5,000 miles away.

title: Film: Seeking the American Heritage
description: Little Big Man, the film adaptation of Thomas Ber ger's epic comic novel, is Arthur Penn's most extrava gant and ambitious movie, an attempt to capture The es sence of the American heri tage in the funny, bitter, uproarious adventures of Jack Crabb, an irritable, 120odd yearold gentleman who may or may not have been the sole survivor of Custer's Last Stand.

title: NEW COPTER UNIT IS FORMED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 14 (AP)  Highly placed sources here reported today that the United States had formed a provisional air caval ry brigade with more than 200 helicopters to patrol 10,000 square miles around Saigon.

title: Guard at Soledad Stabbed
description: SOLEDAD, Calif., Dec. 14 (UPI)  Another guard was stabbed today at racially tense Soledad Prisn where two guards and five inmates were killed earlier this year. Prison officials said that he was not wounded seriously. The guard was William Monaghan, 41 years old.

title: Lions Beat Rams, 2823, and Keep Chance Alive for 2dPlace Playoff Spot
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14The wellbalanced Detroit Lions, led by Greg Landry, a young quar terback, whipped the Los Ang eles Rains, 2823 tonight and kept alive their hopes of a Na tional Football League title,.

title: SMITH VANQUISHES ROSEWALL, 64, 65
description: TOKYO, Dec. 14 (Reuters) Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., celebrated his 24th birthday to night with a 64, 65 victory over Ken Rosewall of Australia that gave him the undisputed. lead in the $50,000 Interna tional Lawn Tennis Federation Masters roundrobin tourna ment.

title: Fuel. Oil Suppliers and Unions Meeting, to Avert Strike Tonight
description: Negotiations were under way last night to avert a strike at midnight tonight by the city's fuel oil deliverers and oil burn er repairmen.

title: G.O.P. Leaders Indicate Pessimism on 1972 Races
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Dec. 14 Most of the 28 Republican Governors and Governorselect, meeting today at this snow clad resort in the Sawtooth Mountainsincluding six in cumbents who were denied re electionare full of political complaints, recriminations and prescriptions for reform.

title: Charles Rice Crosby, 64, Financial Executive, Dead
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., Dec. 14 Charles Rice Crosby, a New York financial executive, died yesterday of injuries received in an automobile accident on Interstate 91 between here and Springfield. He was 64 years old.

title: Pollution in Russia, Too
description: Since the Soviet Union is geographically the world's largest country, the Supreme Soviet's adoption of a com prehensive water conservation and protection code is of international interest.

title: Market Place
description: Let's say you're a con servative small investor. You're exceptional in that you aren't buying new issues with the idea of reselling for a quick profit.

title: An Enthusiastic Entry Into Day Care
description: You can't tell how many scientists we may have here, male or female, commented Roy Wilkins, executive direc tor of the National Associa tion for the Advance ment of Colored People, as he watched a group of 4 and 5yearolds fashion used milk cartons and pieces of paper plates into turkeys.

title: CONNALLY TO GET KENNEDY'S POST AT THE TREASURY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  President Nixon announced to day that he would nominate former Gov. John B. Connally Jr. of Texas, a Democrat, to replace David M. Kennedy as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: PROGRESS IS SEEN ON PACIFICATION
description: LONDON, Dec. 14 (AP)Sir Robert Thompson, an adviser to President Nixon on the war in Vietnam, said today that the United States Vietnamization and pacification policies were unassailable by the enemy.

title: Westcoast Will Seek Gas And Oil in Honduras Gulf
description: The Westcoast Production. Company said yesterday that it hadagreed to explore for oil and gas on concessions in the. Gulf of Honduras held by sub sidiaries of the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., and the Hanna Mining Company.

title: Dispute Checks Drive for Common Market Currency
description: BRUSSELS, Tuesday, Dec. 15 A dispute over supranational ity between France and her five European Common Market partners has temporarily check ed efforts to create a single cur rency within the European Eco nomic Community by 1980.

title: WHEAT FUTURES SHOW PRICE DROP
description: Reacting to a Government statement that resale privi leges would not be extended beyond next spring for com mercially stored wheat, corn and soybeans, most futures prices of those commodities dropped yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade.

title: News Will Break Ground For Plant in Queens Today
description: The Daily News will hold groundbreaking ceremonies for a new production plant in Queens at 2:30 P.M. today.

title: Trustee of New Haven Road Seeks to Speak on Rail Act
description: Richard Joyce Smith, trustee of the bankrupt New Haven Railroad Company, sent a tele gram yesterday to Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indi ana, and chairman of the sur face transportation committee of the Senate Commerce Com mitee, requesting an opportu nity to state his views on the proposed Essential Rail Serv ices Act of 1970.

title: Rates for U. S. Treasury Bills Show Drop at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Sample Says Secret Boycott Forced Him Out of N.F.L.
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 14 (AP) Special Federal grand jurors resumed their investigation into the National Football League today with testimony from John Sample, a former player who contends he was black listed out of the league.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the middle of the week the St. Louis football forces were feted at their annual awards dinner and enthusiasm got so high that it developed into a pep rally worthy of yesteryear's collegiate traditionals. It was all aimed at the hated New York Giants, the next opponent, and the Car dinal old grads were blistering in their attacks and exhortations.

title: The Albany Thaw
description: Although the weather outside the DeWitt Clinton Hotel in Albany was frightful over the weekend, with the tem perature skidding downward and the snow beginning to fall, the spirit within the State Democratic party proved . . . well, delightful. Members of the State committee showed rare harmony in adopting a series of controver sial resolutions embodying a number of vital reforms. Regular leaders as well as insurgent reformers voted aye. These leaders at last gave some indication of understanding the deep public resentment against anti quated antidemocratic procedures which long have cried out for change.

title: SENATE UNIT BACKS AID FOR CAMBODIA BUT BARS TROOPS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14  The Senate Foreign Relations CoMmittee today approved the Administration's $255million program of military aid for Cambodia but with a restric tion prohibiting the President from sending American ground troops or advisers to Cambodia.

title: No. 100 Set as Ceiling For Draft in January
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)The Selective Service System said today that men with numbers of 100 and be low would be eligible for the January draft. The number. 100 is expected to be the cell ing for several months, the agency said.

title: Nominee for Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 John Bowden Connally Jr. is the second conservative Texan to ride out of the Lone Star State into President Nixon's corral in the last week. Mr. Connally, 53 years old, a Democrat who is a longtime political friend of former President Lyndon B. Johnson, was nominated today to be Secretary of the Treasury. Last week, the President named Representative George Bush, a Republican who was de feated by Senatorelect Lloyd M. Bentsen Jr., to be Ambas sador to the United Nations.

title: Executive Editor Named
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 14 (UPI) Harold E. Hutchings, assistant to the editor of The Chicago Tribune, has been named exec utive editor effective Jan. 1. He has been a staff member for 36 years and was formerly chief of the Tribune's press service in New York, city editor and as sistant managing editor.

title: JUDGE IS ON TRIAL IN ALABAMA CASE
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 14A county judge who failed to place the names of Negro candidates on a ballot in 1968 went on trial here today on charges that he had deliber ately ignored a Federal court order instructing him to in clude them.

title: Atlantic Phone Cable Knocked Out of Service
description: A transAtlantic telephone cable was knocked out of service at 3:40 P.M. yesterday for unknown reasons, the American Telephone and Tele graph Company said.

title: Maryland Fans Arrive Early To Cheer Unbeaten Freshmen
description: When Lefty Driesell became Maryland's basketball coach last season, he promised to make the Terps the U.C.L.A. of the East. Driesell appears to be making progress.

title: Klan Is Blamed for Night Raid on Center at Delaware U. Campus
description: NEWARK, Del., Dec. 14A lightning nighttime raid by a commandostyle vigilante group on a controversial, ecumenical student church center at the University of Delaware has left this community of 18,000 per sons in fear and political tur moil.

title: SOUTHAMPTON TOPS KINGS POINT, 7854
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 14  Southampton, Stony Brook and New York Tech tri umphed in the firstround play of the Schaefer Long Island basketball tournament at the Island Garden today.

title: 25 GREEKS IN EXILE ASSAIL U.S. ARMS AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 Twentyfive Greek Journalists living abroad have expressed a deep sense or worry and con cern over a letter from a State Department official explaining that the recent decision by the United States to resume ship ments of heavy arms to Greece was based entirely on consid erations Which concern the se curity of the United States.

title: State Panel Weighs Rise For Bank Mortgage Rates
description: ALBANY, Dec. 14 (AP)The Assembly Banking Committee is discussing possible legisla tion to permit banks to charge more interest for conventional mortgages.

title: These Stores Deliver the Customers
description: Some of the merchants who cater to the carriage trade are now providing the carriages.

title: Welfare Rights of Noncitizens To Be Considered by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 The Supreme Court agreed to day to decide if states may con stitutionally deny welfare bene fits to people because they are not United States citizens.

title: Books of the Times
description: For 25 years, Elie Wiesel has been in one form or another a witnessa witness to the range, bestiality and completeness of the destruction of European Jewry by the Germans. In his mind, the death marches that emptied the towns of his native Hun gary have no end. His is not a role he sought, but having acquired it, he will not give it up. Ausch witz informs ev erything he writes novels, legends, dialogues. He is not belligerent about it, only un yielding. Nothing he can say meas ures up to the enormity of what he saw, what oth ers endured. The implications these experiences have for mankind ter rify him. He can not get over how thin is the veneer that disguises the brute animal. Civ ilization? he asks. Foam that crests tne waves and vanishes. There is surprising ly little physical horror in his books. It is the mind that is outraged, the spirit that is degraded. When an emaciated father gives his bowl of soup to his starving son, when a naked mother covers her child's body with her own, against the expected spray of bullets, pain and death pale be fore the suffering and humiliation in these events. The story, the author says, need ed to be told for the sake of our children. . . . We needed to face the dead again and again in order to appease them, to seek a symbol, a beginning of a promise.

title: PRIESTS CONTEST PRISON'S CENSORS
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 14The Berrigan brothers, appearing together publicly today for the first time since last April, chal lenged a Federal prison's rights to censor their writings and sermons.

title: For GiftGivingWithout the Shopping
description: They bought 50 travel clocks for Russian ballet company, 25 silver tape measures as gifts for construction ex ecutives and a birthday cake with cello on it for Jacqueline Du Pre. Their find of the moment is a turnofthe century cigarette case, enameled with rosy, reclining nude.

title: Scottish Water Is Part Of Whisky Blending Kit
description: At the moment they're thinking of advertising it as the gift for the man who thought he had everything: And that would seem just about right for a doityour self Scotch blending kit.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Riding a strong northeast er, heavy flakes of snow just on the edge of rain slanted down from a slatecolored sky. It was the last day of the Massachusetts deerhunt ing season and four or five inches of snow lay on the leaves under the tangled scrub oaks.

title: HENRY W. BEER, 89, RETIRED LAWYER
description: Henry Ward Beer of 2768 East 16th Street, Brooklyn, a retired lawyer who was presi dent for more than two decades of the Federal Bar Association of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, died Sunday after a long illness in a nursing home here. He was 89 years old.

title: WORLD COURT PLEA ON WHISKY WEIGHED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 The Supreme Court has been informed that a case that it re fused to hear involving taxes on Irish and Scotch whiskies may be taken to the World Court at the Hague, the Nether lands.

title: Possibilities for Giant Title
description: If the Giants win their final regularseason game against Los Angeles at Yankee Stadium Sunday, they will gain the Eastern Division championship of the National Conference and a berth in the Super Bowl playoffs.

title: EASING REPORTED BY RESERVE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted in September to seek some eas ing of conditions in .the money market in order to bring about a growth in the money supply at a rate of 5 per cent, it was disclosed today.

title: Graham Impact on Batsheva Dancers
description: It is not for nothing that Martha Graham is the artistic adviser of the Batsheva Dance Company of Israel, now on its first visit to New York at the New York City Center. Miss Graham was the very first person consulted by the company's founder, Bethsabee de Rothschild, and she has been associated with this young Israeli troupe from the start.,

title: 100 Protest at School Crossing
description: Almost 100 parents blocked traffic for more than two hours yesterday morning at West End Avenue and 96th Street to protest hazards their children face in going to school.

title: StripMining Boom Leaves Wasteland in Its Wake
description: ST. CLAIRSVILLE, Ohio, Dec. 12A way of life as American as the farmhouse lightning rod, the corn crib and yellow squash put up in Ball jars died here on the spent farms of eastern Ohio a generation ago. Now it is literally being buried.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Remember Those Old Granny Dolls??
description: The same wave of nostal gia that produced granny glasses and granny dresses has brought forth a rash of granny dolls and other para phernalia reminiscent of the days when grandmothers sat in rocking chairs instead of jet planes. Sears Roebuck's Christmas catalogue, for one, has devoted two pages to its new Gramma collec tion created by Joyce Miller, a designer of mod ern furniture who lives in a 50yearold carriage house near Detroit with her two teenaged children and a cat named Downstairs.

title: Postal Clerk Admits Killing
description: A Post Office clerk pleaded guilty to seconddegre murder in Federal Court here yesterday in the fatal stabbing of a co worker Oct. 10 in the General Post Office at 33d Street and Eighth Avenue. Judge Edward Weinfeld set sentencing Jan. 15 for Larney Rutledge, 39 years old, of 5210 Broadway.

title: 2 L.I, MEN SEIZED ON USURY CHARGE
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 14 Two former bank employes were arrested today and charged with making usurious loans on which they collected more than 100 per cent interest a year.

title: Cambodia Reports Killing 2,000
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, Dec. 15 (AP)The Cambodian command said to day that Cambodian paratroop ers had killed at least 2,000 enemy soldiers in three days and nights of heavy fighting around the village of Prey Totung, 44 miles northeast of the capital.

title: Dr. J. Hamilton Crawford Dead; A Founder of Heart. Association
description: Dr. J. Hamilton Crawford, director emeritus of the Long Island College Hospital Depart ment of Medicine and professor emeritus of the department of medicine of the Downstate Medical Center, State Univer sity of New York, died yes terday. He was 76 years old and lived at 130 Eighth Ave nue, Brooklyn, and in Buck Hill Falls, Pa.

title: NEW SENATE TEST ON SST PROPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 Senator William Proxmire, leader of the drive that knocked out new funds for the supersonic transport in the Senate two weeks ago, offered today to schedule a fresh test of support for the project when the new Congress convenes next month.

title: PRINCETON HANDS N.Y.U. 7868 LOSS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 14 Ted Manakas, a sophomore guard, scored 25 points tonight to pace Princeton to a 7868 victory over New York. Univer sity.

title: College President Resigning
description: PROVIDENCE, Dec. 14 (AP) The Very Rev. William Paul Haas said yesterday that he would resign as Providence Col lege president effective June 30, ending a sixyear term. He said he planned to remain at the school in a teaching capacity.

title: WILD CAR UPTOWN KILLS 3 CHILDREN
description: Three girls were killed and a fourth seriously injured yes terday evening when a car on the Harlem River Speedway went out of control and mounted the sidewalk, hitting the girls.

title: SEPARATE VOTE SEEN ON WELFARE, TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 Senate leaders and the White House were reported tonight to have agreed on a strategy de signed to promote passage of Social Security and welfare re form legislation at the possible expense of revised trade laws.

title: South Korean Boat Carrying 276 Sinks; 4 Persons Rescued
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tues day, Dec. 15 (AP)  A ferry boat with 276 persons aboard sank early today in icy seas of the Korean Straits, police said. Early reports said Japa nese fishing boats had picked up four survivors.

title: HARBURG ROAMS WORLD OF LYRICS
description: A series of monthly pro grams designed to put the spot light on the forgotten man of songwriting, the lyricist, was inaugurated Sunday night at the 92d Street Young Men's Young Women's Hebrew Asso ciation, with Yip Harburg on stage.

title: Mayor Calls 6Month Extension For Knapp Commission Vital
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that a sixmonth extension in the life of the commission investigating allegations of cor ruption in the New York Police Department was vital to the public interest

title: POLAND APPROVES ECONOMIC REFORM
description: WARSAW, Dec. 14  Po land's leaders approved major economic reforms today and Wladyslaw Gomulka, First Sec retary of the Communist par ty, said the step closes the old and opens a new stage in our economic development.

title: U.S.Algerian Trade Grows Despite Rift
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 1Trade and business relations between the United States and Algeria are flourishing despite the break in diolomatic ties three years ago.

title: Nunn Heads Association
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, DeC. 14 (UPI)Gov. Louie B. Nunn Of Kentucky was elected chair man of the Republican Gov ernors Association and Gov. William G. Milliken of Michi gan was elected vice chairman today during a secret session of the Republican Governers Conference.

title: $200,000 Golf Is Listed With New MatchPlay Format
description: Something was added to the professional golfing scene yes terday when it was revealed that a $200,000 national match play championship would be held at the Country Club of North Carolina in Pinehurst from Aug. 25 through 29.

title: Next Move Up to I.O.S. On a Gramco Joint Deal
description: The president, Ratael Navarro said the Gramco International board met here today to review a report by I.O.S.'s chief execu tive officer, Robert E. Slater on consideration of a joint ven ture in the area of real estate. He said Mr. Slater would report to the 1.0.S. board Thursday in Geneva on the matter.

title: Mass Is Reported Said By 2 Priests in Canton
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 14 (AP) Usually reliable Roman Catholic sources reported to day that two Italian priests flew from Pakistan to Com munist China last week, said mass in a Canton hotel room and then left the country by way of Hong Kong.

title: Iron Ore Sale Announced
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 14 (UPI)The Utah Construction and Mining Company and the Cyprus Mines Corporation an nounced today the sale of 800, 000 tons of iron ore from their Mount Goldsworthy mine near Port Hedland in Western Aust ralia to Japanese steel mills. Consolidated Goldfields of Australia, Ltd., also is a part ner in Mount Goldsworthy.

title: DAVID BIGELOW, 91, TEA COMPANY HEAD
description: WILTON, Conn., Dec.. 14  David E. Bigelow, a founder of the Bigelow Tea Company, died in Norwalk Hospital Friday aft er a long illness. He was 91 years old and lived here at 358 Ridgefield Road.

title: SAILOR WHO SEIZED U.S. SHIP GIVES UP
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tues day; Dec. 15 (AP)Alvin L. Glatowski, one of two young Americans who hijacked a United States ammunition ship in the Gulf of Thailand last March, walked into the United States Embassy here today and surrendered.

title: We Must Limit Families by Law
description: Controlling our population growth by appeal to selfinterest or commu nity welfare has been no more effec tive than it has been in preventing pollution or wageprice escalation. As an issue contributing to most of our major national problems, it is political. To get results it should be handled as such by legislation and government. administration.

title: Delaware's Rushing Is Nation's Best
description: Delaware's football team doesn't like to pass very much, but it puts enough excitement into the running game to satisfy fans who think the only good football is an aerial circus act. And the Blue Hens believe in simplicity.

title: L'Etoile to Be Renamed Today In Honor of de Gaulle, After All
description: PARIS, Dec.14The Place de l'Etoile will be renamed Place Charles de Gaulle tomorrow. It required the combined pressure of President Pompidou and the late President's family to sub due a rebellious municipal council.

title: PEKING BOLSTERS PARTY APPARATUS
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 14Pe king announced today a forma tion of the first Communist party committee to be estab lished at the provincial level since the Cultural Revolution.

title: LEADERS RENAMED IN ALBANY HOUSES
description: ALBANY, Dec. 14Members of the state's Senate and the Assembly met informally here today to redesignate the incum bent majority and minority leaders to twoyear terms and to begin grappling with the issue that is expected to domi nate the 1971 Legislative ses sionmoney and where to get it.

title: Missed Opportunity
description: In opening the White House Conference on Children, President Nixon on Sunday evening made a stirring plea for the passage of his Family Assistance Plan, which would put a financial floor under every family with children.

title: Basketball Poll
description: COACHES RATINGS

title: Scientists, in Paris, Say U.S. Tests Chemical War in Asia
description: PARIS, Dec. 14A group of 60 scientists hostile to the war in Vietnam have concluded that the United States armed forces are using that country as a laboratory for chemical war fare.

title: Esposito, Hockey's Top Scorer, Is Unable to Steal the Limelight
description: The National Hockey League finds itself with the greatest singleseason point getter in its history attracting only passing notice. But that's because Phil Esposition, the Boston bruins center, doesn't get goals with 110milean hour slap shots or make his way around the opposition by

title: 7 in Jersey and Florida Held on Gambling Charge
description: NEWARK, Dec. 14 (AP) The arrest of seven men in New Jersey and Florida in connec tion with the breakup of an alleged $1millionayear gam bling operation was announced today by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: British Report November Trade Deficit
description: LONDON, Dec. 14Britain's overseas trade, the traditional measure of this country's eco nomic health, slipped back into deficit in November following two months of surpluses, the Department of Trade and In dustry reported today.

title: Fund for the Neediest Aided by Youths
description: Some new contributors to the New York Times Needi est Cases Fund were among the 312 whose gifts were recorded by the fund yes terday.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (Reu ters)President Nixon will for mally announce tomorrow that the United States has achieved a gross national product of S1,000billion and that it is the first nation ever to do so.

title: DUNCAN G. HARRIS, LEADER. IN REALTY
description: Duncan G. Harris, chairman of the Manhattan realty con cern of Brown, Harris & Stev ens, died Sunday at his home, 3 Beekman Place, after a short illness. He was 93 years old.

title: Rep. Rivers Improving
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 14 (UPI)  University Hospital re ported an improvement in the condition of Representative L. Mendel Rivers, Democrat of South Carolina who underwent open heart surgery Friday.

description: DETROIT, Dec. 14Sales of new cars continued to lag far behind last year in early De cember, with most of the slump at the General Motors Corpo ration but with no sign of boom at the other manufac turers either.

title: PRICES DECLINE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended lower yester day as the list declined steadily throughout the session on moderate trading.

title: Mr. Nixon's Moral Tone
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14Moral au thority in a great and diverse nation such as ours does not reside in the Presidency alone, President Nixon wrote to Chairman William W. Scran ton of his Commissibn on Campus Unrest. Mr. Nixon was right, of course, but the commission had not claimed otherwise; rather it had made the subtly but vitally different suggestion that only the President can offer the compassionate, reconciling moral lead ership that can bring the country to gether again.

title: Unions Back Down In British Dispute
description: LONDON, Dec. 14  The electrical unions, retreating under the pressure of public resentment, called off their dis ruptive slowdown today.

title: Prime Rate Is Cut to 6 From 7% by Batik Of BUffalo
description: The Bank of Buffalo, a $110 million institution controlled by Financial General Bankshares, Inc., announced yesterday a re duction in its prime lending rate to 6 per cent from 7 per cent, effective today.

title: Diners Club DenverBound
description: DENVER, Dec. 14 (AP)  Diners Club, the first of the nationwide travel and enter tainment credit card companies, announced today that it would transfer its national headquart ers from New York City to Denver, effective with the first quarter next year.

title: Churchill Downs Raises Derby Entry Fee by $500
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 15 (AP)The price for dropping a thoroughbred's name into the Kentucky Derby entry box went tin today from $500 to $1,000.

title: Nancy Richey Married
description: SAN ANGELO, Tex., Dec. 15 (AP)Nancy Richey, the na tion's topranked woman tennis player, and Kenneth S. Gunter, a San Angelo television execu tive, were married today. Her brother, Cliff, also a tennis star, attended the ceremony.

title: Death Sentence Upset
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark Dec. 15 (UPI) The Arkansas Supreme Court overturned yesterday the death sentence imposed on Carl Jackson, 16 years old, a Negro, for the rape of a white woman because the trial judge, William Kirby had refused to allow Jackson's attorney to make an opening statement to the jury.

title: REUBEN SODERSTROM, ILLINOIS UNION HEAD
description: STREATOR, Ill., Dec. 15 (AP) Reuben G. Soderstrom, for mer president of the Illinois A.F.L.C.I.O., died today. He was 82 years old and made his home here.

title: Judge Denies Bail To Seven in Tacoma For Being Unruly
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 15 (AP)Federal District Court Judge George Boldt denied bail today for seven persons con victed of contempt of court in connection with a conspiracy trial.

title: Suffering From the Flu, Porn Cancels Audience
description: ROME, Dec. 15A Vatican ?pokesman said tonight that Pope Paul VI was suffering from nfluenza and had can celed his weekly general audience that was scheduled to be held in St. Peter's Basilica tomorrow morning.

description: Is Beethoven still relevant 200 years after his birth? Even to pose the question seems ludicrous, for his works remain a staple of the repertory and in the tradi tional hierarchy of values they represent one of the glo ries of civilization. But to a former music critic like my

title: Masco to Buy Metallurgical Concern
description: The Masco Corporation, an nounced yesterday it had agreed to acquire Comonwealth Industries, Inc., a Detroit metal lurgical company for common stock worth about $11million.

title: OTTINGER PLANS CITIZENS GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Representative Richard L. Ot tinger said today that he would avoid partisan politics for the time being and would set up a national organization to mo bilize citizens groups for en vironmental and consumer pro tection.

description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 15 (AP)Jim Maloney, a hard throwing righthander of the Cincinnati Reds, was dealt to the California. Angels to day for Greg Garrett, a 22 yearold lefthander.

description: DETROIT, Dec. 15 (AP) Nineyearold Rollie Bloodsaw, who the police said ran away from home last week to avoid a threatened spanking, was found dead yesterday in a con crete garbage receptacle. A medical examiner said the boy apparently died from exposure.

description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 15 Dr. Gorge T. Reynolds, physicist on the Princeton University faculty since 1946, was today appointed director of Princeton's Center for En vironmental Studies, which will bring together faculty members from nine academic depart ments in an interdisciplinary approaCh to environmental problems. Dr. Reynolds has taught seminars on both water pollution and air pollution.

title: Arbitrate the Taxi Strike
description: The brief spasm of violence yesterday by striking taxi drivers is an ugly indication of their awareness that the stoppage is proving a monumental miscalculation. The city is managing very well without its normal comple ment of medallion cabs. There is no public pressure on the fleet operators to surrender, and the frustrated union ists are now resorting to goon tactics to intimidate not only gypsy but regular livery services as well.

title: `Curtains, by a Member of Company, Pleases
description: Incidentally the people who are telling you that they are not affected by the taxi strike are not dance and drama critics with no sense of direction. I am continually finding places between the places between which I travel  and mysteriously I can fit nothing in. Perhaps I will learn. Perhaps it is good for me. But for me if I can enjoy a company like the Batsheva while bereft of taxis, just think of what I might have thought of it given a decent four wheels.

The gomen watt, made with spinach and shallots, was delectable, and the native drink, tej, made with gesho hops and honey, was fas cinating.

description: Eastern Air Lines named a new president and chief operating officer, the Public Service. Electric and Gas Company shifted its top management and the Amer ican Can Company added two new topline vice presi dents. These were among the top executive promotions announced yesterday.

description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho, Dec. 15  Though most of them don't ski, the nation'sRepub lican Governors think that keeping your balance on a run down this resort's for midable Exhibition slope is a good deal easier than in try ing to run a state administra tion. Midst lovely mounds

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Justice Harry A. Blackmun, the Supreme Court's newest member, cast the decisive vote today as the Court lim ited one of the liberal hold ings of the Warren Court for the protection of criminal defendants rights.

description: Rent increases retroactive to August now in effect for. nearly one million rentcontrolled apartments in the city were challenged as unconstitutional yesterday by the Legal Aid So ciety and a Government fi nanced antipoverty group.

description: Plans for the National Football League's four divi sional playoff games the weekend of Dec. 26 and 27 were further clarified yester day.

title: Screen: Frisby's 'There's a Girl in My Soup' Opens:Miss Hawn and Sellers Take Leading Roles Adaptation Is Directed by Roy Boulting
description: In adapting his bad play for the screen, Terence Frisby has slightly opened up the action and dirtied down the situations of "There's a Girl in My Soup"but otherwise he has left everything needlessly intact. By way of opening up he has added a scenic vacation in Southern France that would hardly satisfy Gidget goes to the Riviera. And by way of dirtying down he has, for example, changed things so that his hero, who in the play began by not managing to seduce a former girl friend about to be engaged, in the film begins by successfully seducing a former girl friend who has just been married.The hero, Robert Danvers (Peter Sellers), is a kind of cantering London gourmet, famous from magazine articles and television programs, whose lecherous middle age is threatened even to the point of matrimony when he temporarily beds and boards a young wild bird (Goldie Hawn) who can out-calculate the master in the strategies of love. Nothing much comes from this encounter (it is important for theater at this level that it titillate the tired libido and lay it reassuringly to rest at the same time) but the passing of three acts on stage or 95 minutes in the movieswithout illumination or wit or good humor or good sense.But what seems to have bothered nobody in the theater becomes offensive on film  partly by design, in additional dialogue devoted mostly to stupid not-quite-double-entendres, and partly by the very fortunate accident that the compulsions of even the most commercial cinema are generally more demanding than those of Broadway or the West End.Even the most commercial cinema should do better than Roy Boulting's direction, which is not so much direction as the piecing together of shots and reaction shots in a mechanical imitation of liveliness. Like almost everything else in "There's a Girl in My Soup," it is competent, but competent to no purpose.The only performance to praise is that of Tony Britton, who, as Danvers's very much married publisher and friend, achieves a level of sophisticated pleasantness that actually, suggests comedy. Peter Sellers, on the other hand, is at his least inventive. And Goldie Hawn, who I think might be fun in another part, mostly indulges in bad habits with her too-expressive eyes. In fairness, both Miss Hawn and Mr. Sellers are handicapped by roles in which any attempt at a characterization must seem an imposition."There's a Girl in My Soup" opened yesterday at the Astor and Loew's Orpheum theaters.The real worth and the power of "Skezag," a 73-minute documentary conversation with a young derelict who has initially experimented with hard drugs, comes across only at the end in a shattering postscript. Instead of the cheerfully cynical young man who has been babbling nonstop through a rather surface case history of despair, we now see a glassy-eyed, hoarse-voiced human wreck. Strapping his arm and injecting the needle, he demonstrates, his eyes looking at us and telling the whole, terrible story.In principle, the Whitney Museum is to be commended for opening its showcase to independent filmmakers with stark realism on a vital subject of today. The programs will change weekly, with the museum's entrance fee of $1 covering the auditorium screenings.Commendable, too, is the informal way the two directors, Joel L. Freedman and Philip F. Messina, have set up their color camera for a give-and-take conversation with their subject, who is soon joined in the film by two other young men, both addicts. They swap case histories, they philosophize and they argue fiercely.Most admirable of all is the baring of his thoughts by young Wayne Shirley, the main speaker, as he courageously, often blithely, recounts his life for the camera.It is not, unfortunately, the baring of a soul. The recollections are sketchy, often hazy, the sound track is occasionally garbled, and pertinent background data wrestles with a relentless flow of obscenity. Add to this a monotonous clobbering of the expression, "ya know." The final five minutes says it all.

title: Nureyev's Back in TownSocially
description: The guests filed into the goldcarpeted living, room and went into a series of doit yourself introductions.

title: D.D.B. Joins Insurer's Agency List
