title: Inca Who Led 1780 Revolt Now a Latin Folk Hero

title: A Designer's Home Is His Showcase, Too
description: HELSINKI, FinlandProbably the only home completely furnished with Eero Aarnio furniture is his own.

title: Washington: For the Record

He signed legislation giving the Gov ernment greater powers to regulate the fees charged mutual funds investors. He also signed a bill increasing Interior appropriations and authorization for domestic travel promotions.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF; VOLUME UP A BIT

title: Angels From the Kitchen
description: Alice Murray makes angels, and what with Christmas coming on, she is as busy as a Renaissance Italian on a .ceiling scaffold.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Welfare Families Get Medical Aid in Hawaii
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 15 (UPI) Hawaii became today the first state in the nation to provide a prepaid medical care plan for welfare fam ilies.

title: Bridge .  Weird Is the Word for Deal In an Event at Fall Nationals
description: Weird distributions at the bridge table often give rise to weird episodes. Many of the contestants in the Open Pairs at the Fall Nationals in Houston last month had strange stories to tell about the diagramed deal.

title: BAROQUE CHARMS. FOR PHILIDOR TRIO
description: Let the record show, for pos sible later use, that when this constant listener goes to heaven he wants no harp music, please. No, bring the Philidor Trio from wherever they may .bit at the time, and let them play for him throughout eternity. Let,, there be, perhaps, Elizabeth Humes and Edward. Smith casting vo cal and keyboard spells in Ales sandro SCarlatti's , cantata, Lascia deh lascia al fine, for soprano and harpsichord. Or ask that incredible flutist Shel ley Gruskin to join them in Giuseppe Scarlatti's air, Im magini dolenti, from Arminio in Germania.

title: Books of The Times
description: IF you are thinking of getting this set for a child (up to age 10), throw away all adult ideas about encyclopedias and put yourself in the hands of the editors. Un less you have been very close to the mate rial lately, your notions will be out of kilter. For one, this very junior edition is not allinclusive. You will find Shake speare but not Tolstoy, Stravinsky but not Schoenberg, Einstein but not Niels Bohr. On the other hand, you will find an entry on Benjamin Banneker. Who is he? Well you can look him up in The Young Chil dren's Encyclopedia.

title: SABRES AND RANGERS CLASH HERE TONIGHT
description: Twothirds of The Old Smoothies, the probable rookie of the year and the player hockey fans love to call The Wild Man will be playing for the Sabres tonight when they make their second Madison Square Garden appearance against the Rangers.

title: KARL L. BEISBART

title: RCA SELLS HOLDINGS OF STOCK IN COMSAT

Senator John L. McClellan, Democrat of Arkansas, and the late Senator Robert S. Kerr, Democrat of Oklahoma, were instrumental in bringing the project into being.

title: SCIENTISTS AWAIT VENUS CLOUD DATA

Wingate, the league's executive director. Mr. Terry, 35 years old, is a gradu ate of Clark College in his native Atlanta.

Rogers, a partner in the New York law firm of Davis Polk & Wardwell, and Mrs. Rogers of New York and Prouts Neck, Me. Mr. Zilkha is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Abdulla K. Zilkha of Paris. His father is an invest ment banker.

title: CHARM ANIMATES HODES'S DANCERS

They move sinuously through the choreography that Mr. Hodes has prepared for them, and while none of the six works on the program had that special electrifying edge, all had a wellcrafted charm. Last night the company presented its pro gram at the Wagner College Auditorium on Staten Island.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 15 It was Kids Day today at the White House Conference on Children.

title: Dance: Batsheva Troupe Stages a Robbins Classic
description: The Batsheva Dance Com pany of Israel has just start ed its second and last week at the New York City Center. It really should be seenal though, as I say that, I must admit to some uncertainty as to whether there are any tickets left. Last night, at least in the orchestra, empty seats were few and far be tween. And deservedly. This is, without any qualification at all, a troupe of simply wonderful dancers.

description: He is 200 years old today, and more alive than he ever was. He came from the pro vincial town of Bonn, in Ger many, went to Vienna, where the action was, and within a few years changed the face of music. He also helped change the, face of society. For Ludwig van Beethoven,

description: TOKYO, Dec. 15 (UPI)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., play ing his last tournament before entering the armed forces, won the $50,000 Grand Prix Masters today, although he lost his final match with Arthur Ashe.

description: MOORESTOWN, N. J., Dec. 15 (AP)A cheer went up from a group of teenagers at the close of an unusual ordination at Trinity Episcopal Church here last night.

title: Casual Nude Scene Dropped Into Dance By Rainer Company
description: There is a basic contradiction in Yvonne Rainer's work. De spite what seem to be her best efforts to bore her audience, she only succeeds in making what she does highly interest ing.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Robert W. Lishman, chief counsel of the House Commerce Committee's subcommittee on investigations, died today of cancer at Sibley Hospital. He was 67 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Vietnam Understanding To the Editor: In his press conference on Dec. 10 the President gave a curious interpie teflon of his understanding with respect to reconnaissance flights over North Vietnam. He stated that, under the understanding, not only may we bomb missile sites if our planes are fired upon, but we may also bomb military sites, supply lines and mili tary complexes (whatever this may include) if we see signs of an enemy buildup. This is not an understand ing; this is an ultimatum.

title: MRS. GEORGE HASTINGS
description: GROTONONHUDSON, N.Y. Dec. 15Mrs. Rosino Brice West Hastings, widow of George Aubrey Hastings, who was an administrative assistant to President Herbert Hoover and later public relations counsel to educational and social service organizations, died today at the home of her daughter after brief illness. She was 82 years old.

description: A oneday deer hunt sched uled for this Saturday in the Great Swamp Wildlife Refuge Wilderness in Morris County, N. J., was temporarily barred yesterday.

description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 15 The University of California, facing a financial crisis, an nounced today a series of strin gent budgetary measures, in cluding a freeze on hiring.

description: Under heavy public buying and shortcovering, soybean; futures prices advanced nearly 5 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: A NEW AGREEMENT REACHED IN JORDAN,

title: STOCKS BACK OFF IN CONSOLIDATION
description: The stock market, in a vir tual copy of Monday's per formance, pulled back slightly yesterday as it consolidated re cent strong advances.

description: TORONTO, Dec. 15 (AP) The Stanley Cup stolen from the National Hockey League's Hall of Fame Dec. 4 was not the real cup, which dates to 1893, but a reproduction, Clar ence Campbell, the league presi dent, disclosed today. We have all the original parts of the cup except for a few bands stolen earlier, he added.

title: Typical FatRich American Diet Has Long Been Suspect in Heart Disease Studies

description: ROME, Dec. 15 (Reuters) Thousands of demonstrating students marched through the streets of major Italian cities today while half the nation was paralyzed by strikes called to demand social reforms from the Government.

title: Lottery Drawing Tomorrow
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15 (UPI) The State Tax Department has reported November lottery ticket sales of $3,386,326. Based on the regular monthly $1 ticket sales, prizes totaling $1,254,531 will be shared by 5,417 winners. The final draw ing will be held Thursday at Colonie Center. The November sales raw behind October, when $3,562,694 was realized.

title: Vienna Leads in Salutes to Beethoven
description: VIENNA, Dec. 15  The 200th anniversary of Ludwig van Beethoven's birth tomor row will be celebrated all over the world, but surely nowhere with more fervor than in this ancient capital of music where the composer lived for most of his life, did his greatest works and died lonesome in the gloom of a Danubian winter.

title: WRITER FOUND SLAIN IN VILLAGE ROOMS
description: Benjamin M. Hall III, a writer and historian of American movie theaters and an expert on old theater organs, was found dead in his apartment early today with his throat slashed, according to the police.

title: Art: Whitney Sculpture Annual Ranges Widely
description: Certain exhibitions are, by their very nature, never a wholly satisfactory esthetic experience. The Whitney An nual exhibtion of contempo rary American art at the Whitney Museum is one of those. Since the purpose of the annual, according to John I. H. Baur, the Whitney's di rector, has always been to survey the current state of American art, there are bound to be works of art in this exhibition that, though representative of current trends, are nonetheless of dubious interest to any single observer.

title: Harris in Bowl Game
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 15 (UPI) Boston College's quarterback, Frank Harris, was named today to the North squad for the American Bowl football game Jan. 10.

title: Dempsey to Be Consultant
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 15 (UPI) Gov. John N. Dempsey an nounced today that he would become a consultant on envi ronmental policy for the South ern New England Telephone Company after he steps down as Connecticut's chief executive. Mr. Dempsey, 55 years old, who is being replaced by Repub lican Governorelect Thomas J. Meskill on Jan. 6, will take his new job about Feb. 1.

title: 250MILLION GROSS IN NUMBERS SEEN
description: The numbers game, played daily by a million bettors in this city, does a gross annual business here of $250million and provides the livelihood of more than 10,000 employes of organized crime, the Joint Leg islative Committee on Crime was told yesterday.

description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15  Dr. Edoardo Weiss, who introduced psychoanalysis in Italy and had practiced here since 1941, died yesterday at his home here aft er a long illness. He was 81 years old.

description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 15The president of Rut gers said today that an increas ing number of bomb threats were likely to bring the uni versity to a standstill.

Dec. 15The new street sign reading Place Charles de Gaulle was un veiled today in the presence of Premier Jacques Chaban DeImes and other Gaullist faithful at what was former ly the Place de l'Etoile. title: Rice Named Manager
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Dec. 15 (AP)Del Rice, former major league catcher and member of the California Angels organiza tion the last nine years, was named today to manage the Salt Lake City farm club in the Pacific Coast League.

title: Advertising: Western Agency Visits Soviet
description: Everybody seems to be coming back from somewhere these days, or haven't you noticed?

title: PEROT CUTS STAKE IN SHARES OF E.D.S.
description: H. Ross Perot, chairman of the Electronic Data Systems Corporation, sold 500,000 shares of his company's stock$28.25 million worthyesterday in secondary offering managed by R. W. Pressprich & Co., Inc., at $56.50 a share. The industrial ist's holdings in the Dallas based concern were thus re duced to 73.7 per cent, or 8,537,990. Pressprich reported the stock entirely sold.

title: 2 JETS IN NO RUSH TO ACCEPT TERMS
description: The Motown Sound of Ste vie Wonder singing his hit re cording of Signed, Sealed, DeliveredI'm Yours is now applicable to all the New York Jets except Pete Lammons, tight end, and Verlon Biggs, de fensive end, but nobody seems to be worried.

title: Connally and Strategy
description: President Nixon's decision to replace Secretary of the Treasury David M. Kennedy with John B. Connally Jr., for mer Governor of Texas, came as a complete surprise especially to the top echelon at the Treasury Department.

title: AirLaw Conferees Approve Program Aimed at Hijackers
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 15 (UPI) An international conference on air law today approved convention calling for severe penalties for air hijackers and ruling out any excuse because of political motives.

title: BIG SAIGON FORCE SAID TO HELP ALLY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  South Viet nam was reported to have sent a 3,000man force deep into Cambodia today in response to an appeal for help from Premier Lon Nol.

title: Casper Offers Think'
description: Weekend golfers waste too much time idly watching other weekend golfers line up their shots, Billy Casper suggested here yesterday.

title: Controlling World Population
description: An international team of experts has made a practical proposal for advancing the United Nations into a more meaningful role in the control of population growth. The mission, appointed by U Thant, believes the Secretary General already has authority under General Assembly and Economic and Social Council directives to establish a World Population Institute as a semiautonomous body within the United Nations system.

title: SovietReportedTrying 1 1, Mostly Jews, in Hijacking
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 15Reliable sources said tonight that the trial of 11 persons, most of them believed to be Jews ac cused in a plot to hijack a So viet airliner. in June, began to day in Leningrad.

title: Neville to Bow in Musical As the Humbert of tolita
description: John Neville will make his American musical stage debut as star of the new Alan Jay Lerner and John Barry musical based on Vladimir Nabokov's Lolita, it was announced yes terday by Norman Twain, the producer.

title: The People Who Do No Wrong
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 15On the way into Moscow from Helsinki the other day, the Soviet Ilyushin had climbed to 37,000 feet when a German in the middle cabin noticed that the lever on the emergency exit window where he was sitting was pushed up to Open. He rang for the stewardess, who called the steward, who summoned another officer, who examined the lever and smiled. it is normal, he said, as if only an idiot could have raised the question in the first place.

title: 3 IN STATECABINET PLANNING TO QUIT
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15Three more long time members of Governor Rockefeller's cabinet plan to resign soon to make way for younger men as part of Mr. Rockefeller's plan to make his fourth term in office a period of change, of innova tion, of creation to meet chang ing needs.

title: Webster and Other Giants With Title Memories Recapture That Old Tingle
description: Not since 196397 games ago  have the New York Giants played a game with a championship at stake. Not since Dec. 15, 1963, has there been such a game at Yankee Stadium. On that Sunday, the Giants clinched the Eastern Conference title by beating the Pittsburgh Steelers 3317, in their final regularseason game.

title: Profit Lags at Ashland Oil
description: Ashland Oil, Inc., had higher sales in its fiscal year ended Sept. 30, but earnings from operations fell 10.2 per cent to $51,090,000, or $2.09 a share, from $56,880,000, or $2.42 a share, in the preceding fiscal year, its report yesterday showed.

title: I.C.C. SETS STUDY ON RAIL FREIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)The Interstate Com merce Commission ordered to day an investigation of railroad freightrate structures.

title: The Campaign Against Douglas
description: The finding of a House Judiciary subcommittee that no convincing basis exists for the impeachment of Asso ciate Justice William O. Douglas should bring to an end this sorry episode in the relationship of the Nixon Administration, the House of Representatives and the Supreme Court.

title: Negro Heads Journalism Unit
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 (AP)  The Negro publisher of weekly newspaper here has be come the first black president of a chapter of Sigma Delta Chi, officials of the journalism so ciety said. Chester L. Washing ton, publisher of The Central and Southwest News, was elect ed yesterday to the oneyear presidency of the Los Angeles chapter. He succeeds Ron Funk, editor of The Santa Monica Evening Outlook.

title: Knicks Spend a Relaxing Night Beating Cavaliers, 110 92
description: The New York Knicks prac tice sessions sometimes are more interesting than their 11092 victory over the Cleve land Cavaliers was last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Deputy Republican Leader Resigns His Post in Party
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  The Republican na tional chairman, Rogers C. B. Morton, announced today that Jim Allison Jr. had resigned as deputy chairman. .

title: Bids Opened for Offshore Oil Drilling Rights After a 2Year Delay
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 15 The Interior Department re sumed the leasing of offshore oil drilling rights today after a twoyear interruption caused by pollution disasters.

title: LAIRD TO CONSULT ABRAMS ON TROOPS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird announced today that he would visit South Vietnam early next month to confer with Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the American field commander, on the prospect fat troop reductions.

title: BLUES 21 VICTORS OVER NORTH STARS
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 15 (UPI) Bill Sutherland scored two goals for St. Louis tonight as the Blues avenged their worst loss at home this season with a 21 victory over the Minne sota North Stars.

title: Latin Patriarch Installed
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 15 (Reu ters)Giacomo Giuseppe Bel tritti was invested today as the new Latin Patriarch of Jeru salem and became the highest ranking Roman Catholic prelate in the  Holy Land.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15A House subcommittee released today what it termed a moun tain of evidence on which it based its conclusions that there were no grounds for im peachment of Associate Justice William O. Douglas.

description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15 (AP) Illinois voters approved today a new state Constitution streamlining the revenue sys tem, granting home rule powers to local governments and ban ning employment and housing bias.

description: In the current hunt for a viable incomes policy, the proposal for tax to discourage excess wage in creases has achieved some modest notoriety. On the assumption that the way it works is broadly familiarto raise the profits tax for firms that grant excessive wage increases  I would like to examine some of its strengths as well as defects.

The card ended the New York harness racing campaign of 297 nights, 142. of which were presented at Yonkers Raceway.

description: NORTH HAMPTON, N.H., Dec. 15 (AP)A breeding, mare in foal was destroyed today in a fire at the farm of Peter Ful ler, the owner of Dancer's Im age, the 1968 Kentucky Derby winner.

description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 15 (AP) The sentence of Marine Pvt. Michael Schwarz, convicted of premeditated murder in the death of 12 Vietnamese civil ians, has been commuted from life to a dishonorable discharge and a year at hard labor, his attorney, James E. McLaughlin, announced today. Mr. McLaugh lin said he had been informed of the commutation in an order from the military convening authority, Maj. Gen. C. F. Wid decke, commander of the First Marine Division at Danang, South Vietnam.

title: Screen: Circuit Houses Get 'Take a Girl Like You':Amis Novel Made Into a Kind of Comedy Four Other Pictures Begin Their Runs
description: "Take a Girl Like You," based on Kingsley Amis's 1960 novel, is about Jennifer Bunn, a pretty, 20-year-old school teacher who is determined to remain a virgin until her marriage, although not because of any religious or moral principles. Jenny Bunn is possessed by a mystique that is essentially feminine, and as incapable of being superficially analyzed as that which drives the mountain climber to new heights of ridiculously sublime and sometimes fatal endeavor. She protects her virginity because it's there. Or, as she puts it, because "It's all I have to give."This is a satisfactory answer neither for Patrick (Oliver Reed), the wolf who pursues and falls in love with her; for Jenny (Hayley Mills), who finally loses what is referred to as "it" in bleak but not really traumatic circumstances, nor for us, who begin to suspect that Jenny has problems that are beyond the range and interest of this sort of mild social satire.I must say that I felt much the same way about the Jenny described in Mr. Amis's novel, which has an essentially comic form but is never very funny.The film, like the book, is set in a middle-sized town, not too far from London, and sees Jenny as a symbol of the new middle class, which has been educated beyond its social and economic status and doesn't quite know how to behave in its new freedom. Jenny, who seems to have everything going for her, including a warm natureshe's "a good kisser"intelligence and looks, is both unwilling and unable to exercise her sexual liberation."Take a Girl Like You," opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters with "The Mind of Mr. Soames" (reviewed earlier). It is the first theatrical film to be directed by Jonathan Miller, the young British physician turned actor ("Beyond the Fringe") and stage director. Considering Mr. Miller's reputation as an innovator with Britain's National Theater, "Take a Girl Like You" is only conventionally surprising.That is, it is surprising in terms of the revelations of the plot, which has been changed in at least one major detail in the screenplay by George Melly, rather than in terms of content and style, which might be described as color-coordinated kitchen-sink. The mostly drab milieu has been photographed in bright, cheeky color and there is, behind the opening and closing credits, the inevitable rock title tune.With one notable exception, however, Mr. Miller has obtained excellent performances from his cast, including Mr. Reed; Noel Harrison, as an exurban sybarite who dreams of "lots and lots of lovely sex forever"; and Sheila Hancock and John Bird, as the perfectly mismated couple who run Jenny's boarding house.Miss Mills is an extraordinarily pretty girl, but the once spontaneous attitudes and gestures of the child actress have become cold and calculating in the adult star. Her Jenny is as vulnerable as a Hollywood press agentwhich tends to divert one's sympathies, not only from her, but from the movie that takes her and "it" so seriously.

title: PERJURY CONVICTION OF UNIONIST IS UPSET
description: The conviction and fiveyear sentence of a union official for perjury was reversed yesterday by the Appellate Division, which criticized the trial judge for allowing a hostile atmos phere, including references to the Vito Genovese family?

title: College Fives Play Tonight In DoubleHeader at Garden
description: St. Bonaventure, off to the highest scoring pace in its his tory, and Army, which has al ways stressed defense in attain ing success, meet tonight in the second game of a college bas ketball doubleheader at Madi son Square Garden. RELIGION BELIEVED GAINING IN SOVIET
description: LONDON, Dec. 16  Reli gion is gaining strength in the Soviet Union, particularly among the young, according to a report published here to night. Nevertheless, it added, the militantly atheistic Soviet state is still bent on ulti mately rooting religion out of society altogether.

title: 50  COUNTRIES SIGN
description: THE HAGUE. Dec. 16Fifty nations today signed an inter national convention making hi jacking of civilian aircraft criminal act and requiring the participating nations to mete out severe punishment to the offender.

title: U.S. SAID TO HIDE AID FOR CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16A report by Senate investigators said today that the United States was providing close air support for Cambodian armed forces and carrying out a wide variety of other combat mis sions under the camouflage of acting to prevent move ments by Communist troops in to South Vietnam.

title: HARRY A. CRETER
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 16 Harry A. Creter of 123 Oak land Road, retired president of the Burial Vault Manufacturing Company in Irvington and for mer chairman of the Irvington Draft Board, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital, Summit. He was 77 years old and lived at 123 Oakland Road.

title: ROCKEFELLER SAYS CUPBOARD IS BARE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 16  The Mayors of the state's six larg est cities met here today with Governor Rockefeller in their joint effort to get more state funds and were told by the Governor that the state is in the same boat they are.

title: Japanese Buddhist Group Ending Close Ties With Political Party
description: TOKYO, Dec. I6Religion is absolute, Hiroshi Hojo said. But politics is relative. Therein lies the difference between the two.

title: Soviet Cosmos Launched
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (AP) The Soviet Union launched to day the 387th unmanned satel lite In its top secret Cosmos series, the Soviet press agency Tass reported. The Cosmos was reported to be orbiting a maximum distance from the earth of 348 miles and a mini mum distance of 328 miles.

title: Personal Finance: Little Keogh Plan

title: Hussein and Brandt Confer
description: BONN, Dec. 16 (Reuters) King Hussein, of Jordan and Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany held a 60minute meet ing today on the Middle East situation and questions of mu tual interest. The King arrived by air from Paris on a fourday, visit.

title: Deaths

Beloved husband of Louise, devoted father of Alice Faison, Peggy Landy and Robert Doyle.Also survived by eight grand children and one greatgrandchild. Repos ing at Walter B. Cooke Funeral Home, Third Ave. at 85 St. Requiem Mass St. Thomas More Church, Friday 10 A.M. In terment Gate of Heaven Cemetery.

title: Study Calls the Paper Industry One of Major Polluters
description: An independent investigating group charged in a 400page report that was released yester day that the paper industry was one of the nation's major pol luters and was lagging far be hind in the cleanup effort.

The trial of Basque separatists in Burgos, Spain, has spurred protests against the regime of Gen eralissimo Francisco Franco.

title: FOOD STAMP BILL PASSED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16A food stamp bill embracing stringent must work require ment cleared the House tonight after lastminute support from the Nixon Administration. The vote was 290 to 68.

description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 16 (AP) Directors of Western Airlines approved tonight a $150million merger with American Airlines that would make American the nation's second largest com mercial air service behind Unit ed Air Lines.

description: The DowJones industrial average, down by almost points at noon, displayed some of its recent bounce yesterday by staging a strong recovery before the closing bell.

description: LONDON, Dec. 16The Gov ernment pressed today for an end to free admission to nation al museums and galleries amid a mounting outcry from artists

title: JAPANESE GIRL WINS HER 5TH GOLD MEDAL
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 16 (AP)  Yoshirni Nishigawa, a 17yearold Japanese girl swimmer, became the first athlete ever to win five gold medals as Japan continued to dominate the Asian Games to day.

title: House Prerogative Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)  House Democrats endorsed legislation today to reserve to members of Congress the pre rogative of announcing ap proval of Federal projects and programs in their states or dis tricts. The action, taken at a party caucus, called for intro duction of legislation to put the proposal into operation.

description: The 82yearold Katz Agency, the national adver tising representatives, has just named its fourth presi dent Tod Moore. He is the first nonKatz in the job.

title: Douglas Announces Intention to Remain on Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Justice William O. Douglas an nounced his intention today to remain on the Supreme Court and urged young Americans to keep the faith by working for racial justice and a pollu tionfree environment.

title: Heath Arrives in Washington on the Wings of Success
description: LONDON, Dec. 15Prime Minister Heath arrives in Wash ington tonight on his first offi cial visit, and he comes with glow of success that London expects to interest and please President Nixon when they meet.

title: TAYLOR BELCHER, 86, OILCOAL FIRM HEAD
description: Taylor Belcher, president of the Garrison (N. Y.) Oil and Coal Company, died Sunday of a heart attack in Miami on his way to visit his son, Taylor Garrison Belcher, United States Ambassador to Peru. He was 86 years old and lived at Bear Mountain Bridge Road in Gar rison.

title: McKnally Indicted On U.S. Tax Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 Representative Martin B. Mc Kneally, Republican of New burgh, N. Y., was indicted to day by a Federal grand jury on charges of failing to file Federal income tax returns for 1964 through 1967.

description: ALBANY, Dec. 16: (AP)The state reaped $172Million in tax revenue froth parimutuel rac ing in New York this year, the Tax Department reported to day.

title: Discharged Last June
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 16The Chi cago Daily News, in a news article from Washington today, identified the former agent who made the allegations as John M. O'Brien, 26 years old, who was discharged from the Army as a staff sergeant last June 8.

description: Two bank holding companies  Southeast Bancorporation, Miami, and Northwest Bancor poration, Minneapolis  have formed a new international banking concern registered in Luxembourg to which each has contributed $3million in capi tal.

description: PLYMOUTH, Montserrat, Dec. 16 (AP)  In a fatherson con test, Austin Bramble has won control of the Government of this 39squaremile island in the Caribbean.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)  Youngsters will sing carols and read Biblical les sons at a White House Christmas service on Sunday.

title: U.S. Data Indicate Moscow Is Slowing ICBM Deployment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 American reconnaissance satel lites have picked up evidence indicating that the Soviet Union has slowed the construction of longrange strategic nuclear missiles and is dismantling a modest number of intermediate range missiles.

title: The First Trillion
description: Dedicating a newly devised G.N.P. clock, President Nixon observed with pride that the United States has become the world's first trilliondollar economy. Informed that even as he spoke, the clock would race ahead at the rate of $2,000 a second, the President was carried away with the thought of how much that is going to mean if we just keep it moving and perhaps move it faster in the years ahead.

title: Cartier's Insurance Plan Modified by State Ruling
description: The New York State Insur ance Department has modified its approval of a novel program at Cartier, Inc., the Fifth Avenue jewelry concern.

title: FILIBUSTER PERIL IS FACING SENATE ON 6 KEY ISSUES

Dr. John McDon ald headed a team of Tulane University surgeons who made the transplant.

description: A middle  income housing development containing as many as 1,200 apartments is planned on land owned by the Consolidated Edison Company along the East River adjacent to Stuyvesant Town.

title: Witness Says Arson Defenda.nt Hated Man Next Door
description: An exconvict testified. yes terday that a man with whom he had shared a 33dfloor lux ury apartment on the Upper: East Side had tried to. Set fire to a neighbor's apartment be cause he hated the man .next door.

description: MIAMI, Dec. 16Mrs. Hazel Kast Estill, widow of Reuel C. Estill, who founded the Estill fundraising company in New York, died today at her home here after a short illness. She was 82 years old.

description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 16Mrs. Mollie Netcher Brag no Bostwick, the department store heiress, was married here last Saturday to Paul C. Wilmot Jr., who is with Rich ard Finnis Enterprises, an ad vertising agency in New York. Paul T. Douglas, judge of Palm Beach County, per formed the ceremony at the bride's home. The couple plan to return to New York the first of the year.

description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yester day the receipt of a contract from the Alabama Power Own pany to supply the major por tion of equipment for an 829,. 000kilowatt nuclear generating unit. This is Westinghouse's sixth nuclear plant order for 1970 and marks the 16th order placed by utilities in this coun try. This is twice the number of contracts awarded in all of 1969.

title: Racing Executive Resigns

title: Heath Lands in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16, (Reuters)  Prime Minister Heath arrived by air tonight from Canada for two days of talks with President Nixon. His Royal Air Force VC10 touched down at nearby Andrews Air Force base at 7:26 P.M. after a flight from Ottawa, where Mr. Heath conferred with Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)The Saints and Sin ners Club set out to roast Mrs. John N. Mitchell today for her celebrated early morning telephone calls. In stead, she was praised as the first lady of the Presi dent's Cabinet.

description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 16  Mrs. Marioara Cole Conovich of 64 Arrowhead Way, a goddaugh ter of the late Queen Marie of Rumania, died yesterday at Stamford Hospital after a long illness. She was 59 years old. Her parents, the late Mr. and Mrs. Almerson Hyde Cole of Morristown, N.J., and East Nor walk, lived in Rumania before World War I.

title: U.S. and Soviet End Arms Talk Round
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 16 The United States and the Soviet Union today concluded their discussions at this round of strategic armslimitation talks and prepared to adjourn Friday without any sign of progress toward an accord on halting the nuclear arms race.

title: Books of The Times
description: No one who saw even photographs of the project is likely to have forgotten Ha bitat, the housing project at Montreal's Expo 67 that looked like shoeboxes stacked by a freeform sculptor. But the name of Habitat's creator may not come so readily to mind. This is not as it should be, for Moshe Safdie is a genius; we should elect him Mayor of New York City, if not em peror of the world, tomorrow; and he has put together in his book Beyond Habitat the most interesting collection of ideas have come across since I first heard about the wheel. I hereby recommend his book to Robert Moses and his spiritual heirs, readers of Better Homes and Gardens, riders of the Long Island Railroad, taxi drivers, residents of Stuyvesant Town, all New Yorkers, all Americans, all citizens of the world, and any warm body not in cluded in the foregoing list.

title: Bunker and Abrams Reported to Urge Ban on Herbicides
description: SAIGON, Thursday, Dec. 17 Highranking American officials here reportedly have recom mended a complete halt in the program of cropdestroying herbicides long used to deny food to the enemy.

description: BOSTON, Dec. 16In remote valleys and canyons or clut tered city apartment houses, thousands of young adults, seeking economic advantages, social revolution, love, pot, God or themselves, are creating new life style in America.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)The House Commerce Committee approved today bill to permit the government to guarantee $125million to aid financially troubled rail roads, headed by the Penn Central.

title: Silence of WarTorn Suez Shattered by Sonic Boom

description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 16 (AP)  Today was Beetho ven's birthday and, as he has done for 25 years, Dr. James W. Skaggs took the day off for a personal celebration of genius.

description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 16 Aeronaves de Mexico, the Mexi can Government airline, an nounced today that fares would be reduced by up to 20 per cent on flights from New York and other United States points start inz next April 1.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES A MANPOWER BILL FOR DEFICIENCIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  President Nixon vetoed a $9.5 billion employment and man power bill today because it bore little resemblance to his own proposals and because, he said, it perpetuates and ex tends, the deficiencies in our manpower programs.

description: To the Editor:

title: Opening the Seven Locks
description: Publication of extensive extracts from Khrushchev Remembers in Life magazine and various foreign publi cations has naturally aroused worldwide interest. While at first some question had been raised, on this page and elsewhere, about the authenticity of the manuscript, now appears most likely that these are indeed the words of Nikita S. Khrushchev. If so, Khrushchev Remembers will be regarded as a major contribution to the history the midtwentieth century despite individual errors of fact and despite the evident selfserving character of much of the narrative.

title: 1956 Rioting Recalled By Gdansk Violence
description: WARSAW, Dec. 16The violence in Gdansk for the last two days recalls tha 1956 Poznan riots in which 53 peo ple died and 300 were wound ed in clashes with the police. The Poznan riots, like the new ones, were officially at tributed to hooligans and ad venturers.

title: St. Paul's Sets Back St. George's In School Hockey at Garden, 61
description: The St. Paul's School hockey team made its annual Christ mas vacation appearance in New York yesterday, and the visit to Madison Square Garden was a successful one. The Con cord (N. title: Furuyama Keeps OrientTitle
description: SENDAI, Japan, Dec. 16 (AP)  Lion Furuyama of Japan gained a unanimous 12round decision over Chu EuiTai of South Korea today and retained his Orient junior welterweight title. Furuyama weighed 139 1/2 pounds, Chu 138.

title: Executive Changes
description: Ward Foods, Inc., announced the appointment of four group presidents. Jeff Jaffe, who had been president of the Ward Candy Company, becomes group president of the Ward Candy, Chocolate and Biscuit Group. Irving Farber becomes group presi dent of the Continental Seafood subsidiary and number of other seafood, trawling and commodity operations and a Bermudabased insurance com pany. Alvin Gould will head a group which brings together all of Ward'efood and agricultural equip ment manufacturing facilities. Robert T. Gould becomes president responsible for a group of com panies located primarily on the West Coast.

description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 16John R. Rice.Jr.,,a 17year old honor Student and high ranking Roy Scout, was re turned here today to face murder charge in connection With the slayings of his mother, hrother, sister and grand mother.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 The National Highway Safety Bureau confirmed reports today that some of its officials and engineers are testing cars sup plied by automobile manufac turers by driving them to and from work.

description: PEORIA, III Dec. 16 (AP); Bradley University, which played intercollegiate football since 1897, dropped football from its athletic program. today for economic reasons.

title: Food Enough for Everyone
description: BRECKIN, ScotlandHalf the popu lation of the world is suffering from lack of food and the population is growing at a rate which will double it In thirty years. Based on these esti mates there have been predictions of famines in the immediate future and a world food crisis of staggering proportions by 1985. These alarming predictions Warrant serious considera tion of the amount of food the earth can be made to produce and of how long the explosion of population may continue.

title: Rockefeller Names New Commissioner of Correction
description: ALBANY, Dec. 16  Gover nor Rockefeller today, an nounced the appointment of Russell G. Oswald, an expert in criminal rehabilitation and cur rent], the chairman of the State Board of Parole, as the state's new Commissioner of Correction.

title: The Met's Anniversary Tribute: Thoughtful Fidelio
description: The most solid of tributes to Beethoven on his 200th birthday, a new production of his only opera, was the Metropolitan Opera's con tribution to the centennial. Fidelio was given last night, timed to the exact day. Thus this city held up its head on a day when Bee thoven anniversaries were being celebrated in many cities of the world.

description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 16 (AP) The search continued today for a fourth juror in the Black Panther kidnapmurder trial of Bobby Seale and Mrs. Ericka Huggins. The seventh panel of veniremen was exhausted in the process.

Beethoven Memorialized Many Ways
description: In New York, they scrubbed his statue, played his only opera and held a dinner and reception in his honor at the Met. In Los Angeles, they held a 12hour marathon per formance of his music. In Vienna, where he lived most of his life and composed his greatest works, there were graveside ceremonies, a wreath was placed on his monument and a new mu seum was dedicated to him. And in Moscow, he was eulo gized as a musical reformer whose work was inspired by the humanistic ideals of the French Revolution.

title: 3 in Mishima Group Indicted
description: TOKYO, Dec. 17 (Reuters) Three members of Yukio Mishi ma's private army were indict ed today on charges arising from the author's ritual suicide at an army headquarters here three weeks ago. The Tokyo District Prosecutor's Office in dicted Hiroyasu Koga, aged 23, Masayoshi Koga; 22, and Masa hiro Ogawa, 22, on charges of execution by request, confine ment, causing injury, commit ting an act of violence and co ercion.

title: Pleas of Guilty Are Reported At Leningrad Hijacking Trial
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 17 (UPI) Court officials said today that most of the defendants on trial in Leningrad for attempting to hijack an airliner had pleaded guilty and had admitted work ing for international Zionism.

description: The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation announced the arrest here last night of Judith A. Clark, one of 12 leaders of the Weathermen who were indict ed by a Federal grand jury in Chicago last April 2 on charges of conspiracy and violation of the Federal antiriot act.

title: Sweet Smell of Victory Draws 4 Good Losers
description: MACKINAC ISLAND, Mich., Dec. 17 (UPI)  Four high schools that have only 157 pupils among them meet this weekend in what is billed as the world's smallest holiday basketball tournament and is known locally as the tour ney of good losers. The finals will be broadcast Sat urday by a local radio sta tion.

title: How to Stop a Burglar

It Could Stop a BurglaryYour Own, it contains 50 steps that shopkeepers, factory owners and other businessmen can take to discourage burglars and sneak thieves. It will be dise tributed by policemen in all patrol precincts, or copies may be obtained by writing to thc Office of Public. Information, Police Headquarters, 240 Centre Street, New York, N. Y. 10013.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Through a Congressional barter over American assist ance to schools and nursing homes in Israel, the Administra tion may at long last obtain its desired authority to extend easy credit to foreign coun tries purchasing American arms.

title: DR. SCHUELEIN DIES; EXRHEINGOLD CHIEF
description: Dr. Hermann Schuelein, who retired in 1960 as chairman of the board and chief executive officer of Rheingold Breweries in 1960, died Tuesday at his home, 1136 Fifth Avenue. His axe was 86.

title: SNOWFALL CLOSES SCHOOLS UPSTATE

title: MRS. B. B. HICKENLOOPER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) Mrs. Verna E. Hickenlooper, wife of former Senator Bourke B. Hickenlooper, Republican of Iowa, died today in Georgetown University Hospital. She was 73 years old and had suffered from a heart ailment for several years.

title: Canadians to Release Scanlan's When Registration Is Submitted
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 17The legal adviser to the Montreal Police Department said tonight that it had no objection to the re lease of 102,000 seized copies of Scanian's Monthly, an Amer ican magazine, once a formal registration requirement was satisfied.

title: Kennedy InLaws Divorced
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 17 (UPI)  The parents of Joan Kennedy, wife of Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, have been granted a divorce in Brevard County Circuit Court after 35 years of marriage. Mr. and Mrs. Harry Bennett of Cocoa Beach were granted the divorce Nov. 24, records showed today, be cause of certain disputes, dif ferences and disagreements.

description: The Bach Aria Group marked Beethoven's 200th birthday Wednesday night at Tully Hall with a generous program of, not surprisingly, Bach arias. Ludwig himself, wholehearted admirer of the Leipzig cantor, probably would have approved: the uplifting nature of Bach's cantata texts an4 music seemed an entirely fitting celebration of the occasion.

Seaboard Coast Line has for years owned 33 per cent of Louisville & Nashville's

title: The Game of Soccer Has Become the Fastest Growing Sport in the United States

title: Executive Changes
description: Lawrence S. Huntington has been elected presi dent of the Fiduciary Company of New York. He succeeds Harry W. Fowler who will continue as chairman and chief executive officer. Mr. Hunting ton, 35 years old, has been executive vice president in charge of the investment department since 1968, and a member of the board since April of this year. The company has $1.5billion under management, and an additional $1billion in custody accounts.

title: The Issue: Daylight Savings
description: Let us try to think about another aspect of our environment: light and darkness. Remember how pleasant was when we had an hour's extra daylight in the afternoon? Why do we have to wait until the end of April to have this blessing?

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Commerce Department today, estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $8,449,000, 000, up 4 per cent from the yearearlier $8,157,000,000. Last week's total retail sales were about $1,369,000,000, up 1 per cent from $1,356,000,000.

title: HANOI REBUFFED ON PULLOUT DATE
description: PARIS, Dec. 17North Viet nam invited the United States today to suggest a reasonable deadline for the withdrawal of its forces from South Vietnam since it had rejected the dead line of next June 30 that the Communist side had proposed.

title: Rioting Over Hard Life in Poland Led to Golden October of 1956
description: It was a riot set off by hard living conditions that began the events that Poles now nostal gically call the golden Oc tober of 1956. Workers in the industrial city of Poznan took to the streets in June over low wages and high prices, and by October the issue had broad ened into an uprising against the Soviet Union's political, military and economic strangle hold.

title: LowCholesterol Recipes From a Meat Loaf Maven
description: Dr. Jeremiah Stamler, who describes himself as a meat loaf maven, yesterday offered his lowfat, low cholesterol recipe for this and other dishes to Americans who, want to pre serve their arteries and prevent premature heart attacks.

title: PRICES ARE DOWN ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market moved lower in quiet trading yesterday. Profit taking follow ing the market's recent rally and general lack of buyers were the main reasons for the decline in which special situa tions dominated tradine.

title: BILL ON JOB SAFETY IS SENT TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  The House concluded a three. year battle between Congres sional supporters of business interestsa nd organized labor and gave final approved today to a broad occupational health and safety bill establishing Federal supervision over work ing conditions.

title: Snow Cancels Racing
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Dec. 17 (AP)Lincoln Downs canceled today's and tomorrow's racing programs because of a storm that dropped more than severt inches of snow before turning to rain. Last. Saturday's pro gram was canceled and only two races were run on Monday.

title: Quotations Curb Charged
description: DALLAS, Dec. 17A Dallas securities concern filed a suit today charging that a decision by the National Association of Securities Dealers to exclude listed securities from a new automated quotation system was illegal under the Federal antitrust laws.

description: BONN, Dec. 17Chancellor Willy Brandt told his Cabinet today that the outlook for an EastWest agreement on the Berlin problem had improved as a result of information he had received from the four powers currently negotiating on the issue.

title: U.S. Rejects Criticism by Soviet of Bombing Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The United States today rebuffed a stern Soviet denunciation of Anwtican bombing policy on North Vietnam and urged Mos cow to persuade Hanoi to stop shooting at American recon naissance planes.

description: Hours before the extradition stay of Angela Davis expired yesterday, a Federal judge here granted a stay until today.

title: Liston Arrested on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 17 (UPI)  The former world heavyweight champion, Sonny Liston, was free on bail today following his arrest on sus picion of drunken driving on a freeway last night.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17 (AP)  The Maxwell Club named Jim Plunkett, the Stanford quarterback, and George Blanda, the quarter back and placekicker of the Oakland Raiders, as the out standing college and pro foot ball players of 1970.

description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 17 (UPI)Santa Anita racetrack will offer exacta wagering at the winter meeting opening Dec. 26.

The gift comprises more than 300,000 pieces of authors correspond ence, editorial and publishing records and other documents, covering the period from the founding of the publishing house in 1927 to the midnine teensixties.
