title: Mrs. Meir Receives Note On Talks From U.S. Envoy
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 17 (UPI) Premier Golda Meir met with United States Ambassador Wal worth Barbour today and formally received the latest United States note on proposed resumption of Middle East peace talks. Mrs. Meir said later that Israel would return to the talks only after 'care ful examination of all the issues involved.

title: All You Can Eat Not Bad for $2.75
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Gulf Gamble
description: The Federal Government and the oil. companies are again playing Texas roulette with the nation's marine resources. After a twoyear hiatus, the Interior Depart ment has auctioned off new oil and gas drilling leases in the Gulf of Mexico. The oil companies bid more than $850 million.

title: Air India Strike Ends
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 17 (Reu ters)Air India's international and domestic airline employes began returning to work today after a oneday strike to pro test the use of air force pilots to provide some internal air service. The stateowned air line agreed to withdraw the air force pilots for two days while continuing negotiations in dispute with its own pilots.

title: 3 Drug Suspects Shot by the Police On the East Side
description: Three men believed to be narcotics pushers were shot, one of them fatally, yesterday afternoon when they allegedly attacked and slashed an under cover narcotics detective who was attempting to arrest them in a hallway on the Lower East Side, the police reported.

title: DR. HAROLD MORRIS, A CHINA MISSIONARY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17 Dr. Harold H. Morris, a retired medical missionary for the Episcopal Church, who had served at St. Luke's Hospital in Shanghai and as professor of medicine at St. John's Univer sity there, died today in Bryn Mawr Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at St. Si mons Island, Ga.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Nixon Criticized on Choice For Rail Passenger Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17In an almost empty hearing room on Capitol Hill today, Senator Lee Metcalf quietly assailed the Nixon Administration for having named a former White House aide, Daniel W. Hofgren, to the financial advisory panel of the new National Railroad Passenger Corporation.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES LOSE EARLY GAINS
description: Profit taking tent soybean and grains futures contracts down yesterday after several advances.

title: Circus Adds Performances
description: Additional matinees and morning performances have been added to the engagement of the Moscow Circus on Ice, playing at the Felt Madison Square Garden Center through Jan. 3. Extra. shows at 2 P.M. are set for Dec. 31 and Jan. 1, while performances at 10:30 AM. have been added for Dec. 26, Dec. 28 through 31 and Jan. 2. Halfprive admissions will apply at the extra per formances for children under 12 years.

title: Daley Enters Race For a Fifth Term As Chicago Mayor
description: CHICAGO, Ill., Dec. 17  Richard J. Daley announced to day that he would seek a fifth term as Mayor of Chicago.

title: Russel Captures World Cup Giant Slalom at Val di`Isere
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 17On the type of icy, hard and fast track on which he is almost unbeatable, Patrick Russel of France won the men's giant slalom today at. the Criterium of the Firt Snow.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
2 Pakistani Parties Take Leads in Provinces
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Friday, Dec. 18A party that seeks full regional al autonomy for East Pakistan and another that pledges a redistribution of wealth along Marxist lines took big leads early today over other political parties and hundreds of independent candidates in elections to five provincial as semblies.

title: MRS. KEVIN M`LOUGHLIN
description: Mrs. Lucy Harrison McLough lin, wife of Kevin McLoughlin, a management consultant, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital, after a short illness. She was 55 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: Hercules Chairman to Retire
description: Hercules, Inc., announced yesterday that Henry A. Thour on, chairman of the board, vice chairman of the executive com mittee and a member of the finance committee, will retire Jan. 1 after more than 36 years with the company.

title: Coach Who Caught a Punch Calls for the Barring of Players Who Throw Them
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 17 (UPI)  Charles (Lefty) Driesell, the Maryland bask etball coach, called today for suspension of any college player caught throwing a punch in a game.

title: Michigan Judge Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) =The Senate confirmed today the nomination of Albert J. Engle of Michigan to be a Fed eral judge in the western dis trict of the state. Judge Engel is now a county judge in Mus is now a county judge in Mus kegon.

title: N. Y. YACHT CLUB REELECTS EWING
description: The members of the New York Yacht Club learned the itinerary of their annual racing cruise, elected all their officers and got a little additional in formation.laSt night about the current situation in the Amer ica's Cup, which theirclub will defend in 1973.

title: U.S. Is Said to Plan Pullout of 10,000 Troops in Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 17 (UPI) Kyodo news agency said today that the United States and Japan had agreed on with drawal of 10,000 American servicemen and a large num ber of Phantom jet aircraft from Japan by next June 30. There were also reports of cutback in United States Sev enth Fleet installations.

title: Dust Commander Far. Back As Choice at Tropical Park
description: MIAMI, Dec. 17 (AP)Dust Commander, the 1970 Kentucky Derby winner, made his winter debut in the ninth race at Tropi cal Park today and finished next to last. The 95 favorite was 17 lengths back of the winner.

title: Blackman Receives Award as East's Coach of Year
description: Bob Blackman, whose un defeated Dartmouth football team won the Ivy League title, was given the Joseph M. Sheehan Memorial Award yesterday as the East's ma jorcollege coach of the year. The New York Football Writ ers Association, which named Blackman for the award, also gave Bill McDonald of Edin boro (Pa.) State the trophy as the East's smallcollege coach of the year.

title: Advertising: Grooming Extra Betting Help
description: It's nice doing business with the OffTrack Betting Corporationthey keep you up with what they're doing.

title: Opponent of Supersonic Transport
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 When William Proxmire came East as boy to attend high school at Pottstown, Pa., his classmates voted him the biggest grind. In many ways as a member of the United States Senate he still isa grinding critic of waste ful Government spending and

title: Fresh Thoughts on South Africa
description: PRINCETONIt may be best to go first to the problem that is the most difficult and recalcitrant of all as well as being the one that involves the largest number of people, namely, that of South Africa itself.

title: Brokerage House Is Sued by Wolfson
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 17 (AP)Louis E. Wolfson filed $50million damage suit today I against 72 partners of a New York brokerage house and Jacksonville employe of the firm, blaming them for events that contributed to his serving a Federal orison term

title: Dr. Bernard Goldbaum, 68, General Practitioner Here
description: Dr. Bernard Goldbaum, general practitioner, died Wednesday of a heart attack at his home, 991 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn. His age was 68.

title: Man Guilty in Tax Case
description: David Wenger, 60 year old, of Great Neck, L. I., was con victed yesterday in Brooklyn Federal Court on charges of income taxe evasion for fail ing to report a $15,000 kick back he allegedly received In 1963. The Government had contended that Wenger an ac contended for a Teamster's pen sion fund, for the .kickback for arranging a $150,000 loan from Local 11 of the Hotel and Restaurant Worker's Union for a Manhattan consultant firm, Handy Associates, Inc.

title: Money and Bank Credit Expand; TaxExempt Bond Yields Firm
description: Money and bank credit ex panded at a moderate pace during the last few weeks, banking figures published yes terday showed. But corporate loan demand at major New York City banks was notably slack over the Dec. 15 date, when company tax payments are due, thus heightening the expectation that one of these institutions will shortly take) the initiative to cut its prime rate.

title: Dissidents in Soviet Union Are Facing a Crackdown
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 17The So viet leadership threatened to day to crack down on a small group of political dissidents who have become increasingly outspoken in the last two years and have attracted considera ble attention in the West.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Dean Who Was Ousted at Texas Named President of Boston U.
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17  Dr. John R. Silber, the philosopher who gained national attention last summer when he was dismissed as dean of arts and sciences at the University of Texas in battle with the school's con servative regents, was ap pointed today as the seventh president of Boston University.

title: Cardinal Cooke, in Korea, Visiting Troops at DMZ
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 17, (UPI)Cardinal Cooke, Arch bishop of New York, presided at mass today at the compound of the Eighth United States Army headquarters and flew to the front lines to visit troops of the Second Infantry divi sion.

title: Nader and Six Young Assistants Call on the Federal Government to Raise. Nursing Home Standards
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Ralph Nader and six teenage women assistants told Congress today that the Federal Gov ernment should apply financial leverage as well as adminis trative leadership to improve conditions in nursing homes be cause Federal dollars pay half the bills.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS 16.2% DROP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Dec. 12 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: Housing Starts and Personal Income Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Housing starts rose strongly again, to an annual rate of 1,692,000 in November, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: No Medina Denial Planned
description: FORT MCPHERSON, Ga. Dec. 17 (UPI)An attorney for Cap tain Medina indicated today that the captain would not deny that lie :au ordered the leveling of My I,ai and the slaughter of the Vietnamese village's inhabi tants.

title: Music: Aliciade Larrocha
description: Until Wednesday night, this listener, in 20 years of professional concertgoing had not heard a piano glis, sando played so seductively that it sent shivers down his back. But Alicia de Larrocha did one that way in her in terpretation of Ravel's Al borada del Gracioso at Philharmonic Hall, and it was something never to be for gotten.

title: WHITE POLICEMAN FREED IN AUGUSTA
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., Dec. 17A white policeman was acquitted today on charges of violating the civil rights of a Negro teen ager, killed in rioting last May. The white community was re lieved but not surprised by the verdict.

title: Casper, Miss Englehorn Get Golf Digest Awards
description: Billy Casper and Shirley Englehorn were named yes terday as winners of Golf Digest magazine's awards to the golfers with the most tournament victories of the Year.

title: Texts of Premier's Statement and of Communique
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Following, as monitored in Washington, are the texts of a speech to the Polish people delivered today by Premier Jozef Cyrankiewicz and a communiqu issued by his office:

title: 3 STRUCK SHOWS REOPEN TONIGHT
description: Off Broadway curtains will go up tonight on two of the original 17 shows darkened by the monthlong Off Broadway theater strike settled on Wednesday.

title: Hagan to Coach South Stars
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 17 (AP)Harold (Bo) Hagan, head football coach at Rice, was named today to replace Jim Pittman on the South coaching staff for the Blue Gray game here Dec. 28. Pitt man, formerly of Tulane, ac cepted a position as head coach at Texas Christian earlier this week.

title: Ohio Issue Snapped Up
description: The taxexempt bond mar ket, which has been adrift for much of the last week, reached solid ground yesterday.

title: BACHE &
description: Bache & Co., the nation's secondlargest brokerage house, issued a financial report yester day that put a dollarsand cents evaluation on the turn around in the profitability of the securities industry.

title: Gott Gloomy on Chances for a Peaceful Solution Price Rises Seen
description: Edwin H. Gott chairman of the United States Steel Cor poration, the nation's largest steel producer, yesterday paint ed a gloomy picture of the chances for a peaceful, nonin flationary labor settlement with the United Steelworkers of America next summer.

title: 29 Americans Reported Killed in War Last Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 17 (Al)  With battle field action continuing, at a rel atively low level, the United States command reported to day that 29 Americans were killed in fighting in Indochina last week.

title: Hardin Foresees Changes In Common Market Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) Secretary of Agriculture Clif ford M. Hardin said today he was optimistic that the Euro pean Common Market would move in the near future to liberalize some trade policies with the United States.

title: Display Spurs Related Events
description: Coincident with the Stein family collection at the Museum of Modern Art are a number of related events.

title: Veal and Potatoes for the Weekend Chef
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Bank Executive in Pakistan Takes Issue With Article
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Dec. 17 S. S. Khalid Khan, an executive of the American Express bank here, has taken issue with an article about the political situ ation in Pakistan that appeared in The New York Times last Sunday.

title: Lindsay Urges Suburbs to Alter Laws to Provide Workers Homes
description: Mayor Lindsay called on communities surrounding the city yesterday to ease their zoning restrictions on apart ment houses and make room for bluecollar workers whose jobs have taken them to the suburbs.

title: Dent's 201 Takes Calf Event
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 17 (AP)Closing with 67 for a 15underpar total of 201, Jim Dent of Los Angeles won the $15,000 Sabel Palm open golf tournament by seven strokes today.

title: Erik Bruhn Weighs Several Ballet Options
description: After a 25year career that hSs made him one of ballet's greatest stars, Erik Bruhn, a royallooking Dane, would like to dance Hamlet.

title: Old. Glory Sale Brings $578,800 For 208 Horses
description: YONKERS, Dec. 17  Three yearolds brought the four top bids at the third annual winter Old Glory Sale at Yonkers Raceway today. With 1,200 per sons in attendance, 208 standardbreds were sold for $578,800, an average of $2,782 a head.

title: 10TH VICTIM DIES OF BLAST INJURIES
description: The 10th victim of a blast and fire that wrecked an old threestory building at the tip of City Hall Park died yester day.

title: Royster Plans Busy Future
description: Vermont Royster, who has been teaching the humanities and other graces on Wall Street for a long time and making them love it there, is sure that he still has a great deal to say about the odd shape of many things.

title: John Best, 49, Chairman Of CTS Corp. of Elkhart
description: CULVER, Ind., Dec. 17 (AP) John G. Best, chairman of CTS Corporation of Elkhart, was found dead today in his car in the garage of his sum mer residence on Lake Maxin kuckee. He was 49 years old.

title: Children's Parley Dissidents Score War and SST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 17(AP)  A chaotic rump session of the White House Conference on Children adopted resolu tions tonight against the Viet nam war and the supersonic transport. The delegates also demanded Programs to feed all the hungry people in America.

title: 108 Bids Accepted On OilLease Sites Off Louisiana Coast
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 17 (AP)  The Interior Depart ment today accepted 108 bids for drilling space in the oil rich sea bottom off Louisiana's western coast. They totaled $845,832,785. Bids on 11 tracts were rejected as being too low.

title: Lefkowitz Supports a Bill To Supervise Art Exhibits
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday that he would recommend a bill to the 1971 Legislature to provide for supervision of all art exhibitions here.

title: Rich Guatemalan Abducted
description: GUATEMALA CITY, Dec. 17 (UPI)Robert Gabriel, one of Guatemala's wealthiest busi nessmen, has been kidnapped and is being held for $300,000 ransom, his family said today. The family said Mr. Gabriel was abducted Monday by a group of men who forced him into a car. Mr. Gabriel's brother, Jose, was kidnapped last year and released upon payment of $150,000 ransom.

title: Books of The Times
description: Once when Anne Fremantle was at col lege, she thought she'd like to try an essay on J. M. Synge. She went to Lady Augusta Gregory for help. The lady felt that an heiress with such obvious ability should be speedily served with a husband and she set out to secure one. There were a few

title: News Summary and index
description: FRIDAY. DECEMBER 18. 1970

title: Stock Group Backs Uniting Of Clearing Corporations
description: The Association of Stock Ex change Firms, a group of nearly 500 member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, indicated yesterday that it would press for a consolidation of the clear corporations of the New York and American Stock Ex changes.

title: Thai Cyclists Win Three Gold Medals At Bangkok Games,
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 17 (AP)For the first time in eight days of Asian Games competition, Japan failed today to win a single medal. How ever, the Japanese gave India a surprisingly stiff battle in the field hockey semifinals.

title: COLONELS SURGE TOPS FLORIDIANS
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 17 (AP) Joe Ligon scored 28 points, including 12 of 19 free throws, to lead the Kentucky Colonels to victory over the Floridians, 126123, tonight in an American Basketball Association game.DENVER, Dec. 17 (AP)The Memphis Pros, who arrived several hours late because of a snowstorm in Salt Lake City, started slowly tonight and never caught up as they lost to the Denver Rockets, 10899.

title: Rx for Cairo Traffic Jams: Bicycles
description: CAIRO, Dec. 17The people of Cairo, tormented by over crowded buses and trolleys, are to be urged to put aside status considerations and ride to work by bicycle.

title: Dr. King Holiday Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI) A committee of Congression al leaders and others today re newed a drive to have the Jan. 15 birthday of the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. declared a national holiday

title: Two Russian Divisions Are Stationed in Poland
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.17  A State Department source said today that the Soviet Union had two divisions sta tioned in Poland, and has had for a number of years.

title: Hunt Takes a Bad Turn
description: LUDGERHSALL, England, Dec. 17 (UPI)Organizers of a local hunt have apologized to a retired farmer, Frank Mole, for an incident in which 20 hounds chased a fox into his home and killed it in the sitting room. They have also offered to pay for any repairs.

title: Strike Retreat in Britain ...
description: The decision of the British electrical workers to call off their slowdown is an important symbolic victory for Prime Minister Heath and the new Conservative Govern ment. The Heath strategy to halt wage inflation depends heavily upon the Government's setting a good example to private employers in its own dealings with unions in the nationalized industries.

title: Timing of Price Rises Before Holiday Provided a Spark for Gdansk Turmoil
description: WARSAW, Dec. 17The riots that began Monday In Gdansk were touched off by a weekend price rise that represented a last straw to some Poles.

title: All in Line of Duty
description: COLUMBIA, S. C. Dec. 17 (AP)Driesell said after the game last night he was try ing to stop the fight when he was punched.

title: 100,000 Madrid Demonstrators Shout Their Support of Franco
description: MADRID, Dec. 17  The largest crowd Madrid has seen in 25 years, except perhaps at football games, gathered today to shout its support for Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: Wards to Cut Dividend
description: RICHMOND, Va., Dec. 17 (UPI)Wards Company direc tors today announced plans to cut the next quarterly dividend in half because of the uncertain retail climate. The company said is next declaration in Jan uary will be 5 cents a share, compared with the 10 cents per share dividend paid in No vember.

title: CITY TO SPONSOR HEROIN RESEARCH
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city would sponsor a major research pro gram to develop a longlasting, nonaddictive drug for heroin addiction to replace methadone.

title: BidRigging Plot Is Laid To Meat Renderers Here
description: Twelve leading rendering companies that make soap and other products from meat trimmings were indicted yes terday on charges of a conspiracy to rig bids and suppress competition in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Havlicek and Covens Help Celtics Defeat Braves, 10293
description: BOSTON; Dec. 17 (AP)The Boston Celtics rallied with the help of John Havlicek and Dave Cowens tonight after Jo Jo White had kept them in the game to post a 10293 victory over the Buffalo Braves in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Coast Guard Official Named
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17 (AP)Rear Adm. Robert W. Goehring, Coast Guard chief of staff, was appointed acting commander of the First Coast Guard District today. He assumes a post va cant since Nov. 27 when Rear Adm. William B. Ellis was re lieved of duties pending an in vestigation of the unsuccessful defection attempt of a Lithua nian seaman off Martha's Vine yard.

title: KEATING DROPPED AS TV NEWS AIDE
description: Michael F. Keating was dis missed yesterday as news di rector of WCBSTV. He was re placed by Ed Joyce, a radio newsman for the station's par ent company, the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: A SENATE TACTIC VIRTUALLY DOOMS VOTE ON WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  The chief critic of President Nixon's welfare reform plan, Senator John J. Williams, sprang a parliamentary trap on its supporters today, virtually insuring that it would not come to a Senate vote this year, much less become law.

title: Treasury Statement
description: WASHINGTON,. Dec. 17Cash deposits and withdrawals, close of business, Dec.

title: No Shift at Top Mentioned in Darryl Zanuck Memo
description: Darryl F. Zanuck, chairman and chief executive officer of the Twentieth Century  Fox Film Corporation, issued a letter to the company's em ployes yesterday amid wide speculation that toplevel man agement changes are in the works.

title: Man Seized at Space Base After Phoned Bomb Threat
description: COCOA, Fla., Dec. 17 (AP) Space agency officials tight, ened security at Cape Kennedy Space Center tonight after telephone caller warned the Federal Bureau of Investigation of an attempt to blow up the facility.

title: $15,600 for Monet Print
description: LONDON. Dec. 17 (UN)A print by Edouard Monet brought $15,600 at Sotheby's todaya record auction price for a Monet print. The print, a first edition of the lithograph Les Courses, was offered for, sale by Lord Butler of Saffron Walden. The buyer asked to remain anonymous. The print dates to 1864.

title: Frank A. Cosgrove, Officer Of Johnson &
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 17 Frank A. Cosgrove, former treasurer of Johnson & John son, died last night at the University of Pennsylvania Hos pital, Philadelphia. He was 77 years old and lived at 148 Hodge Road here.

title: RECORD OUTPUT OF CARS PLANNED
description: DETROIT, Dec. 17  The automobile industry is gearing up to produce 2.6 million cars for the first quarter next year, which would be a record for the three months.

title: Quarterly Net Off 42% at Harvester Despite Sales Rise
description: The International Harvester Company attained record sales in the fiscal year ended Oct. 31, with higher fourthquarter volume, but annual earnings fell 17.8 per cent and the quarter profit plunged 42 per cent, the report disclosed yesterday.

title: 110 of 166 Nurses Quit in Brooklyn In a Pay Dispute
description: A group of 110 of the 166 staff nurses at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn re signed yesterday because a sal ary increase was rescinded.

title: Bonnies Top Army, 5851; Niagara Sets Back L.I.U.
description: Army's tough, physical de fense was not enough last night at Madison Square Gar den. The cadets didn't have the shooting to go with it. Shut off without a basket for the final 5 minutes 34 seconds of play they were beaten by St. Bonaventure, 5851, in the sec ond game of a doubleheader in which a total of 100 turn overs were committed by the four teams.

title: Teacher Beaten Unconscious, Washington High Student Held
description: A young woman English teacher at the recently opened ninthgrade annex of troubled George Washington High School was found badly beaten and unconscious yesterday after noon in a thirdfloor staff washroom.

title: Layer's Earnings Exceed $200,000 for 70 Pro Tour
description: DALLAS, Dec. 17 (AP)Rod Laver of Australia, voted the top international tennis player for 1970, has become the first professional to win more than $200,000 in prize money in one year.

title: Manhattan Topples Wagner, 9078, as Seawright Scores 24 Points
description: Wagner battled Manhattan on even terms through the first half last night, but bowed to the Jaspers secondhalf attack, 9078, at Sutter Gymnasium, Staten Island.

title: Pav Rise Is Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) A pay rise estimated at $106 million to $145million for about 400,000 Federal blue collar workers was passed by Congress today and sent to President. Nixon.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: CoinTossing Over Phone
description: If the toss of a coin is needed to determine which secondplace finisher in the National Conference of the Na tional Football League goes on into the playoffs, it will take place immediately after Sun day's games through a tele phone .hookup, Commissioner Pete Rozelle announced yester day. Details of the exact pro cedure were still being nego tiated by the parties concerned.

title: Santa Arrives Early for 3 Mets, Bearing 1971 Contracts
description: The Mets decorated several Christmas trees at Shea Sta dium yesterday while Gen eral Manager Bob. Scheffing continued to spread the spir it of a thirdplace Santa Claus by, signing three more players.

title: Philadelphia Starts Again on 1976 Bicentennial After Government Calls Plan Too Costly
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17  The board of directors of the Philadelphia 1976 Bicentennial Corporation scrapped today its $1.2billion master plan for an international exposition to cele brate the nation's 200th birthday.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: BIG BOARD GAINS AS TRADING EASES; Dow, in Plus Territory ?? Day, Climbs 3.08 Points to Close at 822.15; VOLUME IS 13.66 MILLION; Winners Outpace Losers by 814 to 515Memorex Falls to'54, Off 53/4
description: Two questions that swept repeatedly along raindotted Wall Street yesterday were How's the market? and How's Memorex?

title: INTELLIGENCE AIDE IS SLAIN IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 17 A Lebanese Army intelligence officer was killed today by masked men with machine guns as he waited for a taxi in a Beirut suburb. The police said the men escaped in two cars.

title: Harness Track Brings Suit
description: ALBANY, Dec. 17Saratoga Raceway filed suit in State Supreme Court today to have the New York OffTrack Bet ting Law declared unconstitu tional.

title: MERCURY IN TUNA IS FOUND IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Dec. 17Poi sonous mercury has been found in samples of tinned tuna fish taken from British shops for analysis by the laboratory of the Government Chemist.

title: Nuclear Fuel Delivered
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Com pany's commercial nuclear fuel plant near Lynchburg, Va., made its first shipment of fuel yesterday. The initial shipment 12 nuclear fuel assemblies valued at more than $1million was destined for the Duke Power Company's threeunit Oconee nuclear power plant near Clemson, S. C. Babcock & Wilcox has orders for nuclear fuel assemblies worth more than $400million. The first unit of the Duke Power plant is expected to begin operating commercially in September, 1971.

title: PENTAGON WIDENS RULES TO PREVENT RACIAL INEQUITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  The Defense Department issued tough directives today to en force racial equality in the armed forces after it had re ceived a report detailing frus ??ation and anger among black troops in West Germany.

title: NEGOTIATORS SEEK FUEL STRIKE PACT
description: The two sides in the fuel oil deliverers strike resumed nego tiations yesterday as city offi cials reported an increasing stream of complaints of no heat.

title: Samuels Seeks Law Exempting Offtrack Gains From State Tax
description: Howard J. Samuels, head of the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation, said yes terday that legislation would be sought to exempt all offtrack winnings from state income taxes.

title: SABRES. TOP KINGS ON DUFF GOAL 43
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 17 (UPI) Dick Duff's goal on a relay from Gerry Meehan with 6 min utes 49 seconds, remaining en abled the Buffalo Sabres to snap a fivegame National Hockey League losing streak tonight, with a 43 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Stans Says Slump Hurt Minority Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 The Nixon Administration's major effort under its minority capitalism program suffered in the fiscal year 1970 because of the economic slump, Secre tary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said today.

title: Rigidity on Manpower Reform
description: President Nixon's veto of the manpower bill is an expression of executive inflexibility that will disadvan tage both the unemployed and the cities that could use their services in productive public jobs.

title: Pope Recovering From Flu
description: ROME, Dec. 17  Pope Paul VI. is to broadcast a Christmas message,;to the world from the central balcony of St. Peter's Basilica a noon on Dec. 25, the Vaticanannounced today. A Vatican'.SPokesman said that the Pope was recovering from influenza and was expected to carry out a full schedule of ac tivities during Christmas and New Year's.

title: Striking Cabbies Clash Here With the Police Again
description: Striking, cabbies clashed with policemen again yesterday as the standoff continued in the I3dayold taxi strike.

title: Tombs Dismisses Guard Trainee Who Carried Inmates Note to the Mayor
description: A correction officer trainee, used by rebellious inmates of the Tombs two months ago to deliver a list of their griev ances to Mayor Lindsay, has been dismissed by the Correc tion Department because, his work was below the standard reauired.

title: Oscar Lewis, Author and Anthropologist, Dead
description: Oscar Lewis, the anthropolo gist famous for his unsparingly vivid accounts of family life among Mexican and Puerto Ri can slum dwellers, died of a heart attack Wednesday eve ning at Polyclinic Hospital. He was 55 years of age.

title: Catholic Bishops Are Meeting on Schools
description: MUNDELEIN, Ill., Dec. 17 Five cardinals and 36 bishops of the Roman Catholic Church converged on an isolated re treat house here today to dis cuss the financial crisis in pa rochial school education.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Back in the days when Fran Tarkenton did his scrambling for the still struggling Minnesota Vikings under the disapproving gaze of the Viking coach, Norm Van Brock lin, an unseemly and inordinate number of surprise packages were handed the Los Angeles Rams by the slick quarterback. As an expansion team, the Vikes had vir tually nothine.

title: Aerospace Outlook in 71 Called Bleak; U.S. Steel Chief Wary on Labor Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 The aerospace industry re ported in a selfanalysis today that it had a bad year in 1970 and that 1971 would be worse.

title: CHAMBER OPPOSES CITY SALARY RISES
description: The New York Chamber of Commerce urged the city yes terday to face the reality of a budget deficit and not grant untenable salary and pension increases to city employes.

title: College Placement Counselors Find Sharp Drop in Job Offers
description: Placement counselors at col leges in the metropolitan area, alarmed by a sharp drop in job offers for students, are warning members of the class of '71 that they will be grad uating into a bleak, recession constricted career market.

title: Conferees Kill Plan for Covering Mass Transit Systems Losses
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI)  House  Senate negotiators killed a $750pillion program today under which the Federal Government, for the first time, would have helped cities cover the deficits of mass transit systems.

title: Market Place:
description: The reverberations of I.B.M.'s new capability in computer memory devices and a Memorex earnings trim continued to take their toll in Wall Street yesterday.

title: Bridge:
description: The Winter Tournament of the Greater New York Bridge Association begins today at the New York Hilton with the following schedule: today, Men's and Women's Pairs at 2 P.M. and Mixed Pairs and Novice Pairs at 8 P.M.; to morrow, Swiss Pairs at 1:30 P.M. and 7:30 P.M., and Sun day, Open Teams at 1 P.M. and 7 P.M.

title: First Heavy Snow Falls On North Country Slopes

title: Serkin Slated to Play 4 Beethoven Programs
description: Rudolf Serkin, who com pleted a series of four Beetho ven piano recitals at Carne gie Hall on Wednesday, will offer another series of four Beethoven programs in the same hal next season.

title: University Depression

description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 17 Two Block Island authors were indicted today and then pleaded not guilty in United States District Court to charges of harboring the Rev. Daniel Berrigan at their island home last August when he was evad ing a threeyear sentence and destroyin draft records.

title: A Correction

The firm involved in the merger was Goodbody & Co., not Reynolds. The Times regrets the error.

title: SERVICE FEE ADDED AT BOARD OF TRADE

title: Suit Against Wells Continued

title: Marland Is Sworn In
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI)  Sidney P. Marland Jr. was sworn in today as Educa tion Commissioner and he named 13 aides, including deputy commissioner and two associate commissioners.

title: Commodity Price Index Down 0.2 From WeekAgo
description: The wholesale commodity price index fell to 105.4 Tues day from 105.6 last week.

title: EXTORTION IS LAID TO TWO IN JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 17A Fed eral grand jury indicted two re puted top associates of Simone Rizzo DeCavalcante today on charges of extorting kickbacks from a New Jersey apartment house developer.

title: Slight Cut in Car Insurance Rates Expected in 71

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Army Secretary Stanley R. Resor denied today that Arrny intelligence agents had ever conducted political surveillance of three prominent political figures in Illinois as reported by by Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr.

title: Ordeal on the Trail, as Seen by North Vietnamese G.I.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 15It took the 115 men in a North Vietnamese infantry company almost 90 days to come down the Ho Chi Minh Trail, and no man reached South Vietnam without know ing the fevers of malaria and an exhaustion that sleep did not quickly cure.

description: Errol John's Moon on a Rainbow Shawl, first pro duced off Broadway in 1962, and now revived by the Urban Arts Corps, is a highly atmospheric play about the disappointed and rejected black inhabitants of a back district in Trinidad. The can vas is small but crowded with life.

The lesson is simply that as nations enter the postindustrial age they must find new labor relations formulaswhich safeguaid the working man without unduly threatening oper ations of the state.

description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 17 (AP)  Robert Goldsborough Henry Jr., a boat designer and builder, died at Anne Arundel General Hospital today after long illness. He was 61 years old.

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 17 (Reuters)The North ern Ireland Government tonight proposed to Parliament reforms to help end discrimination against the Roman Catholic mi nority.

title: Pravda's Spiritual Emigrants
description: MOSCOWThe name of the most prestigious newspaper in the Commu nist world is Pravda, which means Truth, and Pravda has published in the last few days a savage editorial against its Nobel Prize winner, Alek sandr Solzhenitsyn, describing him as a spiritual emigrant hostile to the whole life of the Soviet people.

title: Screen: Perfection and a 'Love Story':Erich Segal's Romantic Tale Begins Run
description: What can you say about a movie about a 25-year-old girl who died?That it is beautiful. And romantic. That it contains a fantasy for just about everyone, perhaps with the exception of Herbert Marcuse. That it looks to be clean and pure and without artifice, even though it is possibly as sophisticated as any commercial American movie ever made. That my admiration for the mechanics of it slops over into a real admiration for the movie itself.I'm talking, of course, about "Love Story," the movie from which Erich Segal extracted his best-selling non-novel, mostly, it seems, by appending "she said's" and "I said's" and an occasional "I remonstrated" to the dialogue in his original screenplay.The film, which opened yesterday at the Loew's State I and Tower East Theaters, is about a love affair so perfect that even the death that terminates it becomes a symbol of its perfection.When, at the end, Jenny (ne Cavilleri), the self-styled social zero from Cranston, R. I., the daughter of an Italian baker, is dying of a carefully unidentified blood disease in the arms of her husband, Oliver Barrett 4th, the preppie millionaire from Boston, there is nothing to disfigure love, or faith, or even the complexion. It's as if she were suffering from some kind of vaguely unpleasant Elizabeth Arden treatment. Jenny doesn't die. She just slips away in beauty.The knowledge that Jenny willhow should I put itdisappear not only gives the movie its shape (it is told in flashback), but it also endows everything  from a snowball fight in the Harvard Yard to a confrontation with snob parents in Ispwichwith an intensity that is no less sweet for being fraudulent.Curiously, the novel, which I found almost unreadable (I think it might be as readily absorbed if kept under one's pillow), plays very well as a movie, principally, I suspect because Jenny is not really Jenny but Ali MacGraw, a kind of all-American, Radcliffe madonna figure, and Oliver Barrett 4th is really Ryan O'Neal, an intense, sensitive young man whose handsomeness has a sort of crookedness to it that keeps him from being a threat to male members of the audience. They are both lovely.Then, too, Arthur Hiller, the director, has framed what is essentially a two-character story of undergraduate love with such seeming simplicity that nothing confuses the basic situation. He also associates his film and his characters with all of the good things in life. Jenny and Oliver fall in love in the snow (snow, clean and pure, is very important in the movie.) They court in front of libraries, and they make love (nothing too explicit mind you) while doing homework.When Jenny swears, she fondly uses a four-letter word that was shocking in the fifties, but that even mid-American matrons have heard now. When Oliver graduates from law school, he takes a job with an old, extremely respectable, New York law firm, but it's one that specializes in civil-rights cases. When Jenny is growing weaker, she can't remember the Mozart Kchel listings she once knew. Jenny and Oliver have (middle) class."Love Story" not only revives a kind of movie fiction that I'd thought vanished, it also revives the rich, WASP movie hero who rebels, but not too drastically, and it brings back the kind of wonderful movie aphorism that persists in saying nothing when it tries to say the most ("love means never having to say you're sorry").Francis Lai's background score, mixes Bach and Mozart and Handel with Lai, and resolutely avoids rock. Although Jenny does disappear at the end, everyone in the audience can take heart in identificationthe ladies, because they can see how much will be missed, and the gentlemen, who will have the honor of being abandoned by one of fiction's most blessed females. I might add that Oliver, though distraught, is also very rich, and he has promised Jenny to be a merry widower.I can't remember any movie of such comparable high-style, kitsch since Leo McCarey's "Love Affair" (1939) and his 1957 remake, "An Affair to Remember." The only really depressing thing about "Love Story" is the thought of all of the terrible imitations that will inevitably follow it.

title: EDMUND F. MEASOM
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Dec. 17Edmund F. Measom, a re tired New York City school teacher, died here yesterday at his home, 504 Pelham Road, after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: SUIT SEEKS TO BAR TEST OF ROCKET
description: DENVER, Dec. 18A Col orado environmental scientist who has mounted repeated pro tests against nuclear testing and the handling of armaments filed suit in Federal Court here yesterday to block a nuclear rocket test that is scheduled for January in Nevada.

description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., Dec. 18 (AP)Giving in after threeday filibuster, Missouri Senators sponsoring an income tax increase abandoned their bill today.

title: ANGELA DAVIS LOSES IN 2 APPEALS TO U.S.
description: Angela Davis lost two bids yesterday to have her extra dition to California blocked but the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit postponed her return to the West Coast, pending appeal to the Supreme Court.

title: JOHN GROVER BELL OF COSMETICS FIRM
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 18 (AP) John Grover Bell, who founded Bonne Bell, Inc., in a oneroom office here in 1927 and built it into an international cosmetics concern with sales of more than $20million annually, died today in a suburban hospital. He was 80 years old and was chairman of the concern at his death.

title: Israel's Quintet Advances to Final In Asian Games
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 18 (AP)Israel, the defending champion, advanced to the basketball final in the Asian Games today With an 8378 victory over the Philippines.

title: When to Operate?
description: The National Center for Health Sta tistics has recently released the first comprehensive and reliable data on operations performed in the United States. Considering the fact that more than half of hospital admissions are surgical, this kind of information is long overdue. And, of course, such data are essential if we are to begin to plan, as we must, for comprehen sive medical care on a national scale.

title: Kent Coach Picks Bibent
description: KENT, Ohio, Dec. 18 (AP) Don James, Kent State Univer sity's new head football coach, said today that Maury Bibent, a secondary coach at Colorado State University, would become his defensive backfield coach.

title: Lee Remick Married
description: LONDON, Dec. 18 (AP)Lee Remick, the actress, was mar ried today to William Rory Gowens, a British director, at the Marylebone Registry office. Miss Remick's previous mar riage, to Bill Colleran, an Amer ican television producer, was dissolved in Mexico last year. Mr. Gowens was divorced in London last June by Valeria Gearon, an actress, on grounds of adultery with Miss Remick.

title: Judgesihip Not Acted Upon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP) The Senate Judiciary Com mittee took no action today at a meeting on the nomination of Robert E. Varner to be a United States judge for the mid dle district of Alabama. Mr. Varner in testimony before the committee, has denied sugges tions by opponents of his nomi nation that he was a segrega tionist.

title: 5% Price Increase Is Set By Du Pont on Dacron Yarn

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Heeding demands of young reformers, a special House Democratic panel proposed today that seniority not be the sole basis for the selection of committee chairmen.

description: ATLANTA Dec. 18 (UPI) The Atlanta Braves asked waivers today on Don Cardwell for the purpose of giving the righthanded pitcher his un conditional release. Cardwell, 35 years old, has been in the major leagues for 14 years.

description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 18 (AP)A proposal to double the earnings tax in Kansas City from onehalf per, cent to 1 per cent was approved today in a special election.

title: Oliver W. Larkin Is Dead at 74; Won 49 Pulitzer History Prize

title: Market Place
description: Does the new University of Michigan survey, which finds that consumers are still de pressed and unwilling to spend, reflect actual attitudes or the General Motors strike?

The bank said it would loan up to $250,000 for such equipment to a single industrial borrower at an interest rate per cent below the prime inter est rate.

title: Two Rockets Strike Saigon on Anniversary of War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Dec. 19 (AP)Two en emy rockets crashed into Saigon early today, reportedly killing six South Vietnamese and wounding eight.

description: Most of the music being presented in Christmas pro grams in churches this season is traditional, but at the Episcopal, Church of the In carnation tomorrow a more modern sound will be heard. Richard Felciano's God of the Expanding Universe will be performed, and it is a work for electronic tape and organ.

title: Why More Physicians?
description: The millions of Americana who have waited long hours to see a physician or who have tried in vain to get one to make a house call will no doubt welcome the recommendation of the Carnegie Commission on Higher Edu cation for a 50 per cent increase in medical school enrollment. Before we swallow this Medication whole, how ever, it would be wise to consider what it will and will not accomplish.

description: TRENTON, Dec, 18 (AP) The State Senate today passed and sent to Gov. William T. Cahill a bill extending unem ployment benefits an additional 13 weeks during periods of high unemployment. The vote was 30 to 0.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (UPI) The Senate Commerce Commit tee today approved a $125mil lion loan guarantee for the Penn Central Railroad. The measure is identical to a House Commerce Committee bill ap proved earlier this week.

description: David B. Mulligan Jr., a hotel manager for many years, died Wednesday in Miami Beach, Fla.?? after a long illness. His age was 53.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Drug Agency Bans 4 Classes of Toys It Calls Hazardous
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (UPI) The Food and Drug Admin istration said today, a week be fore Christmas, that it was banning four classes of toys from the market as hazardous, but it refused to identfy them by brand name or to say how they would be removed from stores.

description: A commuter from Allen dale, N. J., riding his bus at 9 A.M. yesterday, was amazed when he realized it was speeding past trucks and automobiles inching along as usual on the New Jessey ap proach to the Lincoln Tunnel.

However, a spokesman, said that Pope Paul has had no fever for two days and was regularly receiving his aides.

description: CHICAGO, Dec. 18 (AP) Roy M. Cohn and another man were freed today of charges they had violated Illinois law by controlling more than 15 per cent of the shares in each of two banks through a holding company.

description: NELLIS AIR FORCE BASE, Nev., Dec. 18  A suggestion emerged tonight that Howard Hughes may have left Las Vegas on a stretcher.
