description: The holiday party whirl for debutantes was ??et spinning last night with a series of 28 dinner parties and one supper dance for 400, all in honor of Miss Melissa Carr Leib, back home for Christmas from Sweet Briar College.

title: Violets Ousted, 10367
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 18 The New York University bas ketball team lost to the Univer sity of Utah, 10367, in the opening round of the Utah Classic tonight.

title: Art: Women at the Whitney
description: Out of 3,000 artists repre sented in the permanent col lection of the Whitney Muse um of American Art, 450 are women, a showing of 15 per cent. Since the current popu lation of this country con tains a majority female rep resentation of 53 per cent, we are entitled to one of several assumptions: (a) that women's work is not or has not been deemed as worthy of inclusion in the Whitney's collection as that of men; (b) that given male (and female) prejudices, women's art has unconsciously been over looked in favor of men's; and/or (c) that for repressive societal reasons, women have simply not produced art in the qualitative quantity that men have.

title: Jets Seek to Clinch Laurels Today as Top Defensive Unit in Conference
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 19In to morrow's season finale with the Baltimore Colts, the New York Jets defensive unit hopes to maintain its honor as the American Conference leader. According to Larry Grantham, the experienced linebacker who calls defensive signals, the Colts must be held to about 200 Yards.

title: A Pole and a Communist
description: To understand Poland, Eastern Europeans have said, understand Gomulka.

title: Schatten Revival Scheduled by Met For Jan. 16 Matinee
description: The Metropolitan Opera House will revive Strauss's Die Frau ohne Schatten dur ing the 18th week of its current season in a non  subscription matinee to be given on Jan. 16. The opera was last given here in the 196869 season.

title: 21 Stock Split Is Recommended By G.E.'s Board
description: The General Electric Com pany's board of directors played Santa Claus yesterday for the company's 520,000 stockholders by approving plans for a 2for1 stock split.

title: 11 STOCKS OFFERED, BUT ONLY FEW GAIN
description: The number of companies making first public offerings of stock picked up this week, but overall activity remained only slightly above the low levels that have prevailed for most of 1970.

title: TV: An Enriching San Francisco Mix
description: It is rare indeed when tele vision contrives to make one think and succeeds at it. One is so used either to stimula tion or to torpor from the tube. And it is unfortunate, but predictable, that such television, in most instances, will cause no critical ripples; will not arouse programers to think of seasonal renewals; nor cause much of a stir among masses of viewers, al though it should. But televi sion and the viewer who watches are the richer, even if only sporadically, for such programs; the medium be cause it usually demonstrates in such programs what it can do uniquely, the viewer be cause he is encouraged to go into his head, to consider, simply to think.

title: Gov. Maddox Quits in Huff During Cavett Show Taping
description: Gov. Lester Maddox of Georgia walked out of a taping of the Dick Cavett Show in a huff last night after demanding that the host of the program apologize for a remark about Mr. Maddox's white supporters.

title: 6 JUDGES RENAMED TO CRIMINAL COURT
description: Six Criminal Court judges whose terms expire at the end of the year were reappointed and sworn in yesterday by Mayor Lindsay at City Hall.

title: Head of Farm Organization Elected to His 16th Term
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 18 (AP)  The National Farmers Organization today selected Oren Lee Staley as its presi dent for his 16th consecutive term.

title: American Cook Found Praise in Paris
description: STONINGTON, Conn.  When Behri Knauth needs fresh lobster or an extra ingredient or two for her cooking she hops on her French bicycle and pedals the few blocks to the wharf side fish market or to the general store in this pic turesque fishing village about 150 miles from New York.

title: Sewage  Treatment System Uses Oxygen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18  The Union Carbide Corpora tion received five patents this week on its Unox pure oxygen process for the treat ment of sewage. Beginning

title: Senate Unit Calls F111 a Fiscal Blunder And Criticizes McNamara and Gilpatric
description: The Senate Permanent Sub committee on Investigations is sued a report in Washington yesterday calling the multibil liondollar F111 fighterbomber program a fiscal blunder of the worst magnitude.

title: C. Cheever Hardwick, Expert On Bonds and Transit, Dead
AN ACID REMOVED FROM DETERGENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Under Federal prodding, the nation's major soap manufac turers have agreed to remove from their detergent products a chemical that could be haz ardous to humans, particularly pregnant women.

title: ROBERT E. GRIFFIN
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Dec. 18 Robert E. Griffin of 154 Car?? teret Street, an electrical de signer for many years for the Ray Consulting Company in Rahway, died yesterday at his home after a brief illness. His age was 54. He retired 18 months ago.

title: Soviet Six 60 Victor
description: VIENNA, Dec. 18 (AP)The Soviet Union hockey team rout ed Czechoslovakia, 60, today as Vladimir Petrov scored four goals.

title: TIGHTER SECURITY VOWED IN SCHOOLS
description: The Board of Education vowed yesterday to tighten. se curity measures In the city's public school system.

title: Music: Brilliant and Eclectic, Y et With Personality
description: Only last week, Peter Maxwell  Davies's exciting Eight Songs for a Mad King had its New York pre miere. And now we have George Crumb's Ancient Voices of Children, which was heard at the Contem porary Chamber Ensemble concert at the Hunter College Playhouse on Thursday eve ning.

title: MOHAWK AIR SETS UP FINANCING PROGRAM
description: Mohawk Airlines, Inc., which has been tied up by a strike and is experiencing financial problems, announced yesterday that the Jet Capital Corpora tion, a New York financial services company, will assist the company in developing a program for obtaining new capital funds and restructuring existing credit arrangements.

title: Karen Wyman Belting Songs at Persian Room
description: Karen Wyman, a small, but tonnosed, blackhaired, bright eyed, 18yearold girl from the Bronx, is carving a niche of sorts at the Persian Room of the Plaza Hotel as the youngest headliner in the room's 36year history.

title: CITY UNIONS SCORE ARBITRATION PLAN
description: The New York City Central Labor Council urged yesterday that the City Council reject Mayor Lindsay's proposal for compulsory arbitration in any contract impasse in negotia tions between the city and the unions representing its em ployes.

title: Arms Talks Resume Feb. 23
description: GENEVA, Dec. 18The 25 member Geneva disarmament conference, which ended its work for the year last Septem ber, will reconvene on Feb. 23, it was announced today. The principal topic will be chemical and bacteriological warfare.

title: Williams of Delaware Honored by Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (UPI)Senator John J. Wil liams, Republican of Dela ware, who is ending a 24 year Senate career, was de scribed today as the con science of the Senate by his colleagues.

title: Russians Orbit 2 Satellites
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched two artificial research statellites today. The official press agen cy, Tass, announced the placing into earth orbit of number 388 and 389 in the longrunning Cosmos series.

title: REED, ILL WITH FLU, SENT TO HOSPITAL
description: The New York Knicker bockers, who have been almost unbeatable in Madison Square Garden, will face the Chicago Bulls tonight but without the services of their leading scorer, rebounder and captain, Willis Reed.

title: Iran Refinery Blast Kills 24
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 18 (AP) Twentyfour persons, includ ing an American engineer, were killed in an explosion at a gas refinery in southwest Iran yes terday, officials reported today. They said the explosion, near Agha Jari, also injured 10 per sons.

title: AREAS SEALED OFF
description: WARSAW, Dec. 18Tension began to rise in Warsaw tonight as reports continued to reach here of antiGovernment clashes in other Polish cities. Some areas of the country were still sealed off today, on the fifth day of unrest.

title: Aviation Hall of Fame Cites Four Leaders in the Field
description: Four men prominent in the field of aviation have been hon ored in ceremonies held at the viation Hall of Fame at Day ton, Ohio.

title: STUDENTS IN ALGIERS CLASH WITH POLICE
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)  Hundreds of students clashed with the police here today in a demonstration demanding the use of Arabic in stead of French in high schools and universities.

title: Waltham Industries in Talks On Restructuring of Debt
description: The Waltham Industries Cor poration disclosed yesterday that it had been holding dis cussions this week with its major creditors about a Wal tham proposal for restructur ing its debt.

title: Independent Leasing Plans For Financing Are Arranged
SOLKIND LEVENSON
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J. Dec. 18  Solkind L. Levenson, a lawyer in New Jersey and New York, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital, Newark of can cer. He was 66 years old and lived at 115 Old Short Hills Road here.

title: Wolves Strike Turkish Areas
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 18 (AP)Hungry wolf packs were reported descending from the mountains on villages today as a blizzard struck eastern and central Turkey.

title: U.S. Court Blocks Recount In the Reelection of Hartke
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 18A threejudge Federal Court panel has blocked an Indiana recount in the reelection of United States Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana.

title: Braves Romp, 11394
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 18 (UPI) The Buffalo Braves took advan tage of the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight to roll up the biggest victory margin in their short history, 11394.

title: Issues in the Fuel Oil Strike Here
description: PARTIESLocal 553 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, representing 2,200 oil truck drivers and 600 oil burner repairmen, and the New York Oil Heating Asso ciation, representing 300 independent companies that serve 40 per cent of the city's homes and businesses using fuel oil.

title: Cardinal Cooke in Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18 (AP)Car dinal Cooke of New York, Unit ed States military vicar for Roman Catholics, celebrated a mass today at Yokota Air Base, near Tokyo. The Cardinal ar rived in Japan after a twoday visit to South Korea, where he visited American troops guard ing the western sector of the Korean demilitarized zone and celebrated a mass.

title: Prague Imprisons U.S. Student, ExAide of Radio Free Europe
description: PRAGUE, Dec. 18 (Reuters)  A 28yearold United States student was sentenced to four years in prison here today be cause he had once worked for Radio Free Europe.

title: Lingering Effects of Marijuana In Body Is Detected in Study
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (UPI) A winner of the Nobel Prize for Medicine, and three other Government researchers have suggested that habitual marijuana users, unlike heavy drinkers and those on hard drugs, may develop a reverse tolerance requiring smaller and smaller doses to produce highs.

title: Finders Given Buried Cash
description: LEWISTOWN, III., Dec. 18 (AP)Three boys who found $12,950 in cash five years ago in a Mason jar that had been buried in a vacant lot are the rightful owners of the money, Judge Francis P. Murphy of Fulton County Circuit Court ruled today.

title: SenateHouse Unit Clears Investors Protection Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18A joint SenateHouse confer ence committee completed work today on legislation estab lishing, for the first time, a system of insurance for investorsagainst financial losses result ing from the bankruptcies of brokerage firms. Losses of up to $50,000 per customer account would be insured under the legislation.

title: Quebec Ends Long Dispute On Medical Specialists Pay
description: QUEBEC, Dec. 18 (Canadian Press)An agreement between the Quebec Government and the province's medical special ists ending a lengthy dispute over pay scales was announced yesterday. The accord is ex pected to make possible full application of Quebec's new medical care insurance plan.

title: Investment Written Down
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration, the largest domestic producer of copper, formally recognized yesterday the un profitability of its molybdenum producing subsidiary in Canada.

title: LFCGreat Western Tie Is Voted by Stockholders
description: Stockholders of the LFC Financial Corporation and the Great Western Financial Cor poration, at separate meetings yesterday, voted in favor of an agreement to merge LFC into Great Western. The combina tion of the two savings and loan companies, which must be effected by Dec. 31, will create

title: Defence League Barred from Harassing a Charity
description: The militant Jewish Defense League was barred by court order yesterday with interfe ing with the fundraising activi ties of the Federation of Jewish Philanthro??ies.

title: 8 U.S. HOSPITALS REPORTED CLOSING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 The Department of Health, Ed ucation and Welfare has rec ommended closing eight Public Health Service hospitals, in cluding a large facility on Stat en Island, Representative Paul G. Rogers, Democrat of Florida, said today.

title: ExColumbia Chaplain Elected Bishop
description: The Rev. Dr. John M. Krumm, rector of the Episcopal Church of the Ascension at Fifth Ave. nue and 10th Street since 1965 and former chaplain of Colum bia University, has been elected Bishop of the Diocese of South ern Ohio.

title: EXCONVICT FACES 25 YEARS FOR FIRE
description: Herbert Kebeck, a 44year old former convict whose hatred for a neighbor appar ently impelled him to set fire to the neighbor's luxury apart ment on the Upper East Side, was found guilty yesterday of firstdegree arson, assault and criminal mischief.

title: Count Held Captive By Two in Robbery Of Fifth Ave. Home
description: A 73yearold Russian count was held captive in his Fifth Avenue apartment for eight hours Thursday night and yes terday while two intruders ran sacked the apartment.

title: Japan Bars Concessions
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18 (Reuters) Japan is unable to make any more concessions in the cur rent textile talks in Washing ton, the Minister of Interna tional Trade and Industry, Kiichi Miyazawa, said today.

title: Extend the Knapp Commission
description: Police corruption does more than protect illegal gambling, prostitution and narcotics enterprises. It helps to breed and intensify each of these evils.

title: Antiques: American Silver Explained at Yale Display
description: American silver is a lot easier to understand after a view of selections from the Garvan Collection now on exhibition at the Yale Art Gallery in New Haven.

title: CHAINS SALES UP 7.4% IN NOVEMBER
description: Sales volume of leading chainstore organizations in November rose 7.4 per cent compared to the level of sales in November, 1969, according to a survey by The New York Times.

title: BOSTON TIES GAME 3:28 FROM FINISH
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 18 (AP) Lew Alcindor broke out of a brief scoring slump with a 40 point effort to lead the Mil waukee Bucks from a 109109 tie to a 124114 National Bas ketball Association victory over the Boston Celtics tonight.

title: Silver Isle Seeks 4th Straight Today
description: Frank Marshall's Silver Isle will seek her fourth consecu tive victory, and her first in a stakes race, in the $20,000 added Saratoga Stakes at Bay Meadows race track in Califor nia today.

title: NINOWSKI TELLS OF N.F.L. PAYOFF
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 18 (AP)  Jim Ninowski, a former pro football quarterback, said to day his pay was increased to $100,000 a year for four years as a result of a secret settle ment reached in 1967 after he threatened the National and American leagues with an anti trust suit.

title: South Eleven Picks Two
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 18 (AP) The American Bowl Classic, to be played Jan. 10, added two key players today to the South squad. They were Joe Schmidt, a University of Miami split end, and Rick Harrington, a defen sive safety from Houston.

title: Pakistanis Killed in Plunge
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 18 (AP)  Tweatysix Pakis tanis are believed to have drowned when a bus plunged from a bridge into a canal 75 miles south of Rawalpindi yes terday. Thirtyfour persons were reported to have been aboard the bus. Eight s??tting on the roof swam to safety. The bodies of four persons were recovered.

title: TENSION RISES IN WARSAW AS CLASHES ARE REPORTED IN OTHER CITIES IN POLAND
ARMY TO DESTROY GERM WAR STOCKS AS NIXON PLEDGED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18  The Army announced today de tailed plans to destroy its biolo gical and toxic weapons in ac cordance with pledges made by President Nixon. But the United States will continue research on defenses against weapons of this kind.

title: Fire Kills 1,500 Chinchillas
description: CLYDE, N. Y., Dec. 18 (AP) About 1,500 chinchillas, val ued at $60,000, were killed yes terday when the she in which they were housed collapsed and burned. Clarence Edwards, own er of a chinchilla farm near t?? western New York village, said a heavy deposit of snow had caused the shed to collapse.

title: BOTH SIDES FIRM IN TAXI WALKOUT
description: Negotiators for the striking taxi union and the fleet owners resumed talks yesterday, but there were no indications of significant progress toward a settlement of the twoweekold walkout.

title: Survivors in Mishima Group to Be Tried Early in 71
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18A time honored Japanese ritekai shaku, slashing off the head of a friend who has committed harakiriwill be judged ac cording to this country's mod ern, Westerninspired criminal code for the first time when three of Yukio Mishima's fol lowers are brought to trial early next year.

title: Hobart Is Indicted By a Special Jury In Student Disorder
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Dec 18A special state grand jury indicted Hobart College in nearby Geneva today, charging that it had recklessly allowed two students and a professor to prevent the prosecution of students seized in a drug raid last June 5.

title: A ForeignPolicy Lesson
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18An important lesson for foreign countries and for American students and practitioners of foreign policy is being taught in the Senate in the waning days of 1970. The lesson is ac tually twofold.

title: TV Stage Is Set for CoinFlip Special
description: After two halfhour conference calls among New York, Detroit and Dallas, plus several other calls of varying lengths be tween Detroit and Dallas between New York and Chicago and between Park Ave nue and Columbus Circle, the National Football League finally has figured out how to flip a coin.

title: Soviet to Call Conference On Baltic Sea Pollution
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (UPI) The Soviet Government has de cided to call a conference of Baltic powers to discuss pollu tion of the Baltic Sea, Scandi navian diplomatic sources re port.

title: FUTURES PRICES UP FOR SOYBEANS
description: Rebounding from Thursday's drop, soybean and grain futures rose yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. There was a sharp rise early in the session but this was trimmed near the close by profit taking.

title: BIRTHDAY CONCERT (NOT BEETHOVEN)
description: Another day, another birth day concert, this time not in honor of youknowwhom (a moratorium on that name is now in force).

title: Giants Have Visions of Madison Ave. Plums
description: Much has been said about the $25,000aman prize at the end of the Super Bowl rain bow, but for the New York Giant players who face the Los Angeles Rams tomorrow, the stakes are really much bigger and more immediate.

title: Violence in Szczecin
description: BONN, Dec. 18It happened on the street right in front of the burning party headquarters in Szczecin. Tanks moved against the population to give them a shock. The people fled to avoid being run over, but a mother and her child were unable to make it. An oncom ing tank struck both of them. A young soldier, standing near by and watching, broke into tears.

title: McCovey Takes Slugging Crown 3d Year in Row
description: Willie McCovey of the San Francisco Giants is slugging his way into the record book as one of the greatest power hitters in National League his tory.

title: Q. Is There a Livable Metropolis? A. They Say It's London
description: LONDON, Dec. 18A spell seems to fall over New York ers who visit London  a mood of enchantment with the serene tempo of life, the quiet streets, the  clean air, the ambience of a city where a brisk afternoon walk may encompass the extraor dinary amalgam of bustling Covent Garden, trendy King's

title: Warriors Win, 122118
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 18 (AP) Jerry Lucas, with 32 points, led San Francisco to within 17 per centage points of firstplace Los Angeles in the Pacific Divi sion tonight as the Warriors beat the Portland Trail Blazers, 122118.

title: Nancy Bennett Wed to W. D. Feniger
description: DALLAS, Dec. 18Miss Nancy Bennett, daughter of King Wade Bennett, executive vice president of Macy's, New York, and Mrs. Bennett of New York and Summit, N. J., was married here this afternoon to William David Feniger. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Yale Feniger of To ledo. Ohio.

title: Amex Stocks Post Narrow Advances As Volume Climbs
description: Prices moved in a narrow range yesterday on the Ameri can Stock Exchange as the list ended slightly higher on mod erate trading.

title: Arms Talks Recess Until March 15
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 18 The United States and the Soviet Union recessed the stra tegic arms limitation talks here today after seven weeks of dis cussions, which apparently clarified some issues but which failed to make any sub stantial progress toward an agreement. The two sides agreed to resume the talks next March 15 in Vienna.

title: CHORAL GROUP KEEPS HOLIDAY TRADITION
description: In 1874, the Oratorio Society of New York began its now tra ditional Christmas season per formances of Handel's Mes siah. The venerable singing organization is now in its 98th season, but Thursday night, at Carnegie Hall, it gave its 148th performance of the work.

title: The Problem Doctors
description: If you are like most laymen, you take comfort in the belief, that doctors of medicine are closely regulated by stringent laws, rigorous government agencies and exacting professional groups.

title: Uconn Loses, 8064
description: LAFAYETTE, La., Dec. 18 (AP)Oklahoma State moved to an early lead tonight and went on to defeat Connecticut, 8064, in the Bayou Classic.

title: 2 BROOKLYN MEN ARE FOUND SLAIN
description: Two cousins, 82 and 75 years old, were found bound, gagged and stabbed to death in their beds yesterday evening in the apartment the two men shared in the Bay fridge section of Brooklyn.

title: Books of The Times
description: A sunny street in Algiers, March 26, 1962. Young Moslem troops under French command, with no crowdhandling experi ence, suddenly panic when faced by civil ian demonstrators and commence firing without orders into the crowd. When someone cries out, Stop shooting! We're not armed! two soldiers spin around and fire automatically in the direction the voice came from.

title: Texas Star Out of Bowl Game
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 18 (UPI) Cotton Speyrer, a University of Texas wide receiver who broke his left arm against Oklahoma Oct. 10, will not play in the Jan. 1 Cotton Bowl outing against Notre Dame, coach Darrell Royal, the Texas coach, said today.

title: Cornell Sextet Advances
description: BOSTON, Dec. 18 (AP)Cor nell downed New Hampshire, 62, and Boston College stopped Dartmouth, 21, tonight in openinground games of the fifth annual Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference. Christmas hockey tournament at Boston Garden.

title: Winner in State Lottery Was Welfare Recipient
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 18 (UPI) A widower who is receiv ing welfare and who won $100,000 yesterday in the New York state lattery, said he would return with his four children to Puerto Rico.

title: Slump Keeps Los Angeles Stores Open Sunday
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 17 Downtown department stores here are open at night and are even open on Sundays during the holiday season. But the joy of the season has not yet pealed at the cash registers.

title: POLLUTION FINES AROUSE DEBATE
description: Members of the City Council raised sharp questions yester day about a key provision of the tough airpollution code proposed by the Lindsay Ad ministration.

title: Patriot Coach Is Rehired
description: BOSTON, Dec. 18 (AP)John Mazur, who replaced Clive Rush as head coach of the Boston Patriots midway through the 1970 season, was given a oneyear contract today.

title: Singer to Have Surgery
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 18 (UPI) Bill Singer, a Los Angeles righthander, is scheduled to undergo surgery tomorrow for correction of linear fractures in the index finger of his pitch ing hand.

title: N. A. A. C. P. Plans Inquiry in Germany
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People announced yesterday that it would send a group to West Germany to investigate racial conflicts and charges of racial discrimination against black American soldiers.

title: A CLOSED SESSION OF SENATE FAILS TO BREAK IMPASSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18Try ing to break an endofsession impasse, the Senate met for an hour and a half behind closed doors tonight without resolving any of the tangled issues that plague it.

title: ROY B. KARN
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Dec. 18Roy B. Karn of 24 Mon tague Place, a chemist for the Dehlis & Stein Company, New ark, for 36 years, died Wednes day at his home. His age was 75. He retired in 1966.

title: A 747 Lands Here Safely With Landing Gear Stuck
description: An American Airlines 747 with 121 passengers and a crew of 17 made a safe emergency landing at Kennedy Interna tional Airport yesterday after trouble developed tin the landing gear.

title: A Crafts Shop Has Lessons in African History
description: We can't keep these Benin bronzes in stockthey sell too quickly, Prince Thomas said recently of the Ni gerian sculptures. His goodnatured dissatisfaction made the owner of IMPORT ant AFRICA Ltd., 228 East 80th Street, sound like a seasoned merchant. But it was only last month that Mr. Thomas assumed complete command of the basement emporium where old and new African crafts, clothing, jewelry and furnishings are sold. Mr.

title: U.S. CORN OUTPUT REVISED UPWARD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP) Prospects for 1970 corn pro duction improved slightly in November and output now is estimated at 4,109,792,000 bushels, the Agriculture Depart ment announced today.

title: West German Thalidomide Trial Ends; $27Million to Go to Deformed Children
description: ALSDORF, West Germany, Dec. 18West Germany's thali domide trial was discontinued today after two and a half years under a compromise set tlement providing some com pensation for those who are believed to have been victims of the sedative.

title: STATE REVIEWING ABORTION SERVICE
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that his office was investigating abortion referral services in the state as the result of com plaints from several outof state women.

title: Jamaica Is Showing Signs of Boom, But Her Unemployment Remains High
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 14 A commission appointed by President Nixon is here study ing the ways in which the United States can help Ja maica remain politically stable and be a safe place for foreign investment.

title: Football Fans to Jam Mexican Bowl Today
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 18 (UPI)  There's one college football game that may at tract the biggest crowd of them all, more than the Rose Bowl, the Cotton Bowl and the Orange Bowl.

title: Defendant at Leningrad Trial Said to Charge AntiSemitism
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (Reuters) A Soviet Jew accused of try ing to hijack a Soviet plane and fly it abroad said in court that he planned the attempt because of antiSemitism in the Soviet Union, informed sources said today.

title: Heath Deplores Lapse in U.SBritish Consultation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Prime Minister Heath said to day that the natural relation ship between the United States and Britain has lapsed in re cent years.

title: Free Thruway Coffee
description: ALBANY, Dec. 18 (UPI) Free coffee will be served through the night on the Thom as E. Dewey Thruway on this Christmas and New Year's Day for the 12th consecutive year.

title: HARRY J. ROMANOFF, CHICAGO NEWSMAN
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 18 (UPI) Harry J. Romanoff, a Chicago newspaperman from the days of The Front Page, died in Augustana Hospital today of a stroke suffered in October. He was 79 years old.

title: Conference on Children Urges Action on Day Care and Racism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The White House Conference on Children ended today with 24 recommendations for President Nixon to act on, topped by more than a dozen overriding concerns voted on by dele gates from across the nation.

title: Brandeis U. Names Third President
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Dec. 18 (AP)  Charles I. Schott land, who has served as act ing president of Brandeis Uni Versity the last 10 months, was named the university's third president today.

title: Resignation of Executive Denied by Fox Film Corp.
Bong Kong Curbs Exports
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 18 (UPI) The Hong Kong Government has reached an agreement with the United States on voluntary restriction of textile exports to America, the Commerce and In dustry Department announced today.

title: AIR FORCE ORDERS A NEW WARPLANE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The Air Force selected today two companies to build competitive prototypes of a new twinen gine craft to provide battelfield support to Army troops.

title: $2.4Million Paid in Britain
description: LONDON, Dec. 18, (AP) More than $2.4million has now been paid to deformed and limbless thalidomide chil dren by the company that marketed the tranquilizing drug in Britain.

title: Jersey Nativity Sc ene Destroyed by Arsonist
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., Dec. 18 (AP)A twostory Nativ ity scene that had graced a public playground here for 21 yers was destroyed last night in a fire the police say was set.

title: BABY IS KIDNAPPED OUTSIDE A STORE
description: The 3monthold son of a New York fireman was kid napped from his carriage yes terday on a busy Brooklyn street while his mother was in a store Christmas shopping.

title: Stalin's Daughter Confirms Reports Of Her Pregnancy
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Dec. 18 (AP) , Svetlana Alliluyeva Peters, Stalin's daughter, con firmed through a spokesman today that she was expecting a baby.

title: Bridge
description: The Greater New York Bridge Association tradition ally introduces new forms of competition at its December tournament. Today at the New York Hilton, enthusiasts in the metropolitan area will have their first opportunity to take part in a Swiss pairs.

title: McCall's Cuts 18 From Book Unit in Economy Move
description: At least 18 staff members, Including its editor in chief and three senior editors, have been been discharged by the book division of the McCall Publish ing Company as part of a pol icy of economic retrenchment;

title: Concessions to Flood Are Disclosed by Senators
description: Reports circulated yesterday that Curt Flood had made handshake agreements with the Washington Senators that would circumvent the reserve clausewhich Flood has been challenging in court.

title: $2.9BILLION HOUSING APPROVED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP) The Senate passed tonight a compromise $2.9billion housing bill containing increased Fed eral aid for new towns as part of a broad attack on problems of urban growth. The voice vote sent the measure to the House.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Peter Fuller, who bought his way into thoroughbred racing, has always considered himself an outsider in the sport, or at least an independent. He made few conces sions to the genteel plantation image: when his horse, Dancer's Image, won the 1968 Governor's Gold Cup in Bowie, Md., Fuller publicly donated the $62,000 purse to further the work of Dr. Martin Luther King, who had been murdered several days before the race. In Louisville, Ky., Dr. King was best remembered for having led demonstra tions mat spoiled the am biance of the 1967 Kentucky Derby. When Dancer's Im age arrived for the 1968 Derby, he was known as the bigger horse, and when traces of an illegal painkilling medication were allegedly found in his post race urinalysis, racing's 24 hour rumor kitchen offered up two unsavory stews. Rumor One: the 48yearold Fuller, in his constant com petitive frenzy to live up to the image of his late father, Alvan T. Fuller, once Gov ernor of assachusetts and presiding judge at the Sacco Vanzetti trial, would do anything to win, and had. Rumor Two: the chemist, acting under orders or sug gestion or personal initia tive, had concocted some thing from nothing in a specimen bottle in the best interests of racing. Forced into hearings by Fuller, the Kentucky State Racing Commission decidedseven months after the racethat Dancer's Image was the official record book winner, but that the $122,600 firstplace money would go to the runnerup, Forward Pass of the great Calumet Farm.

title: Air Crash Kills W. L. Lowry; Airplane Consultant Was 41
description: BETHEL, Conn., Dec. 18 Walter L. Lowry, an airplane executive and consultant, was killed in a plane crash today near Henryville, Ind. He was 41 years old and lived here.

title: U.S. Warns Against Traveling To Poland in Uncertain Period
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18  The State Department warned American citizens today against unnecessary travel to Poland because of the uncertain sit uation there as the impres sion grew here that the initial economic protest was turning into a major political crisis for the Polish Government.

title: Naumburg Disk Award
description: Seymour Shifrin, a professor of music at Brandeis Univer sity, has won the Walter W. Naumburg Foundation Record ing Award for 1970 for his Three Pieces for Orchestra. The music will be recorded this winter by Composers Record ings, Inc.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON POST AN ADVANCE
description: The London stock market closed slightly higher yesterday in quiet trading. Some buying of leading issues was stimu lated by Wall Street's Thursday gain after a steady start pushed prices up, but volume remained depressed and special situations provided most of the trading activity.

title: 3 ARE SUSPENDED BY THE BIG BOARD
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that its board of governors had severely disciplined a former allied member of the exchange and two securities salesmen for violating regulations.

title: Memo Lists Boeing Failures on SST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19A twoyearold Government mem orandum, obtained recently during the intense dispute over the supersonic transport, said that the Boeing Company, prime contractor for the plane's airframe, has failed to meet numerous contract criteria and requirements.

title: Poland at a Glance
description: THE COUNTRY  with a population of 33 mil lion occupying 120,725 square miles in eastern Europe, Poland is bounded on the north by the Baltic Sea, on the northeast and east by the Soviet Union, on the south by Czechoslovakia and on the west by East Germany. Area is mostly lowlands with high mountains along the southern borders.

title: FISHERMEN OPPOSE A FLOUNDER QUOTA
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Dec. 19 (UPI)A quota on yellow tail flounder could mean disas ter for local fishermen, accord ing to industry spokesmen, because it would entail Ameri can boats policing American boats.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: BELMONT HILL SIX TOPS TAFT IN FINAL
description: PRINCETON, NJ., Dec. 19 Gordon Scannell, a right wing, and Leigh Hogan, a center, each scored three goals each today in pacing Belmont Hill to a 71 victory over Taft, in the final of the Lawrenceville School in vitation hockey tournament.

title: May Singhi Breen, Ukulele Lady Of Radio in 20's and 30's, Dead
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Dec. 19May Singhi Breen, who as the Ukulele Lady was fea tured with her late husband, Peter De Rose, composer, on radio networks from 1923 to 1939, died today at the Jersey Shore Medical Center, Neptune. She lived at 606 Eighth Avenue here.

title: Vote Scheduled Tuesday by 2,200 Teamsters on New Contract
description: A tentative agreement was reached by negotiators yester day to settle the fourdayold strike by fuel oil deliverymen, but there was no prospect that the walkout would end before a union meeting next Tuesday to vote on the new contract.

title: U.N. Confirms Plea
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 19A spokesman for Secretary General Thant confirmed today that a plea for help against possible invasion had been re ceived by Mr. Thant from Pres ident Tour of Guinea.

title: Young Protestants Scuffle With Police in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Dec. 19 (UPI)Scuffles broke out today between police men and Protestant youths during ceremonies marking the end of the Roman Catholic siege of Londonderry 280 years ago.

title: Surprise Visitor: Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI) President Nixon paid surprise visits today to Senator Richard B. Russell, Democrat of Georgia, and Gen. Earle G. Wheeler, for mer chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, both patients at Walter Reed Army Medical Center. I wanted to come out and wish you all the best for Christmas. Mr. Nixon told Sen ator Russell.

title: Football Is Still A Man's Game, But ...
Springer Is Judged Best at Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 19 Ch. Chinoe's Adamant James, a picture dog of the English springer spaniel breed, became best in show tonight in the 76th and biggest event of the Kennel Club of Philadelphia. There were 3,436 dogs in the exhibition hall of the Civic Center and James was made best of them by Mrs. Albert E. Van Court of Los An geles.

title: Longhairs Anger Barbers
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 19 (UPI)The Professional Bar bers Union has asked the Gov ernment to ban femalestyled hair on men in public places such as schools and offices. Jos Vergara, the union presi dent, said longhairs have caused a 70 per cent drop in barbers business.

title: Sports of The Times
description: You know what happened to Lot's wife when she took a look back. Oh, well. The end of the year is fast ap proaching and the temptation is always strong to glance behind so that we can see where we've been and perhaps even guess where we're going. So just pass the salt and hope for the best.

title: Congress:
description: WASHINGTON  I've never seen such a confused state of affairs, said Delaware's Repub lican Senator John J. Williams last week. There are so many filibusters running around that unless we put white hats on one group and dark hats on the oth er, I do not know who is threat ening to filibuster and who is not. Then the Senator, who is retiring after 24 years of serv ice, added that things have reached such a point that one wonders whether the filibusters are not filibustering the filibust ers.

title: Communist Bloc:
description: The riots in Poland last week clearly came as a stunning sur prise throughout the Communist bloc. And for Westerners, it was hard to fathom why a regime would suddenly impose major price Increases on food and other elementary necessities, let alone doing so two weeks be fore Christmas in a devoutly Roman Catholic country.

title: Use of British Educational System Here Is Backed by U.F.T.
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, has committed his union to a program of educational reform designed to help intro duce the informal British ap proach to elementary education on a wide scale in New York City.

title: Australia Plans Stiff Penalties To Fight Rise in Narcotics Use
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 19 Faced with a dramatic in crease in drug abuse here, the Government has decided to drastically stiffen penalties for illegal trafficking in narcotics.

title: Demise of Jersey Central Put Off, at Least for Now
description: NEWARK, Dec. 19The Cen tral Railroad of. New Jersey, declining invalid in an era of ailing railroads, has been spared from death once again by another transfusion of state money.

title: Why I Took My Leap to Freedom
description: OF COURSE, the Palm Court in the Hotel Plaza has its oldworld charms, but those charms are quickly dispelled when waiters rush to the table and ask us to leave. The gentleman with you has neither tie nor jacket. No, we do not have a tie or jacket for the gentleman. I'm afraid I must ask you to leave.

title: LARCHMONT BEATS AMERICAN Y.C., 21
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 19Larch mont Yacht Club Interclub class skippers fouled themselves out of victory by threequarters of a point in the opening race today, then defeated American Yacht Club 420 helmsmen, 21, in a team match sailed in the American's 420's in Milton Harbor.

title: HAROLD M. BENNETT
description: Harold M. Bennett, who re tired in 1947 as head of the CinKodak Division of the Eastman Kodak Company in Rochester, died yesterday in Coral Gables, Fla. His age was 87.

title: Cuba Discourages Hijackers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  In the last 18 months the Cuban Government has become in creasingly intolerant of air pi racy. Since 1969 it has been promptly returning the hijacked planes, passengers and crews, and has generally toned down its welcome to hijackers.

title: Rioting Okinawans Attack Americans Outside U.S. Base
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Sunday, Dec. 20 (AP)Some 2,000 Oki nawans hurled gasoline bombs, empty bottles and stones at United States military person nel and Okinawan policemen and damaged 60 American vehicles today at Koza outside Kadena Air Force Base.

title: Maine U. Picks Alaskan
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 19 (AP)A 48yearold adminis trator at the University of Alaska has been named presi dent of the University of Maine at Machias. He is Dr. Arthur S. Buswell, who will succeed Lin coln T. Sennett on July 1, 1971.

title: TAIPEI IS PLANNING U.N. POLICY REVIEW
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan Dec. 18Of ficials here say a general re view of Nationalist China's international position and United Nations prospects will be carried out in the coming months. But they emphasize there will be no hard decisions soon on tactics to be pursued next year to keep the Chinese seat.

I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: International Trophy Exchange
description: In what appeared to be a case of the other fellow's grass being greener, the British Open trophy went to a United States golfer and the United States Open cup was won by an Englishmanfor the first time in 50 years. Tony Jacklin, a 25yearold former Golf assistant at the Pot ter's Bar Club in London, led in ev ery round of the United States cham pionship at Chaska, Minn. and won by seven strokes. Jack Nicklaus captured the British Open at St. Andrews, Scot land, by a stroke in overtime play with Doug Sanders.

title: U.N. Progress in Sea and Air
description: Despite the gloom that marked the official twentyfifth birthday observance in October, the United Nations Gen eral Assembly has completed a surprisingly productive and constructive session.

description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: A Listing of Deaths of Outstanding Figures in the World of Sports During 1970
YUGOSLAVIA. WOOS WORKERS ABROAD
description: BELGRADE, Dec. 18Skilled Yugoslav workers, returning home from Western Europe for the Christmas and New Year's vacation, are being wooed to stay.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: MacArthur FirstDay at Norfolk
description: JAN. 26, 1971, is the 91st anniversary of the birth of Douglas MacArthur at Fort Little Rock, Ark., in 1880. On that day next month, a 6cent com memorative stamp bearing a striking portrait of the five star general will be issued at Norfolk, Va., where he was to have been born, and where he is now buried. Prepara tions had been made by his father, General Arthur Mac Arthur, and his mother, whose home was in Norfolk, to return to that city for his birth, but, as Douglas Mac Arthur was to recall in his memoirs: Virginians are nothing if not loyal, and the Norfolk newspapers covered me beautifully with head lines reading Douglas Mac Arthur was born January 26, while his parents were away.

title: News of the Camera World
description: COMPUTERIZED elec tronic flash units that automatically meter out the correct amount of light required (depending on the distance from light to subject) are no longer un usual, but a new line just introduced goes one step fur therit permits the photog rapher a choice of aperture openings (f/stops) on his cam era. All of the portable com puterized electronic units on the market thus far limit the camera's f/stop opening to a single setting for any given lighttosubject distance. This leaves the photographer no flexibility, particularly when he wants control over the depth of field in his pic tures.

title: ST. JOHN'S VICTOR IN TOURNEY FINAL
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 19 (AP) St. John's University rallied to night to capture the eighth an nual Vanderbilt invitation tour nament as the Redmen beat the host Commodores, 8581.

title: Miss Jean Goldfrank Is a Bride Here
description: The marriage of Miss Jean Goldfrank, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lionel Goldfrank Jr., to Peter Eli Bronstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eli H. Bronstein of Scarsdale, N. Y., took place here yesterday at the Carlton House. The Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Perilman of Temple EmanuEl performed the ceremony.

title: Soviet Plane Down in India
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 19 (AP)A Soviet relief transport plane crashed today while on a flight from Dacca, in East Pakistan, to New Delhi, killing all 17 persons aboard, a Civil Aviation Ministry spokesman announced. here. He said an engine caught fire and the plane crashed as the pilot attempted an emergency landing at an airstrip 100 miles northeast of Calcutta.

title: Lawyer Weds Judith Schiff
description: Miss Judith Ann Schiff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jo seph Schiff of Mamaroneck, N.Y., was married here last night to James Mathew Peck, general counsel to Bing & Bing, Inc., real estate firm. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel M. Peck of New York.

title: Executive Weds Mrs. McKinney
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 19Mrs. Gail P. Mc Kinney of New York was married here today to Emine Messiqua, a vice president of Norman, Craig & Kummel, Inc., in New York, who will soon become managing di rector of the advertising agency's Paris office. Justice of the Peace Douglas Hudson performed the ceremony at Bellair Farm, home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Theodore H. Price Jr.

title: GENEVA IS SEEKING '72 U.N. ASSEMBLY
description: GENEVA, Dec. 19The Swiss Government has asked local officials in Geneva to investi gate how much hotel space would be available in the area in the event that the United Nations General Assembly holds its 1972 session here.

title: Baby Kidnapped in Bay Ridge Found Unhurt in BMT Station
description: A 3monthold baby kid napped from his carriage out side a Bay Ridge store Friday afternoon was found unharmed and asleep in a nearby subway station yesterday morning.

title: Washington Subway Plan Is Caught in a Cost Squeeze
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 This area's yearold effort to turn blueprints into real sub ways has run into difficulties that threaten to increase the project's eventual cost, but not kill it. The question is not whether Washington will ever get a subway system built, but what the final cost will be in money and concessions, a Congressional source said yes terday.

title: MAINE ELKS FACE LIQUOR SALE BAN
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 19  Elks clubs in Maine have been forbidden to serve liquor after midnight Dec. 31 because of failure to comply with Maine's antidiscrimination law.

I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: Naming of Narcotics Agents Costs Coast Paper $10,000
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19 (AP) A list of 80 state narcotics agents published in The Los Angeles Free Press under the headline Know Your Neighbor hood Narc has cost the weekly newspaper a $10,000 fine.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: Hughes Signature Upheld; Maheu Loses Court Plea
description: LAS VEGAS, Dec. 19Robert A. Maheu, who has been in charge of Howard R. Hughes's vast Nevada holdings, today lost his legal attempt to keep control of Mr. Hughes's $150 million investment in the state.

title: Ratelle Nets Pair of Goals, Rangers Take 4th in Row
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 19The New York Rangers continued to fatten their win ning percentage at the expense of the National Hockey's League's expansion clubs to night.

title: Giant Streak Snarls Race
description: Alex Karras, pro football's noted humorist, was asked about his role when New Orleans's Tom Dempsey, a fieldgoal kicker who misses almost as many as he makes, provided the most memorable play of the season

title: Senator's Sonto Wed Patricia Davant
description: Mr. and Mrs. James War ing Davant of New York, Mill Neck, L. I., and Maplewood, Wayzata, Minn., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Jean Davant, to Michael Parks Dominick of Boulder, Colo., son of Senator Peter Hoyt Dominick, Republican of Colorado, and Mrs. Dominick of Washington, and Engle wood, Colo. A June wedding is planned.

title: Rose D. Culter, 68 Debutante, Married to Anthony Allan Ryan
description: HAMILTON, Mass., Dec. 19Miss Rose Diamond Cut ler was married here today in Christ Episcopal Church to Anthony Allan Ryan, a greatgrandson of the late Thomas Fortune Ryan, the financier. The Rev. James Hampson performed the cer emony.

title: Britain:
description: LONDON  Those old enough to remember the wartime visit of Winston Churchill to the United States will appreciate the excitement and the glamour of that occasion. And it was not just Churchillian romance; in those days the appearance of British Prime Minister was a spe cial event.

title: U.S. GROUP APPEALS TO SPAIN ON BASQUES
description: A group or writers, publishers, intellectuals and political figures calling itself the Spanish Emergency Committee 1970 has urged the Spanish Govern ment to abstain from imposing death sentences in the trial of 15 Basques by a military tri bunal in Burgos.

title: Arms:
description: WASHINGTON  American and Soviet negotiators left Hel sinki last week with little sign of any agreement to reach par ity on strategic nuclear weap ons. The Strategic Arms Limi tation Talks (SALT) have failed in the attempt to find a for mula for equating the nuclear firepower of each side. The ne gotiators could not even agree on a precise definition of stra tegic arms.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: Ali Returns and Defies the Statistics
description: In his triumphant return to boxing after a 3year exile, Muhammad Ali proved that his talking is contagious.

title: Strain in U.S.Bonn Relations Reported
description: BONN, Dec. 19High West German officials say that Chan cellor Willy Brandt and the Nixon Administration are close to a crisis of confidence over the Chancellor's Eastern policy.

title: Cut Prices Cut Little Ice
description: LOS ANGELES  The oft repeated comment in recent weeks by retailers across the country that this is not a bigticket Christmas has nat urally turned a spotlight on the bargain basement or budget floor.

title: Antiapartheid Film Shown
description: LONDON, Dec. 19 (Reuters) A film about apartheid shown here depicts South Africa as a place where a hanging takes place every three days, where nonwhites are a silenced ma jority and where hospitals sometimes sleep African chil dren three to a bed. The film, The Witnesses, was made for the International Defense and Aid Fund, which assists polit ical prisoners and their relatives in South Africa.

title: Stormy Seas Off Newport
description: The thousands of yachting events sailed in 1970 were overshadowed by an America's Cup match that was so fraught with controversy that what may have been its most important develop ment was almost overlooked: The rest

title: Little Iowa Town Pours Out in Cold to Fete Its Nobel Laureate
description: CRESCO, Iowa, Dec. 19 I've been waiting for 50 years to see Cresco listed as the only town on a map of the world, and now I've done it, Ralph Fitzgerald, a Cresco oil dealer, exclaimed today.

title: Santa Barbara Oil Drilling Fight Defies Solution by U.S. Aides
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Dec. 19The battle over oil production in the Santa Bar bara Channel, Where a huge leak erupted two years ago and brought a new public awareness of environmental problems, is still defying resolu tion by the nation's environ mental watchdogs.

title: TIMES TO EXCHANGE REPORTS WITH STAR
description: The New York Times and The Washington Evening Star announced an agreement yes terday for an exchange of news dispatches, features and com mentaries

title: Susan H. Weist Is Bride Here
description: Miss Susan Harriet Weist and Philip Simmons Douthit were married here yesterday afternoon in St. Thomas Epis copal Church by the Rev. Dr. Frederick M. Morris, assisted by the Rev. George P. LaBar re Jr. of Vero Beach, Fla.

title: LEBANESE VEXED BY U.S. AID OFFER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 19 The Lebanese Government ap pears to be embarrassed by the Nixon Administration's offer of $5million in military assistance and has still not decided whether to accept it.

title: Paris Strikes Back at Cars: Faubourg St.Honore a Mall for a Day
description: PARIS, Dec. 19  Paris struck back at automobile traffic today.

title: Lawyer and Manufacturer Join Ford Foundation Board
Senate Pauses to Praise Retiring Senator Holland
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 19 (AP) The Senate took time off to day from lastminute legislative bottlenecks to praise Senator Spessard L. Holland, who is re tiring after 24 years in the chamber.

title: SPORT KING WINS FOR $7.60 PAYOFF
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 19  Dave Feldman's Sport King led all the way and scored an im pressive 3length victory over Raymond Vogelman Jr.'s Count Judex in the $24,300 Monumental Handicap at Lau rel race course today.

title: Students Call Paper Boycott
description: ORONO, Maine, Dec. 19 (UPI) The student senate of the University of Maine at Orono has voted to boycott products of two major Maine paper companies, Scott and Hudson. A spokesman, J. M. Wunderle Jr., said the resolution was in support of a court suit by a graduate student, Howard Trot sky, against paper companies log driving on the Kennebec River.

title: PASADENA BOWL ENDS IN 2424 TIE
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 19 (AP)Leon Burns scored his third touchdown and Rod Graves passed to Ken Matthews for a 2point conversion in the fourth quarter to give Long Beach State a 2424 tie with Louisville today in the Pasa dena Bowl.

I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: Records Without Victory
description: Mike Burton broke three world records in the national outdoor cham pionships, but he didn't win a race. That's the kind of a year it was as. Americans (and a few foreigners) bat tered the swimming record book. World

title: Pitt Downs Cornell, 8965
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 19A wellbalanced offense, led by Bill Downes and Ed Harrison, gave the University of Pitts burgh an 8965 victory over Cornell tonight. Downes got 22 points, and Harrison 14.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: Corsaro's Concept
description: MANY Broadway sea sons ago Frank Cor saro won raves for his direction of A Hatful of Rain, Michael V. Gazzo's hardhitting play about a drug addict. And now Cor saro. who has been devoting his time to operatic assign ments in recent years, is scheduled to make his debut as a movie director with a sear ing drama about a group of addicts. Rehabilitated addicts. He has just been signed by co producers Mortimer Levitt and Jerry Hammer to direct the film version of the recent Off Broadway hit The Concept. Edward Mann is now writ ing the script and shooting should begin here in Febru ary, on a budget of $350,000.

title: POLAND IS CALM, REPORTS INDICATE; WARSAW NORMAL
description: WARSAW, Dec. 19Calm appeared to be returning to Po land tonight after five days of the most violent and wide spread rioting in the nation's postwar history.

title: On Christmas Day No More Current Events
description: ISTARTED teaching poetry writing at P.S. 61, which is in Manhattan on East 12th Street between Ave nues B and C, in 1968. I hoped to find a way of teaching the subject that would make children as happy to write poems as they are to draw and paint, and after a few months it seemed to me that I had found it.

title: The Best of Schubert and Ravel
description: THAT time of year has come again when gift giving is not only in order but de rigueur for most people. For those interested in music, whether givers or receivers, thoughts are apt to turn to recordings as desirable and everwel come items reflecting atten tion to personal taste and en joyment.

title: Television
description: THE controversy over the future of television is getting down to fundamentalsnew sources of production which up to now have been directly or Indirectly domi nated by the three networks. Gen eral Electric, the world's largest manu facturer of electrical and electronic equipment, is taking the plunge into show business through a new subsid iary, Tomorrow Productions, Inc., of which Thomas W. Moore, a former head. of the American Broadcasting Company television network, will be President.

title: Nuptials for Dr. Ruth D. Neuman
description: Dr. Ruth Dowling Neuman, daughter of Robert W. Dowl ing, chairman of the execu tive board of the City Invest ing Company, was Married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Bertel Bruun of New York and Copenhagen, Denmark. The ceremony was performed in the Dowling apartment at the Pierre by State Supreme Court Justice Theodore R. Kupferman.

title: Stevie Winwood Keeps Traffic Moving
description: THE FIRST time I met Stevie Winwood, pop music's infant Mozart, he was buried under a pile of wriggling groupies. I had gone backstage at the Fillmore during the first American tour of Traffic and when I walked into the group's dressing room, all I could see was girls. Frizzy, frowsy girls were sitting, kneeling, crawling all over a brokendown ottoman that contained within its bottom est folds this poor little pixie of a boy. Sitting there with his knees up to his eyebrows, Stevie was completely spaced. He didn't even notice the smoldering joint that must have been burning his long white fingers.

title: Medicine
description: Frank is 45 years old, weighs about 20 pounds more than he should, has a high cholesterol level and a family history of heart disease. He's been hearing about cutting down on choles terol for nearly two decades, but he just can't face giving up the foods he loves bestRoque fort cheese dressing, fried pork chops, ice cream:

title: She Is a Woman Who Drinks, And That Is That
description: NEIL SIMON'S The Gingerbread Lady is a skeleton with bells on. The bells, of course, are the hard, quick Simon humors, humors that are less than epigrams and more than jokes. They ring out loud and clear in Maureen Stapleton's blowsy, carousing, bravura perform ance as a lady who can eas ily explain why she has no trouble drinking in the dark (It's not hard, I know where my lips are) They sound as though they'd been tapped sharply with a pencil in Betsy von Furstenberg's brusque, dry, exquisitely enameled performance as a fading beauty whose fortune lies in her makeup kit (Do you know that I spent two whole weeks at Westhamp ton Beach last summer and the sun never once touched my body?). They jangle gid dily whenever Michael Lom bard's homosexual actor friend is objecting to Off Broadway producers who eat Tootsie Rolls when they should be talking to you, and they turn to pure tin when ever ingenue Ayn Ruymen's strident daughter is trading quips with Miss Stapleton. But they are always there, a carillon of facesaving comebacks, often shrewd, nine times out of ten observ ant, compulsive and gen erous, guarantors of our laughter no matter what else goes grim.

title: Another Vintage Year
description: Jim Plunkett of Stanford, Joe Theis mann of Notre Dame and Archie Man ning of Mississippi created validity for the theme that 1970 was again The Year of the Quarterback. But as the season progressed it became distressing

title: WOMAN IN BUSINESS
description: G. G. Michelson, an un swerving fan of the New York Yankees, confirms that old baseball maxim, nice gals finish first. At least, when they are intelligent, highly qualified and never take their eyes off the ball.

title: Detectives Here Make Arrests In Less Than 6% of Robberies
description: A study of serious crimes here has found that only 5.58 per cent of the robberies, 1.35 per cent of the burglaries and 2.2 per cent of the grand larcenies assigned to detectives result in arrests by them.

title: Cartier of Scotch Plains High Wins 2Mile Run at Bishop Loughlin Games
description: Vincent Cartier, who domi nated the schoolboy crosscoun try scene this fall, served no tice yesterday that he may do the same during the indoor track season.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: When an agency man greets an interviewer with an 8:30 A.M. appointment looking as if he's already been at work for a half hour, you've got to figure that here's a man who's going places.

title: A Controversy Draws to Close
description: The holiday greeting card from World Championship Tennis is relatively simple: five Christmas balls, a tennis ball with a holly sprig, and the caption, Season's Greetings. But near the bot tom of the card, in eightpoint type for all the tennis world to savor, is the inscription, ILTF Sanction Pending.

title: Playoff Berth Could Rest on Flip of Coin as N.F.L.'s Season Closes Today
Architecture

The $57mil lion plan, consisting of three 39story towers and two and three story townhouses, is part of a larger scheme for the old Washington Market site in Lower Manhattan.

title: House Passes Bill With Broad Provisions for New Communities
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The House approved and sent to President Nixon today a com prehensive housing bill that contains broad new provisions for building new communities and revitalizing the core of existing ones. The vote was 168 to 104.

description: PARIS, Dec. 19Britain and the Common Market countries are at odds over what percent age of the community budget she would be prepared to pay in the first few years of mem bership.

title: LEBANESE REPORT AN ISRAELI ATTACK

title: Another Decline for Oarsmen

title: Nixon and Brezhnev
description: MOSCOWThe gentlest thing that can be said about U.S.Soviet relations at the end of the year is that they are not exactly bubbling with the Christ mas spirit. The official attitude here toward Washington is now hard and critical. It is not hostile or menacing, but clearly there has been a marked change for the worse since the first of the year.

title: City Employes:
description: The city's yearend contract negotiations with the firefight ers, police and sanitationmen are approaching a critical phase and there are rankandfile rumblings about the poverty pleas being issued regularly and often, by the Lindsay administration.

title: Miss Bacon Bride of William Patten
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 19Miss Katharine Bacon and William Samuel Patten, both descendants of John Jay, the first Chief Justice of the United States, were mar ried in Christ Episcopal Church here at noon today. The Rev. Mason Wilson per formed the ceremony, assist ed by the Rev. W. Murray Kenney. A reception followed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Bacon.

title: Vietnam Opening in Paris?
description: After two months of negativism, the Vietnamese Communists now have made a first cautious response President Nixon's imaginative October offer to negotiate a standstill ceasefire, a political settlement and a time table for American withdrawal. Their response, outlined at the last two sessions of the Paris peace talks, indicates several significant advances from previous positions. It warrants far more vigorous American probing than it ap pears to be receiving.

title: Metropolitan Shows Art From Antiquity
description: Works of art from antiquity from such, diverse areas as Egypt, the Near East, Greece and Romeare on exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where they show the in fluences brought to bear on the arts through the peaceful routes of trade, through war and through conquest.

title: Susan Kurz, Skidmore Alumna, Married to Robert Frank Izard
description: WINNETKA, Ill., Dec. 19 Miss Susan Jane Kurz, daugh ter of Walter Charles Kurz, president of the Tribune Company in Chicago, and Mrs. Kurz, was married here today to Robert Frank Izard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank William Izard of Chicago.

To wit, that after some final discussion within the Cabinet in Jerusalem, Israel can be expected to rejoin the Middle East peace talks early in Jan uary.

title: SLUMCHILD REPORT REVEALS NO. 1 FEARS
description: Rats and roaches scare slum children more than anything else, according to a psychologi cal study of 101 fifth and sixthgraders in Brooklyn.

description: Achievement tests given to public school pupils here ear lier this year show that an increasing number of city youngsters in the intermedi ate grades have fallen behind national standards in reading.

title: Maggie Savoy Bellows, 53, Of The Los Angeles Times
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19 Maggie Savoy Bellows, the women's editor of The Los An geles Times, died here today of cancer. She was 53 years old.

title: Employer's Beard Ban Upheld By the State Court of Appeals
description: The State Court of Appeals has ruled that an employer may refuse to hire a man on the ground that he is not cleanshaven.

title: R. K. Winters to Wed Margery Lee Gordon
description: EAST HILLS, L. I., Dec. 19  The engagement of Miss Margery Lee Gordon to Rich ard Kenneth Winters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Winters of Miami, has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Monte Jeffrey Gordon.

title: 3 Bronx Patrolmen, On Their Own Time, Seize Rape Suspects
description: Bronx patrolmen working on their own time arrested two men yesterday and charged tern with robbing and raping a 22yearold mother of two chil dren eight hours earlier.

title: Photography

title: ARMY MOVEMENTS IN BLOC REPORTED

description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 19 Miss Phyllis Irene Brown and Allen Bowman Sabin, a real estate dealer in Denver, were married here this after noon in the Westminster Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. Robert W. Scott.

title: State and City:
description: James Major drove into Ari etta, N.Y., one snowy morning in 1968 and went directly to the township building of the north country community of 234 peo ple. Working exactly like a bank examiner, he came in unan nounced, flashed his credentials and began by counting the cash on hand, then started to sift through township records, bank statements, vouchers and re ceipts.

title: 1 OF 10 IN U.S. FOUND UNDER POVERTY LINE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI) The Census Bureau reported this week that one of every 10 Americans had an income be low the Governmentset pov erty line in 1969.

description: HAVANA, Dec. 7United States citizens who have hi jacked airliners to Cuba are living here in segregated quar ters because of antagonisms from hijackers of other na tionalities.

title: Nixon Ahead of Muskie in Gallup Poll

description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 19 (AP)  Ground  breaking cere monies for the Amateur Soft ball Association's national head quarters and Hall of Fame were held today.

It is the New Fed eral Theater, whose head quarters are in the venerable Henry Street Playhouse on the Lower East Side, once the home of Sanford Meis ner's celebrated theater school and recently declared a landmark site.

title: U. S. Rules Two Muscovites Are Americans

description: The New York City Ballet's The Nutcracker continues on its merry boxoffice way at the State Theater, with occasional new casting to spark special interest.

title: Children:
description: The White House Conference on Children, which brought 4,000 delegates to Washington for five days last week, began with a working paper that challenged the image of America as a child centered society or a children's paradise. On the contrary, that backgrounder said most Amer ican children are neglected: the children of the poor because of poverty and ignorance; the chil dren of the rich because they are treated as possessions, com peting unsuccessfully for the time of their successoriented parents.

title: President Threatens to Summon New Congress Into Early Session
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 President Nixon threatened to day to call the new Congress into session on Jan. 3 if the current 91st Congress failed to complete action on the Ad ministration's legislative pro gram. The new Congress is scheduled to convene Jan. 21.

title: New Link to Dawn of Urban Culture Is Found in Iran
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec, 19 A previously unknown civili zation that appears to establish trade links for the first time between ancient Mesopotamia in the Middle East and the dis tant Indus Valley civilization has been uncovered in Iran by an Americanled archeology team.

title: Navy Beats N.Y.U., 7372
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 19 John Caldwell's eightfoot jump shot in the final 29 seconds of a fiveminute overtime period lifted Navy to a 7372 victory over New York University in the consolation game of the Utah Classic tonight.

title: Cholera Vaccination Rule Lifted by U.S. as Needless
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  The Government has decided to abandon its longtime require ment that travelers entering the United States from a cholera affected area be vaccinated against the disease. Officials said the change involved no danger to public health.

title: Perry Cooke 3d Weds Louise Taft in Suburb
description: SALISBURY, Conn., Dec. 19Miss Ann Louise Taft, granddaughter of the late Senator Robert A. Taft of Ohio and greatgranddaugh ter of President William How ard Taft, was married here this afternoon to Carlton Perry Cooke 3d, a medical student.

title: Tanzanian Oil Accord
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Dec. 19 (Agence FrancePresse) The Agip Company of Italy will search for oil in new areas in Tanzania under an agree ment signed here with the Government, officials said this week. The agreement adds vast territory to the area Agip is prospecting.

title: Poland:
description: WARSAW Citizens I am speaking to you at a serious time, said Polish Premier Jozef Cyrankiewicz last Thursday. Hostile forces are endeavoring to create new seats of anarchy. The worst rioting since 1956 had erupted in at least three Polish cities, with 10 to 20 persons dead at that point, and hundreds injured.

title: AEROSPACE CUTS CAUSE JOB CRISIS
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 19 George Florea, 48 years old, is playing Santa Claus at a de partment store toyland this Christmas season and finds that it helps ease the bitterness and despair a Little Ten months ago he lost his job as a de sign engineer at Lockheed Missile and Space Company. When his unemployment bene fits ran out, he took the $2.50 anhour job as Santa.

title: Great and Small Give to Neediest Cases
description: Some of the letters to the Fund for the Neediest Cases are formal. Pursuant to reso lution of the Board of Di rectors . . . The note that started that way included a check for $5,000.

title: Computer: N.Y. Hope Of Success OffTrack
SNOW SHOWS STYLE ON THE AUTOHARP
description: Kilby Snow is a master or the autoharp  not just a virtuoso on an instrument that has not attracted very many fast fingered technicians, but a lefthanded virtuoso. His left handedness, Mr. Snow ex plained to an audience that sprawled around Noland's Studio, 463 West Street, to hear him on Friday night, enables him to play drag notes or up ward slurs in a manner that would be impossible for a right handed player because the re lationship of thumb and finger would be reversed.

title: A Smoother Road for Cement?
description: Despite a variety of cur rent problems such as lag ging sales, sagging profits and mounting antipollution expenditures, the cement in dustry faces a brighter out look.

title: Tokyo's Growth Slowing
description: TOKYO, Dec. 19 (Reuters) Tokyo, with 11.4 million people, has slowed the pace of its population increase to the lowest since the end of World War II, with more people mov ing from the center to suburbs, the Premier's office has dis closed.

title: Vatican Denies Reports Pope Is in Poor Health
description: ROME, Dec. 19The Vati can today denied reports that the health of Pope Paul VI had suddenly deteriorated. A statement said that the Pope who is recovering from influ enza, is well and for some days has been receiving his closest advisers.

title: 25 Home on Leave Fail To Return to Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  Twentyfive of the first 198 United States serv icemen to enjoy a new 14day leave in the United States failed to return to Vietnam yesterday as scheduled, the Pentagon said today.

title: PANEL RECOMMENDS LONDON AIRPORT SITE
description: LONDON, Dec. 19 (AP)A Royal Commission has recom mended that London's third airport be built at Cublington, a village 50 miles northwest of the capital.

title: Campuses Quiet but Not Content
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 19 Lightning toppled a 300 pound, ornamental concrete ball from the dome of the Hoover Tower at Stanford Uni versity here a few nights ago, scattering fragments over a parking lot 285 feet below.

title: Pop
description: GEORGE HARRISON: All Things Must Pass (Apple STCH 639). There was a time when George Harrison was viewed by many as the for gotten Beatle. Oh, he was always present, all right, playing fine, but peculiarly anonymous lead guitar, sing ing, and too rarely, contrib uting delightful original songs. And yet the picture was ambivalent, because de spite the attention given to John Lennon's multitalents, to Paul McCartney's lovely melodies and handsome pro file, and to Ringo Starr's character acting, it was George who generated some of the major changes in the style and substance of the Beatles. When George be came interested in Indian classical music, sitars sud denly became the hot item in music stores. When he became fascinated by the meditative quality of Eastern religions, the Beatles (and, through them, a generation of young listeners) started chanting mantras and medi tating hypnotically. And, fi nally, it was George who composed Something, one of the group's most powerful and extensively recorded hits.

title: MEXICO PLANNING TWO NEW TAXES
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 19A 10 per cent tax on luxury con sumption and a new capital gains tax form part of Pres ident Luis Echeverria Alvarez's fiscal program to spread Mex ico's wealth.

title: Lucien Burns Crosland Fiance Of Miss Katherine R. Lupton
description: LOOKOUT MOUNTAIN, Tenn., Dec. 19Mr. and Mrs. John Thomas Lupton have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kath erine Rawling Lupton, to Lu cien Burns Crosland, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Burton Crosland of Potomac, Md., formerly of Short Hills, N. J.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: THE STAGNANT United States economy Is begin ning to stir slightly again from the stimulus of increased automotive and steel production, but consumer buying remains sluggish as the Christ mas season comes to a close. Matthews, minister of the church, assisted.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Fashion goods and apparel are getting an unexpected dividend from the recession this year. A much larger pro portion of Christmas gifts to young and old in the family will be items that have practical value. These in clude pants suits, slacks and sportswear, as well as scarves, gloves, neckties and sweaters.
