description: Prices showed no decisive pattern on the American Stock Exchange yesterday as the list finished mixed on moderate trading.

title: The Catholic Church and the Blacks
description: The Roman Catholic Church in America looks white, thinks white, and feels white. It prays white, wor ships white and in relation to black people, believes preeminently white.

title: Rutgers Coach Suspended Over Controversial Letter
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 21 (AP)  Les Wallack, Rutgers track and cross country coach, was relieved of his coaching duties today after writing a controversial letter to the student newspaper attack ing the intelligence of a guest columnist. Wallack asked to be suspended after he wrote a letter to The Targum, the stud ent daily newspaper, which criticized a column by Gregory A. Burke, a black freshman.

title: WJRZ Gets Radio Rights To Football Playoff Games
description: Radio station WJRZ in Hackensack, N.J., has obtained exclusive radio broadcasting rights for the metropolitan area to the playoff and champion ship games of the National Foot ball Conference of the National Football League.

title: Winter Has Arrived Bringing Light Snow
description: Winter began officially at 1:26 A.M. this morning with the arrival of the winter solstice. The weather obliged and provided a light snowfall overnight.

title: WIMBLEDON RAISES PURSE TO $120,000
description: WIMBLEDON, England, Dec. 21 (AP)Prize money at next year's Wimbledon tennis tour nament will be $120,000, an in crease of $19,200, the All Eng land Club said today.

title: Panther Trial Postponed
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 22 (UPI)The longdelayed trial of four Black Panthers on charges of attempted murder in a 1968 gun battle with the Oakland police has been post poned once again. Alameda Superior Court Judge Redmond C. Staat continued the case and issued a bench warrant for John L. Scott, 19 years old, who was not in court. The other defendants are Wendell Wade, 23, Terry Cotton, 22, and Donnell Lankford, 19.

title: Christmas in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 22The tragic problem in this Holy City at Christmas time of 1970 is not only how to find peace, but how to be sure of the good will of its friends and the good faith of its enemies.

title: Children Never Even Missed Christmas Setting
description: Every year we hear that some of the smallest children think Santa Claus lives here, said Chris Crispens as 22 kindergarten children climbed the stairs to see his annual Christmas exhibit.

title: GOODELL SCORES BOMBING THREATS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  Senator Charles E. Goodell, in his farewell speech to the Sen ate on Vietnam, warned today that the resumption of the bombing of North Vietnam could bring a direct military confrontation with the Soviet Union or Communist China.

title: Budget Office Enforcing Equal Hiring
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 The Office of Management and Budget, acting under a new Administration policy, is requir ing all Federal agencies, to document their equal employ ment opportunity activities as they submit their budget re quests for the fiscal year 1972, according to Administration of ficials.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P. O. Box 557, New York, N. Y. 10036, or to any of the following eight organi zations that certify these cases:

title: Cambodians Claim Victory
description: PNOMPENH, Dec. 22 (Reu ters).  Enemey saboteurs ran into a Cambodian security pa trol on a strategic dam near here today and lost 21 men in an ensuing battle, according to the Cambodian high command.

title: Texas Democrats Say Connally Assures Them
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 Texas Republicans may have been premature in expressing elation at President Nixon's decision to name a Democrat, former Gov. John B. Con nally Jr., as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Cavaliers Lose No. 36
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Chicago Bulls posted their biggest victory margin in five years in the National Basketball Association tonight with a 121 80 triumph over the Cleveland Cavaliers, who lost for the 36th time in 39 games.

title: Switch Panel's Failure Delays L.I. Commuters
description: Service on the Long Island Railroad between Woodside, Queens, and Penn Station was knocked out for an hour and a half during the rush hour last night when a panel that controls the switching system in the Sunnyside yards suffered an electrical failure.

title: Court Rules States Lack Authority on Atom Wastes
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 22A state agency has no power to re quire stricter standards for radioactive pollution than those set by the Atomic Energy Com mission, a Federal judge ruled today.

title: ExHospital Aide Accused Of Forging His Credentials
description: A Bronx man who was em ployed by two city hospitals as an Xray technician for almost three yearS has been indicted by a grand jury for allegedly forging the papers that qualified him for the jobs, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday.

title: Removed in Secret
description: The extradition of Miss Davis was accomplished as secretly as possible and behind a shield of tight security.

title: Draft Board Shifts Objector From Youth Post
description: Under orders from his draft board, a conscientious objec tor has quit his job as a group father to 17 boys in a home for neglected children in Brooklyn and gone to work as a porter in a Schnectady hospital where he hauls gar bage and mops floors.

title: Britain Won't Ban Tuna
description: LONDON, Dec. 22  The British government decided to day against banning the sale of canned tuna despite a finding of a high concentration of methylmercury in samples ex amined here.

title: An English Visitor Repays Compliment: New York Is O.K.
description: From London  portrayed recently as a nice place to live by Mayor Lindsay and migrs such as the humor ist S. J. Perelmanhas come praise for New York and the United States.

title: Answer on Phone: This Is the Robber
description: CHICAGO. Dec. 22 Thousands of radio listeners heard the capture of a sus pected bank robber today.

title: DAVID EARLE JONES OF RUBBER CONCERN
description: GREEN POND, N. J., Dec. 22 David Earle Jones, retired di rector of research of the Amer ican Hard Rubber Company, died yesterday in Chilton Me morial, Hospital, Pompton Plains, after a long illness. He was 74 years old.

title: MISS DURAS'S PLAY OPENS A RUN HERE
description: A Place Without Doors, a play by Marguerite Duras, op ened last night at the Stairway Theater, 235 West 46th Street.

title: EXLOMBARDI AIDE ENDS 3YEAR STAY
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Dec. 22 (AP)Phil Bengtson, the faith ful, softspoken aide who had been handpicked by the late Vince Lombardi to continue Green Bay's football glory, re signed under fire today as the Packers head coach and gen eral manager.

title: MRS. MEIR INSISTS ON ARAB ASSURANCES
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 22Premier Golda Meir insisted today that it the Middle East peace talks were renewed, Israel would want assurances that the Arabs were ready for a genuine peace before discussing Israeli with drawal to new borders.

title: Mohawk Strike Affecting Jobs and Sales on Routes
description: In Utica, N. Y., Lorraine As teri is selling ties to wives at the Boston Store this Christmas instead of offering their hus bands coffee, tea or milk.

title: COLONELS TOPPLE CONDORS, 116100
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 22 (UPI)Dan Issel grabbed 29 rebounds to set a team record tonight and lift the Kentucky Colonels to a 116100 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors in the second game of an Ameri can Basketball Association doubleheader.

title: 20 Queens College Blacks Evict 500 White Students
description: About 20 black students evicted 500 white students, sometimes forcibly, from the Queens College student union building in Flushing yesterday.

title: Indians, Their Livelihood Gone, Bid a Sad Farewell to Burma
description: Driven from their former livelihoods in small shops and trading enterprises in Burma by national ization in 1964, thousands of Indians leave Rangoon each year for their own country, which many of them have never seen.

title: Miss. Hawkins Married Here
description: Miss Mary Louise Hawkins was married yesterday after noon in the Community Church of New York to Her bert Blueweiss of Fort Lee, N. J., publisher of Daily News Record and a vice president of Fairchild Publications, Inc. The Rev. Chadbourne Spring performed the cere mony.

title: Harvard Beaten, 7774
description: Harvard Beaten, 7774

title: State Is Petitioned To Help Preserve Shakespeare Fete
description: Governor Rockefeller has been asked to invoke whatever emergency measure is neces sary for the State of New York to prevent the possible demise of the New York Shakespeare Festival and its Public Theater.

title: ExArmy Officer Says Unit Spied on Campuses in City
description: A former Army agent said yesterday that Army intelli gence personnel had spied on student political, groups on col lege campuses in the city and on welfare mothers demonstra ting at City Hall.

title: Dormitory Shift Barred
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22The Uni versity of Massachusetts Board of Trustees voted down yester day a motion to extend coed dormitory privileges to fresh men. A spokesman said, how ever, that the proposal might be reconsidered at the board's meeting in January. Coed dormitories are now available to upper classmen.

title: All Foreign Banks in Libya Are Nationalized
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 22 (Reu ters)  All foreign banks an Libya were nationalized by gov ernment decree tonight. The state had previously held a 51 per cent controlling interest in the banks.

title: Canadian Cabinet Aide Quits
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 22 (AP)So licitorGeneral George J. Ma?? raith resigned from the Cana dian Cabinet today for personal reasons, and Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau an nounced that he would be re placed by JeanPierre Goyer, a member of Parliament from Montreal.

title: ANOTHER TOP AIDE QUITS POLICE POST
description: The resignation of Chief of Patrol Harry Taylor, the third top commander to leave the Police Department since the Labor Day departure of for mer Commissioner Howard R. Leary, was announced yester day by Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy.

title: Sports of The Times
description: There were almost tragic overtones to the ousting of Paul Brown as coach of the Cleveland Browns after the 1962 season. At that point in, history he was the most successful coach professional football had yet producedVince Lombardi was just then emergingand his removal by Art Modell, the comparatively new owner of the Brownies, was a shock.

title: 16 SEASONS SPENT AS HANOVER PILOT
description: HANOVER, N.H., Dec. 22 Dartmouth officials said tonight that Bob Blackman was leaving Hanover to become head foot ball coach at the University of Illinois.

title: Wall St. Asks: Can Crisis Happen Again?
description: Wall Street is emerging from its darkest period since the Depression and in the sub dued aftermath of neardisaster it is bothered by a vital ques tion: Can it happen again? Has the financial crisis been per manently resolved or merely temporarily blunted?

title: STUDENTS CREATE N.B.C.'S GREETINGS
description: Young English film students created the Christmas cards the National Broadcasting Com pany will televise to millions of its viewers this season.

title: Navy Commandos Killed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22 (AP)  The United States Command said today two Navy commandos were killed and one was wounded in a skirmish in the Mekong Delta. A farmer enemy soldier serv ing as a scout for the Ameri cans also was wounded. There were no known enemy losses.

title: Mideast Politics Give Bethlehem's Handicraft Unexpected Market
description: BETHLEHEM, IsraeliOc cupied Jordan, Dec. 21  The politieg of the Middle East have found their way into the local Christian Arab handicraft industries  with the lucrative result of some untraditional customers and unexpected new products from the birthplace of Jesus.

title: 30 Horses Killed in Fire
description: AMSTERDAM, N. Y., Dec. 22 (AP)Thirty horses died in a fire early today in a riding school in the Amsterdam woods. About 50 horses escaped or were freed, but some of them are still missing, the police reported.

title: CONGRESS BEGINS HOLIDAY RECESS; SST FOES WIN TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The 91st Congress went home for Christmas tonight, still unable to dig its way out of two years accumulation of public problems in time for the ar rival of the 92d.

title: Dr. Paul White in Hospital
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22Dr. Paul Dudley White, the cardiologist who cared for President Dwight D. Eisenhower, was resting to day at Massachusetts General Hospital after a mild heart at tack Sunday. Dr. White is 84 years old. Long an advocate of vigorous exercise and physical fitness as a means of avoiding heart disease, he still maintains a medical practice. Dr. Allan L. Friedlich?? his physician, said the heart specialist had suffered a very mild coronary thrombosis without evidence of muscle damage.

title: 76ers Win in Overtime
description: PHOENIX, Ariz. Dec. 22 (AP)Billy Cunningham scored 9 points in overtime to give the Philadelphia 76ers a 133 129 victory over the Phoenix Suns in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Henry Hyman, 84, Founder Of Noma Light Concern
description: Henry Hyman, who organized Noma Electric Corporation, for merly a major manufacturer of Christmas tree lights, in the 1930's died Monday at his resi dence, 225 Central Park West, after a short illness. He was 84 years old.

title: STOCK INSURANCE VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 The Senate passed tonight and sent to President Nixon the final version of a bill to estab lish a new system of insurance for securities investors.

title: California Financial Corp. Sets Up Added Reserves
description: The California Financial Cor poration, a savings and loan holding company in San Fran cisco, announced yesterday it wourd establish additional re serves of $3,275,000 to provide for possible losses in dis posing of real estate it had ac quired by foreclosure and for investments, The action will

title: KANTOROW BRINGS SUPERIOR RECITAL
description: Superb chamber music play ing of the most joyful sort was heard at the violin recital of JeanJacques Kantorow Monday night at Town Hall on the Young Concert Artists Series.

title: Hickes Pace Seal Victory
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 22 (UPI)Ernie Hicke, a rookie, scored two goals, the last on an open net, and his brother, Billy, tallied once tonight to pace the California seals to a 52 National Hockey League victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Eastern Names Borman A Senior Vice President
description: Former astronaut Frank Borman, commander of Apol lo 8 on the first manned space flight circling the moon, was named senior vice president for group opera tions at Eastern Air Lines yesterday, the company said.

title: New Concern Formed
description: PARIS, Dec. 22  France's largest champagne producer and second largest cognac producer announced plans to merge today, forming a new enterprise with annual sales of $80million.

title: 4 Men Needing Goodwill Find It Always in Season
description: With Christmas two days away, Ron Passerella, a young race driver from Col lingswood, N. J., tells a time ly story proving, popular cyn icism to the contrary not withstanding, that goodwill toward men has not van ished. Passerella and a part ner, Clem Martini, awn a sprint car that they campaign on the United Rac ing Club circuit with a limited budget. For a race at Essex Junction, Vt., two of their friends volun teered to help in the pits.

title: NIXON ASKED TO BAR POVERTY FUND CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22A diverse group representing 19 national organizations sent a telegratm to President Nixon to day urging tint to avert pro posed cuts in the funds re quested for next year's anti poverty programs.

title: U.S. TV MAKER'S SUIT ASSAILED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22 (AP)The suit filed against Japanese tele vision producers by the Na tional Union Electric Corpora tion of Greenwich, Conn., is another example of manage rnent shifting the blame for poor performance to imports in general and imports from Japan in particular, a Japanese Elec tronics Industry Association spokesman said today.

title: 5% Fare Increase Planned On Flights From Europe
description: GENEVA, Dec. 22Passen ger fares for air travel between Europe and Africa, the Middle East, Asia and Australasia are to be increased an average of 5 per cent on April 1, the Inter national Air Transport Associa tion said today.

title: Nixon Considering Holding A News Conference Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (Reuters)President Nixon is considering holding a news con ference soon, possibly before Jan. 1, the White House an nounced today.

title: Hawks Beat Lakers, 11915
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP) Walt Hazzard hit a 15foot jumper with 36 seconds re maining to give the Atlanta Hawks a 119115 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight.

title: MOVETTE SCORES 8LENGTH VICTORY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22  Ridden for the first time by Herb Hinojosa, John Louis Argo's Movette romped to an eightlength victory over Our Cheri, with the favored Rose mont Bow third, at Liberty Bell race track today in the $12,000 Prep for the $25,000 added New Hope Stakes on New Year's Day.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: TREND IS MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market was narrowly mixed in quiet trading yesterday.

title: Cardinal Cooke Visits G.I.'s Close to Demilitarized Zone
description: DANANG, South Vietnam Dec. 22 (UPI)Cardinal Cooke of New York, dressed in a United States Army fatigue shirt, khaki trousers and a camouflage steel helmet, flew to the northernmost reaches of South Vietnam today to visit American servicemen near the demilitarized zone.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Ezra Cornell Marries Shirley Katherine Egan
description: SHREVEPORT, La., Dec. 22  Miss Shirley Katherine Egan and Ezra Cornell, a greatgreatgreatgrandson of Ezra Cornell, founder of Cor nell University, were married here this evening in St. Mark's Episcopal Church. The Rev. Dr. J. Lawrence Plumley performed the cere mony.

title: Urban League Head Sees Nixon In a Quest for More Cooperation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Whitney M. Young Jr. met with President Nixon and his Cabinet today. He said that he viewed the meeting as a new beginning toward greater cooperation between the Gov ernment and, private agencies in attacking problems of the black community.

title: Allende Moderation Seen In Copper Nationalizing
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 22 Chile's President Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, has apparently settled for the moderate ap proach to the nationalization of American interests in Chilean copper mines  moderate, that is, within the complex of politi cal forces that surround him in his new multiparty govern ment.

title: Court Backs Flying Tiger; Hennessy and Moet Merge
description: Federal Judge Sam Perry in Chicago yesterday reversed an order he issued on Monday and said he will permit a merger of the North American Car Corporatin into Flying Tiger Corporation to proceed.

title: GERMAN REDS END BERLIN BLOCKAGE
description: BERLIN, Dec. 22  East Germany today removed the ob structions to road traffic be tween West Germany and West Berlin that it had imposed al most continuously since Satur day.

title: 2d Lunar Night for Rover
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22 (Reuter) The Soviet moon rover settled down today for a period of in activity during the lunar night, from tomorrow until Jan. 7. Be fore it was shut down for its second lunar night, the vehicle was 1,618 yards away from its original landing stage.

title: Business Records
description: EASTERN DISTRICT

title: Need for Taxi Regulation
description: Taxicab offduty signs twinkled like Christmas lights on downtown streets yesterday as cab drivers took advantage of the snow to pick and choose among poten tial riders. The swift poststrike return to normal prac tices which can no longer be accepted underscores the need for prompt action by the City Council to create a Taxicab Commission.

title: City's Consumer Unit Obtains First Mass Restitution Order
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Department, in the first action for mass restitution under the Consumer Protection Act, said yesterday that it had obtained a temporary restraining order against a child model agency charged with fraud and de ception.

title: DANIEL WIDELOCK OF CITY LAB UNIT
description: Dr. Daniel Widelock, chief research scientist and deputy director of laboratory services for the New York City, Health Department, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital after a long illness. He was 59 years old and lived in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: CITY COUNCIL INQUIRY ON SPOFFORD URGED
description: A City Council investigation of the embattled Spofford Juvenile Center in the Bronx was urged yesterday.

title: Enrollment in R.O.T.C.  Drops To the Lowest Level Since 1947
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Enrollment in college Reserve Officers Training Corps pro gramsthe source of more than half the regular officers in the armed servicesplummeted this year to the lowest level since 1947.

title: 2 AGENCIES TO SCAN TV ADS TO CHILDREN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) Two Federal regulatory agen cies announced today they were considering unprecedent ed joint hearings to explore (problems associated with tele vision advertising aimed at children. Myles W. Kirkpatrick, Federal Trade Commission chairman, and Dean Burch, Federal Communications Com mission chairman, discussed the problem yesterday, the an nouncement said. They post poned a decision on hearings pending further study.

title: SCHOOL FUND BILL HITS SENATE SNAG
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  Another piece of Administra tionbacked legislation ran into a roadblock in Congress today when Senate liberals refused to accept a bill passed last night by the House to help school districts reduce segregation.

title: PINFANG HSIA, 68,. BANK OF CHINA AIDE
description: Pinfang Hsia, who was man ager of the Bank of China in this city from 1939 to 1946, died yesterday at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center after a long illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 310 West End Avenue.

title: On Stage, Thoreau Speaks to Today
description: Can you guess which thea ter piece is receiving at least 75 different production in as many communities across the country this season?

title: Philadelphia Police Head Denies Any Discrimination
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (DPI) Police Commissioner Frank L. Rizzo denied today that the Philadelphia police department discriminated in the hiring and promotion of blacks.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, Dec 22, 1970

title: TB Decline Makes Diagnosis Difficult
description: An outbreak of drugresistant tuberculosis among members of a Brooklyn family that led to the death of a 16yearold girl and serious illness in six others, including three infants, has pointed to major problems doc tors face in trying to eradicate this declining disease.

title: Rutgers Names Unit to Review Suspension of Coach
description: Rutgers University ap pointed a fourman commit tee yesterday to review the status of Les Wallack, its suspended track coach. Dr. Mason W. Gross, the New Jersey school's presi dent, named Prof. Monroe Berkowitz of the Economics Department to head the ad visory panel.

title: Manson and CoDefendants Barred From Court Again
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (UPI) Charles M. Manson and three women codefendants put on another outburst in front of the jury at the Tate murder trial todal and had to be removed from the courtroom again be fore the prosecutor could re sume his summation.

title: $1,000 PAY RISES OFFERED TO POLICE AND FIREMEN HERE
description: The city offered $1,000 in pay increases to its firemen and policemen yesterday, and $900 to its sanitationmen.

title: ANTHONY DANCERS USE BIBLE THEMES
description: Two splendid reasons to see the Mary Anthony Dance Thea ter are ROSS Parkes and Yuriko Kimura. Others are Daniel Maloney, Ellen Robbins and Tonia Shimin. The choreog raphy of the works they appear in has a friendly and crafts manly predictability that allows the dancers to appear to excel lent advantage. The company performed Sunday evening at the Fashion Institute of Tech nology.

title: Dance: Makarova's Giselle for Ballet Theater
Business Gifts to Clients Are Diverted to Charity
description: Last Christmas, Maxon Davis, Inc., a New York ad vertising agency, sent $25 electronic football games to its clients as holiday remem brances.

title: 50 Miles of Key Route Cleared Of Enemy, Cambodians Report
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 22 (AP)  A Cambodian gen eral reported today that his forces had cleared enemy troops from the first 50 miles of the 135mile highway from Pnompenh to the Sea.

title: U.S. Expresses Regret In Killing of a Vietnamese
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22 (UPI)The United States Embassy expressed re gret today over the accidental shooting on Dec. 7 of a Viet namese student by an American soldier at Quinhon, 250 miles northeast of Saigon.

title: Crime Figure's Home Burns
description: MOUNTAINSIDE, N. J., Dec. 22 (AP)A fire in the home of Angelo DeCarlo did extensive damage last night, fire officials said. DeCarlo is in Federal cus tody in Missouri for a convic tion earlier this year on conspi racy and extortion. The police said the fire, which began in the attic, appeared to have been accidental.

title: By Rail to the South, a Holiday Pilgrimage
description: ABOARD THE CITY OF NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 20 Chicago could not have been grayer. It was 8 o'clock in the morning and still barely daylight, so thick were the clouds.

title: U.S. STUDENT GROUP TELLS OF HANOI TRIP
description: PARIS, Dec. 22A delega tion of the National Students Association returning to the United States from Hanoi re ported today that it had nego tiated declarations of peace with student organizations in North and South Vietnam.

title: Wagner Downs City, 8481
description: Bob Clay scored 27 points to lead Wagner to an 8481 victory over C.C.N.Y. last night at the loser's Wingate gymnasium.

title: Sunny Side of the Alps
description: CERVINA, Italy, Dec. 22 This has been a poor Decem ber for snow in this part of the Alps. But the resort owners are not embarrassed. They have been telling their guests to ride Cervina's cable cars and to ski in Switzerland.

title: Lost Baggage Is Top Complaint In a Survey of Air Passengers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  Airline passengers continue to complain more about lost and damaged baggage than about anything else, according to a report published today by the Civil Aeronautics Board.

title: DEERE PROFIT OFF 10.9% IN QUARTER
description: Deere & Co. reported yester day lower earnings for the three and 12 months ended Oct. 31 despite higher sales. The farm, industrial and con sumer products manufacturer laid the earnings decline pri marily to Increased labor, ma terial and interest costs.

title: EMERGENCY CURBS ENDED IN POLAND AS WORK RESUMES
description: WARSAW, Dec. 22  The new Polish Government today lifted the state of emergency imposed last Thursday, as a backtowork movement gath ered strength throughout the nation.

title: PATTI HOGAN OUSTED AT SOUTH AUSSIE NET
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 22 (AP)  Kasuko Sawamatsu, a 19yearold Japanese student, won a place in the semifinals of the South Australian women's tennis championship today by defeating Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., 75, 64.

title: Concetta Bellini Cabral, 48; Adelphi Biology Professor
description: Mrs. Concetta Bellini Cabral, professor of biology at Ade1phi University, Garden City, L.I., died yesterday of cancer at her home. She was 48 years old and lived at 380 Garden Boule vard in Garden City.

title: Legislation Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) President Nixon signed legis lation giving the Securities and Exchange Commission addition al authority to protect investors in corporate tender offers and other acquisitions of securities.

title: Simon Traces Path From Flop to Hit
description: No one, not even the au thor, is quite sure what kind of play The Gingerbread Lady is. Neil Simon quizzes himself: Is it a comedy? No. It's not funny? It is funny. It's drama? No, it's too funny to be drama, too dramatic to be comedy. The Odd Couple and Barefoot in the Park were obviously comedies. This is not obvi ously a comedy.

title: Chilean Reports Bolivia Will Free Debray Today
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Wednes day, Dec. 23 (Reuters)The French intellectual, Regis De bray, will be released from a Bolivian prison and flown to Chile today, a police spokes man said here.

title: Screen: Perfection and a Love Story
STOCKS REGISTER A MILD ADVANCE
description: The stock market found an old friend yesterday at the Chase Manhattan Bank and pro duced a mild rally after the Chase cut its prime rate to 6 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: Kentucky Triumphs, 8478
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 22 (AP)  Seventhranked Ken tucky had to put down an Oregon State uprising in the final six minutes tonight to score an 8478 basketball vic tory over the Beavers.

title: Behind the State Audit of 3 Big Cities
description: Assessing Governor Rocke feller's proposed state audit of New York City, Buffalo and Rochester is like looking at a loaded gun. It depends on which end of the audit the acceccor is

title: Letters to the Editor
description: U.S. Policy and the Invasion of Guinea

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Jews to Staff Hospitals In a Christmas Gesture
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 22 (AP) Members of a Jewish group will work at two hospitals on Christmas Eve so Christians can spend the time with their families.

title: Dow Jones Names Editor
description: Henry Gemmill has been named editor of The National Observer, Dow Jones & Co. an nounced yesterday. William Giles, former editor of the weekly, has been, named an as sistant general manager of Dow Jones along with Ray Shaw. William Clabby was named managing editor of the A.P. Dow Jones Economic Report and followup to a positive Mr. Shaw.

title: Milwaukee Proxies
description: Eight stockholders of the Chi cago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad filed 14B forms yesterday with the Se curities and Exchange Commis sion in Washington declaring their intention to solicit proxies for the next annual meeting.

title: St. John's Beaten, 6966; Fordham Is 8583 Victor
description: St. John's young, and some times wild, basketball team tripped and fell last night on the way, to the Holiday Festival at Madison Square Garden as Boston College handed the Red men their first loss of the cam paign, 6966, after six victories.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Film

title: Loan Costs Drop Widely
description: Business and consumer lending rates dropped across a broad front yesterday. Major commercial banks, led by the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York for the third time

title: Javits Queries Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York has asked the Pentagon to send him copies of any secret files it may have on him.

title: Suit on Pennsy Loan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (AP)A class action suit on behalf of bondholders and pre ferredstock owners of the Pennsylvania Company has been filed in the Federal Dis trict Court here against 10 large banks involved in a $50million loan to the Penn Central Trans portation Company, the rail roadoperating subsidiary of the Penn Central Company.

title: Newburgh Visits Recalled
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Dec. 22 (AP)  Two men who identi fied themselves as Army intel ligence agents visited The New burgh Evening News during civil disturbances here in 1967 and 1968, Hillard Gordon, the paper's managing editor, said today. They asked for pictures and information on the out breaks he said.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to OXford 53311 until 11 P.M. In suburban offices. ??:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) ??Arkel 3.3900; While Plains (914) WHite Plains 95300: Hempsteal (516) i'Vartho?? 3660: Commack (516) ??.5300: Stamford (203) ??7767.

title: SUIT BY G.M. IS SENT TO COURT IN CAPITAL
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 22 (AP)A General Motors Corpo ration suit against a safety notification order was dismissed yesterday in United States District Court here, placing the same issue before a Federal court in Washington.

title: Powell's Cove Site Chosen For MidQueens High School
description: A vacant 11acre tract of land fronting on Powell's Cove on the north shore of Queens has been picked by the city's Site Selection Board for the longde layed MidQueens High School,

title: MRS. EDWIN GOODING
description: DOBBS FERRY, N.Y., Dec. 22 Mrs. Catherine Maas Gooding, a retired broadCast news writer with the Associated Press, of which her husband, Edwin, was a retired general desk supervi sor in New York, died today at their home, 300 Broadway. She was 62 years old.

title: Yarborough Honored By Senate Colleagues
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)The Senate paid trib ute today to Senator Ralph W. Yarborough, Democrat of Texas, the first of this elec tion year's senatorial lame ducks, as a champion of the weak, the downtrodden, the aged, the sick, the widowed, the orphaned.

title: McCormack Is Voted Office Space and Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)The House voted to day to give Speaker John W. McCormack a retirement pro gram estimated to cost $38, 000 for each of the next two years.

title: SENATORS RECEIVE HANOI P.O.W. LIST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 North Vietnam released today what it described as a final and definitive list of all the American prisoners of war it is holding.

title: Official Czech Book Charges Zionists With Fomenting Liberalizations of 68
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  A book by two Soviet authors re cently issued by the official Slovak publishing house says that international Zionism and the local Jewish community fomented the 1968 liberalization movement in Czechoslovakia.

title: BEAME UNAWARE UNION PAID AIDE
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that he was not aware that his law secretary, Harry Maze, had been also serving as a paid consultant to Local 810 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Saigon to Free 30 P.O.W.'s
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22The Government of South Vietnam announced that it had decided to release at least 30 disabled or incurably ill North Vietnamese prisoners of war next month to mark the T??t, lunar new year.

title: G.I.'s in Vietnam High on Hope's Marijuana Jokes
description: CAMP EAGLE, South Viet nam, Dec. 22Bob Hope in troduced some marijuana jokes info his Vietnam rou tine for the first time today and immediately won the hearts and minds of 15,000 applauding troops. They also liked the girls.

title: Big Board Names Officer
description: The New?? York Stock Ex change announced the appoint ment yesterday of John L. Mc Connell as a vice president. Mr. McConnell, 44 years old, joined the exchange in January, 1969, as director of government af fairs in its Washington office. Before that, he was assistant to the assistant majority leader of the Senate.

title: The Economist Game
description: Between Christmas and New Year's when most rational hu man beings seek to huddle within the bosom of their fam ilies or fly off to a Caribbean island or Vermont ski lodge, thousands of American econo mists assemble annually in stuffy halls and listen to one another read papers that are

title: Officer Denies Defector Was Beaten on Cutter
description: MATTAPOISETT, Mass., Dec. 22 (AP)The captain of the Coast Guard cutter Vigilant says reports that a Lithuanian defector was beaten by Russians aboard the Coast Guard ship are false.

title: For a Black Political Agenda
description: ATLANTA  Any black assessment of the 1970 elections and the coming 92d Congress must begin by identify ing the political history of black people in America as a long chronicle of be trayal.

title: Cooks Eye View (Jaundiced, of Course) of the Officers Who Eat in Their Mess
description: QUANG TRI, South Viet nam  Yeah, they ask for bacon at breakfast, but we've been out of it for so long they've almost forgot ten what it is, Specialist 4 Louis. McCullough said. He is one of the four cooks who work two shifts in the offi cers mess here, at head quarters for the First Bri gade of the Fifth Infantry Di vision (mechanized).

title: KNICKS SUBDUED BY SONICS, 119108
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 22  Bill Bradley came up with a sore right ankle tonight and sat out the game. Without Bradley and Willis Reed, who was dis charged from the hospital in the morning and is expected to be back for Friday's game, the Knicks were no match for the Seattle Supersonics who snapped New York's fourgame winning streak with a 119108 victory.

title: HardTarget Killer
description: A littlenoticed letter from Secretary Laird to Senator Brooke indicates that a basic change may be underway in the nation's defense policyfrom deterrence of nu clear war to the longdiscredited strategy of preparing to fight one. If confirmed, the change would help ex plain why the Administration is pressing ahead with a vast expansion of MIRV multiple warhead missiles in stead of, seeking to ban them in the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) with Russia. The MIRV buildup on both sides threatens to leave the United States, after vast expense, less secure than before. The LairdBrooke exchange was set off by a recent speech by the Air Force Chief of Staff. General Ryan first stirred concern more than a year ago, when he told a House subcommittee that the Air Force was develop ing nuclear missiles with warheads of increased power and accuracya hardtarget killer, whith we do not have in the inventory at the present time. By a hard target killer, General Ryan clearly meant warheads that could pinpoint and destroy Soviet intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBM's) in underground silos.

title: VIOLATION OF LAW LAID TO EXJUDGE
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22 (AP)  James Del Mauro, former pre siding magistrate in Newark, was found by a courtappointed master to have violated two state laws and the judicial canons of ethics, it was dis closed in State Supreme Court today.

title: Loyola Routs Cornell, 8269
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (AP)  Loyola rolled to a 5129 half time lead over Cornell tonight and went on to an 8269 vic tory. Joe Young led four Loyola scorers who were in double fig lures with 19 points. Ken Weins (topped Cornell with 20.

title: LAWRENCE E. BRIGGS
description: BOSTON, Dec. 21 (UPI) Lawrence E. Briggs, a retired soccer coach at the University of Massachusetts died yester day at the New England Dea coness Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived in Amherst.

title: Legislators Oppose Closing of Irvington House
description: Five State Assemblymen yes terday condemned the proposed closing of Irvington House, a private nonprofit clinic special izing in the care and treatment of children with rheumatic fever and allied diseases, call ing the move incredible and criminal.

title: A Game of TitforTat In the Canadian Style
description: Toronto admen know how to play titfortat and Wil liam Stapleton, president of Stapleton Advertising re cently proved it.

title: HENRY M. POLHEMUS, RETIRED ARCHITECT
description: Henry M. Polhemus, a retired architect, died at St. Luke's Hospital yesterday of a stroke. He was 79 years old and lived at 108 East 86th Street.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE PEOPLE VS. PRESIDENTIAL WAR. Com piled and Edited by John M. Wells with Maria Wilhelm. Foreword by J. William Fulbright. 199 pages. Dunellen Company. $5.95.

title: Israel Schawartzberg, ExJailhouse Lawyer, Dies
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 22Israel Schawartzberg, an official of Scanlan's magazine in New York and a wellknown former criminal, died of a heart attack this morning in his room at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel. He was 56 years old and lived at 157 Field Place the Bronx. He was in Montreal on magazine busi ness.

title: JOHN B. BOREK, HEAD OF Y.M.C.A. DISTRICT
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 22 John B. Borek, executive director of the Middle Atlantic region of the Young Men's Christian Association, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was stricken while driving to his office here, and died minutes after reach ing a hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: QUEENS PHYSICIAN KILLS HOLDUP MAN
description: A Queens physician shot and killed a holdup man in his of fice last night, after he and an accomplice had robbed four pa tients and a receptionist, the police said.

title: Car Sales Lag
description: DETROIT, Dec. 22  New car sales continued slow in midDecember with Detroit's manufacturers hoping that the expected resurgence of the General Motors Corporation in the first quarter, will trigger an improvement.

title: Friend of the World's Poor
description: When Pope Paul VI decided to found a home for the poor of Rome three years ago, he sent halfway around the world and asked a nun in Calcutta to take on the job.

title: AL WILDE
description: Al Wilde, personal manager for Leslie Uggams, the enter tainer, died yesterday after a heart attack in Hollywood. He was 55 years old and lived in Hollywood and at 25 Central Park West here.

title: Profits Continuing At Reynolds & Co.
description: Reynolds & Co., a leading securities house, announced yesterday that its profit in 1970 will be the thirdhighest in the firm's 40year history.

title: U.S HELP READIED FOR BOND MARKET
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York outlined yesterday standby plans to keep the $3billienaday market in United States Government se curities functioning should key banks be forced to withdraw for lack of insurance.

title: Vikings Defense vs. 49ers Offense
description: Norm Van Brocklin, who Used to coach them, said the Minnesota Vikings are a much stronger team this year than last because Gary Cuozzo is a better passer than Joe Kapp. DickNolan, coach of the 49ers, fears neither the Vikings nor the Minnesota weather.

title: N.F.L. Playoffs
description: (WonLostT??ed Records In Parentheses)

title: Sebastian Captivates 2 SoldOut Houses With Song Concert
Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Dec. 22, 1970

title: Easier Money
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank yesterday cut the prime rate of interest from 7 per cent to 6, and major banks throughout the country promptly followed suit. This was the fifth downward move this year in the rate that banks charge their most creditworthy business borrow ers; last March the prime rate was at a peak of 8.5 per cent.

title: America the WasteMaker
description: These comments are from a talk by Prof. J. Wreford Watson of the Depart ment of Geography, University of Edin burgh, to the British Association for the Advancement of Science.

title: All I Hear Is Tanks
description: PARISThe Polish outbursts under score schismatic tendencies in West ern Communism which fragment unity in the parties of both Communist ruled and nonSocialist states. This has nothing to do with the SinoSoviet row although China objects to the Brezhnev Doctrine Russia used as an excuse to invade Czechoslovakia but not formally invoked in connec tion with Poland.

title: Witness Ends Testimony on Panthers
description: A policeman who worked with a detective who had in filtrated the Black Panthers corroborated the undercover agent's testimony yesterday at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here.

title: Child Dies, 3 Injured In Brooklyn Temple Fire
description: One child was reported killed and at least three, persons were injured early this morning when fire swept through a combina tion synagogue and home in the Borough Park section of Brook lyn.

title: Pacific Telephone Net Off
description: The Pacific Telephone and Telegraph Company reported yesterday a decline in net in come for the November quar ter despite higher operating revenues. Net income dropped to $49,437,000 or 36 its a Share, from $51,957,000, or 38 ecnts a share, in the like 1969 period.

title: In Memoriam
description: ??ANNONJohn P. Dec. 23, 1966. In ever lasting end loving memory of a kind man.

title: 4 CONCERNS CHARGED WITH OIL VIOLATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Justice Department an nounced today that it had filed charges against four oil com panies, accusing them of will fully failing to install and main tain safety devices on 26 oil wells off the Louisiana coast in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: The City's First Offer
description: The pay offer the city has made to its police, fire and sanitation unions realistically reflects the bleakness of its financial picture. It is indisputably a modest offer by the standards currently prevailing in private industry, where wages and prices seem in a mad race toward devaluation of the dollar.

title: Labor Support a Big Factor in Gain by Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22For 12 years, Evelyn Dubrow, the lobbyist for the International Ladies Garment Workers Union, has worked on Capitol Hill for liberal causes. Civil rights, edu cation, consumer protection and Medicare, she says, have been her favorites.

title: Burlington Rail Case Is Settled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)  The Government simultaneously brought and settled an antitrust complaint today charging Burlington Northern, Inc., with violations of the Sherman Antitrust Act.

title: F.D.A. MAY IMPOSE SWORDFISH CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  Food and Drug Administration officials are expected to an nounce tomorrow restrictions on imports of swordfish, which, like Alaskan fur seals, Great Lakes salmon, and tuna fish, has been found to be contaminated with mercury.

title: `Peer Gynt Misses In Austere Version For Tom Courtenay
description: MANCHESTER, England, Dec. 21Ibsen's Peer Gynt can be staged either as a lavish spec tacle or as an unadorned poem that leaves everything to the spectator's imagination. Michael Elliott tried the first approach at the Old Vic seven years ago. In his new production for Man chester's 69 Theater Company he tries the second.

title: Oilers Trade Wilkerson
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) Doug Wilkerson, the Houston Oilers' defensive end who was their No. 1 draft choice last winter but who was a disap pointment this season, was traded to the San Diego Charg ers today for a tight end, Willie Frazier.

title: Contributions may be left also at them offices of The Times:
description: 229 West 43d St.

title: Nazi, Guilty in 400,000 Deaths, Is Sentenced to Life by Germans
description: BONN, Dec. 22  Franz Stangl, a key aide in Hitler's mass slaying of Jews in war time Poland who spent 17 years in a Brazilian hideout, was sentenced to life imprisonment by a Dilsseldorf court today. He had been found guilty of murder in at least 400,000 cases.

title: Disk Jockey Found Guilty Of Taking Pay for Choices
description: Freddy Baez, a disk jockey for radio station WHOM, was convicted in Manhattan Federal Court on Monday of accept ing money from record pro moters, and of lying in testi mony before the Federal Com munications Commission in 1966.

title: Food Stamp Compromise Is Approved by Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22  House and Senate negotiators agreed today on a food stamp bill that retains a stringent mustwork provision but frees the states from sharing the cost of the program.

title: Angela Davis Is Moved Secretly, Flown to Coast in Military Plane
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Dec. 22 Angela Davis, the black mili tant, was returned here from New York City today and was booked on charges of murder, kidnapping and criminal con spiracy.

title: Amex Prices Mixed for 2d Day; Index Rises by 0.04 to 221.13
description: Prices ended mixed on the American Stock Exchange yes terday for the second consecu tive session on moderate trad ing. Most issues moved in a narrow price range throughout the day and there were few big Price changes.

title: Robert Wood Johnson Jr. Dead; Headed Medical Supplies Maker
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 22 Robert Wood Johnson Jr., a grandson of the founder of Johnson & Johnson, maker of medical supplies, and its presi dent from 1961 to 1965, died today in Holy Cross Hospital, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., after a long illness. He was 50 years old and lived here at 108 Edgerstoune Road.

title: Petitions by Pennsy Trustees
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 22 (UPI)Federal District Court Judge John P. Fullam took in der advisement today two pe titions by trustees of the Penn Central Railroad.

title: White Carpet Rolled Out For Winter's Arrival Here
description: Winter moved into the metropolitan area yesterday on a twoinch carpet of snow, which changed quickly to slush which changed quickly to ice.

title: Jobs Off in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) A total of 93,000 jobs were vacant in the nation's manufac turing industries in October, only about 40 per cent of the number vacant a year earlier, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Market Place
description: There are few stories to top it. The company's history illustrates how completely people can get carried away in buSiness and IT the stock market.

description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 23, 1970

title: Moynihan, in Valedictory, Hails Nixon And Urges Support for His Proposals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Every time we get a little down, every time we need a little inspiration, we're going to want to call him back to give it to us.

title: Arms for Cambodia Voted; Congress Bars Troop Use
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Congress completed action to day on legislation authorizing the Administration's proposed $255million military aid pro gram for Cambodia but re stricting the President from sending ground combat troops or military advisers into Cam bodia.

title: Met. Squash Racquets
description: CLASS A

title: Fire Pool Insurance Raised 19.4% More In Ruling by State
description: Residents of New York State who are unable to buy fire insurance in the normal mar ket will be compelled to pay an additional 19.4 per cent to purchase it through the indus trywide fire insurance pool, it was disclosed here yesterday.

title: AMERICA'S CUP BIDS FOR 1973 TOTAL SIX
description: British and Australian chal lenges for the America's Cup in 1973 were received yester day by the New York Yacht Club.

title: U.S. BARS SOME CUTS IN PRIVATE PENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)The Treasury has ruled that private pension payments may no longer be reduced be cause of Social Security benefit increases voted by Congress, Senator Jacob K. Javits, Repub lican of New York, said today.

title: Laurene Sherlock Presented at Dance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Miss Laurene Ann Sherlock was presented this evening at a dance at the Columbia Country Club given by her parents, Squadron Leader Allan Arthur Sherlock, Royal Canadian Air Force, retired, and Mrs. Sherlock of Chevy Chase. Md.

title: U.S. Companies Troubled
description: United States copper compa nies with mines in Chile said publicly yesterday only that they were studying the proposed nationalization amendment. But behind the scenes, there were both consternation and anger.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Foxboro Company has announced the elec tion of Ralph Hayden Jr. as chairman of the board and Earle W. Pitt as president. Mr. Hayden, who had been president and continues as chief execu tive officer since 1968 succeeds Rexford A. Bristol, who will become chairman of the executive com mittee and continue as a director. Mr. Pitt was pre viously executive vice president.

title: Rangers Rout Sabres, 72, as Balon Gets 3 Goals and 2 Assists
U.C.L.A. Names Aide
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (UPI) Keith R. Kelley, former Uni versity a California, Los An geles, track star, has been named assistant to the U.C.L.A. athletic director, J. D. Morgan.

title: TV: C.B.S. Presents 'A World of Love
description: With the best will in the world, some famous show business faces pleasantly mo nopolized A World of Love. The children generally sat it out on the sidelines, throng ing a Christmas party held in their honor in the General Assembly hall of the United Nations. But it was not the children's hour.

title: General Telephone Files a Plan for a Satellite System
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation filed yesterday an application with the Federal Communications Commission for the operation of a domestic communications satellite system.

title: One Goes, One Stays, One Moves
description: Alex Webster, the New York Giants coach, met with Wellington Mara, the club president, yesterday and made a foregone conclusion a reality by signing the one year pact he had requested.

title: U.S. Jury Inquiry Into Charges Of Prisoner Beatings Is Sought
description: A Federal grand jury should be immediately convened to investigate the alleged beatings of inmates in city prisons in Queens, two Representatives and a Representativeelect urged yesterday.

title: Jersey City Seeks NewarkFormula Aid
description: JERSEY CITY. Dec. 22 Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City followed the ex ample of Mayor Kenneth A. Gib son of Newark today in ap pealing for more state aid: to solve the city's financial prob lems.

title: Giap Warns the U.S.
description: SAIGON, Dec. 22 (UPI)  North Vietnam's Defense Min ister, Gen. Vo Nguyen Giap, warned in a speech broadcast tonight that unarmed recon naissance planes flying over North Vietnamese territory would be shot down. He said the United States had no right to make such flights.

title: Some Enemy P.O.W.'s Get Taste of Christmas
description: BIENHOA, South Vietnam, Dec. 22A colored photograph of Pope Paul VI was among the Christmas presents given today in an elaborate ceremony to several hundred Vietnamese Communist prisoners of war, including small boys who did not look as if they were 13 years old.

title: Profits in Sales of Christmas Trees Attract Sellers From Many Fields
description: As the wind moves through the dense thicket of Christ mas trees lining the sidewalk, Dominick Vanacore, a state road worker on vacation, sits in a vacant store on Second Avenue near 87th Street and watches passersby.

title: House Votes Guarantees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) The House today voted Gov ernment guarantees of $125 million to prevent a shutdown of the Penn Central Raildoad, the nation's largest rail system, this January.

title: Official Says Granting of Vote At 18 May Cost City $5Million
description: Maurice J. O'Rourke, the president of the Board of Elec tions, said yesterday that the United States Supreme Court decision on the 18yearold vote could cost New York City $5 million or more in the first year.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN BOND MARKET
description: The credit markets respond ed halfheartedly yesterday to the news that the Chase Man hattan Bank decided to cut its basic interest rate on business loans for the third time since midNovember.

title: Late Actions by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Following is a summary of late activity by Congress be fore it recessed tonight for Christmas:

title: Remember the Neediest
description: A class of fourthgraders in a city public school baked cookiesnot to sweeten their own Christmas, but that of others less fortunate than they. The children sold their handiwork and contributed the money to The New York Times Neediest Cases.

title: U.C.L.A. Wins No. 5
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP)  Sidney Wicks and Curtis Rowe led No. 1 ranked Univer sity of California, Los Angeles, to its fifth consecutive victory of the year tonight sweeping by Missouri, 9475, before 12,347 fans. Wicks scored 29 points, Rowe 28.

title: Celtics Trim Warriors
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 (UPI)Jo Jo White and John Havlicek combined for 68 points tonight to pace the Boston Celtics to a 138108 victory over the San Francisco Warriors.

title: Anniversaries
description: FREIRICHHeartiest congratulations to our Parents, Sadie and Sol, on their 50th Wed ding Anniversary. Helaine, Jack, Arthur and Grandchildren.

title: School Headmaster Named
description: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y., Dec. 22C. Hugh P. Silk has been appointed headmaster of the Masters School here, a college preparatory school for girls, it was announced today. He suc ceeds Craighill Burke, who is retiring this June. Mr. Silk is now assistant headmaster of the Collegiate School in New York City and for 12 years served as head of the upper school there.

title: Use of Plane Requested
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22As sistant Attorney General Will R. Wilson said today that the accommodations for Miss Davis aboard an aircraft of the Cali fornia Air National Guard had been arranged at the request of the California Attorney Gen eral's office.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per centage losses on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Federal Newsletter Seeks Closer Ties With Indians
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (Reu ters  Vice President Agnew inaugurated today a new chan nel of communication between the Government and America's Indians.

title: FUEL OIL DRIVERS VOTE TO GO BACK
description: Striking fuel oil deliverers and oilburner repairmen voted last night to accept a new con tract proposal and end their sevenday walkout.

title: Barbara Cochran, 4th in Special Slalom, Takes Grand Prix Combined Title
description: LES CONTAMINES, France, Dec. 22 (Reuters)French girls again were dominant in the in ternational Grand Prix ski meet today, taking the first three places in the special slalom, but first place in combined placings went to Barbara Cochran of Richmond. Vt.

title: Nixon Allows an Increase In Oil Imports Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 President Nixon authorized to day a small additional increase in oil imports for 1971.Last year the President also authorized an increase in im ports of 100,000 barrels a day over the amount that the for mula would have permitted. This increase is still in effect, extended with the addition of 100,000 more.

title: 2 Small Picassos Are Missing Here
description: Two small works by Pablo Picassoone a 1906 pen drawing, the other a 1922 watercolor  were removed from their frames at the Sal omon. R. Guggenheim Mu seum here on Monday and apparently stolen.

title: 4 Alleged Counterfeiters And Bogus $250,000 Seized
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., (AP) The local police and Federal agents arrested four men sus pected of running a counterfeit ring Monday night and seized an estimated $250,000 in al legedly bogus bills at the Gothic Printing. Company, the police said.

title: Blast and Fire on East Side
description: An explosion and fire dam aged a pizza parlor at 1379 Third Avenue, between 78th and 79th Streets on the Upper East Side, early this morning, the Fire Department reported. It said there were no reports of injuries and that the fire marshal's office was investi gating.

title: Pope Deplores Criticism By Intellectuals in Church
description: ROME, Dec. 22Pope Paul VI today deplored corrosive crit icism of Roman Catholic tra ditions and institutions by American and other Western intellectuals in the church.

title: Chile Plans a Referendum If Nationalizing Bill Fails
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 22 (AP)  Mining Minister Ze peda Orlando Cantuarias said today that the Government would hold a national referen dum if Congress rejected a pro posal to nationalize multimillion dollar United States copper in terests in Chile.

title: Chaparrals Romp, 160132
description: DALLAS, Dec. 22 (AP) Texas shattered a club record with a 160132 victory over the Carolina Cougars tonight in which all 10 Chaparrals scored in double figures.

title: LATE RALLY CUTS SOYBEAN LOSSES
description: Early in the trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yester day, prices of soybean fu tures declined nearly 6 cents a bushel and corn and wheat prices dipped about 1 to 2 cents. However, a late rally trimmed the early losses con siderably.

title: Actor Said to Retrieve de Gaulle MS
description: PARIS, Dec. 22A historic de Gaulle manuscript was re ported today to have been saved for France in a cloak anddagger scenario featuring the actor Alain Delon.

title: Rate Rise in Southeast Asked
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 22 (UPI) Railroads operating in 10 Southeastern states filed a pe tition with the Interstate Com merce Commission yesterday seeking an increase in certain freight rates totaling $137 million.

title: Makarova Adds Extra Glitter to a First Night
description: Everybody agreed that the opening of the American Ballet Theater's winter sea son last night at the New York City Center had a speck more glitter because of Natalia Makarova. She's the 30yearold Russian ballerina who left the Kirov Ballet abruptly in London last Sep tember.

title: Hofstra Bows to UMass
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 22 (AP)Unbeaten Massachusetts lifted its basketball record to seven victories tonight with 8760 triumph over Hofstra.

title: Advertising: Wintry Hopes of Eastern Air
description: While Mayor Lindsay, the Sanitation Department and millions of home owners throughout the Northeast are hoping against hope for a mild winter, those rascals at Eastern Air Lines are hop ing against them.

title: DR. JOHN HELDMAN JR.
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 21 (AP)Dr. John Heldman Jr., a longtime baseball coach at the University of Louisville, died last night after a heart attack. He was 65 years old.

title: Advisory Panel Assails Planning for Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 22  A committee of prominent inter national architects and town planners has sharply criticized Israeli proposals to develop Jerusalem into a modern urban complex.

title: Hearing Postponed a Month On a Petition Against M.S.I.
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 23 (AP)United States District Court Judge Edward T. Gig noux has set Jan. 19 as the new date for a hearing on a petition to place financially troubled?? Maine Sugar ??Indus tries, Inc., into receivership.

title: 10Month Deficit Listed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 (UPI)A financial report cov ering the first 10 months of the year showed today that the Penn Central railroad has gone deeper into the red with losses of $252million.
