description: BASKETBALL

title: Insiders Stockholdings
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The lists include the following:

title: Stans Leaving Cabinet For 2Week Vacation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)  Secretary of Com merce Maurice H. Stans, who has been rumored to be the next Cabinet officer likely to go, had a little fun with re porters today.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you have been putting off efforts to obtain a student loan because of the hard time you got the last time you tried even as recent as just a few months ago  delay no longer.

title: ICY ROADS BRING OUT EMERGENCY CREWS
description: A freezing rain, actually a mixture of hail, rain and wet snow, spattered the city during the day and into the evening yesterday, bringing out the salt spreaders and the warnings to drivers of extremely hazard ous road conditions.

title: BANK STOCKS RISE IN A FIRM MARKET
New President Named By Newberry Company
description: J. J. Newberry Company yesterday announced the pro motion of Daryl D. Milius to president of the nation??wide department and specialty store chain. He was formerly executive vice president.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHTS GAMES

title: Lions Activate Robb
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 23 (AP) The Detroit Lions activated Joe Robb, an 11year defensive end, today for Saturday's National Conference playoff game with the Dallas Cowboys. Robb suf fered a knee injury early in the season. He will back up a rookie, Jim Mitchell.

title: His Doctor Says Pope Was Struck, in Manila
description: ROME, Dec. 23 (Reuters). Pope Paul's personal physi cian, Prof, Mario Fontana, said today that the Pope was struck twice during an at tempt on his life in Manila last Nov. 27, according to ANSA, the Italian news agency.

title: Swift Clarifies Status
description: Swift &?? Co.,the world's larg est meat packer, said in Chi cago last night that it had no ownership or managerial inter est in Cia. Swift de la Plata, an Argentine subsidiary of Deltec International, Ltd. Swift de la Plata has filed a petition for reorganization. The Chicago concern said that its relation ship with the company in Ar gentina ended more than 50 years ago.

title: Pulsa: Sound, Light and 7 Young Artists
description: They are seven young art ists, all men between 25 and 30, and they all live together with their wives and girl friends in a big country house called Harmony Ranch in Oxford, Conn., north of New Haven. In the summer time they can be seen, us ually shirtless, in shorts and barefoot, puttering about the house, plowing fields, plant ing gardens, romping with a gigantic Irish wolfhound, cut ting wild flowers or welcom ing swarms of other young people into their commune.

title: Amahl and Globolinks Performed
description: Like the fruitcake, Amahl and the Night Visitors ap pears each Christmastime, and would be unthinkable and possibly undigestible at any other time. The Menotti opera, which is running at the ANTA Theater through Jan. 9, would be sticky as a steady diet, but it can be nibbled at without permanent harm to the blood vessels. And, with the latest Menotti music drama, Help! Help! the Globolinks playing on the same bill as a counter foil, the ANTA has a double layer holiday cake that goes down easily. The double bill has been produced with great polish and theatrical effec tiveness by Mr. Menotti himself.

title: U.S. IS RECEPTIVE ON MIDEAST FORCE
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 23The United States indicated today that it would consider partici pating with its troops in a Mid dle East peacekeeping force if the Arab countries and Israel succeeded in negotiating a permanent contractual agree ment among themselves.

title: Cowboys Pick Tartan Turf
description: DALLAS, Dec. 23 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys chose Tartan Turf today for the playing sur face in Texas Stadium, their new field scheduled to be ready for the 1971 season.

title: Ruling Delayed on Rate Rise Requested by Penn Central
description: ALBANY, Dec. 23The Pub lic Service Commission has ex tended its own deadline to June 29, 1971, for a final ruling on proposed passengerfare in creases by the Delaware & Hudson Railroad and the Penn Central.

title: Eager Buyers Jamming Moscow Toy and Food Stores
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 23The voice on the loudspeaker was pleasantly calm amid the racket caused by plastic sub machine guns bursts, sing ing mechanical birds, whirl ing toy helicopters and thou sands of Russians pushing their way to places near the counters laden with toys and New Year's tree decorations.

title: BOND INSURANCE SOUGHT IN TALKS
description: A break seemed to be de veloping yesterday in the im passe between the Continental. Insurance Company and some major New York City banks threatened by a loss of cover age on Government securities.

title: 3d G.O.P. Loser in Line for Appointment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23. (AP) Thomas Kleppe of North Da kota may be No. 3 on the list of lame duck Republican Repre sentatives given jobs by Presi dent Nixon after failing in bids for the Senate.

title: Verdicts on 15 Basques Are Expected Saturday
description: MADRID, Dec. 23  The lawyers defending the 15 Basque activists charged with banditry and terrorism have been summoned to appear at Burgos military headquarters Saturday.

title: MAYOR HAILS POLICE AND COMMISSIONER
description: Mayor Lindsay praised New York's policemen as the finest of the city, the country and the world during a promotion cere mony yesterday for 14 high ranking police officials.

title: MORTGAGE LENDING UP AT SAVINGS UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Mortgage lending by savings and loan associations was at record levels in November, as was the inflow of savings, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today.

title: Brooklyn Principal Suspended In Inquiry on Promotion Policy
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner suspended yesterday a controversial Brooklyn inter mediate school principal who has been charged with promot ing troublemaking students to high school without the proper academic credit allegedly to get rid of them.

title: 6 Die on Interstate 90
description: ERIE, Pa., Dec. 23 (UPI) Six persons were killed today when their automobile collided with a tractortrailer loaded with asbestos sheeting on Interstate 90 south of here. The state police said the eastbound car, bearing Michigan license plates, skidded on ice near the intersection of route 19, crossed a grassy medial strip and was struck by the truck.

title: NEW YORKERS GET 46 SHOTS AT NET
description: The Rangers had themselves another movable feast last night at the expense of another ex pansion team. This time the op ponent was the Pittsburgh Pen guins, and they never had a chance as they dropped a 61 decision at Madison Square Garden.

title: A CHANGE BY NIXON IN BOMBING POLICY DENIED BY ROGERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Sec retary of State William P. Rogers acknowledged today that President Nixon had gone beyond the terms of the 1968 understanding ending American bombing of North Vietnam when he threatened recently to resume bombing if the enemy stepped up the level of fighting in South Vietnam.

title: Agency Group Shelves Computer Unit Plans
description: The American Association of Advertising Agencies has shelved its plan to create, an agencyowned computer serv ices center.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company has an nounced the election of five senior vice presidents. They include: Boris S. Berkovitch, secretary, and resident counsel; Langdon P. Cook, head of the mu nicipal bond department; Bernard F. Curry, of the pension trust administration; Robert M. Hill, who handles international business for United States corporate customers; and Carl W. Klemme, of cus today and electronic tabulating Charles E. Spahr, chairman and chief execu tive officer of the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), has been elected to the board of directors of the HarrisIntertype Corporation.*Maurice A. Deane has been appointed presi dent of Endo Laboratories, Inc., a subsidiary of the E. I. duPont de Nemours and Company.*Thomas P. Bowles Jr. has been elected presi dent and chief executive officer of the Georgia International Corporation, succeeding C. Felix Har vey who was made chairman.*Allyn & Bacon, Inc., has elected William B. Ans bro president and chief executive officer to succeed Kenneth M. Grubb who has been made chairman.*Robert D. Weimer has been elected executive vice president and Alfred A. Williams was named vice, president, electric operations, Delmarva Power & Light Company.*Joseph F. McCaddon has been named division vice president of the aviation equipment department of the RCA Corporation.*Robert N. Flint, assistant treasurer of the Amer ican Telephone & Telegraph Company, has been ap pointed vice presidentfinance of the New York Telephone Company.

title: Council's Leaders Put off Quick TaxiFare Increase
description: Leaders of the City Council said yesterday that there would be no immediate increase in taxi fares, thereby post poning a raise for the city's 36,000 licensed cabbies who ended a 15day strike Sunday.

title: Rogers Criticizes Hanoi on P.O.W. List
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Secretary of State William P. Rogers today angrily denounced the release by the North Viet namese of a list of previously known prisoners of war as contemptible maneuver de signed to divert attention from what he said was their failure to comply with international law.

title: SECRECY ASSAILED BY ANGELA DAVIS
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Dec. 23 An attorney for Angela Davis charged today that the black activist was roughed up by the authorities in New York City while being transferred here yesterday to stand trial.

title: Governor's Aide Appointed Head of Rockefeller Center
description: The appointment of Alton, Q.: Marshall as president of Rock efeller Center, Inc., was an nounced yesterday by J. Rich ardson Dilworth, chairman.

title: Screen: Perfection and a Love Story
description: What can you say about a movie about a 25yearold girl who died?

title: Business Records
description: Wednesday, Dec. 23, 1970.

title: Hardin Finds Gains on Hunger; Backs Food Stamp Compromise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  Agriculture Secretary Clifford M. Hardin said at yearend news conference to day that long strides had been made toward President Nixon's goal of eliminating hunger.

title: Tax WriteOff Allowed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) The Treasury Department an nounced today regulations per mitting industry to take a rapid depreciation tax writeoff of the cost of equipment to control water or air pollution.

title: New Books
description: Ballet: A Pictorial History, by Wal ter Terry (Van Nostrand Rein hold, $5.95).

title: Miles College President to Return to Alma Mater
description: Dr. Lucius Pitts, president of Miles College in Birmingham Ala., is resigning_from that post to become the first black presi dent of his alme meter, Paine College, a 90yearold predomi nantly Negro school in Augusta, Ga.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 24, 1970

title: Times's Deliverers Agree Not to Delay Normal Production
description: The newspaper truck drivers union agreed yesterday not to interrupt the normal production of The New York Times in a dispute over delivery schedules for the Sunday paper's classi fied section.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Wally Lemm, coach of the Houston Oilers, was asked recently about a linebacker named Dave Meggysey he coached several years ago at St. Louis. Lemm said: He was strictly a borderline football player. Nobody would pay any attention to him if he had not been a football player, and yet he is ripping the game now. He is down on the capitalistic society, but you can bet he'll get paid for this story. Meggysey is just a hippie and St. Louis is better off without him. In looking back, I can see he was an agitator all the time he was there and I was coach. I don't see how a guy who admits to dropping acid and the other things he does in the story can have any pride in himself, and if he doesn't have any pride in himself, he won't have any pride in football or anything else.

title: CHAVEZ ORDERED FREED BY COURT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (UPI)The state Supreme Court today ordered the releade of Cesar Chavez, jailed since Dec. 4 for contempt of court

title: COLOMBO IS GUILTY IN PERJURY CASE
description: Joseph Colombo, who has been described by the Govern ment as a major underworld figure, was convicted of two counts of perjury yesterday for having lied about his criminal record to a state agency.

title: COPPER FUTURES POST INCREASES
description: Copper future prices rose yes terday as a result of reports that the copperproduqing coun tries had agreed to cut pro duction to aid sagging world prices.

title: Touched by 11 Crimes in 14 Months, Man Loses Patience With City
description: The urbanbred patience of Maurice S. Kanbar finally fell apart yesterday and he was angry and indignant.

title: Funds for Neediest Increase
description: With the frantic shopping behind them, many New Yorkers will relax at parties or at home with their fami lies tonight as they did last year and the year before that.

title: Daley Files for Reelection
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23 (AP) Mayor Richard J. Daley and his Democratic runningmates for city clerk and city treasurer filed nominating petitions to day with the city clerk's office. Mr. Daley, John C. Marcin, seeking reelection as city clerk, and Joseph G. Bertrand, candidate for city treasurer, presented a stack of petitions more than 10 fet high. The election is April 6.

title: Trade Center Topped Out With Steel Column 1,370 Feet Above Street
description: The 110story World Trade Center was topped out yes terday with the emplacement of a steel column 1,370 feet above the streets of Lower Manhattan.

title: PLAN FOR CORONA IS CALLED FINAL
description: It would be cruel and moral ly indefensible to try to up set the socalled Corona com promisethe plan to save 59 homes that were to have been razed for a new Queens high schoolwithout having some thing better to offer, the law yer who drew up the compro mise said yesterday.

title: In Mediterranean, a Delicate Balance
description: ABOARD U.S.S. SPRING FIELD, in the Mediterranean, Dec. 17The continued west ward movement of Soviet naval power has brought to the Medi terranean what Atlantic alli ance planners view as a pre carious naval balance.

title: CELANESE SEEKING STEIN, HALL & CO.
description: The Celanese Corporation, an international chemical producer, and Stein, Hall & Co., Inc., a New Yorkbased international specialty chemical company, have agreed in principle to the acquisition of Stein, Hall by Celanese on the basis of one share of Celanese common for four shares of Stein?? Hall com

title: S.E.C. Choice Rumored
description: WASHINGTON; :Dec. 23  Robert A. Podesta, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for eco nomic development, is in line for appointment to the Securi ties and Exchange Commission, Administration officials said to day.

title: Nurses at Center Refuse to Rescind Their Resignations
description: Most of the 160 nurses on the staff of the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn refused yes terday to withdraw the resigna tions they handed in last week.

title: Senator Anderson, 75, Says He'll Retire at End of Term
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 23 (UPI)Senator Clinton P. Anderson of New Mexico says he will retire when his term expires in 1973. He is 75 years old.

title: Remember the Neediest
description: This year The New York Times is not publishing lists of donors to its Neediest Cases Fund, but It is worth reporting that contributions have been coming, as usual, from people in every walk of life. From New York's Police Department comes $1,000, a share of its charity fund raised from voluntary contributions in station houses throughout the city. At the same time contri butions are reported from college students, one of whom writes that the drive helps: put faith back in, mankind.

title: After the Helsinki Arms Talks, New Complications
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Soviet negotiators at the re cently recessed arms talks in Helsinki reportedly proposed that an arms agreement permit both sides to deploy mobile landbased intercontinental mis siles, a development opposed by the United States.

title: Head of Hemisphere Press Group Assails Brazilian Censorship
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 23 The president of the Inter American Press Association, a Brazilian newspaper publisher, has condemned Brazil's censor ship of the press and what he termed persecution of journal ists. The police prohibited the publication of the statement in Brazil.

title: Report on Darien Train Crash Critical of Employe Compliance
description: A Government report on Penn Central collision near Darien, Conn., in 1969 in which four people died, says that some of the railroad's employes did not fully comply with the rules and that the line's officials had in some cases condoned this practice of poor compliance.

title: Jersey Aid to Parochial Schools Is Challenged in Federal Court
description: NEWARK, Dec. 23 Fifteen organizations and 67 individu als filed suit in Fedefal District Court here today challenging the constitutionality of a New Jersey law allotting $9.5million in state funds to private and parochial schools.

title: M'GRATH REPORTS DROP IN PRISONERS
description: The number of prisoners in local detention houses awaiting trial has dropped from 8,000 last summer to fewer than 6, 200 now, the Department of Correction reported yesterday.

title: Saigon Reports Enemy Violations of CeaseFire
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 24 (AP)South Vietnamese headquarters re ported today that Communist forces launched two attacks in the first hours of the cease fire they had proclaimed for Christmas.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW PRICE DROP
2 GIANTS NAMED TO ALLSTAR TEAM
description: Two members of the New York Giants, Fran Tarkenton and Ron Johnson, were named yesterday to the National Con ference allstar team that will oppose the American Confer ence squad in the Pro Bowl game at Los Angeles on Jan. 24.

title: Pope to Be on Eurovision
description: PARIS, Dec. 23Eurovision, the Western European televis ion network, has canceled a scheduled telecast of midnight mass on Christmas Eve from the cathedral of Avila, Spain, it was learned today. A brief announcement from the French state television said that in stead Europeans would see the Pope celebrate midnight mass in the Sistine Chapel at the Vatican.

title: The Making of a Monument
description: Without writing a life of his own, S. Schoenbaum, a scholar from Northwest ern, has, in a massive act of synthesis, shown how others have written theirs. His book is a progress not only through the facts connected with Shakespeare's life but also through all the works that used them.

title: Flip Wilson Due to Narrate TV Documentary on N.B.C.
description: Flip Wilson has been signed as hostnarrator of The Record Makers, a documentary on champions in all fields, which the National Broadcasting Com pany will televise Friday, April 2, from 7:30 to 8:30 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Population Growth and Food

title: TOTAL OUTPUT OF U.S. FOUND OFF FOR YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) The total output of the Amer ican economy declined this year for the first time since the 1958 recession, the Commerce De partment said today.

title: MISS KEMMER GAINS AUSSIE TENNIS FINAL
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 23 (Reuters)Kris Kemmer of Los Angeles, the United States eighth  ranked junior, battled her way to the final of the South Australian women's ten nis championship today.

title: Rogers Alters Format Of News Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Secretary of State William P. Rogers tried a new format at his news conference today, encouraging reporters to group their questions accord ing to subject matter to pro vide more continuity.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS CURBS ON DUMPING IN U.S. WATERWAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  President Nixon ordered today new procedures that will re quire companies to obtain Fed eral permits to discharge wastes into virtually any of the nation's waterways.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: William Humphrey's The Spawning Run (Alfred A. Knopf, Inc., 80 pages, $4) is the most delightful work this reviewer has read in a long time.

title: Phone Service Cuts to Bring Users in State Bigger Credits
description: ALBANY, Dec. 23The Pub lic Service Commission has or dered telephone companies in the state to pay larger refunds for loss of service.

title: MANSFIELD GAINS IN SPLIT ON BILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Mike Mansfield, the Senate ma jority leader, appears to be suc ceeding with his plan to strengthen the Senate's hand in dealing with the House in the final moments of the annual drive to adjourn Congress.

title: POLAND'S PREMIER RESIGNS HIS POST; ECONOMIST NAMED
description: WARSAW, Dec. 23  Jozef Cyrankiewicz resigned today as Poland's Premier and was re placed by a 61yearold econo mist, Piotr Jaroszewicz.

title: A Plague on Both, etc.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23When I was a Congressman I never realized how important Congress was, Presi dent Kennedy told the Economic Club of New York in 1962. But now I do. As he gazes with the rest of us on the bald failure of Congress to get its work done, President Nixon must feel much the same; for if Congress is impotent, what of the nation itself?

title: Federal Court Orders Bail For Conspiracy Defendants
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Cir cuit ordered bail today for de fendants in the Seattle 7 con spiracy trial pending a hearing on their appeal of contempt sentences.

title: Lawrence Hammer, Lawyer And ExPolice Captain, 59
description: Lawrence L. Hammer of 206 15 26th Avenue, Bayside, Queens, a lawyer and retired captain in the New York Police Department, died yesterday in Booth Memorial Hospital after a short illness. He was 59 years old.

title: Train Sets Warehouse Fire
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) A MissouriKansasTexas freight derailed crossing a wooden trestle over Buffalo Bayou near downtown Houston last night and plunged into a fiveinch natural gas line, which explod ed next to a warehouse. The warehouse burned for two hours. Several railroad cars fell into the shallow waters of Buffalo Bayou.

title: RCA Unit to Raise Components Prices In Color TV Tubes
description: The RCA Electronic Compo nents division of the RCA Cor poration announced yesterday that it planned to increase prices by 3 to 7 per cent mil five sizes of color television ??icture tubes. effective March 1.

title: STEADY ADVANCE SCORED ON AMEX
description: Prices advanced steadily throughout the session on the American Stock Exchange yes terday and the list finished at or near its best level of the day.

title: Army Is Emerging as a Political Factor in Spain
description: MADRID, Dec. 23The army has begun to emerge in the last three weeks as a conscious political force, marking an im portant change in the politics of Spain.

title: The Lively Duck
description: The unusual postelection session of Congress was expected to be a lame duck, but it has proved much more lively than lame. The productivity of both houses has been obscured by the spectacular impasse which the Senate Finance Committee created when it merged several unrelated bills into one huge unmanageable package.

title: Necessity Turns Two Men's Fancy Into Another One
description: Fanciers have become in terested in dogs for many reasons. Few, however, have turned to them for the rea sons put forth by Dr. William Ptomey and Leon Duffer, owners of the Pine Hollow Kennel in Pensacola, Fla.

title: Editors Honor Canham
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Dec. 23 (AP) Erwin D. Canham, editor in chief of The Christian Science Monitor, is the recipient of the University of Arizona's annual John Peter Zenger Award for actions involving freedom of the press. Mr. Canham was selected by more than 85 edi tors and publishers across the United States.

title: MANSON ACCUSED OF MURDER LUST
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23 (AP)  The prosecution in the Sharon Tate murder trial char acterized Charles Manson today as having an insatiable lust for death, blood and murder.

title: Correction
description: In a recent article by Barbara Ondrasik on P.O.W.'s, some words were inadvertently dropped from the text. It should have read: . . . There have been 790 fliters downed over the North. What, happened to the other 461? Information released recently by Mrs. Cora Weise of the Liaison Com mittee lists names of many men who it is said, have never been detained in North Vietnam. Some of these men were, known prisonera; have; been identified from pictures or other sources. . . .

title: Securing a Middle East Peace
description: Secretary of State Rogers's public offer of United States participation in a U.N. peacekeeping force in the Middle East goes to the heart of a central issue in the Arab Israeli talks which are expected to begin early next year under auspices of United Nations Ambassador Gunnar Jarringthe question of security guarantees.

title: Soviet Denies AntiSemitic Aim in Hijack Trial
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 23The So viet Union today scoffed at Western allegations that the trial in Leningrad of 11 per sons  most of them Jews  for attempted hijacking of a Soviet airliner had antiSemitic or antiZionist motivations. The trial, which began Dec. 19, is expected to end tomorrow when the threeman tribunal gives its verdict and pro nounces sentence.

title: CITY LABOR BOARD WEIGHS IMPASSE
description: The city's Board of Collec tive Bargaining is expected in the near future to invoice im passe procedures or to rec ommend some other course aimed at averting a crisis New Year's Eve in the city's nego tiations with its uniformed services.

title: Offtrack Off Base?
description: A ticket to Radio City Music Hall's annual Christ mas show costs $1.75 to $3.75.

title: More Passport Delays Predicted by U.S. Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)Frances G. Knight, head of the passport section in the State Department, sent out at Christmas time last year a letter saying that lack of funds would mean delays of two weeks in the issuance of passports.

title: Hanoi Defends Treatment Of Prisoners as Humane
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 23North Vietnam today defended its treatment of American war prisoners, which it called humane, and said their plight was a result of atrocities com mitted in Vietnam by United States military men and the failure of the United States to withdraw from Vietnam.

title: CHARLES C. SMITH
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 (AP)  Charles C. Smith, for mer state auditor general, died yesterday. He was 62 years old.

title: 114YearOld Queens Church Ruined by a 3Alarm Blaze
description: The First Congregational Church of Flushing, a 114year old white frame building at 38 14 Bowne Street, Queens, was heavily damaged by fire yes terday.

title: Auto Sales Rate Off
description: The sales announced by the Big Four auto makers for the midDecember selling period were equal to a seasonally ad justed annual rate of 4.72 mil lion units, according to adjust ment factors developed by the Conference Board.

title: Checking Account Debits Down 1.5% in November
description: Debits against checking ac counts in New York City banks declined in November by 1.5 per cent from the October level to $4.82trillion, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday.

title: Nets Triumph by 11695; Royals Turn Back Bullets
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. L, Dec. 23Rick Barry scored 41 points to lead the New York Nets to a 11695 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors in an American Basketball Associa tion game tonight. The Nets had lost three straight games.

title: Michigan Killer Sentenced To Spend Life in Solitary
description: BAY CITY, Mich., Dec. 23 (AP)William Kinard, 26 years old, of Bay City has been sen tenced to spend the rest of his life in solitary confinement and at hard labor for the April 14 murder of a gas station attend ant.

title: Giants Hart Gets Surgery
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (UPI)Jim Ray Hart, out fielderinfielder of the San Francisco Giants, underwent surgery on his ailing right shoulder yesterday. Dr. Lloyd Taylor, who performed the operation at St. Mary's Hos pital, said he removed some bone from Hart's shoulder. The surgeon said he found multi ple, recurrent and chronic degenerate changes in the shoulder bone which the sur gery would remedy. Hart was expected to take about three months to recover.

title: Lawyers Can Buy Tapes of Own Pleas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The National Archives has made it possible for many a lawyer to hear the sweetest music this side of heaventhe sound of his own voice arguing a case before the Supreme Court.

title: Court Gets Plea on War
description: BOSTON, Dec. 23 (AP)A motion asking the Supreme Court to reconsider Massachu setts's test of the constitution ality of the Vietnam war was filed today by State Senator elect Jack H. Backman, Brook line Democrat. Mr. Backman said the motion was filed on behalf of 20,000 petitioners from throughout the country.

title: Christmas Caper at Bob's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 News item: Army intelligence agents have spied on 800 civilians in Illinois, in cluding leading political figures, ac cording to Senator Sam Ervin. To get oneself spied upon by the U.S. Army, the Senator says, it was apparently necessary only to be in disagreement with Administration policies, foreign or domestic.

title: Losses of Pennsy Mount; General Mills Profit Up
Vanocur to Relinquish Role as Anchorman
description: Sander Vanocur will relin quish his role as anchorman on First Tuesday, the Na tional Broadcasting Com pany's monthly televised news magazine, in favor of other correspondents, start ing with the program of Jan. 5.

title: Soviet Atom Test Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)  Seismic tremors presumably from a Soviet underground nu clear explosion, were recorded by the United States today, the Atomic Energy Commission re ported.

title: Food Shortages Seen in East Germany
description: BERLIN, Dec. 23East Ger many is facing a new year of persistent food shortages and price rises for basic consumer goods, according to knowledge able sources in East Berlin.

title: Gallup Survey Finds a Decline In Roman Catholic Churchgoing
description: PRINCETON, NI., Dec. 23 Churchgoing among Roman Catholics continued to decline in 1970, with 60 per cent of adults of this faith attending church in a typical week com pared to 63 per cent last year and 71 per cent in 1964, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Brooklyn Rabbi's Daughter Killed in Fire in Synagogue
description: The 6yearold daughter of a Brooklyn rabbi died in a fire early yesterday that destroyed the storefront synagogue of Congregation Hayoscher Veh Atov at 1345 46th Street, in the Borough Park section.

title: Another Physician Shoots a Suspect Trying to Rob Hint
description: A physician in upper Man hattan shot and wounded one of two youths who attempted to mug him in a hallway of a building where he was making a house call yesterday, the police said. Some hours earlier another physician shot and killed a holdup man in his ??ueens office.

title: Little Help for Children
description: The most charitable comment on the White House Con ference on Children is that it probably has done no harm to the causes it espoused. Its major recommenda tions were unassailable: condemnation of racism and other forms of discrimination as well as support for better facilities for the physical, emotional and educa tional care of children.

title: Touch Going to Rome
description: Touch, the Off Broadway communal musical, has been chosen to represent the United States at the International Theater Festival in Rome next spring, it was announced yes terday by Edith O'Hara, who produced it for the Plowright Players. The festival begins April 25.

title: Debutantes Attend 2d Junior Assembly
description: Red and white balloons, red carnations, white chrys anthemums and Christmas greens decorated the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza last night for the second and final Junior Assembly of the sea son.

title: RESTAURANT GROUP TO SHUT LOCATIONS
description: Restaurant Associates Indus tries, Inc., has decided to sell or close a number of marginal or loss locations in the next few months.

title: CAHILL CRITICIZES U.S. FISCAL GOALS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 23  Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jer sey, signing into law a $50 million urbanaid and city tax package for Newark, criticized President Nixon today and at tacked Federal spending priori ties that, he charged, short change the nation's cities.

title: TALKS SUSPENDED ON TEXTILE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)  White House negotiations With Japan over voluntary curbs on textile imports will be suspended until early 1971, Sec retary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said today.

title: SongandDance Theme: Kick the Habit
description: Twentyfive former heroin addicts sang and danced in a Christmas show yesterday, and the theme was a warning to 300 students at the Benjamin Franklin High School of the dangers of drug addiction.

title: Clemente Draws $100 Fine
description: SAN JUAN, Dec. 23 (AP) Roberto Clemente, manager of the Puerto Rico Winter League, the San Juan Senators of was fined $100 and suspended for seven days last night by the league president, Guigo Otero, for bumping and butting an umpire during an argument in a game last Saturday. Cle mente will not be able to join the team until Tuesday.

title: HANOI BIDS U.S. SET A WITHDRAWAL DATE
description: PARIS, Dec. 23The North Vietnamese called on the Nixon Administration today to agree to withdraw American forces from Vietnam by next June 30 or to suggest another date. They offered to help the United States meet the deadline if need be.

title: Karen Erskine Bride in South Of Anthony J. Drexel Biddle 3d
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Dec. 23Miss Karen M Erskine, daughter of Comdr. Kenneth M. Erskine, U.S.N., and Mrs. Erskine, and Anthony J. Drexel Biddle 3d, son of Mrs. Edwinston Loughborough Robbins of Gladwyne, Pa., and the late Anthony J. Drexel Biddle Jr., who was Ambassador to Spain, were married here this evening. Lieut. Comdr. Herbert T. Lewis, Chaplain Corps, U.S.N., performed the Protestant cer emony in the Eternal Father of the Sea Chapel at the Naval Base here.

title: MANAGERS URGED FOR SANITATION
description: Teams of industrial engineers who could bring about sharp changes in the traditional mili tarylike operating methods of the Sanitation Department were requested yesterday by Envi ronmental Protection Adminis trator, Jerome Kretchmer.

title: Vatican and Jewish Aides Agree to Joint Bias Fight
description: ROME, Dec. 23International Jewish leaders and Vati can officials ended a fourday meeting here today with an agreement to join forces in fighting racism, antiSemitism and all forms of discrimina tion.

title: Sales Also Advance
description: General Mills, Inc., a leading producer of packaging foods, showed small gains in sales and earnings for the second fiscal quarter ended Nov. 29, but halfyear results were more favorable, according to the semiannual report issued yes terday.

title: MONROE F. DREHER; HEADED AD AGENCY
description: DARIEN, Conn., Sept. 23  Monroe F. Dreher, retired head of Dreher Advertising, Inc., in New York City, died today of a sudden illness at his Salem Street home.

title: Bomb Threat at Library
description: The Main Public Library, at Fifth Avenue and 42d Street, was evacuated yesterday after the Department of Sanitation received an anonymous tele phone call that a bomb would go off in the library at noon. A search by the police failed to find any explosives.

title: Strolling Down the Avenue on a Tour of the Christmas Windows
description: They may not be spend ing as much this year and there may not be as many of them, but for throngs of New Yorkers and tourists the giant trees of light that beckon from Saks;; to Lord & Taylor are an irresistible lure.

title: Nickel SetAside Reduced
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) The Commerce Department today reduced the setaside that nickel producers are re quired to save for defense related items. The setaside for each of the first three months of 1971 was established at 20 per cent of average monthly shipments during the last half of 1968. The setaside for December and for most re cent months has been 22 per cent.

title: A. C. C. ABSOLVES 2 TEAMS IN FIGHT
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Dec. 23 (UPI)Acting Commissioner Norval Neve of the Atlantic Coast Conference has declared the result of last week's South CarolinaMaryland basketball game official. He says the fight that ended it almost five min utes early could have hap pened anywhere.

title: Nixon, at Piano, Leads Children Singing Carols
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  President Nixon played Jingle Bells and Silent Night on an upright piano for a swarm of children gathered around him to sing Christmas carols in the East Room of the White House tonight.

title: PEPPERDINE DOWNS N.Y.U. QUINTET, 8684
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23  Jacob Davis's 33foot jump shot in the final second of a five minute overtime period gave Pepperdine College an 8684 triumph over New York Uni versity last night at the Sports Arena. It was the second con secutive overtime defeat for the Violets, who have a 27 won lost record.

title: Bank in Queens Is Robbed Of $25,000 by 6 Gunmen
description: Six armed men wearing ski masks escaped yesterday after noon with about $25,000 after robbing the Springfield Gar dens branch of the National Bank of North America, at 21602 Merrick Boulevard in Queens.

title: Advertising: Retiring N.W. Ayer Censor Reflects on 37 Years
description: For you it's only. Christmas Eve, but for David Gudebrod it is the end of two longtime associations.

title: Secretary's News Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Following are excerpts from a news conference held today by Secretary of State William P. Rogers:

title: Mimi Benzell, Entertainer, Dead
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Dec. 23 Mini Benzell, a Metropolitan Opera soprano who switched to a successful career in musi cal comedy, nightclubs and on radio died of cancer today in North Shore Hospital. Miss Ben zel, the wife of Walter. Gould, a New York concert manager, was 47 years old and lived at 45 Cardinal Road.

title: Matchbook Helps to Trace Path of a Stolen Copter
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 23 (UPI) The Erie County Sheriff's office said today that with the help of a matchbook it had traced a helicopter stolen Sunday from a hanger in a suburb to somewhere in Alabama.

title: I.M.F. Move Is Hailed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  The treasury welcomed today final Congressional passage of legislation permitting the United States to accept a high er quota in the International Monetary Fund, but warned that a separate appropriation bill must be passed by Dec. 31 to prevent a United States permanent loss of $130million in paper gold.

title: Bill Rates Are Lowest in 3 Years At Treasury's Monthly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Monthly Treasury bill rates at today's auction of 265 and 365 day bills, posted a threeyear low, the Government an nounced late this afternoon.

title: Jury Gives the Death Sentence; First in the State in Seven Years
description: UTICA, N. Y., Dec. 23  A 34yearold man convicted of killing two policemen as he was fleeing the scene of a holdup became today, the first man to face the death penalty in New York State in seven years, and the first Sentenced to death under the state's re vised penal code.

title: Buchholz Quits Tennis Tour Because of Elbow Ailment
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 23 (UPI)  Earl (Butch) Buchholz said to day he was quitting the profes sional tennis tour because of a prolonged case of tennis elbow.

title: N.F.L. Playoffs
description: (WonLostTted Recede In Parentheses)

title: Rogers Tells of Soviet Naval Activity at Cuban Port
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Secretary of State William P. Rogers said at a news con ference today that there had been some Soviet naval activity recently in the area of Cienfuegos, the Cuban port where the Soviet Union is re portedly developing facilities for nuclear submarines. But he said there had been no new construction since President Nixon's news conference 10 days ago.

title: New Regulations Pledged by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  The Securities and Exchange Commission has pledged to write new regulations covering two major areas of the securi ties business  a cash reserve against customers credit balances and segregation of securities owned by customers but held in street names.

title: Ski Conditions
description: ALBANY, Dec. 23 (AP)New York State ski conditions as re ported today to the State Com merce Department:

title: Class 4  4: Voices Are Raised, but Only in Song
description: On the last morning of school before Christmas, Class 44 trooped to the prin cipal's office, which doubles as a broadcasting studio, to sing holiday songs over the loudspeaker system to all the classrooms of Public School 198, Manhattan.

title: High Cost of Hospital Care
description: Just a little over a year has passed since Blue Cross won court approval for a 43.3 per cent increase in hospital insurance rates for more than 3 million New Yorkers. Announcement that Blue Cross is now seeking a further increase of 19.3 per cent, effective next May 1, is a disconcerting indication thateven in this period of rampaging inflationthe cost of health care is still rising much more steeply than most other elements in the family budget.

title: Saigon Assembly Selects Oct. 3 for Presidential Vote
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 23 (UPI)The South Viet namese National Assembly voted today to hold the 1971 presidential election on Oct. 3. The measure, part of an over all election procedures pack age, now goes to the Senate.

title: Blackman Says Challenge Drew Him to Illinois
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Dec. 23 (AP)Bob Blackman, named of ficially today as head football coach at the University of Illi nois, said that after 16 years of Ivy League. play and six championships in nine years, he had come to the end of the line.

title: U.C.L.A. Beats St. Louis
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23 (AP) Top rated University of Cali fornia, Los Angeles turned back a stubborn St. Louis University, 7965, in an intersectional bas ketball game tonight.

title: BOSTON TRIUMPHS ON 2 EARLY GOALS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 23 (UPI)Ed Westfall and Fred Stanfield scored in the first 6 minutes 4 seconds of the first period to night end the Boston Bruins then held off the Detroit Red Wings to win their ninth straight National Hockey League game, 21.

title: Seale Is Accused in Connecticut Of Vandalism in Isolation Cell
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 23  Correction Commissioner Ellis C. MacDougall testified in Federal Court here today that Bobby G. Seale, the Black Pan ther national chairman, had set fire to a television set and had broken other furniture in his isolation cell at the State Correction Center in Montville.

title: MRS. ROGER S. HOWSON
description: NEWTOWN, Conn., Dec. 23  Mrs. Julie Benjamin Howson of Taunton Lake Road, widow of Roger S. Howson, retired librarian of Columbia University, died today after a long illness in Glen Hill Convalescent Home in Danbury. She was 84 years old.

title: Decline in Winter Wheat Foreseen by U.S. Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP) The Agriculture Depart ment forecast today a 1971 winte?? wheat crop of 1.04 bil lion bushels based on field con ditions as of Dec. 1.

title: ELINOR ROSS SINGS FIRST AIDA AT MET
description: Elinor Ross, the American soprano who made her Metro politan Opera debut in June as Turandot and did her first Tosca with the company a few weeks ago, appeared in another title role, that of Verdi's Aida, on Tuesday night.

title: German Trade Surplus Off
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, Dec. 23 (UPI)West Germany's large foreign trade surplus dipped sharply in November, the Federal Statistics Office said today. Figures released by the agency listed the November surplus at $184.97million, well under the $466.94million in Oc tober and the $394.80million in November, 1969. Exports in No vember totaled $2.84billion, down 10 per cent from the pre vious month.

title: A MULTIMEDIA YES FAILS AT PREMIERE
description: The first performance of Yes, a multmedia work by David Cope presented at Car negie Recital Hall on Tuesday night, will have to be reviewed with a firm No.

title: DR. SOPHIE GOTTLIEB, WROTE ON MARRIAGE
description: Dr. Sophie Koerner Gottlieb, a clinical psychologist who practiced in collaboration with her husband, Dr. Bernhardt S. Gottlieb, a psychiatrist, died yesterday apparently of a heart attack, at their home, 225 West 86th Street. She was 72 years old.

title: BRIBE TRIAL STARTS FOR CITY PATROLMAN
description: Waverly Logan, a suspended New York patrolman formerly assigned to Harlem's preventive enforcement patrol squad, went on trial yesterday on depart mental charges of accepting $100 from a convicted narcotics dealer.

description: Two small works by Pi casso that were removed from the Solomon R. Guggen heim Museum on Monday turned up in the mail there yesterday in three pieces.

title: 8 Cigarette Makers To List Tars in Ads

title: LANDRY, MORTON SUCCEED AT HELM
description: The Dallas Cowboys and De ??oit Lions, who meet in the first round of the National Football League playoffs on Saturday, share an unusual dis tinction. They switched person nel at the game's most im portant position, quarterback, in the course of the season, Craig Morton for Roger Stau bath at Dallas and Greg Landry felt. Bill Munson at Detroit

title: Art: Engaging Prints by Jasper Johns
description: Although the exhibition that opened Tuesday at the Museum of Modern Art is called Jasper Johns: Litho graphs, it is anything but a lineup of prints. What with modifications in ink, pencil, chalk, paint and collage on working proofs, and varia tions in paper and color that transform some of the stones from impression to impres sion, these prints have the variety and intimacy of drawings.

title: MRS. TEME BRENNER OF PUBLICITY FIRM
description: Mrs. Teme Casten Brenner, president of Rogers, Cowan & Brenner, Inc., public relations, with offices in New York and Beverly Hills, Calif., died Tues day of cancer at her home in Beverly Hills. Her age was 50.

title: Museum of Modern Art Threatened With Strike
DR. EDNA K. TROPP
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Dec. 23  Dr. Edna Kroll Tropp, wife of Dr. Leon Tropp, died today in Beth Israel Medical Center, Newark. She was 48 years old. The Tropps lived here at 379 Meisel Avenue.

title: City Reports Advances in Welfare Hotel Housing
description: Steps have been taken to im prove living conditions in ho tels for welfare families and to reduce the need for emergency hotel housing, Human Re sources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman said yesterday.

title: DR. BAILEY PEPPER, ENTOMOLOGIST, 64
description: Dr. Bailey B. Pepper, pro fessor of entomology at Rut gers University and chairman of the department of entomol ogy and economic zoology, died Tuesday in Doctors Hos pital, after a long illness. He was 64 years old and lived in Edison, N. J.

title: MRS. ERNEST ANGELL
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Brosius Hig gins Chapin Angell, wife of Er nest Angell, retired chairman of the American Civil Liberties Un ions, died yesterday apparently of a heart attack. She was 70 years old and lived at 156 East 66th Street.

title: Oil Dealers in City Trying To Cut Backlog of Orders
description: Fuel oil dealers worked yes terday at reducing the backlog of customers who had run out of oil and predicted a rise in the price of oil because of the cost of the new union con tract that followed a seven day strike that ended Tuesday night.

description: A number of wives of American prisoners of War in North Vietnam have se lected their Christmas cards to honor their husbands this year.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The Food end Drug Administration recalled from the market today nearly every brand of frozen swordfish after finding exces sive amounts of mercury in 89 per cent of the samples tested.

title: Pill Is A Four Letter Word
description: DUBLINThere are some circles in Dublin in which pill is a fourletter word.

description: DALLASIn October, 1969, I first became involved in efforts to secure the release of American prisoners being held by the North Vietnamese, Viet cong, Pathet Lao and Chinese. Our strategy was developed from numer ous meetings with them, and with countries friendly to them.

title: PARENTS GOVERN HEAD START UNITS
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 23  Parents of children enrolled in Head Start programs have been granted broad governing au thority, including the right to hire and dismis local program directors.

description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec, 23 (UPI)Charles Rug gles, the stage, screen and tele vision performer whose wryly turned milquetoast image made him one of the mast disarming comedians in show business, died in St. John's Hospital to day at the age of 84. A mem ber of the family said he had had cancer.

title: Credit Markets: Prices of Bonds Drift Downward
description: Bond prices drifted down ward yesterday, paying no at tention to the prime rate re ductions Tuesday or the Fed eral Reserve's?? purchases of securities this week.

description: Dominick & Dominick, Inc.?? the investment banking and brokerage concern, announced plans yesterday for the acquisi tion of Dittmar & Co., Inc., a regional securities house based in San Antonio, Tex.

description: Dr. John Kemeny of Dart mouth College has failed to convince the seven other Ivy League presidents that the league should permit its foot ball teams to play 10 games a year. Ivy teams have long been limited to nine games, with no postseason games and no spring practice. With

title: Art Institute of Chicago Begins Admission Charge
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23 (AP)A contribution admission fee, like the one New York's Metropoli tan Museum has been collect ing since last summer, was ap proved today for the Art Insti tute of Chicago.

title: CUBICOLO PRESENTS GORDON IN 4 WORKS
description: Lonny Joseph Gordon's idea of choreography is that of a thirdrate graphic designer, all trite effects with no underlying form. Tuesday evening at the Cubiculo he presented four works on a program he shared with Gale Ormiston.

title: $809,945 AWARDED IN SPECTRUM SUIT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 (AP)The Philadelphia 76ers basketball team, the Philadel phia Flyers hockey team and two ether organizations that Use the Spectrum have been awarded a total of $809,945 in damages in a suit against the arena's architects.

The Thanksgiving turkey has scarcely been made into the last sindwich when she starts making the mertu for a series of four sitdown din neri, with 20 or more guests each, to celebrate the Christmas holidays.

title: Colombian Jumps $250,000 Bail Set in Cocaine Smuggling Case
description: A former Colombian vice consul who was convicted last month by a Federal jury in Brooklyn on two counts of smuggling $5million worth of pure cocaine into this country was reported yesterday to have jumped $250,000 bail and fled to Colombia.

description: ALBANY, Dec. 23 (AP)Gov ernor Rockefeller today com muted the sentence of L. Jud son Morhouse, the former Republican State. Chairman, who was convicted four years ago in connection with the is suance of a liquor license to the Playboy Club in New York City.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Ralph Nader, a longtime critic of the automobile industry, said today that the Justice Depart ment had been urged by some of its top antitrust officials over the last four years to bring a suit to break up the General Motors Corporation.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird issued a directive today aimed at strengthening his direct con trol over military intelligence activities, particularly investi gations within the United States.

description: GENEVA, Dec. 23  Gramco Management, Ltd., the mutual fund organization, was in volved in a case of private telephone tapping during its merger negotiations with In vestors Overseas Services, Swiss Federal officials asserted today.

description: Forty high school athletes and their coaches, pleaded at City Hall yesterday that unless the city allocates $375,000 im mediately athletic and other extracurricular activities in the public high schools would be sharply curtailed, if not stopped.

description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., Dec. 23Miss DeAnne Adele Sloan and Christopher Elam Riddle, both of whomserved as Peace Corps volunteers in Tunisia, were married here this afternoon in St. Theresa's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. Bernard J. O'Connor per formed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Robert Ellis of the United Church of Christ in Billings, Mont.

description: In guiding the Cincinnati Ben gals to the American Con ference playoffs in their third year of operation, Paul Brown has emphasized a phase of pro football that many devotees ignorethe kicking game, as coaches call it. description: The Lindsay administration, which would like better side walk trash baskets but is not sure it can afford them, is considering this proposal from private companies: Let us put our advertising on the baskets and we will pay for them.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec..24 (UPI) The Office of Economic Op portunity granted $333,090 to day to Howard University in Washington to operate its fel lowship program to train law yers for the antipoverty pro gram.

title: Chrysler Said to Change Plans for Warehouse Site
description: MARLBOROUGH, Mass., Dec. 24The Chrysler Corporation was reported today to have dropped plans to build a $2.5 million warehouse, distribution and sales plant between Marl borough and neighboring North boro in favor of a site in neigh boring Westboro.

title: French Free Leftist Editor
description: PARIS, Dec. 24 (AP)One of the editors of a banned Maoist newspaper, La Cause du Peuple (The People's Cause), was re leased from prison yesterday after serving nine months bf a year's sentence. The editor, Jean Pierre le Dantec, was sen tenced last May. The news paper is supported by an organization that includes Jean Paul Sartre and Simone de Beauvoir.

title: U.S. Court Upsets State's Ban on Flag Changes
description: A special threejudge Fed eral court here ruled yesterday that a New York State law prohibiting the display of words or symbols on the American flag was unconstitutional.

title: Jan. 3 Call of Congress Suggested Again by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI) The White House suggested ??gain today the possibility that President Nixon might convene the new Congress on Jan. 3 if the present Congress fails to vote on measures that he con siders vital.

title: Elyesa Bazna, German Spy Cicero in War, Dies
description: MUNICH, Germany, Dec. 24 (AP)  Elyesa Bazna, the World War II German spy who served as valet to the British Ambassador in Turkey, died Monday in Munich at the age of 66. He used the code name of Cicero, and the movie, Five Fingers, was based on his ex ploits.

description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Dec. 24 Three New Jersey men have been indicted here on seven counts of involuntary man slaughter each as the result of a bus accident in which seven children died on Route 22, 10 miles west of this eastern Penn sylvania community last July 15.
