As a result, aircraft lease deals have assumed in creasing prominence in the acquisition of equipment that otherwise may have proved impossible.

title: BLUES TO OPPOSE RANGERS TONIGHT
description: The St. Louis Blues, the first club with a winning record to face the Rangers since Dec. 2, meet the New Yorkers tonight at Madison Square Garden.

title: JOHN P. KILLEEN
description: John P. Killeen, a retired auditor of the Textron Com pany in Providence, R. I., and earlier a public accountant here, died Friday in East Greenwich, R, I., where he lived. His age was 61.

title: Insurer Sues Claimant
description: LITTLE ROCK?? Ark. Dec. 26 (UPI)The St. Paul Fire and Marine Insurance Company has filed suit in an attempt to re gain $500,000 it said had been paid to an allegedly fraudulent claimant. The money was paid to Dr. John Hundely, who tes tified he had been permanently disabled in an accident. The in surance company contends Mr. Hundley has carried on an active medical practice for the last six months.

title: Correction
description: In both our Summer Read ing and Christmas Issue listings of outstanding books of the year, Birth Control in Amer ica: The Career of Margaret Sanger was listed without the author's name. The book was written by David M. Kennedy of the department of history at Stanford University, and we re gret this omission.

title: CURRAN TO CAPTAIN ARMY'S HARRIERS
description: Bob Curran, a second class man (junior) from Ossining?? N. Y., has been elected captain of the 1971 Army crosscountry team, it was announced by Col?? Gus Dielens Jr., athletic direc tor.

title: Ski Jumpers to Begin Bear Mountain Drills
description: Ski jumpers, from Bear Mountain, Mount Beacon and Salisbury, Conn., will practice tonight, tomorrow and Tues day at Bear Mountain, in final preparation for the ski jump season, which begins next week.

title: Philip Johnson Gazes Sadly on the City
description: Gazing dawn upon Man hattan the other day from his 37thfloor office in the Seagram Building, Philip Johnson, the, architect, found little to please him in the wide expanse of midtown highrises.

title: BACKHAND EXCELS IN 63, 63 MATCH
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 26 (AP) Erik Van Dillen posted the biggest upset of the Sugar Bowl invitation tennis tournament to night by defeating topseeded Bob Lutz?? 63?? 63.

title: News of the Rialto
description: FRANK MERRIWELL would have liked Broadway's spunk. Yale's legendary, al beit fictitious, athletic hero was a neversaydie guy and apparently so is Broadway. Here it is the halfway mark of the 197071 campaign and producers and theater own ers, battered by what the sportswriters like to describe as a fusillade of blows to the jaw, head and midsec tion, not to mention a couple of extra kicks in the shins when the referees weren't looking, still refuse to give up. Let's look at the record.

title: OHIO TRIO TO CAPTAIN AT BOWLING GREEN
description: A trio of juniors from Ohio have been named captains for Bowling Green's 1971 football team.

title: Boumediene Visiting Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)Presi dent Houari Boumediene of Al geria arrived here today for a fourday state visit.

title: Ducks Beat Blazers, 53
description: COMMACK, L. I., Dec. 26 (AP)Jean Nicol scored three goals tonight to lead the Long Island Ducks to a 53 Eastern Hockey League victory over the Syracuse Blazers. Alain Lan glais and Butch Morris got the other Long Island goals.

title: 3 Nixon Aides Call Drive on Pollution Major Policy Goal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Three high officials of the Administration looked back this week over President Nixon's first two years in office and set forth what, they considered the central themes of his domestic policy.

title: Happy New Year
description: HAPPY NEW YEAR! Turning out the old year and welcoming the new one is a postal tradition in many coun tries. A numbernotably in the Far Eastare observing the advent of 1971 as the Year of the Boar.

title: Boat Gets Rocked in Economics
description: Economics, the textbook by Paul Samuelson, winner of the Nobel Prize, has become synonymous with the college teaching of introductory eco nomics over the last decade. However, a classroom revolu tion is brewing, which, while not altogether elminating Professor Samuelson and his famous text, is focusing the academie spotlight on other theorists as well.

title: NEGRO IS APPOINTED TO CAROLINA STAFF
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Dec. 26 Gov. Elect John C. West has announced the selection of an executive staff, including the first Negro appointed in mod ern times to a major staff posi tion in the Governor's office.

title: Robert R. Weller And Lissa Waite Planning to Wed
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 26 Prof. and Mrs. William G. Waite have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Lissa Waite, to Robert R. Weller, a student at the Yale Law School.

title: Crime:
description: Newcaster Don Harris of Chi cago radio station WGN heard that a robbery was taking place at the American Savings Bank in suburban South Chicago Heights last Tuesday. Mr. Harris decided to find out for himself. He picked up the phone and dialed the bank's number, hop ing to get a report from one of the officers. What he did get when the phone was answered went like this:

title: San Francisco to Try U.S. For 419 Parking Tickets
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 26 (UPI)The City of San Fran cisco is taking the United States Government to Munici pal Court over a matter of 419 parking tickets.

title: Helmsley Buys Land
description: The sale of Parkmerced, a 3,483unit apartment project in San Francisco, to an in vesting group headed by Harry B. Helmsley was con cluded last week. The Metro politan Life Insurance Com pany sold the complex of highrise, garden and town house units to the Helmsley group for nearly $40million and also leased the 143 acres under them to the group for a long term.

title: Coins
description: NUMISMATISTS who collect paper money have a bonanza await ing them. Several changes in the signature on the face of United States notes have occurred since 1968and several more are to be made. The experiehced numismatist, of course, is overjoyed. And for newcom ers there couldn't be a much better time to start a collec tion.

title: Mrs. Meir Is Pessimistic About Chances of Peace
description: TEL AVIV Dec. 19The indi cations here are that the Israeli Government will decide soon to rejoin the United Nations talks on the Middle East, but Premier Golda Meir is decidedly pessimistic about the chances for, a settlement.

title: SCIENTISTS URGED TO IMPROVE IMAGE
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26  The head of the National Academy of Sciences, Dr. Philip Handler, urged scientists tonight to exhort and educate the public as to the role of their profes sion in helping to build a bet ter nation and a better world.

title: Allen of Rams Awaits Ball's Bounce
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 26 George Allen, the perfection ist coach of the Los An geles Rams who has learned not to expect too much for Christmas, still retains high hopes for the new year.

title: Banks:
description: Lenin, in planning the Soviet takeover of Russia, put nation alization of the banks at the top of his list of principal meas ures of revolution. The banks, he said, as we know, are the centers of modern economic life, the principal nerve centers of the whole capitalistic economic sys tem.

title: Carolina School Drops 2 Texts Scored by Ministers
description: ROCKY MOUNT, N. C., Dec. 26TWo literature textbooks were recently removed from this city's three public junior high, schools after a group of Fundamentalist ministers ob jected to their contents and authors.

title: Atomic Controls:
description: WASHINGTON  The Atomic Energy Commission, no stranger to controversy, is at year's end caught once more in a crossfire of critic ism. The chief issue: just how safe are the standards and procedures established by the A.E.C. to govern nuclear power plants and atomic bomb testing? In recent weeks, a series of develop mentsranging from court decisions to an aberrant test blast  has provided new ammunition to those on both sides of the controversy.

title: What's With This Green Thumb?
description: PERHAPS it is time to lay at rest forever the myth of the green thumb. Someone who saw a gardenia plant bloom ing in my window repeated that old clich again, Oh, you surely have a green thumb! I didn't explain that the gardenia was in a cool, sunny spot, in rich, moist, well  draihed soil, and re ceived fiequent foliage sprayings, all cultural re quirements for gardenias, Why bother explaining, when I had done so before, and she hadn't listened?

title: Photography
description: EVERYONE is an art ist who says he Is an artist and everything is art that the artist says is art. in the world of painting and sculpture  or rather, in the world of found objects, selfexpression and accidental effects that has largely superseded the world of painting and sculpture  this rule has been in effectsince at least 1917, when Marcel Duchamp signed a urinal with the name R. Mutt and submitted it as a Foun tain to the Society of In dependent Artists in Paris.

title: Katharine Adams Bride of L. G. Walker
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 26 Miss Katharine Alcott Adams, who was graduated this month from De Pauw Uni versity, was married here this afternoon to Laurence Gordon Walker, a Princeton University graduate in the class of ??70. The ceremony, in the Congregational Church of the Redeemer, was per formed by the Rev. C. Arthur Bradley.

title: MRS. J. G. TAYLOR SPINK
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 26 (AP) Mrs. J. G. Taylor Spink, widow of the publisher of The Sporting News, died yesterday of a heart attack in her hotel. She was 77 years old.

title: ATTACK IS CHARGED BY NORTH KOREANS
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP)North Korea charged that U. S. imperialist aggressor forces, including a spy ship, entered North Korean waters today. The North Koreans said they dealt a decisive counter blow at the intruders.

title: Five More For 1971
description: FIVE additional commem orative stamps for 1971 have been announced by Postmaster Gen eral Winton M. Blount. One stamp will revive the American Painting series, which began in 1961 and which was allowed to lapse this year. There will also be continuations of conserva tion issues, the American Poet series begun this year, and the institution of what may be an annual Historic Preservation program, with the 1971 issue to depict early American architecture.

title: Indiana Upset, 8380
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 26 (UPI)Washington State, lead ing by 20 points (midway through the second half, held on to defeat 12thranked Indi ana, 8380, in the opener if the Far West Classic tonight.

title: White House Releases Nixon Midterm Facts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)More than 53,000 peo ple were entertained at the White House during the first two years of the Nixon Pres idency.

title: Rabbis Are Accused of Failing Youths
description: The spiritual head of Ortho dox Judaism in the United States asserted yesterday that Jewish leaders had failed to prevent young Jews from iden tifying with all sorts of ideolo gies as well as withradical left ist political concepts.

title: Geraldine Benjamin Wed in Mexico
description: Miss Geraldine Anne Ben jamin, daughter of Robert Spiers Benjamin of Mexico City and the late Mrs. Doro thy Calhoun Benjamin, was married yesterday to Karlis Ameriks, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arturs Ameriks of Pleasant Ridge, Mich. The ceremony was performed in the Union Church (Interdenominational) in Mexico City by the key. Frank Wood, a Presbyterian minister.

title: U.S.G.A. MEETING TO DISCUSS RULES
description: A broad range of subjects, from the character of the golf ball to the rules of amateur status will, be discussed by the Unitel States Golf Associa tion during four days of meet ings in January. The sessions will conclude with the 77th an nual meeting of the association at the Biltmore Hotel in New York Jan. 30.

title: Cleveland High School Senior Named a G. O.P. Party Official
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 Ar thur J. Fridrich, with his long hair and modtype clothes, does not look like the average political leader, but this week he was placed in the center of things political.

title: Son to Mrs. R. J. Milch
Chemical Causing Rats to Fear Dark Is Synthesized
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 26 (Reuters) Scientists at Baylor College of Medicine said today they had isolated a brain chemical that produces fear of the dark.

title: Dean of Public Health At Harvard to Resign
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 26 (AP)Dr. John C. Snyder, dean of the Faculty of Pub lic Health at Harvard, an nounced today that he was resigning his post at the end of the current school year.

title: A Diller, a Dollar, an A & R Scholar . . .
Travel Slump on Clark St., U.S.A.
description: THE LODICOSthose lucky devils pictured in the familiar bank ad vertisementmay not be shovel ing their driveway this winter, but the Townes, a real, and probably much more representative couple, expect to be giving their snow shovels a good, hard workout all winter long. The Townes aren't going any place this win ter, and, for that matter, don't anticipate being relieved of having to mow their lawn next summer, either.

title: Spanish CourtMartial Delays Sentencing Basque Nationalists
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 26  Sentencing in the courtmartial of 15 Basque nationalists was suddenly postponed today until next week, possibly as a result of the freeing yesterday of the West German consul, Eugen Beihl.

title: Moslems Seek Just Peace, Yahya Declares at Parley
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 26, (Reuters)President Agha Mo hammad Yahya Khan told dele gates from 23 Moslem countries today that Islam means peace, but warned it must be peace with honor and justice.

title: Colonels 126122 Victors
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 26 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels jumped ahead in the first quarter and went on to defeat the Texas Chaparrals, 126122, tonight.

title: City's 2 Firemen Dismissed
description: SIERRA MADRE, Calif., Dec. 26 (UPI)  The City Council dismissed on Wednesday the city's two fulltime firemen, Richard Ludden, 38 years old, and Donald Burleson, 27, in a reorganization. Mayor John N. Simmons said the city was consolidating the two positions into one, fire marshal, and that the two men would be able to take a competitive examination for the job. The fire marshal will direct operations of a 23 man volunteer department with a parttime chief.

title: Criminals At Large
description: I haven't the figures at hand, but I've a strong suspicion that mystery characterizes a sub stantially higher proportion of the output of fiction than it does of the entire repertoire of the theater. The observation, if valid, wants some explaining.

title: Dependable for Blossoms
description: ONE of the most de pendable house plants for flowers is Epiph yllum, the Orchid Cac tus. The blossoms are the largest and most beautiful of all cactus family flowers, and the plant is amazingly easy to rare for

title: Critter Films
description: SPANISH FORD, Utah Ranchers living near this somewhat somnolent central Utah community have been coming to town in unusual numbers recent nights to shop, and to take their wives and children to a movie.

title: Food Stamps:
description: It started with Mary Addison. The series of field trips that has taken the Senate Select Com mittee on Nutrition and Human Needs all over the country be gan almost two years ago with a visit to migrant labor camps in Collier County, Fla. Mrs. Addi son, a deeplywrinkled black woman of 65, had spent her life as a stoop laborer helping to harvest cro??s.

title: Miss Elizabeth Blakey Bride Of Charles Richard Thompson
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, Dec. 26  Miss Elizabeth O'Brien Blakey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Miller Blakey of Columbus, was married here this afternoon to Charles Richard Thompson of New York, son of Mrs. Clarence P. Thompson of Kansas City, Mo., and the late Mr. Thomp son.

title: Depths of Brain Probed For Sources of Violence
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26He was a policeman in Boston, wellliked in his community and known as a good husband and father.

title: French Buildings Closed
description: PARIS, Dec. 26 (Reuters) Authorities have closed 806 public buildings across the country following a fire at a dance hall in central France last month that killed 146 young persons.

title: Postponed
description: The December 18 Board of Estimate hearing on the housing for the. Washington Market renewal site, men tioned in last week's column, has beencarried over to Jan uary 14. Action on approval is expected then.

title: CITY'S LOST TRIBE REVIVED FOR SHOW
description: In an earlier day, a forest of wooden Indians, carved and brave with paint, peopled the streetssidewalk signs for to bacco shops.

title: Fuqua Gets 57 Points
description: QUINCY, Ill., Dec 26 (AP) Rick Fuqua poured in a tourna ment record of 57 points to lead Oral Roberts to a 12083 victory over St. Benedict's in the opening round of the Quincy holiday basketball tour nament today.

title: Kurtenbach of Canucks To Be Out Six Weeks
description: VANCOUVER, British Co lumbia, Dec. 26 (AP)Or land Kurtenbach, the captain of the Vancouver Canucks who was injured in a Na tional Hockey League game in Toronto Wednesday night, will be out of action for at least six weeks.

title: Soviet Union:
description: MOSCOW  While the Western world was preparing to celebrate Christmas Eve, a Leningrad court Thursday night was pronouncing sen tence on 11 defendants9 of them Jewswho had con fessed earlier in the court to planning to hijack a Soviet airliner in Leningrad last June 15.

title: Marianne Perry Will Be a Bride
description: The engagement of Miss Marianne dewolfe Perry to Thomas Alexander Dewitt Bowman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Parker Bowman of New York and Brookfield, Conn., has been announced by the future bride's parents Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Perry Jr. of Montevideo, Uru ??

title: Deborah Upham Will Be Bride Of William Lincoln Rudkin Jr.
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn.. Dee. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edward Filliettaz have announced the engagement of Mrs. Filliet taz's daughter, Miss Deborah Bourne Upham, to William Lincoln Rudkin Jr. He is the soh of Mr. and Mrs. Rudkin of Southport.

title: Long Hair Puts Pitt Wrestler in Bind
description: PITTSBURGH, Des. 26 (AP)Mark Payne's shoulder length hair is too long for the National Collegiate Ath letic Association.

title: After a Decade in Vietnam, U. S. Officials Expect a Crucial Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 24'It seems every year in Vietnam is crucial, an Amer ican official said this week. But next year does seem more crucial than this. The military picture has greatly improved. But more of our troops will be leaving. And I'm worried about the political and economic fab ric. Disaster in either could un dermine everything we've done here.

title: Hearts Soar in Cortland As 12 Servicemen Fly In
description: CORTLAND, N.Y., Dec. 26 Must be an antiwar rally. They can't be waiting for us.

title: Religion
description: For most of Christian his tory, the role of the parish clergyman has been rather clear: preacher of the gospel, counselor, liturgist and gen eral spokesman for the val ues of the next world in the midst of this one.

title: UNITAS EXHORTS MATES AT MEETING
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 26The recent past is a living part of Baltimore's football present, so much so that it doesn't have to be put into words specifically.

title: Rent for Postal Boxes Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) The postal service has con firmed what many persons have known for several weeks that the rental on post office boxes has gone up 20 per cent. A spokesman said the increase ranged between 5 cents and $2.40 for three months, depend ing on the size of the box. It will raise $8million a year in additional revenue.

title: ZAMBIAN EMBASSY CAUSING A FUROR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  Soon after Zambia bought a 27room mansion on Emlbassy Row here last July, her repre sentatives became embroiled in controversy.

title: I. A. P. G. TO BUILD TOUR IN NEW YEAR
description: A relatively new organization named the International As sociation of Professional Golf ers is making plans to build up a tour of its own on the twin premises that (1) there should be competitive opportunities for the rabbits who fail to qualify for the regular tourna ments of the Professional Golf ers Association and (2) it can provide fans with professional golf on Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays, when the P.G.A. events are not running.

title: The British
description: Cheap, fast travel has not, as was hoped by meliorists, led to a more generally or genuinely international outlook. Quite the contrary. Removed, albeit voluntarily, from their familiar frame, most people become more con vinced nationalists than before. There fore, books investigating the why and wherefore of nations large and small today are popular. Luigi Barzini on Italians, Sanche de Gramont on the French, Anthony Sampson on Britain, are outstanding.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Of all the possible times to take over as head of a major American steel company, the beginning of this month was not the most auspicious. Earnings in the third quarter for most of the industry had scarcely covered the divi dends and the final quarter promised to be worse.

title: APARTHEID STUDY PREDICTS CHANGE
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec, 26A study of apar theid just published here says that a revolutionary situation is likely to develop in South Africa if the political aspira tions of nonwhites are not sat isfied.

title: Hi, Mom, Greetings, It's BrianIn Hollywood!
description: HOLLYWOOD. AMONG the aging sprites, the spoiled actors, and the scarred veterans of television commercials and motorcycle flicks who comprise the youth revolu tion in film directors, only four come to mind who can honestly claim what would seem to be a basic qualifica tionto be under 30. Threeare Michael Wadleigh, who made Woodstock, Paul Williams, who directed Out of It and The Revolution ary, and Jim McBride, direc tor of David Holzman's Diary and the upcoming Glen and Randa Go to the City.

title: Leaders Will Meet in Chad
description: FORTLAMY, Chad, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)Heads of state of the 15??ation joint AfricanMalagasy and Mauri tian organization will meet here from Jan. 27 to Jan. 29.

title: Ad Majora Triumphs by Five Lengths in Hessian Handicap at Liberty Bell
BlueGray Captains Named
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 26, (AP)  The captains for the BlueGray college football game today. Bill Montgomery of Ar kansas and Rick Kingrea of Tu lane will lead the Gray team, and Mike Sherwood of Virginia and Jay Wallace of Missouri will represent the Blue.

title: Dr. Harvey A. Shub Weds Susan Smith
description: Miss Susan Jayne Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Smith of Bronxville, N.Y., was married here last evening to Dr. Harvey Alan Shub, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Shub of Brooklyn. Cantor Jerry Heller per formed the ceremony at the Essex House.

title: Theater in London
description: LONDON. EVERY seven or eight years, a show appears, swept up by some un stoppable zeitgeist which is destined to succeed no matter what obstacles are Put in its path. My Fair Lady was such a show; Hair was another. Almost as often, there comes a show so irremediably hexed that do amount of salutary gris gris can save it from catastro phe. Lionel Bart's Twang was such a show; so is the new musical Isabel's a Jezebel.

title: Karen L. Knapp Engaged
description: ZANESVILLE, Ohio, Dec. 26 Dr. and Mrs. William A. Knapp have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Lynn Knapp, to David Hays John son, son of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Johnson Jr. of Rosemont, Pa. Miss Knapp is a senior at Denison Uni versity. Her fianc, an alum nus of Denison, is a candi date for his master's degree at Cornell University. His father is president of Albert M. Greenfield & Co., Inc., New York, Philadelphia and Atlantic City real estate firm.

title: Universities:
description: To many college students who want to be learners and doers at the same time, much within the present structure of higher education is irrelevant. They consider classroom and course credits as roadblocks to ad vanced learning.

title: For Many Countries, Development Starts With U.N. Seed Money
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Dec, 26  Seven years ago a Norwegian fisherman named Paul Strom went to the Philip pines for the United Nations to convince people to abandon their old bag nets in favor of modern nets that reach some 60 feet down and then are pulled shut like a purse.

title: But Who Will Spy on the Spies?
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26Secretary of Defense Laird has ordered a com prehensive review by Feb. 1 of mili tary intelligence activities. His order was directed at ending unconstitu tional domestic surveillance programs, as well as improving intelligence operations abroad; but it may not go far enough to achieve either purpose.

title: NIAGARA DEFEATS MOREHEAD STATE
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Marshall Wingate and Ed Street sank two free throws each in the final 21 seconds tonight to help Niagara University post a 7469 victory over Morehead State in the opening round of the Queen City invitation bas ketball tournament.

title: Girl, 2, Brother, 14, Die in Queens Fire At Welfare Hotel
description: A 2yearold girl and her 14 yearold brother died in a fire in a welfare hotel in Flush ing, Queens, last night.

title: Angela Davis:
description: By 3:20 A.M. last Tuesday, most of the demonstrators and newsmen had abandoned their vigil outside the Women's House of Detention in New York. They had been awaiting the appear ance of Angela Davis, the black militant who had been incar cerated there since her capture in New York on Oct. 13. Less than 24 hours earlier, Miss Davishad lost her fight to prevent extradition to California. She has been indicted there on charges of murder, kidnapping and con spiracy growing out of her alleged purchase of the guns used in a shootout at San Rafael courthouse last August in which four persons lost their lives.

title: Two Factors in Communist Blot Economies that Compare Poorly with Other Selected Areas
Base Shelled as Vietcong End Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sun day, Dec. 27 (AP)The Vietcong ended their 72hour Christmas ceasefire with a mortar attack on an allied naval base early today.

title: 45Acre Jersey Preserve
description: TRENTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Gov. William T. Cahill has ac cepted a deed to 45.3 acres of land in South Brunswick Town ship for use by the state as a wildlife refuge and conserva tion area. The land was given to the state Thursday by Mrs. Grace B. Cook on the condition that it be used as a nature pre serve for the public.

title: JACQUES SCHIFFER, HOFFA ATTORNEY
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26Jacques Maurice Schiffer, who had been the attorney for many years for James R. Hoffa, president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, died today of can cer at Passavant Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 46 Andover Road, Rockville Centre, L.I.

title: Pocket Picker Expected to Steal Show
description: Frank Chapot, a longtime member of the United States Equestrian Team, is highly impressed with his new hunter, Pocket Picker.

title: The Collected Works Of Samuel Beckett
description: Samuel Beckett's most recent work is entitled, in English, Lessness; and it is in lessness, lostness and lastness that this extraordinary writer has hidden himself. What he writes is gerontological, the autumn of the body as Yeats termed it, the an nals of lowering metabolism. Here is God's paucity, men at the end of their tether, played out, past decep tion even by themselves. Christ, what a planet! sighs a character in the radio play All That Fall. Wob bling toward their ends (I can't go on, I'll go on), they straighten up for one thing only, a firm refusal of the colossal fiasco that life affords on what Krapp in his last tape calls this old muckball.

title: How Universities Sell Their Candidates to AllAmerica Voters
description: You've got to be a football hero, to get along with the beautiful girls, or so go the lyrics to a song extolling the virtues of being one of the sport's chosen few every fall.

title: Space
description: Lunakhod, the Soviet lunar rover, has gone to sleep for its second twoweek night on the moon after a twoweek day spent wan dering around the Sea of Showers under remote con trol from earth.

title: But What About Streetcar on 42d Street?
$10.8Million Loss Reported In Goods for U.S. Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) A House Armed Services sub committee has charged that $10.8million worth of goods destined for United States mili tary exchanges in South Viet nam were lost in transit from ports to depots between Dec. 26, 1965, and Jan. 1, 1967.

title: Surveillance of Citizens Stirs Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird's move this week toward curbing military intel ligence activities has under lined the gravity with which political leaders in the capital are coming to view the spread of covert intelligence gather ing and the permanent stor age of such data.

title: Bacheler Sets Peach Bowl Marathon Record in First Attempt at Distance
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 26 (UPI) Jack Bacheler won the Peach Bowl marathon today and set a record in the process.

title: Headhunters Sight Job Upturn
description: If you hear the muted sound of scuffling and grunt ing in the plush offices along Park and Fifth Avenues, don't be alarmed.

title: Italian Aides to Meetin Congo
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)  Italian ambassadors to West African countries will meet here in February to discuss ways of increasing cooperation between Italy and states in the region, the Italian Embassy has announced.

title: W. E. HIMSWORTH, 58, GAS COMPANY AIDE
description: Winston E. Himsworth, vice president in charge of Staten Island operations for the Brook lyn Union Gas Company, died Friday evening. He was 58 years old and lived at 55 Austin Place, Tompkinsville, S. I.

title: Pop
description: THE steadily growing in terest in the blues, primed by the blues influence on contem porary pop groups which helped to bring such source bluesmen as B. B. King and Muddy Waters to promin ence, is currently being re flected in an accumulation of reissue collections of early blues singers. There is arapidly building library of readily available blues rec ords, of which Columbia's project of reissuing all of Bessie Smith's recordings is the most ambitious effort.

title: Home Improvement
description: TWO new softcover books recently re leased, both about 8 by 11 inches, should prove of interest to home handymen as well as handy women. One is titled Furni ture Upholstery and Repair, the other is Children's Rooms and Play Yards. Both are published by Lane Maga zine & Book Company, Wil low Road, Menlo Park, Calif. 94025, and both are priced at $1.95.

title: MitchellLama Housing Periled
description: The MitchellLama program in the city, which has built thousands of subsidized apart ments for middleincome fami lies, is being strangled by high construction costs and interest rates that are now threatening to bring the program to a halt.

title: Alhambra Gal Outraces Windgusher, Pays $46.40
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 26 (AP)  Alhambra Gal caught Windgusher in the final 40 yards today and won the $10, 000 Sugar Bowl Handicap at the Fair Grounds.

title: Club to Fete Blackman, Arkansas State Eleven
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)  Arkansas State and Bob Blackman, former Dart mouth coach, will receive awards as the year's out standing small college team and for outstanding contribu tion to football at the 36th annual dinner of the Touch down Club here Jan. 9.

title: Elizabeth Hoe Will Be Bride Of William King
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Dec. 26The engagement of Miss Elizabeth Babcock Hoe to William Duncan McPhail King has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Edward Livings ton Hoe, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Lieut. Col. William Mc Phail King, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. King of Cornwall onHudson.

title: Miss Brennan Plans Nuptials
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Dec. 26Miss Sandra May Brennan, a teacher at the Emerson School in New York, and Richard Westlake Worthing, an insurance executive, plan to be mar ried in April. Their engage ment has been announcd by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Moran Brennan.

title: Nissan Plant for Congo
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Congolese Government has authorized the Nissan motor company of Japan to set up a car assembly plant in Kinshasa. The plant, representing an in vestment of $500,000, will have an initial capacity of 1,500 vehicles a year.

title: Prisoners:
description: WASHINGTONInvariably, the Christmas season brings diplo matic maneuvers on Vietnam temporary ceasefires, negotiat ing ploys, publicity on prisoners of war, moves that play upon the emotions of the season. Mostly they are ephemeral, but sometimes they are deeply re vealing.

title: Nathan Gaiptman Is Dead; Yiddish Theater Costumer
description: Nathan Gaiptman, who sup plied costume to the Yiddish theater until his retirement four years ago, died Thursday in Miami Beach, Fla. He was in this late 70's and lived at 141 East Third Street here.

title: Mrs. Carner and Hayes Cited in Golf
description: Ted Hayes Jr., a 30year old from Georgia, and Mrs. JoAnne Gunderson Career, a 30yearold from Rhode Island, were named yesterday the 1970 professional golf tournament rookies of the year by Golf Digest maga zine.

title: Shapp V??ws Not to Send Anyone to Electric Chair
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26 (AP)  Gov.elect Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania says he will not send anyone to the electric chair during his term in office.

title: South African Wins
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 26 (AP) South Africa's Byron Bertram, the secondseeded player, over came Jean Caujolle of France in the quarterfinals of the Orange Bowl international junior ten nis championships today.

title: Sun patterns
description: Madras, that oldtime favorite, is back. New life has been given to this classic cotton plaid, which originated in India, in dresses that mix or patchwork the patterns to add a fresh look at sun resorts.

title: Swedish Police Threaten Strike on New Year's Eve
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 26 (Reu ters)Many of Sweden's po licemen are expected to go on strike New Year's Eve follow ing a deadlock in wage talks with the State Board for Col lective Bargaining.

title: British Weather Perverse
description: LONDON, Dec. 26 (AP) Snow and ice today crippled southeast England, usually one of the warmest parts of Britain. In Scotland and the north, usu ally the coldest part of the country, sunny skies prevailed.

title: Judging Art by Gender?
description: THE MOMENT was pro pitious. For months women's rights had been an issue. And so, with strategic foresight, the Whitney Museum elected last spring to devote its yearly holiday exhibition to women artists.

title: For at Least One Nighta Happy New Year
description: Depression, recession, crisis and conflict notwithstanding, New Year's Day is a holiday, and New Year's Eve demands a celebration.

title: Lining Up Against the Future
description: PARISThe crisis in Spain exposed as fallout from the trial of Basque extremists indicates that the Franco regime is tottering and that when the sick old generalissimo goes there is likely to be a struggle for real power no matter who inherits the formal succession.

title: $5Million U.S. Aid to Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)  The United States has decided to give new financial aid to Jor dan worth $5million to repair damage caused in the fighting between the Jordanians and Palestinian guerrillas last Sep tember.

title: Chewing Tobacco and Snuff Gain As Attacks on Smoking Increase
description: CARMEL, Ind., Dec. 26 When Clayton Cordell leaves for the second shift at the Chevrolet plant, he usually has a wad of tobacco tucked inside his cheek. And when his wife, Catherine, goes out shopping in the afternoon, the chances are she may have a pinch of tobacco in her mouth, also.

title: Miss Madden Plans Nuptials
description: Dr. and Mrs. John L. Madden have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Ann Madden, to Roger Paul Fav ale, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas Favale of the Bronx. A spring wedding is planned.

title: Robert G. Page, ExPresident Of Phelps Dodge, Is Dead at 69
description: Robert G. Page, chairman of the executive committee and former president and chairman of the board of Phelps Dodge Corporation, died Friday of acute bronchitis and cardiac ar rest in Central Suffolk Hospi tal at Riverhead, L. I. He was 69 years old and lived at 1165 Fifth Avenue and Quogue, L. I.

title: HEAT ENGINES URGED FOR ELECTRIC CARS
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (UPI) Electric cars with auxiliary, gasolinepowered engines to re charge their batteries could be in production within five years, an electronics researcher told scientists today.

title: Lydia Rappolt Wed To David Weinstein
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Dec. 26 Miss Lydia Claire Rappolt and David Bruce Weinstein were married here this after noon at the Knickerbocker Country Club by the Rev. Henry Powers, an Episcopal priest.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 27, 1970

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Few things better illustrate the importance of the free market in ideas than the drastic change that has re cently occurred in the field of economics. Doctrines that were regarded as heretical and perhaps dangerous only five years ago are now es poused by high officials in Washington and hardheaded bankers on Wall Street.

title: Another Trade Record
description: World exports reached rec ord levels during 1970, al though developing nations again could not match the growth rates of the de veloped and socialist coun tries.

title: LEAD IS STUDIED IN COASTAL FISH
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 26  Some of the lead pollutant from automobile exhausts may be finding its way into man's body by way of the fish he eats, ac cording to a study under way here at the Scripps Institution of Oceanography.

title: Saints List Preseason Foes
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 26 (AP)The New Orleans Saints of the National Football League announced today they would play preseason home games against Philadelphia and Hous ton next year. The Saints will play the Eagles Sept. 4 and the ?? Sept. 11.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: OLD FIELD, N.Y., Dec. 26 Summer flounder, also known as fluke, display a remark able reluctance to carry on procreative activities within the confines of a laboratory.

title: Bargaining Panel Meets Today With Mayor on Firemen's Pact
description: With a work stoppage by 11,300 firemen threatened for New Year's Eve, members of the city's Office of Collective Bargaining will meet with Mayor Lindsay today in an effort to find a solution to the contract dispute.

title: Carolyn Horne Is Betrothed
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Dec. 26 Prentice C. Horne, head master of the Wardlaw Coun try Day School here, and Mrs. Horne of Plainfield and New London, N. H., have an nounced the engagement of their Daughter, Miss Carolyn Olsen Horne, to Howard W. Boyd Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Boyd of Wellesley Hills, Mass.

title: Margaret Connorton Married Here to Philip Cullen Reilly Jr.
description: Miss Margaret Connorton, daughter of Dr. John V. Con norton, executive vice presi dent of the Greater New York Hospital Association and a former Deputy Mayor of New York, and Mrs. Connor ton, was married here yes terday afternoon to Philip Cullen Reilly Jr., son of Dr. Reilly, a physician, and Mrs. Reilly of New York.

title: Armed Forces:
description: WASHINGTON  In July of 1969, at an airport stop in Guam at the start of a fivenation tour of the Far East, President Nix on told newsmen of his hope that in the future America's Asian allies could play a much greater role in their own de fense. Mr. Nixon said that while the United States would con tinue to meet its commitmentsin Asia, the time was past when it could or should permit its friends there to become so de pendent that America could be dragged into future Vietnams. The United States will assist its friends, but neither dictate to them nor assume the principal burden of providing troops for their defense.

title: Company Shows Housing Units
description: Hercules, Inc., which an nounced its diversification into the modular housing field earlier this year, has un veiled its first units. The condominium development which is on a sixacre tract at the Sugarbush Valley ski area near Warren, is called Middle Earth.

title: Tass Terms Religion No Factor in Hijacking Trial
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today that the 11 defendants in the Leningrad trial had been convicted not because most of them were Jews but for their crime of seeking, to hijack a Soviet airliner and for betray. ing the country.

title: Wings Rally Snaps Ranger String, 74
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26  Nick Libett scored on a dropped puck at 11 minutes 56 seconds of the final period to break a 44 tie tonight and the Detroit Red Wings went on to a 74 victory over the New York Rangers.

title: Demirel Escapes Bombs
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Dec. 26 (AP)  Rioting students threw several fire bombs at a car in which Premier Suleyman Demi rel was riding past Istanbul Technical University today. Mr. Demirel was uninjured. The stu dents were protesting the death of a youth in a demonstration in Ankara on Friday.

title: Joseph Cheshire Nash Upton To Marry Penelope Carlhian
description: CONCORD, Mass., Dec. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Jean Paul Carlhian have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss M. Penelope Carlhian, to Joseph Cheshire Nash Upton. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Graydon Upton of McLean.

title: Tasman Auto Racing Begins Saturday
description: The Tasman Series of sev en races is the New Zealand Australia version of the Con tinental Championship of North America and the For mula 5000 competition in Europe. It runs during the winter lull of North Ameri can and European racing, and an interesting aspect of

title: CLARK KICKS GOAL
description: DALLAS, Dec. 26The low est scoring playoff game in the 50year history of the National Football League ended dramat ically today when Mel Rentro of the winners intercepted a pass that had just brushed off the fingertips of Earl McCul louch, the losers split end. This play, on the Cowboys 13yard line in the final minute, pre served for Dallas a 50 victory over the Detroit Lions.

title: Warfield, the Flying Dolphin, Ready to Test Raiders Again
description: OAKLAND, Dec. 26In to morrow's American Confer ence semifinal playoff game between the Miami Dolphins and the Oakland Raiders perhaps the most influential player will be Paul Warfield, the Dolphins sleek wide re ceiver. The game will be televised in the New York area on Channel 4, starting at 4 P.M.

title: YearEnd Rally?
description: Hohoho. Tis the season to be jolly and, on Wall Street, tis the season for the yearend rally.

title: Economic Arm of S.C.L.C. Buys a Theater in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (AP) Operation Breadbasket, the eco nomic arm of the Southern Christian Leadership Confer ence, has purchased the South Side theater where the group's weekly meeting is held every Saturday.

title: TILT BEFORE QUAKE MAY GIVE A WARNING
description: STANFORD, Calif., Dec. 26 (AP)A team of scientists re ports it has discovered that be fore an earthquake, large sec tions of the earth tilt, thereby early warning system.

title: Chisolm Named to Coach Club Football at Brooklyn
description: William Chisholm has been appointed club football coach at Brooklyn College. Chisholm, who began the year as the col lege's first fulltime trainer, succeeds Frank McCahill, who was interim coach for the club'sfirst season.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONFor the last five years, Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., a 74yearold former judge of the North Carolina Supreme Court and a meticulous student of the United States Constitu tion, has been issuing thickly documented warnings that this country is becoming a police state.

title: Catholic Nurses in Scotland Advised oh Abortion Duties
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  Roman Catholic nurses in Scotland are to be given guidance on how to avoid taking part in abortion opera tions, the Catholic Information Office here has reported.

title: Defector:
description: WASHINGTON  He asked for a knife to kill himself. The request was, of course, denied. In such stark tones, a 77page report released last week by Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe presented for the first time a thorough and de tailed account of the desperate attempt of Simas Kudirka, a 32 yearold Lithuanian seaman, to seek asylum aboard a United States Coast Guard cutter and the failure that may have cost him his life

title: Translated From the American
description: The most provocative book of the French literary season is philosopher JeanFran??ois Re vel's Ni Marx ni Jsus (Nei ther Marx nor Jesus), a product of its author's recent travels in the United States. Revel pro claims that world revolution if it occurs can come only from the United States, where estab lished society is contested from within as it is nowhere else. America the conservative thus offers the world a revolution ary model different from all the previous ones, more valid now than Christianity or Commu nism.

title: California Wins, 8276
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 26 (AP) Charlie Johnson scored 8 points early in the second half as Cali fornia took an 11point lead and posted an 8276 victory tonight over Cincinnati.

title: Greece Is Reported To Arrest a Jurist Depicted in Film Z
description: ATHENS, Dec. 26Christos Sartzetakis, the investigating magistrate who was the basis for a character in the film Z, was reported to have been ar rested in Salonika on Christmas Eve.

title: Don't Forget the Neediest
description: Christmas is over. For the man who has everything it meant more ties he'll never wear, more gadgets he doesn't need, more to eat than was good for him.

title: Architecture
description: IT may be cold comfort to Grand Rapids, but Boston is keeping its Old City Hall. Since the two Victorian buildings were almost interchangeable for period and style, and both have been replaced by new structures, it seems like a funny roll of the diceBos ton won, Grand Rapids lost. The irony, of course, is that Boston is so much richer ar chitecturally. Maybe that's why.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sure, it's confusing. But televiewers this afternoon will have to adjust themselves to the situation. They won't be seeing double but they may think that they are hearing double. In his usual pearshapedtones, the space cadet in the announcer's booth will intone that John Brodie of the San Francisco 49ers has just thrown a pass to Gene Washington. Moments later he will be saying that Gary Cuozzo of the Minnesota Vikings has just thrown a pass to Gene Washington.

title: Floridian Leads by 2 Shots In Orange Bowl Junior Golf
description: MIAMI, Dec. 26 (AP)  Rick Hmielewski of Plantation, Fla., shot a twounderpar 69 today to take the firstround lead in the Orange Bowl international junior golf tournament.

title: In 1600, Revolution Was in the Air
description: ANYONE who looks at music todayor bet ter, listens to itcan tell you, if he knows his history, that revolution is in the air. All the argu ments that swirled around the reformers of the past are being wrangled overagain: the music versus the words, manner versus mat ter, form versus content, sci ence versus art, elaboration versus simplicity  all the shibboleths familiar to Monteverdi, Gluck, Wagner, Schoenberg and Webern. Oh, yes, and popular versus classical. That efficient provocateur is back, stirring as much learned and igno rant controversy as it did in 1600, when the tiny band of Florentine musicians known as the Camerata was hatch ing its Nuove Musiche plot to overthrow the rule of the Flemish composers whose contrapuntal techniques had brought music to a gloriousdead end. It makes no dif ference that the New Music reformers thought they were reviving classical Greek ideals in music; they made a revolution.

title: . . . and Forward
description: Looking backward is not a particularly popular pasttime among Wall Street analysts as 1970 draws to a close. It was that kind of year.

title: SOUTH AFRICA BLACK MAY BE GIVEN MEDAL
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 26A black African may become the first person to receive South Africa's highest civilian award for bravery. He is Godwin Khosa, a 35yearold school principal, who plunged into a flooded river to organize a rope rescue of more than 50 persons from a bus.

title: BRAZIL BERATED OVER OLYMPICS
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Why has Brazil, the largest country in Latin America with a population of 92,000,000, won only three gold medals in the history of the Olympics?

title: Barbara E. Mueser Bride of Physician
description: Miss Barbara Ellen Mueser and Dr. Richard Putnam Per kins were married here yes terday afternoon in St. Sav iour Chapel of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine by Canon Peter Chase.

title: Duck Stamps Will Show Reece's Painting of Teal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 The 197172 duck stamp will show three cinnamon teal painted in water colors by Maynard Reece of Des Moines, who has won five of the national competitions for the stamp.

title: The Tourist as Hero: A Study in True Grit
description: NOW that military medals have lost some of their sheen in light of recent reports that the Army has been handing them out like salted peanuts in Vietnam, the Government might consider unload ing some of its surplus supplies by pinning them on deserving tourists.

title: Surgeon, 63, Is Nominated For President of Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 26  A wellknown local surgeon but a virtual political unknown, Dr. Benjamin Henry. Sheares, 63 years old, has been nominated for President of Singapore.

title: Gen. Albert Blanding, 94, Dies; Headed National Guard Bureau
description: BARTOW, Fla., Dec. 26 (UPI)Lieut. Gen. Albert H. Blanding, who served as chief of the National Guard Bureau under President Franklin D. Roosevelt in the 1930's, died today at his home in this com munity. He was 94 years old.

title: DR. JOHN LYNCH
description: Dr. John Francis Lynch, who retired four years ago from the general practice of medicine in Woodside, Queens, died yester day at his home, 8409 35th Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens. His age was 73.

title: King's College Tournament To Open Tomorrow Night
Ethyl Aides See Future for Leaded Fuels
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26The of ficers of Ethyl Corporation, caught between the environ mental movement and the auto industry, think that they have a good chance of com ing out of the twofront war with only minor injury.

title: SUBURB OF DETROIT NAMED IN BIAS SUIT
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (UPI) Suburban Warren and several Federal agencies have been named in a Federal Court suit filed here that alleges that a planned cutoff of urban re newal funds to Warren was de signed to keep blacks out.

title: Hoover Tells Puerto Ricans Comments Were Not Critical
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 26 (AP)J. Edgar Hoover has told Puerto Ricans that he had no intention of criticizing their nationality in a recent maga zine interview. He had been quoted as having said that Puerto Ricans and Mexicans could not shoot straight but were dangerous with knives.

title: PACT IS APPROVED FOR SUSQUEHANNA
description: President Nixon yesterday signed an authorization for Federal participation in the Susquehanna River Basin Com pact. The President's action will enable the three states through which the river flows to coordinate antipollution ef forts and, to develop the water way's power resources, among other things.

title: Robert H. Craft Jr. Will Marry Miss Jamie Ford in February
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Wil liam Ford of New York and Quogue, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Jami son (Jamie) Ford, to Robert Homan Craft Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Craft of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Official Joining University
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The president of the State Senate, Maurice A. Donahue, has ac cepted two positions with the University of Massachusetts. He will be director of the school's new Institute for Governmental Service and Commonwealth Professor of Practical Politics. The appointments are effective Jan. 15, after his term as Sen ate president ends.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Budget problems, ranging from troublesome to critical, are plaguing governors and legislatures in all 50 states. Commonly listed causes: ris ing expenses for schools and welfare; a shortfall in reve nue stemming from a sluggish economy. A United Press In ternational survey of state houses points out the difficul ties now facing state offi cials. Among its findings are these:

title: German Reich
description: THE German Reich the German state was founded a cen tury ago on Jan. 18, 1871. To commemorate the centennial the West German Government will issue a 30 pfennig stamp reminiscent of the Reichspost functioning 100 years agothe imperial eagle in black within a red and yellow frame.

title: Russell Miller Fiance Of Marlene Kovalik
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Dec. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Paul Kovalik have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Marlene Ann Kovalik, to Russell L. Miller of Ruther ford. He is the son of Mrs. Elaine Miller of Glen Oaks, Queens, and Bernard Miller of Plainview, L. I.

title: Sermons to Be in Swahili
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse) Swahili, Tanzania's official language, will be used instead of Arabic for Friday sermons in mosques, the Tanzania Mos lem Council has decided.

title: Jim French, $7.40, Outduels Sir Dagonet in $24,000 Miami Beach Handicap
description: MIAMI, Dec. 26During the running of the eighth race at Tropical Park today, Johnny Campo, the trainer, was stand ing alone at the corner of the walking ring, in a pensive mood. George Poole, another trainer, glanced at Campo and said:

title: Connecticut Planning To Tax Bootleggers
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 26 (UPI) Connecticut residents who tried to avoid state taxes on liquor by bootlegging their Christmas alcohol from New Hampshire will be taxed and possibly prosecuted, John L. Sullivan, state tax commis sioner, has warned.

title: Iraqi Regime Eases Curbs, but It Still Inspires Fear
The New Style in Cairo
description: CAIROPresident Sadat of the United Arab Republic has already changed the tone of political life in Cairo. He is very bitter about Israel; sarcastic about the Jews haggling for territory, but, unlike Nasser, he talks primarily about Egypt and seems to waste little time dreaming about a vast Arab empire.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: 1776  John Cullum is the Senator from South Carolina in the musical which moves to the St. James Theater Wednesday.

title: POLICEMEN BLOCK ROBBERY ATTEMPT
description: A two  man team of plain clothes patrolmen, volunteers in the Police Department's sixweekold plainclothes anti crime patrol experiment, foiled an attempted robbery last night and arrested four persons who had allegedly stabbed one man and shot another in the South Bronx.

title: Foreign Economic Policy To Get New Nixon Stress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  President Nixon will announce soon another change in the organization of the White House to give major status to the field of foreign economic policy, it was reliably reported today.

title: JOHN A. COOKE
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 26 John A. Cooke, retired vice president of the Berlin & Jones Envelope Company of East Rutherford, died Thursday in Englewood Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived in Bergen field.

title: DEBATES IN SENATE RESUME TOMORROW
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) The Senate returns Monday from its Christmas holiday facing a variety of unresolved issues.

title: Is 4Channel Stereo A Commercial Ploy?
description: Is fourchannel stereo nec essary? Is it really more pleasing than ordinary twochannel stereo? Or is it just another way to get the audiophile to buy more high fidelity equipment?

title: U.S. Women Take Lead Over Italy On 3 Net Victories
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 26 (UPI)Patti Hogan and Sharon Walsh combined to give the United States a 30 victory over Italy today in the first round of the women's tennis Federation Cup.

title: Top Wrestlers to Compete In Wilkes College Tourney
Miss Ordway Engaged To Thomas R. Quesada
description: WHITE BEAR LAKE, Minn., Dec. 26The engagement of Miss Margaret Strand Ord way, a junior at Wheaton College in Norton, Mass., to Thomas Ricardo Quesada, a University of Virginia senior, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John Gilman Ord way Jr., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Gen. Elwood Richard (Pete) Quesada, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Quesada of Wash ington and a great grandson of the late Joseph Pulitzer, the newspaper publisher who endowed the Pulitzer Prizes.

title: DOUBLE EXPOSURE IN KODAK CLASSIC
description: The Fordham varsity basket ball team, fresh from two games in Florida, heads back north this week to play a pair in the eighth annual Kodak Classic in Rochester. N.Y.

title: Speaker:
description: WASHINGTONIn the cere monial manner beloved by poli ticians, the changing of the guard is taking place in the House of Representativesbut no one is quite sure what the new guard will bring to a traditionbound institution that is feeling the winds of reform.

title: POST WINS, 6661, IN JERSEY EVENT
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Dec. 26  C. W. Post, breaking away late in the second half, advanced to the semifinals of the fifth annual New Jersey Kiwanis basketball classic at Montclair State's Panzer Gym tonight by defeating Upsala, 6661.

title: DIPLOMATS AIDED G.O.P. CANDIDATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec 26 (AP) Seven of President Nixon's Ambassadors made substantial donations to major Republican races for the Senate this fall, piping at least part of the money through a fundraising operation run by a former White House aide.

title: The Rolling Stones Return to Hard Rock
description: GET YER YAYA'S OUT! The Rolling Stones (London NPS5). This album, the 14th for the Stones not counting the various bootlegged editions, marks a partial return to the group's early days of hard driving, 50'sfashion rock n roll. The tunes are longer than the standard threemin ute 50's product though, and influenced considerably by a 60's hard  rock structure. There are two Chuck Berry numbers  Carol, which is on their first album, and the previously unrecorded Little Queenie. Love in Vain is taken directly from blues singer Robert Johnson's bril liant version of the song. The Iyrics are traditional but the guitar phrasing is distinctly Johnson's. Mick Jagger and Keith Richard, however, as sume credit for the arrange ment which is not quite so blatant a pilferage as their former practice of crediting neither writer nor arranger of old blues and early rock tunes.

title: GuineaSoviet Trade Accord
description: MONROVIA, Liberia, Dec. 26 (Agence France  Presse)  Guinea and the Soviet Union have initialed a trade agree ment for 1971, the Conakry radio reported today in a broadcast monitored here. The agreement covers the special Soviet loan to Guinea's Kindia bauxite office.

title: PETER D. G. HAMILTON
description: LITTLE FALLS, N. J., Dec. 26Peter Davidson Gunn Ham ilton, a retired civil engineer who had specialized in harbor design and development, died Thursday in Mountainside Hos pital, Montclair. He lived at 230 Long Hill Road.

title: Egyptian to Visit Britain
description: CAIRO, Dec. 26 (AP)For eign Minister Mahmoud Riad will pay a fourday visit to Britain Jan. 3 at the invitation of the British Government, the official Middle East News Agency has reported

title: Excerpts From an Informal Conversation With Premier Golda Meir of Israel
WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe cur rent fiscal exercise in the capital is to solve the follow ing conundrum:

title: Death of 13YearOld Boy Believed Caused by Drugs
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26 (AP) A 13yearold boy died today in his home, and officials be lieve he may be the city's youngest victim of a drug over dose.

title: Russians Seem to Smoke More and Worry About It Less
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26Arka dy Raikin, a leading Soviet comedian, recently played the role of a doctor gravely warning a patient about the hazards of smoking. The pa tient, visibly shaken, fervent ly promises never to smoke again. As soon as the patient leaves, the doctor pulls out a package of cigarettes and, with obvious pleasure, takes a deep drag as the curtain falls.

title: Miss Helen McConaughy Wed in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 26 Miss Helen McConaughy of Darien, niece of the late Gov. James L. McConaughy, was married here this afternoon to Lindley M. Franklin Jr. a widower of Noroton, and treasurer of the Executive Council of the Episcopal Church.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: WALL STREET displayed a confident and festive mood last week as the holiday period and the final days of the year approached. The stock market was not particularly buoyant, Chrismas bonuses were rather lean after a rugged year for the market and the brokerage business, but a hopeful attitude was building up for 1971.

title: Arcari Defeats Dos Santos By Decision in Rome Bout
description: ROME, Dec. 26 (AP)Bruno Arcari of Italy, the world jun ior welterweight champion, won a unanimous 10round de cision from Jos Dos Santos of Brazil in a nontitle bout today.

title: 1,000 to Compete Today For Karate Titles Here
description: Twenty karate champions and more than 1,000 contest ants from 50 states will be competing against one an other in the United States Great Grand National and open championship tourna ment at Sunnyside Gardens in Queens today.

title: What's Wrong With Children's Television ...
description: NEARLY all American homes now have at least one electronic teaching machinethe televi sion set. It is the child's first teacher other than his parents, and it gets more of his time and attention than his parents or school teachers do. Preschool children between the ages of 3 and 5 watch an average of 54 hours of television every week. Theonly activity that takes up more of their time is sleeping. And television, for good or ill, is an effective teacher. After six weeks of watching Seasama Street, preschool children gained 26 per cent on a simple figure analogy test; nonviewers gained 3 per cent.

title: POLICE SPOKESMAN REBUTS GOODMAN
description: The Police Department yes terday took issue with State Senator Roy M. Goodman's recent charges concerning the department's manpower and its procedures in coping with bail jumpers.

title: Two That Try to Break the Rulesand Fail
description: THERE'S a line of dia logue rolling around in my head this week. Sad as it is, I can't get it out. It's not a line for New Year's, when we ought to be persuading our selves that new beginnings are possible. But it comesfrom one new play that's just opened (a not unrepre sentative play for our time) and it could easily be made to stand for the whole dis heartening effect of yet an other production currently clamoring for attention. Itbelongs in the record. The line is this:

title: Ivory Coast Plans a Chain Of 800 Retail Food Stores
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Ivory Coast is planning to create a chain of 800 food re tail outlets over the next five years, the Economy and Fi nance Ministry has announced.

title: Ann Richards Fiancee Of William A. Nitze 2d
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 26Mr. and Mrs. E. E. Richards of South Bend and Clearwater Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Kendall Richards, to William Albert Nitze 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul H. Nitze of Washington.

title: The Pulps
description: The Shadow's aim was certain . . . . Snarling, bestial fiends fell with dying curses on their evil lips.

description: PEORIA, Ill., Dec. 26 (AP) with six players scoring in dou ble figures, Bradley routed Yale, 11278, tonight.

title: New Mexico Establishes Refuge for Prairie Dogs
description: SANTA FE, N. M.  Condi tions seem to be improving for the oncescorned prairie dog, the small, barking rodent that formerly dotted vast areas of the Western Plains and Rocky Mountains.

title: Senate Hearing Scheduled, On Panel Leader System
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Senators Fred R. Harris, Dem ocrat of Oklahoma, and Charles McC. Mathias Jr., Republican of Maryland, said today that they would conduct a twoday hear ing next month in their effortto jettison the seniority system of selecting Senate committee chairmen. The hearings are scheduled Jan. 18 and 19.

title: Leafs Rout Flyers, 91
description: TORONTO, Dec. 26 (UPI) Paul Henderson scored three goals and Norm Ullman, Dave Keon and Ron Ellis scored two apiece tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs routed the Phila delphia Flyers, 91.

title: Bobby Baker:
description: WASHINGTON  In the early 1960's, smiling Bobby Baker had his cake and ate it too. A smart youngster froth Pickens, S.C., he be gan as a page in the United States Senate and in a few years was writing the book.

title: Election by Y.M.Y.W.H.A.
description: The Associated Y.M. and Y.W.H.A.'s of Greater New York have elected Sidney J. Silberman as president and James Block as chairman of the executive committee. Mr. Silberman is a partner in the law firm of Kaye, Scholer, Fier man, Hays & Handler, and Mr. Block is executive vice presi dent of the Block Drug Com pany.

title: Rodriguez to Head Wyer Team Again In Daytona Grind
Italian Village Grooms for Bobsleds
description: CERVINIA, Italy, Dec. 26 The old montanaro, a griz zled but wellpreserved mountaineer who has climbed the nearby Matterhorn sev eral times, seemed puzzled as he watched work being done on the local bobsled run.

title: NETS TURN BACK COUGARS, 10498
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 26 (UPI)  Even Bob Verga's 27 points weren't enough to stave off the Carolina Cougars fourth straight loss tonight, 10498, to the New York Nets.

title: ARCH C. LUTHER
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Dec. 26 (AP) Arch C. Luther, former edi tor of The Philadelphia In quirer's Today Magazine, died yesterday at Cooper Hospital at the age of 72.

title: Airline Feeding: Task for Experts
description: In some countries vege tables are grown in night soil while in others meat is not inspected by responsible government officials and in still others the use of polluted water is commonplace. All pose problems for airlines, which must restock their planes after long journeys from the United States.

title: High Court Asked to Uphold A Legacy Law in Louisiana
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 26 (AP)  Attorney General Jack Gremillion has asked the Su preme Court to uphold the con stitutionality of a Louisiana law that bars illegitimate children from inheriting any part of their father's estate.

title: U.S. WANTS MOVE BY SOVIET ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 White House officials say that the success of the talks on the limitation of strategic arms de pends largely on a political de cision by Soviet leaders to pro ceed toward a settlement

title: Chess
description: THE recent 12th annual Armed Forces Chess Championship Tour nament in the American Legion's Hall of Flags, Washington, D. C., was heralded by a heartening message from President Richard Nixon: It is once again a pleasure to applaud those organizations that have joined to make competitive chess available to the men and women of our armed forces ...

title: Canadian Golf Unit to Employ Pro Management Services
description: MONTREAL (Canadian Press)  The Royal Canadian Golf Association will employ profes sional management to assist in the operation of the 1971 Canadian open golf champion ship.

title: POWER SHORTAGE LEADS TO AD CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The threat of fuel and power shortages this winter has prompted several states to call for a moratorium on utility company advertising drives for new customers, but some companies have declined to go along.

title: Texas Governor Blocks Grant And Poses a Federal Problem
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 26Gov. Preston E. Smith, by opposing a $2,181,125 Federal grant for his state park system and in voking Federal rules to block it, has posed a problem for Acting Secretary of the Interior Fred Russell.

title: OKLAHOMA TO LOSE A SNOOPER AGENCY
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 26 (AP)The controversial Okla homa Office of Inter Agency Coordination, formed secretly two years ago to keep surveil lance on possible dissenters, will be abolished, Gov.elect David Hall has promised.

title: The New Year's Eve Syndrome
description: JOAN and Stanley have been mar ried 16 years, have twin daugh ters, Chrissy and Missy, 11, and have always hated New Year's Eve. Joan has hated New Year's Eve ever since she spent the holidays in Boonton, N. J., with her roommate from Wellesley, and her blind date for the evening, a boor from Princeton, climbed out the living room window when the lights were turned out at midnight ... leaving a frantic trail offootprints plunging across the snowy lawn. Stanley has hated New Year's Eve ever since the year he was 16, and was the only boy in his class not invited to Ivin Blumberg's party in his family's finished basement  finished (he later heard) in mauve and yellow leather to look like a Longchamps restaurant, and the scene of a minor orgy (at least for those days), with couples taking turns in the unfinished laundry room behind the mirrored bar. Though everyone assured Stanley he had been excluded because of jealousy Ivin was an ugly runt, he was tall and handsome  nothing ever oblit erated the humiliation of that evening spent alone in his room while his parents kept the downstairs radio tuned, full blast, to Vincent Lopez playing Auld Lang Syne from the Hotel Taft Grill Room. He vowed he would never spend another New Year's Eve like that  and hasn't. Every New Year's Eve since then (with the exception of one spent in Seoul), has seen Stanley at some festive or uproarious or (on a few rare, happy occasions) orgiastic party. Ostensibly enjoying himself.

title: Tom and Nancy Seaver Discover the Good Life in Journey Across the Country
description: Physically, I was exhausted, mentally, I was exhausted, Tom Seaver recalled: I was ready for a refresher course in life.

title: Black Studies Take Hold, But Face Many Problems
description: Black studies programs have established a hold at many predominantly white colleges and universities since the big student push for them began more than two years ago. But they are still beset by prob lems of financing, staffing and autonomy.

title: Robertson Stems Warrior Comeback by Rallying Bucks to 131111 Triumph
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 26 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks dissi pated all but 5 points of a 20 point lead tonight, but rallied behind the scoring and feeding of Oscar Robertson to rout the San Francisco Warriors, 131 111, in a National Basketball Association name.

title: JOHN HARVEY
description: John Harvey, head of United Talent, Inc., artists manage ment, died Friday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 53 years old and lived at 11 River side Drive.

title: The Continuity
description: The last few grains of sand slide down toward the neck of the hourglass of the year. Another beat in the great rhythm we try to capture with a calendar is at hand and we talk about summaries and new beginnings.

title: SOVIET AND U.A.R. PLEDGE SUPPORT TO PEACE EFFORT
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26The So viet Union and the United Arab Republic, in a communiqu is sued tonight, said they con tinued to support all efforts to achieve a peaceful settlement of the Middle East crisis.

title: KANSAS CRUSHES MISSOURI, 9663
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 26 (UPI)A couple of accurate shooting guards, Bud Stall worth of Kansas and Jack Deviider of Iowa State, sparked their teams into the semifinals of the Big Eight tournament to night with victories over Missouri and Oklahoma, re spectively.

title: BOLD JOEY TAKES SANTA ANITA RACE
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 26 Bold Joey, a 151 shot that had never won a stakes, raced to a fourlength victory today in the 31st running of the $66,100 California Breeders Champion Stakes for 2year olds. It was the openingday feature of the Santa Anita win ter meeting.

title: 20,000 FANS ATTEND ROCK FETE ON COAST
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Dec. 26 (UPI)Twenty thousand young people swarmed over Laguna Beach today, and the hippie participants predicted the Christmas rock festival might go on through New Year's Day.

title: Columbia Quintet on Coast For 4 Games This Week
description: Columbia's basketball team will play four games in Cali fornia this week, during the second week of the school's Christmas vacation.

title: Conversations With Americans
description: This book is so irresponsible that it may help to provoke a responsible inquiry into the question of war crimes and atrocities in Vietnam. Conversations with Americans is a lesson in what happens when a society shuns the examination of a pressing, emotional issue and leaves the answers to a Mark Lane.

title: Bucknell Eleven to Open 10Game Slate on Sept. 18
description: Bucknell University will open its 1971 football season at Lewisburg, Pa., on Sept. 18, when The Citadel comes to Memorial Stadium for the first time.

title: 30th Crosby ProAmateur Set for Monterey Jan. 14
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif. (AP) One of the most popular stops on the pro golf tour is the Bing Crosby proamateur. The 30th annual event will be held over three Monterey Peninsula courses Jan. 14 to 17.

title: Hiring Rate in November At Lowest Since Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) The nation's manufacturers hired factory workers in No vember at the rate of 23 per 1,000 already on the payroll, the Labor Department has re ported. It was the lowest rate since the Kennedy Adminis tration.

title: D. C. Yendells Have Son
description: A son was born Dec. 11 to Mr. and Mrs. David C. Yen dell of New York. Mrs. Yendell is the former Miss Jane Kaplan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Kaplan of New York and Palm Beach, Fla. Her husband is with Crossley Surveys, Inc. The child, who has been named Michael David, is the grand son also of Mr. and Mrs. John Yendell of London.

title: Xerox No Dropout
description: One of the buzz words on Wall Street in the mid1960's was education, as compa nies from various fields pro claimed their intentions of turning a dollar while, at the same time, helping to solve one of the nation's most pressing social prob lems.

title: Koanga Saved by The Music
description: ORIGINALLY the Opera Society of Washington was going to stage Virgil Thomson's Mother of Us All. Difficulties of one kind or another ensued, and the production was scratched. What to substitute? Frank Corsaro, who was to direct Mother, happens to be a Deliuslover. He sug gested Koanga, which had never been staged in the United States  nor, in deed, in many other places since it was composed in 1897.

title: Political Jailings Protested in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 26  A hunger strike by political pris oners offers a rare public glimpse of a, controversial and sensitive issue here. The prisoners have been detained with out trial under sweeping pow ers of an internal security act that in effect suspends, consti tutional rights for those sus pected by the police of being a security threat.

title: NEW ATTACK MADE ON SOLZHENITSYN
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26 (Reuters) Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn, the Nobel Prizewinning Russian writer, was described today by a Soviet newspaper as a rene gade and the author of lam poons on the Soviet people.

title: HAWAIIANS FORM A PROTEST GROUP
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 26 (AP) Islanders of Hawaiian ances try, led by the young, are form ing a protest movement in an effort to reclaim the land they feel is rightfully theirs.

title: Rutgers Lists Morgan State On 11Game Football Slate
Harriette Peper And J. L. Thayer Plan Marriage
description: The engagement of Miss Harriette Ann Peper to James L. Thayer, son of Mrs. T. Redmond Thayer of Asheville, N. C., and the late Mr. Thayer, has been announced by the prospective bride's mother, Mrs. Franklyn Henry Peper of Brooklyn and Manchester, Vt. A wedding next summer is planned.

title: 3 African Nations in Accord
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse) Representatives of the Congo and two other former Belgian colonies, Rwanda and Burundi, have agreed to extend the life of three joint commissions. The commissions cover politics and law; economics, finance and technology, and culture. They were set up in 1969.

title: STARS GAIN 11 TIE ON PARISE'S GOAL
A Diplomat's Wife Who's a Whirlwind
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y.In her teens Cristina Aristegui used to race her sports car through Caracas, and the Venezuelan police would groan about CatiraThe Blond One.

title: Spain:
description: MADRIDThe 31yearold regime of General Francisco Franco marshaled its de fenses last week to fight off the most serious political danger it has known in many years. It was an energetic but wintry effort, like that of an old man up at night chasing rats in his attic. The real threat was not simply the Basques, nor the opposi tion, nor the small band of men who kidnapped a West German consul. It came mainly from within. It was the decay and divisions of old age.

title: INFLATION KILLS PEACE DIVIDEND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) The socalled peace dividend, the billions of dollars the Nixon Administration had hoped could be channeled back into health and education programs when the Vietnam war wound down, has proved to be a myth in a wave of inflation.

title: MILTARY TO CURB USE OF HERBICIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  The White House announced today a program for an order ly, yet rapid phaseout of the herbicide operations in Viet nam.

title: White a Hit for Buckeyes
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 26 (UPI) Jan White, a tight end, was singled out for praise today by Woody Hayes, Ohio State foot ball coach, after the Buckeyes went through a long hitting workout. Hayes said White, a senior, had had 10 particularly good workouts in a row and had been working very hard in preparation for the Rose Bowl game against Stanford.

title: Britain Says Breath Tests Are Reducing Road Deaths
description: LONDON, Dec. 26 (AP)  Breath tests for British motor ists suspected of drinking are cutting the road accident toll here, the Department of En vironment has reported.

title: Landry, Cowboys Coach, Lauds Doomsday Defense for Its Best Game Ever
description: DALLAS, Dec. 26George Andrie kissed Jethro Pugh, Bob Lilly lighted a long cigar, Steve Kiner wondered whatever hap pened to Lem Barney and Tom Landry produced a string of superlatives about The Dooms day Defensee.

title: Soviet Lifter Surpasses His 3 World Records
