description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26, Reu tersVasily Alekseyev of the Soviet Union, the world and European champion, im proved his world records for the press, jerk and total lift today in the superheavy weight division in the Soviet championships in Oneprope trovsk.

title: Buildings in the Bronx Battle to Survive
Penguins Shatter Bruins 10Game Winning Streak With 4to2 Triumph
900 Complaints Over Heat Made to City, a Decrease
description: Despite the ending of the strike by fueloil deliverymen last Tuesday night, more than 900 complaints about lack of heat poured into the Depart ment of Rent and Housing Maintenance yesterday.

title: Van Lier Sparks Royals
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 26 (UPI) Norm Van Lier, who had 29 points for the game, led Cincin nati from an 11point deficit at the start of the second half to a 130118 victory tonight over the Atlantic Hawks.

title: Whisperjet
description: WASHINGTON. THERE are riches under those rags. Beauty is thinskinned. A penny saved is a hedge against inflation. A man has but one life to give for his country's police action. All good things come to those who bide their time and do not bite their nails.

title: Critic's Choice: Ten Best Films of 1970
description: I HAVE a friend who appears to be quite sane in every respect but one: towards the end of January he starts compiling his list of the 10 best movies of the year, which isn't really due, technically, for another 11 months. The list is written on a piece of threebyfiveinch notepaper that is then folded so that, when it slips into his wallet, it's about the size of a very thick, conventional stamp.

title: Trail in Laos Vulnerable To Attacks, Moorer Says
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff has declared that if North Vietnam attempts a largescale offensive this spring in Cambodia or in the southern region of South Vietnam, one possible course of action for the South Vietnamese would be to stage a ground thrust across the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos to cut the enemy's supply lines.

title: Cubs Sign Collegian
description: RUMFORD, Me., Dec. 26 (AP) Tom McBean, a pitcherout fielder at Husson College, signed a contract today with the Chicago Cubs.

title: JOSEPH DE LINOIS
description: Joseph de Linois, a veteran radio announcer and the creator of two French Hour pro grams in this country, died of a heart attack Wednesday at his home, 200 West 54th Street. He was 77 years old.

title: What's Opened in the Theater?
description: COMMUNE, a play developed by The Performance Group and its director, Richard Schechner, got mixed re views from two critics, un favorable from three. Mel Gussow: Scheduler is antiliterary and since Commune has no text, one anticipates it as a great liberating force on Sahechner's theatrical im agination. Because of thepotency and contemporaneity of the subject mat ter and its suitability for environmental theater, one is necessarily interested. It is not in its intent, but in its conception and per formance that Commune is disappointing. The play is compiled and arranged from various sources and group improvisations. Pre sumably, with inspiration, such pieces  acted, danced, physicalized could be transformed into something whole, a collage, the play about Middle America by the children of Middle America  no cop outs, no kidding, that Scheduler has promised. The truth is that beneath the theorizing, the envir onmental aspects, the audi ence encounter, Commune is not very revealing about communal life (or for that matter, life today), and notvery experimental as thea ter. For Walter Kerr, see Page 1.

title: Woman Envoy to Ceylon
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Dec 26 (AP)Yugoslavia has named a woman, Olga Strujic, as Am bassador to Ceylon, which has a woman Prime Minister. The United States appointed Fran ces Willis to a similar post shortly after Mrs. Sirimavo Bandaranaiko became head of the government once before, in 1960.

title: PEKING'S CABINET ADDS AN OFFICER
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 26The military complexion of the Chi nese Communist Government has been advanced by the ap pointment of a littleknown military man, Pai Hsiangkuo, as Minister of Foreign Trade.

title: NATHANIEL BRAUN
description: Nathaniel Braun, a lawyer and law reporter, died of a heart attack Friday at Lebanon Hospital in the Bronx. He was 67 years old and lived at 308 West 104th Street.

title: Seat Belts on Railroads Urged by Safety Board
description: The National Transportation Safety Board has recommended that the Federal Railroad Ad ministration study the possibil ity of incorporating some kind or restraining device, such as seat belts, in passenger trains.

title: Pacers Beat Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH; Dec. 26 (AP) Indiana took advantage of poor shooting by the Floridians and the Pacers rolled to a 11592 victory tonight.

title: Jolly Heath, Student, Wed
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Dec. 26 Miss. Elizabeth Jolly Heath, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest H. Heath Jr., was married in the Unitarian Church here today to Henry H. Rossbacher, a lawyer with the New York firm of Mudge, Rose, Guthrie & Alexander. The Rev. Deane Starr performed the cere mony, which was written by the couple.

title: Rough Riders in the Senate
description: The disgraceful jamming of legislative business in the closing days of the 91st Congress inevitably increases the clamor for reforms in Congressional machinery. Most of the proposed changes are familiar: an end or at least a modification of seniority, more democracy in the committees, fairer representation on the crucial confer ence committees between the two houses and an end to the Senate filibuster. But there is one procedural vice that gets attention only from scholars of the subject, though it does as much harm as any.

title: 4 G.I.'s Wounded in Truce
description: SAIGON, Dec. 26Christmas Day for American troops here was militarily not much differ ent from the preceding weeks of relative quiet on the battle field.

title: Poland:
description: GDANSK, Poland  There are new faces, but what does that mean? It remains to be seen. Thus did a citizen comment last week on the government changes made in the wake of the antiGovern ment violence that started in this snowcovered port and spread to other Polish cities.

title: The Nation
description: An association created to make New York City more livable and to encourage businesses to locate here decided last week to at tempt a hardnosed assessment of what might happen to the city if its police, fire and sanitation forces initiate job actions when present union contracts expire en New Year's Eve, just four days from now.

title: Antoine de SaintExupry
description: On the morning of July 31, 1944, two weeks before the Allied land ings on the French Riviera, Antoine de SaintExupry vanished on a re connaissance mission in the skies somewhere between Corsica and the Rhone Valley. He had been a pilot for a long time; he was a writer, and a good deal of a philosopher.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: To observers of trends in our industry, a noteworthy development has been the gradual redefinition of the role of programing as an agency function, and partic ularly of its relationship to the media function.

title: Cigarette Makers, Facing TV Ban, Try New Ways of Advertising
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Cigarette commercials go off the air after Jan. 1 but the to bacco industry is using all of its marketing ingenuity to fill the void.

title: UNITAS CONNECTS
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 26De spite dehumanizing weather that produced a zerodegree chill factor, the Baltimore Colts used a familiar formula for a virtually perfect 170 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals to day in an American Confer ence semifinal playoff game. The formula was Johnny Unitas and defense.

title: Cavaliers Gain 4th Victory
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (UPI) John Johnson, a rookie, tossed in his season high of 33 points today to spark the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 120107 victory over the Buffalo Braves in a National Basketball Association game.

title: A Frustrated Caseworker
description: Alan Newmark, had never seen Helena's father before he walked into the Clinton welfare center of the Depart ment of Social. Services at 103 Clinton Street in Brooklyn one recent morning.

title: San Diego School Chief Out
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 26 (AP) Jack Hornback, after less than two years as superintendent of San Diego schools, is giving up the post for personal and compelling reasons. He had resigned six months ago ina disagreement with the Board of Education over financing special minority education pro grams but later withdrew the resigration. He was hired Feb. 1, 1969, from New York State's South Huntington School Dis trict No. 13.

title: Rome Cabinet Seeks Repeal Of Law on Migratory Birds
description: ROME, Dec. 26 (UPI)The Government confessed to a blunder this week and asked Parliament to repeal an 11 monthold law permitting the use of nets for capturing small migratory birds.

title: Nuremberg And Vietnam
description: For a long time Americans refused even to consider the mounting evi dence of war crimes in Vietnam. When Bertrand Russell organized an International War Crimes Tribunal in 1967, the energies of liberals and conservatives alike were devoted to discrediting its evidence, although the Russell proceedings provide a generally reliable account of the criminal side of the American war effort in Vietnam. Similarly, when adistinguished group of religious lea ders, including John Bennett, Abra ham Heschel, William Sloan Coffin Jr., sponsored and endorsed a com pilation of news accounts of war crimes in Vietnam, they could not find a recognized publisher to put out the book. It was finally published in 1968 by the obscure Turnpike Press under the title of In the Name of America, but the book, despite its explosive contents and careful ex position, went unnoticed and un reviewed.

title: Hawks Triumph, 42
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia Dec. 26 (UPI)Pit Martin's 14th goal of the season midway through the second period to night proved decisive as the Chicago Black Hawks posted a 42 victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Congress:
description: WASHINGTONThe law re quires Congress to decide how much money the Federal Gov ernment can spend and which programs it should spend it on during each fiscal year befor?? it begins on July 1. When Con gress sulked out of the Capitol last Tuesday night for a cheer less Christmas recess, it had still not decided on about $90 billion worth of such spending for the fiscal year that was al ready half over.

title: Donors to the Neediest Cases Often Find a Choice Difficult
description: Sirs, wrote the donor to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, how impossible to select which. . . .

title: Samuel Beckett Poet And Critic
description: Samuel Beckett's poems are few, splendid and little known. The verse of a novelist or playwright is seldom justly celebrated, no matter how re markable it isD. H. Lawrence's is major poetry, for example, as in asmaller way Malcolm Lowry's verse is at least as good as his fiction. James Joyce, on The other hand, locked all the fragilities of verse into an antechamber of his poetic man sion, and it may be the presence of Joyce near Beckett's early career that has led critics to minimize the quality of Beckett's poems.

title: Cambodian Clash Reported
description: KOMPONG CHAM, Cambodia, Dec. 26 (AP)Cambodian and North Vietnamese forces were reported to have clashed across the Mekong River from this pro vincial capital today. Field offi cers said the fighting began with an exchange of fire be tween rival patrols picking up their dead. It was the sixth consecutive day of fighting on the river, 50 miles northeast of Phnompenh. Casualties were said to be heavy on both sides.

title: 10 Debutantes Bow in Scarsdale
description: At the 16th annual Holly Ball at the Scarsdale (N.Y.) Golf Club last night, 10 daughters of club members made their formal bows to society. Mrs. William J. Mc Hugh was chairman for the event. Her daughters, Aileen and Maureen, were among the debutantes, who wore long white gowns and carried holly and red carna tions with red velvet stream ers.

title: BOYER'S 2 GOALS LEAD PITTSBURGH
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26 (UPI) Wally Boyer scored two sec ondperiod power play goals to lead the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 42 victory over Boston to night, snapping the Bruins 10 game winning streak.

title: Queen Elizabeth Listed As Ohio Tax Delinquent
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (AP) Queen Elizabeth II is listed as a delinquent taxpayer in Cuyahoga County.

title: Brownsville's Gift To Cowboy Garb
description: NORTH HOLLYWOOD, Calif  Nor man Norell? This is nothing against him, said Nudie, the cowboys coutu rier, but, in my opinion, his design is nothing. A shoulder seam. A side seam. Maybe shorter. Maybe longer.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: What happens to high price, highstyle, name designer apparel that sells for $300 to $3,000 when re tail business is suffering from an economic slowdown?

title: Florida Teacher Tries to Keep Job Lost in Fight on Flag Oath
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 26Leroy Bates, a black social studies teacher at Henry D. Perry school in Hollywood, Fla., refused to recite the Pledge of Allegiance to the United States flag.

title: Martin Liguori Jr. To Wed Miss Jones
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Dec. 26Mr. and Mrs. Edwin E. Jones have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Carol Ann Jones, to Martin William Liguori Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Liguori of Cedar Grove. The future bridegroom, a cham pion in the mile run, was re cently named an adviser to President Nixon's Council on Physical Fitness.

title: Koanga HighClass Minstrel Show?
description: WASHINGTON, D.C. THERE are actually two events taking place concurrently when Frederick Delius's opera about slavery, Koanga, is presented. The first is a rather handsomesounding oratorio full of pleasant passages sonic ally equidistant, perhaps, from Wagner, Verdi, and Grieg. The other is a well meant but illconceived little play adapt ed by librettist C. F. Keary from George Washington Cable's Louisiana novel, The Grandissimes. In part because it was

title: After the Holidays
description: FLOWERING plants re ceived as Christmas gifts will thrive quite well if they receive a little tender loving care.

title: 2 Tankers Offered for Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Two World War II tankers, now at Campanh Bay, Vietnam, are being offered for sale by the Maritime Administration for scrapping in the United States or friendly foreign coun tries. They are now used as floating power plants.

title: In the Heyday of the Paris Avant Garde
Australia Seeks More Jobs for Women
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 26 The Government has urged employers to make more kinds of jobs available to women and to provide more opportunities for women workers at the ex ecutive level.

title: the traveler's world
description: THIS was an interesting, strange, often exciting year in the world of travel, progress being made on many horizons, retrogressions on others, but, all in all, another eventful 12 months in an industry that does not stand still very long. Herewith, a re capitulation of some of the things that happened in tourism in 1970:

title: End of Prison Strike Sought
description: WALLA WALLA, Wash., Dec. 26 (UPI)The warden of Walla Walla Prison asked 1,300 strik ing inmates to name represen tatives to discuss with him their demands, including a plea forthe privilege of growing long hair and beards. The men have been locked in their cells since Tuesday, when they refused to shave and complained of being dehumanized by prison ad ministrators.

title: Peaceful Sea Beds
description: THE first United Nations postage stamps of 1971 will be issued Jan. 25 commemorat ing Peaceful Uses of the SeaBed. There will be two stamps, one in United States currency, 6cent in blue; and the other in Swiss currency, 30centime in green. There will be 2,400,000 produced of the 6c stamp, and 2,000,000 of the 30centime stamp, which has an equiva lent value in U. S. currency of 7 cents.

title: The Prisoner Issue
description: Secretary of State Rogers spoke to the point describing as a contemptible maneuver Hanoi's action in summoning representatives of Senators Kennedy and Fulbright to Paris and handing them a previously known list of American war prisoners.

title: Great Bars I've Known, Or E Why my Konvoluted memoirs may seem Looped
description: HE would be a presumptuous man who could define the moment of the arrival of the New Year, since everything would depend on whether he chanced to be Chinese, Jewish, AngloSaxon Christian or, like myself, a pagan Scotsman for whom it is of ancestral importance and inescap bly bound to the ritual of the lifted elbow. It is not our day of atonement; it is the day for which we subsequently, atone.

title: BACKERS RALLYING FOR CITY PLANNER
description: Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx urged re appointment by Mayor Lindsay of Planning Commissioner Bev erly Moss Spatt yesterday as vital to the survival of the city.

title: A's to Meet Tokyo Orions Twice in Preseason Games
Cyprus and Greek Islands Found To Have Links 3,500 Years Ago
description: Archeologists digging on a re mote hill in Cyprus have found evidence of commercial ties be tween Cyprus and the Greek is lands as early as 1500 B.C., ac cording to a Columbia Univer sity expert.

title: Mrs. Eisenhower Found in Poll To Be Most Admired Woman
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 26 For the second consecutive year, Mrs. Dwight D. Eisen hower tops the 1970 list of women most admired by the American people, according to the Poll.

title: Theismann, a Small Schoolboy, Now the Big Man of Notre Dame
description: Joe Theismann, the big man who has led Notre Dame into two straight Cot ton Bowl games and has top pled Irish records in his three years at South Bend, was originally considered too small by the man who recruited him. This disclo sure came this week from Peter Lusardi Jr., the former chief recruiter for Notre Dame in the New Jersey area who is now operating out of Hallandale, Fla.

title: On Building Own Home: A Rebuttal
description: Loring Mandel evidently had a frustrating time desigriing and build ing his house in a Long Island valley. He wrotein a tone of anger under cut by resignationof astronomical cost, inexplicable delay, shoddy work manship and material of poor quality. Our experience was different.

title: A Paraplegic's Legacy
description: Twentyfive years ago I re ceived a letter from a young veteran that was profound and deeply moving. The writer was only 19 years old. He had bro ken his back in the Pacific and was one of the first paraplegics to be treated in the veterans hospital program. He weighed only 70 pounds because he ate practically nothing, remarking, Why should I.

title: Growing Up Liberal In Atlanta
description: FEW people would argue that racial equality has yet been accomplished in the South, or anywhere else in the United States, but the racial progress that has been made seems incredible when you go back and look at the situation as it stood at the end of World War II.

title: For Queen and Country
description: LONDONTen gnarled and knotted men, whose straining and heaving in the wrest ling ring entertain British audiences and televison viewers, have been enlisted by a Government department to persuade oil rich Kuwaitis to spend their money on British goods.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: INTEREST RATES declined again as Chase Manhattan Bank cut its prime lending rate for the third time in six weeks. Other major banks followed reduction to 63/4 per cent from 7 per cent; prior to first cut last month the rate was 71/2 per cent . . . Federal Reserve Bank of New York moved to keep Government securities market operating in New York in face of possible withdrawal by major banks unable to obtain insurance.

title: Pistons Down Bulls, 117114
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (UPI) Erwin Mueller sank a basket in the final minute of play to put the Detroit Pistons ahead of the Chicago Bulls tonight and Dave Bing followed with three straight field goals to seal a 117114 victory.

title: Japanese Keeps Title
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP)Ja pan's Koichi Okada knocked out Yun SukOk of South Korea in the 11th round of a sched uled 12round bout in defense of his Oriental junior feather weight boxing championship tonight. Each fighter weighed 121 pounds.

title: Suns Triumph, 115103
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 26 (AP) The Phoenix Suns took an early 18point lead tonight and went on to defeat the Portland Trail Blazers, 115103.

title: ROBERT W. PRESSING
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 26 Robert W. Pressing, former vice president of the Linde Di vision of Union Carbide Corpo ration of New York City, died yesterday at Stamford Hospi tal. He was 52 years old and lived at 52 Round Hill Drive.

title: Worldly Prophets
description: A weighty assortment of 6,500 prophets, diagnosti cians and wouldbe scientists, otherwise known as econo mists, is converging on De troit today. The annual con vention of the Allied Social Science Associations, an um brella for seven organizations of which the largest and most venerable is the American Economic Association, will not be a jubilant rite.

title: U.S. Studies DoubleDuty Moon Craft
description: With Lunakhod ??, Russia's automated lunar vehicle stir ring new debate on the issue of manned versus unmanned space exploration, the Project Apollo office in Houston is taking a serious look at a pro posal that would take advan tage of both techniques.

title: Glenn Plans Fund Drive
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (UPI) John Glenn Jr., the first American to orbit the earth, plans to hold a fundraising gala here next March to help settle $163,343 in debts. He amassed the debt in his un successful primary election bid for a seat in the Senate.

title: Miss Kopman Bride of A. R. Tomkinson
description: Miss Edythe H. Kopman managing editor of Weight Watchers magazine, was married here yesterday after noon to A. Russell Tomkin son, a vice president and ac count supervisor with Jamian Advertising here, The Rev. Dr. Carl Soule, a Methodist minister, and Rabbi Martin Zion performed the ceremony at the Church Center for the United Nations.

title: SUFFOLK IS SUED IN ECOLOGY TEST
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 26 A citizens group has brought suit against Suffolk County, its 10 towns and 29 incorporated villages to block the further development of their natural resources . . . until ecologically sophisticated, environmentally responsible criteria for such de velopment have been estab lished.

title: Amelia P. Milliken Will Marry Marsh M. Rowell Jr. in March
description: WINNETKA, Ill., Dec. 26 Mr. and Mrs. John F. Milliken have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Amelia Porter Milliken, to Marsh Mason Rowell Jr., a commercial photographer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rowell of Northbrook.

title: Israel's Aid Needs for 1972 Put at $500Million
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26. Senator Henry M. Jackson, sponsor of the $500million mil itary credit for Israel about to be approved by Congress, has forecast that Israel will need an equivalent amount in 1972.

title: Catherine McKenna Wed to R. O. Hills
description: The marriage of Miss Catherine McKenna, daugh ter of Mrs. Lawrence J. Mc Kenna of Douglaston, Queens, and the late Mr. McKenna, to Robert Oelze Hills, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry S. Hills of Wading River, L. I., took place here yesterday morn ing.

title: Massachusetts Golf Listed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The Massachusetts Golf Association said today that the state ama teur championship would be held July 7 at the Taconic Golf Club in Williamstown as part of the host's 75th anniversary.

title: Challenge to the States
description: The increasingly severe financial squeeze on state governments has evoked justifiable pleas to Washington for a prompt start on Federalstate revenuesharing. Governor Rockefeller has redoubled his efforts to arouse the White House and Congress to the nature of the fi nancial crisis which threatens the entire federal structure of government in this country. There are encouraging signs that at least in the White House the response has been positive.

title: Congressman Is Told Hanoi Gave P. O. W.s Special Holiday Privileges
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 26 (AP)  A United States Congressman said to day that North Vietnamese officials had told him Ameri can prisoners of war were allowed to participate in sports and had been given special privileges this Christ mas season.

title: Who's That Cowboy? Bill Cosby!
description: BLL COSBY is saying goodbye to the small screen and hello to the big screen. The TV star is all prepared to make his film debut in Man and Boy, an original script by Harry Essex and Oscar Saul, which Cosby's own company, Jem min, Inc., is financing at a budget of about $1million. Filming will start Jan. 11 on location near Phoenix.

title: TAXFREE PROPERTY INCREASES IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec., 26 (UPI) The value of taxexempt prop erty in New Jersey increased $3million this year to a total in excess of $9billion, the New Jersey Taxpayers Association reported today.

title: Zambians to Hang Tusks
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 26 (AP)A parliamentary commit tee has voted to hang elephant tusks on the walls of the Na tional Assembly building to enhance Zambian tradition.

title: Mrs. Shotwell Wed To Hugh Halsell 3d
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Dec. 26 Mrs. Jean Barker Shotwell, Widow of Capt. James Hunter Shotwell, U.S.A., and daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Cleveland Barker of Southport, was married at noon today to Hugh Halsell 3d son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Halsell of Greens Farms.

title: Dance
description: IT was more than two years ago when I first saw the Batsheva Dance Company from Israel  and I think I fell in love with them from their first jump. It was in Holland, I recall, and the company, then a mere 4yearold strip ling, was enjoying its first triumphant European tour.

title: Mercury:
description: There is no cause for alarm, the Food and Drug Administration said last week, but nonetheless it an nounced plans to remove from grocery shelves nearly every brand of frozen sword fish in the country.

title: Alix C. MacCallum Plans Wedding
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 26Miss Alix Chase MacCal lum, greatgranddaughter of Franz August Assmann, a founder of the Continental Can Company, plans to be married in February to James H. Martinsen of Bridgeport, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. C. Martinsen of Sarnia, Ontario.

title: Beame Says Scofflaw Trap Is Falling Short of Goal
description: The city's Parking Violation Bureau, established last July as the computerized scourge of scofflaws, has fallen seriously short of expectations in col lecting traffic fines, Controller Abraham D. Beame reported yesterday.

title: Harry James Hits a High Note for Montclair State
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Dec. 26Harry James, the key man of the Montclair State College basketball team that began its season with five victories, is very rugged, aggressive and fiery competitor, according to Coach Ollie Gelston.

title: Al Davis Will Be Speaker At Football Writers Dinner
description: MILWAUKEE (UPI)  Al Davis, former commissioner of the old American Football League, will be the main speaker Feb. 28 at the third annual dinner of the Wisconsin chapter of the Professional Football Writers Association of America.

title: Kissinger Says Kidnappers Should Not Get Concessions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's assistant for national security affairs, believes that no concessions should be made to political kidnappers.

title: These Days, You Have to Be Ill to Get Into. Doctors Hospital
description: When Tom Ewell, the actor, was look ing for an apartment on East End Avenue some years ago he went into a building that he thought would be just right and asked if there was vacancy. He learned he was in Doctors Hospital. That shows how little the structure between 87th and 88th Streets looks like an institution.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Uris Buildings Corpor ation, returning to residential construction in the city for the first tithe in two decades, is planning to build an apart ment development near the East River.

title: SHOEMAKER CITED BY SPORTS LODGE
description: Willie Shoemaker, who suf fered serious injury in the 1968 and 1969 racing seasons, and finally triumphed over physical adversity to become the world's leading jockey in horse races won, will be honored by Sports Lodge of B'nai rith for high principle and achievement in sports in 1970 at the organiza tion's annual Bill Corum Me morial Awards Dinner on Sat urday, Jan. 23 in the Hotel Roosevelt. Shoemaker is the first awards winner announced by Sports Lodge.

title: L.S.U. Five Defeats DePaul, 91 to 72, As Sanders Stars
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Louisiana State's 6 foot9inch center, Al Sanders; got 29 points tonight to lead the Tigers to a 9172 firstround victory over DePaul University in the 35th AllCollege basket ball tournament.

title: So. Carolina, Providence Score Easily in Festival
Ontario Council to Advise On LitterPollution Control
description: TORONTO; Dec. 26 (Canadian Press)A 14member council to advise the Ontario govern ment on measures to, control pollution arising from litter and packaging has been an nounced by George Kerr, Min ister of Energy and Resources Management.

title: BALTIMORE GETS STRICT AIR CODE
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 26  Dr. Neil Solomon, Maryland's Sec retary of Health and Mental Hygiene, has signed air pollu tion regulations for the metro politan Baltimore area that state officials consider among the most restrictive in the na tion.

title: Welfare Caseworkers Find Reforms Short of Goals
description: The city's effort to free welfare caseworkers from smothering paperwork so they can do pure social work is falling far short of expecta tions, according to many of those involved in the pro gram.

title: ManChild
description: This is a book with a striking cover and an intriguing title but by neither, unhappily, can the book be judged. The argument that David Jonas and Doris Kleina psychiatrist and science writerwant to make isthat in biological terms man is not progressing but regressing to a more infantile state. In their view this is a good thing which may result in less war, more sensitivity, better sex and yet less population because of the reduction of the sexual and mater nal instincts. Con ?? the Fourth Reichwill cuddle us, and we will abandon technology, play more games, think more intellectual thoughts, write more, do more art, and pop through other creative out lets.

title: HomeCanning Boom
description: MUNCIE, Ind.  When F. Edmund Ball, now chairman of the Ball Corporation's ex ecutive committee, went to Asheville, N. C., not too long ago, to preside at the open ing of another Ball canning jar plant he was told that his company's primary prod uct was no stranger to North Carolinians.

title: Minority Program Helps Negro Earn Law Degree
description: DECATUR, Ga., Dec. 26 (AP) Marvin N. Clark, a 28year old Negro, has received a law degree, the first minority group representative to gradu ate under a program sponsored by the American Bar Associa tion, law schools and various other legal groups.

title: J. Edgar Hooper Does It Again!
LAUREL HANDICAP TO TOWZIE TYKE
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 26 Hickory Tree Stable's Towzie Tyke won his fourth straight race today, taking the $22,550 Capital Handicap by 1 lengths over a fastclosing Never Wink at Laurel race course.

title: LEEDS INCREASES LEAD IN SOCCER
description: LONDON, Dec. 26, (Reuters)  Leeds United increased its leead in the English Soccer League First Division to 3 points today with a 30 victory over Newcastle United. Arsenal, its nearest rival, was held to a scoreless tie by Southampton.

title: No Deaths at Hospital
description: ROME, Ga., Dec. 26 (UPI) Battey State Hospital, founded 24 years ago as a treatment center for tuberculosis, has re corded its first deathfree month in history. Dr. Raymond Corpe superintendent of the hospital also said that the number of patients had been but from 1,957 in January, 1953, to the

title: Stanford Holds 2 Drills
description: LUNG BEACH, Calif., Dec, 26 (UPI)  Stanford's football team had its final twoaday workout today in preparation for the Rose Bowl game witl Ohio State next Friday. Coach John Ralston worked his tean for 1 hour 15 minutes in the morning in sweat clothes. In the afternoon, the Indians drilled for 1 hour 35 minutes in full gear.

title: CITY MUSEUM ADDS TRUSTEES TO BOARD
description: The election of Mrs. Edwin I. Hilson, Thomas Carhart Amory and Ralph Ellison as members of the board of trustees of the Museum of the City of New York has been announced by Louis Auchincloss, museum president.

title: . . . And What Four Mothers Are Trying to Do About It
description: THE sky stretches across my win dow, the dirty gray of a subway wall. The wind is making the storm windows rattle like a poorly anchored pair of teeth, and I curl up tighter inside the womb constructed of two blankets, an afghan and the night's collection of body heat There is a tug at my elbow. I open an eye and see the face of my 4yearold, all wideawake shining skin.

title: Shyness to Cost $150 a Day
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26 (UPI) The city may lose $150 a day because Mayor Peter F. Fla herty was camera shy. Mr. Flaherty refused to be photo graphed while accepting a $1million, check from the Port Authority for removal of the city's street car tracks. In turn, the authority said it would keep the check until the Dec. 31 deadline, depriving the city of $150 a day in interest.

title: Voting:
description: Few people are as electorally weak as young people.Rich ard M. Scammon, public opin ion analyst.

title: KOREAN PARTY RULE REVAMPED BY PARK
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 26 President Chung Hee Park reshuffled the leadership of the ruling Democratic Republican party today in preparation for next spring's presidential and National Assembly elections.

title: HAYES WILL LECTURE AT COACHES CLINIC
description: Woody Hayes, whose unde feated Ohio State team will face Stanford in the Rose Bowl on New Year's Day, has been named the first of 10 coaches who will conduct classes at the 24th Annual National Football Clinic in Atlantic City, March 22 to 25.

title: Sled Dogs to Race Six Miles on Long Island Today
description: sled dog racing devotees won't have to go to the frozen tundra of the north to watch races. Nor will they have to wait for the world championships at Laconia, N. H., in February. For otday, at 11 A.M., the Siberian Husky Club of Greater New York will conduct races

title: Lillian Board, British Runner Who Won Olympic Medal, Dies
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Dec. 26 (UPI)Lillian Board, a 22yearold British track star, died today in Munich Univer sity Clinic, where she had been undergoing treatment for in testinal cancer, a clinic spokes man said.

title: Buccaneer and Apollo Lead Fleet in 630  Mile SydneytoHobart Ocean Race
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  The 73foot New Zealand cutter Buccaneer and the western Australian yacht Apollo were leading the fleet tonight in the annual Sydney toHobart race.

title: U.S. Women Down So. Africa and Gain Semifinal in Tennis
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 27 (AP)The United States rallied from a 10 deficit today and moved into the semifinals of the Federation Cup women's tennis tournament with a 21 decision over South Africa.

title: Bail to Be Set for Seattle 7
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 27 (UPI)  A Federal judge who sentenced the Seattle 7 con spiracy defendants to jail for contempt is excpected to set $25,000 ball for each of them tomorrow by order of an ap peals court. District Court Judge George Boldt had earlier denied bail to the defendants, who were sentenced during their trial on charges of con spiring to damage the United States Courthouse in Seattle during a demonstration Feb. 17.

title: STEEL SHIPMENTS EXPECTED TO RISE
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 27Steel producers expect shipments to rise by 5 million tons in the first quarter of 1971.

title: Three Die in Apartment Fire
description: WALPOLE, Mass.; Dec. 27 (AP)Three persons died today when fire swept through an apartment over a garage. The police identified the victims as Kathy Parmenter, 20 years old, of Norwood; Richard Galligan, 23, of Canton, and Alfred Sa wizky, 25, one of the renters of the apartment. The other renter, Douglas Artman, 24, suffered burns and smoke inhalation.

title: Strike at Israeli Airports
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 27 (Reuters) A strike of Civil Aviation Authority employes closed all Israeli airports for one hour this morning. The workers were protesting a Transport Ministry order that senior aviation per sonnel were not to serve on workers committees.

title: Bazley Takes Run, Knifton Wins Walk at Asbury Park
description: ASHBURY PARK, N.J., Dec. 27 (AP)  Bob Bazley of the Shore Athletic Club won the 5,000meter run and John Knif ton of the New York Athletic Club won the 10mile walk in the seventh annual Asbury Park Boardwalk Polar Bear Track Meet today.

title: MilitaryAid Offers By South Africans To Lisbon Reported
description: CAPETOWN, Dec. 27The South African Government has at least twice offered concrete military aid, to the Portuguese authorities in their wars against insurgents, according to sources in Mozambique.

title: Barbara I. McIlroy Is Married In Garden City to Lade Moore
description: GARDEN CITY,. L I., Dec. 27Miss Barbara, Jane Mc Ilroy and Lorle Albert Moore, son of Mr. and Mt. Albert James Moore of Muttontown, were married here this after noon. The Rev. Joseph E. McGinnis performed the cere mony in the Episcopal Ca thedral of the Incarnation.

title: Garden Wins Out as Site of AliFrazier Heavyweight Title Bout March 8
description: The muchdiscussed site and date of the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier fight for the world heavyweight championship are reported to be Madison Square Garden on Monday, March 8.

title: 30% of New Power Plants In 71 Expected to Use Coal
description: The association said that the electric utilities had notified the Federal Power Commission of plans to install 35,759,995 kilowatts of new generating capacity in 1971.

title: Rep. Rivers Survives New Heart Stoppagel
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 27 (AP)Representative L. Mendel Rivers, Democrat a South Carolina, suffered series of heart stoppages to day, but heart function has been restored, a University of Alabama Hospital spokes man said.

title: Garden LineUps
description: FIRST GAME

title: Miss CM Wed to Vincent Reel, Her American Coach
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec: 27 Chi Chang, who became one of the world's top women track stars, was married to her American coach, Vincent Reel, in a simple Christian ceremony today.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: EGYPTIAN LEADER GIVES CONDITIONS FOR PEACE ACCORD
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23President Anwar elSadat of the United Arab Republic, in an interview with The New York Times, has for the first time defined his nation's conditions for peace with Israel in the Middle East war. They are as follows:

title: TV: Hansel and Gretel in New N.E.T. Production
description: Humperdinck's Hansel and Gretel is, allegedly, a chil dren's classic especially suit able for presentation during the Christmas holiday season, and last night a new produc tion of it was shown over WNET, Channel 13, by Na tional Education Television with the aid of a $50,000 grant from the International Business Machines Corpora tion.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 28, 1970

title: LASTSECOND BASKET GIVES PACE VICTORY
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 27  An eightfoot jump shot by Dale Wright with one second left gave Pace College of New York a 7371 upset vic tory over Montclair State, the defending champion, in the opening round of the annual New Jersey Kiwanis basketball tournament tonight.

title: MRS. MORRIS SIEGEL
description: Mrs. Claire L. Siegel, wife of Dr. Morris Siegel, a wellknown Rockland County veterinarian, died yesterday after a long ill ness in the Harkness Pavilion of the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. She was 55 years old and lived in Nyack, N. Y.

title: Jewish Appeal Names Two
description: The appointment of Meshu lam Riklis and Laurence A. Tisch as general chairmen of the $150million campaign by the United Jewish Appeal of Greater New York was an nounced yesterday. Morris L. Levinson, president of the ap peal, said the drive would start at a dinner on Feb. 24 at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Bus Burns in Pennsylvania, But 45 Riders Are Unhurt
description: BEDFORD, Pa., Dec. 27 (UPI) About 45 persons escaped in jury early today when the chartered bus in which they were riding burned 15 miles west of here on the Pennsyl vania Turnpike.

title: TELLER DEPLORES SECRET RESEARCH
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27Between noisy interruptions by antiwar demonstrators, Dr. Edward H. Teller, the nuclear physicist who is often called the father of the hydrogen bomb, advo cated at a meeting of scientists here today the abolition of se crecy surrounding much of the, nation's scientific research, in eluding work in nuclear science.

title: Tremors in Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Two mod erately strong earth tremors today shook the central Yugo slav city of Banja Luka, 150 miles west of here, the Yugo slav press agency Tanyug re ported. There were no casual ties or damage, the agency said.

title: Specialists Split on Role of Population in Pollution and Crime
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27Four specialista divided today on the role of overpopulation in corruption of the environ ment, the rise in crime and the increase, in per capita cost of government.

title: U.S. Sextet Beats Poles
description: ZUG, Switzerland, Dec. 27 (AP)The University of Minne sota hockey team upset the Polish National team, 21, to night in the first game of a tour of Switzerland.

title: Molecular Biology in Hanoi
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass??My first en counter with Vietnamese scientists oc curred within a few hours after ar riving in Hanoi. As we were crossing the Long Bridge, perhaps the most heavily bombed target around Hanoi, I strained to catch better sight of people moving through the hot dark ness on bicycle and foot. Sitting next to me was Mrs. Tran Thi An, a pro fessor of biochemistry. She began a conversation in French:

title: Saturday Basketball
description: Colleges

title: Raiders Come Out of Game In Good Physical Condition
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 27 (AP)Physically the Oakland Raiders came out of their vic tory today in good shape for next week's American Confer ence title game against the Bal timore Colts.

title: Jobless Rate Tops 6% in Jersey Region
description: The PatersonCliftonPassaic area in New Jersey was added yesterday to the nation's list of major cities or areas with sub stantial unemployment.

title: Party by Perle Mesta Brings Youth to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 Mrs. Perle Mesta, perennial partygiver and former Minis ter to Luxembourg, gave a supper dance at the Sulgrave Club here last night for her debutante grandniece, Miss Elizabeth Louise Ellis.

title: Mediator Who Blends In
description: Although Arvid Anderson, the chairman of the city's Office of Collective Bargain ing, is one of New York's leastknown figures In labor negotiations, he is quite con tent to stay out of the lime light even when disputes he is involved insuch as the current negotiations with the sanitation men, policemen, and firemen reach the crisis point.

title: Persian War 64 Choice In Irish Sweeps Today
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 27 (AP) Persian War remained a firm 64 favorite today for tomor row's Irish Sweepstakes, a hurdle race that offers several first prizes of $120,000.

title: Miss Judy R. Warriner Bride Of Stephen Condict Walke Jr.
description: IRVINGTON, N. Y., Dec. 27 Miss Judy Rutter Warriner, who is descended from Lendall Pitts, a leader of the Indians at the Boston Tea Party the night of Dec. 16, 1773, was married here this afternoon to Stephen Condict Welke Jr.

title: 2 ISRAELI PARTIES BACK NEW TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 27The parties in the Israeli Govern ment coalition today supported a return to negotiations with the Arabs through Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special representative for the Middle East

title: PAIR OF COWBOYS REPORTED AILING
description: DALLAS, Dec. 27 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys said today that Pettis Norman, a tight end, and Rayfield Wright, offensive tackler, were injured in yester day's 50 playoff victory over the Detroit Lions.

title: Mrs. Clarence Dickinson, 72, Medical Writer and Editor, Dies
description: Mrs. Lois Stice Dickinson, a medical writer and editor, died of a heart attack on Saturday during a visit to Summit, N. J. She was 72 years old and lived at 7 Gracie Square.

title: SOLOMON IS VICTOR AT ORANGE BOWL NET
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 27 (AP) Harold Solomon; the defend ing champion, defeated Raul Ramirez, 75, 64, in the quar terfinals of the Orange Bowl in ternational junior tennis cham pionship today.

title: Truck Driver of the Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec 27 (UPI) W. T. Smith, 61 years old of Waco, Tex., who has drivin 4 million accidentfree miles was named today as the pro fessional, truck driver of the year. He will come to Washing ton in January to receive the award from Transportation Sec retary John A. Volpe.

title: CONSUMER FOUND IN CAUTIOUS MOOD
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27Business may get better, but it won't boom until the consumer blesses the economy, and he still doesn't feel like it, speakers at the convention of the Allied Social Science Associations said here today.

title: CANADIENS WIN FROM FLYERS, 42
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (AP) Marc Tardif scored three goals tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 42 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers in a National Hockey League game.

title: After the Revolution  I
description: GENEVAToday a new generation of revolutionaries is repeating a failure in its predecessors that has already caused immeasurable human suffering. Intent on destroying the established society, it shows rio serious concern with What would take its place.

title: DUDLEY W. SUMMERS
description: RED BANK, NJ., Dec. 27 Dudley W. Summers, secretary and general counsel of Super markets General Corporation in Woodbridge, died Friday of a coronary thrombosis in River view Hospital. He was 33 years old and lived at 56 Fair Haven Road in Fair Haven.

title: Knicks Rally to Turn. Back Bullets, 110105
description: We got everything this aft ernoon except the win, said a smiling but disappointed Gene Shue, the coach of the Baltimore Bullets.

title: 1,200 Delegates Start 5Day Meeting of LeftWing Youth Here
description: Twelve hundred young people showed up at the Manhattan Center yesterday for the start of the fiveday 10th annual con vention of the Young Socialist Alliance. Many expressed pride that J. Edgar Hoover, Federal Bureau of Investigation direc tor, had pictured their move ment as the largest and best organized youth group in left wing radicalism.

title: Planning Commission Vacancy
description: In a climate of growing community concern, the im pending appointment to the City Planning Commission is arousing more than routine interest. It would be pleasant, but naive, to think that the days when these appointments were used as handy political payoffs to maintain a neat ethnic, religious and borough balance were over.

title: 11 Arrested in Protest at Soviet Mission
description: Militant Jewish demonstrat ors protested outside the Soviet Mission to the United Nations last night and 11 of them were arrested in a clash with police.

title: Times Appoints Reeves To Urban Affairs Post
description: Richard Reeves has been appointed chief metropolitan urban affairs reporter of The New York Times, A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor, announced yesterday.

title: Agnew Going to California
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) Vice President Agnew and his family will spend The New Year's holiday with friends in Palm Springs, Calif., his office said today. The family plans to leave Washington Tuesday morning and return Jan. 4. The Vice President has no public appearances scheduled during the California stay, his office said.

title: Chile Orders an Increase In Native Music on Radio
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 27 (AP)Chile's leftist Govern ment has ordered radio sta tions to devote 40 per cent of their music programs to Chilean songs, effective Jan. 1. The first reaction from commercial broadcasters, who play a lot of foreign music, indicated the new policy would meet opposition.

title: Susan C. Snyder Is Bride of Interne
description: Miss Susan C. Snyder was married here at noon yester day to Dr. Mark A. Korsten. Rabbi Judah Nadich per formed the ceremony at the Westbury.

title: Broadway Bids Dolly! a Fond Adieu
description: The First Fiduciary Trust of West 44th Street, otherwise known as Hello, Dolly! closed yesterday because of dwindling receipts. It had posted gross Broadway assets of over $27million  $60 million worldwide  since opening on Jan. 16. 1964.

title: The Theater: A Mocking Performance of Hamlet
description: In Beyond the Fringe, Jonathan Miller and his comic partners did a hilarious take off on Shakespeare. Miller is still mocking the Bard. His latest prank is his Oxford & Cambridge Shakespeare Com pany production of Ham let, which began a limited run Saturday night at the Hunter College Playhouse This time, however, the joke is really on Miller.

title: The Dutschke Case
description: LONDON, Dec. 27The loyaltyse curity proceedings that soiled the 1950's in America have faded in most of our memories to the level of night mares. When we read about the Op penheimer case now, we find it hard to believe that the legal and official establishment ever accepted such an apparatus of unknown accusers, secret evidence and undefined standards of guilt.

title: ARABS END BOYCOTT OF ENGINE COMPANY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 27 The Arab countries have ended a 14year ban on the French company that produces jet engines for the Mirage fighter ??lane.

title: Dolly ! Quits at 2,844
description: Hello, Dolly! the longest running musical in Broadway history, closed yesterday at the St. James Theater, where it opened Jan. 16, 1964. It ran 2,844 performances here, sur passing My Fair Lady at 2,717. (Details on Page 38.)

title: New School Help for Unwed Mothers
description: Three years ago Karen was a senior in an inner city high school in Boston. She had many friends, and she was busy taking part in school activities and making plans for college. Then her world fell apart: She found out she was pregnant.

title: So. Carolina Earns Vote of Festival Loser
description: Who's going to win the Holi day Festival? Jack Donohue, the Holy Cross basketball coach, was asked the question yester day as he watched the Knicks Bullets game at Madison Square Garden.

title: Theirs Is No Routine Success Story
description: When Neal Sotnick began putting together his first Knit Row collection with his de signer last February, he had no idea that secretaries, bank tellers and airline employes would he wearing pants suits to work this fall.

title: Merrimack Is 6.2 Victor In Codfish Hockey Final
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)Dave Krzemien scored two goals in leading Merrimack to a 62 vic tory over Boston State in the final of the Codfish hockey tournament at the Boston Arena today.

title: Prison Strike Continuing
description: WALLA WALLA, Wash., Dec. 27 (UPI)About 1,300 inmates of Washington State Peniten tiary were served sandwiches and coffee in their cells today, the fifth day of their strike against dehumanizing prison practices. Warden Bobby Rhay said he was meeting frequently with a new inmate ??dvisory council to discuss prisoners demands, but he rejected a demand for inmate representa tion at policy meetings of prison officials.

title: The Senate and Mr. Nixon
description: The Senate returns to work today, a day earlier than the house, in a final effort to unsnarl the legislative tan gle which its finance committee so recklessly knotted together. Since the Constitution sets Jan. 3 as the ex piration date of Congress, the Senate has only six days to work its will. Much depends upon the leadership which President Nixon is willing to provide.

title: DAVID I. SEGAL DEAD, EDITOR AT KNOPF, 42
description: David I. Segal, a senior editor of Alfred A. Knopf, Inc., pub lishers, who was known for his encouragement of talented new authors, died yesterday, appar ently of a heart attack, at his home, 280 Riverside Drive. He was 42 years old.

title: Outbreak of Gunfire Heard And Investigated in Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Gunfire was heard for 30 minutes in the southern Dart of Amman today.

title: FROG7 Reported in Egypt Is Highly Mobile Missile
description: A new term in the Middle East's dictionary of weapons has been introduced by Mrs. Golda Meir's assertion that the United Arab Republic now has FROG missiles.

title: Bus Plunge in India Kills 7
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 27 (UPI) Seven policemen were killed and 24 others were injured when a police truck carrying them plunged into a canal near Arrah in the northeastern state of Bihar, the Press Trust of India reported today. The agency said the policemen were on their way to target practice.

title: McCarthy Planning to Stay In Capital After Term Ends
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) Senator Eugene J. McCarthy, Democrat of Minnesota, said today that he planned to re main in Washington after his Senate term expired and con tinue to work for political re forms.

title: City to Put Some Juveniles In Homes Pending Trials
Excerpts From the Interview With President Sadat of Egypt
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23Following are excerpts from an inter view with President Anwar elSadat of the United Arab Republic conducted by James Reston, columnist and vice president of The New York Times, and Raymond H. An derson, the paper's Cairo cor respondent. The interview was conducted in English.

title: THOMAS J. BERRIGAN, EDITOR UPSTATE, 66
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y. Dec. 27  Thomas J. Berrigan, re tired editor in chief of The Niag ara Falls Gazette and former president of the New York State Society of Newspaper Edi tors, died yesterday in Mount St. Mary's Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived in Lewiston??

title: Status of Major Legislation Pending Before House and Senate
800,000 Coupons to Get Kidney Machine for Boy
description: RICHMOND, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)Churches; schools, Scouts, neighbors and social organizations collected 800, 000 food coupons in two months to give 12yearold Buddy Giese a kidney ma chine for a holiday

title: Metcalf Urges Universities With Stock Holdings to Force Changes in Corporate Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 Senator Lee Metcalf accused some of the nation's leading universities today of failing to try to influence the racial, en vironmental, safety and pricing policies of business corpora tions in which they own sizable blocks of voting stock.

title: Thai Guerrillas Wound Eight
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 27, (Reuters)Eight policemen and parttime militia men were wounded when guerrillas over ran their post in Southern Thai land, police sources said here today. The guerrillas seized weapons and destroyed com munication equipment at the post in Nakhon Sithammarat Province, about 530 miles south of Bangkok, yesterday.

title: Hanoi Terms List of Captives Complete
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 25Premier Pham Van Dong said today that the recently re leased list of names of 339 American servicemen repre sented a full and complete account of all those now held captive in North Vietnam.

title: Karate BeltHolders Chop and Kick for Titles Here
description: Since Mary Arvelo and Jimmy Santiago took up karate, they have had few chances to use their skills outside of completion.

title: Hanoi Paper Warns Nixon His Stand Invites Setbacks
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27 (AP)The Communist party of North Vietnam said today that unless President Nixon learned from Lyndon B. Johnson's failure in Vietnam, he will invite upon himself heavier setbacks.

title: 49ers Upset Vikings, 1714, and Raiders Beat Dolphins, 2114, in Playoffs
California Teams Win
description: The San Francisco 49ers will play the Dallas Cowboys and the Oakland Raiders will meet the Baltimore Colts next Sunday for the right to play in football's Super Bowl Jan. 17. San FrancIsco advanced by defeating Minnesota, 17 14, while Oakland beat Miami, 2114. (Details on Page 47.)

title: Wayne Maki Seems Unhurt
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Dec. 27 (Canadian Press) Wayne Maki of the Vancouver Canucks, apparently suffered no ill effects from a collision last night with two Chicago Black Hawk players in their National Hockey League game.

title: MARY D. KELLER
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27  Miss Mary Dickey Keller of 420 East 55th Street, New York, an executive in the stockholders relations department of Stan dard Oil of New Jersey, died today in Bryn Mawr Hospital. Her age was 57.

title: NETS WIN, 114108, FOR 3D STRAIGHT
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. ??., Dec. 27Bill Melchionni scored 15 of his gamehigh 27 points in the fourth quarter tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 114108 victory over the Ken tucky Colonels, their third straight in the American Bas ketball Association.

title: Prison Death of Slayer of 6 In Connecticut Laid to Tumor
description: SOMERS, Conn., Dec. 27 (UPI)  Arthur Culombe, 46 years old, who confessed to slaying six persons in a series) of holdups, died Tuesday of a probable brain tumor in his cell at the Connecticut State Prison, State Correction Com missioner Ellis C. Macdougall said yesterday.

title: L.I. Couple Killed in Crash And Child Is Critically Hurt
description: MELVILLE, L.I., Dec. 27A young couple was killed and their baby was crtically injured here last night in a twocar accident on Route 110. The driver of the second car was charged with drunken driving.

title: Pope Expresses Concern On International Events
description: ROME, Dec. 27 (Reuters) Pope Paul VI said today that clouds were gathering on the horizon of international life.

title: Cooking Oriental. Meals With One Big HandicapNo Kitchen
description: The onions for the soup came out of a bureau drawer, a sweetsmelling chicken dish bubbled away on a hot plate on the floor, there were pork chops on a desk and the dessert was being prepared by two girls sitting on the floor. Halfway through the luncheon prep arations a fuse blew and the cooking, in a midtown hotel room, had to be halted temporarily.

title: Bellino II Victor in France In Mounted Trotting Race
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Bellino II won today the Prix de Vincennes, France's leading mounted trotting race for 3 yearolds.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House at 7:16 P.M. today, ending a working week ??nd at his Camp David retreat in Maryland

title: French Group Protests Tactic of Locking Up Boss
description: PARIS, Dec. 27The sporad clic outbreak of an unusual form of labor protestconfinement of the boss until he agrees to wage demandsIs causing a certain disquiet in France.

title: 2 G.I.'s Killed by Mine
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Two American soldiers were killed and four wounded yesterday when their armored personnel carrier hit a mine near the demilitarized zone, a United States spokes man said yesterday.

title: Flushing Church Is Haven For 80 in Fire Fatal to 2
description: In a basement recreation and bingo room of St. Michael's Ro man Catholic Church on Barc lay Avenue in Flushing, Queens, just below the outdoor creche, 3rearold Hope Jurnigan lay on a cot and played with a wind up plush dog, whose tail spun around.

title: Brandt Arrives in Chad
description: FORT LAMY, Chad, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  The West German Chancellor, Willy Brandt, ar rived here today on his way to a vacation in Kenya and was met by President Fran??ois Tombalbaye of Chad. Mr. Brandt will have talks with Mr. Tombalbaye before leaving for Nairobi tomorrow.

title: RATES EXPECTED TO DROP FURTHER
description: With a week's respite from marketing new issues of notes and bonds, Wall Street is try ing to form its ideas where yields and fixedincome secu rities prices are headed in 1971.

title: Moscow's Problems
description: This past year Soviet diplomats in many capitals have been quietly at tempting to convince nonCommunist governments that Moscow represents the wave of the future, that elemen tary prudence requires all rational politicians to seek accommodation with the Soviet Union on favorable terms while such terms are Still available.

title: Foe Raids 2 Cambodian Towns
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Cambodian command said today that North Vietnamese and Vietcong troops had attacked two towns close to their main supply cor ridor in southern Cambodia.

title: Joined Westinghouse in 27
description: Dr. Slack was born Dec. 4, 1901, in Marietta, Ohio, was graduated from the University of Georgia in 1922, where he was a member of PM Beta Kappa, and received a Ph.D. de gree in physics from Columbia University in 1926. He taught physics there before joining Westinghouse in ??927.

title: BRAZIL REPRIEVES CRITICAL WEEKLY
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 27 Two weeks ago, two telephone repairmen mounted a pole out side a twostory house that houses the satirical weekly tabloid O Pasquim, the only consistently critical gadfly per imitbed by the Brazilian military Government in a controlled press.

title: Middle East Pessimism
description: The mutual mistrust and fear between Israel and Egypt emerged forcefully in the interviews James Reston conducted with Premier Golda Meir and Presi dent Anwar elSadat. There is only one major area of agreement: Both leaders strongly doubt that the Jarring peace talkslikely to resume soonwill bring any quick, reasonable settlement. By implication, therefore, both, the Premier and the President appear to expect a resumption of hostilities and much more bloodshed.

title: PRESIDENT URGED TO SPEAK ON RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) James Farmer, who quit this month as one of the highest ranking blacks in the Nixon Administration, urged the Pres ident today to raise his voice in behalf of racial justice and to redeem his campaign prom ise to bring us together.

title: New Haven Police Chief Gives Reasons for Retiring
. . . and the War on Pollution
description: In common with other toxic or otherwise damaging wastes, the flow of mercury into the nation's waterways should be sharply reduced by the Nixon Administration's laudable decision to turn an old law into a new weapon against industrial polluters. The 1899 Refuse Act, passed to prevent the impeding of navigation, has always re quired permits from the Army Corps of Engineers for the discharge of waste into the country's streams. Limited in its purpose, it was rarely invoked.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Orders Elections, Dissolving India's Parliament
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 27Prime Minister Indira Gandhi dis solved India's Parliament to night and ordered new elec tions a year ahead of schedule.

title: Malpractice Suits Increase Insurance For Hawaii Doctors
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 27 (AP) The president of the Hawaii Medical Association says mal practice insurance premiums here have more than doubled for many doctors and that the public will feel the impact through higher doctor bills.

title: Filion, With 5 Victors, Reaches 480 for Year
description: CONNAUGHT, Ottawa, Dec. 27 (UPI}Herve. Filion won five harness races today to give him a seasonvictory total of 480, just five short of the 485 registered by Willie Shoemaker an the thoroughbred tracks.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for the week follows:

title: T.V.A. Plant Outlays Rise
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 27 A total plant investment of about $1.37billion was report ed today for the 160 municipal and cooperative distributors of Tennessee Valley Authority power. That amount was reach ed after the distributors spent a record. $106million for facili ties, Including more under ground distribution, during 1970.

title: Power Off Up to 5 Hours In Northern Westchester
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y., Dec. 27 (AP)  About 20,000 Consoli dated Edison customers were without electricity for up to 5 hours overnight when a power blackout hit the north ern Westchester area.

title: Police Role Vexes South Africa Clergy
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 27Disclosures of security police investigations into church affairs and church men in South Africa have cre ated a wave of concern in re ligious circles here.

title: Czech Party Again Ousts Mrs. Slansky
description: The following article is based on information that has reached The New York Times from Prague.

title: MRS. PETER FRIES
description: Mrs. Helen Fries, wife of Peter Fries, a lawyer, died of a heart attack on Saturday at her home, 352 East 141st Street, the Bronx. She was 44 years old.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Early in the year, the large and flamboyant Governor of Florida, Claude Kirk, waved an arm at several dozen scrubbed young men on the upper dais and boomed: Just look at their haircuts and the way they're dressed. By God, they're America the Beautiful. Stand up Mets. With that single gesture, Governor Kirk became the first of seven men and one woman to qualify as finalists in the selection of Sportsmen of the Year.

title: N.F.L. Playoffs
description: SATURDAY

title: DR. SLACK IS DEAD; PHYSICIST WAS 69
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., Dec. 27Dr. Charles M. Slack, re tired research physicist for Westinghouse Electric Corpora tion, who developed an elec tronic tube that made possible millionthofasecond Xray pic tures, died Friday. His age was 69.

title: Advertising: Agencies Bigwigs View 1971
description: By this time, you've prob ably got some ideas of your own what 1971 is going to be like. Now would you like to hear what some of the big men in the business are thinking?

title: DOMINIC CALABRESE
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 27 (UPI) Dominic Calabrese, a national vice president of the Teamsters Union, collapsed of a heart attack on a golf course here today and died a short time later. He was 58 years old and lived in. Dover, N. J.

title: O'BRIEN PICTURES NIXON AS A LOSER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) The Democratic National Chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, ??aid today that the elections of 1970 showed that President Nixon is vulnerable and could be reelected only through fail ures of the Democratic party rather than the success of the Republican Administration.

title: BUCCANEER LEADS AUSTRALIAN RACE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 27 (UPI)The 73foot New Zea land cutter Buccaneer was lead ing in the 630mile. Sydneyto Hobart yacht race tonight after Apollo, the West Australian entry, lost a rudder and with drew.

title: Glow of Victory Helps 49ers Forget 9Degree Temperature
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 27 (AP)  There isn't a guy in the house that's cold right now, said a smiling John Brodie, his tousled hair covering his forehead.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: GORTLAND HONORS ITS WARRIOR SONS
description: CORTLAND, N.Y., Dec. 27 This was a day for special prayers and parties in this city that raised $10,000 to fly back 16 of its servicemen from Viet nam for a twoweek Christmas leave.

title: Hanoi Allows Interview With 2 P.O.W.'s
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 25Seven American prisoners of war were seen and two were interviewed by this reporter to day in a small prison camp on the outskirts of Hanoi.

title: CLEVELAND POSTS 2D VICTORY IN ROW
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 27 (UPI) Joe Cooke, a rookie, entered the game as a substitute and scored 13 points in the fourth quarter tonight to lead the Cleveland Cavaliers to their second straight victory and first this season over an established National Basketball Association club as they defeated the Phila delphia 76ers, 114101.

title: Economists Forecast 7% Growth in G. N. P.
description: In contrast to the practically zero growth of the economy this year, gross national prod uct in 1971 should rise by 7 per cent to a figure of about $1.05trillion, according to the Conference Board.

title: 12Year Low Is Recorded In MachineTool Orders
description: New orders for American machine tools plunged in November to their lowest monthly level in 12 years. The extremely thin trickle of or ders confirmed the industry's fears that the toltal for all 1970 would be the lowest since 1962.

title: Chess:
description: A wellplayed and signifi cant game during the recent Palma, Majorca; internation al, was White's victory in the Ruy Lopez, Bobby Fischer, the United States star, against Grandmaster Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia.

title: Madeleine Rudel Becomes Bride Of J. S. Grant
description: Miss Madeleine Frandoise Rudel, whose father, Julius Rudel, is the conductor and director of the New York City Opera, was married here last evening to Jeffrey Steven Grant.

title: Sunday Is a Thursday As Prague Holiday Ends
description: PRAGUE, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Christmas holiday for Czechoslovakia ended abrupt ly an a working Sunday. Fac tories, stores and shops were open and traffic appeared about as heavy, as on a weekday.

title: Miss Rearick Is Bride of R. K. Conboy
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Dec. 27Miss Margaret Eliza beth Rearick and R. Kevin Conboy were married here yesterday in St. Agnes Ca thedral by the bride's uncle, the Rev. Gerard J. Sheridan.

title: New Study of U.S. Racial Crisis Planned by the Urban Coalition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 The National Urban Coalition confirmed this evening that it would sponsor a new study of America's racial crisis.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 Following are the votes of dele gations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yes terday:

title: Personal Finance: Alimony Windfall
description: Some divorced women who have remarried may have a little financial wind fall on tax returns, for 1970. Furthermore, they might even have tax claims for overpayment in some prior years. At the same time, former husbands of these women can be in for an un pleasant tax shock.

title: MEMPHIS CAPTURES 3D STRAIGHT, 109106
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 27 (UPI)Steve Jones scored with ??20foot jump shot and added ??wo free throws in the final ??0 seconds today to lead the Memphis Pros to a 109106 victory over the Indiana Pacers ??n an American Basketball As sociation game. The triumph was Memphis's third in a row.

title: Screen: Fools Love in San Francisco
Vienna Choir Boys Pay Annual Call At Philharmonic
description: Entertainment fads may come and go, but the Vienna Choir Boys seem to go on forever. Groups of them have been coming here for years, and although thousands upon thou sands of New Yorkers must have heard their stereotyped Christmas programs by now, there is, apparently, still a sizable public eager to hear more.

title: Goldsmith Officers Named
description: Goldsmith Brothers, Inc., stationers, has elected these officers: Harold Garfield, chair man, secretary and treasurer; Frank J. Meley, president; Herman Feuer, vice president, and James J. Keenan, assistant secretary.

title: Yukica, Boston College Pilot, Interviewed by Dartmouth
description: HANOVER, N.H., Dec. 27, (AP)Joe Yukica, head foot ball coach at Boston College, attended a series of lengthy, meetings with Dartmouth offi cials today.

title: Sabres Foil Wings, 52
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 27 (UPI) Don Marshall scored on a breakaway early in the final period tonight to start a three goal outburst as the Buffalo Sabres downed the Detroit Red Wings 52.

title: Celtics Bow to Blazers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 27 (AP)The Portland Trail Blaz ers snapped a sixgame losing streak tonight, handing the Bos ton Celtics a 135123 defeat.

title: Mercury Poisoning . . .
description: The recall of frozen swordfish from the nation's markets, by order of the Food and Drug Administration, is not so much a warning that the fish itself is now a health hazardone would have to eat a great deal of it to be made illas it is a symptom of the ominous spread of mercury in the waters of the earth.

title: In Memoriam
description: MAIDMANMorris. Gone seven years. Cherished and ever loving thoughts of your handsome cheerful countenance. Brothers and Sisters.

title: OILEXPORT NATIONS SET OPERATING TAX
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries has decided to set 55 per cent as the minimum level of the tax on the net income of oil com panies operating in the 10 O.P.E.C. member states, it an nounced today. The old mini mum was 50 per cent.

title: Stormvogel Rallies to Beat Tiki Bill at Arizona Track
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 27 (AP)Stormvogel rallied in the final 100 yards today and upset heavily favored Tiki Bill in the onemile $10,000 added Arizona Paradise Futurity at Turf Paradise racetrack.

title: Carla Fracci Gives Coppelia a New Buoyancy
Israelis Report Raid 4 Miles in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Monday, Dec. 28 (AP)  An Israeli Army unit crossed into southern Lebanon during the night and blew up four houses in a village Arab guerrillas were said to be using, as a base, the Israelli militafy command said today.

title: Conflicts Beset U. S. Anticrime Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 After two years of operation, the Law Enforcement Assist ance Administration, set up to combat crime and violence across the country, is plagued with weaknesses and contra dictions.

title: Statistics Can Becloud the Pollution Picture
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 27The late Alfred E. Smith, once Gov ernor of New York and Demo cratic Presidential nominee, remarked that statistics can testify for either side. That is nowhere truer these days than in the realm of environmental problems, where conflicting figures not only can be cited by contending par ties but sometimes are bewilderingly meaningless with out some context. Thus the petro leum industry is fond of saying that it is spending a million dollars a day on pollution con trols. That sounds like a lot of money  until some gauge is taken of the size of the petro leum industry.

title: Senators Aides Given List
description: Hanoi's list of prisoners was turned over last Tuesday in Paris to representatives of Sen ator J. W. Fulbright, Democrat of Arkansas, and Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts. The move was denounced the next day by Sec retary of State William P. Rog ers, who termed it a contempt ible maneuver to divert atten tion from what he said was North Vietnam's failure to com ply with international law in its treatment of the men.

title: Tanker Splits in Atlantic; 31 Still on Stern, 6 Lost
description: Battling darkness, high winds and heavy seas, rescue ships at tempted early today to pluck 31 sailors from the pitching stern of a Finnish tanker that had split in half 600 miles east of Cape May, N.J., yesterday afternoon.

title: British Jews in Protest
description: LONDON, Dec. 27The Board of Deputies of British Jews called today for the repeal of the sentences passed on the 11 persons tried in Leningrad.

title: Camp Termed Showplace By CHRISTOPHER LYDON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27A United States Government offi cial said tonight that the North Vietnamese camp where Michael Maclear had inter viewed American prisoners of war was the Hanoi Hilton. the showplace camp where numer ous other journalists have been permitted controlled visits with selected individuals.

description: Music

title: War Bringing Economic Pinch to Cambodia's Capital
description: PHNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 15  The current North Vietnamese offensive against the roads leading to Phnom penh has caused severe short ages of gas, sugar and beer in the capital.

description: Miss Carol Bretzfield and Howard Sheldon Altarescu, graduates of Boston Univer sity, were married here last evening at the Plaza by Rabbi Philip Schecter.

title: Miss Spevack Is Wed in Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 27Miss Susan Gail Spevack and Robert Howard Carlson, third year medical students at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons, were married here this morn ing at the Westchester Coun try Club.

title: Reagan Vetoes $1.8Million Federal Grant for Poverty Agency
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 27Gov. Ronald Reagan moved last night to block Federal fund ing of the California Rural Legal Assistance Organization, an antipoverty group that has waged successful court battles against his administration's policies.

description: BASKETBALL
