description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) Business graduate students at 21 American universities are to join the drive to increase United States exports by researching export opportunities for small American companies.

title: MSGR. T. J. CONROY, HOSPITALS OFFICER
description: NEWARK, Dec. 27 (AP). Msgr. Thomas J. Conroy, di rector of hospitals for the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark and pastor emeritus of Sacred Heart Church, died yes terday at St. James Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: VERDICT DUE TODAY IN TRIAL OF BASQUE 15
description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 27. (Reuters)Fifteen Basque na tionalist guerrillas, six of whom Dace a possible death penalty, will know their fates tomorrow, defense lawyers said today.

title: VAN DILLEN, RAHIM REACH TENNIS FINAL
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 27 (AP)Erik Van Dillen defeated Tom Gorman in a hard battle, 56, 65, 63, tonight and moved into the final of the Sugar Bowl invitation tennis tournament against Pakistan's Haroom Ra him.

title: A MASS PROTESTS EASE OF ABORTION
description: HANOVER, Mass., Dec. 27 (AP)Archbishop Humberto S. Medeiros was joined today by five Boston priests in the con celebration of a special mass protesting the increased accept ance of abortion in the United States.

title: Oral Roberts Quintet Wins
description: QUINCY, Ill. Dec. 27 (AP) Oral Roberts of Tulsa, led by Rich Fuqua with 24 points and Haywood Hill with 22, beat Illi nois Wesleyan, 8769, today in the semifinals of the Quincy College Basketball Tournament.

title: Second Trial in Leningrad Is Said to Be Postponed
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27Unoffi cial sources said today that Soviet authorities have post poned a new trial of nine per sonsall of them Jewswho are charged with antiSoviet agitation and organized anti Soviet activity.

title: Life Said to Pay $600,000 For Khrushchev Memoirs
description: Stewart Alsop, writing in th?? issue of Newsweek magazin?? dated Jan. 4 and on sale today, says that Life magazine paid on the order of $600,000 for memoirs attributed to the former Soviet Premier, Nikita S. Khrushchev.

title: Sadat Sets Policy Sessions
description: CAIRO, Dec. 27 (Reuters) President Anwar 61Sadat will hold meetingS Tuesday with leaders of the Arab Socialist Union, Egypt's sole political organization, to discuss the country's political position leading up to the expiration of the ceasefire Feb. 5.

title: BERENSON'S GOAL EARNS DEADLOCK
description: In the finest of fighting trim, the New York Rangers and the St. Louis Blues battled to a 44 tie in a National Hockey League game at Madi son Square Garden last night.

title: CITY TO ASK PANEL TO BREAK IMPASSE IN 3 UNION TALKS
description: The Office of Collective Bar gaining announced yesterday an impasse in the city's con tract negotiations with its fire men, policemen and sanitation men and said it would appoint a special panel today to try to resolve the dispute. The panel will be empowered to make factfinding recommendations.

title: SEABORG WILL HEAD SCIENTIFIC SOCIETY

description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27 The Argentine military Govern ment has decided once again to take up arms against rising economic and political troubles by ordering a new fiveyear development plan.

title: Madden Credits Lamonica
description: OAKLAND, Dec. 27 (AP) The Raider coach, John Madden, gave Daryle Lamon ica full credit today for hav ing called the pass play that resulted in an 82yard touch down by Rod Shermen in the last quarter.

description: LONDONSix months ago, the proposition that charges ought to be levied for entry into Britain's public art gal leries and museums could scarcely have been thought controversial enough to be argued before a highschool debating society in a dull week, Few speakers would

title: Lettuce Pickets to March
description: CALEXICO, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)  Pickets of the United Farm Workers Organizing Com mittee were ready to march again tomorrow at lettuce fields of six Imperial Valley growers in an effort to dissuade migrant farm workers from reporting for work: The growers have been using many Mexican na tionals.

title: Carl S. Stern, Lawyer in Noted Cases, Dies at 86
description: WEST HAVEN, Conn??, Dec. 27Carl S. Stern, a New York lawyer who once repre sented Earl Browder, former head of the Communist party U.S.A., died today in the Soundview Convalescent Home. He was 86 years old.

title: Lakers Triumph, 128110
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)Jerry West tossed in 35 points and Wilt Chamberlain 28 tonight as the defensively tough Los Angeles Lakers trounce?? the Phoenix Suns, 128110.

title: FIREMEN RESCUE 3 HANGING AT WINDOW
description: The first thing the men of Fire Rescue saw when they re ponded yesterday afternoon to a fire at Brownsville Houses, 301 Sutter Avenue in Brooklyn, was three youths hanging by their fingers from a seventh floor window ledge as smoke poured out above them.

title: Stadler Cards 71 for 142 To Gain Orange Bowl Lead
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Dec. 27 (AP)  Craig Stadler of La Jolla, Calif., fired a par 35, 36 71 today for a 36hole total of 142 and a twostroke lead at the midway point of the Orange Bowl international junior golf tournament on the Biltmore course.

title: Souvenir Liquor Leaks
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 27 (UPI)Many of the lobster shaped ceramic liquor bottles sold as part of the state's ses quicentennial observation have proved leaky. The chairman of the State Liquor Commission, Keith Ingraham, said today that although ceramic bottles tend to leak more than glass, the percentage of leakers has been high with the lobster edition. The bottles, containing bourbon, were sold in the state's liquor stores for $18.05.

title: Christmas Tree Fire Kills 4
description: MINOOKA, Ill., Dec. 27 (AP) A Christmas tree fire killed a woman and three of her young children last night as it leveled their farmhouse near Minooka. The father and three other children escaped injury. The victims were Mrs. Richard Senffner and Diane Marie, 2 years old; Suzanne, 1, and Stacy Lynn, 3 months.

title: If a Child Could Design a Playground...
description: What do children and their parents, as contrasted with designers, like in their play grounds?

title: Rail Crash in Brazil Kills 17
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Seventeen persons were killed and 25 were injured last night when two railroad passenger cars plunged over the edge of a ravine near here and crashed 100 yards down the slop?? a ??ailroad spokesman reported today.

title: Dentist Is Ordained An Orthodox Priest In Jersey City Rite
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 27A dentist joined the ranks of the parttime clergy today when he was ordained a priest in the Greek Orthodox Church.

title: East GermanKuwaiti Ties
description: BERLIN, Dec. 27 (AP)East Germany and the Arab sheik dom of Kuwait have agreed to exchange consulates, the East German news agency ADN an nounced today. They estab lished trade delegation ex changes last January.

title: MRS. WILLIAM H. KING
description: Mrs. Estella Fisher King, one of the first women actuaries, died of a heart attack yester day in Queens General Hospi tal. Her age was 77. She lived at 172  70 Highland Avenue, Jamaica Estates, Queens, and was the widow of William H. King, an executive of the New York Life Insurance Company, who died in 1963.

title: Toys Sold to Raise $5 for the Neediest
New Books

title: Do We Need Nuclear Power?; Critics Seem to Want To Eat Their Cake And Have It, Too
description: I find it somewhat ironic that the people who try to blame today's threat of a power shortage primarily on the failure of a handful of nuclear plants under construction to be on the line in time include some who set up as many obstacles as they could to the construction of these plants in the first place.

title: Scalpers: Shadowy Profiteers in Sports
description: Raymond moves smoothly in the crowd rushing to get into Madison Square Garden, his tall, lean figure bobbing along and making him an easy target. He is approached three, four or five times in a few minutes and each time he disappears for a while, meets another man, then delivers two red or yellow tickets to a waiting customer.

title: INJURY PUTS COLTS ON A TIGHT SPOT
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 27John Mackey, the experienced tight end of the Baltimore Colts, was listed as a questionable per former for next Sunday's Amer ican Conference championship game against Oakland.

description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Chicago Bulls, led by Bob Love's 32 points, defeated the San Diego Rockets, 110101, to night.

title: John Young 3d Weds Betsy Billhardt.
description: MANHASSET, L.I.,Dec.27 Miss Elizabeth (Betsy) Walls Billhardt and John W. Young 3d were married here this afternoon in Christ Epis copal Church by the Rev. Frank N. Johnston, the roe tor. The Rev. Wyndham An derson of the Woodrow Wil son Foundation in Princeton, N. Jo assisted.

title: Vatican Allows 43 Sicilian Nuns To Work Independently in Turin
description: ROME, Dec. 27The Vatican has released 43 Sicilian nuns from religious vows and has authorized them to move to the industrial north, live in small communities, work in factory jobs and help Roman Catholic pastors.

title: Chase Manhattan Bank Promotes 4 Executives
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced over the weekend the appointment of four men to the rank of senior vice presi dent. They are Donald D. Berry Jr., 38 years old; Robert B. Hab good 3d, 34; Ernest L. Loser,44, and Erwin Zeuschner, 35.

title: Phony Myth Still Refuses to Die
description: There is a child in Elmhurst General needing open. heart surgeryAmerican Tobacco Company will give family 5c for every empty cigarette packregardless of brand. Please contribute. That is what the handlettered sign said in the emergency room of St. John's (Queens) Hospital. Be neath it was a large carton almost full of empty packs.

title: Singles Eying Now Ways Flock to Upper West Side
description: It was a cold, rainy Fri day night, but the bar at The Library, a booklined restaurant on the upper West Side that is popular with young singles, was crowded.

title: BALLET AFRICAINS STRESSES ACTION
description: Most successful folk troupes, like Les Ballets Afrieainc, have always tempered authenticity ;artfully with theatrical savvy. Possessing a highvoltage group ,of male and female dancers, the directors of the company lave wisely allowed them full leeway during their current sea son at the Brooks Atkinson Theater which opened Satur iclay evening. Repose is a word that they have banished from their dance vocabulary, in fa vor of action.

title: DR. RICHARD H. YOUNG
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (UPI) Dr. Richard H. Young, dean of Northwestern University's med ical school for 21 years, died yesterday at Evanston Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: MISS FLACK SINGS MIXED REPERTORY
description: Roberta Flack, gowned in glittering gold and silver, made her first concert appearance in New York on Saturday night at Philharmonic Hall before an en thusiastic audience so eager to support her that it buried most of her biggest moments in pre mature applause.

title: Rugoff, Empire Growing, Values College Screenings
description: Donald S. Rugoff, the ebul lient young majordomo of the Cinema V film distribu tion and theatrical empire, has just added film produc tion to his organization's in creasingly expansive future. With Max Palevsky, chair man of the Xerox Corpora tion's executive committee, as managing partner, the new company plans to produce a series of motion pictures, all of which will be distributed. by Cinema V. And thus the Rugoff legend grows.

title: Hunger in the House
description: To say that there is hunger in America, as medical experts have said following extensive surveys in poverty areas, is to extend a fundamental challenge to the world's most prosperous people to eradicate it. To say further, as the experts have said, that this hunger has sometimes led to the stunting of physical growth, to diseases such as rickets and goiter and, in especially severe cases, to irreversible brain damage is to require hunger's eradication.

title: After the Revolution II
description: GENEVAThere is a sense in which ell the ideological revolutions that have succeeded, since the French Rev olution, have failed.

title: Rivers's Death Unlikely to Alter Views of House Unit on Military
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 The death of Representative L. Mendel Rivers, chairman of the powerful House Armed Services Committee, will probably mean little fundamental change in the committee's attitude toward military policy, Congressional sources believe.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 1.1 From Prior Weeks Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 104.3 last Tuesday from 105.4 the prior week.

Market Place.
description: Can a television comedian find happiness and a pot of gold in Wall Street? Jackie Mason hopes so, and his new company, Jama Productions, Inc., is set to go public any day now.

title: Clubs Face Liquor Hearing
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)The State Alcoholic Beverages Com mission announced today that it would hold hearings Feb. 8 to consider revoking licenses held by clubs with whiteonly clauses in their charters. How ard M. Miller, commission chair man, said that the hearings would consider 106 licenses held by the Loyal Order of Moose, the Fraternal Order of Eagles and the Benevolent and Protective Orders of Elks.

title: Dr. J. H. Hollomon Weds Miss Gade
description: GUILDERLAND, N. Y., Dec. 28Dr. J. Herbert Hol lomon, past president of the University of Oklahoma and a former Assistant Secretary of Commerce, yesterday married Miss Nancy Gade, a resident of this Albany sub urb. About 100 persons at tended the ceremony here in the Hamilton Union Presby terian Church.

title: Playing With Fire
description: The mediation machinery painfully put together yester day by the city's Office of Collective Bargaining to ward off New Year's Day strikes or slowdowns by the uni formed forces depends for its success on the civic respon sibility and good sense of the rank and file of the police, fire and sanitation unions.

title: Status Quo Loses in Vote Of Teachers
description: A bloc of generally older college language teachers won approval yesterday for a new constitution for the Modern Language Association despite the objections of a generally younger and radical caucus, which argued for the status quo.

title: Herbert C. Davidson, 87, Of Consolidated Edison

title: No Thank You, Mr. President

title: Sugarman Sees No Ebbing Of Welfare Rise Till 1972
description: Jule M, Sugarman, the city's Human Resources Adminis trator, estimated yesterday that the number of welfare recipi ents here would continue to increase by 15,000 a month and reach 1.25 million by June 30.

description: SAILING TODAY

title: Theater: Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves
description: Bil Baird's new puppet show, Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves, is an ornate, color ful spectacle, something like seeing the Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall or Kismetexcept on a tiny stage. One marvel of. the Baird shows is that tiny stage, the diminution with out loss of detail.

title: Fox Board Meets Here Today; New President May Be Named
description: The board of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation will hold a special meeting here today to hear the report of its committee of independent directors on restructuring with indications that a major executive restructuring will take place immediately.

title: SILVER PRICES UP IN QUIET TRADING
description: The prices of silver futures rose yesterday on the Commod ity Exchange, Inc., here in mod erate trading.

title: Strike Is Averted at the Modern Art
description: A strike threatened for today by staff members of the Mu seum of Modern Art has been averted after a series of discus sions between representatives of the museum and an em ployes group known as the Professional and Administra tive Staff Association of the Museum of Modern Art.

description: George Blanda of the Oakland Raiders was named United Press International's American Football Conference player of the year yesterday. The 43year old. Blanda, a pro for 22 years, took over as the Raiders quar terback when Daryle Lamonica was injured. Blanda was the choice of 23 of the 32 sports writers who voted.

description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla Out of the muck and mat ted tangle of cypress and palmetto trees, the stately spires of Cinderella's castle spring into the Florida sky, waiting to welcome a story book princess and 10 million visitors a year.

description: Harvey B. Scribner, Chancel lor of the city school system, proposed yesterday a new budget of almost $2billion that places the. highest prior ity on teacher training and and retraining to make educa tion meaningful to each of our students.

description: MERCURY, Nev., Dec. 28 (AP)Normal operations at the Nevada atomic test site have been suspended because of heavy snows on access roads and continuing checks for radi ation accidentally given off by an underground test Dec. 18, spokesman for the Atomic En ergy Commission said today.

description: It's always been our policy that no contract means no fight, Harry Markson, director of Madison Square Garden box ing, said yesterday in connec lion with a Joe FrazierMaham mad Ali fight.

title: Sudanese Refugees Return With Hope of Peace
description: JUBA, the Sudan, Dec. 13 People are migrating in droves from the bush to this old mar ket center and to nearby towns, which were virtually de serted a few years ago during the peak of the campaign to crush the separatist movement in the southern Sudan.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from the levels of the preceding auction Dec. 18, the Government reported late this afternoon.

Francisco 49ers were rated the favorites today by 4 points over the Dallas Cowboys by Jimmy (The Greek)) Snyder, the Las Vegas oddsmaker, for the National Conference cham plonship game Sunday at San Francisco. In the American Conference title game Sunday at Baltimore, the Colts and the Oakland Raiders were rated at even money.

title: A New Theory Is Offered On Mania and Depression
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28Mania and depression are not the op posite ends of mood states as previously had been theorized, a team of biological psychia trists working with the drug LDopa have concluded.

title: Britons Assail Abortion Law
description: MANCHESTER, England, Dec. 28, (AP)About 500 teenage boys and girls marched today with placards to protest Brit ain's abortion law. The demon stration sponsored by The Right of Life Campaign, organ ized last month by teenagers al a Roman Catholic school.

title: Whitney Young Named a Director Of Reserve Bank
description: The Federal Reserve. Bank of New York announced yester day that Whitney M. Young Jr., executive director of the Na tional Urban League, had been appointed by the Federal Re serve Board to a threeyear term as a Class C director of the bank.

title: CAMBODIANS KEEP KEY RIVER VILLAGE
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 28 (AP)A. 400map force of North Vietnamese and Vietcong soldiers has pulled back after seven hours of close fighting for a key river village on Pnom penh's ouster defense ring, the Government reported.

description: The American Stock Ex change scored its third consecu tive advance yesterday as the list continued to move ahead in steppedup trading.

title: Israel Hails Result of Raid On Guerrillas in Lebanon

description: BURGOS, Spain, Dec. 28  Six Basques were condemned to death today by a military courtmartial on charges of banditry and of complicity in the killing of a police inspector.

title: MRS. HARVEY P. BARNES
description: Mrs. Helen Richardson Barnes, wife of Harvey P. Barnes, a re tired architect, died Sunday night at their home, 22 East 29th Street, apparently of heart attack. She was 68 years old.

description: The American Football Con ference championship game Sunday between the Balti more Colts and Oakland Raiders at Baltimore will start at 2 P.M., Commis sioner Pete Rozelle an nounced yesterday.

description: Frederick M. Lussen, chief of detectives of the New York Po lice Department for nearly five years submitted his retirement papers yesterday.

title: Yaquis of Arizona Dwell in a Town That is Not a Town

description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28 (AP)Eric Van Dillen defeated Haroon Rahim, 61, 61, tonight to win the singles final of the Sugar Bowl invitation tennis tournament.

description: South Carolina and Western Kentucky, both unbeaten and nationally ranked, advanced last night to the final of the Holiday Festival tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: Yugoslav Change Endorsed
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec, 28 (Reuters)The National As sembly today endorsed a proposal by President Tito to amend the Constitution and set up a collective presidency. Marshal Tito submitted the proposal to the legislature last month.

title: NEW MOHAWK OFFER TO PILOTS REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP) Mohawk Airlines officials were reported to have made a major contract package pro posal to striking pilots today as talks between the two groups resumed after a 10day recess.

description: It's not every Chapin stu dent who gets to spend her Christmas holidays in Iran, but then that's where home is to Princess Shahrazad Pah lavi, niece of the Shah of Iran, who is a student at the East Side school.

title: JOHN CARROLL YOUNG
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 28 (AP) Judge John Carroll Young of the State Court of Claims died of a heart attack here Saturday in St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: 3 Banks in U.S. Are Chosen For ExportLoan Program
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (Reu ters)The ExportImport Bank said today it had made a total of $100million available to three commercial banks in sup port of United States exports.

title: Jersey Paper Publishes In Wake of Serious Fire
description: RED BANK, N. J., Dec. 28 (AP)The presses at the Daily Register of Red Bank began rolling at 12:12 P.M. today as the paper kept its promise to readers and published almost on schedule despite a devas tating Christmas Eve fire.

title: Cairo Expresses Skepticism
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28The United Arab Republic reacted with skepticism tonight to Israel's decision to return to the United Nations peace talks.

title: N. & W. ROAD TO TRIM CAPITAL SPENDING
description: The Norfolk & Western Rail way's capital spending in 1971 will dip to about $100million from the $102million spent in 1970, John P. Fishwick, presi dent, announced yesterday.

title: Saints Retain Roberts With a LongTerm Pact
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28 (AP)J. D. Roberts, interim coach of the New Orleans Saints of the National Foot ball League since midseason. was appointed head coach today, the Saints announced.

title: Growth to Slow Down, Association Head Says
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28Is sci ence, as Dr. Vannevar Bush once termed it, an endless frontier? Are researchers ex ploring an unlimited sea of in formation and understanding, or are its horizons limited and even, to some extent, already in sight?

title: LIBYA GIVES EDICT TO OIL COMPANIES
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 28 (AP)The Libyan Oil Ministry, concerned about declining ex ploration activity, has issued a supervisory edict to oil com panies tin the country to set aside a percentage of their profits for exploration costs, a news. report Said today.

title: Upstate G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Sgt. James V. Dragone of Middletown, N. Y., of the Army, had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: No Special Rate Deals, Newsweek Says in Ad
description: Newsweek magazine wants the advertising community to know that it is not offer ing any special deals that aren't on its rate card. It even went so far as to com mission an ad to say so.

title: Brokers Urged to Set Up Reserves Against Losses
description: William C. Freund, vice pres ident and economist for the New York Stock Exchange, suggested yesterday that mem ber firms maintain reserves to cover losses Incurred during periods of declining demand.

title: JAMES CLARK, 61, SHELL EXECUTIVE
description: OJAI, Calif., Dec. 28 (UPI)  James Edward Clark, re tired Shell Oil Company exec utive, died yesterday at his home. He was 61 years old, and was under treatment for a brain tumor.

title: TWO DISEASES TAKEN OFF QUARANTINE LIST
description: GENEVA, Dec. 28 (AP)Ty phus and relaxing fever are no longer considered quarantinable diseases under new interna tional health regulations effec tive Friday.

title: Laird Discounts P.O.W. Interviews
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today called the inter view of two American prisoners of war by a correspondent of the Canadian Broadcasting Cor poration a carefully staged and edited and censored pro duction that left many ques tions unanswered.

title: 50,000 L.I.R. RIDERS DELAYED BY FIRE
description: About 50,000 Manhattan bound Long ?? Island Railroad commuters were delayed during the morning rush hour yester day when a transformer fire at Pennsylvania Station com pelled the line to terminate service at the Woodside Station in Queens.

title: NONFRANCO SPAIN TO GET GUERNICA
description: PARIS Dec. 28  Pablo Picasso and the Museum of Modern Art in New York have agreed that Guernica, the artist's most famous work and the museum's cherished exhibit, will not return to Spain under the regime of Generalissimo Francisco Franco but will be returned if that regime is fun damentally changed.

title: New Sizes in U.S. Held Inevitable
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28The inch and the mile, the quart and pound, the acre and the degree Fahrenheit may soon go the way of the furlong and the fortnight.

title: More Nigerian Repatriation
description: LAGOS,. Nigeria, Dec. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)  The repatriation of more than 2,000 children still abroad after war time evacuation from the for mer eastern region of Biafra will begin next month, the Ni gerian National Commission for Rehabilitation announced to day. Of the total of 5,000 chil dren evacuated, 2,767 have been repatriated so far and of these 1,961 have been reunited with their parents.

title: 48 American Civilians in Vietnam Charge U.S. Violates Treaties
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 28  A group of American civilian volunteers in Vietnam charged today, in letters to President Nixon and Secretary General Thant, that United States actions in Indochina vio lated the Geneva Convention and other international treaties on the conduct of the war and the treatment of prisoners.

title: HUNTER'S STUDENTS GET ADDED POWERS
description: The city's Board of Higher Education, whose members are also the governing body of the City University, approved last night a reorganization of Hunter College that will give greatly enlarged powers to students.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 29, 1970

title: Young Women Make Bows at Parties
description: Many young women home for the Christmas holiday spent yesterday afternoon and evening at parties at which they were presented by parents and friends.

title: Burns Seeks Wider Curb On Interlocking Directors
description: The Federal Reserve Board has proposed a broad overhaul of Section 8 of the Clayton Act to ban most, if not all, inter locking directorships between financial institutions.

title: Wellington Computer Loan
description: An investor group including the RikerMaxson Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed in principle to lend Well ington Computer Systems, Inc., about $4.2  million in interest bearing five  year convertible debentures. Riker  Maxson has a 25 per cent equity interest in Wellington and will own about 33 per cent if its $1.7million debenture participation is con verted.

title: Michigan Mining Operation Is Shut in 16Month Strike
description: HOUGHTON, Mich., Dec. 28 (AP)  Universal Oil Products announced today that it was shutting down its Calumet Di vision on mining operations aft er failing to negotiate an end to a 16monthold strike.

title: Flyers Acquire Schmautz
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (UPI)The Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League acquired Cliff Schmautz, a right wing, from the Buffalo Sabres today on waivers. Schmautz was drafted by the Sabres last June.

title: Court Orders Father to Restore Support to Hippie Daughter
description: A 20yearold college student whose funds were cut off by her father because he disap proved of her hippie style of life has won a court order that he must resume payment or go to jail.

title: XEROX WEIGHING NEW ACQUISITION
description: The Xerox Corporation's Ed ucation Group announced yes terday that it may acquire the General Educational Services Corporation, operators of vo cational schools, home study and residential training schools.

title: TWO HEARINGS SET ON CABFARE PLAN
description: Public hearings on a pro posed fare increase for taxi cabs will be held by the City Council Jan, 5 and Jan. 7, it was announced yesterday.

title: Court Orders Lawyer to Appear Before Jury Seeking Daughter
description: A Federal judge rejected an attempt yesterday to quash a subpoena directing a Rutgers law professor to appear before a grand jury that wants to find the professor's daughter.

title: Neighborhoods: Austin Street
description: Let's go down to the vil lage, has been a byword for a couple of generations for thousands of middleclass and uppermiddleclass New York ers in and around Forest Hills, Queens.

title: G.M. and RCA Executives Voice Optimism for 1971
description: James M. Roche, chairman of the General Motors Corpora tion, said yesterday In his year end statement that 1971 shapes up as potentially one of the best in the industry's history.

title: Clothiers Honor Bacharach
description: Bert Bacharach, a men's ap parel consultant, has been named Man of the Year by the Men's Apparel Club of New York City. He will be honored at the club's annual award din ner Jan. 18, 1971, at the New Yorker Hotel.

title: ISRAEL'S CABINET VOTES TO REJOIN U.N. PEACE TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 28The Israeli Government finally and reluctantly decided today to re sume indirect peace talks with the United Arab Republic at the United Nations, after four months of suspension and in decision.

title: HOLY CROSS POSTS 103TO88 VICTORY
description: It is difficult for most teams to care much about playing consolation game in a basket ball tournament. But Holy Cross had good reason to be up for yesterday's losers bracket game in the Holiday Festival and beat St. Peter's, 10388, at Madison Sauare Garden.

title: Boston Mayor's Aide Quits
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP) Barney Frank, administrative assistant to Mayor Kevin H. White, said today that he was resigning and would return to Harvard to complete his doc toral studies.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE TO MOVE UPWARD
description: The stock market's yearend rally moved prices yesterday onto new high ground for 1970 as measured by the DowJones industrial average. The DOW added 2.52 points to finish at 830.91.

title: Bonwit Teller Executive Named New York Manager
description: David Long, assistant to the president of Bonwit Teller, has been named general manager ;of the specialty store chain's New York store.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: When U.S. Ended Cuban Sugar Quota

title: In Memoriam
description: FEUERSTEINEmII. Dec. 29, 1964. Dearest Poopee, this day and every day you live In our thoughts and In our hearts. Cherished Husband, beloved Father, adored Grandfa ther.

title: PETER FAHRENDORF, A TRADE PUBLISHER
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Dec. 28 Peter M. Fahrendorf, a retired publishing executive who was president from 1937 to 1968 of. Jewelers CircularKeystone, a trade journal, died today after a long illness at his home in the Chateau Burgundy Apart ments. His lure was 78.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Nomination. President Nix on nominated John H. Reed to serve another term as a member of the National Transportation Safety Board and upon his confirmation will redesignate him as chairman.

title: Brandt Visiting Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)Chan cellor Willy Brandt of West Germany arrived here today for a threeweek vacation during which he will meet President Jomo Kenyatta.

title: Is This Mind Necessary?; OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28As the football went incessantly on, the mind began misbehaving. For one thing it started asking questions about what was happening in the commercials.

title: I.C.C. Unit Favors FreightRate Rise By Trucking Lines
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP) The Interstate Commerce Commission's Board of Suspen sion voted today to allow freightrate increases for motor carriers handling about 80 per cent of the nation's truck ship ments.

title: HARRY G. SLATER, 62, OF NIAGARA MOHAWK
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28Harry G. Slater, senior vice president of the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation and a Syracuse civic leader, died today of a respiratory illness in Peter Bent Brigham Hospital. He wad 62 years old.

title: CITY TO INTENSIFY WAGE PACT TALKS
EXDETECTIVE GETS A YEAR'S PROBATION
description: A former New York detec tive who was indi??ted for con spiring to sell about half a pound of heroina felony pun ishable by up to four years in prisonhas pleaded guilty to the misdemeanor charge of official misconduct and been sentenced to one year's pro bation.

title: Advertising: American Brands Quits Craig
description: American Brands has quiet ly notified Norman, Craig & Kummel that the agency is out of the cigarette business, but N.C.&K. doesn't plan, to be out for long.

title: N.A.S.D. DISCIPLINES 6 STOCK SALESMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) The National Association of Securities Dealers today re voked the registrations of five securities salesmen and sus pended another salesman and one firm.

title: Sketches of Quebec Suspects
description: Described by the palice as the leader of the kidnappers . . . became well known to police in summer of 1969, when he opened hippie haven at Perc, in Gasp, Quebec peninsula on Gulf of St. Lawrence . . . 27 years old . . . born in Montreal suburb . . . itinerant teacher . . . unmarried . . . maintains close link with mother . . . although reportedly master mind of kidnapping, left fin gerprints on ransom notes . . . let passport fall into po lice hands.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Gamble
description: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's decision to hold elec tions in India two months from now, a year ahead of schedule, represents a desperate bid to reverse a tide of despair and anarchy that increasingly threatens Indian democracy.

title: MRS. EDGAR ELLINGER
description: SAN ANDREAS, Calif., Dec. 28Mrs. Blanche Mitchell El linger, widow of Edgar Ellin ger, New York City real estate developer and builder, died yes terday in the Mark Twain nurs ing home. She was 88 years old.

title: Avien Files Chapter XI
description: Avien, Inc., filed a petition in Federal District Court yester day to reorganize under Chap ter XI of the Federal Bankrupt cy Act. The petition also covers Avien's affiliate, the Davis Edwards Pharmacal Corpora tion.

title: Sick Sailor Flown to Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28 (UPI)A young Colombian seaman was taken from the deck of a freighter off the Florida coast yesterday and rushed 130 miles to a Miami hospital by a Coast Guard helicopter. The Coast Guard said Luis Eduardo R. Lopez, 19 years old, was re ported suffering from diarrhea and nausea aboard the freighter Ciudad de Buenaventura, but preliminary examination at the hospital showed no signs of serious illness. He was listed in very satisfa??tory condition.

title: U.S. 1970 Output Off 2.5% For Paper and Paperboard
description: The American Paper Institute said yesterday that United States paper and paperboard production in 1970 would total 52.5 million tons, a drop of 2.5 per cent from last year.

title: Emotionalism vs. Science
description: If scientists have any claim to special public attention on matters of general policy, it is presumably because they bring habits of rational inquiry to social problems. But no such characteristics marked the rowdy attacks on Dr. Edward Teller at last weekend's Chicago meeting of the American Ass??iation for the Advancement of Science.

title: Police Halt Rock Festival
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Dec. 28 (UPI)The police herded the remaining 2,000 participants in a threeday Christmas rock fes tival out of a fogshrouded meadow today and bused them to the city limits. Only two ar rests were made, both for fail ure to disperse, bringing the to tal for the three days to 33.

title: Mother of 3 Loses Appeal For Welfare Aid at College
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Dec. 28 (AP)A 28yearold mother of three was rebuffed today in her effort to remain eligible for welfare benefits while attend ing college fulltime.

title: MOSLEM MINISTERS URGE MIDEAST ACTION
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Tues day, Dec. 29Moslem nations today demanded that the Unit ed Nations resolutions on the Middle East be carried out and called on Israel to withdraw immediately her forces from all occupied Arab territories.

title: A Correction
description: Jacques Maurice Schiffer, who died in Chicago on Satur day, was one of the attorneys for John (Johnny Dio) Dio guardi, who was accused with three others on charges of bankruptcy fraud in 1967. An obituary in The New York Times on Sunday contained an inadvertent transposition, mak ing it appear that Mr. Schiffer was a codefendant rather than a member of defense counsel.

title: CREDIT MARKETS SLIP INTO A LULL
description: The credit markets slipped into their usual endoftheyear lull yesterday. Bond prices de clined slightly while little trad ing was done.

title: Diplomat Says Trucker Beat Him
description: The 51yearold, 170pound chief United Nations delegate from Spain complained to the police here yesterday that he was beaten up by a 390pound truck driver when he declined to move his car from a diplo matic parking zone on East 44th Street

title: irate Driver Calls Pompidou
description: PARIS, Dec. 28 (AP)  A motorist became so Irate today after having been snowbound for 24 hours on France's main northsouth highway that he telephoned President Pompidou from a nearby farmhouse. The call was taken by a presidential aide who filed a report with the Ministry of the Interior.

title: Bucks Rout Royals With Season High In Points, 137114
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 28 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks piled up their highest point total of the season tonight, downing the Cincinnati Royals, 137114.

title: Roudebush of Indiana Asks High Court for Recount Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28(AP)  Representative Richard L. Roudebush, Republican of In diana, carried to the Supreme Court today Zits fight to get a recount in his election defeat by Senator Vance Hartke, a Democrat.

title: SENATE ENDS JAM, DROPS TWO RIDERS ON PENSIONS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Senate partly broke today the legislative logjam blocking Con gressional adjournment by strip ping the controversial welfare reform and tradequota provi sions from a bill increasing So cial Security payments.

title: Queens Fire Kills Boy, 7 and Girl, 5, As Mother Saves 4
description: Two small children were killed and four others hos pitalized early this morning when windwhipped flames destroyed their home in Queens Village.

title: 6.7% Drop in 1970 Steel Output Estimated
description: Steel production by United States mills in 1970 probably will be in the neighborhood of 132 million tons, about one million tons short of the lower estimates accepted in the industry until recent weeks.

title: COLONEL WITHHOLDS DATA ON ARMY SPYING
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (UPI) The commanding officer of an Army intelligence unit accused of spying on civilians refused today to disclose the type of surveillance duties performed by his command.

title: Gray Eleven Trounces Blue, 38 to 7
description: STATISTICS OF THE GAME

title: G.I. Insurance Dividend Will Set Record in 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Veterans of World War I and World War II will receive a higher dividend from their G.I. insurance next year than ever before, the Veterans Administrator, Don ald E. Johnson announced today.

title: Dillon, Read Realigns Top Level
description: Dillon, Read & Co., Inc., a prestigious investment bank ing concern, announced top level changes yesterday in its executive structure.

title: Floods in Western Malaysia
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Dec. 28 (UPI)Monsoon rains contin??ed to drench the eastern coast of western Malaysia to day?? touching off floods and landslides and churning coastal waters.

title: Lindsay Urges U.S. Stand
description: Mayor Lindsay called on Sec retary of State William P. Rogers yesterday to issue a national statement concern ing the Soviet death sentences against two Jews in the Lenin grad hijacking case.

title: EGYPT RETURNING SEIZED PROPERTY
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28In a sweep ing political and economic re form. President Anwar elSadat ordered Premier Mahmoud Fawzi tonight to return prop erty taken from Egyptians over the last decade, sometimes for political reasons.

title: Renegades ... Begging Whisky
description: The course of the world revolu tionary process brings great anxiety to imperialist reactionaries and they are using all available resources in the battle against socialist and na tionalist freedom; against the world of socialism.

title: Egypt Presses Britain on Financing of Oil Pipeline
description: LONDON, Dec. 28  The United Arab Republic pressed Britain today for a decision on aid in financing Egypt's pro posal for a crudeoil pipeline from the Gulf of Suez to Alex andria on the Mediterranean.

title: William Archibald, Playwright, Actor and Dancer, Is Dead at 53
description: William Archibald, the play wright whose bestknown work was the 1950 Broadway hit The Innocents, died Sun day in New York Hospital of infectious hepatitis. He was 53 years old and lived at 405 East 50th Street.

title: HARRY CROWN DEAD; AN INDUSTRIALIST, 63
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Dec. 28Harry Crown, a retired in dustrialist, died of a heart at tack last evening at his home, 83 Croft Terrace. He was 63 years old.

title: Indian Election Date Set
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 28 (Reuter) India's general election, ord ered by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi las night, will be held on Feb. 28 or March 1, it was announced here today.

title: Vatican Asks Clemency National Statement Urged by Lindsay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The United States has reportedly made a discreet appeal to the Soviet Union to commute the death sentences of two Soviet Jews convicted in Leningrad earlier this month of planning to hijack a Soviet airliner.

title: Reports on Ski Conditions
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP) Following are ski conditions from selected New England ski areas as reported by the ski operators Monday morning:

title: Karate Standing Changed
description: A retabulation yesterday in the women's division of the Great Grand karate champion ships held Sunday at Sunny side Gardens in Queens award ed third place to Mercedes Mor ales. Melenza Decker, who had originally been placed third, was moved to fourth.

title: Trash Burned on 110th St. In Spanish Harlem Protest
description: Angry residents of Spanish Harlem heaped garbage in the street at Madison Avenue and 110th Street yesterday and set it afire as part of a protest against the lack of heat and hot water in some buildings, the police said.

title: REALIGNING URGED FOR HEALTH UNIT
description: An advisory committee rec ommended yesterday to Mayor Lindsay that the city's Health Research Council be restruc tured to pay more attention to the health needs of the people and to sponsor communityin volved research relevant to these problems.

title: Entertainment
description: Events

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: SPOFFORD INMATE, 15, FOUND WITH HEROIN,
description: A 15yearold inmate of the Spofford juvenile Center in the Bronx was found yesterday to have had three bags of heroin, a hypodermic needle and a sy ringe sewn into the lining of his clothing.

title: Store Sales Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Commerce Department today estimated retail store sales for the week ended Dec. 19 at $9, 243,000,000, up 4 per cent from the year  earlier $8.903,000,00. Total department store sales in the latest week were about 31,533.00,000, virtually un changed from $1,532,000,000 a year before.

title: Bronx Parents Balked in Quest to Improve School
description: For most of the last two years, the parents of children at Public School 146 in the South Bronx have been un dergoing trial by frustration at the hands of the New York City school system.

title: Evers Fund Plans Community Center For Fayette, Miss.
description: A $417,000 multipurpose community center is to be built in Fayette, Miss., during the next six months, Mrs. Medgar Evers announced yesterday. The town is made up mostly of blacks.

title: Alison L. Baxter Becomes Bride Of S. N. Howard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 28Miss Alison Lawrence Baxter was married here this afternoon to Stephen Niles Howard. The Rev. Mur ray Dewart performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Celanese Unit Sets Raise On Film and Sheet Prices
description: The Celanese Plastics Com pany, a unit of the Celanese Corporation, announced yester day that it would raise prices On several segments of its film and sheet product lines.

title: SEATTLE 7'S BAIL HELD UP BY JUDGE
description: TACOMA, Wash., Dec. 28 (UN)  United States District Judge George H. Boldt refused today to set bail for the Seattle Seven consipracy defendants pending action by an appeals court on a Government motion for reconsideration of the ap peals court's order that the de fendants be released on bail.

title: Critics Vote 5 Easy Pieces Best Film
description: Five Easy Pieces, the comedydrama about a con temporary young man's search for roots, found some roots itself yesterday by be ing voted the best movie of 1970 and garnering a total of three of the seven awards made by the New York Film Critics in their 36th annual Poll.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Albany Savings Bank has elected William L. Pfeiffer as chairman of the board of trustees and chief executive officer, and Vincent H. Crawford as president. The bank is the second oldest savings bank in New York State, with assets of about $400,000,000.

title: POWER RUNNERS SET TWO RELAY RECORDS
description: Mark Centrowitz, a sopho more transfer student from Andrew Jackson High, paced Power Memorial to a meet rec ord in the twomile relay yes terday in the Catholic High Schools indoor relay carnival at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: National Distillers Venture With U.S. Steel Is Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion has denied a request by the National Distillers and Chemical Corporation to trans fer its polyethylene resin pro duction facilities to a joint ven ture with the United States Steel Corporation.

title: Special Election Due
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Dec. 28 (AP)  Gov. Robert E. McNair will call a special election, probably in early spring, to fill Mr. Rivers's Congressional seat. Mr. McNair's office said today that the Governor would set the special election date instead of leaving it up to the incoming Governorelect, John West, who takes office Jan. 19 .

title: FAVORITE SCORES BY EIGHT LENGTHS
description: FAIRYHOUSE, Ireland, Dec. 28 (AP)The favored Persian War raced to an eightlength victory in the Irish Sweepstakes hurdle today.

title: BUCCANEER SAILING ON A RECORD COURSE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 28 (UPI)The 73foot New Zea land cutter Buccaneer held the lead today in the SydneyHo bart yacht race and had 20 hours to cover 150 miles to break the course record.

title: PENN TRIUMPHS OVER UTAH, 8678
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (AP) A towering Penn team, led by 6foot8inch Bob Morse's 27 points, downed Utah, 8678, to night and advanced to the final of the 10th annual Quaker City basketball tournament.

title: Too Many Okinawan Western, Say Pickets
description: Charging discrimination in hiring, about 30 members and supporters of the Orien tal Actors of America picket ed the Majestic Theater last night for an hour before the opening of Lovely Ladies, Kind Gentlemen.

title: Talks That Must Not Fail
description: Israel's welcome decision yesterday to resume indirect peace talks with the United Arab Republic at the United Nations has been greeted with unhealthy skepticism in both Cairo and Jerusalem.

title: Newark Man, 23, Is Held in Slaying Of College Student
description: A 23yearold college drop out from Newark was held for extradition to New Jersey yes terday in the fatal stabbing of a college student whose body was discovered in Greenwich Village Sunday morning.

title: 48 Are Saved and 27 Are Still Missing From 2 Disabled Tankers in Atlantic
description: Rescue vessels picked up 48 men from the Atlantic yester dayall crew members of two tankers that were disabled in heavy seas over the weekend while Coast Guard planes and cutters continued to search for 27 others still missing.

title: Vatican Urges Clemency
description: ROME, Dec. 28The Vatican announced today that it was pleading with the Soviet Gov ernment to spare the lives of the two Jews who were sen tenced to death by a Leningrad court last Thursday on charges of treason by plotting to hijack an airliner.

title: Books of The Times
description: Dwight D. Eisenhower, who will not go down in history as a phrasemaker, made a major contribution while serving as a retired general in the White House by a parting shot against the. militaryindus trial complex. It did not go away and has since expanded in power without glory.

title: Bomb Blast Injures Janitor At Army Office in Georgia
description: COLLEGE PARK, Ga., Dec. 28 (UPI) A. bomb wrapped in a paper bag exploded today when a janitor picked it up in rout of the Army recruiting station in this suburb south of Atlanta.

title: Earnings Increase At Beatrice Foods
description: The Beatrice Foods Company posted record sales and earn ings in the quarter and the nine months ended Nov. 30 for the 19th consecutive year, the company reported in Chicago yesterday. The threemonth re sults were said to be the high est for any quarter in the com pany's history.

title: Venezuela Purchases by Creole
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 28 (AP)The Creole Petroleum Corporation, a Subsidiary of Jersey Standard, reported to day having made purchases amounting to $50.6million in Venezuela an 1970.

title: The Guests Brought Their Own Hors d Oeuvre
description: Among the edibles were polyporus sulphureus, pleu rotus ostreatus, tricholoma virescens and boletus scabra as well as more mundane herringstuffed eggs and gua comole dip in the hors d'oeuvre selection.

title: Westchester Group Sues to Bar Police Surveillance at Protests
description: A Westchester group filed suit in Federal Court yesterday seeking to prohibit the police from maintaining surveillance and gathering information about residents engaged in peaceful political protest.

title: Brimmer Assails Utility Of NegroOwned Banks
description: DETROIT, Dec. 28Negro owned banks do not finance much development in the black community, they export much of their capital to white areas and their spread should not be encouraged on economic grounds, Andrew F. Brimmer, a governor of the Federal Re serve System, said here today.

title: Swain and Koach Advance In Junior Squash Racquets
description: Joe Swain of Episcopal Acad emy, the defending champion, and Glen Koach of Penn Char ter, last year's runnerup, ad vanced to the semifinals yester day in the metropolitan junior squash racquets tournament at the Princeton Club.

title: Hair Style Called Aphrodite Head Clue
description: Iris C. Love, the New York archeologist who identified mutilated marble head in the basement of the British Mu seum as part of the Aphrodite of Cnidus by Praxiteles, said at a conference of scholars yes terday that the hair style of the statue was the most signif icant evidence to support her identification.

title: U.S. WOMEN LOSE IN CUP TENNIS, 30
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 28 (UPDVirginia Wade and Mrs. Ann Jones swept past the in experienced United States team of Sharon Walsh and Patti Ho gan to give Britain a 30 victory in the semifinals of the wom en's tennis Federation Cup to day.

title: 2 Die and 51 Hurt in Virgin Islands Jet Crash
description: In the first fatal crash of a scheduled United States air liner this year, a Trans Carib bean Airways Boeing 727 with 53 persons aboard  many of them New Yorkers bound for a New Year's holiday in the sun  crashed and burned yester day while landing at the air port in St. Thomas, Virgin is lands.

title: Prison Strike Week Old
description: WALLA WALLA, Wash., Dec. 28 (AP)  A weeklong work stoppage continued today at the Washington State Peniten tiary. About 1,000 prisoners have walked off their prison jobs in support of the right of convicts to grow beards and mustache. Prison officials say inmates must be clean shaven as a matter of cleanliness.

title: Defender of the Military
description: Lucius Mendel Rivers believed in a mighty America. He con sidered tanks and ships and planes essential for the coun try's survival. And he thought the power should be used read ily and unsparingly against the nation's enemies.

title: Sato Plans Antipollution Unit
description: TOKYO, Dec. 28 (AP)Pre mier Eisaku Sato decided today to establish an environmental protection agency, headed by a Cabinet minister, on April 1. Officials said that the agency would work on pollution prob lems, which have grown worse tin Japan in recent years.

title: Censorship of Press Decreed in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 28 (UPI)The Government notified Cambodian newspa pers and periodicals today that censorship would be in troduced.

title: Irrigation Threatens Ruins of 4,000YearOld City in Pakistan
description: MOHENJODARO, Pakistan Experts at the ruins of this 4,000yearold city in the Indus Valley have urged the Govern ment to take quick action to save the archeological treasure from further deterioration caused by water and salt.

title: Councilman Proposes Abolishing Plan Commission
description: Contending that the City Planning Commission served no useful purpose, Councilman Edward L. Sadowsky, Queens Democrat, proposed yesterday to Mayor Lindsay that it be abolished.

title: A Jet Hijacking Defendant Ruled Unfit to Stand Trial
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., Dec. 28 (AP)  The first person returned to the Unitd States by the Cuban Government for trial on airplane hijacking charges was ruled today men tally incapable of standing trial.

title: Rep. L. Mendel Rivers Is Dead; Powerful Military Affairs Chief
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 28  Representative L. Mendel Rivers, chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, died in University Hospital early to day of heart failure.

title: Market Summary
description: Monday, Dec. 28, 1970 (Volume 3,547,055 shares)

title: CHARLES M. CROOKS
description: SALEM, Ore., Dec. 28Capt. Charles M. Crooks, secretary treasurer of the International Organization of Masters, Mates and Pilots and its president from 1958 to 1964, died today of cancer. He was 50 years old.

title: The Rose Bowl Parade Still Has Allure for High School Bands
description: At a time when the teenage stereo type seems to consist of longhaired youths in disheveled blue jeans, it must strike a chord of hopeful nostalgia in the graying, saddleshoe set to discover that a healthy slice of the nation's youth remains as close to the Ameri can ideal as apple pie.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A year ago the Kansas City Chiefs upset the Minnesota Vikings In the Super Bowl and at the start of this season both teams took dead aim for a return meeting, the Chiefs to prove that the victory was no fluke and the Vikings to prove that it was. In addition to this spiritual reward, of course, was the nottobeignored item of $25,000 a man to the reigning monarchs of the football universe.

title: Revlon to Close Salon Here
description: Revlon, Inc., close the seondfloor beauty salon in its House of Revlon on Fifth Ave nue, a company spokesman said yesterday. The company's Bou tique for Cosmetics will remain open. The Revlon spokesman said that the decision to close the salon was the result of changing conditions in which we find our commitment to such a highly personalized serv ice no longer attainable.

title: What Makes Voters Vote?; IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28It is dan gerous business to generalize about what the American voter will do, what will make him do it and where he is headed. That is the conclusion that seems most warranted, as analyses of the 1970 elections continue to appear.

title: Defense For Manson Derides Charges
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 28The defense in the Tate murder trial, which earlier rested its case without presenting a wit ness, began today its final arguments to the jury.

title: Colleagues Praise Young, Retiring From Senate at 81
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP) Colleagues of Senator Ste phen M. Young described the retiring Ohio Democrat as a model of courage and convic tion in tributes on the Senate floor today.

title: Foe Lists Saigon Desertions
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)The Vietcong press agency said to day that more than a million Saigon troops had deserted over the last 10 years. The agency, which gave the figure of 1,027,650 deserters, said that between 1968 and 1970, more than 20,000 men had deserted from the South Vietnamese Seventh Infantry Division alone, a figure that was three times higher than the normal strength of the division.

title: Economic Curbs Urged On Britain by O.E.C.D.
description: PARIS, Dec. 28  Britain is headed for worse inflation and difficulties in paying her way into the European Common Market unless she alters pre sent economic policies, the Or ganization for Economic Co operation and Development warned today.

title: STATE TO ELIMINATE BIG LOTTERY PRIZE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28Hundreds more winners of $500 and $100 will be added to the state's monthly lottery drawings but the super prize drawing held three times a year will be elim inated.

title: Laird Predicts Lower Draft Calls in 71
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird forecast today lower draft calls next year, the extent of the drop to depend largely on whether Congress is willing to vote costly increases in military pay and benefits.

title: Grateful Former Patient Sends a Gift to Neediest
description: For 10 years, Mrs. D.'s life had been a succession of doctors, drugs, suicide at tempts, locked wards. It was a world of terror and loneliness . . . the world of mental illness.

title: JAZZ ENSEMBLE SHARES PROGRAM
description: When the Modern Jazz Quar tet made its first appearance more than 15 years ago, it was strongly criticized in some jazz circles for what was considered its stuffy formality, for its ap parent lack of an openly swing ing attack and for its fondness for such nonjazz forms as the fugue. John Lewis, the quartet's leader and pianist, was accused of stifling the natural jazz tal ents of Milt Jackson, the group's vibraharpist, and of being an overly precious pianist himself.

title: Solomon, Gottfried in Final Of Orange Bowl Junior Net
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 28 (AP) Hdrold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., the defender, de feated Leif Johansson, 61, 62, today and moved into the final of the boys18yearold division of the Orange Bowl Junior ten nis championships.

title: Judge Revokes Bail Set for Seven Jailed Panthers
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday re voked the bail that had been set for seven Black Panthers and threatened to jail four Pan thers who are now free on bail.

title: ISRAEL'S DECISION IS PRAISED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 The United States today praised Israel's decision to re turn to the Middle East peace talks and urged both sides to take a flexible approach in the negotiations.

title: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: SUNDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Hockey Player Loses Eye
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 28 (AP) George Guilbault, 27 years old, a center with the New Haven Blades of the Eastern Hockey League, had an eye moved today in surgery. Guilbault was struck in the race by a puck in the first

title: Irish Planning Gatewood Trap For Texas: Real Thing or Decoy?
description: DALLAS, Dec 28  The eyes of the Texas secondary will be riveted on Torn Gatewod Fri day afternoon in the Cotton Bowl. But then, what else is new? The Notre Dame wide receiver has been doublecov ered by opponents all season.

title: Detective Is Shot Foiling a Holdup At Bank in Bronx
description: Detective Is Shot Foiling a Holdup At Bank in Bronxan offduty detective foiled a holdup but was shot in the back in a gunfight with two robbers in a Bronx bank yester day morning, and a guard was shot in the shoulder and a patron pistolwhipped in an other holdup at a Brooklyn bank in the afternoon.

title: QUEBEC ARRESTS 3 IN LAPORTE DEATH
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 28  A threemonth manhunt that in volved up to 10,000, policemen and troops and brought on a national emergency decree ended today with the capture of three suspects in the kidnap ping and murder of Pierre Laporte, Quebec's Minister of Labor and Immigration.

title: Treasury Cites U.S. Deficit Of $2.5Billion Last Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI) The Treasury Department re ported today a $2.5billion budget deficit in November, and a cumulative Government defi cit of $16.5billion since July 1. The deficit was $9.16billion during the same period of the previous fiscal year.

title: Princess HohenloheOehringen Is Married to Janos Farkas
description: OEHRINGEN, West Ger many, Dec. 28Princess Elis abeth zu HohenloheOehrin gen, sister of Prince Krafft zu HohenloheOehringen, head of the old titled family, was married here this morning to Janos Farkas of New York.

title: Critical Decisions fore Franco
description: The incredibly harsh sentences against fifteen Basque nationalists, handed down by a military court in Burgos, are certain to intensify Spain's worst political crisis in many years. Not content merely to decree executions for six defendants, the Judges delivered double death sen tences for three of these men.

title: KENTUCKY UPSET BY NOTRE DAME
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 29 (AP)Notre Dame upset na tionally ranked Kentucky, 99 92, tonight, getting a 50point outburst by its sharpshooting guard, Austin Carr.

title: The Welfare City
description: Mayor Lindsay's rejection of the proposed budget for the Human Resources Administration is a despairing acknowledgement that New York City is in danger of collapse under the staggering weight of its welfare burden.

title: KnittingNeedle Thrust Interrupts One Dissident
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29  An annual meeting of the Ameri can Association for the Ad vancement of Science used to be a quiet, dignified and optimistic affair The nation's established scientists gath ered to renew fraternal ties, to report in an arcane lan guage on their research and to speak of endless fron tiers and the wonders and elegance of science.

title: Student Forfeits Luxury To Offer Help to Neediest
Marquette Routs Dartmouth
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 29 (AP) Thirdranked Marquette uti lized the shotblocking of Jim Chones on its way to defeating Dartmouth tonight, 9855, in the first game of the Milwaukee Classic basketball tournament.

title: 76ers Down Braves, 124113
description: BUFFALO, Dec. ZU (AP) Billy Cunningham scored 21 of his 29 points in the last 15 min utes, leading a rally that car ried the Philadelphia 76ers to a 124113 victory over the Buf falo Braves tonight.

title: RAIL SERVICE PLAN ASSAILED BY I. C. C.
description: This marked a dramatic shift for the commission, which over the last dozen years has authorized the discontinuance of hundreds of intercity pas senger trains on the ground of economic hardship to the rail roads.

title: Mrs. August E. Uihlein, 96, Widow of Schlitz President
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Dec. 29 Mrs. Minnie Geiler Uihlein, the widow of August E. Uihlein, who had been president of the Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company of Milwaukee, died today in the Uffilein Mercy Center here. The center, built by the Uihlein family, cares for the ill and aged.

title: European Protests Mount
description: As governments throughout Europe appealed to Spain to spare the lives of six Basque separatists condemned to death, the conviction of the Masques prompted work stoppages, boy cotts and other acts of protest yesterday.

title: ROCKEFELLER LINKS TAX PLAN TO NIXON
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29Governor Rockefeller has decided not to disclose his tax plans in his openingday state of the state message to the 194th Legisla ture here next week, prefer ring to wait until President Nixon addresses the new Con gress next month.

title: C. W. POST REACHES JERSEY COURT FINAL
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 29 Sinking 29 field goals in 55 attempts, C. W. Post College gained the final of the fifth an nual New Jersey Kiwanis Clas sic at Panzer Gym tonight, downing Monmouth College, 8577.

title: ADMIRAL TESTIFIES ON DEFECTION CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) An admiral being retired by the Coast Guard told a Con gressional hearing today that he was concerned about fish ing talks with the Soviet Union when he recommended return ing to the Russians a Lithua nian sailor who tried to defect.

title: Kansas Outlasts Iowa State
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 29 (UPI) Dave Robisch rescued Kansas from one of the biggest upsets in the history of the Big Eight basketball tournament tonight when he sank two field goals in the last minute of overtime to enable the 11thranked Jay hawks to beat Iowa State, 5956, in the event's semi finals.

title: BREAKDOWNS SLOW TRANSIT LINES HERE
description: Transformer trouble that de layedi thousands of Manhattan bound Long Island Railroad commuters on Monday was re ported cleared up yesterday. But riders of the Long Island, the Penn Central and the sub ways experienced other diffi culties.

title: Front Fours: 49ers Improve Their Image
description: You have heard of the Dal las Cowboys Doomsday De fense, of Minnesota's Purpl?? Gang and The Fearsome Four some of the Los Angeles Rams Here come The Gold Rushers

title: Guinean Archbishop Reported Arrested Following Invasion
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Dec. 29. (Reuters)  Diplomatic sources here said today that several leading Guineans, in cluding the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Conakry, Msgr. RaymondMarie Tchidimba, had been arrested in connection with last month's invasion of Guinea, which Guinea says was backed by Portugal.

title: Inquiry in Virgin Islands Crash Concentrates on Landing Gear
description: Federal officials investigating the crash Monday of a Boeing 727 jetliner in the Virgin Is lands concentrated yesterday on the plane's right landing gear.

title: Burns to Take Post Here, But Keep His Party Job
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Dec. 29  John J. Burns, Democratic state chairman, announced to day that he would join a new public relations firm in New York City, on Jan. 1 but planned to continue in his $30,000a year party post.

title: Britons Urged to Think Decimal As Nation Plans Money Change
description: LONDON, Dec. 29With the imperative slogan Think decimal, Britain will begin a $3million advertising cam paign tomorrow to prepare the public for the change to decimal currency on Feb. 15.

title: Miss Menzies, Magazine Aide, Is Bride of Nathan Mobley Jr.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29 Miss Melinda Menzies, pro motion director of Modern Bride magazine in New York, was married here this after noon to Nathan Mobley Jr., son of Mr. Mobley of Green wich, Conn., and the late Mrs. Eleanor Smith Mobley.

title: Coast Guard Air Search For Tanker Survivors Ends
description: The Coast Guard called off its air search yesterday for 21 missing crewmen from the Panamanian tanker Chryssi, one of two ships disabled in heavy seas in the Atlantic on Sunday. A search by ships is to resume today.

title: City to Register Youths
description: The first voters aged 18 to 21 will be registered in the city next Monday, the Board of Elections announced yesterday. Maurice J. O'Rourke, board president, said that the new voters, franchised by legislation passed by Congress recently, would register at 10 A.M. at the board's offices, 80 Varick Street. He urged all people aged 18 to 21 register. He said that offi cials, including Governor Rock efeller and Mayor Lindsay, would act as registrars on Monday and hand out scrolls.

title: Finest Bronze Age Frescoes Dug Up
description: The discovery of the finest examples known of a mature fresco art from the ancient world was announced to an audience of scholars here yes terday by Dr. George E. Mylonas.

title: Accounts
description: Overseas National Airways to Wyse Advertising, Inc., for its air freight.

title: 60 Debutantes Introduced at International Ball
description: What with eligible young women announcing they can no longer relate to formal debuts and the stock market slump giving parents second thoughts about expense, it looked as though the big debutante bash might be on the wane this year. In fact, the Mistletoe Ball, which dated back to 1957 and was scheduled for Dec. 22, was canceled for lack of interest.

title: People
description: Dennis R. Casey appointed marketing director of the GT&E Service Corporation, a subsidiary of GTE Corpo ration.

title: The Cheerful Grumblers
description: LONDONThe British are grumbling at the end of the year about strikes, prices and other awkward nuisances, but in a world of haters, their grum bling seems almost amiable. Maybe it was just an accident, but the long London garbage strike ended just be fore the Christmas holidays, and the airline workers shelved their griev anoes until after the holidays.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 30, 1970

title: STOCK PRICES GAIN ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London Stock Exchange was firm in slack conditions yesterday. Salective buying o?? leading issues pushed prices u?? following initial uncertainty brought on by the antiinfla tionary economic curbs urge?? by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and De velopment.

title: Panther Is Remanded to Jail After Murtagh Revokes Bail
description: Michael Tabor, one of 13 Black Panthers on trial for an alleged bomb conspiracy, was remanded to jail yester day and his $50,000 bail re voked after he failed to arrive for trial until the afternoon session.

title: Economic Index Up by 1% in November
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The Government index of leading indicators rose in No vember, the Commerce Depart ment reported today, but the widely hailed upturn in Octo ber turned out, after later fig ures were available, to have been a small decline.

title: Jacob White
description: RUMSON, N. J., Dec. 29 Jacob White, who retired in 1964 as president of the Nitro gen Division of the Allied Chemical Corporation, died yesterday of a heart attack yesterday in Riverview Hospi tal, Red Bank. He was 71 years old and lived here at 168 Brigham Avenue.

title: Executive Changes
description: UAL, Inc., the holding company for United Air Lines, has announced the election of Edward E. Carlson as president of the airline subsidiary. Mr Carlson was recently elected as president and chief executive officer of UAL, Inc. He succeeds George E. Keck, who resigned his position with the airline and the presidency of UAL, Inc., on Dec. 21.

title: Letter Reports Hope to Die
description: ST. JEANDELUZ, France, Dec. 29 (Reuters)One of the Basques condemned to death at Burgos wrote to his family saying all six men facing death by firing squad want to die for their cause, a Basque organi zation said here today.

title: DR. LILLI B. RAHN, 59, HADASSAH OFFICER
description: DENVER, Dec. 29A funeral service was held today for Dr. Lilli Bethmann Rahn, a member of the national board of Hadas sah, who died of a long illness on Sunday at the age of 59, and her husband, Alfred H. Rahn, whose suicide followed her death. He was 69 years old.

title: Frye Name Adopted
description: Shareholders of Pacific In dustries, Inc., at a special meeting in Dover, Del., voted yesterday to change the com pany's state of incorporation to Delaware from California and to change its name to Frye Industries, Inc. It is controlled by the Equity Corporation.

title: 3Month Loss Is Narrowed By Four Seasons Nursing
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 29 (AP)  Four Seasons Nursing Centers of America, Inc., op erated at a loss of more than $1million during the quarter ended Nov. 30, according to court records.

title: Decoding the Brain
description: Newly announced scientific results are best approached cautiously until they have been duplicated and verified by independent researchers. But, even with that caution in mind, the advance in brain chemistry just reported by Dr. George Ungar of Baylor College of Medicine will intrigue many and stimulate further related research.

title: Mylai Suspect Held in Atlanta Slaying
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 29A feud between a motorcycle gang and hippies erupted in gunfire here today, leaving one man dead and 17 persons charged with murder.

title: J. Edgar Hoover  Time to Retire
description: The recent tiff between J. Edgar Hoover, Director of the F.B.I., and Ramsey Clark, former U.S. Attorney General and Hoover's former boss; also Hoover's somewhat pointless reitera tion of a previous charge that Martin Luther King was a liar, bring to the fore a question increasingly posed: Is it not time for Mr. Hoover to retire?

title: Governor Names New Insurance Chief
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  The appointment of Benjamin R. Schenck of Yonkers as the new State Superintendent of Insur ance was announced today by Governor Rockefeller.

title: $200,000 in Gems Reported Stolen From Hotel Suite
description: Jewelry valued at more than $200,000 was stolen from the suite of Mrs. Frazier Wall in the Pierre Hotel, the police of the East 67th Street station re Ported yesterday.

title: BAIL FOR SEATTLE 7 IS STAYED BY COURT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29 (UPI)  The Federal appeals court that had earlier ordered bail for the Seattle Seven con spiracy defendants said in ef fect today that all must stay in jail until Jan. 4.

title: More Tyranny for Greece
description: By its last actions of 1970, Greece's military dictator ship has rendered even more ludicrous the claims of its apologists in Washington that it has established a trend toward a constitutional order. These typical moves by Colonel Papadopoulos and his colleagues merely expose the bankruptcy of United States policy toward Greece.

title: Zumwalt Eases Rules On Admiral Promotion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)Adm. Elmo R. Zum walt, the Chief of Naval Operations, has abolished the long  standing requirement that an officer must hold major command at sea be fore he is promoted to ad miral the Navy said today.

title: Pistons Topple Hawks
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29 (UPI)The Detroit Pistons, behind as many as 13 points in their National Basketball Association contest with Atlanta, rallied to beat the Hawks, 9997, tonight.

title: NIXON TO ANSWER QUESTIONS ON TV
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  President Nixon will participate in an hourlong nationally tele vised conversation with four network news correspondents and anchormen next Monday night at 9:00 P.M., the White House announced today.

title: Janus Chorale's Singing Matches Angelic Setting
description: In the Medieval Court of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the figure of the Virgin Mary dominates. In sculpture and painting her face is most often serenely and tenderly turned to the infant Jesus. In the Christmas season the court is further enhanced by an enormous tree, decorated with angels and at its base a splendid cache, the beautiful figures of 19thcentury Nea politan origin.

title: Lena Biorck Has Nuptials
description: Miss Lena M. Biorck, daughter of Dr. Gunnar Biorck, personal physician to King Gustav VI Adolf of Sweden, was married in Stockholm yesterday to Gil bert E. Kaplan of New York, president Institutional In vestor Systems, Inc., a multi media communications com pany.

title: Floridians Calvin Sinks 2 Foul Shots, Defeats Nets, 9190
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 29 (AP) Mack Calvin sank two free throws with seven seconds re maining to give the Floridians a 9190 victory over the New York Nets tonight.

title: Dance: Makarova in Les Sylphides
description: American Ballet Theater, opening the second week of its brief season at the New York City Center, last night moved into its general reper tory with a bill consisting of Fokine's Les Sylphides, Jos Limon's The Moor's Pavane, Alvin Ailey's The River and George Balan chine's Theme and Varia tions.

title: Russell of Knicks Is Given Approval To Play Saturday
description: After almost six weeks of talking about basketball on Knick radio and television shows, Cazzie Russell returned yesterday to playing basket ball.

title: Western Kentucky Faces South Carolina Tonight
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference's 19th annual Holi day Festival basketball tourna ment has followed the form charts to a T.

title: KEY MEN HEALTHY FOR RAIDER TEST
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Baltimore Colts defen sive line, a marvel of patch work all season is hale and hearty again just in time for the American Football Confer ence championship game Sun day against the Oakland Raid ers.

title: ARTHUR ASHLEY
description: Arthur Ashley, manager of the Percy Williams Home, ah organization in East Islip, L. I., named for the actor, that takes care of aged and indigent per formers, died on Monday in East Islip. He was 85 years old.

title: Brown of Bengals Wins Coach Honor 2d Straight Year
description: Paul Brown, who led the Cincinnati Bengals to a divi sion title in the third season of their existence, was named the American Football Confer ence's coach of the year yes terday by United Press Inter national.

title: ARKANSAS SPARES ALL ON DEATH ROW
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 29 Gov. Winthrop Rockefeller commuted today the death sen tences of all 15 men awaiting execution in Arkansas to life imprisonment.

title: Protests Here and Abroad Continue on Soviet Jews
description: The storm of protest stirred by the outcome of the Lenin grad hijacking trial continued unabated yesterday as individ uals and groups denounced the sentences and appealed to the Soviet leadership for clemency.

title: Argentine Guard Killed
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 29 (AP)  A policeman on duty outside President Robert M. Levingston's residence was shot to death today by an unknown assailant. Mr. Levingston was in his office in Government House in downtown Buenos Aires.

title: Wedding Is Held For Mrs. Sibley, Richard Epstein
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Mrs. Beatrice Blair Sibley and Richard Lewis Epstein, both of Rochester, were married here today. The Rev. Joel Baehr, former minister of the Unitarian Church in Rochester, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Montgomery Blair.
