The bride groom is the son of Mrs. Harry Browdy Epstein of Yonkers and the late Mr. Epstein, who was a lawyer.

title: A Reunion for a Designer and Her Favorite Mannequin
description: Six years ago, soon after London fashion began to swing, Jean Muir, one of its swingers, brought her fashion collection to New York for the first time. She was pre ceded by three days by Jen nie Chilcott, her favorite mannequin, who was built along Twiggy's lines. Twiggy faded away, but Jennie re mained here to become one of the most popular runway mannequins.

title: Defense Asserts State Produced No Evidence Against Manson
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 Paul Fitzgerald, chief counsel for the defense in the Tate LaBianca murder trial, ended his final argument to the jury today with an emotional plea in behalf of Charles Manson.

title: FREDERICK BATE, 84, N.B.C. EUROPEAN AIDE
description: WATERFORD, Va., Dec. 29 Frederick B. Bate, who retired in 1949 from the National Broadcasting Company, died Friday at his home here of arte riosclerosis. He was 84 years old. A memorial service was held here today.

title: Battle of the Theorists
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29In the Soviet Union or Red China, where MarxismLeninism is a quasireligion, battles over the theory and ideology of Communism are waged by the top contenders for political power  and usually foreshadow major shifts in national policy. In the United States, where economics is supposed to be a science, battles over

title: Wage Rise for Argentines
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 29 (Reuters)Economics Minister Aldo Ferrer tonight announced a 6 per cent acrosstheboard wage increase in Argentina ef fective Jan. 1 to offset a steady rise in the cost of living.

title: Lockheed Sets Price Rise
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration announced yesterday it would increase the basic price of its new L1011 Tristar jetliner by 4 per cent. The in crease will become effective Feb. 1.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: EASTERN HOCKEY LEAGUE

title: Penn Central Appointment
description: The Penn Central Company has announced the appointment of John M. McGuigan as chief mechanical officer of the rail road. He succeeds James H. Heron who is retiring.

title: Rev. Francis E. Bowen, 79, Long on Fordham Faculty
description: The Rev. Francis E. Bowen, a member of the Jesuit order since 1909, who taught philos ophy at Fordham University from 1940 to 1965, died Satur day in a Poughkeepsie (N. Y.) hospital after a long illness. He was 79 years old.

title: Mohawk Pilots Reject Airline's Major Package
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Striking Mohawk Airline pi lots today rejected a company offer that a spokesman for the regional carrier said would have added more than $3million to pilot costs over the next year.

title: Sadat Asks Plan for Battle
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29  President Anwar elSadat ordered to day that the home front of United Arab Republic be put in a state of readiness for War.

title: IRVING TRUST STAYS A SECURITY CLEARER
description: The Irving Trust Company announced yesterday that it would continue its role as clearing bank for a number of dealers in Government securi ties.

title: Linda R. Baker Married in Jersey
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 29 Miss Linda R. Baker and Leighton Howe Laughlin Jr., seniors at Colorado College, were married this afternoon at the Princeton University Chapel.

title: A Reply to George Kennan
description: George Kennan's reflections on a suitable international strategy for deal ing with the admitted evils of apart heid are echoes of familiar pleas and warnings often voiced by architects of that rigid scheme of repressive laws and measures, which defined individual opportunities and burdens of life solely in terms of the accident of race and color.

title: U.C.L.A. and Pitt Triumph to Gain Steel Bowl Final
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 (UPI) The University of California Los Angeles, beat William and Mary, 9071, tonight to advance to the final of the Steel Bow tournament against Pitt.

title: Senate Votes Pension Bill, But Hope of Rise Now Dims
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Congress took a halting step toward adjournment today as the Senate approved, 81 to 0, a Social Security bill that had been stripped of virtually all controversial extraneous pro posals. The measure would in crease benefits $7.5billion.

title: Dollar Called Overvalued
description: The United States dollar is overvalued in relation to other currencies, the chief economist of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company said yesterday, but there is no practical way at the moment to devalue.

title: Lee Barnes, Pole Vaulter Who Set 1928 World Mark
description: OXNARD, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPI)Lee Barnes, a Univer sity of Southern California polevaulter who won a gold medal at the 1924 Olympic Games in Paris, died last night in a hospital after surgery. He was 64 yeasts old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: West AllStars Selected For N.B.A. Game Jan. 12
description: Three old prosJerry West, Wilt Chamberlain and Oscar Robertsonwere named yes terday as members of the West squad for the National Basket ball Association's 21st annual AllStar game on Tuesday, Jan. 12, in San Diego.

title: Lauterbur Signed by. Iowa To FiveYear Pact as Coach
description: IOWA CITY, Dec. 29 (AP) The task of rebuilding the Uni varsity of Iowa's football pro gram was passed today to Frank Lauterbur who led To ledo to 23 straight victories in the last two seasons. He will receive over $25,000 a year as head coach on a fiveyear con tract.

title: Hanoi Sees Birth Defects
description: TOKYO, Dec: 29 (AP) North Vietnam said today that defoliants dumped by United States aircraft in South Viet nam had caused millions of people to suffer the same fate as victims of the Hiroshima and Nagasaki atomic blasts in World War II.

title: W. K. Gregory, Paleontologist, Dies
description: WOODSTOCK, N. Y., Dec. 29 Dr. William King Gregory, an ichthyologist and paleontolo gist who had been associated for many years with the Amer ican Museum of Natural History and with Columbia University, died after surgery here this afternoon. He was 94 years old.

title: Ethiopian Has No Reports
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 29Yilma Tadessa, the first secretary of the Ethopian mission here, said today that he had no official news of con tinuing fighting in Entrea??

title: Reader's Digest Contests Held Deceptive by F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The Federal Trade Commission accused The Reader's Digest today of deception in the promotion of magazine and book and record club subscrip tions.

title: MRS. RUBENSTEIN, 78, OF FRANKLIN STORES
description: Mrs. Yetta Shor Rubenstein, widow of Frank Rubenstein, cofounder of The Franklin Stores Corporation, died yes terday in San Antonio, Tex., her winter home. She was 78 years old.

title: Lakers Trounce Bulls
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPI)Wilt Chamberlain poured in 34 points tonight to spark the Laker attack as Los Angeles trimmed the Chicago Bulls, 126117.

title: Stetson Confirms Ending Of Output at Philadelphia
description: The John B. Stetson Com pany, one of the oldest Ameri can manufacturers of men's hats, confirmed yesterday that lit is ending production at its Philadelphia plant.

title: HOME
description: (from the modern Japanese of Hagiwara Sakutaro)

title: O.E.C.D. PREDICTS U.S. RISE IN G.N.P
description: PARIS Dec. 29A 22nation economic organization predicted today a fairly strong expan sion in the United States next year with a sharp rebound in foreign purchases of Ameri can corporate securities.

title: Cornf eld Weighs Fight; Airline Merger Opposed
description: Bernard Cornfeld, former chairman of Investors Overseas Services, said in an interview yesterday that he was seri ously considering waging a proxy fight to reestablish his dominance over the giant mu tualfund complex.

title: 3 Activists Score Scientists as Decadent
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29  Three former doctoral chemistry pro fessors, all of whom gave up science for social action, charged the scientific commu nity with decadence and with indifference to and complicity in many of the problems in America today.

title: Life at Best Wretched On Ganges Delta Islands
description: DACCA, Pakistan  Aver age life expectancy on the Ganges Delta Islands is less than 40 years. A quarter of the children die of cholera, smallpox, typhoid and other diseases before they are 5. Tuberculosis is like the com mon cold.

title: Crime Survey Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The Census Bureau will con duct a pilot survey next month in San Jose, Calif., and Dayton, Ohio, to gather information from the victims of crimes. A spokesman said the twoanda halfweek sample survey, to be gin Jan. 11, would reach 5,000 to 6,000 households in each of the cities.

title: F.I. duPont's Two Top Officers Replaced
description: A toplevel management re organization at F. I. duPont, Glore Forgan & Co., one of Wall Street's largest brokerage houses, has resulted in the re placement of its two highest officers, including Edmund du Pont, son of the founder.

title: H. J. SMITH, WRITER, WON OSCAR IN 1959
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 Harold Jacob Smith, an Oscar winning screen writer, died yes terday of a coronary attack in the Kaiser Permanente Hospital in Panorama City in the San Fernando Valley. He was 56 years old.

title: Rebels Charge Ethiopian Annihilation
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 29 The Eritrean Liberation front, which is waging a guerrilla war against the Ethiopian Govern ment of Emperor Haile Selassie, has called for urgent interna tional intervention to end what it described as the mass an nihilation of Eritreans.

title: CARY W. BOK
description: CAMDEN, Maine, Dec. 29 (AP)  Cary W. Bok, retired treasurer and senior vice presi dent of the Curtis Publishing Company, died today at his home here. He was 65 years old.

title: Sarah Ferguson, Melvin McClain Marry in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The marriage of Miss Sarah Ferguson and Melvin Eugene McClain, students at the Uni versity of New Mexico, took place in St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square, there this afternoon. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. William Wagner, assist ecl by the Rev. Dr. John C. Harper, rector of the church. A small reception followed at the home of the bride's moth er, Mrs. John H. Ferguson.

title: GUILTY PLEA IS MADE IN F.H.A. COOP CASE
description: Bernard G. Walpin, a New York lawyer, pleaded guilty in Federal Court in Manhattan yesterday to a charge of con spiracy to defraud the Federal Housing Administration in the financing of a cooperative hous ling project in Brooklyn.

title: HIPPIE DAUGHTER RESENTS PUBLICITY
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 29 (UPI)A University of Louis ville coed who described her self as destitute and looking for a job said today that she was upset over publicity given a New York court ruling that ordered her father to provide support for her or go to jail.

title: Richard Zanuck Quits as President In ShakeUp at Fox
description: As expected, Richard D. Zan uck, the 36yearold president of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation, resigned yes terday as an officer and a di rector during a special board meeting.

title: Ari Advances Opening
description: The new Leon UrisWalt Smith musical, Ari, has ad vanced its opening from Jan. 24 to Jan. 15 at the Mark Hellinger Theater. Preivews will begin here Jan. 6 after the show concludes its pre Broadway engagement in Washington. David Cryer and Constance Towers are co starred.

title: MRS. BERTRAM CHAPMAN
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 29 Mrs. Helen Marie Chapman, the wife of Bertram D. Chap man, vice president and pro duction director of Newsweek magazine, died of cancer yes terday in Lawrence Hospital; Bromxville. She was 54 years old and lived at 32 Homestead Avenue here.

title: San Diego Yachtsmen Win
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29 (UPI)San Diego State won the 1970 intercollegiate Sugar Bowl yachting regatta on Lake Pontchartrain today with a twoday total of 50 points. Tulane was second with 58, followed by Yale, 66; Kings Point, 69; Michigan State, 74; Tufts, 80; Ohio Wesleyan, 87; and The Citadel, 95. Ed Butler and Paul Hunricks were the San Diego skippers.

title: FORDHAM FIVE WINS 9TH STRAIGHT, 8463
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 29 (UPI) Unbeaten Fordham topped California, 8463, tonight in the opening round of the eighth an nual Kodak college basketball classic for its ninth victory.

title: BANKERS TO LEAVE COMPETING BOARDS
description: Senior officials of at least one major New York City bank are planning to resign from their positions as trustees of com peting mutual savings banks. This was the principal develop ment yesterday In the wake of the proposal by the Federal Re serve Board that Section 8 of the Clayton Act be broadened to prohibit interlocking direc torships between all types of institutions that accept de posits.

title: Squires Down Chaps, 143120
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 29 (UPI) The Virginia Squires, the Eastern Division leader, rallied in the second half and posted a 143120 victory over the Texas Chaparrals in American Basket ball Association play tonight.

title: Text of Rejection of the Welfare Budget
description: Following is the text of a statement by Mayor Lindsay yesterday in which he re jected the initial budget re quest by the city's Human Resources Administration:

title: Market Place:
description: Once upon, a time, Litton Industries, Inc., raised eye brows in Wall Street with an unusual treatment of a S23.2 million capital gain arising out of the sale of. McLean In dustries common stock to R. J. Reynolds Industries on May 23, 1969.

title: LINDSAY REJECTS RECORD REQUEST BY WELFARE UNIT
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday re jected a recordshattering $2.4 billion budget request by the city's Human Resources Admin istration, including $2.1billion primarily for upsurging costs of welfare and Medicaid pro grams.

title: Muskie Is Seeking a Meeting With Soviet Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine has asked for a meet ing with top Soviet officials during his tour of Europe and the Middle East, beginning next Sunday.

title: BERNHARD SPRINGER, PUBLISHER HERE, 63
description: Bernhard. J. Springer presi dent of the Springer Publishing Company of this city, died Sart urday of a brain tumor at his home, 80 Central Park West. He was 63 years old.

title: Gradual 1971 Rise Seen for Retail Business
description: Retail business early next year will begin a slow proc ess of improvement, partici pants in a Wall Street seminar were told yesterday.

title: Rockefeller Appoints Rabin To Post of Presiding Justice
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 (AP)Jus tice Samuel Rabin of Queens was designated by Governor Rockefeller yesterday as presid ing justice of the Appellate Di vision of State Supreme Court, Second Department, to succeed Justice Marcus G. Christ.

title: Strep Throat Claims Victims Despite Penicillin
description: Physicians who attended Representative L. Mendel Riv ers said yesterday that the 65 yearold South Carolina Demo crat had probably been a vic tim of rheumatic heart disease. Mr. Rivers, who was chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, died Monday at the University of Alabama Hospital in Birmingham after open heartsurgery.

title: 3 Lock Haven Wrestlers Win at C. W. Post Tourney
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Dec. 29 Ed Kochakji of C.W. Post was named the outstanding wrest ler for the second straight year and Lock Haven State won three individual titles to high light the sixth annual C.W. Post invitation wrestling tour nament which ended tonight.

title: Erik Bruhn Prepares For Return to Ballet
description: Erik Bruhn will make his first appearance with Amer ican Ballet Theater this sea son in Sunday's matinee of Les Sylphides at the City Center. Natalia Makarova will also dance in the ballet. Both dancers will perform next Tuesday and Thursday in the pas de deux from Act II of Giselle.

title: MAGNUSON REQUESTS DRUG UNIT INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Senator Warren G. Magnuson has asked Elliot L. Richardson, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, to investigate and answer charges that the Food and Drug Administration nored the findings of its own scientists on possible food dangers.

title: Bonnies Gator Bowl Victors
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 29 (UPI)Paul Hoffman in tercepted a pass and scored a layup with 13 seconds left to give unbeaten St. Bonaventure a 7068 triumph over Georgia Tech tonight and the Gator Bowl tournament champion ship.

title: ExPresidents Voted Raise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) The Senate narrowly ap proved tonight legislation to raise the pensions of former Presidents from $25,000 to $60, 000 a year. The bill, approved on a 36to35 vote, goes to President Nixon.

title: ARMY AGENT REPORTS FILES ON ABERNATHY
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29 (UPI)A former Army intelligence agent testified today that Army sur veillance of civilians included dossiers on the Rev. Ralph David Abernathy, head of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, and the Rev. James E. Groppi, leader of civil rights militants in Milwaukee.

title: Harvard Routed, 10387
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 30 (UPI)  Freewheeling Ohio State, with six players in dou ble figures, romped to a 10387 victory over Harvard today in the Far West Classic.

title: Guerrillas Step Up Action In Two Sectors of Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 29Pales tinian Arab guerillas operating from Jordan, Syria and Lebanon stepped up their harassment of Israel overnight.

title: SOVIET COURT ACTS ON APPEAL TODAY
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29  The Supreme Court of the Russian Republic announced today that it would hear appeals tomor row of 11 persons  nine of them Jews  who were con victed of treason in Leningrad last week for planning to hi jack a Soviet airliner.

title: Bitterness Remains in Polish Port in Wake of Riots
description: SZCZECIN, Poland, Dec. 29 (AP)Down the hill past the castle is the Oder River, and across the river are the ship yards, bleak and hazy on the falling snow.

title: Celtics Down Rockets
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 29 (UPI) Dave Cowens sank two free throws with 15 seconds remain ing tonight to cap a lastperiod rally that gave the Boston Cel tics a 110108 triumph over the San Diego Rockets.

title: 25Cent Taxi Surcharge For 8 P.M. to 6 A.M. Urged
description: Legislation was introduced yesterday in the City Council for an additional taxicab meter charge of 25 cents between 8 P.M. and 6 A.M.

title: TV ACADEMY HONORS 8 LOCAL PROGRAMS
description: The New York chapter of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences presented awards to eight local programs and to two individuals last night, The awards covered the broadcast period from Sept. 1, 1969 to Aug. 31, 1970, and were seen here last night over WHET, Channel 13.

title: 3 FROM S.I. SEIZED IN THEFTS AT PORTS
description: The arrest of three Staten Is landers and the recovery of $50,000 worth of merchandise allegedly stolen from the Brook lyn waterfront and the Port of Newark was announced yester day by Edward R. Neaher, United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York.

title: SENATOR ADAMS GETS STATE POST
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 Senator William E. Adams, the Ken more Republican who was ac quitted last April of perjury charges but who lost his bid for reelection, was named to day as general counsel of the State Board of Standards and Appeals.

title: City Starts Promoting Betting Service
description: A makebelieve horse room on wheels, set up shop yester day in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Black Lawyers Bid Army Void Decision On Discharge of G.I.
description: Spokesmen for the National Conference of Black Lawyers said yesterday that they planned to try to get the Army to rescind its decision to give a destitute black soldier a bad conduct discharge.

title: Franco and Cabinet Meet As Clemency Pleas Grow
description: MADRID, Dec. 29  Gen eralissimo Francisco Franco met with his Cabinet in emer gency session today amid a na tional groundswell of pleas for commutation of the courtmar tial death sentences imposed on six Basque guerrillas in Burgos yesterday.

title: Rebuilding Investor Confidence
description: Congress has passed and sent to the White House the longawaited legislation to protect investors from broker age firm failures. The bill establishes a Government backed institution called the Securities Investor Protec tion Corporation (SIPC), which will insure customers accounts up to $50,000.

title: Goldman, Sachs Adding Nine General Partners
description: Goldman, Sachs & Co. an nounced yesterday the admis sion, effective Jan. 1, of nine men as new general partners.

title: Nixon Signs Job Safety Bill, Ending Long Struggle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  President Nixon signed today an occupational health and safety bill giving the Secre tary of Labor authority to set safety standards for factories, farms and construction sites and creating a threemember panel to enforce the standards.

title: City's Breaking Point
description: After five years of fruitless efforts to reform the welfare system, amid repeated com plaints that it was unjust for the Federal and state govern ments to mandate increased city expenses without also pro viding additional funds, the Lindsay Administration said that it reached the breaking

title: Senate, 702, Votes Defense Fund Bill
description: WASHINGTON?? Dec. 29The Senate ended a long battle over imposing Congressional restric tions on the President's war making powers tonight by pass ing, 70 to 2, a compromise ver sion of a $66.6billion defense appropriations bill.

title: ISRAEL RULES OUT ANY WITHDRAWAL BEFORE AN ACCORD
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 29Pre mier Goida Meir declared today that not one Israeli soldier will be withdrawn from occupied Arab territories until a binding peace agreement has been reached with the Arab govern ments.

title: AMEX TURNOVER AND PRICES CLIMB
description: Prices and volume on the American Stock Exchange rose as trading reached its most ac tive level in almost three months.

title: N. Y. U. Loses, 8168
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 29St. Louis University, trailing only in the opening minutes, defeat ed New York University. 8168, today at the Honolulu Interna tional Center in the consola tion bracket of the Rainbow Classic.

title: Things for Youngsters to Do in the City
description: Films

title: J. Bernard Quigley Dies at 46; Lawyer Was Securities Expert
description: J. Bernard Quigley, a mem ber of the law firm of Cahill, Gordon, Sonnett, Reindel & Ohl of 80 Pine Street, New York, died yesterday at New York Hospital after a brief illness. He was 46 years old.

title: U.S. 71 RICE ACREAGE TO EQUAL 70 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Agriculture Department, ending a twoyear series of cut backs, announced today that 1971 rice acreage allotments would remain at this year's level. The reprieve from a further reduction resulted mainly from an improved riceexport situa tion.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: RCA TUBE PRICES UP; OLIN CUTS UREA COST
description: The RCA Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would increase prices by 6 to 12 per cent on selected types of pencil tubes, cathode ray tubes, photo multipliers, super power tubes, photo diodes and image orthi cons used in industrial and broadcast applications.

title: E. I. du Pont Sees 9% Drop in Profits
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., said yesterday that it expected a 9 per cent drop in earnings this year, on sales that would be close to the $3.6 billion registered in 1969.

title: PENN WINS, 7655, FOR 8TH STRAIGHT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29 (AP)Dave Wohl, one of two small men on Penn's tower ing basketball team scored 25 points as the sixthranked Quakers defeated Temple, 7655, tonight to win the 10th annual Quaker City tournament.

title: $15Million Budget Requested For Activities of Mayor's Office
description: The Mayor's office submitted a budget request of $15million yesterday for the fiscal year beginning July 1. This is about $950,000 over the figure for the current year.

title: P.S.C. Counsel Appointed
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 (AP)  Peter H. Schiff, a legal aide to the Federal Power Commission, was appointed today as general counsel of the State Public Serv ice Commission.

title: WHEAT FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Wheat and soybean futures prices advanced shortly after the opening of trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yes terday, but profit taking there after trimmed much of the ad vance.

title: Wives Set Up Pass Protection for Notre Dame Players in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Dec. 29They dislike the midi. They love football as long as Steve Worster isn't carrying one. They cried through Love Story. They call Women's Lib overrated. They find Dal las dull, but better than South Bend in winter, and they wonder what their husbands did as swinging singles here last year.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, D.C. 22. 1970

title: Politicians and the Poor
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 Gov. Ronald Reagan's recent decision to veto $1.8million in Federal funds for California Rural Legal Assistance, the na tion's largest legal services program, raises two key ques tions about public efforts to give the poor some control over their lives. The first ques tion is whether the Nixon Admin istration is willing to defend the inde pendence of anti poverty programs in the face of massive pressures from such powerful figures as Governor Reagan. When Don ald Rumsfeld, former director of the Office of Economic Op portunity, dismissed the nation al director of the Legal Serv ices Program last month, many lawyers charged that he was caving in to political pressure.

title: Bridge:
description: Bridge is played in almost every part of the civilized world. The only major excep tion has been the Soviet Un ion, whose authorities have long encouraged chess, but have held the opinion that cardplaying is a capitalist gambling activity that might distract the workers from more serious pursuits.

title: A Correction
description: Sam Spewack yesterday clari fied his functions in the Sad ler's Wells Opera's production of the musical Kiss Me, Kate, which opened last Thursday night in London. Mr. Spewack said that he had spent several months in Britain writing the version that was presented. A report in last Saturday's New York Times had noted that Peter Coe, producer of the of fering had done the script for the British performance. Mr. Spewack emphasized that the script was solely his own re sponsibility.

title: POLICE TO IGNORE SUNDAY SALES BAN
description: New York City policemen have been ordered not to en force the state Sabbath law, which bans the sale of some items during certain hours on Sunday, except to act on spe cific complaints.

title: Sprays in Vietnam Said to Level Fifth Of Mangrove Area
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29A study of defoliation in Vietnam, un dertaken for the American As sociation for the Advancement of Science, has shown a cata strophic effect on some parts of the country.

title: Rickles Asks Noise Limits To Ban All Jets From City
description: Noise limits so strict that they would bar all present jet aircraft from landing here were proposed yesterday by the city's Commissioner of Air Re sources. Dr. Robert N. Rickles.

title: The Life, Toil and Frustrations of Ladder 120
description: At 1:52 P.M. the silver bell in the rundown fire house on Watkins Street in the Brownsville section of Brook lyn clanged out its number code.

title: MRS. HELEN SHEPARD
description: ROXBURY, N. Y., Dec. 29 Mrs. Helen Shepard, who was a granddaughter of Jay Gould, the financier, died yesterday in Stamford (N.Y.) Community Hospital. She was 59 years old.

title: JACKSONVILLE GAINS IN FLORIDA TOURNEY
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 29 (UPI)  Jacksonville downed Creighton, 9485, to night and Wake Forest topped Georgetown, 9088, to advance to the final in the Gold Coast Classic basketball tournament. Artis Gilmore, Jacksonville's 7 foot2inch center, was held to 15 points, his low of the sea son.

title: NEW ZEALAND YACHT FIRST TO FINISH RACE
description: SYDNEY, Dec. 29 (UPI) The New Zealand yacht Bucca neer, sailed by her owner, Tom Clarke, was the first to finish in the SydneyHobart race to day, with a time of 3 days 14 hours 6 minutes 12 seconds.

title: Law Schools Honor Two
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29 (UPI) Profs. John P. Dawson of the Harvard Law School and Her bert L. Packer of the Stanford Law School were named core cipients today of the triennial award of the Order of the Coif in recognition of outstanding legal scholarship. The awards were announced at the annual luncheon of the Association of American Law Schools.

title: Museum Centennial Leaving an Impact
description: The Metropolitan Museum's Centennial spectacular, the biggest and longest show ever put on by the venerable institution, is nearly over. When its last exhibition ends on March 21, the Centennial will quietly fade away, and operations at the facelifted Beaux Arts edifice on upper Fifth Avenue will settle back into what one staff member calls a peacetime economy.

title: Bishop George W. Bahr, Leader in A.M.E. Church
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The Rev. George W. Baber, a presiding bishop of the Afri can Methodist Episcopal Church and an advocate of church in volvement in social causes, died Saturday in Washington Hospi tal Center of an embolism. He was 72 years old.

title: Ban on Western Asked
description: Continental Air Lines, Inc., which last month raised its offer to acquire Western Air Lines, disclosed yesterday it had filed a series of documents with the Civil Aeronautics Board in Washington in an at tempt to block Western's merg er into American Airlines, Inc. Continental is asking the C.A.B.

title: STAYMAN L. REED, STOCKBROKER, 75
description: SHARON, Conn., Dec. 29  Stayman L. Reed, a limited partner in the New York Stock E??hange firm of J. & W. Selig man & Co., died last night in Sharon Hospital after a short illness. He was 75 years old.

title: Senate Delays SST Plan, Returning It to Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29The Senate returned the super sonic transport controversy to a HouseSenate conference tonight without formal instructions as to a possible com promise in the monthlong SST impasse.

title: OFFSHORE OIL CLAIM RESTATED BY PEKING
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 29Com munist China today restated in emphatic terms the claim it an nounced early this month to the exclusive control of oil and other mineral deposits under the continental shelf extending off the coast.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The formal announcement originally had been scheduled for yesterday, but was postponed until noon today at Toots Shoes. To the surprise of virtually no one, confirmation will be made that Joe Frazier, the recognized champion, and Muhammad Ali, the unrecognized one, will meet at Madison Square Garden on March 8 and thereby settle who is the heavyweight box ing ruler of the blooming universe.

title: Early Evidence Rules Out Bomb in Jersey Oil Blast
description: Preliminary indications are that the explosion that tore through the Humble Oil and Refining Company in Linden, N. J., on Dec. 5 was an acci dent not sabotage.

title: Rabbi Who Rallies Aid for Soviet Jews
description: The date was April 11, 1945. The place was Buchen wald.

title: GRAND UNION NET UP FOR 13 WEEKS
description: Earnings of the Grand Union Company in the 13 weeks end ed Nov. 28 were $3,728,989, slightly exceeding the record $3,720,929 earned in the simi lar period last year, the food and general merchandise re tailing chain reported yester day.

title: House Hears a 2Hour Eulogy of L. Mendel Rivers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 With only a few days left to complete its legislative busi ness, Congress spent hours to day eulogizing the departed and the departing and accommodat ing members who had television engagements or other personal commitments.

title: In Norman Rockwell's Home, Mementos of His Illustrations
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass.For more than five decades, Norman Rockwell has fur nished the memories of millions with stenciled rocking chairs and horsehair sofas, slantfront desks and potbellied stoves. These vestiges of early America, symbols of what the 76yearold illus trator calls those happier, more hopeful times, are now, in many cases, merely props With no more of a known prov enance than their existence on old Sat urday Evening Post covers.

title: House Sends Nixon Bill Establishing Gulf Park
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The House sent to President Nixon today a bill to establish an 18,000acre Gulf Islands National Sea shore off the coasts of Mis sissippi and Florida.

title: Now Playing: The Reviewers Reviewed
description: In an academic discussion sponsored by the Modern Lan guage Association, two work ing playwrights reviewed the state of theatrical criticism this way yesterday:

title: Firemen Plan to Answer Alarms Even it They Take a Job Action
description: The city's firemen, who have been threatening a job ac tion unless they have a new contract by Friday, plan to con tinue to answer alarms of fire and emergency but to curtail other services, according to a guide circulated among mem bers of the Uniformed Fire fighters Association.

title: The King Is Dead
description: PARISThe only King who ever died in the United States was Peter II, former sovereign of Yugoslavia, who expired Nov. 3, 1970, in Denver, Colo. He left behind an inaccurate death certificate and a will including such curious provisions that some of his family suspect it might have been drafted when he was of unsound mind.

title: Advertising: Media Men Mull Over Outlook
description: Judging from what some magazine publishers are say ing, the first quarter doesn't look that bad. And isn't it about time?

title: Small Safe Reported Stolen With $1Million in Securities
description: The theft of a small safe con taining more than $1million in negotiable securities was re ported to the police of the Her bert Street station in Brooklyn yesterday afternoon by Wilbur M. Rabinowitz, president of J. Rabinowitz & Sons, Inc., a wholesale jar and bottle firm at 1300 Metropolitan Avenue.

title: Mrs. Meir's Moscow Memory
description: JERUSALEM  November, 1948, those were the days of the honey moon, when we Israelis and the Rus sians were great friends. Molotov was Foreign Minister at that time, and on November 7th, of course, he threw a great party to honor the revolution anniversary.

title: Braniff Switches 2 Flights
description: Braniff International will op erate two daily flights from La Guardia Airport to Dallas and San Antonio, Tex., begin ning Jan. 15. The airline, which now operates nine daily flights from Kennedy and Newark air ports to the Texas cities, will switch two of the Kennedy flights to La Guardia.

title: Casals, 94, Is Honored At Governor's Party
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 29 (AP)  Pablo Casals cele brated his 94th birthday to day. He was in a hospital early this year with a kidney infection, but he is said to be in sound health now.

title: Draft Resister Sent to Jail
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29 (UPI)John Braxton, 22 years old, a draft resister who refused to report for alternative service, was sentenced to two and a half years in jail today by Fed eral District Judge Alfred Lu ongo. Mr. Braxton is a former Swarthmore College student president.

title: Australian Women Take Tennis Final
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 29 (UPI)  Australia won the women's Federation Cup in tennis for the fifth time today as 19yearold Evonne Goola gong and Mrs. Margaret Court led a 30 sweep of Britain in 122degree temperature. Eleven persons in the crowd of 4,200 collapsed from the heat.

title: Brutus Hamilton, Track Coach Of Olympic Teams, Dead at 70
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPI)Brutus Hamilton, a 1920 Olympic medalist in the de cathlon, who coached track for 32 years at the University of California, died yesterday in an Oakland hospital after a heart attack. He was 70 years old.

title: Ariz. State Rated Favorite Tonight In 3d Peach Bowl
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 29 (AP) Eighthranked Arizona State, an explosive undefeated power with enough speed to help most track teams, tangles with North Carolina and an allAmerica tailback, Don McCauley, tomor row night in the third annual Peach Bowl football game.

title: Rockets Down Pacers
description: DENVER, Dec. 29 AP)The Denver Rockets got 13 points in a row in three minutes late in the fourth period against the Indiana Pacers tonight and posted a 116106 victory.

title: Cougars Sink Stars, 113110
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 29 (AP)Randy Mahaffey's 5 points in the final 2 minutes tonight sparked a fourth quarter rally that lifted the Carolina Cougars to a 113110 American Basketball Associa tion victory over the Utah Stars.

title: Senator Allott Urges an Inquiry On Former Democratic Official
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29. (UPI(Senator Gordon Allott asked the Justice Department today to investigate whether a Kennedy Administration offi cial in the Post Office had been involved in a scandal of major proportions in the awarding of contracts to an air taxi com pany.

title: ATHENS CHALLENGES MOTIVES OF EXILE
description: ATHENS, Dec. 29The mili tarybacked regime challenged the motives today of Elias Demetracopoulos, an exiled Greek journalist who asked three United States Senators to help him obtain a safeconduct pass to enable him to visit his dying father in Athens.

title: After Pakistani Storm: Grief, Indifference
description: DACCA, Pakistan  Mun shi's wife cries all the time now. She sits in the flimsy leanto her husband has pieced together from the debris of the storm, hidden from strangers in the Moslem tradition. Her breasts ache because the baby is no longer there to nurse.

title: Mortgage Offers To Fanny May Dip
P.D.Q. Bach Or Marching to a Different Plumber
description: Despite the best efforts of musicians in every part of the country, Peter Schickele pre tented another Evening With P.D.Q. Bach at Philharmonic Hall Monday. Greeted by a seated ovation, Professor Schickele maintained close rapport with his large audi ence (Truth is impervious to hisses, he explained, en route) as he guided his New York Pick  Up Ensemble through three more works by the composer he has been championing for lo these nearly six years.

title: Banker Doubts Early Ban On Inflationary Pay Rises
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29Inflation ary wage settlements are like ly to continue unless the Fed eral Government intervenes, and conditions are likely to get much more serious before such intervention comes, Roy L. Reierson, senior vice president and chief economist of The Bankers Trust Company of New York, said today.

title: Monadnock Musicians Begin a Concert Series Here
description: Every summer for the last five years a group of young musicians have gathered in New Hampshire's Monadnock region for several weeks of relaxed, informal musicmaking. Although not yet as prestigious as their senior colleagues, Serkin Casals, et al, across the border in Marlboro, Vt., these youthful professionals have al ready enriched New England's summer music scene.

title: PRICES OF BONDS DRIFT DOWNWARD
description: Bond prices drifted lower and interest rates inched a lit tle higher yesterday as the credit markets continued to dawdle through the last few trading days of 1970.

title: Mexico Is Boxing Host
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 29 (UPI) The Mexican Federation of Boxing Commissions said today that it would be host the sev enth World Boxing Council meeting here June 2 through 6.

title: Taiwan May Act to End Book Pirating
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 29 The Government is considering joining the international copy right agreement, thus ending its protection of the widespread pirating or reprinting of for eign books without paying roy alties and without permission from the original publisher.

title: Arkansas St. Picks Coach
description: JONESBORO, Ark., Dec. 29 (UPI)  Bill Davidson today was named head football coach at Arkansas State University, the topranked small college football team In 1970.

title: Books of The Times
description: With a commendable show of indepen dence, Fairleigh Dickinson is reissuing the theater criticism of George Jean Nathan a project that will run to 45 volumes. It is commendable because university presses are more inclined to bestow their impri matur on someone safetly great and safely dead, on William Hazlitt or Leigh Hunt, ??y, than on some one who died a mere 12 years ago and whose posi tion as a classic has not yet been certified. But I think the press has made a safe investment in Nathan, if read ability, astuteness, knowledge of the theater and scorn for humbug are any guarantees. For a man who must have seen as many bad plays as he did, his in volvement and concern for his subject will always be a surprise. There isn't a tired line in a thou sand pages. He could be devastating, but he was never bored. Of one illconceived Ghosts, he wrote of the Nora that when she walked out on her household and slammed the door, the audience rose as one man and rushed to the stage to con gratulate the husband. And in reviewing a play by an English colleague, Charles Morgan, a once popular novelist and drama critic, whose notices adorned the columns of this newspaper, he took the play apart with such exquisite surgical precision as to leave nothing over but the title and a few bare bones. His visits to London thereafter must have been made in a cape, wig, handlebar mustaches and under the name of Alexander Woollcott.

title: Youth in 17Story Fall Alive
description: A teenager who fell 17 stories from the window of a Manhattan housing complex and lived remained in guarded condition yesterday at Metro politan Hospital. The youth, Nelson Rodriguez, 17 years old, fell or jumped Monday night from his kitchen window and landed in a clump of bushes, rebounding onto a section of mud and grass. A team of doc tors performed a fivehour emergency operation and kept him alivebut barely alive, a hospital spokesman said. The youth suffered multiple frac tures of his back, neck and limbs.

title: Contracts Value For Building Grew 13% in November
description: The seasonally adjusted Dodge index of construction contract value advanced 13 per cent to 202 in November, the first month since last August that the index was above 200 (1957 59 equals 100).

title: Harvey & Carlson Set For liberty National
description: The National Liberty Cor poration which a couple of weeks ago named Doyle Dane Bernhach to its agency lineup, yesterday announced that it will also add Harvey & Carlson.

title: Schmeling and 2 Others In Boxing Hall of Fame
description: Two former heavyweight champions, Max Schmeling and Ezzard Charles, and the late Harry Wills, who never got a shot at the title, were named yesterday to the Box ing Hall of Fame.

title: Divisions of TransAm Renamed Two Five Challenge by Car Unit
description: Now that the factories have withdrawn, from the pony division of the Trans American Championship, the Sports Car Club of America is hoping the smaller Trans Am sedans will catch on. The club has even invented an engaging name for them, the Two Five Challenge. This is

title: Past War Crimes Cited
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29 (AP)  The United States has engaged in activities in Vietnam for which Germany and Japan were prosecuted after World War II a legal authority said today.

title: Millionaire Sues to End Ban on Cancer Device
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 29 (UPI)Robert E. Leh mann, a millionaire sports man suffering from leukemia, filed suit yesterday to halt the Ohio Medical Board from enforcing a ban on a device used to treat victims of can cer.

title: Pros Top Condors, 109101
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 29 (AP)  Wendell Ladner stole a pass and scored a field goal to start a 10point splurge that led the Memphis Pros to a 109101 vic tory over the Pittsburgh Con dors tonight.

title: Rangers Down Seals, 32, and Take First Place, One Point Ahead of Bruins
description: What started out as a bland game between the New York Rangers and the California Golden Seals last night at Madison Square Garden devel oped into a spirited encounter that increased in interest.

title: Handlin Warns Scholars Of Decay in Profession
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29A Pulitzer prizewinning historian told convention of historians today a that their profession was in bad disarray, suffering decay from within and a precipitate erosion of professional stand ards and scholarly methods.

title: JULIAN BOND HERE TO PUSH TV SERIES
description: Julian Bond, Democratic member of the Georgia House of Representatives, was in New York yesterday as advance man for, a new sixpant Westing house Broadcasting Company television series, Rush Toward Freedom, which begins next week. He is its hostnarrator.

title: Orange Bowl Golf to Sullivan
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Dec. 29 (AP)Dennis Sullivan of Grant Park, Ill., posted a five overpar 37, 3976 today for a 289 total and a fourstroke victory in the Orange Bowl in ternational junior golf tourna ment at the Biltmore golf course. Kenneth Dye of Fayette ville, N. C., who shot a 35, 38 73 for a 293 was runnerup to the 17yearold Sullivan.

title: DOW JUMPS 11.09 TO NEW 1970 HIGH
description: The stock market yesterday moved higher for the fifth con secutive session as some lead ing market averages finished at new 1970 highs in the heaviest trading in almost four weeks.

title: Hudson Highway
description: Rumblings from Albany indicate that the United States Supreme Court has not had the last word on the long and misguided attempt by the State of New York to penetrate the very waters of the Hudson with a sixlane highway. The plan, a $125million monstrosity, would span a tenmile stretch of landfill laid down along the river's east bank north of the Tappan Zee bridge, send ing trucks and buses careening along a scenically beau tiful stretch of the river, destroying marine life and the homes of poor families in the Ossining area.

title: DISPUTE ENLIVENS G.O.P. CONFERENCE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29The Re publican State Committee, which unlike its Democratic counterpart normally meets in an atmosphere of peace, tran quility and harmony, found it self in the middle of a dispute when it convened here today.

title: ECONOMIC REFORM IS HAILED IN EGYPT
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29The au thoritative Cairo newspaper Al Ahram today hailed the sweep ing political and economic re form ordered yesterday by President Anwar elSadat as one of the most important measures taken toward codifi cation of the revolution of Gamal Abdel Nasser.

title: CAMBODIA ASSAILS SAIGON OVER FUEL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 29  A new strain has been added to the already un easy alliance between Cam bodia and South Vietnam over Pnompenh's need to relieve its critical fuel shortage by importing gas and oil through South Vietnam by way of the Mekong River.

title: 3 Minnesotans Get Prison For Draft Office BreakIns
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 29 (AP)A Federal judge today imposed maximum, fiveyear prison sen tences on three young men convicted of breaking into Min nesota draft offices.

title: A GAIN IN CAMBODIA REPORTED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 29 (AP)Spokesmen said here that South Vietnamese troops had beaten back an enemy ground attack just inside Cam bodia today, killing 74 of the attackers while losing 10 dead. But other enemy forces were reported to have staged co ordinated attacks on points along three of the five main highways leading to Cambodian capital of Pnompenh.

title: BUCKS TURN BACK CAVALIERS, 11997
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 29 (UPI) Lew Alcindor and Bob Dan dridge tossed in 23 points each as the Milwaukee Bucks snapped Cleveland's twogame winning streak tonight by defeating the Cavaliers, 11997, in a National, Basketball Association game before the season's largest home crowd, 7,682.

title: NARCOTICS DEATHS PUT AT OVER 1,050
description: About 1,050 people have died in New York City from narcotic  related causes this yearthe most in a single year in the city's history.

title: Embassy in Sweden Seized
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 29 (UPI) Eighteen Ethiopian students, who said they were supporters or members of the Eritean Lib eration Front, occupied and van dalized the Ethiopian Embassy here today to protest alleged Ethiopian bombings in Eritrea.

title: Jersey Republicans in Dispute Over Naming Lacey Successor
description: A dispute involving leading Republican figures in New Jersey as well as Justice De partment officials has erupted over who should succeed Fred erick B. Lacey as United States Attorney for New Jersey.

title: TOLL OF 39 FEARED IN MINE EXPLOSION
description: WOOTON, Ky., Dec. 30An explosion ripped through an underground coal mine near Wooton today and 39 miners were missing and presumed dead. The bodies of 15 men had been recovered by late tonight

title: 385 Workers Are Laid Off By Honeywell Information
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Dec. 30 (AP)Honeywell Information Systems announced today it has laid off 385 employes as a result of current economic conditions.

title: Army Atrocity Charged on Bogota TV
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Dec. 30 A priest and a colonel have been debating on television here the merits of atrocity charges against the Colombian Army.

title: Basque Trial Indicates Contradictions of Spain
description: MADRID, Dec. 30The trial in Burgos of Basque national ists on charges ranging from banditry to murder is ended, but it is not over.

title: Filion Gains 486th Victory
description: DOVER, Del., Dec. 30 (AP) Herve Filion guided a win ner home in the first race at Dover Downs tonight to set a career record of 486 for the number of harness racing vic tories posted in one year of racing.

title: CAPITAL OUTLAYS SEEN UP ONLY A BIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 An important business indica tor supplied new clues today that the recovery of the econ omy next year may not be very robust.

title: On Israel's Kibbutzim, a Generation Gap
description: KIBBUTZ BEIT ALFA, Is rael  Three generations of a pioneer kibbutz family sat in their tiny, Spartan living room. The grandparents had founded the farming settle ment and their son is a leader in the contemporary kibbutz movement. To the small chil dren playing on the straw mat will fall the judgment whether this idealistic experi ment has been viable.

title: Angeline Galbraith Becomes Bride
description: WINNETKA, Iil., Dec. 30 Miss Angeline Johnson Gal braith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Drummond Gal braith Jr., was married here this evening to C. Foster Brown 3d, son of Mrs. C. Foster Brown Jr. of Northfield and the late Mr. Brown. The ceremony was performed in Christ Episcopal Church by the rector, the Rev. William S. Lea.

title: BILL ON AMMUNITION MAY DIE IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  Opponents of gun control legis lation appear to have failed in an effort to push through Con gress, in the last days before adjournment, a bill that would permit a person to buy .22 caliber rimfire ammunition without having his name re corded.

title: Proposal by Pilots Union Turned Down by Mohawk
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Negotiators for Mohawk Airlines today turned down a contract proposal made by striking pilots who said the package reflected an urgency on their part to get the carrier flying again.

title: Spectator Is Fined for Jeering Murtagh's Happy New Year
description: The trial of 13 Black Pan thers erupted yesterday as it was adjourning in response to a statement from the bench by Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh that he wished every one a happy new year.

title: Mrs. Janet Sonnenthal, Golfer, Is Married to Joseph Willen
description: Mrs. Janet Y. Sonnenthal of New York, widow of Hans A. Sonnenthal, was married here yesterday afternoon to Joseph Willen, executive con sultant and former executive vice president of the Federa tion of Jewish Philanthropies of New York.

title: Gruson Elected a Vice President Of New York Times Company
description: Sydney Gruson, assistant to the publisher of The New York Times, was elected a vice president of the New York Times Company by the board of directors yesterday.

title: People and Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30In New York, Governor Rockefeller has let it be known that he is planning closer state supervision of New York City's garbage collection efforts, and Mayor Lindsay says he wants to look more closely at operations of the staterun subway system.

title: Help Wanted Ads Up in Job Slump
description: Although unemployment in November was at its highest point of the year, there was an increase in helpwanted advertising, according to The Conference Board.

title: WOMAN IS ACCUSED OF A REALTY FRAUD
description: The owner of a Bronx real estate concern was indicted yesterday, charged with hav ing diverted to her own use funds intended by Bronx resid ents for deposits on homes to be built in Puerto Rico.

title: Antipoverty Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 As a big sedan approached the southwest gate of the White House this afternoon; a lean man in the back seat fumbled for his blue plastic pass labeled Frank Charles Carlucci III.But before he got it out of his wallet, the overcoated guard waved him

title: I.B.M. Doesn't Yet Know The Size of Its Phone Bill
description: A spokesman for the Ameri can Telephone & Telegraph Company said yesterday it could be several weeks before it could be determined how many unauthorized calls from servicemen in West Germany had been charged to a special International Business Machines Company number in Armonk, N.Y.

title: For the Kurds in Iraq, Peace but Little Else
description: CHOMAN, Iraq, Dec. 17In their flowing frocks and gold nose studs, Kurdish country girls now walk the roads around this mountain hamlet without fear of attacks by the Iraqi Air Force.

title: Welfare: A Patchwork of Federal and State Programs
description: Until the Great Depression, the task of helping the poor was left to private charities and lower levels of govern ment. With the massive poverty of four decades ago, the Fed eral Government was forced to step into the picture.

title: Cape Canaveral Bill Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) A bill to restore the name Cape Canaveral to Cape Ken nedy is dead. The joint resolu tion authorizing the change died in the Senate Interior Committee.

title: Language Unit Elects Women's Liberation Leader
description: The Modern Language Asso ciation, a scholarly organiza tion of college teachers of Eng lish, languages and linguistics, has had only two women presi dents in its 85year history. Yesterday, a women's libera tion leader won the post of second vice president, which will automatically make her the president in 1973.

title: PENTAGON OFFICE CUTS PAPERWORK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Defense Department's Office for Manpower and Reserve Af fairs is taking the lead toward digging out from under a moun tain of paperwork at the Pen tagon.

title: Sea Train, Coast Rock Group, Offers a Concert
description: Sea Train, a Los Angeles rock group, played a generally dis appointing concert Tuesday evening at Carnegie Hall.

title: F.T.C. Tells Gas Stations To Post Octane Ratings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 The Federal Trade Commission issued a regulation today to re quire the posting of octane ratings on gasoline pumps in most of the country's gasoline stations.

title: Air Cargo Is Expanding Without Jumbos
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30The air cargo business continues to grow, but not precisely along the lines of some visionaries of the industry. Some cross fertili zation of talent and transpor tation modes seems to be the trend in the industry.

title: Two by Two to Aid Fund
description: Two by Two, the musical starring Danny Kaye, will give a special performance on Jan. 3 at the Imperial Theater for the benefit of the Actors Fund of America, the theatrical charity organization.

title: Total Is $2.77Billion
description: LONDON, Dec. 30The Euro bond market was mostly stag nant in 1970, reflecting the un certain state of business activ ity in the United States and Europe, a survey by the London office of the American invest ment bankers, White, Weld & Co., showed today.

title: A Correction
description: In the obituary of William Archibald, the playwright, in The New York Times of Tues day, it was incorrectly stated that Mr. Archibald had com pleted the book and lyrics for a musical version of Henry James's Washington Square. Mr. Archibald was responsible for the book only. The lyrics were written by Kenneth Jerome.

title: Across the Land, the Arts Are Lively
description: The big cultural battalions  the major orchestras, operas, theaters, dance com panies and museums  dom inate artistic activities in their communities, but in areas where they do not exist fresh, imaginative projects are being developed that surprise and delight observers familiar with the American scene.

title: A White House Farewell
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (UPI) President Nixon said farewell today to Daniel Patrick Moyni han, his urban affairs expert, who is returning to teaching at Harvard. Mr. Moynihan took a twoyear sabbatical from Har vard to join the White House staff early in 1969.

title: $5Million Decision Is Made In 10 Minutes by Promoter
description: Could you explain that? a newsman requested during yesterday's announcement of the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier title fight.

title: Youth's Torture Reported in New Atlanta Slaying
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Murder charges against 17 per sons in an Atlanta hippie dis trict slaying were dropped to day, but a second homicide, this one involving torture, came to light

title: Social Security Deadlock
description: The belated Senate passage of the Social Security bill comes too late to permit Congress to act responsibly on this farreaching legislation before time runs out for the 91st Congress this Sunday. Representative Mills, chair man of the House Ways and Means Committee, is wisely reluctant to participate in a conference committee which would have to make quick compromises on several com plicated issues.

title: Entertainment Events
description: TODAY

title: State Narcotic Unit Grants $543,366 to Four Programs
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30The State Narcotic Addiction Control Commission has approved grants totaling $543,366 for four drugabuse programs in New York City.

title: Bill Is Signed For Investor Protection
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 President Nixon signed legisla tion today creating a Securi ties Investor Protection Corpo ration, which will insure inves tors against losses resulting from the failure of, any regis tered brokerage firm. The in surance provisions become ef fective immediately.

title: 2 Magazines Announce They Will Now Take Ads
description: Two existing magazines have decided to become ad vertising media. One is City Magazine, a bimonthly pub lished by the National Urban Coalition, the other is Harvest Years, which is aimed at folks who are retired or plan ning to retire.

title: Marie Menken, 61, Early Leader In Underground Movies, Dies
description: Marie Menken, an artist and a member with her husband, Willard Maas, of the first gen eration of underground film makers, died Tuesday in Long Island College Hospital, Brook after a short illness. She was 61 years old and lived at 62 Montague Street, Brooklyn.

title: Robberies Plague a People's
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Dec. 30A detarmined band of Rutgers graduates, under graduates and dropouts are struggling to keep in opera tion a people's store they operate in a poor neighbor hood of blacks and whites.

title: Waf Fighting Air Force Gives Birth to a Son
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Dec. 30 (AP)  Airman 1st Cl. Gloria Robinson, the 19 yearold Waf who is waging a court battle to stay in the Air Force, gave birth early today to a 6pound 1ounce boy.

title: $10 Payment Recommended On General Outdoor Stock
description: A United States District judge recommended yesterday that Gambles, Inc., Minneapolis, must pay $10 a share to ap proximately 600,000 former shareholders of General Out door Advertising Company. The basis for the recommendation was that Gambles allegedly misrepresented the value of certain properties of General Outdoor before acquiring it in 1963.

title: Lake George Fish Unsafe to Eat Because of Mercury, State Says
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30Fish tak en from Lake George should not be eaten because some of them have been found to have high levels of mercury, the State Department of En vironmental Conservation said today.

title: Happy New Year!  From the DMZ
description: DMZ, KoreaIt is night at the northernmost American outpost in Korea. There is no moon. A fog clings to the ridgeline and fills the lower valleys with an eerie glow. It is very quiet. Eyes strain to see that which does not move. Ears strain to hear that which makes no sound.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CHAPPAQUIDDICK IS LAND, Mass. Heavy snow driven by a northerly gale swept across Martha's Vine yard Island before dawn on the last day of the Massachu setts duckhunting season, and we were content.

title: Tactics Changed in Drive For Parochial School Aid
description: In a major shift in tactics, proponents of state aid to re ligious schools have virtually abandoned their long campaign for repeal of the socalled Blaine Amendment, which bars such aid.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in ownership by lead ing stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies.

title: Lost $5Million Bonds Found by a Boy, 13
description: The 13yearold son of an insurance claims adjuster was credited yesterday with solv ing the mystery of the dis appearance of $5million in negotiable Treasury bonds from the Irving Trust Com pany.

title: 5 Southern Players Named For American Bowl Game
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 30 (UPI)  Five Southeastern Confer ence players were named to the South squad today for the Jan. 10 American Bowl allstar football game.

title: Manson Arraigned in 2 More Murders
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30 Final arguments in Charles M. Manson's murder trial were in terrupted today to permit the arraignment of Manson and three members of his hippie family on two more charges of murder.

title: VIST A Funds Won't Be Cut Off, Poverty Office Nominee Asserts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Nixon Administration has aban doned a proposal to eliminate all funds for VISTA, Frank C. Carlucci, the directordesignate of the Office of Economic Op portunity, testified today.

title: U.S. CONFIRMS STUDY OF HOSPITAL CLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) The Nixon Administration confirmed today that it was considering closing the eight hospitals and 30 outpatient clinics operated by the United States Public Health Service. It

title: AUSTRIA WILL GET ART LOOT OF NAZIS
description: VIENNA, Dec. 30 (Reuters)  Nearly 8,000 art treasures snatched from private collec tions in Austria by the Nazis will be turned over to the state unless the real owners claim them by midnight tomorrow.

title: TRANSIT PATROLMAN INDICTED IN MURDER
description: A 26yearold Transit Author ity patrolman was indicted for murder yesterday by a Manhat tan grand jury in connection with a slaving in August, 1968.

title: Rams Crush Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 30 The Fordham Rams, led by Charlie Yelverton's 46 points, won the eighth annual Kodak Classic tournament, tonight by routing the University of Rochester, 12872. It was Ford ham's 10th victory without a loss this season and gave the Rams their first tournament championship.

title: Philadelphia Judge, Upset With Nixon, Plans to Quit
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30 (AP)Chief Judge William H. Hastie of the United States Court of, Appeals for the Third Circuit, upset because President Nixon has not yet filled a two andahalfyearold vacancy on his mint; has decided to resign in the middle of next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sonics Claim Haywood, But Legal Snarl Looms
description: The Seattle Supersonics of the National Basketball Asso ciation announced in Seattle yesterday that. Spencer Hay wood, last season's American Basketball Association most valuable player and rookie of the year, had signed a multi year contract with them. But there were indications that court entanglements might hold back Haywood's shift from one league to the other.

title: Warsaw Weekly Blames Party for Price Rioting
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30 (UPI) A leading Polish magazine de plored double  thinking in Communist society today and blamed the ruling party for the preChristmas food riots.

title: Artistry Goes to an Irish Setter's Head
description: Dr. Marion O'Neill and Jane Gavin aren't artists. But Irish setter enthusiasts will attest that the two women did an artistic job when they drew the outline for their swimming pool in Atlanta. It's the profile of an Irish setter's head.

title: Rockefeller 4th Will Seek State Ban on Strip Mines
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 30John D. Rockefeller 4th announced today that he would seek the abolition of strip min ing in this state completely and forever to save it from the spreading cancer of sur face despoliation by the coal industry.

title: Market Place:
description: The stock market has spar kled so lately that everyone is guessing that the economy is getting ready to stage a major comeback  everyone who is still employed, that is.

title: 80 Boys and a Priest Present a Spanish Circus
description: PARIS, Dec. 30The Paris holiday season is being brightened by the presence of a children's circus from Spain, directed by a priest, which is crowding the Grand Palais, usually the site of art exhibitions but now tempo rarily converted into an arena theater with two saw dust rings in its center to accommodate the visiting spectacle.

title: LongHair Trend Thinning Barber Ranks
description: After 40 years as a no frills, scissorsontheside bar ber, Tony Callone's feet hurt, but, the real pain is in his pocketbook.

title: Wall St. Is Trying to Sell Itself to Wary Public
description: Wall Street is emerging from adversity after two years of brutal crisis that threatened the holdings of millions of inves tors, but now it finds itself in a quandary.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 31, 1970

title: Reports on Skiing Conditions in the East
description: NEW YORK STATE

title: AMEX REGISTERS 5TH GAIN IN A ROW
description: The American Stock Ex change posted its fifth consec utive advance yesterday in the heaviest trading in three months.

title: Ali and Frazier Make It Official: They Sign for Title Fight Here March 8
description: For a flat fee of $2.5million each, Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier Signed yesterday for their world heavyweight cham pionship showdown at Madison Square Garden on March 8, a Monday.

title: WHIRLPOOL TO LIFT PRICES ON MACHINES
description: The Whirlpool Corporation announced yesterday that it would increase prices on some laundry and dishwasher models, effective Feb. 1.

title: Bruins Take Steel Final
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30 (UPI) Sidney Wicks and Curtis Rowe scored 26 points each as the University of California, Los Angeles, beat Pittsburgh, 7764, and won the Steel Bowl championship tonight.

title: Belgians and Dutch Act
description: PARIS, Dec. 30Belgium and the Netherlands have just con verted American reserve assets by $170million in separate monetary transactions that could signal a tougher European position on the question of financing deficits in the inter national accounts of the United States.

title: Saigon Says Vietcong Killed 19 After the Start of Foe's Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 31 (Reuters) A South Vietnamese military spokesman reported today that Vietcong guerrillas killed 19 members of a hamlet defense force in an attack about 90 minutes after the beginning of their New Year's ceasefire.

title: Personal Finance
description: A man's home may be his castle, but it can also be his favorite place to work and a tax deduction.

title: Executive Changes
description: 21 Brands, Inc., has announced the election of Joseph D. Cotler as president and chief execu tive officer. He succeeds Edgar H. Adsit, who has been named to the newly created post of vice chair man of the board. Previously Mr. Cotler held the post of chairman of the executive committee and chief executive officer: Also H. J. Lester has bees promoted to vice president and sales manager. 21 Brands is a division of the McKesson Liquor Com pany and a subsidiary of ForemostMcKesson, Inc.

title: A.E.C. Head Walks Out As Dissidents Crowd. In
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30An or ganized group of radicals dis rupted two meetings of the American Association for the Advancement of Science here today and prevented the asso ciation's presidentelect from speaking.

title: WAILER TO SERVE AS OFFENSIVE AIDE
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 30 (AP) Sid Gillman returned today to the job of head coach of the San Diego Chargers inn will drop his positions as general manager I with the National Football League team.

title: U.S. Hospital in Philippines Visited by Cardinal Cooke
description: MANILA, Dec. 30 (AP) Cardinal Cooke greeted hos pitalized United States service men at Clark Air Base today as he approached the end of his annual overseas tour.

title: Na New Jet Fighter Crashes in L.I. Woods on Second Test Flight
description: CALVERTON, L. I., Dec. 30 The Navy's new. F14 fight er plane, trying to land on its second test flight, crashed less than a mile short of the runway today after a series of troubles with the control system. Both pilots made an escape, ejecting themselves from the craft about 300 feet up and landing safely by parachute. Oops, flight con trol, loss of flight control sys tem, the pilot, William H. Miller, radioed as the swing wing jet glided over the trees. Just a second. No. can't hold it. Eject! Eject it! The twintail jet, built by the Grumman Corporation and designed to be the backbone of the Navy's carrierbased fighter force starting in 1973, crashed into woods, sending up flame and black smoke. The crash has set back for two or three months the test ing of the supersonic plane, which is eventually to be able to fly at 1,650 miles an hour. The craft is intended to re place the aging F4 Phantom as a fighter plane to assure superiority in the air, and in its mission of defending the fleet it is to replace the can celed F111B, the Navy version of a craft originally intended to serve the Air Force and the Navy.

title: Assemblyman Plans a Bill To Let Tenants Keep Pets
description: A Brooklyn Assemblyman held a sidewalk news con ference with two dozen pet owners yesterday to announce he would prefile a bill in the Legislature to permit tenants living in multiple dwellings to keep their pets.

title: ... Ordeal of Soviet Jewry
description: By now the Kremlin can be in no doubt of the intensity of outrage stirred all over the world by the death sentence against two of the eleven defendants nine of them Jewsin the Leningrad skyjack case.

title: A Correction
description: A Washington dispatch in Tuesday's New York Times quoted a Selective Service spe cialist as having said that if draft calls in 1971 dropped to a total of 100,000, it could mean that men with draft lottery numbers higher than 20 might not be called up. The figure 20 was a typographical error; the number mentioned by the spe cialist was 120.

title: South Carolina Tops VV. Kentucky, 8684, in Final
description: Undefeated South Carolina and previously, unbeaten West ern Kentucky waged a magnifi cent basketball struggle in the final of the 19th annual Holiday Festival and South Carolina Won, 8684, before 18,243 ec static fans at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: First Divorce Under Italian Law Is Granted to Separated Couple
description: MODENA, Italy, Dec. 30 (UPI)The first couple in mod ern Italian history to be grant ed a divorce became single to day. Italy's divorce law took effect Dec. 18.

title: U.S. OIL INDUSTRY IS FACING STRIKE
description: DENVER, Dec. 30The oil industry is facing the possi bility of a strike that would affect about 60 per cent of the nation's oil refining ca pacity. Hundreds of separate contracts with the Oil, Chem ical and Atomic Workers Inter national Union expire at mid night tomorrow.

title: DOW INDEX DROPS BY 0.68 TO 841.32
description: The stock tape still possessed enough appeal for one broker to say: This market is beauti ful. We've waited a long time for this and we're enjoying it. One reason brokers enjoyed the market was the volume. Turn over on the New York Stock Exchange boomed to 19.14 mil lion shares, thereby registering one of the five busiest days of 1970.

title: Soviet Judiciary Still PartyDominated
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 30A major accomplishment of the Soviet Union in the first postStalin decade was the adoption of a new criminal code aimed at putting Soviet society on a sound legal basis.

title: She Fights City Hall And Wins in 43d Year
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., Dec. 30 (AP)'If you're in the right, you can hold out for ever, against City Hall, said. Miss Adelia Corraz when she learned the city had dropped a 43year effort to collect an $85.47 sewer assessment.

title: Old Cynic's Almanac
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Almanac for 1971:Jan. 1 through 20: Cold with quixotic spells in the Northeast and heavy bills over all areas. President Nixon, at a news conference, makes one thing perfectly clear. 1970 foot ball season ends.

title: U.S. Skiers Find Bad Gastein Is Short on Snow
description: BAD GASTEIN, Austria, Dec. 30This ancient Alps mountain resort is suffering from an unusual shortage of snow, and it has been a little embarrassing. The colorful town is playing host to its largest cluster of skiers from Americaabout 200and it hoped to send them home sing

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 30 Byron D. Benson of Newark and Meriden, N. H., a retired vice president of the Peoples Bank & Trust Company of Passaic, died last night in Val ley Hospital after suffering stroke Christmas Day. He was 80 years old.

title: Roudebush Loses Court Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)  Representative Richard L. Roudebush, Republican of Indi ana, was set back today in the Supreme Court in his fight to get a recount of his election defeat to Vance Hartke. With out comment, Justice Thurgood Marshall refused to suspend the ruling of a threejudge Federal Court in Indianapolis that blocks a recount in 11 counties.

title: HOUSE APPROVES FOOD STAMP BILL WITH WORK PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 Despite vehement protests by liberals, the House approved compromise food stamp bill with a stringent must work requirement tonight as Con gress impatiently pushed to ward adjournment.

title: New Year Storm Cloud
description: How joyously New York City welcomes in the New Year tonight depends on how responsibly the rank and file of the Uniformed Firefighters Association conducts itself at its membership meeting this morning.

title: Neighborhood Patrols Get Test by Police Tomorrow
description: Police Commissiner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday that beginning tomorrow a 16 man neighborhood police team under the fulltime com mand of a sergeant would be gin patrolling a 12square block area of Brooklyn.

title: Lenore Ulric, Broadway Star Of Belasco Era, Is Dead at 78
description: ORANGEBURG, N. Y., Dec. 30Lenore Ulric, a dynamic star of stage and screen in the twenties and thirties, died to day in Rockland State Hospital, where she had been a patient for several years. She was 78 years old.

title: FRANCO COMMUTES DEATH SENTENCES FOR SIX BASQUES
description: MADRID, Dec. 30Generalis simo Francisco Franco today commuted all the death sen tences imposed in the Burgos courtmartial of 15 Basque guerrillas charged with banditry and the killing of a police in spector.

title: Leads Military Tribute at Rivers's Funeral
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Dec. 30 Lucius Mendel Rivers, who never wore the uniform of his country, was buried near here today amid the military pomp and pageantry he cherished.

title: BLACKMAIL LAID TO SAIGON ON G.I.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 Representative Lester L. Wolff of Nassau County charged to day that the South Vietnamese Government was jeopardizing the Operation Reunion program, under which American soldiers in Vietnam are permitted two week leaves in the United States, by threatening to can cel the landing rights of the charter aircraft companies that have been flying the men home.

title: 20 in Israeli Mess Hall Are Killed by Rockslide
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 30  At least 20 Israelis were crushed to death today when a rock slide flattened the mess hall of an army camp near the Jordanian border, south of the Dead Sea.

title: For New Year's Day, How About Museum?
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art suggested yesterday one solution to whattodo onNewYear'sDay: come to its Open House program from 1 to 5 P.M.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: New Laws. President Nixon signed a bill setting up the Securities Investor Protection Corporation. He also signed legislation to permit the Sec retary of Agriculture and the states to adopt restrictions on certain egg products.

title: Screen: 'A Very Curious Girl' Takes Her Revenge:Nelly Kaplan Directs a French Feature
description: Ever since Marie reached the age of puberty (and, perhaps, even before), the citizens of the bleak little village of Tellier have been having their way with the girl, an always sullen, sometimes beautiful slavey with no last name. When the postman comes to tell Marie that her mother has just been fatally winged by a hit-and-run driver, he tries to effect a quick rape before breaking the news. Nobody thinks much about Marie herself. She simply provides services, as does a public utility.Nelly Kaplan's first feature film, "A Very Curious Girl" (original title: "La Fiance du Pirate"), is the often amusing, cool, unsentimental story of Marie's revenge. When she acquires a tape recorder and starts charging for those services she earlier provided free, Marie confronts the local representatives of church, state, industry and agriculture with the images of their own inhumanity. They may be no better off for it but, for Marie, its a journey towards liberation."A Very Curious Girl," which opened yesterday at the Murray Hill Theater, comes to us with the recommendation of no less an authority than Pablo Picasso, who calls it "insolence raised to the status of art" and says that he finds in it "the same atmosphere as in the best films of Luis Buuel."I suspect that Mr. Picasso's film criticism has, in this case, been shaped as much by an affection for Miss Kaplan, who made a highly praised, one-hour film about the artist in 1967, as by what I can only regard as his somewhat special view of Mr. Buuel. It must be thatto Mr. Picassothe best films of his extraordinary countryman seem a lot more jolly and optimistic than they do to those of us who don't share ancient Spanish roots.To compare "A Very Curious Girl" with the work of Buuel is to burden a picturesque burro with the treasures of the Alhambra.
