It can't carry the weight. The film is as unequivocably moral as a Marcel Pagnol tale and its humor more Gallic than grief-stricken, closer in tone to any number of Fernandel movies than to anything conceived in the ferocious mind of Buuel.At heart, Miss Kaplan's movie is the record of one woman's amazing financial, physical and emotional achievements, elevated above your general run of quaint, come-uppance histories by the humor and good sense of the director. Bernadette Lafont, Claude Chabrol's favorite early heroine ("Le Beau Serge," "A Double Tour"), plays Marie with a kind of sexless, intellectual wrath, which makes all the fuss about her legendary sensuality even funnier than it might be if she were a steamy teen-ager.I also liked Georges Geret (who played the psychopathic murderer in Buuel's version of "Diary of a Chambermaid"), as the postman who likes to peep while making his rounds, and Jacques Marin (the baffled detective in "Darling Lili"), as one of Marie's most helpless clients. Claire Maurier, whom I remember only from "The 400 Blows," in which she played Antoine's adulterous mother, turns up here as a leather-skinned, Lesbian farmer, and Louis Malle, the director, plays a tiny role as another of Marie's lovers. Miss Kaplan has obviously received more than a little help from her friends.Not so successful are those moments when the director consciously tries to create a dark vision of a world that might have been created by Buuel. A drunken funeral scene manages to remind one of "Viridiana," but without much joy and with absolutely no horror. "A Very Curious Girl" is, instead, effective as an optimistic object lesson. There are multiple rewards to be earned when aimless lust is organized and put on a strictly cash basis.

title: President Affirms Trade Commitment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 President Nixon said today his administration remains com mitted to the objective of ex panding mutually advantage ous world trade.

title: Portugal Concedes The War Is Opposed By Officer Recruits
description: LISBON, Dec. 30The Port uguese Minister of Defense warned today against attempts at subversion of the armed forces by, new officer recruits from universities.

title: Israeli Reiterates Hope
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 30 Eor eign Minister Abba Eban called today for a rhetorical dees calation between Israel and the United Arab Republic, an end to accusations and threats as the two countries embark upon a new phase of negotia tion.

title: Dark World of the Wino
description: The door of the liquor stove pushes open slowly, and all of us greet Chi cago. Chicago appears to be having a bad day today. His hair is grotesquely matted, and only the freezing weather spares it from more parasites. His black face, trying to point away from his feet, is half scabbed from this most recent collisions with the street. One blotch of fresh blood in hit left cheek tells us that the trip over was an eventful one. An unlit cigarette butt, picked up off the street, hangs from his remaining brown teeth in between his torn lips. As he tries to talkor breathesaliva drools from his mouth Uncontrollably.

title: 1,100 SavedUp Pennies Donated to the Neediest
description: Among the 268 contribu tions yesterday to the Fund for the Neediest were 1,100 pennies saved up in a jar, $437.15 from a family shar ing the proceeds of an un expected windfall and $35 from a woman who said she was tired of Christmas holi days that seemed to be held for the benefit of retailers.

title: 3 Jewish Leaders Meet Nixon and Ask Help in Softening Verdicts in Leningrad
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 Three American Jewish leaders had an unscheduled meeting with President Nixon today to make their case for help in seeking clemency for the 11 persons, including 9 Jews, con victed in a hijacking trial in the Soviet Union.

title: NEW XRAY SOURCES IN SPACE ARE HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) A United States satellite may have discovered a few new X ray sources deep in space, but it is too early to be certain, space agency project officials said today.

title: LaBenz Wins Canadian Mile
description: SASKATOON, Saskatchewan, Dec. 30 (Canadian Press) Chuck LaBenz won the mile in 4 minutes 11.5 seconds last night as the Saskatchewan Knights of Columbus indoor track meet began. Other winners were Tom Von Ruden in the 800meter run (1:52.3) and Reynaldo Brown in the high jump (7 feet).

title: 1819 Court Decision Cited To Back City Welfare View
description: Corporation Counsel J. Lee Rankin said yesterday that a decision by the United States Supreme Court in 1819 might provide the constitutional ba sis for Mayor Lindsay's refusal to pay increased welfare costs mandated by the Federal and state governments.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Rev. Eugene J. Erny, 75, Pastor of Brooklyn Church

title: Watchman, What of The Night?
description: Watchman, tell us of the night, what its signs of promise are. To the words of the familiar carol most Amer icans would today respondfew signs of promise, the night fills us with foreboding.

title: Joe Colombo's Tube Chair: Make of It What You Will, a Seat or Sculpture
description: That remarkably prolific Italian designer, Joe Colombo, has just come up with a chair design that is as much soft sculpture as it is seat ing. The chair consists of four nested cylinders, which arrive in a big sea bag marked Tube Chair. The cylinders are made of white plastic covered with a cush

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Dec. 30 Dr. William H. Lang of 20 Tulip Street, a pollution expert with the Esso Research and Engineering Company in Flor ham Park, died yesterday of heart attack at Overlook Hospi tal, Summit. His age was 58.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In a year of sports autobiographies, perhaps the likeli est subject was Willis Reed, captain and melodramatic hero of the year's most exciting team, the Knicks. He did not write one, explaining; Why shouldn't I have something completely my own, a place to get away to? A successful businessman has a home in the country to escape to. I have my childhood; it was beautiful to me and I don't want people just opening a book and reading about it.

title: 2 Glens Falls Papers Sold To CaliforniaBased Chain
description: GLENS FALLS, N. Y., Dec. 30 (AP)The two daily news papers in this upstate New York city have been bought by a California publishing com pany, it was announced today.

title: Former Premier Assails Greek Military Regime
description: ATHENS, Dec. 30  Former Premier Panayotis Kanellopou los, whose Government was toppled by the army coup in 1967, said in a New Year's mes sage that the Greek people are now deprived of the right to exercise their political liberty and are also deprived of the guarantees of their human rights.

title: GOVERNOR CHIDES CITY ON WELFARE
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that improved ad ministration might hold down New York City's rising welfare costs, but that the essential need was Congressional adop tion of President Nixon's wel fare reform proposals.

title: BILL ON RAIL AID VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) The Senate completed Con gressional action today on legis lation that would provide up to $125million in Federal loan guarantees that the Penn Cen tral Railroad says it needs to meet its January payrolls. The vote was 47 to 29.

title: LATE RALLY EARNS 111103 TRIUMPH
description: By way of celebrating the third anniversary of Red Holz man's elevation from chief scout to coach, the New York Knickerbockers defeated the San Francisco Warriors, 111 103 yesterday in the fashion to which they and their fans have become happily accus tomed during Holzman's re gime.

title: Archeologists Concerned Over Shipwreck Looting
description: Looters constitute one of the greatest problems facing under water archeologists, the Arch aeological Institute of America was told yesterday.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: EDWARD R. EASTMAN, SERVED ON REGENTS

title: Top Officials Join Drive to Register Voters Under 21
description: Governor Rockefeller, Mayor Lindsay and other public offi cials have been invited to help Monday in starting to register nearly a million voters from 18 to 20 years old in New York now eligible to cast bal lots in Federal elections.

title: Broadway Theaters Set To Raise Curtain at 7:30
description: Starting Monday, all Broad way shows will raise their evening curtains at 7:30, an hour earlier than tradition al, and at 2 for all matinees, 30 minutes earlier than usual.

title: Jersey Nuptials For Ellen Ward, J. A. Cooney 2d
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Dec. 30 Miss Ellen R. Ward, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. William R. Ward, was married here this afternoon in the Ogden Memorial Presbyterian Church to James A. Cooney 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Cooney of Indianapolis. The Rev. Clarence Lecrone per formed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Peter McHugh.

title: State and 2 Unions Agree On Dental Plan for 137,000
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30  New York State and unions repre senting 137,000 state workers today reached agreement on a dentalinsurance plan.

title: PENGUIN SIX TIED BY CANADIENS, 33
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 30 (UPI) Mark Tardif scored with a 60 foot slap shot midway through the final period tonight as the Montreal Canadiens battled back to earn a 33 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: ExInterior Chief Calls For Moral Leadership
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30  The science establishment, particu larly the National Academy of Sciences, was accused here to day of failing to exert moral and political leadership on is sues involving the impact of technology on mankind.

title: KENNY KEPT CASH IN HIS BASEMENT
description: NEWARK, Dec. 30 (AP) John V. Kenny, the Hudson County Democratic boss, told a Federal grand jury that he had paid for $700,000 in bonds from a larder of cash he kept in the basement of his home, court documents disclosed to day.

title: Miss Kathleen Cleary Is Wed to John Look
description: NORTHPORT, L. I., Dec. 30 The marriage of Miss Kathleen M. Cleary to John Reynolds Look took place here this afternoon in St. Philip Neri Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. Richard Scanlon performed the cere mony.

title: FIREMEN SEEKING A NEW CITY OFFER TO BAR JOB ACTION
description: Leaders of the firemen's un ion pressed the city last night for new proposals that they could present to a mass meet ing of their members called for this morning to decide whether to curtail some fire services.

title: Reeves Dismisses Allen as Rams Coach
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30 (AP)  Dan Reeves, the owner of the Los Angeles an nounced today that the con tract of Coach George Allen would not be renewed.

title: Mrs. Gilbert Miller's New Year's Party A Tradition Ending?
description: It is a tradition of several decades, one that began in a mansion on Fifth Avenue when Kathryn Bache was a young girl.

title: Ads on TV May Vanish, but Not Cigarettes
description: Philip Morris has bought, for $1.25million, the 11:30 P.M. to midnight commercial time on all three networks for tomor row night, so if Dick Cavett, Johnny Carson or Merv Griffin is your habit, be prepared for a lastditch spate of cigarette commercials.

title: KEEP VELAZQUEZ, BRITAIN IS URGED
description: LONDON, Dec. 30A Gov ernment advisory committee to day urged Britain to keep the Velazquez portrait that was sold last month to the Wilden stein Gallery of New York for a world record auction price, $5.544.000.

title: Canadian Bill Rates Rise
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 30 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $165million of new 92day Treasury bills at an av erage price of 98.893 and aver age ??ield a 4.44 per cent?? corn pared with last week's 98.905 and 4.39 per cent. Today's $45 million of 183day bills brought 97.783 and 4.52 per cent, against last week's 97.820 and 4.44 per cent.

title: PRICES END MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
No Surrender to Rats
description: Three years ago the rat control bill had to weather some callously unfunny wisecracking by its Congres sional opponents, but in the end this experiment in good sense and urban decency won out. Since then, New York City has chalked up its first small victories over this rampant health hazard to children in the slums.

title: 70 MERGER ACTIVITY DOWN 28% FROM 69
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) The merger boom lost more steam in 1970 with only 1,230 major business linkups re cords, according to the bi monthly magazine, Mergers and Acquisitions. The total was 28 per cent below that of 1969, when 1,712 deals were made, and 33 per cent below the 1968 peak of 1,829 corporate mergers.

title: Late Politician's Room Yields $800,000
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Dec. 30 More than $800,000 in cash, some of it stuffed into shoe boxes, has been found among the effects of Paul Powell, Illi nois Secretary of State who died in October, it was an nounced today by Dr. John S. Rendleman, executor of Mr. Powell's estate.

title: Nixon Accused of Misusing Pocket Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Six Democratic lawmakers charged today that President Nixon mis used his pocket veto power last week when he announced he had killed a $225million medical education bill without giving Congress an opportunity to override his action.

title: Maureen Cunniff Wed
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Dec. 30  Miss Maureen Cunniff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Geoffrey or Penn Valley, was married here this afternoon in St. Thomas Roman Cath olic Church to James F. Dor ment Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Dorment of Montclair, N. J. The Rev. Joseph O'Connell performed the ceremony. The bride's father is a lawyer in Philadelphia. Mr. Dorment, whose father is president of the Hampton Construction Company in Baltimore, is a member of the law firm of Schumann, Hession, Kennelly and Dorment in Jersey City.

title: U. S. Navy's River Fleet Ends Operations in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 30  The United States Navy ended its fouryear role in inland waterway combat today.

title: IVY LEAGUE REMOVES BAN ON BIDS TO N.I.T.
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Dec. 30The Ivy League announced today that it would permit its col leges basketball teams, other than the champion team, to compete in the National Invi tation Tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: FEE FOR MEDICARE WILL RISE IN JULY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Medicare premiums paid monthly by 19.5 million aged persons to cover doctor bills will increase by 30 cents, to $5.60 a month on July 1, Federal officials said today.

title: Experts Discount The Stock Option But Plans Expand
description: The Conference Board, Inc., said yesterday in a longde layed research report that the use of stock option plans was increasing steadily in spite of adverse conditions.

title: POLL FINDS NIXON IS MOST ADMIRED
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 30 For the second consecutive year, the Gallup Poll reported today, President Nixon is the man most admired by the American people. His vote this year, however, is considerably smaller than that recorded in last year's poll.

title: Theater: A Bedtime Trio in Village
description: Bed, they say, is a great leveler. For her first, profes sional play, the actress Shel ley Winters has taken three horizontal encounters and placed them virtically in the pattern of world events. The

title: Stalled Peace Talks End 2d Year
description: PARIS, Dec. 30The Paris peace talks on Vietnam ended their second full year today with both sides agreed that no progress had been made. Each side blamed the intransigence of the other.

title: Doctors Find President in Excellent Shape
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  President Nixon, who runs in place every day and watches his weight, was proclaimed in excellent shape today after his annual physical examination.

title: Solving One Big Problem of Convention Visitors
description: The New Year's celebration came early to a group of youngsterschildren of members of the Modern Language Associationwho have been staying at the New York Hilton while their parents attended a fourday convention that ended last night.

title: FUNDS NET SALES OFF IN NOVEMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  Net sales of mutual funds in November declined to $128.5 million from $177.5million in October, the Investment Com pany Institute reported today.

title: S.E.C. DEREGISTERS EQUITY CORPORATION
description: The Equity Corporation, fol lowing a prolonged period of negotiations with the Securi ties and Exchange Commission, was granted yesterday an order declaring that it was no longer an investment company.

title: Chile Prepares a Bill To Nationalize Banks
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 30 (AP)President Salvador Al lende Gossens announced to night that he would send bill to Congress next week to nationalize all private banks in Chile.

title: Books of The Times
description: Having just gone through a yearend mindcleaning of books published in 1970 that were not reviewed in this column but probably should have been, I find Winthrop Sargeant's singular confession, In Spite

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Advertising: Ayer and Pemberton Unite
description: News conferences were held in England, South Af rica, Australia, Switzerland and New York yesterday to announce that America's own N. W. Ayer & Son and the Pemberton Group of Britain plan to do their thing to gether and do it globally.

title: Black and Puerto Rican Builders Assail Plan to Train Minorities
description: An organization of black and Puerto Rican building contrac tors declared yesterday that the New York City plan to train minority workers for jobs in the construction industry ig nores even the existence of the black and Puerto Rican construction industry here.

title: Sprint, ShortRange ARM, Kills incoming Missile in Pacific Test
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)  The Sprint missile, a key weapon in the Safeguard anti missile system, has scored its first successful test interception of an intercontinental missile warhead, the Pentagon an nounced today.

title: Pentagon Offers a Settlement To Lockheed in Money Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Defense Department proposed today a settlement of its dis putes with the Lockheed Air craft Corporation on terms that would stave off the company's bankruptcy at a cost to the Government estimated at $757 million.

title: 3 L.I.R. UNIONS WEIGH STRIKE ON SATURDAY
description: A union official said last night that a decision on wheth er to strike the Long Island Railroad some time after 12:01 A.M. Saturday would be made today by three unions involved in a contract dispute with the line.

title: M.T.A. Bids to Take Over Penn Station and Trackage
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority, which tomor row takes over control of the New Haven Division of the Penn Central, including Grand Cen tral Terminal, also is moving to bring Pennsylvania Station un der its wing.

title: 3 Texas Longhorns Shift to Long Hair
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30Texas, known for its conservative football philosophy, showed up with something new today for its Cotton Bowl game against Notre Dame: Long hair.

title: Pupils Concur: Math Can Be Beautiful
description: What's another way of say ing zero? asked William F. Johntz.

title: Cairo May Arm Civilians
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30In appar ent expectation of Israeli at tacks against strategic facili ties deep inside Egypt if war fare resumed, the Egyptian leadership is preparing to dis tribute weapons to civilians around the country, according to informed sources.

title: Excerpts From Udall's Address at Scientists' Meeting
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30  Fol lowing are excerpts from the speech today by Stewart L. Udall, former Secretary of the Interior, at the annual meet ing of the American Associ ation for the Advancement of Science:

title: Offtrack Bet Start Is Delayed
description: Offtrack betting's sched uled Jan. 11 opening here was postponed yesterday for at least a week because of some kinks in the computer system.

title: U. S. Hopes Soviet Accepts Need Of Adherence to Mideast Truce
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  The United States expressed hope today that the Soviet Union understands that there should be no other military violations of the ArabIsraeli truce in the Middle East.

title: Volkswagen Recalls 79,000 Of 71 Cars for Wiring Test
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J., Dec. 30 (AP)Volkswagen, of America has announced the re call of 79,000 of its 1971 models to inspect for possible defective wiring in steering column locks, ignition switches and wiring harnesses.

title: De Sapio Denied Rehearing
description: Carmine G. De Sapio, the former Democratic leader of New York County, has lost a move for a rehearing on an ap peal from his conviction in an extortion conspiracy case. The United States Court of Appeals here denied De Sapio's move, but allowed him to remain free without bail pending his motion for a review by the Supreme Court. De Sapio was sentenced to two years In prison and fined $4,500 after he was convicted of conspiracy to bribe former Water Commissioner James L. Marcus in connection with city contracts.

title: FILTROL ATTACKS SLICK'S BID AGAIN
description: The Filtrol Corporation charged the Slick Corporation with fraud yesterday in an amendment to its antitrust suit. The suit, filed in Federal

title: Coast Guard Names Replacements
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Coast Guard named re placements today for two offi cers who ordered a Soviet defector returned to his ship last month.

title: Bridge:
description: Since bridge is a little known game in the Soviet Union, it is nut surprising that Moscow has only 50 competition players and that such cities as Kiev and Lvov even fewer. What is remark able is that the tiny Soviet republic of Estonia, with a population of 1,250,000, has 1,500 paidup duplicate play ers.

title: Palen Flagler Weds Anita Colby
description: Miss Anita Catherine Cou nihan, better known as Anita Colby, was married here yes terday afternoon to Palen Flagler, a corporate vice president for J. P. Stevens & Co., the textile concern. The ceremony at the home of Mrs. Thayer Gilpatric, a friend of the bride, was at tended by some 80 guests, who stayed on for a reception in Mrs. Gilpatric's covered garden.

title: SUGAR FUTURES RISE BY 4 POINTS
description: The decision by the Interna tional Sugar Council to in crease the 1971 export quotas under the global sugar pact had little effect on the futures prices or world sugar on the exchange here. The ??uota was raised to 100 per cent from 95 per cent of the basic export tonnages set up in the pact.

title: Leslie P. Bryant, George H. Hume Of Army Marry
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 30Miss Leslie Parker Bry ant and Cpl. George Holliday Hume, U. S. A., were married here today in the Episcopal Church of Bethesdabythe Sea by the Rev. Dr. Hunsdon Cary Jr.

title: Panther Case Hearing Set
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 30 (AP) A Federal court hearing is scheduled for tomorrow onthe petition of Arthur Turco Jr., 27yearold New York Iawyer, for release on bail pending his trial in connection with an al eged murder plot. Mr. Turco faces conspiracy and other charges in the torture and murder of Eugene Leroy Ander son, a 20yearold painter and Black Panther whose remains were found in a municipal park.

title: Blacks' Role in Science Linked to Negro Colleges
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30  The future of blacks in science is tied to public support of Negro colleges, a black educator said here today.

title: KDI Corporation Obtains Court Help in Paying Debts
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 30 (AP) A Federal bankruptcy referee signed an order today permit ting the Cincinnatibased KDI Corporation, a diversified hold ing company, to retain its busi ness while paying off its credi tors.

title: ROLE ON NIXON PANEL FOR MISS DICKERSON
description: Nancy Dickerson, a former Washington correspondent for the National. Broadcasting Com pany, was selected to be public television's representative at next Monday's Conversation with President Nixon, by John Macy, president of the Corpora tion for Public Broadcasting. A spokesman for Mr. Macy said yesterday that the reason was her long identification with major TV network.

title: Franco Opts for Humanity ...
description: Generalissimo Franco has struck a rare blow for decency and humanity in Spain by commuting the death sentences of six Basque nationalist guerrillas to thirty year jail terms. His action was a clear censure of the army court that had sentenced the six and decreed unusually cruel prison terms for nine other defendants.

title: Offshore Oil Fire Curbed As a Wild Well Is Plugged
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 30 (AP)  An offshore oil well that blew wild Dec. 1, killing four men, was plugged today, sharply reducing the intensity of the biggest oil fire in indus try history.

title: Senate Session Delayed For Tributes to Murphy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (UPI)The Senate turned from its heavy preadjourn ment work load for an hour and 20 minutes today to praise Senator George Mur phy, Republican of Califor nia, who was defeated for reelection by Representative John V. Tunney, a Democrat.

title: Reserve's Buying Sparks Increases in Bond Prices
description: Bond prices picked up some ground yesterday as the Fed eral Reserve bolstered the credit markets in the afternoon by buying first some Treasury ?? and then some coupon bearing Government securities.

title: Hallowed Ground
description: Gettysburg, the highwater mark of the Confederacy, is about to be subjected to a new low in historical taste lessness. If plans proceed after enthusiastic approval by Pennsylvania county and tourist interests, a monster tower 300 feet high will be built to overlook the battle field, dominate it and desecrate its mood. All for an admission price, of course.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK BUCKS, 119 TO 107
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30 (UPI) Bill Cunningham scored 35 points tonight to pace the Philadelphia 76ers to a 119107 victory over Milwaukee in a National Basketball Association game. The defeat snapped a fivegame winning streak for the Bucks.
